Many research studies include weight and height as primary outcomes. Although having trained personnel conduct direct measurements of body weight and height using research quality equipment and standardized techniques is considered the “gold standard” in research, financial and/or logistical considerations  frequently preclude the application of this gold standard. Previous investigations have found good concordance between measured and self reported height and weight among youth  and adults .
Recognition of the morbidity and premature mortality associated with mental disorders has prompted attempts to increase access to treatment and opportunities for early detection among children . Although MH issues commonly present in primary care, primary care providers  typically receive limited training in their diagnosis and treatment . Most PCPs expand their expertise over the course of their careers through consultation and collaboration with specialists.
Saphenous vein grafts have been established as the gold standard conduit for lower extremity bypass grafting . Conventionally, the great saphenous vein  is typically harvested via a long continuous or “skip” incisions that may extend from the groin to the ankle, before its use as an arterial conduit. This approach however is associated with significant morbidities including surgical site infections, ischemic skin flaps, fat necrosis, lymph leak, increased postoperative pain and longer hospital stay for as many as 24% to 43% of patients  .
In vivo evidence of cerebral amyloid angiopathy  was limited until the introduction of gradient echo T2*  weighted magnetic resonance  imaging, which remains the clinical standard for detection of brain microbleeds  which often result from CAA . SWI is an advance in T2* weighted brain MR imaging that enhances contrast from local susceptibility tissue variations . At 1.5T, the SWI sequence was found to be fourfold more sensitive for detection of traumatic BMB than conventional GRE T2* and recent data in mild cognitive impairment subjects indicates again at least a fourfold increase in BMB recognition by SWI compared to conventional GRE T2* imaging  .
Neutrophils, through their ability to be rapidly recruited to tissues and deploy adiverse array of antimicrobial effector mechanisms, are essential for the clearance of manybacterial pathogens. This commences with immune ‘sensing’ ofpathogens by tissue resident cells followed by activation of the vascular endothelium andneutrophil extravasation from the bloodstream, and finally initiation of neutrophilantimicrobial functions,  . The current paradigm of neutrophil recruitment is described by a well definedseries of steps that occur within post capillary venules, .
p38 is one of the major MAP kinases, which regulates multiple biological processes in mammals . It was initially identified as a key mediator of inflammation and stress responses. In response to DNA damage, eukaryotic cells undergo proliferative arrest to allow DNA repair, which is crucial for maintaining genome stability and preventing tumorigenesis .
The reversible formation of disulfide bonds between cysteine residues is increasingly recognized as an important mechanism for the regulation of protein function. These post translational modifications can modulate the activity of a wide range of proteins, including transcription factors, kinases, metabolic enzymes and membrane channels, , , , , , . Organisms ranging from bacteria to humans control the formation of protein disulfides in the cytosol through the action of the glutathione and thioredoxin redox systems, .
Several research groups have initiated efforts to use computational approaches to investigate intrinsic disorder within integral membrane proteins   that include voltage gated potassium channels , notch pathway proteins , single pass membrane proteins from humans , and plasma membrane proteins in humans and in bacteria such as E. coli . IDPs and IDRs are highly abundant in nature and the overall amount of disorder in proteins increases from bacteria to archaea to eukaryota , . Even in the Protein Data Bank , which is highly selective for structured proteins, only approximately 30% of crystal structures are completely devoid of disorder, with the remaining structures exhibiting IDRs of various lengths.
Cancer is largely a disease affecting older adults . Seventy two percent of cancer survivors are 60 years of age and older . Cancer treatments lead to a number of side effects in older adults including cancer related fatigue and global side effect burden .
Infection with the parasite Trypanosoma cruzi causes Chagas disease. The important manifestations of clinical Chagas disease are acute myocarditis and chronic dilated cardiomyopathy. Chagas disease is endemic in many areas of Latin America, affecting ~20 million infected people.
Normal pregnancy is associated with dramatic increases in placental blood flow, which is directly correlated with fetal growth and survival as well as neonatal birth weights and survivability . Several lines of evidence have shown that VEGF and FGF2 promote angiogenesis and production of the potent vasodilator nitric oxide  in placentas, implicating critical roles of VEGF and FGF2 in placental angiogenesis and vasodilatation  . ERK1/2, a threonine/tyrosine kinase, is one major target of MAPK kinase 1/2 , while AKT1 and p38 MAPK, two serine/threonine kinases, are primarily activated by PI3K and MAPK kinase 3/6 , respectively.
Alzheimer’s disease  is the most common cause of dementia in mid to late life. One promising approach are anti amyloid therapies, based on the hypothesis that increased amyloid beta  deposits in the brain is a major underlying cause of the pathology of AD . demonstrated that active immunization of transgenic mice with Aβ peptides leading to circulating anti AB antibodies and prevention of Aβ deposition .
Inflammation and cancer have been linked in numerous studies , yet the mechanistic basis for this relationship remains unknown. Among these reactive species are superoxide, hydrogen peroxide and HOCl— the latter generated by myeloperoxidase from activated neutrophils . Of the halogenated uracils, ClU is arguably the most likely product of inflammation mediated damage.
Major histocompatibility complex class I and II molecules play a vital role in initiating immune responses by presenting peptide antigens to CD8 and CD4 T lymphocytes respectively. More recent research however has shown that MHC II is not exclusively expressed by these populations and can be found on non APC subsets, such as activated T lymphocytes  and basal vascular endothelial cells . Although a substantial amount of research assessing the functional relevance of MHC II expression on non APCs has been conducted its precise role on these cells remains unresolved.
Brugada syndrome  is characterized by an electrocardiographic pattern of ST segment elevation in the right precordial leads and an increased risk of sudden cardiac death. BrS has been associated with cardiac sodium channels  mutations causing decreased sodium current . We have reported that the A280V mutation in the glycerol 3 phosphate dehydrogenase 1 like  causes BrS by reducing INa.
Inhalational anesthetics produce various clinically important actions, including hypnosis, amnesia and immobility . It is believed that different anesthetic actions involve distinct molecular targets in specific neural pathways; for immobilization, the site of action is spinal . Why, then, is the respiratory system relatively resistant to inhibition by inhalational anesthetics?
The Southwest United States, including Arizona and New Mexico, has a diverse climate  and is home to many different avian species . Arizona, in particular is part of the Pacific flyway which starts in Alaska and extends as far as South America . While there are four migratory flyways in the United States, the Pacific flyway is believed to pose the greatest risk of introduction of avian influenza  H5N1 virus due to mixing of birds from Asian countries .
Gastric hydrochloric acid  is a noxious stimulus that following penetration through the mucosal barrier contributes to pain arising from the oesophagus, stomach and upper small intestine. Both the gastric HCl evoked visceromotor reaction and medullary c Fos response are suppressed by vagotomy, which attests to a significant role of vagal afferent neurons in gastric chemonociception  . The proton gated members of the ASIC family are encoded by 3 different genes: ASIC1, ASIC2 and ASIC3, with ASIC1 and ASIC2 each having alternative splice variants termed ASIC1a, ASIC1b, ASIC2a and ASIC2b.
Bipolar disorder  is a prevalent, severe, and highly disabling psychiatric disease characterized by recurrent depressive and manic episodes, and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality due to general medical conditions, such as obesity, diabetes and cardio disease  . Studies have also reported altered apoptotic factors and their mediated responses in BD. Changes include DNA damage in peripheral blood of BD patients , increased pro apoptotic serum activity in BD patients  and mitochondrial dysfunction .
In the United States, one out of every three persons aged 20 and older has hypertension, with more than 100 million people having either pre hypertension or definite hypertension. , Both human and animal studies have shown onset of hypertension because of loss of nitric oxide, which acts as the endothelium derived relaxing factor. Nitric oxide is catalyzed by endothelial nitric oxide synthase , an enzyme with multiple genetic variants that might confer risk for hypertension.
Microbicides will be used by healthy women to prevent HIV and sexually transmitted infections ; therefore these products require an exceptional safety profile. Similarly, a recent trial of cellulose sulfate was halted due to concerns about safety . Thus, there is a need to develop new methods that can better evaluate the safety and toxicity of candidate microbicides .
Human and mouse studies have proven that high levels of cholesterol rich remnants cause atherosclerosis, but the relevance of triglyceride rich lipoproteins  to atherogenesis remains controversial. In part, this controversy stems from the fact that elevated levels of TRLs and remnants often coexist . Humans with chylomicronemia have severe hypertriglyceridemia but low levels of cholesterol rich remnants.
Sonoporation has shown promise to facilitate intracellular transport of drugs, proteins, genes, and other therapeutic agents that are otherwise impermeable to the cell . Because ultrasound exposure can be non invasively controlled in application volume and location as well as exposure duration, sonoporation is uniquely suitable for in vivo site specific delivery . However, even with recent progress in the field, a detailed mechanistic description of sonoporation and its full range of bioeffects remains to be elucidated  .
Autism spectrum disorder  is featured by severe deficits in social communication, social interaction, and restricted, repetitive patterns of behaviors, interests and activities . Other integrative models of autism mainly focus on impaired functional connectivity , and abnormalities of neurodevelopmental processes  which manifest as a cognitive deficit affecting the “binding together” of discrete features into a single, coherent object or concept . We proposed that neurofeedback based operant conditioning of prefrontal EEG activity immediately post rTMS sessions will result in more pronounced improvements of functional outcomes as compared control waitlist group of children with ASD, as we hypothesized that rTMS over the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex  improves I/E ratio and enhances gamma activity.
The population of the United States  is aging rapidly. The number of adults in the U.S. age 65 or older will more than double to approximately 71 million by 2030 . Approximately 80% of older adults have at least one chronic disease and the numbers of elders living in the community with serious, eventually fatal chronic conditions has increased dramatically over the last decade placing tremendous strain on family members .
Indoleamine 2,3 dioxygenase 1  is a metabolically active enzyme with the capacity to promote immune tolerance and exert anti microbial effects. IDO 1, and its recently discovered paralog IDO 2 , function to catalyze the initial and rate limiting step of tryptophan degradation via the kynurenine pathway. These changes include the inhibition of T cell replication, induction of T cell apoptosis and the support of regulatory T cell differentiation and suppressor function activation.
Adolescence is a developmental period in which an individual transitions from immaturity and dependence on the family unit into maturity and independence. Sex differences in the timing of adolescent related changes may occur in rats as well, with females demonstrating certain maturational changes indicative of impending adolescence as early as P20 and male rats displaying some adolescent associated characteristics as late as approximately P55  . It has been suggested that human adolescents experience more stressors and negative life events than children or adults .
In vivo bioluminescence imaging  uses luciferase enzymes  as reporters to generate light emission during the catalytic oxidation of their substrates for non invasive imaging of biological targets and processes in intact cells and living animals . For example, BLI is used to measure the mass and location of implanted cells in animals , to evaluate the efficacy of anticancer drugs , and to detect protein protein interactions in living cancer cells  . BLI employs both the enzyme and substrate to generate the light emission, and many strategies have been developed to regulate the activity of the reporter enzyme at the various levels  for molecular imaging .
The psychological impairments observed in schizophrenia  involve most, but not all, cognitive functions . Deficits in tasks thought to rely on the integrity of the frontal lobes, such as working memory and executive control , have been repeatedly observed and modeled . In contrast, deficits in reinforcement learning and reward based decision making, dependent on both the basal ganglia and prefrontal cortex, have been observed in some cases, but not in others  .
Cerebral ischemia is a devastating aspect of stroke, cardiac arrest, and surgical procedures that interrupt blood flow to the brain. An early mild ischemic insult protects CA1 pyramidal neurons against subsequent, normally lethal ischemic challenges . This phenomenon is referred to as ischemic preconditioning .
Profound neurogenesis occurs in restricted areas of the adult mammalian brain under physiological conditions . In the olfactory system, central neurogenesis provides subventricular zone derived interneurons to the OB . Peripheral neurogenesis in the olfactory epithelium produces OSNs throughout life .
Non infection related morbidity and mortality has become increasingly significant in the care and management of HIV infected patients treated with combination antiretroviral therapy . An increased risk of myocardial infarction  in HIV infected patients was described in 2007 by Triant et al. . HIV infection is associated with known cardiovascular risk factors such as increased total cholesterol, decreased HDL cholesterol, lipodystrophy and the metabolic syndrome .
Ca2+ mediated signaling regulates diverse aspects of cellular functions in bacteria, plants, fungi and animals . In order to fit the specific physiological requirements of each cell type, a specific set of proteins are selectively employed from a large repertoire of Ca2+ signaling molecules. For instance, Ca2+ influx through sperm specific CatSper Ca2+ channels is crucial for sperm cell hyperactivation and male fertility in mammals , and Ca2+ release through the intracellular ryanodine receptor channel is necessary for skeletal and cardiac muscle contraction .
Understanding life history evolution requires knowledge of the forces shaping correlated suites of fitness characters in response to patterns of age specific mortality . Therefore, it is necessary to integrate how life history traits are expressed across environments  and standing levels of genetic variation in fitness components  with patterns of demographic and environmental variability . Currently, large gaps remain in our understanding of how genomic expression throughout the life cycle is influenced by relevant ecological variables.
The ErbB family of receptor tyrosine kinases includes EGFR, ErbB2 , ErbB3 , and ErbB4 . Over the past ten years, it has become evident that many epithelial cancers require EGFR or HER2 signaling for their growth and survival. Inhibitors of EGFR and HER2 come in the form of small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitors  and targeted antibodies .
Despite the efficacy of empirically supported treatment options for patients with anxiety disorders , a great many patients with anxiety disorders are not reaping the benefits of these treatments, and treatment refusal and attrition remain a significant problem. For instance, motivation to change anxiety related behaviors appears to be a significant predictor of reduction of anxiety symptoms among patients with panic disorder  and generalized anxiety disorder . Another potential drawback is that the incorporation of a second treatment into existing CBT protocols may increase the total amount of time in treatment necessary for demonstrable treatment gains.
Muscle pain can result from repetitive or eccentric activity, and may persist for days  or weeks  after exposure to these activities . While the underlying cellular mechanisms in these pain syndromes are not well understood, inflammatory cytokines, which sensitize high threshold mechano sensitive muscle afferents  are likely to be involved . For example, following eccentric exercise in humans  and in a repetitive motion induced muscle pain model in the rat , levels of inflammatory cytokines are increased in the exercised limb .
Tissue factor pathway inhibitor , a Kunitz type serine protease inhibitor, is an endogenous inhibitor of TF mediated coagulation. TFPI suppresses factor Xa generation by binding via its Kunitz 1 domain to the TF:FVIIa catalytic complex and via its Kunitz 2 domain to factor Xa. The formation of a quaternary TF:VIIa:TFPI:Xa complex dampens ongoing FXa generation.
Global change is mostly associated with increasing concentrations of atmospheric CO2 and other greenhouse gases triggering climate change, but other anthropogenic processes also affect the local and global environment. With few measurements in remote areas, deposition and changes in deposition can only be estimated from large scale models . Wood also contains nitrogen, mainly in the form of cell wall proteins but also in various extractives.
Endothelin 1  is the predominant isoform of three distinct isopeptides constitutively secreted by endothelial and other vascular cells, and the most potent endogenous vasoconstrictor known . Indeed, ET 1 contributes to vascular stiffening and calcification with aging, which are all major independent cardiovascular risk factors and associated with cardiovascular complications such as myocardial infarction, stroke, and renal injury  . ET 1 activates two G protein coupled receptors, ETA and ETB .
Cancer development has been known to share many molecular frameworks with embryonic development, tissue renewal and differentiation . For example, in normal tissues the Notch signaling pathway is activated under strict temporal and spatial control during tissue regeneration and cell fate determination. Notch3 gene amplification correlated with gene overexpression and pathway activation in ovarian serous carcinoma tissues.
The incidence of type 1 diabetes  has been increasing globally at a rate of approximately 3% per year since the 1960s , and it varies in different parts of the world, with high figures in the Nordic countries  and the opposite in the countries of East Asia such as China and Japan with ∼1 case/year/100,000 individuals . These geographical differences in T1D incidence may be related to food consumption , as large quantities of soy products are widely used in traditional Asian diets, which are typically low in fat. Type 1 diabetes is mainly caused by autoimmune destruction of the pancreatic insulin producing β islet cells of Langerhans .
The development of T cells in the thymus is an ordered progression of differentiation and proliferation events . The majority of these regulators play ongoing roles throughout T cell development, however their specific effects can vary from one stage to another . The various stages of thymocyte differentiation have been characterized through the expression of specific cell surface markers.
Tumors of the central nervous system  have significant intra  and inter tumor heterogeneity in terms of cellular composition, cellular proliferation, invasiveness and epigenetic status . Integrative large scale gene expression analysis of 200 GBM tumors revealed 4 subtypes: proneural, neural, classical and mesenchymal . In addition, there are at least two prognostic subgroups of pediatric GBM based on association with or without aberrantly active Ras/AKT pathway .
However, despite the prevalence of loss experiences in young adults, and the potential for problematic grief responses, this age group has received relatively limited empirical attention . Psychological responses to loss of a family member or friend are complex, and vary in intensity and types of symptoms . There has been little investigation of whether personality variables  or the quality of the relationship between the bereaved and deceased  may play a role in the development of complicated grief or depression, particularly among young adults.
Mast cells play an important role in many immunological and inflammatory reactions. The activation of mast cells for release of these mediators in allergic reactions depends on IgE and its high affinity receptor FcεRI present on the surface of these cells. Tyrosine phosphorylated receptor recruits the cytoplasmic protein tyrosine kinase Syk to the membrane which results in a conformational change in Syk, with an increase in its enzymatic activity .
Over three fourths of the population with heart failure  is aged 65 years and older, and the proportion of older HF patients is projected to increase as more adults are surviving into old age. Indeed, older HF patients have greater hospitalization rates, health care expenditures, and mortality  as well as symptoms of exercise intolerance that are often more severe than in younger HF patients. Formal assessment of exercise performance with measurement of peak exercise oxygen consumption  and exercise ventilatory efficiency  using cardiopulmonary exercise testing , is commonly used to guide management of HF patients.
Human immunodeficiency virus type 1  is a member of the lentivirus subfamily of the Retroviridae family and the etiologic agent of acquired immune deficiency syndrome . During or shortly after budding, Gag is proteolytically cleaved by the viral protease into the four major structural proteins: matrix , capsid, nucleocapsid, p6; and the two spacer proteins p1 and p2. This cleavage is required for efficient release of particles from cells .
Recent studies have suggested that general anesthetics act through specific ion channels to inhibit neuronal excitability. On the basis of the membrane potential at which they activate, these channels are subdivided into high voltage activated  and low voltage activated , or transient  Ca2+ channels. These channels are products of different genes, which give rise to α1 subunits that form the pores of the neuronal Ca2+ channels named CaV1 family  encoding L type; CaV2.1  encoding P/Q type; CaV2.2  encoding N type; and CaV2.3  encoding R type.
Tocomin® represents commercially available mixture of naturally occurring tocotrienols  and tocopherol  extracted from palm oil/palm fruits that possess powerful antioxidant, anticancer, neuro/cardioprotective and cholesterol lowering properties. Cellular autophagy represents a defense mechanism against oxidative stress and several anticancer compounds. Recently, we reported that tocotrienols induce apoptosis and endoplasmic reticulum stress in breast cancer cells .
Craniosynostosis is defined as the premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures and is a common malformation  occurring in all ethnic groups . Craniosynostosis of the sagittal suture is the most common form of craniosynostosis, accounting for 5560% of all craniosynostoses . Although environmental and genetic risk factors for craniosynostosis have been identified, no single risk factor has emerged as being necessary or sufficient to cause premature fusion of any of the calvarial sutures.
Polypeptides expressed from the Hepatitis C virus  genome are of interest because the virus infects more than 170 million people . A 3,000 amino acid polypeptide is encoded from a single stranded RNA of 9.6 kb. This polypeptide is cleaved proteolytically into 10 mature proteins; 3 structural proteins , 6 non structural proteins  and a small 63 residue membrane protein  whose sequence is found between those of the structural and non structural proteins.
Heterotaxy syndrome is characterized by multiple congenital anomalies arising from defects in embryonic left right patterning and loss of normal asymmetric laterality . The developing heart is particularly sensitive to left right positional information, and abnormalties are associated with significant morbidity and mortality due to structural defects and/or arrhythmias . Cardiac conduction system  abnormalities in the human heterotaxy population are thought to arise from either duplication or absence of one or more CCS elements resulting from similar left right patterning abnormalities.
Modic changes  are signal variations of the vertebral endplate and the adjacent subchondral vertebral marrow seen on magnetic resonance images  . According to the patterns of signal changes on T1  and T2 weighted images, traditionally MCs have been classified into three types . Type 1 MCs show decreased signal intensity on T1 weighted images and increased signal intensity on T2 weighted images.
Breast cancer is a common malignancy and a leading cause of cancer deaths in women . It results from the accumulation of genetic alterations including activation of oncogenes and inactivation of tumor suppressor genes . Identification and characterization of these genes improve our understanding of breast cancer and management of patients.
Aortic root dilation leading to aortic dissection has been associated with numerous connective tissue disorders such as Marfan syndrome , EhlersDanlos syndrome  and LoeysDietz syndrome  . Other patients at risk include those with valvular abnormalities such as bicuspid aortic valve  and various genetic syndromes such as Turner syndrome, 18q deletion syndrome, and fragile X syndrome . In addition to valvular abnormalities and genetic syndromes, adult onset diseases, such as hypertension, are additional risk factors for aortic root dilation .
Mouse thyroglobulin  sensitized splenocytes activated in vitro with MTG and IL 12 induce a severe granulomatous form of experimental autoimmune thyroiditis  after transfer to syngeneic recipients . G EAT lesions are characterized by infiltration of inflammatory cells and destruction of thyroid follicles . Thyroid lesions reach maximal severity 20 days after cell transfer, and inflammation resolves or progresses to fibrosis by day 60 depending on the extent of thyroid damage at day 20 .
Childhood asthma is the most common chronic disease among children and is a major public health problem in the United States as well as in many other countries, such as Colombia, which has a prevalence estimated at 10 12% . Childhood asthma causes considerable morbidity, interference with normal daily activities, and a burden for the health care systems and for the whole family, especially during periods when it is inadequately controlled . Asthma control has been considered a key therapeutic goal and an outcome measure in clinical research studies, and its regular assessment has been recommended as a guide to a stepwise  approach to asthma therapy  .
Conventional chemotherapeutic regimens involve high doses of a cytotoxic agent followed by a 3  to 4 week rest period. Such scheduling was believed to be important to balance the drug’s toxic effects on the tumor and on the host. However, recent studies using this approach have demonstrated a rapid acquisition of chemoresistance in certain patient populations after an initial response .
For nearly 50 years the rate of progression of COPD has been defined by the slope of the annual decline in FEV1 determined from serial measurements of FEV1 obtained over a span of years in the course of observational or intervention studies. In intervention trials conducted over the last few decades, this slope has been determined mainly from serial measurements of the post , rather than the pre , bronchodilator FEV1 . The rationale for the latter practice appears to derive from the assumption that there may be less variability in the post  than the pre bronchodilator measurement and that the post bronchodilator value would be less influenced by noncompliance with instructions to withhold bronchodilator medication during the washout period prior to scheduled spirometric testing.
Malaria continues to impose a substantial health burden across the globe. It is estimated that annually between 300 and 500 million clinical cases of malaria occur, of which 1.5 to 2.7 million cases are fatal . G protein coupled receptor signalling pathways provide a means for intracellular components to respond to extracellular stimuli.
Neurotrophic factors including the tolloid/bone morphogenetic protein 1  family of metalloproteinases enhance the survival, growth, and function of neurons. The tolloids and BMP 1 contain a conserved metalloproteinase domain not found in BMPs 27 which are classed as transforming growth factor β  superfamily members . Furthermore, a tolloid like gene, apTolloid/BMP 1 , in the marine mollusk Aplysia was found to be regulated during nonassociative long term sensitization .
The social brain hypothesis states that the emergence of computationally more powerful brains cannot be explained solely by the ensuing advantage in solving problems posed by the physical environment. Indeed, it has been shown that facial judgments may be processed in less than 100 ms  . Moreover, the fact that humans appear to have universal standards of facial attractiveness within and across cultures  implies a biologically encoded mechanism rather than an effect of enculturation  .
Nanomaterials are used in a range of appliances and household products, in the manufacture of textiles and electronics, as well as for medical products and in bioremediation technology. Metal oxide nanoparticles  are commonly used due to their exceptional physicochemical properties, which make them highly suitable and desirable for many consumer products and industrial technologies . CuO NPs also have potential wide industrial applications, such as gas sensors, photovoltaic cells, catalyst, and heat transfer nano fluids .
The kidney shows a quantifiable decrease in function with age . The glomerular filtration rate declines with 20 25% from 40 to 80 years of age. This has been linked, using kidney tissue obtained before transplantation and on autopsies of subjects not known to have a renal disease, to a significant increase with age of the number of sclerotic glomeruli and the amount of interstitial tissue .
Brain metabolite measurements using MR spectroscopy  generally require averaging of many acquisitions from the same spatial location to obtain acceptable signal to noise ratio . This results in relatively long scan times and increases the likelihood that the subject will move at some point during the scan. Such motion can cause errors and artifacts that may not be evident in typical quality assurance procedures.
Glutamate, the major excitatory neurotransmitter in the central nervous system , is neurotoxic when its extracellular concentration is high. Glutamate transporters, also called excitatory amino acid transporters , play an important role in removing glutamate from extracellular space into cells . Dysfunction of EAATs causes extracellular glutamate accumulation that results in glutamate excitatoxicity.
Resistance to chemotherapy is a major obstacle for the success of cancer therapy. Paclitaxel is a diterpenoid compound initially isolated from Taxus brevifolia and is widely used against malignant epithelial tumors. There are a variety of mechanisms responsible for the development of chemoresistance in cancer cells; reduced drug uptake or increased drug efflux, increased repair of drug targets, alteration of drug targets that prevent drug binding or action and blocks in biochemical pathways that mediate drug induced cytotoxicity.
Depression and substance abuse are common among low income, minority adults in safety net settings. Little is known about comorbidities across service sectors supporting these clients . The study uses cross sectional baseline client data  from Community Partners in Care , an initiative to improve depression services in Los Angeles County.
Glaucoma is a multifactorial disease that results in progressive death of retinal ganglion cells and loss of visual fields. Studies have shown that open angle glaucoma  disproportionately affects people of African descent  over those of European descent  and is a leading cause of blindness in persons of AD . Furthermore, it has a younger age of onset, progresses more rapidly and occurs with greater severity in the AD population .
Members of the ABC  transporter superfamily are widely recognized as major contributors to controlling drug distribution and pharmacokinetics, and the acquisition of anticancer drug resistance. While several ABC transporters have been shown to transport anticancer drugs in vitro, P glycoprotein  stands out by conferring the highest level of resistance to a vast array of drugs and because of its demonstrated association with clinical multidrug resistance  and poor clinical outcome . Pgp transports large, hydrophobic, positively charged molecules that can have strikingly dissimilar structures, including clinically relevant compounds such as anticancer drugs, human immunodeficiency virus  protease inhibitors, immunosuppressive agents and antiepileptics .
Barriers to consent when conducting prehospital research are unavoidable. Federal regulations allow an exception from informed consent  for certain studies. However, before an EFIC study can be approved, investigators must consult both the geographic community where the study will be conducted and the community from which subjects will be drawn  .
TSC is an autosomal dominant disorder characterized by the growth of benign tumors called hamartomas in multiple organs including the brain . TSC patients suffer from epilepsy, autism and developmental delay. TSC is caused by mutations in either the TSC1 or TSC2 genes.
For many years, multidrug resistance  has been explained solely as the result of ABCB1 over expression in a tumor . The authors discovered that these cells displayed resistance to a variety of structurally and mechanistically unrelated drugs in addition to colchicine . Human P glycoprotein, the product of the MDR1 or ABCB1 gene, was subsequently shown to confer MDR on drug sensitive cells .
Mail order pharmacies are widely used to deliver medications in the U.S., with up to 1/3 of chronic illness medications delivered by mail. Research suggests a positive association between mail order pharmacy use and greater adherence to diabetes and antihypertensive medications,  and with better LDL C control. These favorable outcomes may reflect improved access to medications with mail order pharmacy use, which may be of particular value to patients with disabilities, time constraints, or limited transportation ., However, there may be unintended consequences to using mail order pharmacies.
Imaging and therapy play crucial roles in prevention, early diagnosis, efficient treatment, and confirmation of complete cure. Optical coherence tomography  that utilizes a low coherence light source is a non invasive and high speed imaging modality for obtaining micrometer resolution images of tissue structure and velocity fluctuation  of scattering particles. Among various OCT contrast agents for obtaining enhanced optical signals, gold nanoparticles  are promising OCT contrasting agents.
Tobacco use is the major preventable cause of premature death in the United States, accounting for more than 400,000 annual deaths from cancer, cardiovascular and respiratory disease., Secondhand smoke  exposure in nonsmokers increases the risk of lung cancer, cardiovascular disease, and has a number of other negative health outcomes. Cotinine is further metabolized by P450 2A6 to trans 3' hydroxycotinine . P450 2A6 activity varies across people and the ratio of 3' HCOT to cotinine has been used as a measure of this variability.
Long term efficacy of osteochondral allografts  depends on the presence of viable chondrocytes within graft cartilage to locally maintain homeostasis and prevent degeneration. Historically, fresh OCA, used within 7d of donor death, have high chondrocyte viability and, when implanted into large cartilage defects to treat isolated post traumatic, osteonecrotic, or osteochondritis dissecans lesions, has resulted in long term clinical success rates  >75%. While chondrocyte viability is a useful marker of overall cartilage tissue function, future improvements in the application of OCA would benefit from identifying markers of allograft biological performance and sensitive indices of cartilage function .
Food frequency questionnaires  facilitate dietary data collection in large cohort studies and are the most frequently used diet assessment method in nutritional epidemiology to assess habitual eating habits and rank individuals’ energy and nutrient intake . Development of an appropriate food and nutrient database is required to translate information derived from FFQs into estimates of nutrient intake, dietary quality or for absolute or rank ordered nutritional risk assessment . Experts use a variety of approaches in database development for FFQ analysis, including reliance on expert opinion , population specific data driven methods , or a combination of the two .
The development of Ln magnetic resonance imaging  contrast agents that report on their environment through molecular interactions is an active area of research. Ln MRI agents have been designed for sensing pH, metabolite concentrations, metal ions, proteins, or enzymes. A relatively new class of contrast agent known as paramagnetic chemical exchange saturation transfer  agents, shows promise for development as responsive MRI agents.
CXCR4  is a G protein coupled receptor which serves many functions in the immune system. CXCR4 defects in humans lead to a syndrome characterized by warts, hypogammaglobulinemia, immunodeficiency, and myelokathexis, collectively termed the WHIM syndrome  . CXCR4 monogamously recognizes the CXC chemokine ligand 12 , also known as stromal cell derived factor 1 , or pre B cell growth stimulating factor .
Endothelin 1  is one of several vasoconstrictors that may play a role in the progression of Crohn’s Disease and ulcerative colitis, conditions categorized as inflammatory bowel disease . Elevated plasma  and tissue  levels of the potent vasoconstrictor have been found in IBD patients, with the elevations speculated to induce hypoxia  as a consequence of decreased blood flow. over 30 years ago, decreases in blood flow are found more frequently in chronic and mild IBD and in the late fibrosing stage of Crohn’s Disease, while increases in blood flow can be found in severe IBD .
The twin epidemics of obesity and diabetes threaten to overwhelm healthcare systems in the U.S. and worldwide. Specifically, 2/3 of the US population is overweight or obese, while 40% exhibit symptoms of pre  or frank diabetes, and the combined direct and indirect costs of obesity and diabetes are now approaching $500 billion a year. Compounding those factors in a subset of mentally ill patients is the use of second generation antipsychotics , which are known to induce weight gain and to exacerbate risk for metabolic disease and diabetes, especially in youth .
The endoplasmic reticulum associated degradation  pathway mediates the destruction of numerous normal and misfolded ER localized proteins . Accordingly, there is great impetus to understand the molecular mechanisms that mediate this important route of protein degradation . Ubiquitin is then transferred from the ubiquitin charged E2 to the substrate or the growing ubiquitin chain by the action of an E3 ubiquitin ligase, resulting in a substrate attached multi ubiquitin chain.
Statistical analyses are an essential component of medical research, which when appropriately applied can further our understanding of risk factors, treatment effects and other aspects of disease. Knowledge of statistics is also important for those involved in the peer review process of a research article, as they will be responsible for judging the adequacy and correctness of the statistical methods used. In fact, readers often rely on the “approval stamp” given to articles that have undergone peer review by a reputable journal.
The human mitochondrial genome  is a small, circular, highly coding molecule , making mtDNA mutations more likely to be deleterious than nuclear ones . Until recently, mammalian mitochondria were not thought to possess any DNA repair activities , however, it is now clear that mitochondria are proficient in DNA repair of certain types of DNA lesions, particularly those repaired by the base excision repair  pathway, which removes oxidative and alkylating damage . DNA microsatellite instability  is a hallmark of several types of cancer .
Subtilosin, a ribosomally synthesized 3.4 kDa cyclical peptide  produced by both Bacillus subtilis  and Bacillus amyloliquefaciens , is a bacteriocin that has the potential for applications in contraception and reproductive health due to its unique properties, such as natural origin, biodegradability, antimicrobial properties, lack of immunogenicity, overall safety, ease of production and formulation . This compound also displays antimicrobial activity against the foodborne pathogen Listeria monocytogenes Scott A  and against bacterial vaginosis associated pathogen Gardnerella vaginalis, including their antibiotic resistant forms  . Over 530 million people worldwide are infected with HSV 2, which can cause recurrent and painful genital lesions, being recurrent genital herpes, the most prevalent sexually transmitted disease  .
Cardiac amyloidosis involves the deposition of insoluble fibrils in the myocardium and is an underdiagnosed cause of heart failure with preserved ejection fraction . The most clinically relevant cardiac involvement occurs in primary light chain  amyloidosis, familial transthyretin amyloidosis , and senile transthyretin amyloidosis . Other forms of systemic amyloidosis including secondary AA amyloidosis rarely affect the heart.
Large intracranial arterial occlusions are associated with high morbidity and mortality. In patients who are ineligible for or fail intravenous thrombolytic therapy, endovascular revascularization is often the only method that can potentially improve functional outcome. Although a good arterial occlusive lesion  score represents good or excellent target vessel recanalization and is associated with favorable clinical outcomes, it does not necessarily equate to tissue revascularization.
The growth in science and engineering research conducted by teams has dramatically accelerated since 1975, making multi university collaborations the fastest growing authorship structure. Numerous literature reviews have found that team science is becoming increasingly prominent. Bennett, Gadlin and Levine Finley provide a generic definition of team science: “Team science has been described as a collaborative and often cross disciplinary approach to scientific inquiry that draws researchers who otherwise work independently or as coinvestigators on smaller scale projects into collaborative centers and groups.” The definitions or models of team science are very closely situated with or intended to inform strategies for evaluating team science.
The intracellular adaptor Dab1 is a key regulator of neuronal migration during brain development . The protein is composed of an N terminus domain of approximately 180 amino acids, named PI/PTB , followed by a cluster of five tyrosines and a C terminus containing two consensus regions for the serine/threonine kinase Cdk5 . Further confirmation that Dab1 conveys a Reelin signal in neuronal migration through lipoprotein receptors, came from the observation that mouse mutants for the four genes  show the same neuronal migration defects  .
The spirochete genus Borrelia comprises three major groups of species. The first group includes several agents of relapsing fever , such as B. duttonii and B. hermsii. The species of the second group are transmitted by hard  ticks of the genus Ixodes and include agents of Lyme borreliosis , such as B. burgdorferi and B. afzelii, as well as species, such as B. bissettii, that have not been associated with human disease.
Decades of epidemiological data strongly suggest that high density lipoproteins  protect against cardiovascular disease . These mutant SR BI receptors were unable to mediate selective uptake of HDL cholesteryl esters  in cultured cells . While the risk for cardiovascular disease has not been assessed in this small cohort of patients, the antiatherogenic properties of SR BI and its ability to promote reverse cholesterol transport are firmly established in genetically modified mouse models.
Although control of cardiovascular disease  risk factors reduces morbidity and mortality, most Americans at risk for CVD related events have not achieved therapeutic goals for management of these factors. The American Diabetes Association and the National Diabetes Education Program have promoted use of the ABC indicators, which include:  glycated hemoglobin  for control of diabetes mellitus,  blood pressure, and  cholesterol  as modifiable indicators targeted for treatment in order to reduce CVD risk. The D factor  has been added by the current researchers as an additional risk factor.
In 1992, six years after Bill Brinkley became editor in chief of Cell Motility and the Cytoskeleton following the untimely death of founding editor Robert D. Allen,  demonstrated that tubulin and the radial spokes of Chlamydomonas flagella are delivered to the distal tip of the flagellar axoneme where assembly of the organelle occurs. Very shortly thereafter, the process of intraflagellar transport  was first observed in the Rosenbaum laboratory at Yale . IFT is necessary for organelle assembly and maintenance because IFT transports materials to the distal tip, the site of organelle growth and turnover, and returns components back to the cell body for degradation or recycling .
Basic mechanisms responsible for temperature regulation in living animals are well understood. Since no “heat storage” is known to exist in the brain, temperature regulation in the brain can only rely on communication between brain and body as metabolites are delivered and heat is exchanged through blood flow. With fixed OEF this differential does not depend on the temperature of arterial blood, however, decreasing blood temperature could change the rate of metabolic reactions leading to decreased OEF .
The acute defensive response to a threatening event prompts behavioral, physiological, and cognitive reactions that are essential to survival. Whereas traditional psychophysiological models have interpreted the initial phase of defense  as indicating sensory “rejection” to facilitate internal processing or protect the individual from the aversive character of the external stimuli , the defense cascade model  predicts enhanced perceptual processing in the context of an acute defensive response. According to this view, emotions are founded on defensive  motivational circuits in the brain that developed early in evolutionary history to ensure the survival of individuals and their progeny.
The most frequently studied candidate gene for Neuroticism, depression, anxiety related traits and disorders is the serotonin transporter . The SLC6A4 gene is on chromosome 17q11.1 q12. estimated that the polymorphism accounted for 3% to 4% of total variation and 7% to 9% of inherited variance of anxiety related personality traits.
Psoriasis is an autoimmune disease affecting 7.5 million Americans. There is increasing evidence that psoriasis is associated with the prevalence and incidence of diabetes and diabetes related complications. Prospective studies from several countries have found that the risk of developing diabetes is increased among those with psoriasis, especially among those with more severe psoriasis.
One of the greatest challenges in ocular drug delivery is effectively administering drugs to the back of the eye to treat diseases of the retina, choroid and vitreous body . Such posterior segment diseases include macular degeneration and diabetic retinopathy, which are two of the leading cause of blindness. While conventional delivery using topical eye drops can transport drug to the anterior segment, this method generally cannot deliver useful amounts of drug to the posterior segment, due to rapid elimination via precorneal tears and conjunctival blood flow, low corneal permeability coupled with counter directional intraocular flow of aqueous humor, and long diffusional distances from the ocular surface to the back of the eye .
The human  and mouse  melanocortin 1 G protein coupled cell surface receptors play important roles in melanocyte biology, notably in the production of melanin pigment . Engagement between Mc1r and α MSH results in stimulation of black eumelanin production through a cAMP dependent signaling pathway . In humans, the MC1R is highly polymorphic with more than 70 variants described .
Acyl CoA binding protein , also known as diazepam  binding inhibitor , is a soluble 10 kDa lipid binding protein ubiquitously expressed in all tissues of eukaryotic species examined . Via the ACBP promoter, ACBP expression is also determined by several nuclear transcription factors important in lipid and glucose metabolism: peroxisome proliferator activated receptors   α and  γ as well as sterol regulatory element binding protein  . LCFA CoAs are potent regulators of a wide variety of enzymes, signaling receptors, and nuclear regulatory proteins involved in fatty acid and glucose metabolism .
Ovarian carcinoma is the fourth most common cause of cancer death among women in the United States, with more than 21,550 new cases diagnosed and an 14,600 deaths estimated for 2009 . A recent report demonstrated that the response rate for various regimens in the setting of second line chemotherapy for recurrent platinum resistant CCC was only 1% . One possible treatment strategies that may improve patient outcome is the use of angiogenesis targeted agents.
NADH:quinone oxidoreductase 1  is a cytosolic protein that catalyzes metabolism of quinones and their derivatives . It has been shown that the two electron reduction of quinones, catalyzed by NQO1, competes with the one electron reduction catalyzed by cytochromes P450 and P450 reductase. Human NQO1 gene has been localized to chromosome 16q22 .
The study of open set masked sentence recognition is often limited by the number of unique items available in a particular corpus. These corpora vary on a number of dimensions , and not all are appropriate for testing all listener groups, such as children or non native speakers of English. Many early studies of auditory and visual word recognition used the ascending method of limits, wherein a parameter affecting recognition  is systematically increased, and threshold is defined as the point at which the word is correctly identified .
Proliferation of somatic cells in higher eukaryotes depends on the presence of external mitogens, which activate corresponding receptors present on the plasma membrane. A common downstream event of these receptor activations is the activation of the mitogen activated protein kinase  cascade by Ras . A typical MAPK cascade comprises three sequential protein kinases RAF, MEK and ERK.
Acetaminophen is one of the most commonly used over the counter analgesics and the major cause of acute liver failure due to accidental and intentional overdose . Toxicity is characterized by centrilobular hepatic necrosis progressing to fulminant liver failure . Tissue repair following acetaminophen intoxication involves proliferation of remnant hepatocytes and the production of new extracellular matrix proteins .
Since its invention, MRI has moved to ever stronger magnetic fields to exploit the concomitant increases in signal to noise ratio and the opportunity to obtain images with improved contrast. Despite formidable challenges from the underlying physics, cardiac MRI has recently been demonstrated at 7 Tesla  . The FLASH   and bSSFP   images obtained are of sufficient quality to assess cardiac volume and function ; and right coronary angiography is feasible .
In clinical and research assessments of respiratory health, it is often necessary to conduct multiple tests during a brief visit. Although closely spaced tests may be unavoidable, concern that one test could influence the results of subsequent tests may lead to test ordering recommendations to minimize possible carryover effects. Early evidence showed that prior spirometric maneuvers reduced FeNO , so current American Thoracic Society/European Respiratory Society  guidelines recommend collecting FeNO before spirometry .
The combination of mass spectrometry with solution phase hydrogen/deuterium exchange  has become a powerful method to study protein structure and protein/protein interactions  . The reliability and sequence resolution of solution phase HDX monitored by mass spectrometry has been hampered by the limited number and poor specificity of proteases that are active at the low pH necessary to quench HDX. However, incomplete cleavage of some proteins and limited number of proteolytic peptides has restricted its range of applicability.
Bacteria are oftentimes found associated with animals, plants, fungi, and protists, as well as other bacteria. They have been successful in colonizing both extra cellular and intracellular tissues of their host, enabling some specific function or capability. In particular, environmental transmission has a number of obstacles prior to infection as well as during colonization and persistence that bacteria are constantly subjected to .
In striated muscle, ryanodine receptor channels  located at the sarcoplasmic reticulum  calcium stores are the main pathway for intracellular Ca2+ release upon physiological or pharmacological stimulation ,  and  . Functional studies of gating of RyR channel molecules require their isolation from cells  and . In skeletal muscle, L type Ca2+ channels  activate RyR1 mediated SR Ca2+ release through physical interactions , ,  and .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive neuronal degenerative disorder of the central nervous system that ultimately results in the loss of cognitive function . This disease is characterized by the accumulation of toxic amyloid β  proteins in the extracellular space of the brain and on the wall of blood vessels in the brain  . The endothelium of brain blood vessels provides a semi permeable barrier between blood components and brain tissue.
Asthma is a complex disease caused by multiple genetic and environmental factors. Two traditional approaches for identification of asthma susceptibility genes are association studies of candidate genes and linkage studies followed by positional cloning. Candidate gene association studies focus on genes plausibly involved in disease pathogenesis or located in a region of linkage for the disease.
A population of resident cardiac stem/progenitor cells  has been found to contribute to the regeneration of myocardium after injury, myocardial infarction , or with stress such as pressure overload . SDF1 CXCR4 has also been shown to play a prominent role in the maintenance of the hematopoietic stem cell niche in the bone marrow   . We have also noted, in the myocardium, that chronic blockade of SDF1 CXCR4 with the antagonist AMD3100 results in increased proliferation of c kit+ CSPCs which was also seen in primitive hematopoietic progenitors, .
Phosphorylation of myofilament proteins is an important post translational modification which regulates cardiomyocyte contractility of the heart. cTnI is the “inhibitor” of the trimeric troponin complex, which together with cardiac troponin C  and cardiac troponin T , controls the position of tropomyosin on the actin filament in response to Ca2+ and thereby regulates actin myosin interactions and thus cardiomyocyte force development and relaxation. cTnI has multiple phosphorylation sites that regulate cardiomyocyte contractility in cardiac health and disease.
The great French physiologist, Claude Bernard, introduced the idea of the “inner world” of the body, when he theorized that body systems function as they do to maintain a constant internal environment what he called the milieu interieur. Near the end of his life, in about 1876, he postulated that the body maintains the constant internal environment by myriad, continual, compensatory reactions, which would tend to restore a state of equilibrium in response to any outside changes, enabling independence from the external environment. Pasteur on his deathbed is said to have conceded, “Bernard was right.
While a wide variety of self report measures have been developed to assess adherence with HIV ART, few of the questionnaire items that make up these measures have been subjected to rigorous cognitive testing to ensure that the items are consistently understood by respondents. Accurate self reports of medication could be useful in routine clinical care because research has consistently shown that physicians’ assessment of their patients’ adherence with ART is inaccurate . They could also be useful for research when more objective measures such as MEMS caps  or unannounced pill counts  are impractical or too costly  .
Rapid developments in tissue engineering utilizing decellularized whole organs as biologic scaffolds coupled with advances in stem and endogenous lung progenitor cell biology have offered the potential of using acellular suboptimal donor or cadaveric lungs recellularized with appropriate cell types for ex vivo lung regeneration . Acellular lungs are also powerful in vitro platforms for studying cell extracellular matrix  interactions in lung diseases such as emphysema and fibrosis, and in aging . As acellular scaffolds derived from rodent lungs are readily available and easily handled, high throughput approaches can be utilized to study cell matrix interaction or to assess the multiple conditions needed for effective recellularization and development of functional lung tissue .
Dysregulation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal axis , one of the body's major stress sensitive physiological systems, is frequently implicated in the etiology of Major Depressive Disorder  . Robust cross sectional associations have been found between the presence of MDD and a variety of alterations of the HPA axis, including elevated cortisol levels, elevated corticotropin releasing hormone , and impaired negative feedback control of the HPA . The few existing studies taking this prospective longitudinal approach have converged upon similar findings.
Accurate computation of free energies of binding remains a key challenge for computer aided drug design. Consequently, the resultant starting point has some ambiguity for typical free energy perturbation  or thermodynamic integration calculations, which could be used to predict the effects of ligand modifications that displace water molecules . However, simulations in the grand canonical ensemble require definition of a constant chemical potential.
In the classical view, the cellular signal generated by a heterotrimeric guanine nucleotidebinding protein coupled receptor  is governed by the affinity and efficacy of its natural agonist. In addition to facilitating the trafficking of receptors to the plasma membrane, RAMPs act as switches to control the ligand preferences of two class B GPCRs, calcitonin and calcitonin receptorlike receptors  . Recently, the essential role of an accessory protein for the MC2 receptor, MC2R accessory protein , was described .
Although primary Sjögren’s syndrome  affects up to 0.10.6% of the general population, few rigorous etiologic studies have focused on the initiating immunopathologic process occurring in the exocrine glands. Gene expression profiling studies demonstrated activation of type I and type II IFN pathways in pSS patients . B cells are highly activated in this auto immune disease through diverse pathways, including the overexpression of the BAFF cytokine , and T cell patterns are skewed towards a memory phenotype and a T helper 1  polarization associated with high serum levels of IFN γ .
The number of distinct spoken words is a widely used measure of early language abilities, which manifests during infancy. Word comprehension  in typically developing children starts at the age of about 6 to 9 months and the spontaneous production of words  emerges at about 10 to 15 months,. During the next months the accumulation of words is typically slow, but then followed by an increase in rate, often quite sharp, around 14 to 22 months of age ,.
Epigenetic mechanisms, i.e., DNA methylation and histone modification, are important for normal development including imprinting, X inactivation, cell differentiation and transcription. , The status of transcription  is associated with specific types of modifications at particular residues of histone tails. Environmental variables, including stress, maternal behavior, environmental disruptors and nutrition affect neural development and also influence sexual differentiation of the neonatal brain.
Dyskeratosis congenita is a rare skin and bone marrow failure syndrome, associated with a classical triad of mucocutaneous abnormalities, namely abnormal skin pigmentation, leukoplakia and nail dystrophy . Pancytopenia is frequent and bone marrow failure is the most common cause of death. The more common X linked form is due to mutations in DKC1, encoding dyskerin .
Idiopathic intracranial hypertension  is increasingly recognized as a cause of spontaneous cerebrospinal  leak in the ENT and neurosurgical literature. The diagnosis of IIH in patients with spontaneous CSF leaks is classically made a few weeks after surgical repair of the CSF leak when symptoms and signs of elevated intracranial pressure  appear . Two young obese women developed spontaneous CSF rhinorrhea related to an empty sella in one, and a cribriform plate encephalocele in the other.
Microglia activation constitutes a major mechanism of self defense against brain injury, infection and disease. In the pilocarpine mouse seizure model, microgliosis persists for at least 30 days following seizure induction and correlates with local neuronal death . Changes in glial function could perhaps be a component of metabolic abnormalities which are observed in epileptic patients  and rodent seizure models .
Diet is a complex and irrefutable risk factor for cardiovascular disease . Egg is a significant source of cholesterol, containing an average of 213 mg per egg. European and Canadian guidelines, in contrast, do not restrict cholesterol, as the literature suggests that saturated and trans fat restriction is a more effective means of CVD risk reduction., Egg is a low glycemic index, whole food that has been part of the human diet since early mankind.
Structural changes in glycosylation that are influenced by disease states have been of great interest, especially with respect to oncogenesis and tumor progression, and many reports have focused on such biomarkers for cancer related diagnosis. We have reported such changes in murine cancer cells, including metastatic and non metastatic astrocytomas. Current protocols remain a cottage industry of techniques, where no existing approach is comprehensive.
Nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide  is an essential coenzyme regulating numerous cellular metabolic pathways. In particular, NAD has been recognized as a substrate for a growing group of “NADdependent” enzymes with multiple roles in cellular regulation . NAD dependent protein modifications are catalyzed by enzymes broadly defined as ADP ribosyl transferases.
Adults in all human societies face the task of supervising and socializing the young to follow norms for acceptable behavior. Accordingly, the influence of adults is a central theme in the study of adolescent deviant behaviors such as delinquency and drug use. Most of this work focuses on parents , the adults with primary responsibility for these tasks and with whom children initially spend the most time.
Influenza viruses belong to the family Orthomyxoviridae and are divided into three genera A, B, and C . Influenza A and B viruses are responsible for the annual epidemics in humans . Contemporary influenza B viruses can be divided into two genetically and antigenically distinct lineages known as Victoria and Yamagata lineages .
Protein arginine methyltransferase  5 belongs to a family of enzymes that transfer a methyl group from S adenosylmethionine to the arginine side chains of histones and other proteins . PRMT members are divided into four types  based on patterns of arginine methylation. PRMT5 plays a role in cell signaling, chromatin remodeling, and control of gene expression through its association with MEP50 and the subsequent methylation of many cytoplasmic and nuclear substrates, including histone, nucleolin, p53, eIF4E, EGFR, and C RAF .
Control over a previous stressful experience is an important factor in determining an organism’s neural and behavioral response to future stressful events. IS can also enhance the behavioral struggling responses to subsequent novel stressors , and is also known to produce a sensitized neural response  in the hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus  to subsequent novel stress challenge . Thus, it is unknown whether the emergence of a sensitized HPA axis response to novel stressors observed after IS is an outcome that depends on the lack of stressor controllability during the initial tailshock session.
The body responds to tissue damage and infection by mounting an inflammatory response that serves to protect the affected tissue from further insult. Although P. gingivalis possesses virulence factors that alone can induce tissue damage, such as Arg X and Lys X specific extracellular cysteine proteinases , the accumulation of inflammatory cytokines is a major contributor to the breakdown of periodontal tissues. While there is some debate as to whether P. gingivalis derived LPS activates both TLR2 and TLR4, several studies indicate that both receptors can be stimulated by highly purified LPS or lipid A molecules, and by stimulation with the intact bacterium .
The cilium is a subcellular organelle that protrudes from the plasma membrane of almost every vertebrate cell. While ciliopathies can present overlapping phenotypes, the extent to which the pathways mechanistically overlap has yet to be determined . Seven proteins  form a stable complex, the BBSome, which mediates protein trafficking to the ciliary membrane and perhaps to other membrane compartments .
Mitochondria are essential for maintaining neuronal viability and neuronal function because of their ability to provide ATP, regulate calcium homeostasis and control Fe/S cluster biogenesis . Consistent with this critical role, abnormalities in mitochondrial structure and function are closely associated with a wide array of neurological diseases and nervous system injury . Recent evidence demonstrates that mitochondria are highly dynamic structures that display significant variability in size, shape and distribution.
Ovarian cancer remains the most lethal gynecologic cancer, with approximately 15,000 ovarian cancer related deaths estimated in the United States in 2008 . Secretory leukocyte protease inhibitor  has been reported as one of the most commonly amplified genes in epithelial ovarian cancer , an observation that is explained in part by genomic amplification of the SLPI locus, 20q12 13 . Significantly elevated serum concentrations of SLPI have been found in ovarian cancer patients compared to healthy women or women with benign ovarian cysts, leading to the inclusion of SLPI in some experimental ovarian cancer biomarker panels  .
The obligate intracellular pathogen, Anaplasma phagocytophilum, survives and propagates primarily within neutrophils by reprogramming critical granulocyte functions. This reprogramming includes delayed neutrophil apoptosis that allows time for bacterial replication , increased recruitment and clustering of neutrophils which promotes bacterial dissemination and inflammatory response , and impaired host defenses, such as reduced NADPH oxidase superoxide anion production that permits intracellular survival . These modifications occur with active intracellular replication and with changes in host gene transcription.
Iron, copper, and zinc are three of the most abundant transition metals in biology and are essential components of most cells . Accordingly, there is a growing body of evidence indicating that cells maintain total concentrations of these transiton metal ions within a narrow conserved range, which is defined as the resting or minimal “metal quota”,,. However, cells such as mammalian oocytes are rare and there are few quantitative approaches appropriate for single cell analysis, making it difficult to establish the concentration of essential metals and their functions at key points in development .
HIV drug resistance  testing is not routinely available in many resource limited settings , therefore ART program and site factors known to be associated with HIVDR should be monitored to optimize the quality of patient care and minimize the emergence of preventable HIVDR . In 2009, Namibia selected five World Health Organization Early Warning Indicators  and piloted abstraction at nine antiretroviral therapy  sites: ART prescribing practices, Patients lost to follow up  at 12 months, Patient retention on first line ART at 12 months, On time antiretroviral  drug pick up, and ARV drug supply continuity . Definitions for these selected EWIs and their respective recommended targets are summarized in  .
Rapamycin  is a specific inhibitor of the mTORC1 signaling complex, the central regulator of cell nutrient sensing and energy metabolism . Applied in high doses , rapa is a well known immune suppressant, used to prevent organ rejection . However, recent seminal studies highlighted the importance of nutrient sensing pathways during an immune response by showing that short term mTORC1 inhibition using low dose rapa  enhanced the development of antigen specific memory CD8 T cells during acute infection .
Compared with cone mediated photopic vision or rod mediated scotopic vision, mesopic vision is more complex because it involves both rods and cones, i.e., rod and cone signals interact with each other to contribute to our vision. Modern anatomical and physiological studies have identified three major neural retinogeniculate pathways in the primate visual system that convey retinal information to visual cortex, the magnocellular , parvocellular , and koniocellular  pathways . The pathways are named after different layers of lateral geniculate nucleus  that receive inputs from distinct types of retinal ganglion cells and project to different areas of primary visual cortex.
Hyperthermia therapy for the treatment of solid tumors has been under investigation and used in clinical trials for several decades. While not utilized as extensively in the USA, a recent phase III study reported by Jones et al. at Duke University confirmed the European results for superficial tumors. These tools influence the pre treatment plan but provide less guidance for monitoring the therapy or adapting its delivery during a procedure as a result of variables not easily predicted or controlled , which can have profound effects on the thermal dose achieved .
Octadecyl rhodamine B  is a cationic amphiphile used in numerous studies including electronic energy transfer in organized molecular assemblies,  membrane structure,  and distances of closest approach between protein domains and membranes. In a series of papers,  we have described the use of R18 as an acceptor in fluorescence resonance energy transfer  experiments where we examined the dynamic structural transformation of a cell adhesion molecule, α4β1 integrin in living cells. In these studies, the expression of α4β1 integrins on the cell surface was presented in terms of a fluorescence measurement of an α4 specific peptide derivative 4 ureido) phenylacetyl L leucyl L aspartyl L valyl L prolyl L alanyl L alanyl L lysine .
Increasing evidence indicates that many cell types including fibroblasts respond to stresses, such as oxidative stress, inflammatory cytokines and various genotoxic agents, by engaging in a senescent like phenotype, which differs from replicative senescence in that no telomere shortening is detected . With compelling evidence for the existence of senescence in vivo , this irreversible cell cycle arrest state has been considered as an important tumor suppressor mechanism . Paradoxically, abundant evidence indicates that senescent fibroblasts secrete degradative enzymes, cytokines and growth factors, which closely resemble activated those of fibroblasts .
Liver ischemia and reperfusion injury , an exogenous Ag independent inflammatory event, occurs in multiple clinical settings, including partial hepatectomy, trauma, and transplantation. Indeed, IRI remains one of the most critical problemsin liver transplant recipients causing up to 10% of early graft failure, leading to a higher incidence of acute and chronic rejection, and contributing to acute donor liver shortage . Back in 2003, we proposed that liver damage due to reperfusion following prolonged ischemia should be considered as an innate immunity dominated inflammation response .
Naked mole rats are eusocial African rodents that inhabit a cooperative social environment that is characterized by a reproductive hierarchy and division of labor . Naked mole rats live in large subterranean colonies where a single reproductively active breeding female, or queen, will mate and produce offspring for the entire colony . Pregnancy induced lumbar spine elongation increases as each pregnancy progresses, peaks just before parturition, and subsides after birth .
Functional deficits after spinal cord injury  are caused primarily by destruction of axonal connections between neurons and failure of spontaneous axonal regeneration. Regeneration failure is attributed to factors intrinsic to injured neurons, including the inability to activate genetic growth programs  , and to extrinsic factors, including molecular inhibitors . An unfulfilled goal of spinal cord regeneration research remains the reinnervation of natural neuronal targets.
Nephrotoxic serum  mediated kidney disease is a well studied mouse model of glomerulonephritis  and has proven to be a valuable model providing insights into the mechanism of lupus nephritis . The severity of injury correlates directly with the dose of antibody injected. Histological changes induced by inflammatory injury exhibit apoptosis related subtly degrees of abnormalities.
Peripheral neuropathy associated with agenesis of the corpus callosum is an autosomal recessive disease characterized by progressive sensorimotorneuropathy, mental retardation, dysmorphic features  and complete or partial agenesis of the corpuscallosum . The mice alsodeveloped high blood pressure , age related deafness , and renal dysfunction . In a recent study, Shekarabi et al used a synapsin 1 promoter CRE mouse todrive deletion of KCC3 in neurons, and demonstrated that loss of neuronal KCC3reproduced the neuropathy phenotype observed in the KCC3 knockout mouse.
Reported rates of sphincter preserving surgery  for rectal cancer in the US range from 26.9% to 54.3% . Preservation of continence is an important goal, but will not be technically feasible in all patients. While reported rates have increased over time  with improved surgical technique  and preoperative imaging modalities , a large amount of institutional variability remains .
Rats display differential response to stress. In an outbred population of SD  rats, Wood et al. Two groups of rat populations were identified, one exhibiting extreme aggression, and the other displaying docile behavior. The question of whether aggression is associated with stress and anxiety is important.
Amyloid β  has been the most cited probable causative factor in Alzheimer’s disease  since the identification of Aβ in 1984 . One of the main theories in AD causation is the Amyloid Cascade Hypothesis, which proposes that Aβ formation leads to a series of neurotoxic events that eventually lead to cell death . As a result, significant amounts of research have been performed analyzing the relationship between Aβ42 and Aβ40 levels and cognitive performance in transgenic mice, and numerous articles have claimed a significant correlation between increased Aβ levels and cognitive decline  .
Altered metabolism was among the earliest observed differences between cancer and healthy tissues. Under anaerobic conditions pyruvate is converted to lactate and ATP generation is limited . Pyruvate kinase operates at the final step of glycolysis catalyzing the transfer of a phosphate group from phosphoenolpyruvate  to ADP, yielding one molecule of ATP and one molecule of pyruvate.
Chronic exposure to inorganic arsenic  in drinking water has been associated with cancer and it is suspected to cause other chronic diseases, including diabetes. There is, however, a high degree of inter individual variation in iAs metabolism and disease manifestation. The presence of variant alleles in intronic G12390C , C14215T  and G35991A  SNPs were shown to be significantly associated with the second methylation step in indigenous women in northern Argentina, that is, with lower percentage of total As  in urine represented by monomethylarsenic  and higher percentage represented by dimethylarsenic .
Amide amide NOESY provides valuable distance constraints for calculating global folds of large proteins, which are especially important for proteins with high β sheet content. In extreme cases, such as β barrel proteins, amide amide constraints alone can be sufficient to define the overall topology. Amide amide NOESY is also useful for defining secondary structure elements and for confirming and extending backbone amide assignments.
