Both coronary artery calcium  and the ankle brachial index  are measures of subclinical cardiovascular disease ., From a prevention perspective, it is important to monitor these subclinical CVD measures and determine which risk factors may contribute to their changes. In this regard, the direct effects of physical activity  on the development or progression of subclinical atherosclerosis are not well established. In patients with intermittent claudication, a decline to a lower ABI has been linked to decreased participation in moderate and vigorous PA.
Failure to form an optimally vascularized and adequately invaded placenta may result in a range of pathologies, including recurrent miscarriage and pregnancy induced hypertension  . Many aspects of placental development are believed to be genetically determined and therefore genes responsible for placental development are obvious candidates for susceptibility to conditions associated with placental dysfunction, such as preeclampsia . We hypothesize that genes involved in early placental development and, in particular, trophoblast invasion, will be important regulators of placental invasion and that genetic variations in such genes may play a role in predisposing to the development of PIH .
Racial minorities are priority populations to reduce HIV/AIDS disparities in the United States. Prevention approaches encompass a range of proven effective strategies including increasing early HIV testing, improving access to treatment, treatment linkage and retention programs, reducing HIV associated risk behaviors, and implementing harm reduction strategies. Young people  account for approximately 26% of new HIV diagnoses and African Americans constitute approximately 44% of new HIV cases annually .
The intestine is exposed constantly to many antigens and innate immune stimuli, including dietary constituents, commensal bacteria and pathogens . If this process fails, inappropriate responses can lead to inflammatory bowel diseases and celiac disease. Mononuclear phagocytes  in the lamina propria  such as dendritic cells  and macrophages  are central to these events, serving distinct, yet complementary functions.
It is well established that regular participation in vigorous and moderate intensity physical activity lowers the risk of cardiovascular disease  and CVD mortality. Paradoxically, the risk of an acute cardiac event, including myocardial infarction or sudden cardiac death , is increased during a bout of physical activity, although less so in those who are habitually physically active,. Accordingly, efforts to identify adults at elevated risk for physical activity associated cardiovascular complications usually center on assessment of CVD risk factors and/or diagnosis of occult CVD .
It is well established that the NF κB family of transcription factors plays a critical role in B cell physiology,. Activation of NF κB via the alternative pathway, which is mediated by NF κB inducing kinase  and IKK1  downstream of B cell activation factor of the TNF family  BAFF receptor  interactions, is essential for mature B cell survival. In contrast, the role of NF κB signaling in B cell development remains unclear, and is indeed highly controversial .
Many glomerular diseases accompany proteinuria, and structural damage develops along the downstream tubule. This tubule injury is closely correlated with progressive loss of kidney function . pointed to uncertainties underlying those studies.
The mesolimbic dopamine  pathway is composed of DA neurons in the ventral tegmental area  of the midbrain that project to the dorsal striatum, hippocampus, amygdala, and prefrontal cortex . This diffuse modulatory pathway is involved in attention to rewarding stimuli, learned behavior, and drug addiction . It is believed that VTA DA neurons are inhibited by local GABA interneurons, and projection GABA neurons from other brain regions .
Differentiated thyroid cancer  constitutes approximately 95% of thyroid carcinomas. DTC arises from aberrant follicular cells and is classified histologically as either papillary, follicular , or poorly differentiated., Generally DTC is effectively treated by surgery, radioactive iodine , and l thyroxine therapy., However, 723% of patients develop distant metastases, and two thirds of patients with distant metastases become RAI refractory. These patients have poor prognosis, and lack of effective therapy  makes their clinical management difficult.
The response of insects to microbial infections encompasses several distinct mechanisms . Sessile and circulating blood cells, the cellular arm of host defense, phagocytose microorganisms present in the hemolymph. It is surmised that reactive oxygen compounds that are toxic to microorganisms are generated during the process of melanin synthesis and deposition .
The autonomic nervous system  plays a crucial role in the tonic maintenance of blood pressure . For example, muscle sympathetic nerve activity  is tightly coupled to BP via the baroreflex . Unexpectedly, in women, MSNA is not related to TPR or CO , indicating that women regulate BP differently in comparison to young men .
Asthma is a complex heterogeneous disorder, with a broad spectrum of phenotypes ranging from mild to severe disease with varying degrees of responsiveness to standard steroid therapy. In addition, TH17 cells, which mediate neutrophil recruitment, are thought to play an influential role in asthma pathogenesis, especially in asthmatics that fail to respond to glucocorticoid therapy. However, the presence of this phenotype in patients is yet to be clearly defined .
Acanthamoeba keratitis  is a debilitating, extremely painful and vision impairing infection of the cornea caused by parasites of genus Acanthamoeba . Contact lens wear is thought to be the leading risk factor . Given that over 25 million individuals in the United States alone wear contact lenses and the amoebae are ubiquitous in the environment, one wonders why the occurrence of AK is not much higher.
Protein splicing is an auto catalytic posttranslational process in which an in frame protein fusion, called an intein, is excised from the precursor protein with the concomitant ligation of the two flanking exteins, the N  and C exteins. In principle, intein inhibitors, as a novel class of antibiotics, would have minimal toxic effects to human cells. Intein sequences are characterized by conserved blocks .
Over the past three decades, fretting and corrosion of modular taper connections has been studied in the context of total hip arthroplasty . Modularity affords the surgeon greater flexibility to restore knee function and stability for the patient. Thus, modularity is employed in TKA, although to a lesser extent than in THA .
Macrocyclic antibiotics were first introduced as a new class of chiral selectors for enantioseparations by HPLC and capillary electrophoresis in 1994. There are many structurally related oligophenolic glycopeptides belonging to the later group which have proven to be useful. Thus far, vancomycin, ristocetin, teicoplanin, A82846B, LY307599, avoparcin and A40926 of the macrocyclic glycopeptide family, have been evaluated as chiral selectors.
The differentiation fates of cells are often influenced by the intercellular signals that cells receive. In the first phase, cells in the eye field asynchronously proliferate from the earliest larval stage until the third instar stage of larval life . RD genes encode transcription factors that promote the development of eyes throughout the animal kingdom, and they are organized in a hierarchical transcription network.
Prolonged hypertension is a prevalent and significant contributor to morbidity and mortality from heart failure. The DASH clinical trials provided evidence that diets rich in fruits and vegetables reduced blood pressure. Animal models of hypertension permit mechanistic appraisals of the interaction of diet and disease.
Ganaxolone , the 3β methyl analog of the progesterone metabolite allopregnanolone, is the first neurosteroid related agent to be evaluated in man for the drug treatment of epilepsy . The most studied and best accepted molecular target of neurosteroids is GABAA receptors . As is the case for other agents that enhance GABAA receptor mediated inhibition, ganaxolone exhibits protective activity in diverse animal seizure models .
Protein kinases play key regulatory roles for many processes in cells, influencing signal transduction cascades by the phosphorylation of target proteins. For example, activating mutations are a common and recurrent cause of diverse types of cancer . Similar types of activating mutations in LRRK2 , cause dominantly inherited form of Parkinson’s disease  .
Bronchopulmonary dysplasia  is the most common cause of pulmonary morbidity in premature infants. Infants with BPD are at increased risk for death, and survivors have life long morbidities. Despite the increased survival of extremely premature infants, BPD remains a major morbidity., Approximately 40% of infants born between 22 and 28 weeks gestation are diagnosed with BPD, defined as oxygen supplementation at 36 weeks postmenstrual age .,, Developing drugs to prevent or treat BPD, a major goal of neonatal care over the past 20 years, would substantially decrease long term morbidity and reduce healthcare costs of premature infants .
Arterially perfused right and left ventricular wedge preparations have proved valuable in the elucidation of the cellular basis for the electrocardiogram  and the mechanisms underlying a variety of arrhythmogenic syndromes, including the Brugada, long QT, and short QT syndromes  as well as conduction disease, catecholaminergic VT , and ischemia related arrhythmias. , In all cases, transmural heterogeneities, or differences in the action potential duration and morphology across the ventricular wall, have been shown to contribute prominently to arrhythmogenesis attending these syndromes . Timothy syndrome, also referred to as syndactyly associated long QT syndrome  or LQT8, is a multisystem disorder characterized by developmental defects causing dysmorphic facial features including round face, flat nasal bridge, receding upper jaw, thin upper lip and webbing of the toes and fingers .
Obesity is a major public health concern. Despite efforts to decrease obesity prevalence, the number of obese adults continues to rise. Exercise, and more commonly physical activity  are used to increase energy expenditure .
Loma Linda University, in collaboration with Northern Illinois University and UC Santa Cruz, has built and tested a pre clinical prototype proton CT  scanner based on a design presented previously . The system is designed for scanning of head sized phantoms and small animals. This report presents some of our preliminary test results for the scanner installed on the research beam line at Loma Linda University Medical Center  .
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are a diverse family of ligand gated cation channels found primarily in neuronal and muscle cells in humans. Structurally, each nAChR exists as either a homopentamer of α subunits or a heteropentamer of α and β proteins. nAChRs can be formed by any grouping of α2 α6 subunits together with β2β4 subunits; leading to a large assortment of different receptor subtype combinations.
The human pathogen, Helicobacter pylori, has colonized the stomach of the majority of humans for millennia . Given the vast degree of genetic diversity found among H. pylori clinical isolates, it is not difficult to imagine how variations in strain background may contribute to differential disease outcomes. The degree of diversity that exists among H. pylori strains was first shown when the second genome sequence became available for this organism; strains 26695  and J99  have a 6% difference in their genomic content.
Testicular germ cell carcinoma  is the most common malignancyin younger men. Age, history of undescended testes, family history of testicular cancer, and race/ethnicity are the only established risk factors for the disease . Although not entirely consistent, associations observed for inguinal hernia, estrogen excess during gestation, maximal height attained, and the relatively young age at which testicular cancers are diagnosed compared to other cancers suggest that early life events are involved in testicular cancer carcinogenesis .
Sterol carrier protein 2  is known as a nonspecific intracellular lipid carrier. However, four genes encoding single SCP 2 domain proteins have been identified in the yellow fever mosquito Aedes aegypti . The in vivo physiological roles of these mosquito SCP 2 and SCP 2 like proteins remain unclear.
As a term, hypoxia, in its most encompassing, indicates a diminished availability of oxygen. Systemic hypoxia occurs in a variety of conditions, diseases and accidents often precipitated by dysfunctional respiration , but loss of blood based oxygen carrying capacity, reduced oxygen transportation from capillaries to tissue  and environmental oxygen loss  are also common precipitants. Outside the primary care setting, pulmonary disease associated hypoxia often significantly impacts well being, as the acute and overt consequences of labored breathing, dyspnea, and dizziness significantly suppresses the performance of activities of daily living .
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services’ http://medicare.gov/hospitalcompare website makes available to the public quality of care data from over 4,000 hospitals in the United States. As such, the website fits into an overarching goal of healthcare reform for the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services  to increase the patient centeredness of healthcare by providing the patient with data so that he or she can intelligently participate in his or her care decisions . Among the measures that CMS reports on the website are a group of surgical process of care measures called the Surgical Care Improvement Project .
Retail clinics provide a new model of urgent care. Located in retail stores such as pharmacy, discount, or grocery chains, these clinics require no appointments, are open on weekends and evenings, report little waiting time, and offer services limited to immunizations and treatment of minor acute conditions. Compared to outpatient physicians, retail clinics serve a population that is younger, more likely to be uninsured, and less likely to have a primary care physician.
Systemic juvenile idiopathic arthritis  is a chronic inflammatory disease of childhood characterized by a combination of systemic features  and arthritis. Although SJIA represents only 10 20% of all JIA, it accounts for more than 2/3 of JIA mortality . Levels of macrophage migration inhibitory factor , which up regulates phagocytic function and secretion of pro inflammatory cytokines by macrophages, are also significantly elevated in SJIA serum and synovial fluid  and may drive monocyte activation in SJIA, at least in part.
Hematopoietic cell transplantation  is a complex treatment procedure for various malignant and non malignant hematological disorders. Patients who undergo allogeneic HCT often experience post transplant complications which may lead to prolonged hospitalizations, readmissions or even death. Patients who may benefit from allogeneic HCT are often referred to larger treatment centers.
Proteases play a critical role in tumorigenesis by facilitating rapid cell cycling, mediating local invasion, fueling angiogenesis, and promoting metastasis . Specifically, cathepsin B , a lysosomal cysteine protease, has been shown to be involved in tumor initiation, hyperproliferation, and de differentiation and is up regulated in early human colon adenomas, carcinomas and metastasic lesions . The central role of CTSB in carcinogenesis suggests that it is not only a promising target for therapy or chemoprevention, but for molecular detection of neoplasia  .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  describes a heterogeneous group of non Alzheimer forms of dementia with onset of illness usually before 65 years of age arising from the degeneration of the frontal and temporal lobes. The main clinical syndrome in FTLD is frontotemporal dementia , though related disorders of semantic dementia  and progressive non fluent aphasia  stem from differing topographical distributions of what is considered to be a similar underlying pathology . When the behavioural and personality changes of FTD are accompanied by clinical motor neurone disease , the syndrome of FTD with motor neurone disease  emerges  .
Atherosclerosis has been linked to multiple risk factors including hypertension, elevated cholesterol, smoking, diabetes, and obesity. The adductor canal  is the region in which the femoral artery passes from the anterior thigh at the femoral triangle, between the vastus and adductor muscles, to the posterior thigh at the adductor hiatus where it exits the canal and becomes the popliteal artery . This region of the artery is relatively straight and free of major branches, yet is a prevalent site for disease , suggesting that mechanical factors are especially important here.
The senile plaque is a pathological hallmark of Alzheimer’s disease  and is composed of β amyloid , activated microglia, astrocytes and degenerating neurons . Microglia, the mononuclear phagocytes of the brain , accumulate in senile plaques in AD patients and in animal models of AD . However, their exact role in the pathogenesis of AD remains to be elucidated.
T1 weighted gradient echo and T2 weighted spin echo imaging is a routine component of pediatric abdominal MRI for evaluation of the abdomen. Although respiratory triggering and navigation is routinely used for T2 weighted imaging and coronary imaging , there has been less attention to mitigating motion artifacts in T1 weighted imaging. One common approach is phase reordering .
Molecular screening lies at the foundation of biological tests in the clinic and at the bench, with specific examples including expression profiling of messenger RNA to connect drug responses to disease  and microRNA profiling for cancer diagnostics. It can also be viewed as a limitation in throughput, when considering sample pooling . All of these attributes are extremely important for biomolecule quantification as they determine the sensitivity, specificity, and dynamic range of detection.
5 Fluorouracil  based neoadjuvant chemoradiation therapy has become standard care for patients with advanced rectal cancer, resulting in decreased local recurrence rates, improved tolerance of prescribed therapy, improved organ preservation, and fewer treatment related complications . However, with current preoperative treatment strategies, complete pathologic response only is observed in approximately 20% of cases with ∼40% of the tumors demonstrating no pathologic response . Molecular mechanisms resulting in therapeutic resistance in colorectal cancer  are poorly understood.
Brugada syndrome  is a primary arrhythmogenic disease that can cause sudden cardiac death in young populations. It is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait, with approximately 20% of BrS cases caused by mutations in the SCN5A gene that encodes the α subunit of the cardiac sodium channel. Electrophysiological studies using animal models and mammalian cell lines have suggested that reduced sodium currents account for loss of the epicardial action potential  dome, which may lead to the exaggeration of the transmural AP dispersion in the right ventricular outflow tract and gives rise to the typical ST segment elevation in the right precordial electrocardiogram  leads.
Cystine  and cysteine residues are important for protein structure and function. In their reduced form, cysteines participate in the active site of different enzymes and, together with histidine, are the two most common residues involved in the coordination of zinc ions in Zn finger motifs  . In a seminal work,  showed that chemical shifts of proteins can be computed accurately by quantum chemical approaches.
Uterine leiomyosarcoma  is a high risk malignancy that is diagnosed in only a few thousand women each year in the United States. Median survival for women with advanced or unresectable, recurrent disease is less than one year. Single agents with moderate activity in LMS include ifosfamide  and gemcitabine .
Centrosome duplication in somatic cells is regulated so that the parental centrosome assembles one and only one daughter centrosome during each division cycle . At the core of the centrosome lies a pair of microtubule based structures known as centrioles. In mammalian cultured cells, a tube structure has been described that reproduces during centrosome duplication .
Cancer of the skin is one of the most common types of human cancers. Melanoma accounts for about 4% of skin cancer cases but causes a large majority of skin cancer deaths. Treatments for advanced disease are inadequate .
Rabies is an important zoonotic disease that is estimated to kill at least 60 000 people worldwide each year . It is caused by the rabies virus, a non segmented, negative strand lyssavirus in the Rhabdoviridae family. PEP readily prevents development of clinical rabies and death when given soon after exposure to a rabid animal .
Although diabetes prevalence and incidence continues to increase in the United States , the burden of diabetes varies greatly among race/ethnicity subgroups, with nationally representative data indicating African Americans having the highest prevalence followed by Latinos and whites . Diabetes burden also varies among US immigrants by place of birth, with foreign born Asians having the highest diabetes prevalence . When compared to US born individuals, diabetes prevalence is typically higher among foreign born individuals .
For decades, psychopathy researchers have theorized that the extreme affective and behavioral traits that characterize the disorder could arise through different causal mechanisms. In previous studies primary and secondary psychopaths have typically been differentiated based on levels of trait anxiety . This practice is supported by ample theoretical and empirical work.
Diffusion tensor MRI  has emerged as a promising tool for in vivo studies of muscle architecture , damage and inflammatory processes , microstructure , and for quantitative interpretation of blood oxygenation level dependent  contrast effects . and subsequently confirmed in studies of both skeletal  and cardiac  muscle. Several studies have demonstrated that measuring diffusion transverse to the muscle fibers’ long axes may be useful for examining the health and microstructural properties of muscle.
An essential function of the visual system is to maintain stable representations of the environment across saccadic eye movements. As the eyes move, the retinotopic  positions of objects change, while their spatiotopic  positions remain stable. How does the visual system resolve the intrinsic instability of a retinotopic representation in the face of almost continuous eye movements?
For persons with severe mental illness , the period following discharge from inpatient psychiatric treatment is frequently a period of significant personal disequilibrium. Disengagement from mental health services and other supports jeopardizes the potential for future community adjustment, and warrants interventions that establish, maintain and strengthen adequate linkages to ongoing care . Researchers have focused on continuity of care  as a key indicator of quality of care in health services generally , including in the domain of mental health services  for persons with severe mental illness .
Helicobacter pylori infects half of the world’s population and is a causative agent of gastritis, peptic ulcer, gastric cancer and lymphoma . The host response to H. pylori provides an environment in which epithelial cells may be damaged by mediators of inflammation including cytokines , proteases and reactive oxygen and nitrogen species . Infection with H. pylori results in apoptosis of gastric epithelial cells due to multiple mechanisms including the Fas/FasL system , MHC class II , the mitochondrial pathway  as well as the p53 protein family  .
It is widely appreciated that with aging comes an increasing risk of cancer incidence, yet epidemiologic data indicate that at ages greater than about 60 years, the rate at which incidence increases begins to diminish, and at sufficiently old ages, may even decrease . Recently, Lopez Otin and colleagues  identified nine ubiquitous "hallmarks" of aging: genomic instability, telomere attrition, epigenetic alterations, loss of proteostasis, deregulated nutrient sensing, mitochondrial dysfunction, cellular senescence, stem cell exhaustion, and altered intercellular communication. Genomic instability and epigenetic alterations have also been identified as key processes in carcinogenesis .
The blood brain barrier  is one of the most challenging factors for effective diagnosis and treatment of brain diseases. Others have had promising results with biopharmaceutical approaches such as the modification of drugs to cross the barrier through endogenous transport mechanisms . This method has several potential advantages over other approaches tested to overcome the BBB .
Postoperative hypersensitivity  can be defined as pain in a tooth associated with mastication or with contact with hot, cold, sweet, or sour stimuli that occurs 1 week or more posttreatment. A 2006 survey of the authors’ practice based research network  revealed that POH following posterior resin based composite  restorations is a common concern among its member practitioner investigators. The literature on POH is sparse, however, and it is difficult to draw firm conclusions from the few relevant published studies.
Long lived serological memory is the product of long lived memory B cells  and plasma cells . Bmem cells are long lived although their half life is as yet undefined in both mouse and man . IgM Bmem cells are produced independent of T cell help, differentiate in the absence of GC structure , produce natural antibodies  and part of circulating marginal zone B cells .
Adolescents’ involvement in high risk sexual behaviors renders them vulnerable to unplanned pregnancies and sexually transmitted infection  . An emerging body of research has investigated this problem from the perspective of Life History Theory  . LHT, a branch of evolutionary biology, maintains that organisms maximize their reproductive success in response to environmental conditions .
We report here on a new genome scan meta analysis   of genome wide linkage scans  of schizophrenia . We previously published a GSMA of 20 scans that included 1208 pedigrees with 2945 genotyped affected individuals. Meta analysis can achieve much larger sample sizes than single studies.
Regaining mobility at the community level is a fundamental component of successful rehabilitation among stroke survivors . However, current research on poststroke mobility has focused primarily on visible physical attributes, for example, gait performance . Spatial neglect also significantly influences mobility performance.
Stress is considered to be an important factor in the initiation, maintenance and relapse to alcohol abuse . Human laboratory studies have supported a strong positive relationship between experimentally induced stress and alcohol related behaviours. Stressors increase alcohol craving and subjective anxiety and induce autonomic changes , and several studies have demonstrated an increase in alcohol consumption following acute stress in social drinkers  and alcoholics .
Parkinson disease  is an age associated neurodegenerative disease clinically defined as a progressive movement disorder. In advanced PD, patients also exhibit cognitive deficits and depression. Research data have clearly indicated that during PD, SN dopaminergic neurons are subject to oxidative and nitrosative stress .
Dynamic cerebral autoregulation adjusts cerebral perfusion pressure  in response to arterial pressure fluctuations on a beat to beat basis within a relatively short time, ranging from 6 to 12 sec . Impairment of autoregulation is observed after traumatic brain injury  , and it is one of the mechanisms rendering the brain vulnerable to secondary ischemia and leading to fatal outcomes . Reliable assessment of cerebral autoregulation is clinically important for monitoring of patients requiring neurological intensive care .
Ras genes frequently sustain oncogenic mutations in human and rodent cancers and many immortalized cell lines can be transformed by introduction of activated Ras alleles such as H RasV12 . In addition, activated Ras down regulates an array of anti oncogenic genes that promote apoptosis, cell cycle arrest, DNA repair, and differentiation. These include Fas , the p16Ink4a tumor suppressor , lysyl oxidase , prostate apoptosis response 4  , the cytoskeletal protein tropomyosin , PTEN , RhoB , Gadd153/CHOP , Egr 1, and FOXO3a .
Membrane proteins carry out their functions by changing their structures under specific environmental cues. The M2 protein forms a pH gated tetrameric proton channel in the virus envelope that is important for virus replication . The membrane spanning helix of the M2 protein contains the pH sensing , gating , and amantadine binding residues , and is thus the functional core of the protein .
The kidney derives from the intermediate mesoderm  that is a narrow strip of mesodermal cells sandwiched between the paraxial mesoderm and the lateral plate mesoderm. During embryogenesis, three sets of nephric structures  emerge from the nephric cord within the IM in succession from an anterior to posterior direction. Some components of the transient mesonephric kidney contribute to the development of the metanephric kidney.
Stroke is the third major cause of death and the leading cause of long term disability in the U.S. Although men are at greater risk for stroke, older women have a higher risk for stroke than men , more fatal strokes, greater post stroke disability and mental impairment . Declining ovarian steroid hormones are thought to contribute to the increased stroke associated disability and fatality in this group .
Allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  is a curative therapy for hematological malignancies , owing to the graft versus leukemia/lymphoma  effect mediated by alloreactive T cells, but graft versus host disease  mediated by the same alloreactive T cells remains as a major obstacle . It has long been proposed that, in the pathogenesis of acute GVHD, recipient hematopoietic antigen presenting cells  such as dendritic cells play a major role in initiating allogeneic T cell activation and induction of acute GVHD . Critical cellular interactions occur in secondary lymphoid organs such as mesenteric lymph nodes  that function as the meeting ground between host APCs and donor T cells .
Arterial spin labeling   is a magnetic resonance  method for the measurement of tissue perfusion, and has been most widely used for the evaluation of cerebral blood flow  . In combination with measurements of other MR parameters , evolving tissue status can be assessed over experimental time courses of minutes or hours  . Quantification of CBF using ASL methods is an active area of research .
In settings as diverse as malignant transformation to stem cell differentiation, when cells change their identities, epigenetic mechanisms mediate and finalize these new cellular identities. They arise de novo or progress from lower grade to higher grade over time . Recent work has assisted in classification of glioma tumors .
Cyclooxygenase II  is one of two enzymes that catalyze the rate limiting step in the synthesis of prostaglandins. For example, high COX 2 in benign atypical hyperplasia lesions is associated with increased risk of developing breast cancer . COX 2 enhances breast cancer metastasis to bone in mouse models  and is associated with bone marrow and brain metastasis .
We report a boy who received two allogeneic stem cell transplantations from umbilical cord donors to treat chronic granulomatous disease . The CGD was cured after the second transplantation, but 2½ years later, he was diagnosed with Duchenne muscular dystrophy  . Examinations of his DNA, muscle tissue, and myoblast cultures derived from muscle tissue were performed to determine whether any donor dystrophin was being expressed .
The central auditory system changes as a function of experience, reorganizing throughout the lifespan according to available auditory input. One way of shaping the auditory system is to use auditory training exercises. In a series of studies, we trained naive listeners to identify two within category pre voiced ‘ba’ sounds differing in voice onset time  .
Macroautophagy  is a catabolic process in which sequestered cytosolic components are delivered to a specialized compartment for degradation by lysosomal hydrolases. For example, it has become evident that components of the ESCRT complex machinery are essential to autophagosome maturation, either in the process of autophagosome closure, fusion with target vesicles, or both , . As the process of autophagosome maturation is further illuminated, additional molecular players in the process will undoubtedly become apparent .
Cortical bone is a composite material containing approximately 25% water by volume . In normal bone, most of the water is loosely bound to the organic matrix . Separation of bound water from pore water is of critical importance since the two are associated with different contributions to the mechanical properties of cortical bone .
The prognosis for patients with high grade brain tumors such as glioblastoma multiforme  remains poor. Since approximately 80% of patients develop tumor recurrence within 2 cm of the original tumor site, the aim of postoperative therapy is to eliminate the nests of tumor cells remaining in the margins of the resection cavity  . Photodynamic therapy  has been investigated as a postoperative treatment option following surgical tumor resection .
The turkey, Meleagris gallopavo, is native to North America and exists widely as both an important wild bird and the second most widely consumed poultry meat species in developed countries. It is surprising that the turkey, an ecologically and agriculturally important species, lacks a whole mtGenome sequence, which is one of the reasons why the phylogenetic relationship between the turkey and other avian species, especially gallinaceous birds, is also very little understood. Using DNA DNA hybridization,  reported, in broad terms, that based on DNA DNA hybridization data and in contrast to some earlier reports involving morphology as well as mtDNA, galliform birds form two clades one of which include chicken, guinea fowl, Old World quail, and turkey.
Health effects associated with air pollution have been studied in various cities around the world . Recent studies have found significant heterogeneity of PM associated health effects across cities or regions . More recent epidemiological studies have analyzed health outcomes associated with estimated exposure to PM related constituents , in addition to the standard PM mass metrics  .
Ornithine lipids  belong to a class of fatty acylated amino acids that do not contain either glycerol or phosphate. However, the function of the OL species in these bacteria remains unclear. Finally, we have recently noted that OL’s are one of the lipid species that remain associated to cytochrome c oxidase , when purified and crystallized from R. sphaeroides  .
Radiation exposure from a nuclear accident or a radiological attack may cause death from acute radiation syndrome , which results from radiation injury to key organ systems such as the hematopoietic system . Hematopoiesis is a radiation sensitive process and complications from radiation injury arise rapidly because radiation destroys both proliferating progenitor cells in the bone marrow and mature circulating cells in the peripheral blood . There are currently no pharmaceuticals approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration  to mitigate hematopoietic ARS .
Human adolescents are at an increased risk of alcohol use. According to the 2006 Monitoring the Future National Survey, 6% of 8th graders, 19% of 10th graders and 30% of 12th graders reported being drunk within the past 30 days . Interactions with peers during adolescence provide a substantial source of positive experiences for humans , and, in the same way, an opportunity to interact with peers is more rewarding for adolescent rats than for their more mature counterparts  .
Ischemic heart disease is the leading cause of death worldwide. It is characterized by reduced blood flow to the damaged heart muscle followed by death of cardiomyocytes., At present, the only curative treatment for end stage congestive cardiac failure is cardiac transplantation with its obvious limitations and complications. Alternative multidisciplinary approaches, such as the combination of cardiac stem cell therapy with tissue engineering, have attracted considerable attention and expectations.
Making medical decisions in the context of serious illness is stressful, especially for surrogate decision makers. Although advance directive forms were developed in part to ease the burden of surrogate decision making,   a growing body of literature demonstrates that surrogates often feel unsupported and experience emotional burden and post traumatic stress. Cultural attitudes about end of life and surrogate decision making differ, ,  and many cultures do not adhere to Western views on autonomy   the cornerstone of traditional advanced care planning .
Control of mixing and transport in capillary bioreactors and biofouled capillary membranes is an important engineering challenge in industrial and biomedical systems. Staphylococcus epidermidis is a gram positive, coagulase negative member of the bacterial genus Staphylococcus. Unfortunately for these patients, S. epidermidis biofilms are resistant to most common antibiotics .
Polychlorinated biphenyls  were commercially manufactured in the United States from 1930 to 1970 for use as dielectrics in transformers and capacitors, and as cooling fluids in hydraulic systems. Nevertheless these compounds remain in use and in our environment today and represent a potential human health hazard  . Although their potency varies, mixtures of halogenated biphenyls as well as many individual congeners have been reported to be promoters of carcinogenesis in various liver tumor models .
Freezing of biological tissue is emerging in biomedical applications to treat diseased tissues  or to preserve tissues . Cryotherapies are minimally invasive surgical techniques to destroy malignant tissues by freezing while sparing surrounding normal tissues. This can provide a prolonged time window for transplantation and implantation surgery, and ultimately “off the shelf” availability of engineered tissues .
Depression is an often overlooked but pervasive disorder having a lifetime prevalence of 16% among the U.S. population  with women twice as likely to be affected as men . In women, depression has been studied in relation to polycystic ovarian syndrome , in vitro fertilization treatment success , and premenstrual dysphoric disorder . In addition, women with mental disorders, including clinical depression, are more likely to report menstrual cycle disturbances .
It is evident from pre clinical studies that tumor cells can be recognized by the immune system . Regulatory T cells are critical mediators of tolerance against self and foreign antigens . Evidence for the generation of adaptive Foxp3+ T reg cells outside the thymus was derived from the observation that chronic and low dose antigen presentation leads to the generation of adaptive Foxp3+ T reg cells .
Musculoskeletal models of the shoulder typically represent muscle lines of action as a collection of line segments . These models have been useful for a wide variety of applications including simulating surgical procedures , investigating wheelchair mechanics , and controlling neuroprostheses . However, shoulder muscles have characteristics that make them challenging to represent using line segment representations.
Our knowledge of the prospective association between two major public health problems of adolescents, depression and the use of addictive substances, remains limited. Prospective studies of the association of depressive disorders with substance use in adolescence warrant study, given the high prevalence of depressive disorders observed among youth with substance use disorders in both clinical and non clinical populations  Previous research on relationships between depression and smoking in adolescence has suggested bi directional causation  and reciprocal relationships . Adverse physical health related consequences of smokeless tobacco use are well understood, but whether it potentially contributes to nicotine dependence is, surprisingly, unknown .
Pelvic floor muscles  in women, which support the pelvic organs, include the levator ani and the coccygeus muscles, but do not include the external urethral sphincter  or the external anal sphincter. The PFM in female rats has a similar bowl shaped anatomic organization as humans with some exceptions, such as lack of a recognized puborectalis muscle. , There are conflicting opinions regarding levator ani and pudendal nerve innervation of the PFM.
Atherosclerosis contributes to nearly one half of the mortality in the western world and is growing in epidemic proportions in rapidly developing countries in Asia. High levels of blood cholesterol, high blood pressure, obesity, diabetes, stress, and lifestyles including smoking are among the risk factors contributing to this alarming increase in this disease. However, these therapeutic modalities do not decrease atherosclerotic plaque burden.
RNA molecules are extremely versatile functional biopolymers that participate in key informational pathways that characterize living organisms on Earth. Far from being simply coding for proteins as mRNA, a plethora of non coding RNAs are actively contributing to proteins translation as ribosomal RNAs and transfer RNAs, and various catalytic and regulatory functions as ribozymes, riboswitches and regulatory elements. By taking advantage of RNA architectonics, an approach for rationally designing 3D RNA architectures, we previously showed that the structural information encoding specific conformation of natural RNAs could be implemented within artificial RNA sequences to control both 3D shape and self assembling interfaces.
Chelatable iron and other transition metals such as copper catalyze formation of highly reactive hydroxyl radical  from H2O2 and superoxide , which damages DNA, proteins and membranes . Cytoprotection by desferal in various models of oxidative stress and hypoxia/ischemia suggests a role for iron in the pathogenesis of injury . In hepatocytes, generation of reactive oxygen species , including H2O2, O2• , and OH•, contributes to lethal cell injury from oxidative stress, various hepatotoxicants and ischemia/reperfusion .
The myriad of changes that occur in adolescence require substantial revision to the systems responsible for understanding one's experience. Research has shown that girls are far more likely than boys to engage in relational aggression . Additionally, girls perceive relationally aggressive behaviors to have greater negative consequences than do boys .
Macroevolutionary studies of neuroanatomy tend to show coordinated variation of different brain structures that are related to developmental constraints. Particular selective pressures, however, have been shown to exert effects on specific regions that result in a mosaic like pattern of evolution, with different structures showing divergent evolutionary trajectories. Cranial and craniofacial integration and modularity have been extensively investigated in studies of human evolutionary anatomy,.
Studies on both animals  and humans  have suggested a role for pathogens in the etiology of atherosclerosis, including cytomegalovirus , herpes simplex virus , hepatitis A virus , Helicobacter pylori , and particularly Chlamydia pneumoniae . The observation that periodontitis is related to atherosclerosis  further supports an infectious etiology. In addition to individual pathogens, pathogen burden  has been also found in association with atherosclerosis  .
Almost half of all deaths due to childhood pneumonia occur in sub Saharan African . World Health Organization  recommendations for case management of pneumonia in children aged 2  59 months have been credited with contributing to substantial reductions in mortality . For over two decades, these guidelines have recommended classification into four classes of severity based on clinical signs at initial presentation with inpatient management reserved for the severe categories   .
Stroke patients with higher density of cerebral blood vessels fare better and survive longer than those with lower vascular density . Adult bone marrow stromal cells  selectively target the injury site, participate in arteriogenesis and angiogenesis, and induce a neovascular response resulting in a significant increase in blood flow to the ischemic area which aids in repair of injured brain . Chemokines are important factors controlling cellular migration.
The microbiota plays an essential role in regulating intestinal homeostasis through its capacity to modulate various biological activities ranging from barrier, immunity and metabolic function. Recent evidence generated from experimental models indicates that microbial dysbiosis can influence intestinal disease, as implantation of cancer associated biota increased cancer development in the azoxymethane/dextran sodium sulfate model of colitis associated CRC,. While the biological events implicated in the development of microbial dysbiosis and emergence of carcinogenic microorganisms are yet to be defined, host genetics and environmental factors such as diet and lifestyle are likely contributing elements in microbial community assembly and maintenance .
HDACs are a family of enzymes that were initially characterized as histone deacetylases . HDACs have drawn intense research interest as inhibitors for these enzymes display potent anti tumor activities and induce cancer growth arrest or cell death . To date, it is not known which of the HDAC family members are the critical targets that underlie the anti tumor activity of HDAC inhibitors.
B cell commitment, survival, and immunoglobulin assembly are all products of a carefully orchestrated network of transcription factors guiding gene expression. In hematopoietic stem cells , graded expression of the transcription factors PU.1 and Ikaros direct development away from the myeloid lineage and into common lymphoid progenitors , . While the microenvironmental cues that direct early B cell commitment and differentiation are not entirely understood, IL 7R {http://www.signaling gateway.org/molecule/query?afcsid=A001267} and Flt 3 expression are critical.
All of us experience the involuntary shaking of the hands which is physiological tremor. This tremor places severe constraints on motor performance. Although many factors contribute to tremorigenesis, an important component comes from neural oscillators rhythmically active at ~10Hz  .
Inhibition of AR function is standard therapy for the initial presentation of disseminated prostate cancer . Unfortunately, the clinical benefit of these new therapies is not durable . These observations further emphasize the importance of AR signaling in PCa development and progression.
Chemokines are 812 kDa sized secreted proteins that mediate the directed migration  of leukocytes. The chemokine family encompasses nearly fifty members, which are classified based on the relative position of their conserved N terminal cysteine residues . Chemokines elicit intracellular responses via G protein coupled receptors .
The Botzinger complex  is a neuronal population of expiratory  neurons with an augmenting  discharge pattern within the most rostral extension of the ventral respiratory column  in the vicinity of the retrofacial nucleus . The BOT region and surrounding reticular formation also contain some E units with decrementing  discharge patterns  as well as other respiratory related neurons . The BOT area and particularly the pre Bötzinger complex  are believed to be important in the generation of the respiratory rhythm and modulation on expiratory motor activity .
Measures of arterial pulse pressure  variation and left ventricular  stroke volume  variation induced by positive pressure breathing vary in proportion to preload responsiveness. However, the accuracy of commercially available devices to report dynamic LV SV variation has never been validated . We compared the accuracy of measured arterial PP and estimated LV SV reported from two FDA approved aortic flow monitoring devices, one using arterial pulse power  and the other esophageal Doppler monitor  .
Ischemic stroke is an important contributor to morbidity and mortality. Maternal and perinatal coagulopathy predispose to pediatric stroke  with 30% of such events being due to thrombosis . Indeed, the brief therapeutic window of tPA and the high incidence of post treatment complications, including intracranial hemorrhage , have constrained the actual clinical use of tPA to approximately 38% of all patients eligible for such therapy .
Bone marrow derived mesenchymal stromal cells  have been widely investigated for their therapeutic potential in both autoimmune and alloimmune diseases . By comparison the successful clinical translation of BMSC therapy is still in question  and the mechanism of action remains largely unknown , representing an obstacle to further clinical applications of BMSC . Intravenous infusions of human BMSC are immediately sequestered in the lung microvasculature and their therapeutic effect in corneal injury and myocardial infarction has been attributed to paracrine secretory factors such as IL 10  and TSG 6 .
In the mammalian forebrain, most excitatory synapses are located on dendritic spines, small protrusions of dendrites. Spine morphology modulates synaptic properties and the ability to undergo plasticity, . Because dendrites and spines make up a significant fraction of the cortical neuropil, it has been hypothesized that changes in dendrite and spine number and morphology may lead to alterations in cortical thickness measures, a finding reported in several mental disorders, including schizophrenia .
Ideally, family implies a functional group living situation in which opportunities exist for economic and instrumental cooperation, informal communications, and reciprocated social and emotional obligations among family members . Family interaction and living provides the context for physical maintenance, familial affection, and social control of family members. Often, family involves the rearing of and caring for children.
In multi cellular organisms, a variety of biochemical, physiological and behavioral processes undergo rhythmic fluctuations that closely parallel the time course of the daily solar cycle. Evidence for their autoregulatory interactions and function in the clock mechanism is based on the observations that disruption or knockout of these PAS genes alters the regulation of other core components in the molecular feedback loops and abolishes circadian behavior . The aryl hydrocarbon receptor  is a PAS gene component of the signaling pathway responsible for the metabolism of drugs and environmental toxins such as polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons .
Few studies have analyzed the cohort effects of lifecourse socioeconomicposition  on racial disparities in body mass index  trajectories. We assessedthe contribution of lifecourse SEP on racial differences in BMI trajectories among twodifferent age cohorts of women . Four waves of the Americans' Changing Lives' study  were usedto compute BMI trajectories for 2194 Black and White women.
Protein isoforms can differ in their biological activity, regulatory properties, temporal and spatial expression and intracellular location . Protein isoforms harbor variations in the amino acid sequence and can originate from separate genes that have evolved from a single ancestor gene generated by gene duplication or from a single gene by alternative splicing. Furthermore, there can be sub isoforms when a particular protein isoform has a number of different possibilities of mRNA splicing, generating additional splice variants  .
A major limitation in human information processing concerns the ability of the brain to process two temporally close meaningful stimuli. For example, a delayed or larger T1 evoked P3b has been observed in trials in which T2 was missed  versus detected  . Usually, one starts by focusing or stabilizing concentration on an object such as the breath.
TiO2 nanoparticles  are a promising vehicle for the delivery of therapeutic and diagnostic agents. Moreover, the semiconductor and photocatalytic properties of TiO2 make it a potent source of electrons and electropositive holes as well as reactive oxygen species —all of which can react with cellular DNA., , , However, in order for NCs to be useful cytotoxic agents they must first be internalized and retained by cells. To achieve this goal, we have created TiO2 NCs that can bind Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor .
Temperature affects our lifestyle, as it conveys information about the environment and influences our comfort level. Animals need to process a variety of temperature stimuli appropriately to exhibit a proper behavioral response. ThermoTRP channels , which are evolutionally conserved temperature sensors , detect a wide range of temperatures and contribute to behaviors in many animals, including Drosophila .
The early down regulation of CB1  was first observed in post mortem tissue of HD patients and occurs in most mouse models of HD, including R6/2, R6/1, YAC128 and HdhQ150 mice . It was recently reported that mutant huntingtin acts at the Cnr1 promoter and inhibits CB1 expression in neurons . Furthermore, it is known that functional CB1 receptor signaling allows neurons to better resist various insults and pathological events by, for example, reducing excitotoxicity and regulating growth factor expression .
Photoreceptor cells are the sensory neurons in eye that absorb light to initiate vision. Since these cells are post mitotic, loss of photoreceptors results in permanent blindness. Insults that can kill photoreceptors include genetic mutations, mechanical injury and oxidative damage .
The pharmacokinetics of mycophenolic acid , the pharmacologically active component of mycophenolate mofetil  are well described in transplant recipients and population pharmacokinetic models are reported. After oral intake, MMF is rapidly and completely absorbed, hydrolyzed into the active MPA, which is 98% bound to plasma proteins, including albumin. MPA is primarily metabolized by glucuronidation to form the 7 O glucuronide conjugate  which then undergoes elimination via the kidneys or enterohepatic recirculation back to MPA in the gastrointestinal tract.
The size and asymmetry of neurons result in a non uniform distribution of demand for mitochondrial functions such as ATP synthesis and calcium homeostasis. Mitochondria are concentrated in areas of the neuron expected to have higher ATP consumption; indeed, synapses were first recognized ultrastructurally based in part on their high density of mitochondria . Other such regions are active growth cones and axon branches , nodes of Ranvier , myelination boundaries and demyelinated regions , and sites of axonal protein translation .
Inwardly rectifying potassium channels, and Kir2 channels in particular, are crucial for setting a sharp threshold for excitation in excitable cells, as well as stabilizing the resting membrane potential in both excitable and non excitable cells. They are particularly important in cardiac cells where they underlie IK1, the cardiac inwardly rectifying potassium conductance, and play a crucial role in shaping the action potential. Kir2.1 knockout mice die shortly after birth; however, studies in neonates reveal a lack of IK1 current, broadened action potentials and ineffective clamping of the resting membrane potential leading to spontaneous action potentials .
In the United States depression affects up to 2.5 percent of children and 8.3 percent of adolescents . The selective serotonin reuptake inhibitor  fluoxetine  is approved by the Food and Drug Administration for child and adolescent depression . SSRIs are also used in anxiety and conduct disorders such as separation anxiety and aggression in these populations.
Endogenous serum peptides that carry important information of disease are considered to be great potential biomarkers for clinical diagnosis. Hepcidin, a hormone peptide, has been recognized as a potential biomarker for iron related disease. For example, both anemia of chronic disease  and iron deficiency anemia  present similar clinical indicators, such as decreased serum iron level and transferrin saturation.
Discovery of antibodies to citrullinated protein antigens  has improved our understanding of the seropositive subset of rheumatoid arthritis . ACPAs and rheumatoid factor  are present in serum of RA patients years before clinical diagnosis of RA. While these autoantibodies, particularly anti cyclic citrullinated peptide , are highly specific  for RA, the sensitivity in those who later develop RA is notably lower .
Pain present 6 months following root canal treatment  may be either of odontogenic or nonodontogenic origin. This is importance because treatments and prognoses are different; therefore the aim of this study was to provide specific diagnoses of patients reporting pain 6 months after receiving initial orthograde RCT . We enrolled patients from the Midwest region of an existing prospective observational study of pain after RCT.
The loss of skeletal muscle mass and alterations in contractile function known as sarcopenia is a common, though poorly understood phenomena of aging . Although the origins of sarcopenia are yet unknown, oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction are believed to play a role . Recent evidence in sarcopenic gastrocnemius muscle of young and old rats revealed increased proteolysis, reactive oxygen species  overproduction and vulnerability to apoptosis .
Bioluminescence is a naturally occurring phenomenon in certain species such as the firefly resulting from oxidation of luciferin to oxyluciferin in the presence of molecular oxygen and adenosine triphosphate. This reaction is catalyzed by the enzyme luciferase and results in the emission of light . Bioluminescence imaging  is an in vivo optical imaging technique that detects light emitted from firefly luciferase expressing cells by special charge coupled device  camera .
Mechanical loading of cartilage explants can regulate chondrocyte metabolism and direct growth and remodeling . For instance, bending of immature articular cartilage during in vitro culture can induce marked changes in tissue shape . This technique of shaping cartilaginous tissues may have applications towards creating grafts of specific shapes for joint repair or craniofacial reconstruction and towards understanding the effects of physical forces on the developing morphologies of cartilage structures .
Obesity is a significant public health problem, and the impact of caring for increasing numbers of obese individuals is being felt worldwide and across medical disciplines. Both animal and human studies have demonstrated that obesity is associated with adverse health consequences, including susceptibility to a diverse group of diseases affecting the cardiovascular, pulmonary, renal, and endocrine systems . A growing body of literature has been devoted to examination of the pathophysiologic mechanisms that link obesity to these maladies, with a general consensus that chronic inflammation provides the connection  .
Insulin degrading enzyme  is an 110 kDa zinc metalloprotease that belongs to the M16A family ; . IDE N and IDE C are homologous to each other and have an αβαβα roll structure, shared among proteases within the M16 family, which include mitochondrial processing peptidase, pitrilysin, and mitochondrial presequence peptidase; ; . This is consistent with the observation that IDE gene knockout mice have an elevated level of insulin and develop symptoms of diabetes, while single nucleotide polymorphisms of the IDE gene are associated with type 2 diabetes in humans; .
Human transplant recipients harbor significant numbers of alloreactive memory T cells generated by previous encounter to alloantigens, via heterologous immunity or homeostatic proliferation as a result of lymphoablation . Alloreactive memory T cells contribute to both acute and chronic allograft rejection, indicating that current im munosuppressive therapies do not inhibit the generation or maintenance of T cell memory . Immunologic memory is thought to be one of the major barriers that preclude the induction of antigen specific tolerance in clinical transplantation .
myc is well known for its role in tumorigenesis when overexpressed and N myc  is most strongly associated with primitive “blast” nervous system tumors neuroblastoma, medulloblastoma, retinoblastoma, and glioblastoma . However, at physiological levels myc genes are important regulators of many aspects of normal cell behavior including metabolism and cycling . One theory is that Myc’s wide range of functions is linked to its widespread euchromatic function associated with specific histone modifications such as acetylation of lysine 9 and methylation of lysine 4 of histone H3  .
Higher arterial stiffness and pressure pulsatility, hallmarks of aging, are associated with increased risk for cardiovascular disease  morbidity, including incident hypertension. Carotid femoral pulse wave velocity , the current reference standard measure of global aortic stiffness, is associated with CVD events including coronary heart disease, stroke, and CVD mortality. Arterial calcification, in turn, is also associated with CVD events and mortality, whether assessed in the coronary arteries ,,  thoracic aorta ,,  or abdominal aorta .
The mammalian target of rapamycin  regulates cell growth and metabolism. Rapamycin is a macrolide fungicide that inhibits mTOR signaling by binding to FK506 binding protein 12 . Cancer cells have increased metabolic autonomy.
Many of the decisions we make on a day to day basis require balancing out factors driving the desire to achieve good results , with those associated with avoiding potentially perilous situations. Such decisions often benefit from past experience, and are therefore supported by adaptive mechanisms for learning from positive and negative outcomes. An added desirable factor is that converging pharmacological data exist  in which manipulation of the neurotransmitter in the brain region of interest produces corresponding changes in the same cognitive process, providing a “proof of concept” that any genetic effects associated with this neurotransmitter are causal rather than simply correlational .
Hepatitis C virus  coinfection is common among HIV infected individuals worldwide; it has been estimated that 45 million HIV infected individuals are chronic HCV carriers. In the U.S. and Europe, approximately 1033% of all HIV infected individuals are coinfected with HCV. ; In addition, recent studies have shown that coinfected patients are diagnosed at a younger age, have more advanced HCC, and have shorter survival time than HCV mono infected patients.
That estradiol modulates neural functions like mood, affect, anxiety, fear and vulnerability to addictive drugs in addition to its well documented role in reproduction is now well accepted . However, a large body of evidence in both young and aged rodent subjects indicates that estradiol promotes memory . Effects of estrogens are mediated through receptors , and for almost fifty years, it was thought that this receptor was a single ligand dependent transcription factor acting in the nucleus to enhance nuclear transcription .
Cardiovascular disease, including coronary artery and peripheral vascular disease, is the leading cause of mortality in the United States and accounted for over 30% deaths in 2004. The standard procedure to replace the diseased segments of small diameter arteries  involves the use of native, autologous grafts such as saphenous veins. , However, this approach requires multiple surgical procedures and is often limited by the amount of adequate autologous vessels available.
Glioblastoma  is the most common malignant primary brain tumor in adults. Four out of every 100,000 Americans are diagnosed with GBM, which represents ~15% of all primary brain tumors . Once the diagnosis of GBM has been made, the overall median survival time for patients treated with surgery, radiation and chemotherapy is only 14 to 15 months .
Protein isoforms coded by alternatively spliced pre mRNAs expand the functional repertoire of genes. The importance of this mechanism for developing protein diversity is illustrated by the finding that most multi exon human genes are subject to alternative splicing . The significance of alternative splicing to neurons is underscored by the variety of neurological diseases that result from its dysregulation  .
More than 70 million Americans live with cardiovascular diseases, which lead to >910,000 deaths each year. MPI is capable of identifying regional abnormalities in coronary artery and determining their physiological relevance to myocardial function and viability. Since the 1980s, intensive research efforts have been directed towards using cationic and neutral 99mTc complexes  as radiotracers for MPI., As a result of these extensive efforts, 99mTc sestamibi 6]+; MIBI = 2 methoxy 2 methylpropylisonitrile) and 99mTc tetrofosmin 2]+, tetrofosmin = 1,2 bisethane)) have been approved as commercial radiotracers for SPECT MPI.
L selectin is a type 1 transmembrane adhesion protein expressed by leukocytes. A disintegrin and metalloproteases  are a family of transmembrane proteins with an adhesion function and an active or inactive Zn dependent protease domain . This robust manner of ectodomain shedding is distinct from most other ADAM17 substrates, such as pro TNFα, which tends to be cleaved from the cell surface over an extended period of time following leukocyte activation .
Human plasma high density lipoprotein  particles have been classically defined as a group of pseudomicellar, quasispherical protein/lipid complexes with hydrated densities in the range of 1.063 to 1.210 g/ml. The remaining 10 15% of protein mass is composed of minor amphipathic proteins, including apoC’s, apoE, apoD, apoM and apoA IV, with enzymes and lipid transfer proteins such as lecithin:cholesterol acyl transferase  and cholesteryl ester transfer protein . Recent proteomic studies  have however identified up to 75 distinct proteins associated with centrifugally isolated HDL.
Lynch Syndrome, also called hereditary non polyposis colon cancer , is an autosomal dominant inherited cancer predisposition syndrome characterized by predisposition to develop a number of cancers at an early age and high penetrance with mutation carriers having a significantly increased lifetime risk of developing colorectal  and other forms of cancer . In addition, there are apparently polymorphisms in MMR genes that may cause increased risk of developing cancer . The complete loss of mismatch repair function in tumors leads to increased mutations at microsatellite sequences resulting in the microsatellite instability high  phenotype, although numerous studies report MSI H Lynch Syndrome cases that lack mutations in known MMR genes; examples include  .
While interferon  plays crucial roles in the defense against viral infection, excessive production may lead to pathogenesis of autoimmune diseases . An example is Aicardi Goutières syndrome , a hereditary neurodegenerative disorder characterized by early onset and progressive encephalopathy with a high level of IFN α in the cerebrospinal fluid . Both isoforms of ADAR1 convert adenosine to inosine on its double strand RNA substrates, potentially changing the coding information on mRNAs .
Diffuse gliomas are common and variably aggressive primary central nervous system tumors, currently stratified by the World Health Organization  into three malignancy grades: II, III and IV. Glioblastoma  is generally classified as a diffuse glioma of astrocytic morphology with microvascular proliferation and/or necrosis. Determination of grade , is made primarily on the basis of tumor proliferative activity , along with additional criteria of increased cellularity and nuclear atypia.
Embryonic stem cells harbor a consistent capacity for multi lineage differentiation . Stem cell based cardiopoiesis originates from undifferentiated progenitors that are specified into early cardiac mesoderm . Then, transition into cardiac lineage restricted differentiation occurs with nuclear translocation of cardiac transcription factors, culminating with metabolic maturation and establishment of efficient ionic handling required for excitation contraction coupling .
Maternal psychosocial stress has been associated with adverse maternal child outcomes. Vulnerable women’s experiences with stressors during pregnancy and their desires and priorities for appropriate and useful stress reduction interventions for pregnant women are not well understood . Qualitative interviews with low income, urban women explored their stress exposures and reactions during pregnancy, ways that stressors overlapped and interacted, and their priorities for stress reduction.
Alcohol abuse is a leading cause of preventable death and illness, and the economic cost of alcohol abuse is estimated to be $185 billion annually in the USA alone. Adoption and twin studies suggest that alcohol use disorders  are 50 60% genetically determined,. EtOH induced static ataxia , a form of cerebellar dependent motor impairment, consistently shows LLR in individuals with a family history of AUDs compared to individuals without a family history of AUDs,.
Aging is associated with significant changes in limb skeletal muscles, of which sarcopenia is the most evident. Aging increases the latency of eye movement onset and decreases peak velocity, acceleration and range of eye movement . EOMs are particularly vulnerable to age related mitochondrial myopathies, such as chronic progressive external ophthalmoplegia  .
Attention and emotion impart a value system to sensory processing, allowing the central nervous system to mold sensory experience into a subjective landscape . Such areas include thalamus, primary and secondary somatosensory cortices , insular cortex , and anterior cingulate cortex  . Brain areas actively involved in modulating pain transmission during distraction from pain have been less studied.
Chemical cross linking coupled with mass spectrometry is a commonly used technique to characterize proteins, interactions and complex topologies . However, there are few successful applications on complicated biological systems, , because system complexity and product heterogeneity have generally precluded large scale applications of cross linking strategies. Some examples use the isotopic labeled cross linkers/proteins , and some other examples involve the IR  or UV  dissociation of cross links, which are reported by the Brodbelt’s group, .
Obesity is a complex disorder with heterogeneous adiposity phenotypes. One recognized phenotype is the metabolically healthy obese  individual who, despite having excessive body fatness, seems to be protected from adipose associated metabolic abnormalities . Even if the same definition was used to define the MHO phenotype, conflicting evidence regarding the outcomes was still noted .
Glycolytic enzymopathies are severe heritable human diseases that result from specific mutations affecting enzymes involved in anaerobic metabolism. However the pathogenesis of this disease is not well understood. The most common homozygous human mutation, Glu104Asp, also exhibits a temperature sensitive phenotype in vitro , suggesting that the underlying pathogenesis in TPIsugarkill may be similar to human disease causing mutations.
In our recent paper describing the heating of human skin by mm waves we used a homogeneous skin model . The Pennes bioheat transfer equation  , frequently used in thermal modeling, fitted well to the experimental data obtained in the forearm with low blood flow rates. We showed that mm waves in spite of shallow penetration into the skin  were able to heat much deeper subcutaneous layers.
The transition between wakefulness, NREM, and REM sleep is accompanied by neuromodulatory changes. Acetylcholine, norepinephrine, serotonin, histamine, and hypocretin levels are high in wakefulness and low in NREM sleep, and noradrenergic, serotonergic and histaminergic cells become silent during REM sleep . Following neuromodulation, the EEG and the underlying patterns of neuronal activity also change, especially in cerebral cortex.
MicroRNAs , a class of small noncoding RNAs, serve as key post transcriptional regulators of gene expression and mRNA translation , . miRNAs are increasingly recognized as mediators in a variety of biological processes including cardiovascular development and disorders , . Highly specific miRNA expression patterns have been reported in association with heart failure , , myocardial infarction , and cancer .
Over the past decade, yeast display has emerged as a leading technology for the selection and characterization of monoclonal antibodies  from both immune and nonimmune libraries. The majority of yeast display antibody libraries that have been constructed to date utilize the single chain variable fragment  format, and there are only three examples in the literature of combinatorial antigen binding fragment  yeast display libraries. Because both scFv and Fab libraries have unique advantages and disadvantages, there is controversy over which format is better suited for antibody display.
Inhibition studies are routinely performed to gain insight into the structure and function of transporters, particularly when a transporter crystal structure is not available. A simplifying assumption in proposing such pharmacophore or QSAR models is that inhibition data assumes the same type of inhibition, since two compounds that inhibit a transporter by differing mode may not bind to the same binding site. Hence, inhibition studies can benefit from elucidating the type of inhibition by which various compounds inhibit.
Mesial temporal lobe epilepsy  is the most common type of epilepsy in adults , and frequently becomes resistant to drug therapy, leaving ultimately only a neurosurgery option to control seizures. TLE develops following a variety of insults, including brain injury and status epilepticus . Precipitating insults are followed by a characteristic seizure free “latent period” lasting months or even years in humans .
The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention  has prioritized interventions to reduce sexual risk taking among HIV positive persons . Disclosure of HIV positive status to sexual partners may reduce risk of transmission in serodiscordant partnerships . However, the association between HIV serodisclosure and sexual risk behavior is complex, varying by person , partner  and situation level factors .
PTEN , the tumor suppressor gene located at 10q23.3, is known to participate in the pathogenesis of a wide variety of hereditary cancer syndromes and sporadic malignancies . This may suggest that PTEN plays a role in melanoma progression. Indeed, when analyzing PTEN protein’s subcellular localization, we found that 30 of 30 metastatic melanomas had complete loss of nuclear PTEN protein expression .
Ovarian cancer is the most lethal gynecologic malignancy and the fifth most common cause of cancer related deaths in women. The estimated number of new ovarian cancer cases in 2008 in the U.S. was 21,650 with an estimated 15,520 deaths . Paclitaxel resistance develops leading to treatment failure and death.
Obesity or accumulated adiposity is an important etiological factor in the clustering of clinical conditions that comprise the metabolic syndrome  . These conditions include central obesity, hypertension, hyperglycemia, and dyslipidemia . Although, high precision imaging techniques, including computed tomography  or dual energy x ray absorptiometry  imaging, are considered to be the gold standard for measuring fat distribution, their clinical value is often undermined by the cost and time burden associated with CT or DXA.
Although the classical teaching has been one of a chronic inflammatory demyelinating disease marked by multi focal white matter lesions, multiple sclerosis  is being increasingly recognized as a disease of the central nervous system  characterized by widespread demyelination, axonal loss and gliosis, and neurodegeneration . In line with these diffuse histopathological changes, prior study, such as through PET examination, has revealed decreased oxygen utilization and extraction, with extensive reduction in cerebral glucose metabolism in MS patients . As tissue damage in MS has been shown to invariably extend beyond the focal plaque, modern MRI techniques are being developed to allow for the qualitative and quantitative demonstration of the global, diffuse nature of neuropathological changes in order to closely monitor disease severity, progression, and response to therapy .
Airway secretions contain a broad spectrum of endogenous antimicrobial factors  which contribute to the inherent host defense of the respiratory tract. Complement factors, surfactant proteins, antimicrobial peptides , antibacterial polypeptides, and host derived lipids are all integral components of this intrinsic defense system. AMPs encompass both cathelicidins and defensins.
Cataract is an opaqueness of the lens that causes decreased visual acuity . Cataract becomes more common with increasing age and is one of the leading causes of blindness and visual impairment among the elderly population throughout the less developed world . Thus, identification of factors that could delay or prevent cataract development would be important both for increasing the well being of older adults and for reducing medical care costs.
DNA structure is fundamental to diverse DNA transactions, such as replication, repair, nucleosome assembly, and the regulation of gene expression. , Throughout the text, references to DDD or R3 dodecamer crystal form relate to the sequence d2. Two key features are variation of the width of the minor groove and bending of the DNA double helix.
Among term infants, hypoxicischemic encephalopathy  due to acute perinatal asphyxia is an important cause of neurological morbidity and mortality. Currently, therapeutic hypothermia represents the only intervention, which has been demonstrated to favorably alter the outcome of term infants who suffered from perinatal asphyxia. An early and reliable diagnostic test is essential to guide and monitor treatment.
Bacteriophage endosialidases hydrolyse internal α 2,8 linkages in polysialic acid , a polymer which may exceed 200 N acetyl neuraminic acid  residues, which comprises the capsular polysaccharide of Escherichia coli K1 and group B Neisseria meningitidis  and is also expressed at limited sites in vertebrates .
