However, this simple Gaussian model does not yield accurate estimates of entropy when the true multivariate distribution of the spatial fluctuations in a molecule differs significantly from the Gaussian distribution, especially when the PDF is multimodal.
As a transcription factor that is activated by environmental stimuli and cellular stresses, NF κB plays an important role in numerous biological and pathological processes . NF κB is generally considered as a cell survival factor that protect cancer cells against apoptosis because it upregulates expression of anti apoptotic genes . NF κB can be activated by many anticancer therapeutics .
Serotonin , is a major neurotransmitter acting upon several receptor subtypes in brain, among which is the well characterized serotonin subtype 4  receptor . Brain distribution and other evidence suggest that 5 HT4 receptors have functions in normal cognition, learning and memory . Perturbations to 5 HT4 receptors have been implicated in some neuropsychiatric disorders, including Alzheimer’s disease , depression , and eating disorders .
Benign prostatic hyperplasia , the most common benign neoplasm in American men, is a chronic, progressive condition associated with the development of lower urinary tract symptoms . It has been demonstrated that the effect of moderate LUTS on health related quality of life  was comparable to that of having diabetes, high blood pressure or cancer, while the effect of severe LUTS was comparable to having had a heart attack or stroke. The degree to which patients find LUTS bothersome and disruptive to their daily lives provides the basis for the decision to seek treatment  and is most often the factor that brings men to medical attention.
Asperger syndrome  is an autism spectrum disorder which is characterized by deficient social interaction and communication skills, stereotyped behaviors, as well as circumscribed special interests . Although language delay is not a general characteristic of AS , individuals with AS may have initial mild deficits in their language development, and have semantic pragmatic deficits in their language use . However, research on this topic has so far been quite sparse.
Identification of new biomarkers to predict bad pregnancy/fetal outcomes would be of enormous clinical benefit. In particular, a non invasive detection of a biomarker that can identify pregnancies at risk would allow determining optimal timing of delivery and implementation of neuroprotective strategies to the mother. Currently, there are very few methods to predict adverse pregnancy/fetal outcomes .
The incidence of delayed fracture healing, or non union, is estimated to occur in 5 10% of fractures . In elderly persons with osteoporosis, non union rates can be upwards of 30%  . Studies have found mechanosensitivity to have a genetic basis .
Parkinson's disease  is a disabling neurodegenerative disorder marked by progressive motor dysfunction and characterized by the loss of nigrostriatal dopamine  neurons and cytoplasmic inclusions termed Lewy bodies . While the pathogenesis of PD has not yet been established, previous studies have implicated both genetic as well as environmental contributions. Animal models of PD have been constructed by over expression of α syn, and several of these have been used to identify factors that protect against α syn toxicity.
Ebola  and Marburg  virus are members of the family Filoviridae, which belongs to the order Mononegavirales. The MARV genome, like other members of the order, is a negative sense single stranded  RNA genome just over 19kb in length that encodes seven genes . Transcription is known to initiate at the 3′ terminus  of an encapsidated genome with one or more stem loop genomic RNA structures functioning as promoter elements for RNA dependent RNA polymerase  binding and transcriptional initiation .
Cross cultural studies of substance use behaviors have demonstratedconsiderable variation in the types of substances most commonly consumed, as well asthe social and physical contexts in which they are consumed . Such observeddifferences in drinking across ethnically defined groups are often attributed to“cultural norms.” We find this use ofthe concept of cultural norms, published in NIAAA's practitioner directed journalAlcohol Research & Health, to be fairly typical of theliterature in our field . The term “cultural norms” was not defined in this article.
Human plasma phospholipid transfer protein  is a 476 amino acid protein secreted by a wide variety of tissues  and is associated predominantly with apo A I containing lipoproteins in plasma . Among the diverse biological functions proposed for PLTP is its role in modulating vascular lipoproteins. It can mediate the conversion of HDL into larger and smaller particles  and generate pre β HDL in the process .
The proportion of women who are overweight  25 30 kg/m2) or obese  when they become pregnant is substantial and rapidly increasing; a recent study estimated that over 20% of US women are obese at the start of pregnancy. High pre pregnancy BMI, particularly obesity, increases the risk of numerous adverse maternal and fetal outcomes including preeclampsia, gestational diabetes and fetal death. The impact of obesity on physical health during pregnancy has been studied extensively, while the relationship between obesity and maternal mental health has been largely neglected.
Primary Sjögren’s Syndrome  is an autoimmune disease characterized by a lymphocytic infiltrate in, and subsequent destruction of, the lacrimal and salivary glands . Immune mediated impairment of glandular function results in keratoconjunctivitis sicca and xerostomia . Alpha fodrin was identified as a potential autoantigen in mouse models  and some human patients , although the relevance of this putative autoantigen to disease remains controversial .
Urinary tract infections  occur in women with diabetes mellitus more frequently than in women without diabetes, are more severe, with pyelonephritis occurring at a five fold higher rate, and often result in complications that are otherwise rare, such as emphysematous cystitis, and fungal infections . Asymptomatic bacteriuria  occurs three times more often among women with diabetes than among otherwise healthy women; ASB is associated with an increased risk of symptomatic infection but is not causative . The presence of ASB in diabetic women is not associated with a faster decline in renal function , or greater risk of diabetic complications or mortality.
The costs of an uncomplicated renal transplant event are approximately $100 000 for the first in 90 days of care . CMS spends $27 billion/year on the care of renal failure patients, and approximately 13% of this amount is for kidney transplantation  . For example, postkidney transplant sepsis the costs insurers $48 000, posttransplant pneumonia costs insurers $38 000 and postkidney transplant urinary complications are associated with $28 000 of additional insurer costs .
One of the still unsolved mysteries of anesthesia is how temporary amnesia is produced during wakefulness by drugs such as midazolam or propofol. Though testing recognition memory some time after the administration of propofol clearly demonstrates the presence of amnesia, one cannot determine which memory process or processes are affected. Long term memory is defined here as memory that is not working memory, i.e. memory retained longer than 20 seconds after encoding in the absence of rehearsal.
Emotions are associated with the automatic generation of bodily responses, notably those mediated by the autonomic nervous system: changes in heart rate, blood pressure and bodily states contributes to emotional feelings: coupling of emotion with peripheral arousal is highlighted by influential theories of emotion, such as that of James and Lange, who argued that the central representation of bodily arousal states provides emotional colour to otherwise emotionless sensory experiences . It is also noteworthy that all these regions have been shown to be sensitive to visceral changes . Thalamus, cingulate, insula and OFC support interoceptive representations that underlie emotional feeling states  and contribute to a general ‘pain matrix’  .
Reactions of high valent iron complexes have attracted considerable interest because iron oxo intermediates are formed in catalytic oxidations in the laboratory and in nature . In a typical catalytic sequence, an iron species is oxidized to an iron oxo transient with a formal oxidation state of +5 on iron by a peroxy  or oxo containing sacrificial oxidant, and the high valent iron oxo species then oxidizes a substrate in a two electron, oxo transfer process to return the iron complex . Synthetic porphyrin iron complexes and related corrole iron complexes mimic heme containing peroxidase and cytochrome P450 enzymes, and high valent iron oxo species with both types of macrocycles have been known for years .
Pyrethroids are synthetic chemicals modeled after the naturally occurring pyrethrins, found in chrysanthemums . Type II pyrethroids, such as deltamethrin, are defined by an α cyano group that is known to produce a long lasting inhibition of voltage activated sodium channels . Pyrethroid pesticides are often thought of as “safer” alternatives to the more toxic organophosphates because of their low mammalian toxicity.
Coordination of activity between the hippocampus and medial prefrontal cortex  has been demonstrated extensively during sleep and wakefulness . The reactivation of place cells occurs during brief high frequency oscillations  in the hippocampal local field potential  and is thought to have a direct role in memory consolidation . Ripples in the CA1 region of the hippocampus occur in close time proximity to spindles recorded in neocortical regions such as mPFC .
Squamous cell carcinoma  is the most common malignancy of the upper aero digestive tract. Despite continually evolving therapeutic options, we have witnessed little improvement in survival for patients with squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck  over the past three decades . The overwhelming majority of experimental and clinical immunotherapeutic modalities for patients with SCCHN are directed towards the activation of major histocompatibility complex  restricted αβ T lymphocytes .
Cognition is a set of high level brain functions that vary substantially among individuals. Twin studies have demonstrated that the heritability is about 60% for general cognitive ability and about 50% for memory . Recently, two genes have received particular attention for these effects.
Advances in the treatment of pediatric major depressive disorder have demonstrated effective acute phase treatments, including antidepressant medication , psychotherapy  and their combination ). Despite these gains, 40%70% of youth will experience a relapse/recurrence of depression . Most treatment studies focus on acute phase outcomes, and those studies which report long term outcomes generally continue the acute phase treatments into long term care.
Gastric cancer  is a major cause of cancer related death, worldwide. Helicobacter pylori  plays an important role in gastric carcinogenesis, although the majority of individuals with H. pylori infection do not develop gastric cancer. Surveillance of these high risk patients using reliable and accurate predictive markers is important for reducing the incidence of cancer and its mortality.
The class B scavenger receptor family is a group of integral membrane proteins which includes scavenger receptor class B type I , its splicing variant SR BII , thrombospondin receptor CD36 and lysosomal integral membrane protein II . SR BI/BII and CD36 have many common features including high structural homology and localization in plasma membrane caveolae like domains which facilitate lipid exchange and cell signaling . The SR BII isoform also mediates holopartical uptake and internalization of HDL .
Prostate cancer is one of the most common cancers affecting men in the United States with approximately 234,000 new cases and 30,000 deaths in year 2006 alone . While some prostate tumors are aggressive and deadly, many others can be indolent and remain dormant for many years, without obvious symptoms of diseases , . Metabolism of arachidonic acid by LOXs leads to the formation of regioisomeric cis/trans conjugated hydroperoxyeicosatetraenoid acids , which subsequently give rise to hydroxyeicosatetraenoic acids , leukotrienes, lipoxins, and hepoxilins .
Schistosomiasis, also known as bilharzia or snail fever, is a neglected tropical disease caused by parasitic schistosomes  indigenous to tropical and subtropical regions of the developing world. Intravascular adult females produce hundreds of eggs daily during this time, which either cross the intestinal lumen to continue the lifecycle or circulate to the liver where they induce a robust host immunological response. Chronic inflammation of the liver ultimately results, leading to portal vein hypertension and severe hepatic fibrosis.
Experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  is a CD4+ T cell mediated demyelinating autoimmune disease of the central nervous system  in mice , which serves as a model of multiple sclerosis  in humans. Mast cells  are derived from haematopoietic stem cells, which migrate into vascularized tissues and serosal cavities where they complete their maturation . The heterogeneity of these cells is suggested by their ability to produce an array of both pro  and anti inflammatory mediators and act as antigen presenting cells expressing a spectrum of co stimulatory molecules .
Congenital heart defects  occur in approximately 1% of live births and are the most common birth defects . Most CHDs are caused by abnormalities in septation and valvulogenesis. Endocardial mesenchymal transformation  is a critical process for normal septation of the outflow tract  and atrioventricular  canal.
Paclitaxel is a first line chemotherapeutic agent that inhibits the dynamic instability of microtubules, thus preventing bi orientation of chromosomes during mitosis . Thus, given the promise, yet limitation, of current anti mitotic therapies, the identification of mechanisms supporting intrinsic resistance to paclitaxel in NSCLC is essential. Our goal here was to identify the cell autonomous components that permit escape from mitotic stress induced cell death in a paclitaxel resistant NSCLC setting .
Kaposi sarcoma associated herpesvirus , also known as human herpesvirus 8  was first described in 1994 . The lytic infection is also critical for the spread of KSHV to different organs . Herpes simplex virus , human cytomegalovirus , and KSHV  are examples of viruses from the three different herpesvirus families that cause latent infection of cells .
The high level of alcohol binge drinking during adolescence remains an important public health concern . Alcohol exposure during adolescence may induce long lasting neurobiological changes that could attenuate responsiveness to alcohol later in life . The adolescent brain is more sensitive to the neurotoxic effects of alcohol than the adult brain .
Although the health benefits of breastfeeding are well established, the rates of breastfeeding initiation, continuation, and exclusive breastfeeding during the first few months of infancy are lower than expected among US mothers . Multiple health organizations, including the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention , the World Health Organization, and the American Academy of Pediatrics, recommend exclusive breastfeeding for the first four to six months of life . Despite this, the CDC estimates the national rate for exclusive breastfeeding among new US mothers at infant age three months to be only 35 percent .
Men who have sex with men  continue to make up the vast majority of HIV infections in the US. Several published reports of HIV risks that stratify risk behavior by race do not demonstrate elevated risk behavior among black MSM  as compared to white MSM . , For example, BMSM on the whole report fewer sex partners and similar rates of unprotected anal intercourse when compared with WMSM.
In the United States, there exists a common stereotype of the Asian model minority: a group of individuals who excel academically and exhibit few behavioral difficulties . For this reason, at risk Asian American youth remain relatively understudied. Between 1980 and 2000, juvenile arrests of Asian youth increased by 11 percent in the U.S., while juvenile arrests during the same period decreased for African American and European American adolescents .
Interactions between neurons and glial cells are crucial mechanisms underlying synaptic plasticity in the spinal dorsal horn in pathological pain conditions . Excessive activation of glutamate receptors in spinal dorsal horn neurons is a key mechanism leading to abnormal neuronal activation in the pain signaling system . Currently, mechanisms leading to reduced glial glutamate transporter functions and molecular mechanism by which IL 1β alters synaptic transmission in the spinal dorsal horn remain obscure.
The majority of aligned sample solid state NMR studies on proteins immobilized in supramolecular complexes, such as virus particles or membranes, have relied on 1H/15N double resonance experiments . However, there are two disadvantages to the 1H/15N double resonance approach: it is restricted to the amide nitrogen sites in the polypeptide backbone and the few nitrogen containing side chain sites, and the direct detection of 15N signals has low sensitivity because of its low gyromagnetic ratio. The design of triple resonance experiments for stationary samples is considerably different than that for magic angle spinning  experiments.
EC have been shown to play a central role in vasculogenesis during development and in angiogenesis . EC mediated angiogenesis also plays a key role in tumor development and metastasis , and endothelial dysfunction has been found to be an independent predictor of cardiovascular diseases . In addition, endothelial signaling in developmental organogenesis appears to be universal in vertebrates , making them important for tissue engineering.
Pneumocystis carinii pneumonia  remains a life threatening disease process prevalent among immunosuppressed populations. Therefore new treatment modalities that specifically address the pathophysiology of PcP are needed. Mortality is particularly high, up to 8090%, among those patients who require admission to an Intensive Care Unit.
Serotonin  has long been documented to play a critical trophic role in early brain development . One unique developmental feature concerning 5 HT is its transient presence in thalamocortical afferents, particularly those involved in primary sensory circuits . These findings suggest that abnormal development of the 5 HT system could lead to altered wiring of neural circuits and inappropriate behavior .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a systemic inflammatory disease of unknown etiology characterized by destructive joint disease, significant morbidity and increased mortality . There are numerous genetic factors associated with increased risk for RA including HLA alleles containing the shared epitope , PTPN22 polymorphism, and others . These genetic factors are thought to predispose individuals to the development of autoimmunity, likely due to genetic and environmental interactions .
Back pain is a common occupational problem in commercial fishermen. In a cross sectional study of Swedish deep sea fishermen, half of fishermen experienced low back symptoms during the last 12 months . However, the importance of these factors from a prevention standpoint is limited by the degree to which they are modifiable.
Most therapeutic regimens for lymphoma are based on combinations of drugs, radiation and/or surgery to maximize patient survival. Oncolytic viruses are also being combined with other therapeutic modalities: the genetically modified adenovirus H101, which is approved in China for the treatment of head and neck carcinoma, is delivered in combination with chemotherapy . Moreover, several current clinical trials are based on the combination of oncolytic viruses with other therapies , .
Individuals lower in socioeconomic status  consistently suffer poorer mental and physical health. They are at heightened risk for numerous mental health problems, including depression, anxiety, and disruptive disorders , , as well as for a variety of chronic medical illnesses, including cardiovascular disease, arthritis, and some cancers , . This is the notion of resilience, that is, individual characteristics or situational processes that can buffer those facing adversity from poor outcomes , .
Worldwide, nearly half of all pregnancies are unintended, contributing to substantial negative health outcomes including maternal morbidity and mortality, complicated pregnancy outcomes and significant societal burdens . Despite a wide variety of reversible hormonal contraceptive methods available for women , no new reversible contraception options have been developed for men since the invention of condoms over 400 years ago. Many reversible male hormonal contraceptive regimens have been tested in clinical trials, using either testosterone alone or testosterone in combination with a progestin, to suppress gonadotropin secretion .
During the last decade, attempts to improve survival of adults with ALL have focused on the role of early dose intensification to eradicate minimal residual disease and prevent the emergence of drug resistant sub clones. Several trials have explored the role of allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplantation performed in first remission,. Others have tested the efficacy of dose intensification of several of the drugs that are standard components of ALL regimens,.
Family relationship quality predicts medical outcomes in stroke , end stage renal disease , and heart failure . Important aspects of family relationships include the extent to which family members are critical or blaming of each other, and the extent to which family members can express their feelings with each other and confide in each other. Among stroke patients, family functioning predicts number of hospital days during the first year following a stroke and is a better predictor of rehospitalization than typical predictors of stroke outcome .
Chromosomes are not randomly arranged in the vertebrate cell nucleus . However, it is not clear to what extent their nuclear positions, together with their neighborhoods, are conserved in daughter cells . Using similar experimental approaches, the results of recent studies argued that the chromosomes were arranged similarly in maternal and daughter cells , or that positions of chromosomes in daughter nuclei were conserved only partly and in most cases largely differed from the positions seen in mother cell nuclei  .
While the biomedical effectiveness of antiretroviral therapy  for HIV/AIDS is well established , far less is known about the “social effectiveness” of ART for adults in sub Saharan Africa. One primary way that working aged adults contribute to household welfare is by generating income in either the formal or informal sector. Labor force participation and absenteeism are incomplete measures of productivity, however, because they do not capture what is known as “impaired presenteeism”    when workers return to work but are not fully productive due to illness or disability  .
The immediate early gene  Arc/Arg3.1  was identified as a hippocampal transcript strongly induced by seizures and synaptic plasticity inducing electrical stimulation in the rat hippocampus . Arc/Arg3.1 activation and function have been investigated most in the rodent hippocampus, where this immediate early gene plays an essential role in spatial processing, learning and memory. Thus, although the detailed mechanisms through which Arc/Arg3.1 affects hippocampal functions are still under investigation, with recent evidence pointing to regulation of AMPA receptor endocytosis , mapping of Arc/Arg3.1 transcriptional induction provides a high resolution approach to linking the activity of neural circuits to complex hippocampus based behavior .
Epithelial ovarian cancer  is the fourth leading cause of cancer related deaths in women in the United States and the leading cause of gynecologic cancer deaths. Although 80% 90% of patients initially respond to first line chemotherapy agents carboplatin and paclitaxel, less than 1015% remain in complete remission and most patients eventually recur with chemoresistant tumors . Type I/CD44+ EOC cells have many characteristics associated with CSCs.
Neural differentiation of embryonic stem cells  has become a prolific area of stem cell research. This can be attributed to molecular embryologic studies of the developing nervous system which have resulted in major discoveries defining the mechanisms underlying developmental processes and because ESCs readily differentiate into neural lineages in vitro , . Proteomics has emerged as a powerful direct method of simultaneous identification and quantitation of proteins.
G protein coupled receptors  are the largest family of signal transduction proteins in the mammalian genome and a major target of therapeutic drugs,. Their signaling includes both canonical pathways mediated by heterotrimeric G proteins, and non canonical pathways mediated in part by β arrestins,. Historically, GPCR signaling was considered linear and drug development programs focused on the discovery of ligands that would either activate or block receptor function.
Developing hematopoietic cells normally require input from growth factor signaling pathways to support basal glucose metabolism for cell survival and proliferation. It is now clear that aerobic glycolysis can be directly initiated by growth factor signals and oncogenes known to cause hematologic malignancies, including Notch, Akt, and BCR Abl. The extent to which this metabolic phenotype impacts cell survival or oncogenesis, however, remains unclear .
Childhood overweight  and obesity  affect nearly 1/3 of U.S. children, and the prevalence of these conditions has increased at least four fold since the 1970s . However, obesity in ASD may be particularly problematic for a variety of reasons. First, core symptoms of ASD may relate to weight problems: for instance, children with ASD may lack social motivation to participate in family meals or in structured physical activities with other children , which might promote healthy weight.
Changes in vascular growth and survival play an important role in neointimal formation during the pathogenesis of atherosclerosis and the arterial response to injury . Hedgehogs  are a class of 19 kDa morphogens that interact with heparin on the cell surface through an N terminal basic domain and are tethered to the surface through cholesterol and fatty acyl modification . Sonic hedgehog  is the most widely expressed hedgehog during development where lack of Shh is embryonically lethal .
Symptomatic seizures in infancy are associated with later life epilepsy and cognitive deficits. Epilepsy and autistic like behavior have been described to occur concurrently in 30% of patients with either disorder ; the rate of co occurrence is even higher in subjects with both autism and intellectual disability . There is no known causal relationship between epilepsy and autism, including in acquired models of epilepsy.
Social phobia is characterized by pervasive social timidity, social distress and avoidance, and for some individuals, difficulty in basic social discourse. Although different research clinics use somewhat different criteria by which to define subtypes, the distinction can be made reliably . One area where there has been less empirical attention however is the issue of social skill.
Aromatase, a member of the cytochrome P450  protein superfamily  is a unique gene product of the CYP19 gene. To date, there have been no published studies of aromatase distribution or regulation throughout the human brain, while animal studies suggest that brain aromatase activity is higher in adult males than in adult females and is modulated by changes in testosterone levels but not the phase of the female estrus cycle  . Changes in aromatase activity are also implicated in a wide range of human diseases, including Alzheimer's disease , brain injury  breast cancer , endometriosis , and hepatic cancer  .
Gastroschisis is a congenital defect of the ventral body wall, resulting in protrusion of the intestines outside the abdominal cavity. Evidence in support of this hypothesis comes from both human embryology and clinical observations. Normal re routing of the blood supply in the area of the developing abdominal wall results in an asymmetry, as the left omphalomesenteric artery undergoes apoptosis and the right side is retained .
The prognosis of acute internal carotid artery  occlusion may be difficult to predict. Patients with acute ICA occlusion may be asymptomatic or experience neurological effects ranging from transient ischaemic attack to devastating stroke. One possible explanation for such variation is that relatively good prognoses may be associated with robust collateral circulation from other arterial sources .
The ductus arteriosus is a prostaglandin sensitive fetal vascular shunt. Timely closure of the ductus arteriosus after birth is critical for successful postnatal circulatory adaptation. Patency of the fetal ductus is primarily attributed to low oxygen tension and active vasodilation by endogenous prostaglandins and nitric oxide .
Fractional flow reserve  enables physiologic assessment of coronary lesions at the time of invasive coronary angiography , and is the gold standard for identification of lesions that cause ischemia . By invasive and pathologic studies, high risk anatomic plaque features have been established as fundamental to the processes of acute coronary syndromes  and sudden cardiac death . For these lesions, several common characteristics are shared, including plaque burden, thin cap fibroatheroma, positive arterial remodeling, necrotic cores, spotty calcifications, and macrophage infiltration .
Crohn's disease  is a chronic inflammatory bowel disease that often has its onset during young adulthood and is characterized by a protracted course of relapses and remission, . Advances in medical therapy over the past two decades has significantly revolutionized the management of CD and improved our ability to achieve remission, and reduce the number of surgeries and hospitalization . Yet, nearly half the patients with CD continue to require at least one surgical resection during the course of their disease.
Understanding the transcriptional and signaling programs that specify cardiomyocyte fate from uncommitted progenitors may provide important clues to impact cellular strategies for treating failing or infarcted heart tissue. Gata4 deficient ES cells retain the ability to differentiate into cardiomyocytes in vitro, and the analysis of chimeric mice hosting knockout cells proved that Gata4 is not required for cardiomyocyte differentiation . The ventricular hypoplasia is thought to be associated with defects in cardiac morphogenesis and cardiomyocyte proliferation, rather than differentiation .
It is generally appreciated that the intrinsic mechanical properties of soft tissues provide insight into a variety of disease processes including liver fibrosis , breast lesions , myocardial infarction , hypertension , diastolic dysfunction , arterial stiffness , and muscle function . As such, there exists a continuing need for the improved noninvasive detection, assessment, and quantification of tissue mechanical properties . Techniques such as ultrasound elastography based on cross correlation analysis , transient elastography , as well as magnetic resonance elastography   are capable of quantifying the stiffness of soft tissues noninvasively and are based on imaging tissue response to intrinsic or extrinsic motion sources.
Serine and glycine are nutrients that fuel metabolic pathways including one carbon metabolism and sulfur metabolism. This metabolic unit referred to as the serine, glycine and one carbon  network provides an integration point in cellular metabolism that allows for cells to achieve diverse biological functions by converting serine and glycine into several metabolic outputs. They also include polyamine synthesis and work in the maintenance of redox status as determined by glutathione biosynthesis and NADPH production .
Stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse are highly prevalent conditions which are often managed surgically. Since the introduction of the tension free mesh slings in the late 1990’s for incontinence and the subsequent development of vaginal mesh procedures for pelvic organ prolapse, the surgical management of both conditions has increased substantially. With these recent changes in surgical practice, an assessment of the lifetime risk of surgery for stress incontinence and pelvic organ prolapse is necessary to understand the overall public health impact and burden of pelvic floor disorders.
Differentiated epithelial and endothelial cells have strong attachment requirements, presumably to prevent cellular vagrancy and consequent tissue disorganization. During transformation, cells lose such anchorage context and not only survive but also proliferate without attachment to solid matrix. Certain pathways downstream from integrins may influence detachment signals.
Lung cancer is formerly the highest cause of mortality among tumor pathologies worldwide. There are no validated techniques for an early detection of pulmonary cancer lesions other than low dose helical CT scan. Unfortunately, this method have some downside effects .
The peroxisome proliferator activated receptors PPARα and PPARγ are nuclear receptors that, upon heterodimerization with the retinoid X receptor , function as ligand activated transcriptional regulators of genes controlling lipid and glucose metabolism . PPARγ is also expressed in pancreatic β cells, but its level of expression is much lower than elsewhere . Agonist induced activation of PPARγ/RXR is known to increase insulin sensitivity , and synthetic ligands of PPARγ, thiazolidinedione drugs , which have the ability to directly bind and activate PPARγ  and stimulate adipocyte differentiation , are used clinically to reduce insulin resistance and improve hyperglycemia in Type 2 diabetes mellitus  .
The vertebrate retina is an accessible, well described sensory tissue that continuously provides valuable insights into neurogenesis, nerve structure, and nervous system circuitry . In particular, major advances have been made using the retina as a model for central nervous system development. This is especially true for RGCs, for which extensive analysis has revealed the transcriptional network circuitry critical for RGC specification and differentiation .
We aim to better characterize the staining patterns of inverted papilloma  with and without carcinoma by performing immunohistochemistry for p16, EGFR , p53, and Cyclin D1 antibodies on a large patient cohort . One hundred and sixty two IP specimens from 122 patients treated at the University of Michigan between 1996 and 2011. Twenty two specimens contained carcinoma.
HER 2/neu is a 185 kDa transmembrane protein homologous to epidermal growth factor receptor . Overexpression of this protein is required for the maintenance of malignant phenotype of several tumors and is associated with poor prognosis in cancer patients . In previous studies, several MHC class I epitopes of different tumor antigens such as p53, carcinoembryonic antigen, MAGE2/3 and HER 2/neu were identified and many of these peptides are being or have been tested in clinical trials .
Allergic disease, including food allergy, allergic rhinitis , atopic dermatitis , and asthma, is one of the major causes of morbidity worldwide . Its prevalence has been rising in many parts of the world and the global prevalence differences are lessening . As such, the economic burden of these diseases is substantial in both developed and developing countries .
Converging evidence suggests that inbred Wistar Kyoto rats  are models of inherent anxiousness and vulnerability to stress. Enhanced stress reactivity has several implications for eyeblink conditioning. For one, enhanced stress reactivity may manifest as increased reactivity to the appreciation of the US, expressed as the magnitude of the unconditional response  .
Clinical applications of 13C MRS have been explored in a wide range of human brain diseases from the new born to advanced age . 13C enriched glucose and acetate have been used to distinguish neuronal from glial metabolism and, with low power  decoupling within the FDA limits of power deposition , previous no go frontal areas of the brain have become accessible to 13C MRS examinations . Data analyses based on complex, steady state multi enzyme models have been replaced by simpler single step calculations, to distinguish between normal and diseased states of neurons .
Unremitting bacterial infection increases nitrogen excretion resulting from an imbalance between rates of whole body protein synthesis and degradation . Although sepsis induced changes in protein balance can be detected in several tissues, much of the urinary loss of nitrogen and increased protein turnover is attributable to the erosion of muscle mass . The mechanism by which prolonged sepsis leads to muscle atrophy involves both a decreased rate of protein synthesis and increased the rate of proteolysis .
In mammals with haemachorial placentation, pregnancy represents a physiological state in which intimate contact between maternal and fetal tissues must occur. PSGs are members of the carcinoembryonic antigen  family of immunoglobulin  like genes . PSG protein and mRNA have been detected in trophoblast giant cells and spongiotrophoblasts of the mouse as early as Embryonic Day 6.5 .
It has become well accepted that osteocytes play an important role in bone maintenance and adaptation in response to mechanical stimuli . For example, PGE2 was found to increase bone mass by stimulating osteoblast recruitment and NO may inhibit proliferation of osteoblast precursors and accelerate their differentiation into osteoblasts . Osteocyte derived sclerostin negatively regulates osteoblastic bone formation through the Wnt signaling pathway .
Heavy alcohol consumption and illicit drug use during college are associated with significant adverse effects on the health, well being and safety of young adults . Recently, it has been estimated from national data that 20.6% of full time college students meet DSM IV criteria for an alcohol use disorder  and 7.9% meet criteria for a drug use disorder . Researchers have long advocated for early identification, screening, and intervention with high risk students as part of a comprehensive approach to reducing problems related to substance use .
One of the most effective strategies to improve BP control involves team based care that includes collaborative care or independent management by a pharmacist. We conducted a systematic review of the literature that included 37 controlled clinical studies of either nurse or pharmacist assisted BP management. The reduction in SBP when a pharmacist was involved was 9.3 mm Hg and 4.8 mm Hg in studies involving nurses.
Atherosclerosis is a chronic inflammatory condition in which immune and non immune mechanisms induce endothelial dysfunction, the first step in atherogenesis. However, the potential atherogenic role of the complement system, a main effector arm of immunity and inflammation, remains to be determined . These three pathways eventually converge at the level of C3 and the formation of a C5 convertase.
Prostate cancer  is the most common non skin cancer among men in developed countries and the second leading cause of cancer death . Therefore, an improved understanding of the molecular pathways leading to chemo resistance will have direct clinical implications by increasing our capability to develop new treatment options that may overcome drug resistance in advanced PCa . This pro survival activity represents a major functional difference between the normal PCPH protein and the mt PCPH oncoprotein, because expression of the normal protein consistently provided lower levels of protection against apoptotic agents, including chemotherapeutic drugs and radiation .
Frontotemporal lobar degeneration  comprises a clinically heterogeneous group of disorders that primarily affect either personality or language. bvFTLD is the most common clinical presentation with early behavioural and personality changes. A number of related neurodegenerative diseases with a prominent motor component overlap with FTLD, namely the corticobasal syndrome , progressive supranuclear palsy  and motoneuron disease   .
The cellular mechanisms underlying nigral dopaminergic degeneration associated with various pathological conditions such as Parkinson’s disease  and methamphetamine abuse are yet to be clarified. In recent years, studies have implicated oxidative stress as a key contributor to dopaminergic cell degeneration, including PD associated degeneration. , Oxidative damage triggered by reactive oxygen species  such as hydrogen peroxide  can activate a series of signaling events ultimately leading to programmed cell death, or apoptosis.
Sickle cell disease  is a chronic disease associated with a diversity of serious pathophysiologic complications including, but not limited to, chronic hemolytic anemia, stroke, acute chest syndrome, pulmonary embolus, pulmonary hypertension, cholecystitis, hepatic and splenic sequestration, retinal detachment and hemorrhage, aseptic necrosis of the joints, priapism, iron overload, and chronic leg ulcers. Patients with SCD often present to the emergency department  with acute pain crisis, often referred to as a vaso occlusive crisis . While the frequency and severity of complications varies widely, it is likely that all persons with SCD will obtain care in the ED at some point in time .
Cancer is the leading cause of death in U.S. and many developed countries. The number of global cancer deaths is projected to increase 45% from 2007 to 2030 . Several different approaches have been implemented for prevention, early detection, diagnosis and treatment of various types of cancers.
There is increasing evidence to suggest that size at birth and childhood growth are important determinants of body composition and chronic disease in later life . Although maternal birth weight, smoking, exercise levels and adiposity in pregnancy have all been shown to influence bone mass at birth , less is known about the prenatal determinants of other aspects of neonatal body composition such as fat and lean mass, and the extent to which these effects are modified by the early postnatal environment. Many epidemiologic studies of obesity have used BMI as the main outcome measure but interpretation of BMI is difficult because it reflects both fat and muscle mass.
The synapse between the motor nerve and skeletal muscle, commonly referred to as the neuromuscular junction , is cholinergic in vertebrates and is a model system for the investigation of synapses . γ and ε are developmentally regulated and can substitute for each other. The embryonic type γ is replaced by the adult type ε as the synapse matures  .
Oxidative stress, defined as an imbalance between the production of reactive oxygen species  and the antioxidant defence system, plays an important role in the pathogenesis of insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes mellitus  . Attention has therefore been focused on the potential protective role of dietary antioxidants in the aetiology of impaired glucose tolerance and T2DM . A meta analysis of observational data from cohort studies showed protective effects of greater intakes of dietary antioxidants on risk of T2DM .
The presence of epileptiform abnormalities on electroencephalogram  augments clinical information about seizures and helps with both diagnosis and classification. Since the first EEG does not always show an epileptiform abnormality and serial EEGs may all be normal , multiple EEGs are often recorded in an effort to find an epileptiform abnormality that may guide treatment, particularly if patients continue to experience seizures . Most previous studies of the yield of epileptiform abnormalities on EEG in new onset seizures have evaluated a single EEG.
Motor redundancy or, when considered more positively, motor abundance  makes it possible for multiple variations of joint and muscle coordination to be used to achieve a given task performance. These results are consistent with Bernstein's intuition that task performance typically involves “repetition without repetition” . Many of the above cited studies have investigated differences in indices of variability of various task relevant variables when performing a particular task.
Gray ProRoot mineral trioxide aggregate   was patented in 1995 as a root end filling material . Mineral trioxide aggregate  has two phases, calcium oxide and calcium phosphate; the calcium oxide reacts with tissue fluid to form calcium hydroxide  . The chemical and physical characteristics  and biocompatibility  of MTA have been reported.
Cognitive models of social anxiety posit that the interpretation of ambiguous information as threatening maintains anxiety . For example, it is difficult to know if a conversation partner's yawn indicates boredom  or exhaustion . Participants with social phobia did not show this pattern in learning a benign meaning of a homograph.
In 1932 Joannes Cassianus Pompe described the clinical and pathological findings in a 7 month old girl who died with an unusual disease  that has come to bear his name . In an insightful study almost a decade later , Hers inferred that it was a lysosomal storage disease, the first in what has become an extensive list of 40 to 50 lysosomal storage diseases  . Patients with less severe enzyme deficiencies generally develop symptoms later in life, with skeletal muscle weakness, especially of respiratory musculature, but not cardiac failure .
Poly  based hydrogels are currently being investigated for a myriad of biomedical applications, including drug delivery, surface modifications, diagnostic devices, and tissue engineering due to their appeal as a hydrophilic and cytocompatible biomaterial as well as the range of physicochemical properties that can be achieved to meet the needs of the application . These materials are of particular interest for tissue engineering applications because of their ability to mimic the extracellular matrix of tissues and direct the growth of neo tissue within a three dimensional architecture ,. By varying parameters such as network morphology, crosslinking density, and polymer composition, PEG based hydrogels can be easily tailored to meet the requirements for regeneration of a multitude of tissue types  .
The ability to track drug delivery and disposition is critical to the development and assessment of new therapeutic agents. Detailed analysis of absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion  is required by regulatory agencies that govern the approval process. Such vehicles carry large payloads of drug and ideally are designed to preferentially release the active therapeutic agent only when bound to the target .
The ability to rapidly change the velocity and direction of whole body center of mass is a fundamental locomotor skill in most sports. Thus, identifying factors that influence proficiency of this motor skill could be useful for the development of training programs aimed at improving sport performance . Currently, little is known regarding definitive factors that influence agility.
In endochondral bone development mesenchymal condensates differentiate into chondrocytes that proliferate to form and enlarge the bone structure . Chondrocytes continue to proliferate and undergo well ordered phases of maturation. The chondrocytes undergo cycles of proliferation, flatten and form orderly columns, become hypertrophic and eventually die, to be replaced by osteoblasts adjacent to the growth plate in the marrow space and the bone collar.
BCL 2 family proteins are important regulators of the mitochondrial outermembrane potential  and thereby the induction of apoptosis . The proapoptotic BCL 2 family members BAX and BAK containmultiple BH domains and control the MOMP. Binding of Nur77exposes the BCL 2 BH3 domain and converts BCL 2 from an antiapoptotic protein to aninducer of apoptosis .
To fully understand the biological relevance, regulation and function of DNA in processes ranging from replication to transcription and repair, it is important to gain atomic level insight into the sequence specific structure, deformability and dynamics of DNA . Towards this end, many experimental, theoretical, and simulation approaches have been applied to provide this atomistic insight into DNA structure and dynamics on timescales ranging from very fast femto  and pico second processes to longer millisecond timescale events such as base pair opening . MD simulations tens of microseconds in length were performed to attempt to address this question.
Optimal recovery of cerebral blood flow  has been implicated as a critical factor in determining neuronal survival after asphyxial cardiac arrest  in infants and children. CBF after CA is well described in adult animal models; however there are limited data on CBF after pediatric asphyxial CA. In adult CA models CBF after CA is phasic in nature, with global hyperemia present for 15 30 min after return of spontaneous circulation  characterized by CBF 2 3 times higher than baseline, followed by delayed hypoperfusion that occurs after 15 30 min and continues for several hours after ROSC  .
Social networks are imperative for human survival and reproduction: they allow the sharing of information, knowledge and resources, as well as aiding cooperation, for example in hunting and for collective childcare . Sustaining social bonds beyond the residential band is a challenge that hunter gatherers need to solve in order to survive. We argue that the most conservative interpretation of the distance over which raw materials are moved is that it reflects the distance over which there exists the potential for maintaining social cohesion if social encounters and interactions occur.
The stem cell niche is essential in the maintenance and differentiation of stem and progenitor cells in vivo . However, because Sertoli cells also produce factors such as inhibin, which seems to prevent stem cell self renewal, researchers have resorted to other common feeder cell types . have used mitomycin C inactivated murine embryonic fibroblasts , which produce leukemia inhibitory factor , whereas the Brinster group  used STO cells and Seandel et al. One of the most extensively studied systems to date is the cultivation of embryonic stem cells .
Tobacco smoke exposure during pregnancy results in a number of deleterious health effects for both mother and offspring . Prominent among these is an increased risk for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder  and other non clinical cognitive issues in children of smoking mothers, suggesting that a component in tobacco can adversely affect neurodevelopment . A number of methods of administration during pregnancy and the early postnatal period have been employed in rodents to assess the potential of nicotine to alter neurodevelopment .
Taxol  is one of the most effective microtubule targeting drugs for breast cancer treatment and it accounts for significant improvements in breast cancer patient’s survival in the last two decades. Taxol resistance is a major obstacle that severely limited the improvement of response and survival in Taxol treated cancer patients . One focus of attention in this effort is on ErbB2 , a receptor tyrosine kinase that is overexpressed in 20 30% of human breast cancers, and has been shown to correlate with a poor prognosis .
Trichomonas vaginalis is a sexually transmitted protozoan that causes vaginitis in approximately 2050% of infected women, and non gonococcal urethritis in a small percentage of infected men. We previously hypothesized that this lack of specific symptoms might facilitate persistent and undetected trichomonosis  in men, thereby providing T. vaginalis with greater opportunity to ascend to the prostate than other more symptomatic sexually transmitted agents. Indeed, early trichomonosis researchers believed the prostate to be the reservoir for T. vaginalis based on its frequent detection in prostate fluid from male partners of women with trichomonal vaginitis.
In recent years, the WHO has estimated that suicide rates have shown a 60 % rise worldwide with nearly one million deaths from suicides each year. Strikingly, low and middle income developing countries have accounted for 84 % of suicides . Suicide is a well recognised public health challenge ranking as the second leading cause of death for the 1519 years age group, and one of three leading causes of death in the most economically productive 1544 year age range .
Noncovalent interactions, such as hydrogen bonding, hydrophobic packing, and aromatic interactions, are important forces in biomolecules because these collective interactions contribute to the overall stability of nucleic acids, proteins, and peptides. This interaction is electrostatic in nature and plays a critical role in biomolecular stability. For example, aromatic interactions are responsible for base pair stacking in DNA.
Post operative wound infections in pediatric patients undergoing cardiothoracic surgery occurs in 2.38% of patients . This complication results in increased morbidity, longer hospitalizations, and increased cost—with over $1.6 billion annually in extra hospital charges reported . In particular, the financial burden is becoming a more urgent concern for our field as insurance reforms limiting the reimbursement for these “preventable” complications become more common.
Manipulating gene expression in skeletal muscle is of interest for a wide array of fundamental and applied research questions relating to gene function in neuromuscular development, health and disease. Embryonic or perinatal lethality resulting from manipulating gene expression can prove to be a significant hurdle to research. Notably, the Cre/loxP system is used in mice to allow for conditional activation or inactivation of mutations.
Neuromyotonia is defined as persistent muscle contraction following voluntary movement, resulting from hyperexcitability of the peripheral nerve and not the muscle itself. Neuromyotonia can be acquired and is often associated with autoimmune reactivity against voltage gated potassium channels . In total, 8 mutations were identified in 33 families, often in a compound heterozygous state although the R37P allele was prevalent and did appear as a homozygous variant.
Voltage gated ion channels are multi functional . For example, VGSC β subunits regulate channel transcription, cell surface expression, and subcellular localization, modulate channel currents, and participate in cell cell adhesion  . VGSC α subunit cDNAs express functional channels in heterologous systems.
Stroke is the leading cause of neurological disability among adults , with associated behavioral sequelae ranging from the functional  to the clinical  . Aging is a major risk factor for stroke . Among the issues to clarify for the growing population of mild stroke older adults are  the range and specificity of cognitive or motor effects,  underlying neurological damage ,  clinical diagnosis and prognosis,  possible relationship to other vascular sources of cognitive impairment, and  neurorehabilitation and productivity prospects .
Neurons of the major pelvic ganglia  innervate urogenital organs and components of the lower bowel. The MPG are unique autonomic ganglia in that they contain both sympathetic and parasympathetic postganglionic neurons and receive input from the lumbar sympathetic and sacral parasympathetic nerves. Classically the ganglia have been perceived as relay stations for the central neurochemical drive to the peripheral organs.
It is well recognized in economic theory, as well as in everyday life, that purchasing decisions are influenced by price and disposable income. This principle applies to the sale of cigarettes as it does other consumer goods. Studies have repeatedly illustrated that a 10% increase in the price of cigarettes typically results in a 2.55% decrease in cigarette consumption.
Calpain is a cytosolic cystein protease that translocates to membrane upon activation. Through interactions with its substrates, calpain plays an important role transducing signals of cell migration, differentiation, and proliferation . Because VEGF mediated angiogenesis is at least partially attributed to endothelial cell production of nitric oxide  ,, we became interested in whether some of the undiscovered roles of calpain deal with VEGF production of NO• and angiogenesis.
The two emerging techniques for the study of fetal brain function in utero are functional magnetic resonance imaging  and fetal magnetoencephalography . Because fMEG does not provide anatomical imaging, this additional information must be obtained by complementary imaging techniques such as ultrasound  . Until recently, there have been no appropriate models for the generation of biomagnetic and electrical signals originating in the abdomen.
Diabetes mellitus is a chronic metabolic disease with serious oral health implications. Studies  also suggest a bidirectional relationship between periodontal disease and diabetes, with periodontal disease worsening glycemic control, and poorly controlled or uncontrolled diabetes increasing the likelihood of destructive periodontitis . Furthermore, studies  have shown that poor perception of one’s oral health status  among people with diabetes has a strong negative impact on their health related quality of life.
Peripartum hysterectomy, a surgical procedure performed at the time of delivery or in the immediate postpartum period, although a rare event, is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. The main complications related to emergency peripartum hysterectomy include transfusions,,, need for re exploration because of persistent bleeding and febrile morbidity , major surgical complications or maternal death, . Many studies have estimated an incidence rate in the US between 0.8 and 1.5 per 1,000 deliveries,, although, the incidence has been reported to be as high as 2.28 per 1,000 deliveries.
Minority families often reside in neighborhoods with few supermarkets or alternative healthy food options , making fresh produce difficult to obtain. This qualitative study identified factors influencing fruit and vegetable shopping and use of alternative healthy food options . Forty eight minority women with children completed interviews regarding food shopping habits and use of and attitudes toward alternative healthy food options.
Glioma is one of the most fatal tumors and its etiology is largely unknown . Several recent reviews  and a meta analysis  indicate that a history of atopic conditions, such as allergies, asthma, and eczema, is inversely associated with the risk of glioma. The biological mechanism behind this association is thought to be elimination of pro cancerous cells by increased immuno surveillance due to the hyperactive immune state seen in atopy.
While tuberculosis  control programs have made major strides in reducing TB incidence in adults in many high burden countries, assessing program impact on pediatric TB remains difficult because of the lack of a dependable “gold standard test”. Children comprise an estimated 20% of the total TB caseload in high incidence communities,,, but most surveillance programs only count acid fast bacillus  smear positive cases, excluding over 95% of presumptive TB cases among children under 12. Adequate diagnosis of pediatric TB is difficult due to lack of sputum production and paucity or absence of organisms in respiratory secretions, because TB bacilli typically remain confined to perihilar nodes that do not rupture into the bronchus.
Despite declines over the last 25 years, more than a fifth of the US population continues to smoke, and an increasing number of tobacco users are intermittent smokers in social settings . It is likely that environmental cues contribute to social and habitual tobacco use. Nicotine, the primary addictive substance in tobacco smoke, stimulates neuronal activity in the ventral tegmental area and downstream dopamine  projection regions that support addictive behavior .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease , a hepatic manifestation of the metabolic syndrome, and NASH, a progressive form of NAFLD, are two of the most common chronic liver diseases in the United States and worldwide. These two pathological states have been shown to progress to cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma. The successful prevention and treatment of NASH relies on the ability to identify vulnerable subpopulations and detect the disease early and greatly depends on a better understanding of the underlying molecular mechanisms involved in NASH pathogenesis.
Carcinomas are epithelial cancers that constitute 90% of human malignancies and are fatal due to their metastases. Non small cell lung cancer  is the leading cause of cancer related deaths in Western countries. No curative therapies are available for patients with metastatic NSCLC, whose median overall survival is approximately 12 months.
One type of RNA editing involves the conversion of adenosine residues into inosine  in double stranded RNA  through the action of ADAR  . 5 HT2CR is detected exclusively in the central nervous system and plays roles in various physiological and behavioral processes. Increased anxiety , hyperlocomotion , and adult onset hyperphagia and obesity  have been reported with 5 HT2CR null mice, confirming the importance of 5 HT2CR in the regulation of emotion, locomotion, and appetite and metabolic rate control.
Activated protein C  is an endogenous serine protease with anticoagulant, anti inflammatory and cytoprotective activities . Its anticoagulant activity is mediated by irreversible inactivation of the coagulation cofactors, factor Va and FVIIIa . In the central nervous system, activation of the protein C  cellular pathway results in neuroprotection after transient brain ischemia or embolic stroke .
Interest in the substance abuse treatment workforce is increasing while service providers and researchers are attempting to understand the intricate social factors that facilitate or impede service delivery and adoption of new technologies. Turnover in health service organizations disrupts service provision, affects client/counselor relationships, hampers their ability to achieve goals efficiently, and interferes with aspects of organizational functioning  that are important in providing quality care. Understanding supervisory turnover is therefore essential .
Plasma and red blood cell  fatty acid  composition have both been proposed as biomarkers for cardiovascular disease  risk . Not only individual FAs but also composite indices  may predict CVD events and could therefore theoretically serve as risk markers. One approach to risk marker validation is to conduct a case control study in which the FA composition of samples taken from patients with disease is compared to that of individuals free of the disease.
Breast cancer  survivors face unique health challenges, such as lymphedema, which may impact their health related quality of life . In BrCa survivors, lymphedema is chronic, progressive swelling that involves the arm, shoulder, neck or torso from physical disruption or compression of lymphatic channels from tumor invasion, surgery or radiotherapy. , Lymphedema may develop at any time from initial treatment to twenty years later.
Homeodomain containing transcription factors  were discovered on the basis of their remarkable role in specifying positional information along the body axis, a function widely conserved among metazoans . In Drosophila, for example, sex specific expression of the Hox gene Scr is required for development of the male specific sex comb and has influenced the morphological evolution of this structure  . Hox proteins of the Abdominal B  family control varied aspects of sexual development.
Binge eating  and night eating  are behaviors associated with dysregulated eating. Each also represents a potentially modifiable behavioral feature that can be targeted in interventions for both eating disorders and weight management. Several twin studies using varying definitions of the behavior of BE report heritability estimates ranging from 46% to 51% .
Wound classification  has an interesting background. The study results were first published in the Annals of Surgery in 1964 with a further report in 1968., In 1970, the National Nosocomial Infectious Surveillance  system was established, as an aggregated database for infections occurring at acute care hospitals, and this incorporated wound classification as a risk factor for surgical site infections ., In 1985, wound classification also appeared in the Center for Disease Control’s  guidelines for prevention of postoperative wound infection as a “Must” element of documentation at the time of the operation. However, none of these early sources were absolute “owners” of the system .
In amyotrophic lateral sclerosis , unlike other motor neuron diseases, both the cortical and spinal components of motor neuron circuitry progressively degenerate . Therefore, bringing effective treatments to ALS requires targeting both the spinal motor neurons  in the spinal cord and the corticospinal motor neurons  in the motor cortex. Therefore, due to the central involvement of CSMN in motor neuron circuitry and their selective vulnerability and degeneration in various diseases, it is imperative to understand cellular mechanisms for CSMN vulnerability and to develop CSMN directed gene delivery approaches in the cerebral cortex .
Antibiotics are the most commonly prescribed medications to children across all age groups. One fifth of all pediatric ambulatory visits result in an antibiotic prescription . Despite an overall decline in antibiotic prescribing for US children  inappropriate use of expensive broad spectrum antibiotics is rising , which substantially increases health costs, promotes bacterial resistance, and contributes to increasing rates of antibiotic associated adverse effects.
Niemann Pick C disease  is a lethal, neuronopathic autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder of childhood caused by mutations in the NPC1 or NPC2 proteins, leading to an accumulation of unesterified cholesterol and glycosphingolipids  in lysosomes . Clinically, NPC is characterized by progressive neurological deterioration and hepato splenomegaly, with varying age at onset and ensuing course . Two disease causing genes, NPC1  and NPC2  have been identified .
Chronic kidney disease  is a serious public health problem. According to the National Kidney Foundation, 26 million people in America  have CKD and millions more are at an increased risk. CKD progresses through 5 stages; Stage 5 CKD requires renal replacement therapy .
Each year influenza viruses cause significant morbidity and mortality . In fact, last winter , 23,753 specimens tested positive for influenza viruses in collaborating laboratories of the World Health Organization and the National Respiratory and Enteric Virus Surveillance System in the United States . Of the influenza positive specimens, 79% were influenza A viruses and 62% of these were of the H1 subtype .
Pain interference  refers to the degree to which pain limits or interferes with individuals' physical, mental and social activities. This domain is increasingly recognized as important for both understanding patients' experiences and as a key outcome in pain clinical trials . A number of measures of pain interference have been developed including a 9 item scale from the West Haven Yale Multidimensional Pain Inventory  , a 7 item scale from the Brief Pain Inventory , a 6 item Pain Impact Questionnaire  , a 3 item scale from the Chronic Pain Grade , and the 7 item Pain Disability Index .
In musculoskeletal medicine an increasing clinical need exists for bone regeneration and grafting strategies to treat bony voids after spinal fusion, maxillofacial surgery, implant fixation, resection of primary tumors and metastases, or trauma. Recently it has been proposed that the main function of transplanted BMSCs is not to directly conduct bone formation but rather to contribute to a regenerative environment by which host osteoprogenitors can be recruited to the site of repair and differentiate into matrix producing osteoblasts. , Hydrogels are biodegradable synthetic or natural polymers that can be manufactured in large quantities and whose mechanical and biological properties can be varied over a wide range, thereby opening novel treatment opportunities.
The morphogenetic events of early embryonic development are comprised of a series of complex cell and tissue movements. These movements include mesendoderm migration, epiboly and convergent extension, each of which relies on tight temporal and spatial control of chemical and mechanical signals over multiple length scales . Cohesion of the mesendoderm tissue is maintained by cadherin based cell cell contacts across which tensile forces are distributed .
Great strides have been made in reducing incidence and mortality from colorectal cancer  in the United States over the last decade. In addition, mortality rates decreased from 19.0 cases per 100,000 in 2003, to 16.7 per 100,000 cases in 2007. Relatives of patients with CRC are at increased risk of developing the disease.
Protein design was cast in 1983 as an “inverted” folding problem by Pabo, who discussed how finding sequences compatible with a given structure might be easier than predicting how a sequence folds. Despite very significant progress, many basic questions related to computational protein design methodology remain. One important issue is how to choose a structural template for the target, , .
Traditionally comprising three major families: the Conidae , the Terebridae , and the Turridae s.l. , the superfamily Conoidea is an extremely biodiverse group of venomous marine snails. Venoms of conoideans are a complex mixture, with more than a hundred individual peptide components, comprising a largely untapped pharmacological resource  .
Adenovirus vectors have garnered significant attention as candidate vaccine platforms due to their large transgene coding capacity and potent immunogenicity. Ad vector based vaccines are being pursued for a number of viral infections, including Ebola , influenza , hepatitis C , rabies  and HIV 1 . Recently we have evaluated an Ad26 vector based vaccine for HIV 1 in clinical trials , and preclinical studies with Ad26 based vaccine regimens in non human primates resulted in partial protection against acquisition of infection as well as virologic control following SIVmac251 challenges .
Mechanical circulatory assist  devices such as ventricular assist devices  are often employed to augment the function of failing ventricles in patients with advanced heart failure. While VADs are effectively utilized to provide a bridge to transplant or as destination therapy, they unfortunately still have limitations such as mechanical failure, infection, bleeding, and thrombosis . These conditions make platelets more susceptible to shear induced activation, resulting in enhanced coagulation and formation of thromboemboli .
The increase in resistance of bacterial strains to existing antibiotics is a major public health concern  World Health Statistics 2008. HDPs are elements of the host innate immune defense system. The upregulation and/or release of HDPs is induced upon infection with bacteria or viruses.
Onset of bipolar disorder  during childhood significantly affects an individual’s psychosocial development. Moreover, youth with BP are at high risk for suicidal behaviors and completed suicide, substance abuse, and legal problems, and have particularly high rates of health services utilization . Some of the most common comorbid disorders among youth with BP are the anxiety disorders .
Over 28,000 solid organ transplants are performed annually in the United States . In particular, post transplant lymphoproliferative disorder  is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in transplant recipients . Epstein Barr virus  is prominent in the etiology of PTLD , but recipient age, variations in pharmacologic immunosuppression, and type of organ transplanted have also been associated with PTLD risk .
In the United States, approximately 39,000 women will be diagnosed with endometrial cancer and over 7,400 deaths will be attributable to this disease . Although the incidence of endometrial cancer is 30% lower among Black women compared to White women, mortality among Blacks with endometrial cancer is 60% higher . Population based studies have suggested that inequalities in treatment may contribute to poor survival observed among Black women with endometrial cancer  .
The molecular chaperone heat shock protein 90  is currently of major interest as an anticancer drug target. The combinatorial effect of HSP90 inhibitors on multiple oncogenic pathways explains the broad spectrum of anticancer activity of HSP90 inhibitors, and allows them to overcome resistance to various other anticancer therapies . This combinatorial action might also render the probability of cells escaping treatment with HSP90 inhibitors by using alternative resistant pathways less likely to occur.
The human organic cation transporter  type 1 was first isolated from the cultured human glioma cell line SK MG 1 . Later, the presence of OCT1, OCT2, and OCT3 were confirmed in different cultured glioma cell lines . This corresponded to the early data that cultured gliomas possess well expressed, Na+ independent, monoamine transporters .
Macrophages are permissive to CCR5 tropic HIV 1 and in most models can host active viral replication without significant cytopathic effect,. This interaction may contribute to HIV related disease during HIV 1 transmission when R5 tropic virus predominates, by transfer of virus to T cells, as a long lived viral reservoir and by provoking bystander cell apoptosis that may be involved in T cell or neuronal death,. In addition the effect of HIV 1 infection on macrophage function is of significant interest.
Thermal ablation with radiofrequency  and microwave energies is becoming an increasingly important treatment for unresectable tumors of the liver, kidney, lung, and bone . Prior to use in patients, ablation device performance is typically predicted by computer modeling, or characterized with experiments in ex vivo and in vivo models . The expected size and shape of an ablation zone created by a given device is often based upon these experimental results and utilized to predict clinical performance during human application.
The level and localization of p53, often referred to as “the guardian of the genome”, is tightly regulated . Following DNA damage p53 is activated and translocates to the nucleus where it initiates sequence specific transcription of genes involved in cell cycle arrest or apoptosis . The critical role of p53 in maintaining homeostasis in normal cells is evidenced by the fact that over 50% of all human cancers harbor mutant p53 proteins .
Epidemiologic studies have established that depression and anxiety disorders are predictive of numerous health outcomes in later life, including risk of cardiovascular disease,  type 2 diabetes,  osteoporosis,  cognitive decline,  and mortality, particularly among those with established cardiovascular and metabolic disease. , The mechanisms underlying these associations remain largely unspecified. These physiologic systems are complex and interact with each other, and studies of biomarkers of these systems  are limited in their ability to index biological stress exposure organism wide and within cells.
Haloferax volcanii is a halophilic archaeon  commonly isolated from hypersaline environments such as the Dead Sea. volcanii maintains homeostasis by accumulating high concentrations of intracellular cations or counterions . This contrasts with the typical biological strategy in which cells accumulate organic solutes and pump salt ions out.
Recognition memory is supported by the medial temporal lobe , as damage to this brain region across species impairs performance on recognition memory tasks . Studies have consistently demonstrated a role for the perirhinal cortex in this type of memory ; however the role of the hippocampus has been subject to much debate. One potential reason for this discrepancy is that recognition memory has typically been thought of as a combination of two distinct processes, recollection and familiarity .
Effective fat suppression or separation is critical for diagnostic quality in body MRI and is commonly used to eliminate undesired adipose tissue signals or prevent chemical shift artifacts. These problems have been mitigated by using a 4D tailored spectral spatial fat sat pulse proposed in . That fat sat pulse is robust to B0/B1 inhomogeneity and more time efficient than the standard fat sat pulse .
Angiogenesis, the formation of new capillaries from the existing vasculature, is a process subject to exquisite regulation. Numerous pathological conditions are characterized by persistent, abnormal angiogenesis. To effectively prevent and treat ocular NV, a more thorough understanding of the cellular and molecular mechanisms involved in the angiogenic process is necessary .
Geographical, epidemiological and in vitro evidence support the hypothesis that Glucose 6 phosphate dehydrogenase  deficiency confers protection from disease caused by the Plasmodium falciparum parasite . This process releases toxic by products, inducing oxidative stress on the cell. The geographical distribution of these deficiency alleles closely reflects populations historically exposed to endemic malaria , .
Mechanical stimuli have long been recognized as an important factor in determining the structure and function of living cells and tissues. , For decades, physicians have been applying mechanical loads to living tissue in order to achieve beneficial therapeutic effects. In order to better understand these clinical effects, researchers have been studying the molecular and cellular responses to mechanical stimulation with increasing intensity.
Left ventricular noncompaction  is associated with heart failure and arrhythmias such as atrio ventricular  block and intraventricular conduction disturbance . Recently, we have demonstrated that genetic defects of the LIM domain binding protein 3  encoding Z band alternatively spliced PDZ motif protein  are associated with LVNC. In the study, we identified ZASP1 D117N mutation in two Caucasian males who suffer from systolic dysfunction, dilated left ventricle with hypertrabeculated myocardium, and IVCD.
Over the past two decades, the question of what factors govern agreement behavior has been a major focus of language production research. In large part, this interest is due to the observation that agreement is inconsistent in use, and to the discovery by Bock and colleagues  that it is relatively easy to elicit subject verb number agreement errors in the laboratory.
