The cellular response of animals to hypoxia is mediated by a heterodimeric transcription factor, hypoxia inducible factor  . In a separate oxygen dependent mechanism of HIF regulation, asparaginyl hydroxylation  in the HIF α C terminal transactivation domain  reduces the interaction of HIF with transcriptional coactivators . HIF hydroxylation is catalysed by Fe  and 2 oxoglutarate  dependent oxygenases.
Primary HCV infection is asymptomatic in the majority of cases, with 50 80% of individuals developing chronic infection . Studies of chronic HCV infection have demonstrated a low frequency of HCV specific CD4+ and CD8+ cells both in the peripheral blood and liver . By contrast, no clear correlation has been found as yet between anti HCV humoral responses and viral clearance  .
Solution phase hydrogen/deuterium exchange  coupled with mass spectrometry is a non perturbative method to study protein conformational changes in protein ligand and protein protein interactions . However, back exchange still averages ∼30% , depending on various factors, e.g., peptide sequence . With MALDI, the back exchange level is even higher  .
FOXO  comprise a subgroup of the winged helix or forkhead transcription factors that regulate a wide range of biological functions, including development, growth, stress resistance, apoptosis, cell cycle, immunity, metabolism, and aging . FAS ligand, tumor necrosis factor related apoptosis inducing ligand , BIM, and insulin like growth factor binding protein 1 . In response to survival growth factors such as IGF I, Akt/PKB and the related kinase phosphorylate FOXO protein at the first and second phosphorylation sites  which creates a binding site for the chaperone protein 14 3 3 .
Adolescence is a critical period of vulnerability for the onset of smoking . Compared to adult smokers, adolescents more readily develop symptoms of tobacco dependence , showing withdrawal symptoms, craving for cigarettes and failed attempts at quitting in the first weeks of smoking . Women are also more likely to experience mood changes during abstinence, resulting in shorter or less frequent abstinent periods compared to their male counterparts .
The M2 protein of influenza A viruses spans the viral envelope and forms a tetrameric channel that conducts protons across the membrane when the external environment is acidic. At acidic pH, the imidazolium rings undergo small amplitude reorientation and exchange protons with water molecules at a rate of 105 s−1 7,8. Cation π interaction between His37 and Trp41 was observed in resonance Raman spectra and suggested by molecular dynamics  simulations.
Drug addicted individuals often take drugs despite conscious, well intentioned plans to abstain. Abnormal  ACC activity has been documented on selective attention and inhibitory control tasks in users of various addictive substances . We recently showed that ACC deficits extend to emotionally salient tasks in addiction, with individuals with cocaine use disorder  showing hypoactivations in dorsal and rostral ACC  during a drug Stroop task.
Translocator protein   is highly expressed in the mitochondria of phagocytic inflammatory cells, including reactive astrocytes and activated microglia in brain . For example, the TSPO selective PET radioligand   PK 11195 has been used for more than two decades to identify areas of brain inflammation in several neurological diseases . More than 90% of PBR28 uptake in monkey brain is specific .
In the United States, PCa is the most common malignancy and second leading cause of cancer related deaths in men . Despite decades of research and treatment advances, androgen withdrawal is the only effective therapy for advanced PCa patients . PI3K is activated in response to diverse mitogenic signals and catalyzes the formation of second messenger lipid phosphatidylinositol 3, 4, 5 triphosphate .
Genome wide association studies  have detected associations between various loci and colon cancer. 8q24, 8q23, 11q23, 3q21, and SMAD7 on 18q21 have all been identified as potentially involved in colon cancer etiology . Of these loci on chromosomal regions of 8q21, biological rationale exists for an association between SMAD7 and colorectal cancer .
Somatic education has become commonplace in many academic dance curricula  and efforts to define the field of ‘somatics’ are ongoing . As more dance professionals embrace the use of somatic education to integrate health and wellness concepts into dance training, ‘these practices can refine bodily perceptions, which can contribute to improvement of technique, aid the development of expressive capacities and prevention of injuries’ . For example, one student in a Pilates Method course wrote:Dancing has always given me the same mind body connection that I have learned from Pilates, but I had never realized it before.
The metastatic potential of a tumor is presumably contained within cells that are able to escape and disseminate from the primary lesion. These predictive features are used to stratify patients into low and high risk groups. Among the latter studies,  found that 75% of pre surgery patients without clinical evidence of metastatic spread, and only 11% of normal controls, harbored disseminated epithelial cells in their bone marrow.
Natural Killer  cells are lymphocytes of the innate immune system that play an important role in the elimination of neoplastic or virus infected cells. NK cell cytotoxic activity is controlled in part by cell surface receptors for class I MHC that survey potential target cells for aberrant class I expression. Human NK cells use the killer cell immunoglobulin like receptor  family to interrogate class I status, whereas murine NK cells use members of the C type lectin related Ly49 family, .
Ataxin 1  is a member of a family of proteins that includes the transcriptional repressor HBP1, ATXN1, and ATXN1L. Each of these proteins is characterized by the presence of an ataxin 1/HBP1  domain . This 120 amino acid region forms an OB fold  and is implicated in protein protein interactions  as well as protein oligonucleotide binding .
Influenza A virus infections represent a serious challenge to human health and are increasingly recognized as an important agent in community acquired pneumonia . In addition to primary disease, influenza infection is known to predispose individuals, particularly persons with underlying medical conditions, to an increased incidence of secondary pneumonias, which in turn leads to more severe disease outcomes . A recent study of CAP hospitalizations during influenza season demonstrated that those patients with a history of prior influenza vaccination had a significantly reduced mortality compared to unvaccinated patients, which portrays the increasingly recognized role of influenza in CAP .
Our sensory environments are full of regularities distributed in space and time. However, such relationships are embedded within complex and continuous environments. In the auditory domain, one study has examined the neural basis of how statistical and prosodic cues are integrated during word segmentation , and another study has examined the time course of learning with ERPs and their relationship to familiarity .
Multiple myeloma  is a cancer of the plasma cells affecting primarily the elderly, with the highest incidence occurring at the sixth through the eighth decade of life . The overall annual incidence rate of MM in the U.S. from 1973 2005, age adjusted to the 2009 population, was 11.0 and 4.3 per 100,000 person years for blacks and whites, respectively . Autologous HSCT is still widely accepted as a treatment option for MM patients <65 years of age, yet it is now being challenged through historical control studies and RCTs comparing outcomes from HDT versus non intensive therapy using novel therapies such as thalidomide, bortezomib, lenalidomide and carfilzomib .
Since the systematic search for antibiotics began, thousands of natural products have been discovered that inhibit protein synthesis by binding to the ribosome. Additional ribosomal inhibitors have emerged from cancer chemotherapy screens. Many of them block the activity of the large ribosomal subunit by interfering with the binding of either aminoacyl tRNA or peptidyl tRNA to the peptidyl transferase center , where peptide bonds form .
A mechanistic link between the prolonged corrected QT interval  and increased risk of fatal arrhythmogenesis is well established by the detailed investigation of the relatively rare monogenic, long QT syndromes . However, QTc prolongation has also been associated with increased risk of SCD in a non long QT syndrome community based cohort of unrelated individuals . The potential of prolonged cardiac repolarization as a stratifier of risk among unrelated individuals in the general population merits further evaluation .
High resolution MRI datasets that require high signal to noise can be obtained from chemically fixed human autopsy tissues  to facilitate the interpretation of in vivo imaging studies and help validate MRI characterizations in animal models of disease . It is not possible to collect this data in vivo due to restrictions on the imaging time tolerated by patients, and due to current clinical magnet gradient and field strength limitations. Hence, most autopsy tissues begin immersion fixation in formalin solutions many hours after the patient's demise such that a PMI less than 4 hours is rare.
The entorhinal cortex  provides the majority of connections between the hippocampus and other cortical areas . Principal  neurons in the superficial layers  of the EC receive excitatory glutamatergic afferents from olfactory structures, parasubiculum, perirhinal cortex, claustrum, amygdale and neurons in the deep layers of the EC   as well as inhibitory GABAergic inputs from local interneurons . The output from the hippocampus is then projected to the deep layers of the EC that relay information back to the superficial layers  and to other cortical areas .
Trigeminal nerve mediated pain has a major impact on human health, and significantly debilitates the functioning of the afflicted . Conditions such as migraine headache, trigeminal neuralgia, non migraine headache and dental pain reduce well being and negatively affect productivity and the economy. Unfortunately, many pharmacological approaches to alleviate trigeminal pain are rife with harmful side effects and/or risks of addiction, necessitating a continued search for other methods of pain relief .
Heterosexual contact is the most common mode of HIV transmission among women in the United States. Sexual partnerships are the building blocks of networks through which HIV and other sexually transmitted infections  disseminate. The sequencing, interval between and duration of partnerships, and frequency of sexual interactions influence individual risk of infection and population transmission.
Tyrosine hydroxylase , the rate limiting enzyme for catecholamine neurotransmitter biosynthesis, is essential for proper neurological function. In mice, homozygous disruption of the TH gene is embryonic lethal due to altered cardiac and/or cardiovascular development . The majority of studies have concentrated on the role of the promoter region  in the human and rodent TH gene and identified several cis regulatory elements that modulate expression .
FAN1 possesses 5’ flap endonuclease and 5’ 3’ exonuclease activities and is involved in a DNA ICL damage repair pathway. FAN1 is thought to be recruited to ICLs via its interaction with the monoubiquitinated form of the FANCI FANCD2 complex, and, accordingly, disruption of the nuclease activity of FAN1 sensitizes cells to ICL inducing agents. In ICL repair, FAN1 is thought to co operate with other nucleases to introduce DNA incisions necessary for the efficient unhooking of the ICL.
Social insects owe their ecological and evolutionary success in part to an efficient division of labor, most notably between numerous non reproductive workers and one or a few reproductives in each colony. The highest levels of polyandry have been reported in honey bees, with some records exceeding 100 matings of individual queens  and the overall estimates for honey bee species vary between 11.6 and 54.9 . These species specific estimates often derive from limited sampling of one population.
Despite advances in screening and treatment, colorectal cancer  remains the second leading cause of cancer related deaths in the USA . Therefore new improved treatments are needed. We have previously described an HLA A1 restricted CTL  derived from the peripheral blood mononuclear cells  of a rectal carcinoma patient.
The bonding strength of the interfaces within the cemented arthroplasty system has been evaluated using conventional mechanical testing such as reported in . The most comprehensive study of bone cement interface to day was carried out by Mann and his associates , including modelling the tensile behaviour of the cement bone interface , mechanical strength of the bone cement interface under shear and tension , mixed mode  and creep fatigue loading conditions . There is a large variation in the results between specimens due to the difference in the amount of cement infiltration into bone and variations in the human cadaver bone tissues .
Despite the development of sophisticated in vitro assays for primitive hematopoietic stem cells , transplantation assays remain the gold standard for HSC enumeration. NOD/SCID mice have long been the standard for xenografting human HSCs, but the remaining natural killer  cell activity interfered with efficient human cell engraftment. To reduce residual NK cell activity in recipient xenograft mice, a new strain, NOD/SCID/β2mnull mouse, was established.
Cutaneous malignant melanoma  is an etiologically heterogeneous disease with genetic, host, environmental factors, and their interactions contributing to its development. Approximately 10% of CMM cases occur in a familial setting. Germline mutations of the CDKN2A gene have been described in approximately 20% of familial melanoma kindreds,.
The placenta is the primary fetal source of oxygen and nutrients. As such, it is a principal regulator of fetal growth and fetal health. Typical placentas will grow uniformly out from the umbilical cord insertion, resulting in a round to oval disk with a centrally inserted cord.
Several types of intermediate filaments  contribute to the development and maintenance of the neuronal cytoskeleton. These include nestin, internexin and the neurofilament proteins; neurofilament  heavy ,   medium  and   light . The function of peripherin, a type III IF, remains controversial .
Deafness is one of the most common human health problems, affecting one in 7001000 newborns . Deafness can be caused by gene alterations and environmental factors including ototoxic drugs such as aminoglycoside antibiotics. Mutations in mitochondrial DNA  are one of the important causes of sensorineural hearing loss in some countries .
Anterior cruciate ligament  injury is a devastating injury that occurs with high frequency during sport athletic participation. More than 200 000 ACL injuries are estimated to occur in the United States annually. Previously identified high risk populations include athletes participating in pivoting and cutting sports and female athletes.
Low muscle mass, an important initial indicator of malnutrition , has been reported with chronic infections, particularly tuberculosis and human immunodeficiency virus  , and can lead to adverse health outcomes and increased risk of death . However, it is unknown if chronic hepatitis C virus  infection is associated with low muscle mass, especially prior to the development of cirrhosis. Determination of the prevalence and risk factors for low muscle mass among chronic HCV infected patients is important because such results could help heighten awareness of the need to screen these patients for malnutrition and identify modifiable risk factors that should be addressed by clinicians.
The family Paramyxoviridae contains a number of important human pathogens. Nipah virus first emerged in Malaysia and Singapore during 1998/9, resulting in an epidemic of encephalitis with 105 deaths from 265 reported cases . The paramyxovirus family also contains animal pathogens, including parainfluenza virus 5 , which causes respiratory infection in canines and also infects humans asympotomatically  .
Obesity continues to be a pervasive problem among African Americans. Efforts are ongoing to reduce and prevent obesity and excess body weight among African Americans through community based initiatives and weight loss programs in primary care. Structural changes are also recommended, but these approaches take considerable effort, especially during economically challenging times when policy changes may be difficult to make if they involve re allocating limited financial resources or could generate new expenses.
The accelerated increase in obesity over the past two decades  has drawn attention to the effect of body weight not only on cardiovascular disease risk  and other health related outcomes specific to peripheral target organ systems but also on the brain . Volumetric differences in the gray matter of other brain areas have also been associated with indicators of body weight and fat among otherwise healthy individuals who are lean and obese . Changes in white matter brain tissue are also associated with weight gain .
Coronary revascularization is one of the most common adult cardiac surgical procedures, which can often require cardiopulmonary bypass . Coincident with the separation from CPB, is the release of bioactive molecules including endothelin  and cytokines . While mechanistic links remain to be established, ET release and cytokine activation have been associated with a protracted post operative course following CPB .
Infection with HIV continues to negatively impact the central nervous system despite effective combination antiretroviral therapy  that has improved survival rates . These findings support the theory of cognitive reserve, which refers to individual differences in the threshold of neurological insult that a person can withstand before manifestation of cognitive impairment . For example, studies have shown that for two individuals with the same neuropathological burden, the person with higher cognitive reserve  would express less neurocognitive impairment than the person with lower reserve .
Aicardi syndrome  is a severe sporadic neurodevelopmental disorder, originally characterized by a triad of agenesis of the corpus callosum, chorioretinal lacunae, and infantile spasms . More recent studies have identified a broader range of abnormalities with a wide variability in severity and often asymmetry . Ophthalmological abnormalities are also variable and include unilateral or bilateral chorioretinal lacunae, optic nerve dysplasia, and microphthalmia .
Schizophrenia is a neuropsychiatric disorder that affects 1% of the population. The disease is characterized by positive symptoms such as delusions and hallucinations, negative symptoms such as social withdrawal and affective flattening, and disorganization of speech and behavior. The etiology of schizophrenia appears to be due primarily to genetic factors, as evidenced by a sibling relative risk of approximately 10 and an estimated heritability of 81% .
Macrocycles such as cyclam derivatives show promise as stem cell mobilizers and antivirals, including activity against HIV and related AIDS disease. Maraviroc is an entry inhibitor that specifically targets the chemokine receptor, CCR5. Binding of the virus to CD4 occurs through attachment of the viral envelope glycoprotein gp120, and through this association the virus gains access to the coreceptor CXCR4, an important coreceptor for HIV 1.
Obesity is an emerging epidemic in the United States. Currently, over 35% of adults nationwide are considered obese , and the national prevalence of obesity has been climbing steadily since 1980. Due to the increasing prevalence of marked obesity, the World Health Organization and the National Institutes of Health have stratified obesity by BMI, and others have further differentiated class III obesity  to now specifically include extreme obesity  and super obesity.
“Sickness behavior” is widely recognized as an expression ofimmune system activation . This constellation of symptoms frequently occurs in the context ofcancer and its treatment, likely because of the immune system activation thataccompanies the disease. Major depressive disorder  is another condition thathas a high prevalence in patients with cancer.
Mass spectrometry has opened new vistas into the probing of biological problems. MALDI MS has certain advantages over other MS techniques. The initial success of these applications has promoted the development of MALDI imaging mass spectrometry  for visualizing endogenous and exogenous molecules in tissue sections that would otherwise require elaborate, time consuming, and costly  histochemistry and autoradiography techniques .
Women who experience intimate partner violence  are more likely to suffer from health problems than women without IPV . Each year, morbidity and mortality result from 5.3 million cases of intimate partner violence  in the US . While there is increased risk for IPV among women who are younger, are of low income, or those who experienced childhood trauma, all women carry some risk for IPV  .
The United States Department of Justice, Bureau of Justice Statistics reported that as of yearend 2011, there were over 2.2 million Americans incarcerated . In addition, high levels of other sexually transmitted diseases  are found within incarcerated populations compared to other US populations  . For example, analyses of data from a mandatory HIV testing program by the Georgia Department of Corrections, conducted from 1992 to 2005, found 88 documented cases of HIV transmitted while the tested individuals were incarcerated .
Oxygen undoubtedly belongs to the most important analytes on earth. Traditionally, most oxygen sensors were designed for the physiological range. For instance, it was demonstrated that bacteria can show respiration and potentially aerobic growth far below the Pasteur point .
The hematopoietic system is the most sensitive tissue in the body to the effects of ionizing radiation. In addition to its acute effects, the induction of oxidative stress and DNA damage in HSCs are thought to underlie the increased risks that irradiated individuals have for developing long term complications, including myelofibrosis, myelodysplasia and acute leukemia . Currently, hematopoietic failure following exposure to ionizing radiation is treated with the cytokine granulocyte colony stimulating factor  ; however, in the absence of endogenous hematopoietic recovery bone marrow transplantation is the only definitive cure.
Normal function of the retinal tissue depends in part on adequate supply of oxygen. Phosphorescence lifetime imaging technique has allowed mapping of retinal vascular pO2.,, With this technique, oxygen tension nonlinearly depends on the phosphorescence lifetime of an oxygen sensitive molecular probe. In this paper, we propose a solution by devising a regularized direct least squares  method in which we directly  regularize pO2 values obtained from LS estimates of the variables.
During the last decade, physical performance measures have gained increased acceptance in the evaluation of functional status of older persons. One of the most commonly used measures of physical performance is the Short Physical Performance Battery . This measure evaluates lower extremity function through tests of gait speed, standing balance, and time to rise from a chair five times.
Nasal chondromesenchymal hamartoma  was first described in 1998 as a rare nasal tumor that typically presents as a unilateral mass in children . A mixed mesenchymal pattern of chondroid and/or osseous islands of tissue with a variably cellular stroma characterized the morphologic features. The lesion may be expansile and locally destructive, with extension into the intracranial space .
Optimal function of the serotonin neural system is critical for numerous and wide ranging outcomes such as mood or affect , anxiety , cognition , metabolic syndrome , sleep , pituitary hormone secretion  and vulnerability to stress . These receptors decrease or increase serotonin neurotransmission, respectively . UCN1 binds to CRF R2, thereby promoting serotonin transmission  .
Encapsulation of pancreatic islets in semi permeable devices has been an attractive approach for islet transplantation to restore glycemic control in type I diabetic patients. However, poor graft survival has been a major limitation of islet encapsulation for use in clinical implantation. For example, many studies have shown that the purity and composition of alginate, a widely used natural polymer for islet encapsulation, substantially affect the survival of trapped islets .
Similar to light waves, ultrasound waves may be focused onto relatively small volumes, greatly increasing their intensity. Exposures such as these induce coagulative necrosis resulting in permanent cell death, and are presently being used to treat uterine fibroids and prostate cancer world wide . Clinical trials are underway to treat breast and kidney tumors , as well as liver  and testicular cancer .
Bisacodyl is a diphenyl methane laxative that has been used for the treatment of constipation since its introduction into the market in 1952 and, more recently, in facilitating bowel evacuation before investigational procedures  or surgery. The Physician’s Desk Reference indicates that, for constipation, bisacodyl is given in usual doses of 5 to 10 mg daily as enteric coated tablets administered at night or 10 mg as a suppository or enema administered in the morning. Absorption from the gastrointestinal tract is minimal with enteric coated tablets or suppositories; the small amount that is absorbed is excreted in the urine as the glucuronide.
Neuropathic pain is cited as one of the most debilitating consequences of spinal cord injury  . Opioids are highly effective at treating pain. Widerström Noga and Turk  found that approximately 11% of spinally injured patients using opiates reported feeling “pain free,” 22% were “considerably better, ” 48% were “slightly better, ” and 19% reported “no effect.
Mast cells play an important role in the innate and adaptive immune responses, secreting numerous preformed mediators and cytokines that can recruit as well as polarize other elements of the immune system. We still do not fully understand how the cytoskeleton is altered after crosslinking of FcεRI. It is believed that cortical actin can act as a barrier to vesicle fusion  .
A paramount question in neuroscience is to understand the cell cell interactions that control neuronal survival, development, and function. Progress in this field of research, however, has been limited by the inability to separate most individual neuronal populations from neighboring neuronal and glial cell types. Immunopanning is relatively inexpensive, gentle on cells and can produce very good yields .
Joint injury in young adults leads to increased risk for development of osteoarthritis  irrespective of surgical intervention to stabilize the joint. Joint injury initiates a cascade of responses which can result in cartilage degeneration, pain, and compromised joint function. In vitro models of mechanical injury to cartilage, alone, demonstrate damage to cartilage matrix resulting in increased water content, decreased stiffness, increased hydraulic permeability, sGAG loss to the culture medium, and damage to collagen.
The Electrocardiogram  is a clinical standard for monitoring patient cardiac activity. MHD distortions induce a voltage  overlaid onto ECGs obtained within the bore of the MRI. In  MRI, and in large diameter vessels where the direction of the blood flow and B0 is are approximately orthogonal, the large amplitude VMHD may obscure the ECG’s QRS complex  .
Although allogeneic hematopoietic progenitor cell transplant  is curative therapy for many disorders of lymphohematopoiesis, it is associated with significant morbidity and mortality. Refractory viral diseases in the immunocompromised host have been treated by infusion of virus specific lymphocytes. Donor lymphocyte infusion  therapy has been used after transplant for a variety of infections including persistent adenovirus, CMV, EBV LPD,,  and hepatitis.
Cancer is driven by the acquisition of somatic DNA lesions. Understanding of the progression of the lesions, distinguishing the early driver mutations from subsequent passenger mutations, deciphering the role of somatic mutations in regulating protein expression are all under active investigation. The availability of genomics technologies  have fueled recent studies on these topics,.
Striped patterns are known to produce visual discomfort and can even induce headaches or epileptic seizures in hypersensitive observers . The discomfort is strongest for the range of medium spatial frequencies  for which the visual system is generally most sensitive. Recently  showed that discomfort in more complex images could also be accounted for by the extent to which the images contained an excess of energy at medium spatial frequencies.
A diet rich in fruits and vegetables is associated with a decreased risk of some chronic diseases, such as certain types of cancers . These studies tailored messages to variables important in social cognition such as attitudes, self efficacy expectations, intentions, and stages of change. The social intelligence theory of personality may help to account for the inconsistencies in these findings .
It is highly controversial whether dietary fiber protects against colorectal cancer  because of conflicting results from human cohort based epidemiologic studies . These studies have been complicated by the participants’ genetic heterogeneity, differences in the composition of their gut microbiota, and the utilization of different fiber sources . It also has not been established how dietary fiber might protect against CRC, but two general mechanisms have been proposed that are not mutually exclusive.
The α6 integrin, a laminin receptor, is expressed on tumor cell surfaces and is associated with poor patient prognosis, reduced survival and increased metastasis in a variety of tumors . Integrins are type I transmembrane heterodimers composed of α and β subunits. The heterodimer confers ligand binding specificity to a particular extracellular matrix substrate .
Small molecule inhibitors targeted against “druggable” oncogenic mutations are remarkably effective in the treatment of metastatic cancer. Unfortunately, their efficacy is often limited by the emergence of resistance . The clinical significance of this heterogeneity has been demonstrated for colorectal and lung cancers where preexisting clones with mutations conferred drug resistance  .
In mice and humans there are 19 independent Wnt genes, encoding secreted glycoproteins that have diverse and critical roles during embryonic development, in adult tissue homoeostasis and in human diseases . Wnt ligands can be broadly divided into two classes: canonical Wnts such as Wnt1 and Wnt3a, and non canonical Wnts such as Wnt5a and Wnt11. Non canonical Wnts, on the other hand, share certain components with the canonical Wnt pathway such as Fz and Dsh/Dvl, but signal through multiple  catenin independent branches that include the Wnt/Ca2+ and the planar cell polarity  pathways  .
Galanin is expressed at high levels in most cells of the developing DRG in late gestation and starts to downregulate in the early postnatal period . Low levels of the peptide are detected in <5% of adult DRG neurons, which are predominantly small diameter C fiber nociceptors , with higher levels detected in the primary afferent terminals of the spinal cord . These studies have shown that the role played by galanin in pain signaling  is complex with facilitatory and inhibitory effects observed, sometimes in a modality specific manner .
Increasing evidence indicates that reactive oxygen species  play a critical role in ethanol induced liver injury . Ethanol induced oxidative damage causes lipid peroxidation resulting in the formation of a variety of reactive molecules, including malondialdehyde  and 4 hydroxynonenal  . In addition to the ROS dependent formation, γ ketoaldehydes can also be formed via the rearrangement of prostaglandin endoperoxides produced by the enzymatic activity of cyclooxygenases .
Bacillus anthracis lethal toxin  is composed of lethal factor  and protective antigen . PA binds to cell receptors and delivers LF into the cytosol . In the cytosol LF cleaves and inactivates members of the mitogen activated protein kinase kinase  family.
Exposure to endogenous and exogenous alkylating agents can trigger substantial cytotoxicity, mutagenicity and carcinogenicity via alkyl adducts at the guanine O6 position. Attack by this Cys145 then leads to the alkyl transfer reaction, which is facilitated by reduction of the negative charge on the repaired guanine via the donation of a hydrogen bond from the −OH of Tyr114 to N3 of the O6 methylguanine substrate . Since AGT is highly protective against the genotoxic effects of many alkylating agents , the observation by Abril and colleagues  that Escherichia coli cells overexpressing hAGT or Ogt, an E. coli homolog of AGT, exhibited enhanced cell killing and mutations when exposed to the bis electrophiles, 1,2 dibromoethane or dibromomethane, was unexpected.
Vaginal bleeding is common in early pregnancy, and has been associated with adverse outcomes. Most studies of vaginal bleeding rely on recalled data, which may be influenced by outcome and other pregnancy events. , No studies have evaluated the accuracy of vaginal bleeding reports in pregnancy .
According to the National Cancer Institute, approximately 10.5 million Americans with a history of cancer are alive . Numbers such as these demonstrate the enormity of this disease in terms of morbidity and mortality . Cancer affects all aspects of patients' lives.
The transplantation of non human organs to human recipients  is regarded as an alternative approach for bridging the gap between the increasing number of patients with end stage organ failure waiting for transplantation and the limited availability of grafts . Nevertheless, several complications of porcine organ transplantation have been described, principally the hyperacute rejection , which occurs shortly after xeno Tx and induces vigorous innate immune responses that can result in rapid graft loss. Xeno Tx of islets is associated with rapid innate immune reactions taking place intravascularly as a result of the exposure of porcine islets to human blood.
Nationally, homeless youths’ lives are becoming increasingly intertwined with problem substance use. A comprehensive body of literature details the high engagement of homeless youth in substance use, including a high prevalence of injection drug use  and alcohol abuse; oftentimes taking dominance over youths’ commitments and goals. Youths’ viewpoints about drugs, as well as their personal use habits, often are formed from familial drug history, along with the informal support system created with other homeless on the streets.
Obstructive sleep apnea  may arise from any combination of contributions from constricted airway anatomy, physiologic dysfunction of muscles that line the oropharynx, and altered pharyngeal wall compliance. Multiple imaging modalities have been used to study the airway and have supported anatomical differences between patients with and without OSA. The main observation has been that the oropharynx, and specifically the retropalatal region, is smaller in patients with OSA than in controls.
The circulation of autoantibodies against antigens expressed by tumors is a common occurrence in cancer patients. In prostate cancer, the GRP78 antigenic region corresponds to an epitope defined by the tertiary structure peptide CNVSKDSC which mimics a complementary tertiary structure site in GRP78 . In a recent study in patients with malignant melanoma, the expression of GRP78 in tumor tissue was found to correlate with poor overall patient survival, but the presence of GRP78 autoantibodies, their epitope specificity, or their mechanisms of action were not assessed  .
UHMWPE mediated osteolysis is a significant complication of total joint replacement, which contributes to decreased implant fixation and limits the long term survival of joint replacement components. , Particulate wear debris results from the motion between opposing implant bearing surfaces. In addition, implant exposure to oxygen rich biological fluid can cause in vivo degradation of the mechanical properties of UHMWPE components, which leads to an increase in the overall wear rate.
Prior to the advent of retrograde tracing, cells of origin for fiber tracts were discovered by cutting axons and looking for cells that displayed signs of retrograde degeneration, specifically chromatolysis . The cells of origin of the corticospinal tract  were first identified in this way , and since then, there has been continuing debate about whether corticospinal neurons die as a result of axotomy. Within the context of developing therapies to promote axon regeneration and recovery following spinal cord injury , this is a crucial question that needs a definitive answer.
Epithelial mesenchymal transition  is a critical process in malignant progression that confers to epithelial cancer cells the ability to breach basement membranes and metastasize to distant sites . At the molecular level, EMT is characterized by loss of the epithelial cell adhesion molecule E cadherin, which enables cells to increase motility and invasiveness through the disruption of intercellular contacts . From a mechanistic perspective, many signaling pathways, such as those mediated by TGF β , Ras , IGF IR , and GSK3β , have been linked to EMT induction under different cellular contexts through increased expression of Snail and/or other transcriptional repressors of E cadherin, including Zeb 1, Twist, and Slug.
The sleep waking cycle is a key factor influencing the expression of absence epilepsy . AE and other forms of idiopathic generalized epilepsy are associated with a number of abnormalities in sleep architecture including longer latencies to sleep and REM sleep onset, increased percentage of drowsiness and awakenings, reduced REM sleep percentage and decreased sleep efficiency . AE patients also have increased daytime somnolence .
Effective methods to regulate gene expression or protein function within mammalian hosts are essential for understanding basic biological mechanisms as well as directing gene based therapies. Generating knockouts of a specific gene and subsequent monitoring of that perturbation in vivo is a powerful technique for understanding ways in which proteins contribute to complex biological processes . Strategies to overcome this limitation have introduced elements of spatial and temporal control over gene expression .
In order to establish and maintain the dorso ventrally  or anterior posteriorly  restricted stripes of homeodomain gene expression in the developing embryo it is necessary to coordinate multiple signaling pathways and the assembly of transcription factors on the regulatory DNA of each gene  . Regulation of the DV restricted homeodomain proteins Ventral nervous system defective  and Intermediate neuroblasts defective  in the embryonic neurectoderm has been investigated extensively. For both of these genes, multiple enhancer elements have been identified that control different aspects of expression.
The species specific tropism of numerous retroviruses is determined by host cell proteins, termed restriction factors, which inhibit viral replication at numerous stages of the viral life cycle. In addition to these domains, TRIM5α also contains a C  terminal B30.2/PRYSPRY  domain, which has been shown to dictate the species specific antiviral activity of TRIM5α proteins . The resulting TRIM Cyp protein also exhibits antiviral activity against various retroviruses .
The ATP binding cassette  transporter superfamily members: i) P glycoprotein , ii) multidrug resistance associated protein 1 , and iii) breast cancer resistance protein  are integral plasma membrane efflux pumps . They transport a vast array of lipophilic, amphipathic  substrates against their concentration gradients by hydrolyisis of adenosine triphosphate, limiting substrate cellular influx and retention, thereby conferring a multidrug resistance phenotype . Notably, these transporters share common protein motifs and a degree of substrate overlap .
An important hallmark of Alzheimer's disease  is the accumulation of insoluble hyperphosphorylated and fibrillized tau in neurofibrillary tangles  . Since there is a clear correlation between NFT density and cognitive decline, misfolded and aggregated tau is likely a key pathological agent in AD . The hypothesis that tau plays a critical role in AD pathogenesis was further strengthened by the discovery that inherited forms of frontotemporal dementia with Parkinsonism linked to chromosome 17  resulted from mutations within the tau gene .
Synthetic peptides derived from the HIV 1 inner envelope glycoprotein gp41 represent a new class of HIV 1 entry inhibitors that exert their antiviral activity by blocking viral membrane fusion. However, there are in general several limitations for polypeptides as drug candidates, including poor oral bioavailability and short serum's half life because of their susceptibility to protease digestion. It is well known that glycosylation can significantly influence a peptide's pharmacokinetic properties such as its protease susceptibility .
Adeno associated viral  vectormediated gene transfer has shown potential as a therapeutic platform for inherited and metabolic diseases . Moreover, cross reactivity of anti AAV antibodies results in neutralization of a wide range of AAV serotypes , eliminating the obvious solution of switching AAV serotype . Thus far, two clinical studies in which an AAV vector was delivered through the systemic circulation have been conducted; both studies targeted the liver to express coagulation factor IX  to treat hemophilia B.  AAV vectors were prepared as previously described .
Chlamydia trachomatis, a Gram negative obligate intracellular bacterium, is the leading cause of bacterial sexually transmitted disease  worldwide . Genital chlamydial infections are observed predominantly in young adults . Untreated infections ascend to the upper genital tract  and cause severe sequelae including pelvic inflammatory disease, ectopic pregnancy, and infertility .
Apolipoprotein B  is the essential protein responsible for the formation of chylomicrons from the small intestine and very low density lipoproteins  from the liver. The translation of apoB begins with a 24 or 27 amino acid signal peptide that targets the synthesis of apoB to the rough endoplasmic reticulum  of hepatocytes and enterocytes, thus committing the protein to a secretory pathway  . So far two factors have been found specifically associated with the efficiency of the assembly and secretion of apoB containing lipoproteins  the availability of lipids and microsomal triglyceride transfer protein .
In patients undergoing liver resection, the optimal future liver remnant  volume required for safe recovery is uncertain. Portal vein embolization  has become an important means to increase the FLR volume prior to major hepatectomy and thereby reduce postoperative liver failure. Continued growth has been observed for up to 1 year.
Corynebacterineae is a suprageneric actinomycetes group that includes the causative agents of the human diseases tuberculosis, leprosy and diphtheriae, by Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Mycobacterium leprae, and Corynebacterium diphtheriae, respectively. This complex is often referred as mycolyl arabinogalactan peptidoglycan  complex  . Structural motifs of the AG polymer were first established for M. tuberculosis .
Increasing evidence suggests that neurotrophic factors may be an ideal therapeutic target for the treatment of both neurodegenerative diseases and psychiatric diseases. Currently, only symptomatic treatment  for PD patients is available. For example, antidepressants have been associated with hippocampal neurogenesis in rodents , which was suggested to be facilitated by a number of trophic/growth factors, including brain derived neurotrophic factor  and GDNF .
Polychlorinated biphenyls  are a group of 209 chemically related compounds, which differ in both number and position of the chlorines on the biphenyl moiety  . PCBs were discovered over 100 years ago and first commercially manufactured in 1930s. Because of their remarkable electrical insulating properties and their flame resistance, PCBs were widely used in many industrial applications such as in dielectric fluids, in transformers and capacitors, hydraulic fluids, and as sealants.
The ubiquitin fold modifier 1  is a crucial post translational modifier that belongs to the ubiquitin like protein  family. The Ufm1 cascade  has been implicated in endoplasmic reticulum  homeostasis  and cell cycle control . Recently, we reported that the Ufmylation pathway is down regulated both in the livers of DDC re fed mice and in the livers of human alcoholic hepatitis , non alcoholic steatohepatitis  with Mallory Denk Bodies  present, and cirrhosis, where protein quality control was down regulated .
Arthritis and rheumatic conditions are the leading cause of disability in the United States, affecting approximately 46 million adults, with estimated total medical costs of &dollar;128 billion annually. Osteoarthritis , the most common arthritic condition, is characterized as “a range of disorders that result in structural and functional failure of synovial joints when the dynamic equilibrium between the breakdown and repair of joint tissues is overwhelmed.” The prevalence of OA has been estimated to be 12% in people 25 and older and increases to almost 68% in people aged 65 and older. Strong OA risk factors identified by epidemiological studies include age and high body mass index .
Acute Lymphoblastic Leukemia  is the most common malignancy of childhood and adolescence, with this age group comprising approximately two thirds of the 4000 total cases diagnosed annually in the United States. Over the past few decades there have been significant improvements in ALL treatment outcomes, resulting in five year event free survival rates of nearly 90%. Recent research has begun to examine more specific and functional cognitive processes.
The transforming growth factor beta  family of cytokines, including TGF β s and bone morphogenetic proteins , exerts diverse functions in many types of cells and tissues. Cells perceive TGF β signals through cell surface proteins termed type I and type II TGF β receptors , both being serine/threonine kinases. In the canonical TGF β pathway, TβRI in turn directly phosphorylates and activates downstream transcription factors called receptor regulated Smad proteins .
DNA methylation is an epigenetic mark that is critical in determining chromatin accessibility and regulating gene expression. DNA methylation, which refers to the addition of a methyl group to the fifth carbon in cytosine residues within CG dinucleotides, is involved in cell differentiation, imprinting, X chromosome inactivation, and suppression of transcriptional noise and ‘parasitic’ DNA. Abnormalities in the DNA methylation pathway are associated with pathological consequences.
Nocturia is defined by the International Continence Society  as waking at least once nightly to void, with each void preceded and followed by sleep. Its prevalence increases significantly with age, and is approximately 70% among individuals > 60 years of age. Nocturia and insomnia are inextricably linked, and it is often difficult to determine the direction of this relationship.
Travelers' diarrhea  affects 2050% of persons from developed nations who visit developing countries. Common causal organisms of parasitic diarrhea in travelers are Cryptosporidium spp., Several studies have documented a high sensitivity for DNA PCR based methods in detecting Cryptosporidium in fecal samples. Although technically more demanding, the nested PCR based on the 18S rRNA gene followed by direct sequencing offers the added advantage of characterizing the infecting organism at the species level.
Out of Hospital Cardiac Arrest is a leading cause of mortality in the United States. Patients who are treated with cardiopulmonary resuscitation  for cardiac arrest may achieve return of spontaneous circulation , which is characterized by the return of pulses after CPR and/or electrical defibrillation. However, patients may often lose pulses after ROSC, a clinically significant event termed rearrest .
Steroid receptor coactivator 3  is a member of the p160 SRC family. SRC 3 has histone acetyltransferase activity and interacts with multiple nuclear receptors and transcription factors, to regulate the expression of their target genes, including estrogen receptor , progesterone receptor , E2F1, nuclear factor kB  and activator protein 1  . SRC 3 also plays a role in EGFR signaling  .
Japanese quail is widely being used as a model  in research in a variety ofdisciplines including physiology, nutrition, endocrinology, pathology, embryology,reproduction and immunology. Physiological and anatomical parameters serve asvaluable tools for predicting outcomes consequences . Growth rate, a key morphologicalcharacteristic, has been positively correlated with robustness, physiology andbehavior of birds .
Despite a better understanding of cancer genes , the survival rates of many human tumors have only marginally improved over several decades. This likely reflects the extraordinary molecular and genetic heterogeneity of the transformed cell , which, combined with the multilayer redundancy of cancer signaling pathways , promotes cellular adaptation and multidrug resistance . These challenges are exemplified by glioblastomas, a group of heterogeneous and highly malignant primary brain tumors with survival rates that rarely exceed 12 to 15 months after diagnosis .
Kaposi sarcoma associated herpesvirus  ORF57, a homologue of HSV 1 ICP27, EBV EB2, and HCMV UL69, is a viral early protein which plays important roles at the posttranscriptional level for virus gene expression . When the KSHV genome contains a disrupted ORF57, it results in both inefficient expression of a subset of viral lytic genes and poor production of infectious virions . It is also known to form specific associations with RNA, which is facilitated by cellular proteins .
Perfluorooctanoic acid  and other perfluorochemicals  have recently been associated with adverse health effects, including carcinogenicity , hepatotoxicity , and developmental and reproductive toxicity . PFCs repel grease/oil and are used to treat clothing and carpet to prevent staining, and in the manufacturing of certain food containers and wrappers. Of note, data from the National Health and Nutrition Examination Survey  cross sectional biomonitoring study indicated that >95% of participants had detectable serum concentrations for several PFCs  suggesting widespread human exposure .
More than half of all persons with cancer diagnoses are over the age of 65, with the incidence increasing with age. Of great concern in addressing the care of older persons with cancer are the symptoms that contribute to suffering and distress, with pain being the most common, feared, and pervasive problem. One of the goals of hospice care is a pain free death.
The fabrication of artificial organs and engineered living tissues is dependent on the ability to generate and assemble novel materials into appropriate 2 D or 3 D structures and to precisely tailor material related properties to achieve a desired clinical response. To that end, the development of artificial extracellular matrices is integral to fashioning microenvironments that are engineered for optimal mechanical and biological performance. In the late 1990s, our group was the first to demonstrate that electrospinning could be used to fabricate native and recombinant elastin mimetic proteins and native collagen into non woven fiber networks comprised of nanometer scale fibers that more closely mimic native scaffolds .
Cells in early apoptosis are normally not immunogenic, are rapidly cleared from circulation  and do not induce autoantibody production . Mice genetically defective in apoptotic cell clearance develop lupus like autoimmunity  and cells undergoing necrosis can induce production of IgG anti dsDNA antibodies in both lupus prone and normal strains of mice  . Toll like receptors  are innate immune sensors that recognize pathogen associated molecular patterns and promote immune responses .
Bile salts, multifunctional, amphipathic end products of cholesterol metabolism, vary considerably in structure between species . Most bile salts may be subdivided into three major classes    C27 bile alcohols, C27 bile acids, and C24 bile acids    based on the length of the alkyl side chain and whether the terminal polar group is a primary alcohol or a carboxylic acid . In a recent review compiled by , available information on biliary bile salt structures from about 700 vertebrate species fish, reptiles , birds, and mammals was tabulated.
Extensive coverage of human genetic variation is now readily available . The existence of publicly available sequencing data from the NIEHS SNPs Program , SeattleSNPs , HapMap ENCODE  and dense HapMap data  have provided investigators with the means to more rigorously select variants for subsequent association study. The utility of currently available genetic data resources is immense, and many successful findings have resulted .
The American Cancer Society estimates that 178,480 women were diagnosed with breast cancer in the U.S. in 2007 . Twenty to thirty percent of breast cancers exhibit amplification or overexpression of the HER2/erbB2 oncogene, which is associated with more aggressive disease and poor prognosis . Trastuzumab  is an FDA approved, recombinant, humanized monoclonal antibody that selectively binds to the extracellular domain of HER2 .
Prion diseases are fatal neurodegenerative disorders of mammals caused by the conformational conversion of the cellular, GPI linked prion protein, PrPC, into a β sheet rich, aggregated isoform known as PrPSc . This disproportionately low incidence of infection was very fortunate, yet it was unexpected by most scientists, and has led to speculation of specific risk factors associated with the vCJD infected individuals . Among such risk factors there may be genetically determined, host encoded modifiers.
Tissue factor pathway inhibitor  is a potent inhibitor of coagulation. When tissue factor  is exposed with damage to the vessel wall, it initiates coagulation via factor VII. TFPI reversibly binds and inactivates factor Xa and the TFPI Xa complex inhibits factor VIIa TF complexes.
Insulin action is essential for growth, development, and metabolism. The tyrosine phosphorylated IRS1 functions as an adaptor to activate downstream phosphoinositide 3 kinase /AKT signaling, which leads to enhancement of glucose uptake, synthesis of protein and glycogen, and execution of the growth promoting and metabolic effects of insulin. Although serine phosphorylation of IRS1 induced by insulin can function as a feedback control, other factors, such as proinflammatory cytokines, also increase phosphorylation of IRS1 and function as negative regulators.
Genetic variability in the envelope glycoproteins of HIV 1 is one of the most important obstacles to overcome in the development of an effective vaccine. These glycoproteins form a trimolecular complex of three surface gp120 molecules bound non covalently to three transmembrane gp41 molecules on the virus surface, where the trimer spike mediates cell attachment and subsequent membrane fusion events that allow the virus to enter cells . Neutralizing Abs block virus entry by binding and disabling the trimeric Env spike .
Spatial compounding techniques are widely used in ultrasound to suppress speckle noise and improve image quality . Similarly, shear compounding coherently compounds the shear elasticity maps from shear wave fields that are illuminated by shear waves with different incident angles . Shear compounding also improves the contrast of shear elasticity maps for inclusions with complex geometries and various inhomogeneities, because differently angled shear waves can illuminate and produce good elasticity maps of different parts of the inclusion, which can then be compounded to obtain a robust elasticity map of the whole inclusion .
The development of protective T cell based antitumor immunity is critically dependent upon the normal function of DCs. However, clinical results to date have yielded minimal success , and the reasons for this remain unclear . Many tumors, including human breast cancers, contain appreciable numbers of tumor infiltrating DCs   but the stimulatory capacity of these DCs is often compromised .
Reading is a learned ability specific to humans. Functional imaging studies have identified left hemisphere frontal, temporal and parietal regions that are activated during reading tasks , and cross sectional studies have reported variations in brain structure in similar areas in children as a function of reading skills . Brain maturation involves dynamic changes in gray and white matter .
Magnetic resonance spectroscopy  is increasingly used for the noninvasive assessment of cellular metabolism, both in vitro  and in vivo . Proton  MRS can measure the total choline  peak consisting of PC, GPC, free choline, and corresponding ethanolamine metabolites . In the field of cancer, MRS has emerged as a promising tool for characterizing disease and assessing response to therapy .
The receptor tyrosine kinase HER2 is amplified and/or overexpressed in 2030% of all breast cancers , leading to constitutive proliferative and survival signaling via the downstream Ras/Erk and PI3K/Akt pathways. Amplification or overexpression of HER2 is associated with poor prognosis, and perturbation of HER2 signaling with trastuzumab or lapatinib has led to clinical benefit in HER2 positive breast cancer patients . However, many patients with early stage disease experience tumor recurrence despite adjuvant treatment with trastuzumab, and patients with metastatic disease inevitably develop resistance to anti HER2 therapies .
Intracellular lipid containing structures are found in many cell types in nature. These subcellular organelles are found in the cell cytoplasm of most eukaryotic organisms, within eukaryotic plastids, and in some bacteria . The current model of eukaryotic cytosolic LD biogenesis is that they bud or “blister” off of the outer leaf of the endoplasmic reticulum  due to accumulation of neutral lipids between the leaflets of the phospholipid bilayer .
Engineered biomaterials have been developed for degradable hydrogels and advanced drug delivery, but to fully assess their effectiveness, there is a need to track their fate in vivo, noninvasively. The efficiency of a MRI CA at relaxing surrounding protons is given by its relaxivity, which describes the change in relaxation rate in the surrounding protons per unit of agent concentration. The presence of multiple Gd ions per molecule increases the local Gd concentration.
Parkinson’s disease  is a chronic neurologic disorder with cardinal motor signs of muscle rigidity, tremor, slowness of movement , and/or paucity of movement . In animal models of parkinsonism , and in idiopathic PD , GPi neurons exhibit a constellation of abnormalities in spiking activity including elevated firing rates and altered firing patterns . The mechanistic underpinnings of elevated bursting activity and its true clinical significance remain unclear, however.
Behavioral theory posits that environmental context is an important determinant of risk for substance use disorders. That is, the probability of drug use is predicted to increase as a function of decreased access to non drug related sources of reinforcement or increased availability of drugs  . Laboratory studies with nonhumans and humans show drug self administration varies inversely with availability of alternative, non drug reinforcers .
Cancer testis  antigens are a category of tumor antigens with restricted expression in normal testis and active expression in various types of tumors due to disruption of gene regulation . Currently, approximately 20 CT antigens or antigen families have been identified by T cell epitope cloning, serological expression cloning, and differential mRNA expression analysis . Mage3 has been characterized as a more frequently expressed CT antigen in many tumors, including melanoma, non small cell lung carcinoma, head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, and hepatocellular carcinoma .
Methadone maintenance is one of the most widespread treatments for opioiddependence. However, conclusions based on observational group comparisonstudies can be limited due to lack of experimental control, individual differencesin patient populations, and selection biases for groups. An experimental design inwhich cognitive performance is assessed as a function of time relative to methadonedosing would be helpful in determining the effect of methadone itself oncognition .
The latest view of philosophers is that color is an objective material property  not a subjective experience. However, those who study visual perception know that surrounding colors have a great influence on color perception . Opponent color signals travel from retina to V1 through the parvocellular neurons of the lateral geniculate nucleus .
Infants in the neonatal intensive care unit  are exposed to a large number of medications, most of which are not labeled for use in infants because clinical trials for safety, dosing, and efficacy of drugs are lacking in this population. Hospitalized infants are often excluded from clinical trials due to ethical concerns and difficulties with recruitment. Furthermore, these hospitalized infants in the NICU are more likely to be pre term, with greater proportions exhibiting renal and hepatic dysfunction.
Since the introduction of cytological screening in the 1940s, the incidence of cervical carcinoma has declined in many developed countries . Nevertheless, prospective studies of cervical neoplasia suggest that HPV infection alone is not responsible for tumor development and additional genetic or epigenetic changes in tumor cells are required for tumorigenesis  . The fragile histidine triad  gene is a candidate tumor suppressor gene located at chromosome 3p14.2 and encompassing the FRA3B common fragile site .
Theoretical advances in cognitive science have recently been applied to intervention research  and translated into curricula designed to promote metacognition and use of analytic strategies in adolescents’ general decision making . Proponents of fuzzy trace theory  and dual process models  generally support this view . Improving problem recognition not only has implications for increasing internal motivation, but motivation to change is a consistent predictor of engagement in therapeutic activities .
The inbred DBA/2J  mouse strain is a well established model of spontaneously elevated intraocular pressure , progressive glaucomatous loss of retinal ganglion cells , and early damage of RGC axons at the level of optic nerve head, which represent the hallmarks of glaucoma . Photoreceptors, horizontal, and bipolar cells remain histologically intact . D2 mice develop iris atrophy and pigment dispersion due to mutations of two genes, Gpnmb and Tyrp1.
2,3,7,8 Tetracholordibenzo p dioxin  is a potent and persistent environmental toxicant, which produces a variety of biological effects in animal and cellular models . Of these effects, immune suppression including inhibition of B lymphocyte differentiation into antibody secreting cells is one of the most sensitive consequences of TCDD exposure . The CH12.LX B cell line has provided a useful model in studying the effects of TCDD on Ig expression in B cells and has lead to the identification of a novel transcriptional target of TCDD: the Ig heavy chain  locus .
The ε4 allele of the apolipoprotein E gene  is the strongest known genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer's disease  . Other genetic factors, such as APOE promoter polymorphisms have been reported to be associated with AD, including −491, −427, −219 , and +113 . In addition to the APOE core promoter, other cis regulatory elements of APOE have been characterized, which include multienhancer 1 and 2 , that influence APOE regulation in macrophages and adipocytes , hepatic control regions, HCR1 and HCR2, that play a role in APOE regulation in the liver , and a brain control region  that can modulate APOE expression in neurons and microglial  .
Although prostate cancer is the most frequent malignancy detected in men in Western Countries, there is a general lack of information regarding the molecular mechanisms involved in the progression of this cancer. To identify the cellular processes and proteins that are involved in the development of prostate cancers, tissue expression microarrays have been used to monitor the changes in gene expression during malignant transformation. Furthermore the highest level of myosin VI expression was detected in medium grade androgen dependent prostate cancers, whereas androgen independent more advanced and aggressive cancers show less dramatic over expression .
Several methods have been established that enable the production of transgenic livestock including pronuclear injection, intracytoplasmic sperm injection , sperm mediated gene transfer and somatic cell nuclear transfer . These methodologies, each having advantages, have all been utilized to create transgenic large animals. In recent years, SCNT has primarily been used due to several advantages such as the lack of mosaic transgene integration  and SCNT is the only method to knock out  a gene in domestic animals   The efficiency of SCNT to create transgenic clones relies heavily on the ability to make genetic modifications to the somatic cell genome prior to nuclear transfer.
Schizophrenia is a debilitating psychiatric disorder that typically strikes in early adulthood, likely due to a disturbance of synaptic maturation or stabilization processes that normally occur in dendritic spines during adolescence . Indeed, postmortem examinations from the brains of schizophrenia patients reveal a reduction in cortical thickness that results from a loss of dendrites and dendritic spines . Thus, a comprehensive understanding of the cellular and molecular mechanisms that control synapse development and dendritic spine stability should lead to better strategies to treat and prevent schizophrenia .
Many everyday objects involve distinctive manipulations with certain motor movements appropriate to their intended usage. A doorknob, for instance, is typically associated with grabbing and turning motions. In an eye tracking study, participants looked at the manipulation related picture  significantly more often than the unrelated ones  or the visual control  when asked to touch the corresponding object on a display in response to an auditory input .
Several chronic inflammatory diseases affecting the gastro intestinal tract, as well as a variety of other organ systems, are associated with alterations in gut microbiota composition, suggesting involvement of the microbiota in these disorders . Such studies indicate that innate immunity maintainins a healthy gut microbiota composition, thus avoiding development of chronic inflammation. For example, loss of the flagellin receptor toll like receptor 5  results in increased levels of flagellated microbes that promotes low grade inflammation, metabolic syndrome and colitis .
Hypertension affects 30% of adults in Western populations and predisposes to myocardial infarction, stroke, heart failure and renal failure., Despite the prevalence of this disease, the etiology of hypertension in most adults is unknown and perturbations of the central nervous system, the kidney and the vasculature have been implicated. Adoptive transfer of T cells restores hypertension in these animals. have shown that T cells play a role in hypertension in Dahl salt sensitive rats.
An increased demand for recombinant proteins in research and biopharmaceutical applications has led to increased production of these biomolecules, which in turn requires fast, effective purification processes. Moreover, scale up of membrane separations can occur relatively easily by increasing membrane surface area, and the large pores and small thicknesses of membranes result in a low pressure drop. , Bhut and Husson modified regenerated cellulose membranes with poly brushes to form anion exchange membranes with a remarkable dynamic binding capacity of 130 mg of BSA per cm3 of membrane.
Currently in the US, up to 60% of all pregnancies occur in women who are either overweight or obese at conception . This poses a significant public health concern as maternal obesity adversely affects the immediate health of both the mother and offspring . Further support for developmental programming imprinted by maternal obesity comes from observations that children born to women following weight loss after bariatric surgery have diminished risk of obesity compared to children born to the same women prior to the surgery when they were obese .
Type 2  diabetes mellitus  is an emerging epidemic in Western cultures that is thought to afflict 150 million people worldwide . Insulin resistance is frequently accompanied by a variety of metabolic and cardiovascular abnormalities that include hypertension, glucose intolerance, Type 2 diabetes, dyslipidemia, atherosclerosis and central obesity. A number of studies that employ strength training regimens have been shown to improve glycemic control, increase skeletal muscle size and strength, and positively change body composition.
The impact of a postoperative troponin elevation on long term survival after vascular surgery is not well defined. We hypothesize that a postoperative troponin elevation is associated with significantly reduced long term survival . The Vascular Study Group of New England registry identified all patients who underwent carotid revascularization, open abdominal aortic aneurysm repair , endovascular AAA repair, or infrainguinal lower extremity bypass .
Excessive renal sympathetic nerve activity  has been proposed to be a final common pathway for the genesis of hypertension, the largest global contributor to premature death. The sympathetic nervous system appears to be especially important in individuals with an exaggerated response to dietary NaCl , whether this results from genetic or acquired factors., Norepinephrine infusion in animals reduces urinary sodium excretion and increases blood pressure, but these effects may not reflect direct stimulation of salt reabsorption by renal tubules. Additional effects of the sympathetic nervous system on the renal vasculature may also contribute, by altering renal hemodynamics.
The Monopolar spindle one binder  family of zinc binding proteins is conserved from yeast to humans . The founding Mob members, S. cerevisiae Mob1p and Mob2p, activate Dbf 2 kinases and facilitate exit from mitosis . Mob isoforms have also been localized to neuronal dendrites in mammals, where NDR  kinases regulate dendritic branching .
Leukocyte telomere length has been inversely associated with multiple diseases including osteoporosis, hypertension, myocardial infarction , coronary heart disease , type 2 diabetes , and Alzheimer’s disease. Growing evidence suggests that telomere length plays a critical role in cellular aging, . As loss of telomeric DNA is impacted by cell division and oxidative stress, and induces cellular senescence, telomere length has been postulated as a biomarker of senescence and human aging in many published studies, .
Subject specific musculoskeletal models are essential to biomedical research and clinical applications, such as customized joint replacement , computer aided surgery , gait analysis  and automated image segmentation . For example, reliability and wear of implants are dependent upon the stress distribution in the bone , which is primarily determined by implant properties . In gait analysis, a realistic geometrical model is the first step towards creating an accurate musculoskeletal model  .
Recombinant adeno associated virus  is a nonpathogenic parvovirus that has shown great promise for efficient gene delivery to both dividing and nondividing cells of many tissues. With new rAAV serotypes continuing to be identified, the ability to target specific cell types within a given organ is also expanding. It is generally accepted that rAAV genomes integrate at a low frequency and that the majority of genomes remain episomal, as either linear or circular concatamers.
Warfarin  is an anticoagulant with a narrow therapeutic window and wide inter individual response. Several pharmacogenetic algorithms incorporate SNPs in both genes , but these SNPs alone explain only one third of the variability in warfarin dose . Incorporating other SNPs may further improve the accuracy of warfarin dosing  .
The complement system is an essential element of the innate immune system . C4 has two isotypic forms, C4A and C4B, encoded by loci in the MHC class III region on chromosome 6. A C4 gene duplication is always concurrent with its neighboring genes RP at the 5' region and CYP21 and TNX at the 3' region .
Physiological signals are transduced from the outside of a cell to the cytoplasm through transmembrane receptors. Mutations in these receptor proteins, such as G protein coupled receptors , can lead to many diseases and many receptors drug targets,. This provided support for the study of isolated fragments.
Fibrosis is a common feature of many systemic inflammatory conditions and can also occur as a primary progressive disease. Fibrosis can lead to organ dysfunction and significant morbidity. Unfortunately, despite intense investigation, we still have a poor understanding of the pathogenesis of tissue fibrosis and fibrotic diseases are difficult to treat.
Chronic changes in electrical excitability profoundly affect synaptic transmission during development and throughout life. Neurons adapt to changing electrical activity patterns in a plastic manner by up  or down regulating subsequent synaptic signaling. This activity dependent plasticity takes on many forms, from Hebbian feed forward strengthening of synapses to homeostatic depression of global synaptic activity.
The nucleus accumbens , a key brain reward region, is important for integrating sensory and cognitive inputs that drive motivationally relevant behaviors in response to environmental stimuli . The NAc also has been implicated in behavioral abnormalities associated with drug addiction and depression. Accordingly, targeting the NAc with deep brain stimulation  has been shown to alleviate depression  and addiction like behaviors in both humans and rodents  .
Axotomy is a principal pathology generated by traumatic brain injury , resulting in synaptic deafferentation , and inducing synapse reorganization at sites of terminal loss . Surrounding ECM forms the environment where immune molecules operate, and stabilizes synaptic structure . Among immune mediators of synaptogenic onset, both chemokines and cytokines are critical .
Stroke is the fourth leading cause of death and the leading cause of serious long term disability in adults in the United States . Intravenous thrombolysis therapy with tissue plasminogen activator , the only FDA approved treatment for ischemic strokes, is severely limited by its short therapeutic time window of less than 4.5 h . Vascular remodeling triggered by reduction of blood flow is a major endogenous defense mechanism in the brain following stroke.
Mitochondrial permeabilization and cyt c release are key events that trigger caspase activation and apoptosis in mammalian cells . Strictly regulating apoptosis after the point of cyt c release is particularly important for neurons so that they can recover from any mitochondrial damage and survive long term . Neurons have been shown to strictly inhibit caspases by the X linked Inhibitor of Apoptosis Protein  and by the maintenance of a highly reduced cellular environment that prevents cyt c oxidation and restricts its pro apoptotic activity .
Semaphorins are a large class of secreted or membrane associated proteins that act as chemotactic cues for cell migration and axon guidance . Although best characterized in the nervous system , they are widely expressed in other tissues where they have a role in angiogenesis, organogenesis, and immune cell regulation . There is a growing body of evidence suggesting that semaphorins and their receptors may play a regulatory role in carcinogenesis  .
Candida species are a leading cause of infectious disease related morbidity and mortality in the Neonatal Intensive Care Unit. , The incidence of candidemia in extremely low birth weight neonates  is 7% and the incidence is 12% in neonates < 750 g birth weight. Candidemia has an attributable mortality of 2030% and frequently results in severe morbidity, including neurodevelopmental impairment, among survivors .
Native collaterals are pre existing arteriole to arteriole anastomoses that bridge adjacent arterial trees in healthy tissues. Evidence suggests that conductance of the collateral circulation also differs greatly in healthy humans. Surprisingly, no studies have examined when  these unique vessels form.
Geobacter sulfurreducens biofilms are a well studied electro chemically active biofilm system that utilizes conductive elements to respire on electrodes . One of the more recent tools used to analyze the conductivity or electron transfer capability of G.sulfurreducens biofilms is electrochemical impedance spectroscopy . EIS measures the impedance response of the biofilm to small AC perturbations in polarization potential.
Within the antioxidant system, manganese superoxide dismutase  is found in the mitochondrial matrix, from which approximately 75% of cellular superoxide  is generated. Cancer cells almost always express low levels of MnSOD and if the activity of MnSOD is increased, the phenotype of cancer cells should be at least partially reversed as hypothesized by Oberley and Buettner . H2O2 may be the effector species involved in the tumor suppressive effect of MnSOD due to the fact that addition of pyruvate, a scavenger of H2O2, can enhance the proliferation of MnSOD overexpressing cells .
The use of microfluidic platforms for screening and assays has become an important part of the analytical toolbox  . In recent years, droplet based systems are showing increasing utility as they allow for sample aliquoting on chip and for carrying out many simultaneous experiments on the samples with no inter sample mixing  . At present, techniques for encapsulation of species within aqueous droplets have matured  .
Mature human immunodeficiency virus type 1  protease  is an aspartic protease that is responsible for processing the Gag and Gag Pol polyproteins to yield mature proteins required for viral maturation.
