Mutational and structural studies of essential conserved residues have contributed, directly or indirectly, to the structure based design of HIV 1 PR inhibitors. Therefore, inhibitors designed to interact with such essential residues are expected to be more effective under drug pressure.
The congenital long QT syndrome  is an inherited channelopathy that is characterized by a prolonged corrected QT interval  and an increased predisposition for polymorphic ventricular arrhythmias and sudden cardiac death  in young individuals without structural heart disease. Genetic mutations leading to LQTS have been identified in 12 susceptibility genes, with the LQT1 3 genotypes comprising more than 95% of genotype positive LQTS. Prior studies have shown that prolongation of the corrected QT interval  is a major risk factor for arrhythmic events in LQTS patients.
KRAS is a small G protein that acts as a transducer in the epidermal growth factor receptor  signaling pathway . Approximately 40% of colorectal cancers  harbor activating mutations in KRAS, making it the most commonly mutated gene in the RAS/RAF/MAPK pathway. Most  KRAS mutations occur in codons 12 and 13 in the phosphate binding loop of KRAS , and mutations in either codon possess transforming capacity .
Attempts and approaches at manipulating p53 activity in treating human cancer have been numerous and diverse. For example, viral mediated introduction and expression of wild type TP53 in p53 defective tumor cells has been extensively investigated for more than a decade, including through clinical trial activity . Alternative approaches for increasing tumor cell wild type p53 activity include the use of small molecules that promote p53 transcription, and the use of compounds that inhibit p53’s interaction with mdm2  .
Dysregulation of apoptosis in the bone marrow is a central feature in patients with myelodysplastic syndrome  . TRAIL  induces apoptosis preferentially in neoplastic cells . However, many tumors show resistance to TRAIL , due to various mechanisms.
HMN 176  4 { amino] stilbazole} 1 oxide) is a newly synthesized sulfonamide derivative that exhibits potent anti proliferative activity in human tumor cell lines, especially breast, non small cell lung, and ovarian tumors . The drug is also cytotoxic to drug resistant human and murine cell lines . Additional evidence that HMN 176 inhibits cell proliferation, in part, via its effects on transcriptional regulation, is suggested from cDNA microarray analyses of human ovarian carcinoma lines, in which the drug is reported to up  or down regulate expression of a number of genes .
Stroke is a major cause of serious, long term disability in the United States, with an estimated 795,000 strokes occurring every year. Like older individuals, young people with stroke often experience decreased participation in major life roles and responsibilities., Displacement from productive work and community roles has substantial financial and health consequences as individuals live longer with stroke . Nearly 50% of previously working individuals either never attempt to return to work following mild stroke or are met with failure when they do.
Retinal ganglion cells  carry different aspects of visual signals from retina to visual cortex through separated parallel synaptic pathways. Glutamate activates metabotropic glutamate receptors on cone ON BCs and rod BCs and thereby hyperpolarizes the membrane potentials of these cells. All ON RGCs only synapse with ON BCs in the sublamina b of the IPL and all OFF RGC only synapse with OFF BCs in the sublamina a of the IPL .
Pediatric anxiety disorders affect approximately 10 15% of children and adolescents, and are associated with significant, enduring impairment, Although research on pediatric anxiety disorders is rapidly growing, knowledge of pathophysiology remains limited. The emotional Stroop is based on principles of cognitive interference; attention bias is manifested by longer response times for color naming of threat vs. positive or neutral words. The stimuli then disappear and one is replaced by a target probe.
Military veterans who participated in atmospheric nuclear weapons testing conducted by the United States between 1945 and 1963 are being studied for late occurring health effects. The study cohort consists of 115,329 individuals who were present in one or more of seven test series: CASTLE, CROSSROADS, GREENHOUSE, REDWING, and HARDTACK I conducted at the Bikini and Enewetak Atolls and Johnston Island in the Pacific Proving Grounds ; UPSHOT KNOTHOLE and PLUMBBOB conducted at the Nevada Test Site ; and TRINITY, the first nuclear test, conducted in New Mexico . The NTPR program was initiated in 1978 following a series of public laws that were approved by Congress and published under the Code of Federal Regulations .
Despite high survival rates for early stage breast cancer, it is still the second leading cause of cancer related deaths in the United States. This is due to the poor survival associated with late stage, invasive disease and treatment resistant breast cancers. Several reports identified the RON  receptor tyrosine kinase, a MET family member, as an important driver of breast tumorigenesis.
Clostridium difficile is an anaerobic spore forming rod shaped gram positive bacterium that can infect both humans and animals. Over the past decade, there has been a progressive increase in the prevalence, severity, and mortality of CDI worldwide. Certain C. difficile strains, including the BI/NAP1/027 strain, also produce a binary toxin CDT, which is formed by two separate, unlinked polypeptide subunits, CDTa and CDTb .
Monoclonal antibody  L8A4 binds specifically to the epidermal growth factor receptor variant III  that is present on gliomas but not normal tissues, and is internalized rapidly after receptor binding. Because of the short range of its β emissions, labeling this mAb with177Lu would be an attractive approach for the treatment of residual tumor margins remaining after surgical debulking of brain tumors . L8A4 mAb was labeled with 177Lu using the acyclic ligands  trans  cyclohexane 1,2 diamine  pentaacetic acid  and 2  6 methyldiethylene  triaminepentaacetic acid , and the macrocyclic ligands S 2  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane tetraacetic acid  and α  1,4,7,10 tetraazacyclododecane 1,4,7,10  tetraacetic acid .
With recognition that the nucleus tractus solitarii  is the primary site of termination of cardiovascular reflex afferent nerves , electrophysiological and anatomical studies contributed to an understanding of reflex transmission from those afferents to NTS neurons and beyond. Amongst the sites to which the NTS projects and from which it receives afferent projections is the cerebral cortex . Because lesions affecting cortical areas are known to produce autonomic dysfunction and, at times, sudden cardiac death , the reciprocal connections could be critically important in clinical medicine .
Nef, an accessory protein expressed by HIV and other primate lentiviruses, plays an essential role in viral pathogenesis,. Nef defective HIV strains have been isolated from infected patients that remain asymptomatic for long periods in the absence of antiretroviral therapy, providing strong evidence that Nef is a critical virulence factor for HIV pathogenesis. Taken together, these studies provide a strong rationale for the discovery and development of a new generation of HIV therapeutics targeting Nef .
The RAS RAF mitogen activated protein kinase /extra cellular signal regulated kinase  kinase  ERK and phosphoinositide 3 kinase  PTEN AKT signaling pathways play central roles in the signal transduction networks promoting tumor initiation and tumor progression. This is highlighted by the high frequency of mutations of RAS, RAF, PI3KCA, AKT, and PTEN as well as amplification of AKT present in a broad spectrum of human malignancies . For example, abolishing signal transduction through MEK offers the potential advantage of inhibiting both proliferation promoting and antiapoptotic signals originating from either activated cell surface receptors or mutant RAS and B RAF.
Glutamate is an endogenous excitatory neurotransmitter, and it was estimated that this neurotransmitter is utilized by as many as one third of the synapses in the central nervous system . Glutamate can induce cytotoxicity via two different pathways. The other pathway involves the inhibition by extracellular glutamate  of cystine uptake mediated by the glutamate/cystine antiporter, which subsequently results in low intracellular glutathione  levels and culminates in oxidative stress and cell death .
Vertebrate vision is based on two physiologically different photoreceptor cell types: rods and cones. cGMP hydrolysis by activated PDE6 leads to a closure of cGMP gated channels in the plasma membrane and generates an electrical signal . The turn off and recovery of the visual signal are achieved by reactions inactivating R* and the Gαt1GTP/PDE6 complex, and restoration of cGMP levels through Ca2+  dependent activation of retinal guanylate cyclases.
During the first human H5N1 outbreak in 1997, 18 cases of H5N1 influenza A infection in humans were confirmed, and more than 300 infected individuals have been diagnosed since 2003. Studies of patients infected with H5N1 influenza have shown that systemic viral replication can occur  . However, viral antigen has not been detected consistently outside the respiratory tract of humans .
Glutamate is the major excitatory neurotransmitter and essential for many functions in the mammalian central nervous system . Glutamate receptors can be divided into two classes: ionotropic glutamate receptors and metabotropic glutamate receptors  . Eight mGluR subtypes have been identified and classified into three distinct groups based on pharmacology and sequence homology.
Regeneration is a process by which damaged or lost structures are perfectly or near perfectly replaced . In classic models of regeneration, this process follows a pattern of epithelial migration to cover the wound, formation of a regeneration blastema and ultimately proliferation and cell differentiation leading to replacement of the lost or damaged structure. The zebrafish  caudal fin has become a valuable model for studying regeneration.
The interplay between the immune system and cancer is an ongoing focus of scientific interest. Increasing evidence indicates that dysregulation of the immune system, as for example found in allergic and autoimmune disorders, can affect survival of cells in developing tumors . This observation suggests that the cancer rates in individuals affected by such disorders might be different from those in individuals that do not suffer from allergies or autoimmune diseases.
Most of our understanding of sound representation in cerebral cortex comes from experiments using synthetic acoustic stimuli . The small number of experiments that have, in fact, evaluated functional models using complex natural sounds have reported that the ability of current models to generalize to novel natural stimuli is quite limited  . Typically, STRFs are estimated using synthetic broadband stimuli .
Polyunsaturated fatty acids have multiple regulatory actions within cells including activating cellular signaling pathways and regulating gene expression. Yet, the ability of dietary polyunsaturated fatty acids to activate AMPK in all tissues is not uniformly observed and a role for AMPK in regulating the transcription of glucose responsive genes is controversial . Glucose 6 phosphate dehydrogenase  is the rate limiting enzyme in the pentose phosphate pathway.
The yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae has been used as a model eukaryote to study the aging process for 50 years . Replicative life span is defined as the number of divisions a cell undergoes before becoming senescent. Like in other organisms, chronological aging in yeast results from a series of time  and metabolism dependent changes that result in reduced viability, and is distinguished from loss of viability due to the secondary effects of deleterious mutations or adverse environmental factors .
Tumor hypoxia is known to contribute to tumor radioresistance and poor clinical outcomes . The biological cornerstone of these hypoxia specific stress responses is the hypoxia inducible factor  family of transcription factors . HIF 1, the best studied member, is a heterodimer consisting of a tightly regulated HIF 1α subunit and a constitutively expressed HIF 1β subunit.
Methadone is an evidence based medication for the treatment of opioid dependence, and has been available in the U.S. for over four decades., In its early stages of adoption, buprenorphine tended to be used by populations with insurance coverage, and patients relying on the publicly funded treatment sector often did not have equal access to buprenorphine when it first became available. Several years after the BBI was initiated, Maryland expanded its state Medicaid Program to cover certain outpatient substance abuse treatment services, including methadone. Under the new policies, access to both medications was rapidly expanded.
As access to antiretroviral drugs is expanding in sub Saharan Africa and second line treatments are often not readily available in the setting, it is imperative that adequate assessment on the prevalence and transmission of drug resistance mutations is performed to ensure optimization of treatment efficacy . Antiretroviral therapy  has been successful in suppressing the human immunodeficiency virus , however it fails to completely eliminate HIV from infected individuals and often elicits drug resistant variants. These mutations found in less than 20% are not detectable by standard genotyping sequencing techniques .
Autism is defined by impairments in the areas of social interaction and communication and marked by the presence of a restricted repertoire of behavioral activities and interest. Although not identified as a core phenotype of autism spectrum disorders , face processing and recognition is thought to be a relative area of weakness for many individuals with ASD . Briefly, alterations in face processing in ASD may include: biases toward high spatial frequency information in faces ; reduced configural processing of faces ; alternative patterns of attention to features within the face such as atypical or reduced eye attention ; and differential patterns of responses to familiar vs. unfamiliar faces .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is a major cause of chronic liver disease. It encompasses a spectrum of histopathology, including hepatic steatosis  and nonalcoholic steatohepatitis . The liver harbors resident populations of cells that regulate innate immune responses.
One dimensional semiconductor nanostructures such as quantum wires  and quantum rods ,  have been attracting significant interest over the last decade due to their tunable optical properties, which in turn give rise to applications in biomedical fields ranging from multiplex imaging to sensors, . For example, CdSe quantum rods were prepared by solution techniques using structure directing agents, metallic nanoparticles, micellar templating techniques, etc, . These include larger absorption cross section, and larger surface area per particle, which facilitates conjugation with multiple active molecules .
The study of RNA enzymes, or ribozymes, is of considerable interest due to their importance in biology, their evolutionary implications, and potential impact for the design of drugs and new biomedical technology. , The hammerhead ribozyme , ,  is a small self cleaving ribozyme derived from RNA discovered in satellites of various plant virus genomes. The catalytic activity of HHR motifs have promise in a number of biomedical applications.
The phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase  pathway plays an integral role in the regulation of many key cellular processes, mediating proliferation, differentiation, intracellular signaling, and glucose metabolism . Accordingly, several PI3K inhibitors are currently in clinical trials with promising results in glioblastoma, breast, hematological and non small cell lung cancer studies  . Magnetic resonance spectroscopy  is a noninvasive, radiation free method that has been valuable for informing on biochemical composition of cancer cells and providing metabolic imaging biomarkers of cell transformation and response to treatment .
Suicide is an enormous public health problem in the United States and around the world. Each year over 30,000 people in the United States and approximately 1 million people worldwide die by suicide, making it one of the leading causes of death . A recent report from the Institute of Medicine  estimated that in the United States the value of lost productivity due to suicide is $11.8 billion per year .
The global burden of morbidity and mortality from hepatitis C virus  infection is truly pandemic . There is no vaccine for the prevention of HCV infection and current therapeutic regimens for HCV infection are limited by efficacy, cost, and treatment side effects. HCV is transmitted primarily through percutaneous exposure to blood contaminated with HCV.
Chronic viral infections, such as those caused by human immunodeficiency virus , hepatitis C virus , and hepatitis B virus  are among the leading causes of death in the world . In the United States, there are approximately four million people with persistent hepatitis C infection and more than ten thousand HCV related deaths each year, with mortality from HCV expected to double in this decade and possibly surpass that caused by HIV  . This permits comparison of immune responses between those individuals who successfully control the infection and those who fail.
In order to help educators and policy makers build the primary care physician work force, researchers must systematically evaluate medical students’ reasons for choosing primary care or specialty practice. ’s theoretical model of specialty choice suggests that both student “needs” and “perceptions” are important in formulating career decisions. In summary, primary care oriented students have different beliefs about the value of primary care.
Prostate cancer  is the most frequently diagnosed malignant tumor and was the second leading cause of cancer related death in American men in 2011. However, one of the most troubling aspects of this disease is that after hormone treatment, the tumor inevitably progresses from an androgen dependent  to an incurable castration resistant  form . Some miRNAs have also been reported to be aberrantly expressed in human CaP .
The apolipoprotein E  ε4 allele on chromosome 19 is a major genetic risk factor for late onset Alzheimer’s disease  that may account for as much as 50% of the risk for developing the disease . Non demented APOE ε4 carriers show subtle functional and structural brain differences  and cognitive changes  that may reflect a prodromal phase of AD. By contrast, young ε4 carriers have been shown to demonstrate better episodic memory performance and reduced learning  and retrieval related activity , suggesting that the negative effects of the APOE ε4 allele accelerate with age .
Pancreatic carcinoma is the fourth leading cause of cancer related deaths in the United States today . Most patients are diagnosed with advanced disease at a time when very little can be done to extend life expectancy beyond 5 6 months in inoperable cases ). Indeed, the anti AK drug VX 680 demonstrates potent, selective cytotoxicity and suppression of pancreatic tumor growth in xenografted mice .
The neurohypophysial hormone vasopressin  is the hormonal regulator of water homeostasis and has major effects on behaviour and vascular tone . The mPVN together with the supraoptic  nuclei of the hypothalamus constitute the neurohypophysial system that is the primary source of Avp and the related peptide oxytocin  released into the systemic circulation from neurons terminating in the posterior pituitary. Under basal conditions about 50% of these neurons also express Avp .
It is generally accepted that the tendency of insulin to self associate in solution is strongly enhanced in the presence of zinc ion , which is normally present at a concentration of ca 0.2 mM in human serum . In particular, under conditions where zinc free insulin exists in monomeric form, insulin in the presence of zinc is thought to exist primarily as a hexamer binding two moles of zinc per mole of hexamer . The concentration dependent self association of bovine Zn insulin at pH 7.0 was previously studied by Milthorpe et al  via sedimentation equilibrium over the concentration range 0.03  0.6 mg/ml, who reported that over this concentration range the sedimentation equilibrium could be accounted for by an equilibrium between monomer and hexamer.
Synchronization of cortical areas in the human brain plays an important role in the understanding of the computational basis for human cognition . However, coupling across frequencies would allow for much more complex cortico cortical interactions  and has been examined in brain signals . Cross frequency coupling in the human brain suggests nonlinear interaction and it is speculated that such interactions play a crucial role in the coordination of complex cortical computation.
Neuronal exocytosis is a highly regulated Ca2+ triggered process involving the membrane fusion of synaptic vesicles with the presynaptic plasma membrane. There is strong evidence that the synaptic vesicle protein synaptotagmin 1  acts as the Ca2+ sensor for this process ; ; ; . Synaptotagmin 1 consists of two tandem cytosolic C2 domains, C2A and C2B, that are anchored to the synaptic vesicle by a single transmembrane helical pass .
Spiral ganglion neurons  transmit primary acoustic information from cochlear hair cells to the brain. Two main categories of SGN are commonly recognized: the large, bipolar type I, which make up ~9095% of the entire ganglionic population, and the smaller sized, pseudomonopolar type II . The central processes of SGNs bifurcate into ascending and descending branches within the CN and maintain a tonotopic map .
Over the past several years, three different laboratories have independently isolated mitotically active germ cells from juvenile and adult mouse ovaries that can be propagated ex vivo , generate what appear to be oocytes in defined cultures in vitro , and differentiate into fertilization competent eggs after intraovarian transplantation in vivo . Although more experiments are needed to define the exact physiological contribution of these newly discovered cells to adult ovarian function and perhaps aging related ovarian failure, the now large body of evidence from multiple laboratories supporting the existence and functionality of mammalian OSCs provides a strong impetus to characterize these cells more rigorously  . One approach to do this, which has proven extremely useful for exploration of mammalian spermatogonial stem cell biology , is to establish and propagate OSCs under defined conditions ex vivo.
Peer relationships provide a socialization context of great importance during adolescence, in part because adolescents who are similar to one another tend to aggregate in groups and to influence one another’s behavior in those groups . Concurrent links between social standing in the peer group  and youth behavior  are well documented . However, less is known about the stability of social standing in the peer group, individual characteristics that may predict changes in social standing, and implications of changes in social standing for subsequent behavior.
Copy number alterations represent a substantial category of genetic variation. A powerful way to find cancer genes is to identify genomic regions with recurrent copy number alterations  in tumor genomes. Indeed, hybridization of genomic DNA to oligonucleotide microarrays can reveal genome wide copy number changes, .
Disclosure of HIV status among people who test positive for HIV has important implications for preventing new HIV infections and for the treatment, care and support of people living with HIV/AIDS  . The potential preventive health benefits of disclosure have been emphasized in health research and programs  with a particular focus on HIV disclosure to sexual partners  . There is mixed evidence that disclosure to sexual partners leads to sexual risk behavior change .
Mental disorders are leading causes of disability in the U.S. , and antidepressant medications are a mainstay of treatment for depressive and anxiety disorders . However, many people do not receive effective treatment, particularly ethnic minorities . Substantial racial and ethnic differences in access to and quality of mental health care have been reported, including antidepressant pharmacotherapy , and the substantial general under treatment of mental disorders is even greater for black Americans .
Rapid economic growth, including that of the alcohol industry combined with poor regulatory policies, multiple health risk factors, such as infectious diseases and malnutrition, and inadequate public health resources make alcohol related problems especially significant in developing countries . Alcohol production and consumption in India have shown increasing trends . Studies in India have used alcohol screening measures, primarily the AUDIT , to examine hazardous alcohol use, defined as an alcohol consumption pattern that increases the risk of harmful consequences for the user and others , and to assess harmful drinking or alcohol abuse.
Primary vaginal cancer occurs predominantly in post menopausal women over the age of 60 and accounts for less than 2% of gynecological cancers diagnosed . Squamous cell carcinoma, which arises from the epithelial lining of the vaginal tract, accounts for 7095% of primary vaginal tumors . Treatment options for primary squamous cell carcinoma of the vagina  depend on the progression of the disease.
Humoral immune responses play a major role in conferring naturally acquired immunity to malaria . While the complex nature of the parasite  and the high degree of antigenic variation  certainly contribute to this apparently impaired generation of humoral immune memory, there is also increasing evidence that the malaria parasite actively alters B cell function . In malaria endemic areas, expansion of atypMBCs appears to be linked to both cumulative duration and frequency of parasite exposure .
At a physiological level, endothelin  1 plays an important role in the control of fluid volume balance and blood pressure. Systemically, ETB receptors clear ET 1 from the circulation and protect against ETA receptor dependent vasoconstriction, cell proliferation, matrix accumulation, and inflammation. Recent clinical studies have suggested that ETA antagonists may be a useful therapeutic approach for proteinuric renal disease, but the precise mechanism of action is not known.
Type II diabetes mellitus  is a metabolic disorder with multiple derangements in metabolic and immune pathways that predisposes individuals to cardiovascular disease. While glycemic control is of paramount importance, recent data indicate that broad pleiotropic strategies that target multiple pathways are more likely to succeed in the reducing cardiovascular risk in these patients. Emerging evidence suggests an important role for theincretin hormone, glucagon like peptide , in the regulation of post prandial glycemic control and satiety.
Obesity is associated with expansion of metabolically active adipose tissues leading to local and systemic inflammation, insulin resistance, and dyslipidemia, all of which can contribute to cardiovascular disease. In addition to these systemic effects, obesity is associated with expansion of perivascular adipose tissue  immediately adjacent to the adventitia of large arteries. PVAT is anatomically co localized with atherosclerotic lesions in humans, correlating with plaque burden and vascular calcification,.
LRP1 is a multifunctional member of the LDL receptor gene family that interacts with numerous ligands. Ligand engagement can result in either removal of the ligand from the extracellular environment or stimulation of specific intracellular signaling pathways. Determination of the contribution of LRP1 to vascular diseases was hindered initially by the embryonic lethality of whole body deletion.
Chronic hyperactivation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis results in long term exposure to elevated circulating glucocorticoids, which exert long lasting and often detrimental effects on an organism’s growth and development , immune functioning , reproduction , mood and addictive tendencies , and cognitive functioning. Higher blood cortisol levels predict poorer cognitive performance in healthy aged subjects . found that small but significant increases in salivary cortisol across sampling periods on a single day of assessment were related to better memory on a contingency learning task .
Diagnosis of the sporadic form of the fatal motor neuron degenerative disorder amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  depends on clinical criteria and electromyographic evaluation for definitive confirmation. Mounting evidence suggests a link between the Nogo A protein and ALS. Nogo A is best known for its role as a myelin associated inhibitor of nerve sprouting and regeneration .
Pseudomonas aeruginosa remains a significant cause of nosocomial infection and septic mortality in patients admitted to the intensive care units . Since the early 1980s, the incidence of P. aeruginosa pneumonia has been steadily rising. Among the virulence factors described is the type III protein secretory system .
CD81 is a ubiquitously expressed member of the tetraspanin superfamily of proteins. These associations are thought to occur mainly in membrane compartments such as lipid rafts and tetraspanin enriched microdomains , thereby forming a membrane network known as the “tetraspanin web”. Through its direct association with CD19, CD81 participates in the B cell coreceptor, a complex of integral membrane proteins  that lowers the threshold of activation of the B cell receptor in response to opsonized antigens .
Cardiovascular disease is the leading cause of death among persons with diabetes and there is evidence that cardiac damage is often present at the time of clinical diagnosis of diabetes , . Elevated glucose levels are thought to induce hyperglycemia mediated coronary microvascular dysfunction and result in myocardial injury  . Previous studies have shown that persons with pre diabetes or diabetes have an increased prevalence of atherosclerosis as measured by carotid intimal thickness or coronary artery calcium .
In the adult skeleton, bone is continuously being formed and resorbed. This bone remodeling process is accomplished by a precise coordination of the activities of two cell types: osteoblasts, which deposit the calcified bone matrix, and osteoclasts, which resorb bone,. Bone resorption and formation do not occur along the bone surface at random.
The ability to speak, swallow, taste food, and maintain a healthy oral cavity is heavily reliant on the presence of saliva, an important effect of which on our everyday lives is often unappreciated . It is highly common especially in patients undergoing radiotherapy treatment for head and neck cancer, drug usage and patients suffering from Sjogren’s syndrome. Considering the severe impact that xerostomia may have on the patient’s quality of life, there is an unmet clinical need for an efficient treatment.
Endometrial cancer is the most frequently diagnosed malignancy of the female genital tract. According to the National Cancer Institute , endometrial cancer is the most common type of gynecological cancer. All endometrial cancers can be further delineated into two types .
Folliculogenesis is a coordinated process driven by signals from ovarian cells as well as the anterior pituitary. Following activation from the ovarian reserve, follicle growth is characterized by an increase in oocyte size and proliferation of the surrounding granulosa cells. Folliculogenesis concludes when a mature cumulus oocyte complex is ovulated from an antral follicle following the luteinizing hormone  surge.
Neurotransmitter release is essential for communication between neurones and thus brain function. It is stimulated by influx of extracellular calcium  via voltage dependent Ca2+ channels on nerve terminal depolarization by action potentials . Ca2+ influx evokes this release by stimulating the fusion of neurotransmitter containing synaptic vesicles  with the nerve terminal plasma membrane.
Broadly, stress can simultaneously provoke both an adaptive and apoptotic response within cells. Integration of these programmed survival and death signals determines the fate of the cell. Multiple and rather consistent defects in pathways that control apoptosis are found in virtually all human epithelial and lymphoid tumors.
Transcranial magnetic stimulation  can be used within the MRI scanner to noninvasively manipulate brain activity while subjects undergo functional neuroimaging. Importantly, while great attention and effort has been directed to accounting and correcting for TMS influences on image acquisition , the influence of the scanner’s magnetic field on TMS remains relatively unexplored . TMS can be shaped by nearby magnetic fields , so the scanner’s static field likely influences the TMS coil’s field.
The introduction of α1,3 galactosyltransferase gene knockout  pigstransgenic for human complement regulatory proteins, markedly improved pig xenograftsurvival in non human primates  . However,dysregulation of coagulation in the form of thrombotic microangiopathy in the graft and/orconsumptive coagulopathy  in the recipient remains a major barrier . It has beenreported that increased immunosuppressive therapy  significantly prolongs organxenograft survival, but not systemic anticoagulation .
Chronic kidney disease is now recognized as a major public health concern. , It is estimated that approximately 26.3 million adults in the US have non dialysis dependent kidney disease and over 470,000 have end stage renal disease, collectively representing over 13% of the US population. In the next 20 years, the burden of chronic kidney disease is expected to increase, with over 2 million individuals projected to be receiving renal replacement therapy  by 2030.
Although the initiating factors and sequence of molecular and cellular events leading to the dysfunction and death of neurons in Alzheimer's disease  are not fully understood, the accumulation of amyloid β peptide  and hyperphosphorylated tau, oxidative stress, impaired energy metabolism and a disruption of neuronal Ca2+ regulation are implicated . In addition, cerebral neurovascular alterations that result in reduced cerebral blood flow , impaired blood brain barrier  function and reduced glucose utilization have been shown to occur early in the disease process . The reduced energy availability and increased oxidative stress that occur in AD may promote neuronal membrane depolarization and overactivation of glutamate receptors resulting in excitotoxic damage to the neurons .
Research with split brain patients provides considerable evidence for left hemisphere involvement  in the critical domains of reasoning, decision making, and problem solving  while limiting the role of the right hemisphere, and in particular the right prefrontal cortex  to little more than visual organization . This conclusion has been reinforced by recent neuroimaging and patient studies of logical reasoning, where numerous studies have implicated left PFC in logical reasoning tasks  . However, this traditional view is being modified.
Epidermal fatty acid binding protein  belongs to a family of low molecular weight  cytosolic proteins that binds long chain free fatty acids. The members of the FABP family share similar tertiary structure which consists of two short α helical segments and a fatty acid binding cavity surrounded by two five stranded antiparallel β sheets . An analysis of the temporal and spatial expression profiles in the developing brain shows that E FABP exhibits a robust expression during embryonic neurogenesis, axonal growth, neuronal migration and terminal differentiation .
The prevalence of diet induced obesity is reaching epidemic proportions in industrialized nations. In parallel, there has been a dramatic increase in type 2 diabetes mellitus. Together, these two diseases are an enormous health and financial burden.
The vocal fold mucosa is a layered structure comprised of epithelium and lamina propria ; both of which are superficial to the thyroarytenoid  muscle. Together, these mucosal structures facilitate vocal fold immune, transport and barrier function, and underpin self sustained tissue oscillation for voice production . The LP is especially important for vocal fold oscillation as it contains an extracellular matrix  rich in proteins and glycans with favorable viscoelasticity .
Cardiac ryanodine receptors  are sarcoplasmic reticulum  Ca release channels, crucial in excitation contraction coupling . Homotetrameric RyR2s have a transmembrane channel domain, and regulatory and scaffolding cytoplasmic domain . In heart, FK506 binding protein  12 and 12.6 isoforms are co expressed, and can bind RyR2 at a stoichiometry of 4 FKBP per RyR tetramer,.
Health literacy has been defined as “the degree to which individuals have the capacity to obtain, process, and understand basic health information and services needed to make appropriate health decisions” . Health literacy consists of a constellation of skills, which include the ability to perform basic reading tasks and comprehend text, such as written instructions  as well as the ability to locate information and use documents such as medical forms, charts, and tables  . Evidence for the negative impact of poor health literacy is accumulating.
Prostate tumors are usually androgen dependent in the beginning, so front line therapies are initially aimed at reducing the amount of free androgens that sustain these tumors. There are three primary MAPK subclasses: extracellular signal regulated kinases ; c Jun N terminal kinases ; and p38. ERKs 1 and 2 are well known for being involved in controlling cell proliferation  by integrating upstream signals to regulate cell cycle proteins by post translational modifications .
The epidermal growth factor receptor  is the prototypical receptor tyrosine kinase. Ligand binding also activates the EGFR's intrinsic kinase domain resulting in transphosphorylation of carboxyl terminal tyrosine residues on the receptor's binding partner. The coordinated activation of these pathways regulates cell growth, differentiation, migration, proliferation, and apoptosis.
The contraction of striated muscles is regulated by the troponin complex, which controls the association of actin and myosin in a calcium dependent manner. Following membrane depolarization, the rise in intracellular  is sensed directly by the Ca2+ binding subunit of the troponin complex, troponin C . This movement of TnI, along with an accompanying shift of the tropomyosin strand, removes both a kinetic and a steric hindrance for myosin's binding to actin, facilitating crossbridge cycling and force generation  .
Interleukin 22  is a cytokine expressed by immune cells but acting on non haematopoetic cells. The receptor for IL 22 is expressed in barrier sites such as skin, intestine, lung as well as in liver, pancreas and kidney . IL 22 production is attributed to many immune cells types such as CD4, CD8 and γδ T cells, NK cells and subsets of innate lymphoid cells  .
Alveolar Capillary Dysplasia with Misalignment of Pulmonary Veins   is a rare, lethal disorder of the lungs. Affected patients typically present with severe respiratory failure and refractory pulmonary hypertension within a few hours after birth and die in the first month of life, although rare late onset presentations have been reported . Histopathologically, ACDMPV is characterized by malposition of pulmonary veins adjacent to small pulmonary arteries, medial thickening of small pulmonary arteries, deficient lobular development, a paucity of alveolar wall capillaries, and occasional lymphangiectasis .
Arterial and venous thromboses are major causes of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality and arterial thrombosis is the most common cause of myocardial infarction and stroke . In the acute treatment of arterial thrombi, strategies that target both platelet activation and the generation of fibrin have led to the greatest clinical success . Heparin has played a central role in the treatment of arterial and venous thrombosis .
Graft versus host disease  has severely limited the use of allogeneic hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  for the treatment of hematological malignancies . Donor T cell mediated alloreactive responses and conditioning regimen induced tissue damage, with subsequent activation of the innate immune system and inflammatory cytokine release, are implicated in the pathogenesis of acute GVHD  following allo HSCT  . IL 6 is a pro inflammatory cytokine with pleiotropic biological activities in immune regulation and inflammation .
The olfactory bulb  is a unique model for investigating in vivo the correlation between vascular density, synaptic transmission, metabolism and neurovascular coupling . Dorsal glomeruli can be easily imaged in vivo with two photon laser scanning microscopy , a technique that allows one to characterize vascular architecture with a micrometer spatial resolution, and to measure cerebral blood flow  and neuronal activity  with a millisecond time resolution. The underlying layer is composed of glomerular modules in which OSN terminals synapse onto juxtaglomerular and principal cell dendrites.
Chronic transplant dysfunction, likely caused by ischemia secondary to graft arteriosclerosis , is the most significant factor limiting long term survival after clinical heart and kidney transplantation. The histopathology of GA includes proliferative intimal expansion, primarily of vascular smooth muscle cells , with inadequate outward vessel remodeling, resulting in luminal narrowing. Evidence supports a possible association of acute graft arterial injury and GA  .
Currently, more than 2 billion individuals have been infected with M. tuberculosis and about 5%10% those infected will develop active TB disease during their lifetime. In 1921, the vaccine Mycobacterium bovis BCG, developed by Albert Calmette and Camille Guérin, was first used in humans . Routine BCG vaccination involves the intradermal administration of BCG to infants shortly after birth and it has been found to partially protect against some childhood forms of tuberculosis such as TB meningitis and military TB .
Motor related, cortical areas have long been thought to contribute more to movements than simple commands. These “higher order” processes have been suggested to include memory, prediction, timing, abstraction or targets, etc. but specific demonstrations of how these processes are manifest during specific movements has been lacking generally.
Voltage sensitive sodium channels are large integral membrane proteins that consist of four homologous domains  each containing six transmembrane segments  connected by extra  and intracellular loops . Sodium channel blocking insecticides  are a relatively new group of insecticides. Metaflumizone , the second SCBI to be commercialized, causes poisoning symptoms that are similar to those produced by other SCBIs .
Patients receiving hospice care have a variety of distressing symptoms and problems facing them, with fatigue and pain being among the most distressing. As patients near the end of life, priorities may shift from concerns about work and health to concerns about what comes after death. Thus, many patients may strengthen or renew their relationship with God, however they may define that relationship, confirming the need for clergy to be included in the interdisciplinary team.
Despite the health consequences of cigarette smoking , 20.8% of Americans continue to smoke . Bupropion HCl is a first line treatment for TD that alleviates withdrawal symptoms , and is more effective than placebo in maintaining abstinence . The best established mechanism of action of bupropion HCl is that it blocks the reuptake of dopamine .
The pancreas is a complex organ with two distinct functions. The exocrine pancreas, composed of acini and ducts, produces and transports digestive enzymes to the gut. For example, islets produce high levels of at least two ligands for the epidermal growth factor receptor , heparin binding epidermal growth factor like growth factor  and betacellulin.
The paired box transcription factor  family consists of 9 highly related members with critical roles in organogenesis and tissue specification during development, including skeletal muscle, pancreas, central nervous system, kidney, and immune system . Mutations and gene rearrangement of PAX genes are frequently associated with human diseases and cancers . In particular, PAX3 and PAX7 are required during early embryogenesis for the development of the neural crest and skeletal muscle , and gene rearrangements with FKHR are frequently implicated with rhabdomyosarcoma   .
Amblyopia, also known as “lazy eye,” is a spatial vision disorder that affects about 3% of the population . It is characterized by reduced visual acuity in one or both eyes without any organic origin. Although conventional wisdom on visual development suggests that spatial vision becomes hard wired after the critical period  and only infant and young child amblyopes are treated in current clinical practice, a number of recent studies suggest that perceptual learning might be a potential treatment for adult amblyopia .
H5N1 influenza A viruses that transmitted from poultry to humans in 1997 claimed the lives of six of the 18 people infected . The mouse model has been used extensively to investigate the pathogenesis of H5N1 virus infection ; the viruses are associated with a range of morbidity and mortality . One such pair of viruses is A/Hong Kong/483/97  and A/Hong Kong/486/97 .
Body dissatisfaction is pervasive among adolescents  and has been linked with poor emotional well being  and weight and shape control behaviors . In the 2011 Youth Risk Behavior Survey, a nationally representative sample of US high school students, 61% of girls and 32% of boys reported trying to lose weight; 12% of adolescents reported fasting, 5% reported using diet pills, and 4% reported self induced vomiting or laxative use for the purpose of weight control . In addition, there is growing awareness and concern regarding the use of muscle enhancing behaviors among adolescents .
Sensory systems sample the environment, translating external stimuli into transient and sometimes enduring internal neural codes or representations. In the olfactory system, volatile odorants are detected in the periphery by ORNs which transduce chemical stimuli into electrical signals that are relayed downstream to the OB or the AL. These dynamic patterns change most rapidly during the odor's onset and offset .
Carcinomas arise from transformed epithelial cells and account for >80% of adult malignancies. Lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer deaths with five year survival rates of 10 15%. Rb is inactivated by cyclin D/cyclin dependent kinase  4/6 dependent phosphorylation leading to cell cycle progression.
E2F1 is a highly conserved member of the E2F family, a group of nine transcription factors that coordinate a transcription program underlying cell cycle progression. Embedded within the transactivation domain is the pocket binding motif for tumor suppressor Retinoblastoma protein , which binds E2F1 during quiescence and G1 to repress E2F1 activity . Alternatively, E2F1 can trigger cell death through multiple transcription independent mechanisms, by inhibiting activation of anti apoptotic signals such as NFkappa B, reducing levels of TRAF2, and inducing activation of calcium sensitive cysteine protease calpain, which leads to proteolytic degradation of the Mdm2 homolog and p53 inhibitor, MDMx  .
While Pseudomonas aeruginosa is a frequent cause of acute nosocomial pneumonia in patients undergoing mechanical ventilation, burn victims, patients with corneal trauma, patients with healing surgical wounds  and cystic fibrosis  , healthy individuals are generally highly resistant to serious infection. There are clearly multiple, redundant innate immune mechanisms contributing to this resistance. Lipid rafts are specialized areas of the plasma membrane that are enriched in cholesterol and sphingolipids .
The HIV 1 envelope  protein is encoded by the 3’ end of the HIV 1 viral RNA  genome in a region that overlaps the Vpu open reading frame , and the Tat and Rev ORFs . Also encoded in this region is the rev responsive element  that binds to Rev . Ordinarily, the nuclear export signal  of Rev binds to a complex of the cellular proteins Crm1 and Ran GTP to facilitate the nuclear export of the HIV 1 vRNA that encodes the Gag and GagPol proteins, as well as other incompletely spliced HIV 1 RNAs .
Agonists acting at spinal α2 adrenergic and opioid receptors , share common signal transduction systems mediated through inhibitory G proteins, the activation of which inhibits pain transmission. Synergistic interactions between analgesic agents acting at ORs and α2ARs have been observed repeatedly in several laboratories after spinal administration using both behavioral  and electrophysiological  methods. Synergistic interactions can result in greater than 100 fold increases in analgesic potency as well as increased maximum efficacy.
Psoriasis is a common chronic inflammatory skin disease of unsolved pathogenesis. Psoriatic plaques are dominated by T lymphocytes as well as innate immune cells such as dendritic cells and macrophages . Crosstalk between immunocytes and keratinocytes, which results in the production of cytokines, chemokines and growth factors, is thought to mediate the disease.
Pneumonia, an inflammatory condition of the lung, causes greater mortality than any other respiratory disease globally . For example, a recent study found a strong but brief interaction between bacterial and influenza infection that can elevate susceptibility to pneumococcal pneumonia by 100 fold . Influenza responsible for about 801,200 reported infections , 4130 hospitalizations, 1140 deaths, 2.7 million work days lost annually in Israel, and an overall cost to the Israeli economy of 261 million dollars   .
Gene targeting, through the use of homologous recombination , provides the ability to modify any endogenous gene in a predetermined and precise manner. Due to the lack of established ESC in livestock, HR in livestock requires the use of somatic cells, instead of ESC . The efficiency of gene targeting in mouse ESC averages approximately 1×10−6 targeting events per cell, when exposed to electroporation , while initial gene targeting studies in somatic cells demonstrated efficiencies two to three orders of magnitude lower .
Hemorrhagic shock results in the disruption of the microvascular endothelial cell barrier leading to vascular leak . Hemorrhagic shock activates the “intrinsic” apoptotic cascade by decreasing the mitochondrial transmembrane potential resulting in the release of cytochrome c into the cytosol which eventually activates caspase 3  . Sex dimorphism in the clinical manifestation of conditions such as trauma, hemorrhage and sepsis have been subjects of recent investigation .
In mammals circadian rhythms in overt body functions which enable the organism to anticipate and to adapt to the solar cycle are controlled by a master circadian rhythm generator located in the hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nucleus  that synchronises peripheral oscillators . The positive regulators BMAL1 and CLOCK/NPAS2  activate transcription of negative regulators, such as mPER1/2 and mCRY1/2, as well as clock controlled output genes like Avp . Circadian rhythms in clock gene expression in the SCN and in some peripheral oscillators like the liver are self sustained in the absence of rhythmic input .
Over the past decade, significant progress has been made in the development of non contact wide field technologies for quantitative, sub surface functional imaging. For example, fluorescence imaging can now provide surgeons with real time guidance during surgical procedures , and has successfully been translated to human trials for breast cancer sentinel lymph node mapping . Recently, spatially modulated light  has been shown to provide depth resolved maps of optical properties  and biochemical components, such as oxyhemoglobin and deoxyhemoglobin, in turbid media  .
The development of squamous cell carcinoma  of the epidermis occurs via a multistage, stepwise process whereby keratinocytes accumulate distinct genetic lesions in oncogenes and tumor suppressor genes that promote cell growth and cell survival . Furthermore, mutations in both Ras and p53 are correlated with increased invasion, suggesting that these mutations result in changes in cellular behavior that are important for the acquisition of an invasive phenotype . Interactions between tumor cells and the extracellular matrix  can directly contribute to SCC progression.
Consistent with diagnostic requirements, assessment of attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder  focuses on the presence of symptoms and associated impairment., In pediatrics, shared decision making includes integrating parents’ goals and concerns about their children with medical evidence to achieve a family centered medical decision process. Specifically, the AAP calls for “addressing individualized and specific behavioral, academic, and social target goals” . The AAP also states that, “The goals should be realistic, attainable, and measurable,” .
The human genome encodes about 518 protein kinases  which constitutes one of the largest class of genes, termed the “Human Kinome”. Phosphorylation by kinases regulates cellular signal transduction cascades that orchestrate most cellular processes. It is not surprising therefore that dysregulation of protein kinase function has been implicated in many pathological conditions.
Robust lung inflammation induced by infectious and non infectious stimuli can lead to severe pathological states including acute respiratory distress syndrome  and multi organ failure with devastating, often lethal consequences. Upon activation by toll like receptor  or other pattern recognition receptor signaling, macrophages recruit additional pro inflammatory immune cells including neutrophils, exudative macrophages, and Th1 lymphocytes to the lung and alveolar space as a critical part of the innate immune response . ET has generally been ascribed to clinical scenarios involving sepsis and other sepsis like states, in which circulating monocytes can be persistently exposed to endotoxin, resulting in ineffective TNF α or other pro inflammatory cytokine production with repeated LPS exposure .
Polychlorinated biphenyls  and other persistent organic pollutants , such as hexachlorobenzene , and p,p’ dichlorophenyldichloroethylene , a metabolite of p,p’ DDT, have been found to elicit a broad spectrum of biologic, metabolic, and immunologic responses . The potential of these POPs to impair immune responses and trigger autoimmune disease is of growing concern. Given the structural similarity to thyroid hormones, PCBs  may mimic thyroid hormone action and even modulate the mechanisms and interfere with the binding of these hormones , potentially leading to thyroid functional disorders and autoimmune thyroid diseases  .
Depressive disorders, including major depressive disorder and dysthymia, are common among adolescents and are associated with substantial health, social, and developmental consequences. Approximately 8% of adolescents experience an episode of major depression in a given year , and 12% of adolescents have experienced a depressive disorder in their lifetime . Research has also reported that major depressive disorder places adolescents at greater risk for later mental health problems, substance use disorders, educational underachievement, unemployment, poorer functioning in work, and social problems .
Vibrio cholerae, an autochthonous aquatic bacterium, is the causative agent of cholera, a severe, watery, life threatening diarrheal disease. Cholera bacteria are serogrouped based on the variable somatic O antigen, with more than 200 serogroups identified . The epidemic potential of cholera has been realized throughout human history with seven recorded pandemics and the disease is persistent in many developing countries.
The involvement of protein kinase A  and protein kinase C  in the induction and maintenance of LTP in hippocampal pyramidal cells has been studied intensively . PKC also was found to play a role in LTP at MF to pyramidal cell synapses. Numerous studies have revealed the extensive heterogeneity in interneuron long term synaptic plasticity, especially with respect to the mechanisms controlling the induction and polarity of synaptic change .
ADAMTS13, a member of A Disintegrin And Metalloprotease with ThromboSpondin type repeats  family,  controls the sizes of von Willebrand factor  by cleaving vWF at the Tyr1605 Met1606 bond in the central A2 domain. Profound thrombocytopenia, microangiopathic hemolytic anemia and organ ischemia are characteristic features of TTP syndrome. If left untreated, the mortality rate is as high as 80~100%.
Strabismus, a manifest misalignment of the visual axes, is one of the most common childhood visual disorders, occurring in 3 4% of the population . In those with a large near phoria or weak vergence system, the effort to prevent diplopia during sustained near work may cause significant eye strain  . However, either genes or environment can contribute to resemblance among family members; therefore, familial clustering does not clarify etiology.
The denatured state of a protein is the starting point for folding a protein to its native structure which confers its function. However, it is now widely accepted that protein denatured states contain non random structure. , Thermodynamic approaches to characterizing protein denatured states also show strong deviations from the properties expected for a random coil.
Curcumin, 1,7 bis 1,6 heptadien 3,5 dione, is the primary bioactive component isolated from turmeric, a dietary spice made from the rhizome of Curcuma longa . Nonetheless, curcumin has demonstrated anti tumor effects in vivo when administered via dietary supplement, oral gavage or injection, even at the low concentrations achieved in these physiologic systems . Here patients have been rendered disease free following surgical excision of a high risk lesion .
Results from genome wide scans have confirmed common genetic variants with very small effects on breast cancer risk; however, this approach likely misses clinically and functionally important cancer susceptibility alleles because of false negatives and poor coverage in some regions. Therefore, examination of candidate genes still provides a useful, complementary approach. The Breast Cancer Association Consortium, a collaborative data pooling effort of more than 60,000 subjects, was initiated to validate reported genetic associations with breast cancer risk.
Advances in immunosuppression and perioperative management have revolutionized liver transplantation  outcomes in the past 3 decades . Improved long term survival has led in turn to increased prevalence of ‘late’ complications after LTx such as chronic kidney disease . CKD has become one of the leading causes of morbidity and death after LTx .
Chromosomal inversions are known to occur in a wide variety of organisms where they are associated with instances of adaptive evolution, speciation, selfish genes, sex chromosomes, human disease and disease susceptibility . Dobzhansky proposed that natural selection would favor inversions if they captured a set of positively interacting alleles, which he referred to as a “supergene” complex . The suppression of recombination between the alternative chromosomal arrangements along the inverted segment will eventually lead to the formation of two distinct haplotype groups: the standard and the inverted.
Pseudomonas aeruginosa is an opportunistic gram negative pathogen capable of eliciting acute or chronic infection of immunocompromised, burn and cystic fibrosis patients. Although the introduction of antibiotics with anti pseudomonal activity demonstrated initial promise, this versatile bacteria’s ability to develop resistance to multiple antimicrobials has become a significant obstacle to treating infections associated with P. aeruginosa. However, these vaccines never gained clinical acceptance due to a wide array of problems  .
Falls are among the most serious problems facing older adults, which can cause injuries and even death . Slips comprise 40% of outdoor falls among older adults . Therefore an effective training program to prevent sliprelated falls is highly desired.
Chronic postsurgical pain  occurs in 10 50% of patients undergoing major surgery and results in pain sufficient to negatively impact quality of life. Individual differences in pain processing impart risk as well, especially the strength of conditioned pain modulation  in which analgesia is induced diffusely over the body from an intense, focal pain stimulus. Low preoperative CPM correlates with a greater incidence of CPSP following thoracotomy and abdominal surgery.
6  Fluoro L dopa  is a radiopharmaceutical that follows the metabolic pathway of L dopa . In catecholaminergic neurons, FDOPA is decarboxylated by aromatic L amino acid decarboxylase  to fluorodopamine, which is taken up into synaptic vesicles by vesicular monoamine transporter type 2  and cleared from the synaptic cleft by dopamine transporters . In addition to motor symptoms, PD patients suffer from cognitive and emotional symptoms that are not fully explained by nigrostriatal pathology.
Shanks, also known as ProSAP, Synamon, SSTRIP, CortBP and Spank, are a family of scaffold proteins at the postsynaptic density . Shank proteins are thought to promote enlargement and maturation of spines ,  and have been implicated in a number of neuronal diseases including autism  . Shanks have multiple protein interaction domains and can bind to other PSD scaffolds, GKAPs and Homers .
Individual agents used to treat human osteoporosis reduce fracture risk by ~50 60%. Since agents that act with complementary mechanisms are available, sequential therapies that mix anti resorptive and anabolic agents could improve fracture risk reduction, when compared to monotherapies . We evaluated bone mass, bone microarchitecture, and bone strength in adult ovariectomized , osteopenic rats, during different sequences of vehicle , parathyroid hormone , alendronate , or raloxifene  in three 90 day treatment periods, over nine months.
Diabetes mellitus  is one of the most frequent metabolic disorders, with an estimate of 371 million people living with this condition worldwide . Incidence and prevalence are rising, carrying high costs  and rates of morbid mortality, with premature deaths . Around 4.8 million people died in 2012 due to diabetes, half of them were under 60 years  .
The liver performs many complex functions including carbohydrate metabolism, urea and lipid metabolism, storage of essential nutrients, and the production/secretion of bile acids. Therefore, hepatic failure, end stage cirrhosis and infections targeting the liver present a major health problem. Embryonic stem cells  on the other hand are capable of both unlimited proliferation and differentiation into tissue specific cells.
Regulation of gene expression in eukaryotes is an extremely complex process. Ets1•Runx1 partnership provides a perfect basis for filling the gap. The two TFs regulate T cell receptor alpha  and a variety of other genes via binding to a composite Ets1•Runx1 sequence  .
Research in motor learning has been performed with nonfunctional, non novel tasks involving movements that have already been established in the abilities of individual performers . However, this relation is unclear as Klimesch et al. In the last fifteen years it has been further revealed that there exist two separate alpha components, with two specific ranges of frequencies:  Upper alpha  and  lower alpha .
Hypertension is a global health problem affecting 65 million persons in the United States  and about 1 billion persons worldwide. Despite the availability of effective pharmacologic therapies, low adherence to antihypertensive medication remains a public health challenge  and is associated with increased health care costs and with high rates of cardiovascular disease and hospitalization;. It is estimated that adherence rates are approximately 50% for chronic medications.
Despite modest improvements in survival rates from colorectal cancer  over the last 25 years, deaths from CRC still account for approximately 10% of all cancer deaths in the UK. Globally, CRC is ranked second as a cause of cancer mortality with 492,000 deaths per annum . The main CRC prognostic marker at present is stage at diagnosis, which describes tumour spread through the bowel wall, number of affected lymph nodes and spread of tumour to distant organs  .
It has been widely proposed that connexin43 , the main gap junction protein expressed in astrocytes, can under specific conditions form functional “hemichannels”, providing a transmembrane pathway for the diffusion of ions and relatively large molecules . Evidence in support is primarily pharmacological, showing blockade of uptake of fluorescent dyes  and of release of intracellular molecules  by compounds known to block gap junction channels; additionally, electrophysiological recordings have demonstrated the presence of large  conductance channels in astrocytes  . Recently, a newly discovered group of proteins, the pannexins , were cloned from mammalian tissues.
Previous reports indicate that the frontal eye field , a cortical region involved in vision and eye movements, codes predominately for contralateral space . These operations include shifting RFs  and vector subtraction . What are the sources of the ipsilateral information, and how does it reach the FEF?
Transmissible spongiform encephalopathies , such as human Creutzfeldt Jakob Disease , endemic sheep scrapie, and epidemic bovine spongiform encephalopathy  are fatal neurodegenerative diseases caused by infectious particles of ~25 nm diameter and 106107 daltons . Their molecular composition remains speculative. PrP characteristics often change in ways that are unrelated to the agent induced phenotype.
Studies have shown that the posterior visual regions have maximal amplitude of alpha rhythm in electroencephalography  , while the thalamus plays a critical role in generating and coordinating alpha activity . However, several inconsistent results have also been reported. For example, the alpha activity was found to have negative correlations with the BOLD signals of the thalamus , positive correlations with that of the visual regions  and no correlations with the thalamus or visual regions .
In the United States, the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental DisordersIV Text Revision provides the official classification of mental and substance use disorders widely employed in clinical, research, educational, and statistical settings. DSM IV subtypes substance users who meet criteria for Dependence into those with versus without a physiological component using the presence of either tolerance or withdrawal as a specifier. To date, only a few studies have examined directly the presence of subtypes of PD vs. NPD for stimulant users.
The aortic heart valve  normally consists of three cuspal shaped leaflets  that regulate blood flow from left ventricle to the aorta. Accelerated valve calcification producing aortic stenosis  before the sixth decade of life is the most common clinical manifestation of BAV. It should be noted that BAV is part of a larger spectrum of AV structural anomalies that range from single to quad leaflet forms.,,, At the microstructural level, CAVD is characterized by extensive remodeling of the cusps with biomineralization of the fibrosa layer as valve interstitial cells  adopt an osteogenic like phenotype.
Single molecule force spectroscopy is a technique that provides unique information about the biomolecular interaction landscape that is hitherto not possible to obtain from conventional spectroscopy methods. , The experimentally observed rupture force is typically dependent on the external mechanical load. A force spectrum of the single molecule interaction is generated by mapping the most probable rupture force as a function of the loading rate.
Catheter ablation has been shown to be superior to antiarrhythmic therapy for the treatment of drug refractory, symptomatic atrial fibrillation . The past decade has produced significant advances in catheter ablation approaches for AF and improved procedural outcomes. This may be due to a variety of factors, including better patient selection, technological advances and greater operator experience.
Inhibitory control is an important component of executive function, and it is typically assessed using tasks in which participants must withhold or inhibit a prepotent response. Differences in SSRT across individuals relate to activation of a number of neural systems involved in the “stopping network”, including right inferior frontal gyrus, posterior parietal cortex, and pre supplementary motor areas . Individuals with shorter SSRTs, reflective of stronger/faster inhibition, typically show greater activation of these neural systems on inhibition trials .
In humans, stress exposure increases cocaine craving and induces relapse of cocaine use , and in animal models, stressors facilitate cocaine self administration, enhance conditioned place preference , and reinstate cocaine seeking . Although the adaptive responses to stress are generally protective, repeated and uncontrollable stress exposure can increase the risk of mood disorders . The mechanisms underlying these effects are still being resolved, but it is known that stress results in the release of key stress mediators including the dynorphin opioids .
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are ligand gated cation channels composed as homopentameric or heteropentameric combinations of α and β subunits . The most abundant heteromeric nAChR in the brain contain α4 subunits, bind nicotine with high affinity, and have been implicated in conditions including Parkinson’s disease, Alzheimer's disease, epilepsy, and drug dependence  . Each nAChR subunit shares a conserved topology, having an extensive extracellular N terminal domain, four transmembrane domains , short intracellular cytoplasmic loops between M1 and M2 and between M3 and M4, a short extracellular loop between M2 and M3, a large second cytoplasmic loop  between M3 and M4, and a short C terminal extracellular tail .
Growth factors and other mitogens often provide the molecular cues that induce many cellular events, including differentiation, proliferation, and migration . Epidermal growth factor  participates in the growth and repair of many types of tissues throughout the body. A deficiency in EGF is a characteristic common in chronic  wounds, and EGF is also capable of reducing scarring by preventing excessive wound contraction .
Molecular and morphological alterations related to carcinogenesis have been found in terminal duct lobular units , the microscopic structures from which most breast cancer precursors and cancers develop, and therefore, analysis of these structures may reveal early changes in breast carcinogenesis and etiologic heterogeneity. Accordingly, we evaluated relationships of breast cancer risk factors and tumor pathology to estrogen receptor  and progesterone receptor  expression in TDLUs surrounding breast cancers . We analyzed 270 breast cancer cases included in a population based breast cancer case control study conducted in Poland.
Imatinib  is a small molecule that targets the BCR ABL tyrosine kinase and is effective in the treatment of BCR ABL positive chronic myeloid leukemia . While imatinib has been remarkably successful in reducing the tumor burden and suppressing the progression of patients in the chronic phase of CML, it has been less successful in the treatment of the accelerated phase of the disease. One correlation that has been observed in leukemic samples from untreated patients as the disease progresses is increased expression of BCR ABL.
Photodynamic therapy  is a rapidly developing approach for cancer treatment that utilizes the combination of a nontoxic dye, termed a photosensitizer , and harmless visible or near infrared  light to kill cancer cells and destroy tumors by generating reactive oxygen species , such as singlet oxygen, superoxide and hydroxyl radical. Generation efficiency of the excited triplet energy state  was found to be nearly quantitative via intersystem crossing from its photoexcited singlet state . However, synthesis of C60 monoadducts  involves change of the molecular cage structure by only one olefin bond that leads to the retention of a half  cage sphere identical to that of C60.
Heterotrimeric αβγ guanine nucleotide binding proteins  are molecular switches that relay signals from activated G protein coupled receptors  to  cellular effector systems such as ion channels or enzymes that, in turn, control production, release, or degradation of second messengers . Ligand activated GPCRs act as guanine nucleotide exchange factors  for G proteins that stimulate exchange of GDP for GTP on the Gα subunit . Crystal structures have been resolved for both GDP bound inactive and GTP bound active conformations and have shed light on the discrete differences of these nucleotide dependent conformational states .
Endometriosis is a chronic estrogen dependent disease characterized by the growth of ectopic endometrial tissue . Despite the high incidence of endometriosis, the etiology is unknown. The shed tissue then implants and grows ectopically.
Herbal medicines and products are used globally for treatment of diverse pathological conditions. A survey conducted in 191 HIV/AIDS patients in United States of America seeking care for HIV infection showed an approximately 67% patients using traditional medicines currently or in the past . Clinicians however discourage the concomitant use of herbal medicines with the conventional ARVs or other treatments based on their concern on the possible risk of ADRs due to the herbs alone or possible unfavorable effect on the safety and efficacy of the ARVs due to herb drug interactions .
Despite progress in the prevention of mother to child HIV transmission, nearly 260,000 infections occurred among children in 2012. Pediatric HIV infection remains a public health problem, but early treatment improves survival and preserves immune health. Cure of HIV infection remains elusive due to the early establishment of viral latency in long lived resting memory CD4+ T cells that evade immune surveillance mechanisms and antiretroviral drugs.
There has been considerable interest in the neurobehavioral changes, both in terms of cognitive and mood related, that occur in retired National Football League  players, but despite increased media attention, little has been done to systematically examine later life functioning in retired professional athletes. Neurocognitive assessments in athletes and non athletes in the short term following concussion have demonstrated deficits in working memory, attention, and processing speed. An association between recurrent concussion and Mild Cognitive Impairment  and reported memory impairments has also been shown in retired NFL players, with a fivefold increase in MCI diagnosis and a threefold greater prevalence of reported memory problems compared with retirees without a history of concussion.
Streptococcus pneumoniae  is a major cause of bacterial meningitis in the developing world , including recently described epidemic disease in Sub Saharan Africa . As part of vaccine introduction, countries will monitor impact of vaccine against various outcomes, including meningitis. Additionally, in the African meningitis belt, patients with suspected acute bacterial meningitis are treated with a single dose of oily chloramphenicol  on the assumption that their illness is caused by meningococcus .
Cigarette smoking is a well documented risk factor for cardiovascular diseases, including atherosclerosis, coronary artery disease, acute myocardial infarction, hypertension and sudden cardiac death. Multiple prospective studies have consistently shown that cigarette smoking is associated with increased risk of hypertension. Cigarette smoking can stimulate sympathetic nervous activation, oxidative stress, vasopressor effects, cause endothelial dysfunction, vascular inflammation and injury, and increase arterial stiffness; factors that might contribute to the development of hypertension., However, the precise mechanisms underlying the etiological contribution of cigarette smoking to hypertension is still not well understood .
Dopamine receptor genes are key players in regulating neurotransmission in response to dopamine and, therefore, are of central interest in a range of neuropsychiatric diseases, including schizophrenia, substance addiction, and attention deficit hyperactivity disorder . Since many behaviors and psychiatric conditions show moderate to high heritability, the study of genetic variation in the dopamine related genes will contribute to unraveling the molecular mechanisms of the catecholamine pathway. There are five dopamine receptors belonging to two families, characterized by whether they activate  or inhibit  adenylate cyclase in response to ligand binding .
The pronounced occurrence of “feminization” and other endocrine abnormalities at sites downstream from municipal wastewater treatment plants  was first noted in 1994 . Directed evolution and rational design are two general classes of protein design strategies that have been utilized most widely to date . In contrast, rational design strategies rely on mechanistic computational models to understand interactions between the enzyme and its substrate.
Leptin is an adipocyte derived hormone that plays a critical role in the regulation of energy homeostasis. The hypothalamic arcuate nucleus was initially regarded as the principal site of leptin action, but there is increasing evidence for a distributed brain network of leptin action  . Among these distributed brain sites, there is increasing evidence for functional leptin receptors  in the nucleus tractus solitarii , albeit in lower levels than in the arcuate nucleus.
The conclusion of general parasite host models that parasites may regulate the abundance of hosts in some circumstances  continues to motivate empirical research . To a large extent, the effect of endemic pathogens on host survival in the wild remains unknown  . Cowpox virus is an orthopoxvirus endemic in rodent populations throughout Europe and western Asia .
Solid tumors present formidable challenge in the multi disciplinary management of cancer patients. Among solid tumors, breast and lung cancer account for an estimated 399,470 new cases in the United States in 2008, and despite multi modality therapy, remain the leaders in cancer related mortality .
