While the precise mechanism by which thalidomide exerts its anti angiogenic effects remain to be elucidated, thalidomide has been shown to have promising results in a variety of cancers , with multiple myeloma at the forefront.
The current evidence from randomized clinical trials strongly argues that severely injured patients fed exclusively by the parenteral route experience an increased rate of infectious complications such as pneumonia and abdominal abscess compared to patients fed enterally. Experimentally, parenteral nutrition  in mice impairs established respiratory defenses to both bacterial and viral pathogens through reductions in airway IgA. ,  Our lab investigates relationships between PN with lack of enteral stimulation and the deterioration of host respiratory and gut immunity  provided by the mucosal immune system.
Familial hypertrophic cardiomyopathy1 , the leading cause of sudden cardiac death in people under 30 , is characterized by myofibrillar disarray and thickening of the left ventricle, papillary muscles, or septum. FHC is caused by mutations in cardiac sarcomeric proteins including the myosin heavy chain , the regulatory  and essential light chains of myosin, troponins I, T, and C, titin, tropomyosin, actin, and myosin binding protein C . The clinical presentation and prognosis of the disease depend on the specific mutation .
Platinum based combination chemotherapy offers a modest survival advantage over best supportive care for good PS patients with advanced non small cell lung cancer . Because of toxicity, patients with squamous cell histology and history of hemoptysis were excluded from this pivotal trial., Cediranib  is an oral tyrosine kinase inhibitor of all three VEGFRs , PDGFR , that has shown promising antitumor activity against a number of malignancies including NSCLC in phase I studies. N0528 was conceptualized shortly after the phase I study combining cediranib with carboplatin/paclitaxel reported in 2006 that full single agent dose of cediranib at 45 mg once daily maybe administered with standard doses of the combination.
The gastrointestinal tract is poised in a state of equilibrium that permits rapid protective responses against pathogens but curtails damage by hindering long lasting vigorous inflammatory processes. Autoimmune disorders, in particular human inflammatory bowel disease , are etiologically associated with chronically deregulated inflammation . The protective role of Tregs in colon cancer is, however, controversial and other reports suggest a negative correlation with high Treg densities and disease outcome .
Immunotherapy involving the transfer of genes encoding T cell receptors  into peripheral blood lymphocytes  is based on the foundation of knowledge gained from the study of tumor infiltrating lymphocytes . Despite these advances, several limitations of this technology exist. Based on these observations, 15 patients with metastatic melanoma were treated with genetically engineered lymphocytes transduced to express a TCR targeted at MART 1, and durable engraftment at levels exceeding 10% of PBL was observed for at least 2 months .
According to United Nations projections, Nigeria is expected to be at the threshold of reaping a potential demographic dividend , following the expected decline in its dependency ratio from 88 dependents per 100 workers in 2010 to only 69 dependents per 100 workers by 2050 . Moreover, even with fertility decline, Nigeria’s population will continue to grow due to population momentum. But continued fertility decline is a prerequisite for any demographic dividend .
Inward rectifier potassium  channels play fundamental roles in excitable and non excitable cells in mammals, including the regulation of skeletal and cardiomyocyte excitation contraction coupling, the transport of potassium  in renal and intestinal epithelia, and the metabolic coupling of blood glucose to insulin secretion in pancreatic beta cells . In humans, there are sixteen Kir channel encoding genes, which by amino acid homology have been divided into seven subfamilies . Experiments using heterologous expression systems have demonstrated that Kir1 and Kir2 encode functional inward rectifier K+ channels, whereas Kir3 does not .
Autism, a complex and heterogeneous neurodevelopmental disorder with a largely unknown etiology, is characterized by impairments in social interaction and communication, along with the presence of repetitive and stereotypic behaviors or interests. Considered the prototypic autism spectrum disorder, the prevalence of autism is estimated at 0.10.3%; prevalence estimates for autism spectrum disorders as a whole range from 0.30.6% . In the last decade, the reported prevalence of autism has increased by 314 fold, ostensibly because of changes in autism awareness, case definition, and broadening diagnostic criteria  .
Sulfatase enzymes comprise a group of cellular and extracellular enzymes that are key regulators of the degradation of sulfated glycosaminoglycans, including chondroitin sulfate, dermatan sulfate, keratan sulfate, heparin, and heparan sulfate, and of sulfated steroids, including estrone sulfate and dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate. Deficiency of ARSB or GALNS leads to accumulation of sulfated glycosaminoglycans, resulting in the lysosomal storage diseases Mucopolysaccharidosis  VI from ARSB deficiency and MPS IVA from GALNS deficiency. Removal of the 4 sulfate group is required for the degradation of C4S, and removal of the sulfate group is required for activity of steroid hormones.
Despite significant advances in targeted therapies against cancer, metastatic disease remains incurable . Paget’s ‘seed and soil’ hypothesis suggests that a receptive pre metastatic microenvironment must evolve in order for tumor cells to engraft and proliferate at secondary sites . Tumor cell derived factors that enhance or direct metastasis to specific organs have been described .
B cell development begins within the bone marrow, starting from common lymphoid progenitor cells. Development proceeds through discrete stages that ultimately lead to the generation of immature B cells expressing a functional B cell receptor  on the cell surface. Immature B cells subsequently emigrate to the periphery where progression through transitional developmental stages within the spleen leads to the formation of naïve mature B cells capable of activation and differentiation into antibody secreting cells upon encounter with cognate antigen .
The corticotropin releasing factor  family of peptides, including CRF and the urocortins play a critical role in neuroendocrine and behavioral stress responses . Some anxiety disorders have been linked to abnormalities in CRF signaling. Post traumatic stress disorder  patients exhibit elevated levels of CRF in cerebrospinal fluid .
Electrophysiological abnormalities in specific oscillatory frequencies  and in event related potentials  such as mismatch negativity   are consistently reported in schizophrenia. Our understanding on the causes of these diverse electrical anomalies is limited. If so, then some abnormal electrophysiological signals may index the intermediate biological processes connecting oxidative stress to schizophrenia clinical presentations .
Accumulating evidence from both animal studies and pilot clinical trials has demonstrated that pro angiogenic endothelial progenitor cells  have therapeutic effects including stimulation of neovascularization and regeneration of injured endothelium . Aging is one of the major risk factors for the onset and development of cardiovascular diseases . Prior studies indicate that aging of human EPCs contributes to atherosclerosis , and endothelial dysfunction .
When viruses infect cells, intrinsic defensive actions are initiated almost immediately. RNA viruses are recognized as foreign by cellular sensors that are activated by viral proteins or nucleic acids, leading to the production of the critical antiviral type I interferons . Sensing of RNA virus infection by the innate immune system is carried out by membrane bound Toll like receptors, or by cytoplasmic sensors such as PKR, RIG I, and MDA 5 ).
Involuntary smoking  entails exposure to human carcinogens, which are present in tobacco smoke. The composition of involuntary smoking includes both mainstream smoke and sidestream smoke. Mainstream smoke is inhaled and exhaled by smokers; sidestream smoke is released between puffs into the air from the burning cone.
Ascorbic acid  is essential for human health, and in order to survive humans must obtain this nutrient from their diet, primarily from fresh fruits and vegetables . AsA is also critical to plant health, as evidenced by the fact that no plant mutant completely devoid of AsA has ever been described. Despite the importance of AsA, however, the factors regulating its metabolism in plants are not well understood.
The magnocellular neuroendocrine system, with cell somas and dendrites in the supraoptic  and paraventricular  nuclei, has an essential role in osmoregulation . Elevations in Na+ and osmolality activate magnocellular neurons directly  and indirectly, via innervating osmosensitive neurons in the forebrain , to enhance vasopressin and oxytocin release into the hypothalamus and peripheral circulation . IL 1β expressed in oxytocinergic and vasopressinergic neurons  may enhance magnocellular responses to osmotic stimulation.
The pharmacologically important membrane bound flavoenzyme monoamine oxidase A 1 functions in the oxidative degradation of the neurotransmitters dopamine, norepinephrine and serotonin . Human MAO A is found to be ~90% identical in sequence with rat MAO A with each enzyme containing an FAD cofactor covalently attached to conserved cysteinyl residues via an 8 α S thioether linkage. X ray structural analysis on both enzymes demonstrate that crystalline human MAO A is monomeric  and that rat MAO A is dimeric .
Central to adaptive immunity is the linked recognition of antigen by T cells and antigen presenting cells  through direct cell to cell contact. Linked recognition underlies most adaptive immune responses that both protect from infection and that drive tissue damage in autoimmunity . However, unlike TPEM, these techniques cannot be used to understand and quantify the spatial or functional relationships between different T cell and APC populations.
Poliovirus, the prototypic picornavirus, is a small positive sense RNA virus with a genome of approximately 7500 nucleotides. One important example of the multiple RNA protein interactions that are required during a poliovirus infection is the interaction of a cellular protein, poly binding protein 2 , with stem loop IV of the 5′ noncoding region  to mediate cap independent translation initiation. Several RNA binding proteins have been identified as non canonical translation factors that stimulate picornavirus IRES translation, including PCBP2, the La autoantigen, unr , and polypyrimidine tract binding protein  .
Intensive research has been recently directed towards designing new materials for biomedical applications. A hydrogel has been defined as a three dimensional water swollen polymeric network having more than 50 weight% water. Biot’s poroelastic model described the biphasic porous nature of gels.
K Cl cotransport is the coupled electroneutral movement of K and Cl ions carried out by four protein isoforms, KCC1 4. These transporters play an important role in epithelial ion transport and osmotic homeostasis . The neuron specific KCC2 is critical for the maturation of inhibitory GABA responses in the central nervous system by the control of intracellular Cl− concentration .
Iodide , the negatively charged  form of the iodine atom, is essential for the synthesis of thyroid hormones . It is transported from the bloodstream into thyroid follicular cells by the sodium/iodide symporter   and is eventually incorporated into thyroglobulin . Iodide transport is induced by thyrotropin   and suppressed by numerous factors, including an excess of iodide and follicular Tg .
Alpha actinins belong to a family of actin crosslinking proteins of which there are four major isoforms in mammals . Of these, alpha actinins 2  and  3  are expressed almost exclusively in muscle, while alpha actinins 1  and  4  display ubiquitous expression profiles  . ACTN1 and ACTN4 are closely related at both the nucleotide and amino acid levels and each localizes to the lamellipodial extensions of motile cells .
The generation of distinct cellular lineages from multipotent progenitor cells involves differentiation programs that couple up regulation of lineage specific genes with silencing of genes expressed in progenitor cells and alternative lineages. This developmental transition initiates rearrangement and expression of TCRα genes, which leads to expression of unique αβ TCRs on immature CD4+CD8+ thymocytes. Specificities of αβ TCRs are selected through interactions of these antigen receptors with self peptide/MHC complexes expressed on thymic epithelial cells, a process aided by CD4 and CD8 co receptors .
Lipoprotein oxidation plays an in important role in initiation and progression of atherosclerosis, a vascular inflammatory disease, which leads to complications that cause myocardial infarction and stroke . With the changing composition of lipid and protein oxidation products, different forms of oxidized LDL interact with different cellular and soluble receptors. More extensively oxidized LDL , containing aldehydes and modified/degraded apoB 100, binds to CD36 and other scavenger receptors  .
There is a growing interest in using fMRI to study distributed networks of interacting regions across the whole brain . Currently, time series modeling techniques are applied to regional BOLD signals in order to infer synchrony and directional influence among neural populations, both within specific tasks  for review) and, more recently, during task free resting state  for review) . However, the BOLD signal results from a coupling between neuronal activity and vascular responses .
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related deaths, but currently available non invasive screening programs have achieved only a modest decrease in mortality. MicroRNAs  play important role in a wide array of biological processes and are commonly dysregulated in neoplasia. We aimed to evaluate the feasibility of fecal miRNAs as biomarkers for colorectal neoplasia screening .
Emerging research indicates that chemokines and their receptors are part of a signaling system within the CNS that is utilized for communication between cells of the CNS as well as between immune cells and cells of the CNS . For example, CXCL10 levels in the CSF are elevated in HIV infection, with higher levels in HIV infected individuals with neurologic disorders than in HIV infected individuals without neurological deficits . CNS cells, including neurons and glia, have been shown to express CXCR3, the receptor for CXCL10 , and to produce CXCL10 under normal conditions or during pathological states, when chemokine production can be significantly elevated .
The hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nucleus  receives direct synaptic input from the retina , and serves as the master circadian oscillator in the brain that keeps 24 hr time, and drives and orchestrates circadian rhythms throughout both the CNS and peripheral organ systems. A large number of neuroactive transmitters are found in the SCN , and many of these influence clock function. Within this context, cannabinoid receptor 1  axonal immunoreactivity has been reported in the medial hypothalamus, including the SCN .
A link between the Epstein Barr virus  and MS is supported by the increased risk of MS, in individuals with history of mononucleosis ,  or with elevated serum titers of antibodies against EBV nuclear antigens   , and by the higher prevalence of EBV infection in MS cases than controls. There are no longitudinal studies, however, estimating MS risk in EBV negative individuals or the temporal relation between EBV infection and MS. We therefore addressed these questions prospectively in a large population of healthy young adults  Active duty US Army, Navy, and Marines personnel who have at least one serum sample in the Department of Defense Serum Repository , which stores approximately 46 million serum samples originally collected from over 8 million individuals for HIV testing. , For each case, we obtained up to three pre clinical samples .
Colorectal cancer  is one of the most common fatal malignancies worldwide . CRC develops in about 5 percent of the adult population in the United States, and almost half of the affected individuals will die from this disease . Long standing UC predisposes to development of colitis associated cancer , the major cause of death in UC patients .
Altered tissue stiffness through loss of tensional homeostasis is a hallmark of cancer. Malignant tumors have been typically associated with increased tissue rigidity relative to the normal host tissue, which may influence therapeutic response and promote metastasis  and invasiveness. Diagnostic imaging is an essential tool in the management of patients with brain cancer.
The human regenerating  gene family encodes five small secreted and structurally unique proteins that share strong structural similarities to the proteins of the calcium dependent lectin  super family. Identified members of the human Reg gene family include Reg Iα, Reg Iβ, Reg IIIα, Reg IIIβ and Reg IV. These genes are constitutively expressed in normal gastrointestinal  mucosa.
The emergence of next generation sequencing technology, along with the development of the exome chip, has led many investigators to study the role of rare genetic variation in complex human traits. Family based designs have several advantages over population based designs in that they enable the use of statistics that, by design, are robust to confounding due to population stratification. For example, sequencing the parents of affected subjects can identify de novo mutations and also allow the study of rare homozygous genotypes, which are difficult to find in population based designs .
The development of antigen specific effector T cells during the induction of immune responses must be tightly regulated to prevent excessive damage of tissues and organs. Several have reported that APC elimination is mediated through apoptosis induced by CD4+ T cells reactive to antigen/class II MHC complexes presented by the DC . Importantly, Fas mediated elimination of DC has been recently implicated as a mechanism regulating the initiation of autoimmune responses .
Autophagy is an adaptive and essential cellular process that eliminates damaged or harmful cellular components . When optimally regulated, autophagy has been shown to be cardioprotective. The autophagosome fuses with a lysosome forming an autophagolysosome, which ultimately envelops and removes unfavorable cellular components, like damaged organelles and accumulated amino acids,  .
The term retrotrapezoid nucleus  was originally coined by  to describe a rostral extension of the ventrolateral medullary reticular formation containing neurons that innervate the solitary tract nucleus and more caudal regions of the ventrolateral medulla. The possibility that the RTN could contain central respiratory chemoreceptors was therefore considered by  and this interpretation has now received substantial experimental support . The RTN neurons that are activated by hypercapnia in vivo and those that are activated by acid in vitro have the same phenotype in rats, namely these cells are non cholinergic, non catecholaminergic, glutamatergic, and express high levels of the transcription factor Phox2b .
One of the numerous deficits resulting from SCI is hyperreflexia and spasticity below the level of the lesion. A major area of interest is a comparison of the modulation of spinal cord circuitry using passive exercise prior to the onset of hyperreflexia  compared with initiation of exercise after the onset of hyperreflexia . The third objective was to determine if spinal cord circuitry would retain its modulation when exercise was stopped.
There is rapidly accumulating evidence in the field of complementary health practices that greater mindfulness can not only reduce stress and stress related medical symptoms, but can also enhance positive emotions and quality of life. Moreover, studies are beginning to show a relationship between  how much people practice meditation,  how much more mindful they become, and  the positive effects they experience in terms of mental and physical health. This brief, selective review presents some of the most recent scientific findings that demonstrate how practicing mindfulness meditation can impact the mind, the brain, the body, and behavior in ways that may promote whole person health .
Reverse engineering of cellular networks in prokaryotes and lower eukaryotes, as well as in mammals, has started to unravel the remarkable complexity of transcriptional programs. These programs, however, may change substantially as a function of the availability of proteins affecting their post translational modification, such as phosphorylation, acetylation and ubiquitination enzymes, as well as of those participating in transcription complexes , thus making cellular networks highly context dependent . Although the large scale reprogramming of the cell’s transcriptional logic was studied in yeast, , identification of a repertoire of genes that effect these events remains elusive.
Visual hallucinations  are a common and problematic behavior in dementia. , In the short term, VHs pose treatment challenges for clinicians because of the risks of prescribing neuroleptics to dementia patients, but more globally, these symptoms are also associated with rapid cognitive decline, early institutionalization, and high mortality. , Several clinico pathological studies have addressed the neuropathologic  features underlying VHs in dementia.
Glutamate receptors, including NMDARs, have profound effects on neuronal development. NMDAR signaling regulates dendrite patterning, which determines the way a neuron integrates inputs , and contributes to synaptic plasticity including long term potentiation  and depression  . Altered NMDAR function has also been proposed to contribute to other psychiatric disorders including bipolar disorder and autism  .
Rotavirus  is the principal etiological agent of severe gastroenteritis  in young children worldwide . Despite their preferential replication in the intestine, RV induces both an intestinal and systemic immune response, the latter most probably related to the antigenemia and viremia present in acutely infected children and animals . The RV serum IgA titer, measured shortly after natural infection or oral vaccination, is a relatively good correlate of protection .
Myriad changes in brain structure and function accompany aging even in health. Fewer studies have measured iron deposition in normal aging  or have examined functional correlates of regional iron deposition  . Further case exclusion followed examination for excessive edema.
Within the central nervous system vasopressin  acts as a neuromodulator that can influence social behaviors, such as aggression, across species . Two Avp receptors mediate the central actions of Avp: the Avp 1a receptor  and the Avp 1b receptor . In hamsters, there is ample evidence that the Avpr1a is important for aggression .
Inter ethnic differences in focal segmental glomerulosclerosis  and steroid resistant nephrotic syndrome  have been found in pediatric patients in the USA . The ethnicities in these studies were derived by patient self identification. To date, there have been no studies comparing the clinical course of FSGS or SRNS in a group of only Hispanic children versus patients of other ethnic groups although a number of studies have grouped self identified Hispanic patients with AA patients and compared the outcome to that of Caucasian patients .
Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the United States and acute myocardial infarction is the primary culprit. In the U.S. alone, more than 750,000 patients experience a new myocardial infarction every year. Because the amount of tissue destroyed during infarction is a major determinant of prognosis , protecting the ischemic myocardium remains an urgent, yet unmet, need.
Dietary fat is an important modifiable risk factor for hypertension. Interventions that reduce total fat intake can effectively lower systolic and diastolic blood pressure . Recent research further suggest that subtypes of fat with different molecular structure may have different effects on BP.
Synchronization of neocortical neuronal activity, particularly at gamma  frequencies, is related to cognitive functions such as working memory maintenance, attentional selection, sensory motor integration, and memory retrieval ), while disruption of oscillatory synchronization is associated with attention and cognition disorders, including schizophrenia, epilepsy, and ADHD ). However, the physiological and functional consequences of gamma activity for individual neurons remain unclear . The generation and transmission of these oscillations depends critically upon activity in networks of fast spiking inhibitory neurons ; reviewed in , which synapse on the perisomatic compartments of their targets .
RAG1 and RAG2 comprise the site specific endonuclease that creates DNA double strand breaks in the initial steps of VJ recombination. , The RSS contains two conserved sequences, a heptamer and nonamer with consensus sequences of CACAGTG and ACAAAAACC, respectively. There are two types of RSS  that are distinguished by the length of spacer sequence between the heptamer and nonamer.
Arteriogenesis, which refers to the lumenal growth of the arterioles into larger arteries, has been primarily investigated using models of arterial insufficiency for skeletal muscle, brain,, and heart. In these models, the contribution of bone marrow derived cells  has been intensely studied and is now coming into focus. Monocytes, in particular, appear necessary for arteriogenesis.
Challenges in biomaterial design for tissue engineering applications include achieving material properties that match the tissue to be replaced as well as inducing biological responses for enhanced cell attachment, proliferation and/or differentiation . In the absence of any incorporated biological cues, the biological activity of a tissue engineering scaffold is indirectly determined by the physicochemical nature of the material. In particular, its physical properties, such as hydrophobicity, surface charge, topography, and stiffness may directly influence adsorption of adhesion proteins and subsequent cellular interactions .
Inflammatory substances, such as capsaicin, have been used experimentally to measure clinical pain dimensions of hyperalgesia and allodynia, characteristics of central sensitization . Following intradermal and topical application, capsaicin binds to the vanilloid receptor VR 1 and initiates nociceptive C fiber activity . These disorders may represent a common dysfunction in central processing of pain stimuli .
Fruits and vegetables contain a wide variety of potential cancer inhibitory nutrients and other phytochemicals. Substantial evidence has indicated a biological link between dietary constituents and carcinogenesis . Nonetheless, results from individual previous epidemiologic studies on the associations of fruit and vegetable intakes with colorectal cancer have been inconsistent, and a recent summary report suggests fruits and vegetables may have only limited protective effects on colorectal cancer .
Risk stratification in acute heart failure syndromes  is problematic. A recent set of recommendations describes emergency department  patients with AHFS who do not fulfill high risk criteria and may be good candidates for observation unit  management. The goal of this analysis was to report on the outcomes experienced by ED patients with AHFS who do not have any of these high risk criteria .
Cancer is the second leading cause of death in the United States. Tumors arise when control points regulating cell growth or death are compromised. Chemotherapeutic agents such as taxol interfere with cell division.
Charcot Marie Tooth disease , or hereditary motor and sensory neuropathy, is the most common human inherited neuromuscular disorder affecting specifically the peripheral nerves. Based on electrophysiological and neuropathological criteria, the disease is classified into demyelinating forms , axonal forms , and intermediate forms combining features of CMT1 and CMT2 . Intriguingly, genetic defects in six aminoacyl tRNA synthetases   GARS , YARS , AARS , KARS , HARS  and MARS  lead to CMT, highlighting the importance of this protein family in PNS homeostasis.
Human monocytes and macrophages are essential cellular components of multiple physiological activities, including innate and adaptive immunity, tissue homeostasis and systemic metabolism. Their functional diversity requires a large degree of phenotypic and functional heterogeneity, which is finely tuned by local micro environmental factors . Dysregulated macrophage activity has been implicated in various diseases.
Motion artifact suppression is a major challenge in coronary magnetic resonance angiography . For respiratory motion, the typical method is prospective navigator gating, in which a k space segment is repeatedly acquired until the corresponding diaphragm position, tracked by a navigator, falls within a predetermined range in the superior inferior  direction  . These approaches bear a number of limitations.
Synovial joints allow vertebrates to display a great range of motions by articulating bones with one another. Articular cartilage coats bone surfaces and ensures pain free and deformation free movement. A fibrous capsule surrounds the joint and seals its cavity.
The importance of diagnostic testing in the management of infectious diseases was recently highlighted in the report of the Infectious Diseases Society of America’s  Diagnostics Task Force report: “Better Tests: Better Care: Improved Diagnostics for Infectious Diseases.” Similar sentiments are expressed in the report on Antibiotic Resistance Threats in the United States from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention . A number of new diagnostic technologies for infectious diseases  are rapidly emerging: e.g., broad range PCR, next generation sequencing and matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight  mass spectrometry. The reports from the IDSA and the CDC highlight deficiencies in current diagnostic methods, and call for approval and access to methods that are rapid, available at the point of care, use direct from specimen analysis and demonstrate high levels of sensitivity and specificity across a wide range of disease syndromes.
Resting heart rate  measured at hospital admission predicts mortality after acute myocardial infarction  However, during this initial phase, sinus tachycardia can accompany chest pain and/or stress and subside when adrenergic triggers are relieved. Thus, HR measured upon admission is quite dependent on the sympathetic activity and this risk indicator has not gained widespread clinical acceptance, possibly because of the circumstances under which it is measured. A similar risk of death is associated with elevated HR during hospital stay, but there is no study that ascertained HR after hospital dismissal during the first year of MI follow up.
Although the incidence of gastric cancer declined in the West from the 1940s to the 1980s, it remains a major public health problem throughout the world and the cause of 12% of all cancer related deaths each year . Previous studies also showed that microvessel density  and expression of various angiogenic factors related to tumor development and progression are predictive of survival in patients with gastric cancer . However, the molecular mechanisms responsible for abnormal expression of many of these angiogenic factors in gastric cancer, including VEGF, remain unclear.
Human vision is functional over a wide range of light intensities by virtue of two light detection systems. Vision under bright light is mediated by three types of cone photoreceptors. All cones absorb photons over a wide range of wavelengths, but in human retina each type contains an opsin which makes it optimally sensitive to long , medium  or short  wavelength light so that the interaction of signals generated by these cones determines perceived color .
Perceived discrimination—defined as “a behavioral manifestation of a negative attitude, judgment, or unfair treatment toward members of a group” —is a widely used concept in psychological research and has been studied in many different types of consequences. There is ample evidence of research indicating that those experiencing greater discrimination in day to day life tend to have poorer physical and mental health outcomes than their counterparts  . The EDS has also been used with international populations such as South Africans .
The prevalence of adult and childhood non alcoholic fatty liver disease  has increased markedly in conjunction with increasing prevalence of obesity. Although the incidence of NAFLD, which is associated with fat deposition within hepatocytes of the liver parenchyma, varies dependent upon the diagnostic criteria , it is estimated that 20% of USA adults and 10% of children  have NAFLD as diagnosed by liver biopsy . Lipogenesis is mediated by lipogenic transcription factor SREBP 1c  and its downstream lipogenic enzyme target, FAS .
Vaccines prepared from attenuated or heat inactivated viruses have been very successful in treating pathogens such as poliomyelitis , Variola major , and influenza . Subunit vaccines are considered to be a safer alternative to live or attenuated virus vaccine formulations because they can establish protective immunity, yet lack the molecular machinery to cause an infection. Imidazoquinolines  are synthetic FDA approved immunostimulants that have recently been successful in improving the efficacy of subunit vaccines .
Phospholipids are important constituents of cell membranes in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes. For example, Plasmodium falciparum infected erythrocytes have been shown to have an altered lipid composition as compared with non infected cells . The intestinal protozoan Giardia lamblia colonizes the luminal surface of the human small intestine and commonly causes diarrhea, abdominal cramps, bloating, and vomiting syndromes .
Parkinson’s disease , the most common neurodegenerative movement disorder in human, is caused due to the loss of dopaminergic neurons in the substancia nigra pars compacta  . However, clinical application of these molecules in PD has been limited because of difficulties in delivery. Gene delivery and/or protein delivery by stereotactic injection is definitely an option but it has several limitations.
In bacteria, proteins are synthesized at the core of ribosome large subunit 50S at the peptidyl transferase center . The ribosomal tunnel wall is formed mainly from 23S rRNA and several ribosomal proteins, leading to the assumption of its having a ‘non sticky’ property that allows for the passage of any polypeptide. Furthermore, other mutation studies on the conserved L4 and L22 tips have revealed the erythromycin resistance of Escherichia Coli, and the binding of a macrolide to the tunnel entrance, which is observed to trigger the ‘swing motion’ of the conserved β hairpin of L22 to block the nascent polypeptide passage.
Williams syndrome  is a multisystem disorder caused by deletion of 26 contiguous genes on chromosome 7q11.23. To examine the potential modifying relation of other genes to the connective tissue and cardiovascular phenotypes in WS, we elected to examine a common genotype known to be associated with variation in elastin metabolism. Elastin is a major component of elastic fibers that confer elasticity and recoil to several tissues.
The degree of major and minor histocompatibility antigen mismatch between donor and recipient in hematopoietic cell transplantation  is the most important risk factor for graft versus host disease . Immunocompetent donor T cells play an essential role in the pathogenesis of GVHD. GVHD can be prevented by graft T cell depletion but at the expense of a higher risk of graft rejection and relapse.
In eukaryotic cells, early steps in the secretory pathway involve the formation of vesicles that traffic the newly synthesized proteins from the ER to the Golgi apparatus . Several mechanisms of membrane remodeling rely on the interplay between proteins and membranes . The COPII components function synergistically to sculpt a highly curved bud on the ER membrane that eventually gets pinched off at the neck that connects it to the parent membrane.
Simulation modeling and clinical trials offer different and complementary methods of exploring the relationship between a health care intervention and health outcomes. In addition, clinical trials are very expensive and so rarely evaluate all the clinically relevant options; modeling can combine the results of several clinical trials, adjust for trial population differences, and estimate the incremental differences between options not compared in any one trial . Despite the importance of model calibration, there is no standard practice in the disease modeling literature for measuring the level of discrepancy between the model output and the calibration targets.
Repeated exposure to the same stress results in a process of adaptation; that is, a change in the response to the stressor which signals that the individual is making the necessary behavioural and physiological adjustments to cope with its demands . Acute stress, such as restraint, initiates the expression of immediate early genes  such as c fos in a number of structures in the basal forebrain and brainstem; this pattern identifies the location of the neural elements responsive to particular stressors . Repeated exposure modifies this pattern of gene expression: some areas  show slowly diminishing levels of response; in others, such as the hypothalamic paraventricular nucleus , adaptation in IEG expression is more rapid and complete; .
Substantial evidence implicates EGF like growth factor activity in the regulation of cell migration, proliferation, survival and differentiation of normal and malignant epithelial cells . Human KCs express multiple EGF like growth factors including amphiregulin , betacellulin , epiregulin , heparin binding EGF like growth factor , and TGF α in an autocrine fashion . All EGFR ligands are synthesized as membrane bound precursors that require MP mediated proteolytic cleavage to produce the soluble, mature forms ).
Alzheimer’s disease  is characterized by: widespread neurodegeneration throughout the association cortex, basal forebrain, hippocampus, and limbic system ; abnormal accumulation of amyloid β ; excess phosphorylation, misfolding, and aggregation of tau protein ; and increased microglial activation  and reactive astrogliosis . It is likely that an effective therapy will require multiple approaches, including managing Aβ accumulation along with reducing neuronal vulnerability to Aβ and other causative factors . Engagement of strategic receptors upstream of AD relevant signaling pathways may produce simultaneous effects on multiple degenerative mechanisms, including those modulating tau .
In recent years, the health information environment has become increasingly crowded and complex. Individuals can access a wide range of channels of information spanning a broad range of topics related to health . In addition, health advocates have begun to encourage patients to take greater responsibility for their health and to increase their participation in the decision making process .
Muscle invasive bladder cancer treatment requires a radical cystectomy or chemotherapy with radiation protocol . Radical cystectomy has many quality of life implications. In addition, the absolute survival benefit of neoadjuvant or adjuvant chemotherapy is debatable, and toxicity can be significant .
Most cancer patients with advanced tumors undergo combination pharmacotherapy. A challenge in treating these patients is predicting which individuals will respond to a specific therapy. Recent studies have demonstrated the potential that tumor response to chemotherapeutics can be predicted using multivariate Gene Expression based Models .
Hedgehog  proteins, which include Sonic hedgehog , Indian hedgehog, and Desert hedgehog, act as morphogens in multiple tissues during embryonic development . Our previous studies have shown that the embryonic Hh pathway is reactivated in adult animal models of ischemic injury, including hind limb ischemia  and myocardial infarction , and that administration of Shh as a recombinant protein or via gene therapy enhances neovascularization of ischemic tissue by promoting both angiogenesis  and the recruitment of endothelial progenitor cells  . Shh induces fibroblasts and cardiomyocytes to overexpress several pro angiogenic growth factors, including vascular endothelial growth factor  and angiopoietin 1  , which suggests that the effect of Shh on vascular cells is indirect.
Biliverdin reductase A is an evolutionarily conserved enzyme  that catalyzes the reduction of biliverdin IXa, the product of the catalytic activity of the heme oxygenase  enzymes: HO 1 & HO 2, to the quencher of free radicals, bilirubin . Free radical mediated oxidative stress is implicated in the etiology of a wide spectrum of pathophysiological conditions . More recently, however, the protein was detected in the nucleus  in the fixed tissue of animals exposed to cytokines and free radical inducers of HO 1, and the enzyme was characterized as a transcription factor and a dual specificity  kinase.
Clostridium difficile is a gram positive, anaerobic, spore forming bacterium and a major cause of antibiotic associated diarrhea in many countries worldwide . One group of these hypervirulent strains has been characterized as ribotype 027, restriction enzyme analysis type BI, North American Pulsed Field Type 1 . These strains produce the three known toxins: toxin A , toxin B  and binary toxin .
Abnormalities in brain white matter  have been detected and characterized using preferentially T2 weighted magnetic resonance imaging  sequences, which generally detect a prolongation of T2 relaxation as the proportion of unbound water in WM lesions  increases . Furthermore, T2 weighting has been combined with fluid attenuation inversion recovery  to better separate the signal of tissue from that of free water such as in the cerebrospinal fluid  . Similar to FLAIR, DTI studies have revealed WM alterations through measurements of fractional anisotropy  and/or increased mean diffusivity  in a variety of conditions, including aging , multiple sclerosis , cognitive impairment , stroke , AIDS , schizophrenia , bipolar disorder , and brain injury  .
Cancer is one of the leading causes of death among women worldwide. A recent systematic review of research on obesity and screening for cancer of the breast  and cervix  found the most consistent associations between cervical cancer screening and increasing BMI. Findings have varied in the smaller number of studies that examined the relationship between cancer screening and depressive symptoms.
While various clinical and experimental immunosuppressive therapies promote the acceptance of transplanted organs, it is intuitive that graft acceptance is likely achieved by distinct immunologic mechanisms depending upon the therapy. A better understanding of immune parameters responsible for maintaining various forms of graft acceptance would facilitate the development of strategies aimed at achieving vigorous and non reversible transplant acceptance . For example, we have previously reported that inductive therapy with either anti CD4  or anti CD40L  mAb markedly prolongs cardiac allograft survival.
Repetitive behaviors constitute one of the three core domains of symptoms required for autism spectrum diagnoses. There is lower consensus about how early repetitive and stereotyped behaviors are present. While RBs are a reliable diagnostic feature in children older than 2 years of age  and are included in all major diagnostic systems, they have been documented inconsistently in studies of children younger than 3.
Vibrio fischeri is a model for investigations of bioluminescence and mutualistic symbioses, two fields connected by the importance of oxygen. Moreover, anaerobic respiration is apparently induced in symbiotic V. fischeri , consistent with the idea that  is low in the light organ . One regulator that might control anaerobic respiration and luminescence in response to  is FNR.
We recently discovered a novel phenomenon that drives an active contribution of vascular endothelial cells to peripheral pain mechanisms . This phenomenon, referred to as stimulus dependent hyperalgesia, is elicited by two potent vasoactive compounds: endothelin 1  and epinephrine. The discovery of the role of vascular endothelial cells in stimulus dependent hyperalgesia was made possible by adaptation of a method from the cardiovascular and renal vascular literature using the intravenous administration of octoxynol 9 to attenuate endothelial cell function .
For health outcome domains such as fatigue, pain, physical functioning, and emotional functioning there exist numerous instruments purporting to measure the same or similar constructs. The use of different measures in different studies produces results that are difficult to compare and restrict generalizability across studies. Once an item bank is developed, tested, and calibrated, and assuming that the data fit the IRT model, a number of assessment approaches become possible, including computerized adaptive tests and short forms.
The pace of research and development in nanotechnology has generated a large number of unique materials with potential application in many fields, including medicine. Engineered nanoparticles  are already in use for in vivo and in vitro imaging, and considerable research is currently directed towards the development of highly specific delivery systems and other functions with biomedical applications. However, little is known about the immunotoxic properties of silica based NP, which is of potential concern given the literature on silica and autoimmune disease  as well as silicone and immunopathology.
In the decades since chronic illnesses replaced infectious diseases as the leading causes of death, public health researchers have shifted their focus from the individual to the community in recognition that community level changes will foster and sustain behavior change. The prior emphasis on individual lifestyle change has been broadened to include social and environmental factors, often without increased resources . Their charge was specifically to identify new ways to support community health promotion at the national level .
The organization of ion channels within specific subcellular domains along myelinated axons is essential for proper nerve conduction. Specialized axo glial septate like junctions, formed between the glial paranodal loops and the underlying axolemma, mediate the segregation of ion channels within myelinated axons . While numerous proteins reside within the paranodes, to date, only three proteins have been identified as integral components of the paranodal septate junctions: Cont and Caspr in the axon, and the 155kDa isoform of Neurofascin  expressed specifically in myelinating glia .
The Insulin Resistance Atherosclerosis Family Study  is a multi center, family based study with the goal of identifying genetic components underlying quantitative measures of adiposity and glucose homeostasis. An initial linkage scan and subsequent fine mapping revealed suggestive evidence of linkage of Body Mass Index , Visceral Adipose Tissue , and waist circumference  to a ~40cM interval  on chromosome 17q2417q25 in the Hispanic cohort . Though VAT was consistently the trait with the greatest evidence of linkage on chromosome 17q, VAT and WAIST showed greatly diminished LOD scores following adjustment for BMI , consistent with the linked locus/loci contributing to overall adiposity rather than VAT specifically.
Electrophilic fluorination under mild conditions allows the introduction of the positron emitting isotope fluorine 18 into molecules. However, this synthetic method is rarely used due to the nature of fluorine gas. Unlike other halogens, fluorine usually reacts with complex organic molecules in a non specific way, completely destroying the target precursor.
Memory is central to our cognitive lives, enabling us to discriminate novel people, places, and things from stimuli that are familiar due to previous experience. The anatomical organization of the MTL suggests that its component regions mediate the acquisition, retention, and retrieval of memory in different ways. Perirhinal and parahippocampal cortex provide the major inputs to entorhinal cortex, which, in turn, provides the major inputs to the hippocampus .
Cannabinoid receptors and their ligands constitute an endogenous signaling system that is found throughout the body, and is particularly prominent in the nervous system . It is this system that is activated by exogenous cannabinoids such as Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol . Significant strides have been made to advance our understanding of the cannabinoid signaling system since the identification of the two known cannabinoid receptors 1 and 2  CB1 and CB2 .
Voltage gated Ca2+ channels  shape electrical signals in excitable cells and generate a ubiquitous and essential chemical signal, Ca2+ ion. The activity of VGCCs is subject to dynamic regulation by numerous signaling pathways and molecules . The Gβγ bound channels are in a “reluctant” gating mode, requiring stronger depolarizations to open , and activation of these channels results in the dissociation of Gβγ from the channel .
Myocardial infarction  leads to an irreversible loss of cardiomyocytes with expansion and remodeling of the extracellular matrix  and scar formation. The number of cardiomyocytes that enter the cell cycle at baseline, evident by markers for DNA synthesis, occurs at a very low frequency of approximately 0.008%. The trigger that drives this small percentage of cells to proliferate has not yet been determined.
Melioidosis is a community acquired infection frequent in SouthEast Asia and Northern Australia . The disease is especially pernicious as the bacterium is intrinsically resistant to a wide range of antibiotics : even with optimal treatment, mortality in acute cases of disease ranges from 20 to 40 % . Consequently, there has been a recent and concerted effort to develop novel countermeasures against this organism .
Leukemia is the most common cancer type in children, with 5,000 new cases expected in the US in 2012 . The most common type of childhood leukemia is acute lymphoblastic leukemia , which accounts for 78% of cases in childhood, followed by acute myeloid leukemia  which makes up 16% of childhood leukemias . Established causes of childhood leukemia including genetic predisposition, ionizing radiation, and chemotherapeutic agents are estimated to explain < 10% of cases, leaving the majority of cases with an unresolved etiology  .
Evidence from a variety of sources suggests that the language processing system includes at least some components that discriminate between nouns and verbs at the cortical level. The results showed that stimulation to this area induced a delay in producing verbs relative to nouns . The task in the study by  required subjects to manipulate the inflectional form of a stimulus word.
Complex atypical hyperplasia is a benign condition of the endometrium characterized by an increased gland/stroma ratio, abnormal glandular architecture, and nuclear atypia. This abnormality may progress to or co exist with endometrial cancer. In the United States, the incidence of endometrial cancer is 23 cases per 100,000 women per year, whereas the incidence of complex atypical hyperplasia is 17 cases per 100,000 women per year.
The relationship between oral contraceptive  use and breast cancer risk has been extensively studied, yet the composition and patterns of OC use have evolved considerably over time and more recent formulations have received relatively little scrutiny. Notably, there have been changes in OC formulations since they were introduced in the United States  in the 1960s, including decreased estrogen doses, the addition of new synthetic progestins, and the approval of extended cycle OCs . Given that OCs are the leading contraceptive method in the U.S. , ongoing evaluation of their benefits and harms is of critical public health importance .
In registration trials, triple therapy with telaprevir , pegylated interferon , and ribavirin  achieved sustained virological response  rates between 6475%, but the clinical effectiveness and economic burdens of this treatment in real world practice remain to be determined . Records of 147 patients who initiated TVR based triple therapy at the Mount Sinai Medical Center  were reviewed. Direct medical costs for pre treatment, on treatment, and post treatment care were calculated using data from Medicare reimbursement databases, RED Book, and Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project database.
The incidence of nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is increasing dramatically in the United States and developed countries . It is estimated that 25%30% of adults in the United States have NAFLD  and that NAFLD accounts for 39% of newly diagnosed cases of chronic liver disease . NAFLD is composed of several related liver disorders ranging from uncomplicated steatosis to non alcoholic steatohepatitis .
Cellular components in biological tissue have different refractive indices that contribute to light scattering, which limits the photon density delivered to subsurface target chromophores . Recently, there has been growing interest to enhance the subsurface photon density by changing the light scattering property of the tissue  . HCAs have been shown to induce optical tissue clearing by skin dehydration and collagen dissociation or a combination thereof .
In 2002, findings of the ALLHAT Study , reinforced by the Seventh Report of the Joint National Committee on Prevention, Detection, Evaluation, and Treatment of High Blood Pressure  , provided a simplified, effective algorithm for initiating and advancing therapy in most newly recognized patients with hypertension. Monitoring and public reporting of blood pressure control for patients with hypertension in commercial and Medicare patients also helped to enhance health plan and physician awareness of blood pressure control. Between 1999 and 2004, blood pressure control improved in U.S. adults with hypertension.
Phenotypic differences between strains of mice are commonly ascribed as being related to differences in genetic background, or more specifically to differences between strains in the nucleotide sequence of genes . Two of the most commonly used families of laboratory inbred mice are the various 129S and C57Bl6/J  sub strains which are known to differ substantially in many aspects of behavior. However, it has long been acknowledged that variations in environmental conditions also lead to alterations in strain specific behavior .
Specific interactions between small molecules and protein receptors are of crucial physiological and pharmacological importance. For example, the generation of an ensemble of multiple pre determined conformations has been proposed to model the receptor flexibility. These ensemble approaches also have limitations.
The goal of treatment of malignancies is containment of tumor growth either by prompt killing of the targeted tumor cells or by elimination of their reproductive potential. Apoptosis is frequently the mode of cell death upon treatment with most antitumor modalities. It should be noted, however, that the loss of reproductive potential of cells undergoing malignant transformation whether through induction of apoptosis or senescence, plays an important role as one of the barriers to tumor development.
Infiltrating ductal carcinoma  is the most commonly diagnosed breast cancer in women , with African American women more likely to be diagnosed with larger and later stage tumors . Kaiso, a bi modal transcription factor that belongs to the BTB POZ  subfamily of zinc finger proteins, is such a protein  . We reported that nuclear Kaiso is observed predominantly in prostate tumors with high Gleason grades.
The molybdopterin  lies at the heart of more than fifty enzymes that catalyse important chemical transformations in all forms of life. The molybdopterin itself is a metal chelating ligand, that is known to bind molybdenum as well as tungsten in biology. During the biosynthesis molybdenum cofactor, MPT binds to copper, which subsequently is replaced by molybdebun.
Hypoxia inducible factor 1  is a transcription factor that mediates adaptive responses to hypoxia. First identified in studies of erythropoietin gene expression , HIF 1 was subsequently shown to regulate oxygen homeostasis at both the cellular and systemic levels . HIF 1 is a heterodimer composed of HIF 1α and HIF 1β subunits .
Numerous pharmacological or behavioral interventions to manage symptoms experienced by cancer patients during treatment have been designed and tested. First, it is argued that symptoms are ephemeral lasting from hours to weeks. Second, symptoms differ dramatically in their severity and duration.
The novel interleukin IL23 was identified as recently as 2000. IL23 is a heterodimer cytokine composed of a p40 subunit  and the unique p19 subunit encoded by the IL23 gene. Recent genetic findings have confirmed previous immunological data that have implicated the IL23/IL17 pathway in inflammatory bowel disease  pathogenesis.
In the United States, the rate of obesity is steadily rising. Among women of child bearing age, approximately 64% are overweight and 35% are obese. Maternal obesity is a predictor of adverse health conditions in pregnancy; such as preeclampsia, gestational diabetes, inflammation and increased risk for maternal death.
Due to lack of good in vitro models, our understanding of development and stem cell biology of the human lung remains limited. Basal cells are limited to the trachea in mice while they are present throughout the human airways . These differences support the importance of developing in vitro model systems using human airway epithelial cells .
At the 20th Annual Meeting of the International Neuropsychological Society in February of 1992, Arthur Benton delivered the Herbert Birch Memorial Lecture, in which he reprised the highlights of developments in clinical neuropsychology from 1960 to 1990. The idea that we speak with the left hemisphere was firmly established. The work by Hécaen and Zangwill showed conclusively that right hemisphere damage led to defects in visuospatial and visuoconstructional abilities .
Recently, a Multidimensional Prognostic Index  for 1 year mortality derived from data collected in a standardized Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment  was developed and validated in two independent cohorts of older patients hospitalized for acute diseases or relapse of a chronic disease. The strong prognostic value for mortality suggests that the MPI captures a critical dimension of increased susceptibility to disease and impairment that characterizes many frail older persons. It has been suggested that some individuals are genetically predisposed to develop strong disease susceptibility earlier in life than others.
mRNA localization is a widespread mechanism used to achieve intracellular polarity in diverse cellular and developmental contexts. Four localized mRNAs involved in axial patterning within the Drosophila oocyte   gurken , bicoid , oskar  and nanos    have established a paradigm for studying the localization of different transcripts to distinct regions within a cell. During midoogenesis, grk mRNA is localized to the dorsal anterior region of the oocyte, where it is translated to produce a TGFα like ligand that signals to overlying somatic follicle cells to establish the dorsoventral  axis .
Phytoplasmas are small, wall less mollicutes causing more than 700 diseases in hundreds of plant species. Candidatus Phytoplasma solani’  formerly known as Stolbur phytoplasma  affects a wide range of wild and cultivated plants including grapevines, where it induces Bois noir , a disease widespread in Europe and the Mediterranean area . Hyalesthes obsoletus is regarded as main vector in many countries .
The ability to perform more than one task at a time is essential for older adults to maintain functional independence. Walking in home and local neighborhoods often involves simultaneous activities of upper limbs such as carrying bags. The cost of performing multiple tasks simultaneously may result in reduced performance on individual subtasks, particularly among old individuals .
Pyramidal neurons are abundant in brain regions associated with complex cognitive functions, including the cortex, hippocampus, and the amygdala. An understanding of the unique physiology and morphology of these neurons is key to the elucidation of the mechanisms underlying sophisticated cognitive functions in normal and disease conditions. Several lines of evidence suggest that aberrant dendritic arborization may contribute to neurodevelopmental and psychiatric disorders with delayed onset, such as autism spectrum disorders, .
Approximately 30,000 American men lose their lives due to prostate cancer every year . Overcoming the androgen independence of prostate tumors is considered the most critical therapeutic endpoint for improving patient survival . AR overexpression is an effective way of hormone refractory prostate tumors to overcome the growth inhibition effects of elevated serum TGF β levels, even in the absence of DHT  .
Autoimmunity represents a collection of over 80 heterogeneous disorders often controlled by complex genetic and environmental factors. The pathogenesis is thought to result from a breakdown in the mechanisms controlling central and/or peripheral tolerance, which ultimately culminates in autoimmune disease. Treg are a specialized CD4+ T cell lineage that plays a central role in the preservation of self tolerance and whose dysfunction has been implicated in autoimmune diseases including type I diabetes.
Racial and ethnic disparity in the survival of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma  has been well documented. That same year, mortality rates for all cancer sites for African American men were 42% higher than for white men. Second, in some instances the treatment rendered differs between these groups.
CD30, a member of the tumour necrosis factor receptor superfamily, has been the subject of much investigation because of its greatly elevated expression in several types of leukaemia and lymphoma cells, including anaplastic large cell lymphoma  and Hodgkin’s lymphoma  . Two major NF κB pathways have been described both of which are activated in response to CD30 stimulation . Inhibitor of Apoptosis  proteins are a broadly expressed group of intracellular factors that function in a wide range of cellular processes in addition to their initially described role in the suppression of programmed cell death .
Patients with end stage cirrhotic liver disease are known to exhibit unique abnormalities in cardiovascular physiology, known collectively as “cirrhotic cardiomyopathy”  . The key features of this cardiomyopathy, are a) hyperdynamic left ventricular  contractility at baseline, b) left ventricular and septal hypertrophy, c) diastolic dysfunction, d) electrophysiological abnormalities and e) systolic incompetence during exercise, catecholamine or hemodynamic stress . Though the exact prevalence of CC is unknown, recent literature  supports that upwards of 50% adults and children with advanced cirrhosis have CC.
“I get by with a little help from my friends” goes the well known Beatles lyric, and indeed there is strong evidence that social support is protective of health  while social isolation is associated with adverse health outcomes . Though some evidence suggests that social relationships are directly positive for health and well being , other research finds that social relationships can also be associated with negative health risk behaviors . For example women are more likely than men to provide support to family and friends , but men receive more social support on average, than women .
Supraspinal modulation of the excitability of spinal nociceptive networks plays a key role in the perception and reaction to pain . The rostral ventral medulla , of the brainstem comprises several nuclei which send descending projections to the spinal cord that modulate nociception . Physiological and behavioral responses of animals to nociceptive stimuli can be facilitated or inhibited by the activation of separate populations cells within the RVM  which is the major target of efferent projections of the periaqueductal grey  a major site of action of opioid analgesics  .
  This was a prospective cohort study, which enrolled a convenience sample of ED patients presenting with AF. RED AF, previously derived from a retrospective cohort of 832 patients, assigns points based on age, sex, coexisting disease , smoking, home medications , physical examination findings , and adequacy of ED ventricular rate control. We conducted a prospective cohort study at Vanderbilt University Medical Center, a university affiliated, tertiary care ED in the United States.
Differences in the built environment—which refers to the physical features of geographic areas— may have particular relevance to disability. Conceptual models emphasize the salience of environmental features to the experience of participation restrictions, activity limitations, and social exclusion. The purpose of this study is to explore the relationship between the built characteristics of communities and neighborhoods and participation among young and middle age adults with acquired, chronic, physical impairment .
The appropriate patterning, morphogenesis and integration of the gnathostome skull are achieved via an exquisitely positioned and timed cross talk between the embryonic cephalic epithelia and the subjacent mesenchyme. The lambdoidal junction , formed where the maxillary division of the first branchial arch  meets the medial  and lateral  frontonasal processes, exemplifies a morphologically and molecularly intricate epithelial mesenchymal craniofacial interface . Phenotypic analyses of mutations of genes expressed in the ectoderm  have demonstrated the requirement for a properly informed and competent surface cephalic ectoderm  .
Carboplatin  0,0' ] platinum) is one of the platinum agents with enhanced anti tumor activity and reduced side effects in comparison with cisplatin . The side effects of carboplatin were similar to all adverse effects of cisplatin, such as myelosuppression, nephrotoxicity, gastrointestinal upset, peripheral neurotoxicity, electrolyte disturbance and hepatotoxicity, as well as ototoxicity. Although the level of side effects of carboplatin is less severe than that of cisplatin, however, they have attracted increasing attention from clinical doctors and research scientists .
Leukocytes are immune cells involved in host defense. Most leukocyte rolling is mediated by PSGL 1 binding to P selectin  expressed on the inflammation activated endothelium . A semianalytic computer model of steady state rolling has been developed by Tözeren and Ley  which was refined by Krasik and Hammer .
Sensitive biomolecule detection assays with streamlined workflows are crucial for measurement of low concentration clinical analytes and for precise characterization of biological systems. Many detection strategies employ amplification schemes to achieve sensitivity by labeling surface or bead bound targets with enzymes that turn over substrate into fluorescent or colorimetric molecules. To this end, researchers have explored a number of platforms for the creation and utilization of stable and monodisperse miniature reaction compartments.
HIV 1 infection elicits host immune responses that include dysregulation of regulatory pathways for cytokine expression that are characterized by decreased production of pro inflammatory cytokines including IL 12 and IFN γ and increased expression of the anti inflammatory cytokine IL 10, the latter of which has been identified as a factor responsible for impaired innate and T helper type 1  responses in AIDS patients . Innate immunity provides the initial host protective response to infectious danger. Although innate immunity represents a powerful system to combat exogenous invaders, many infections can only be cleared in combination with adaptive immunity.
Pancreatic cancer is a rapidly progressing disorder that is often diagnosed at an advanced, non resectable stage and it is highly resistant to chemotherapy. The low 5 year survival rate of patients with pancreatic cancer of ~6%  is related to the challenges in diagnosing a pancreatic adenocarcinoma at an early stage when curative resection is still possible. Cabbage consumption was associated with a statistically lower risk of developing pancreatic cancer  .
Estrogens have multiple effects on the brain and impact selective aspects of cognitive function in animal models and humans . in nonhuman primates, the effects of estradiol on cognition have been most consistently observed for tasks of spatial working memory and visuospatial attention  and most likely hold distinct biological functions . Thus, predominant activation of one or the other receptor may elicit different cognitive responses .
The gut mucosa is an important site of early SIV and HIV pathogenesis. However, recent studies, some evaluating the effects of long term  ART, have suggested that restoration of gut mucosal CD4+ T cells can occur  and may happen more rapidly if treatment is initiated during acute infection . Importantly, many of these studies have quantified immune reconstitution in response to ART only by relative proportions of T cells.
Chronic idiopathic patellofemoral  pain affects 1417% of the young active population  and is typically exacerbated by activities such as stair ascent/descent, prolonged sitting with flexed knees, jumping, and open chain extension exercises . However, this measure has been subject to substantial controversy over its clinical utility , reliability , and relationship to PF kinematics . These controversies may have arisen from the fact that the Q angle  was originally defined as “the angle between the line of application of the quadriceps force and the direction of the patellar tendon force” .
In 2008, 63% of deaths were due to non communicable diseases  . Smoking and physical inactivity are the two primary risk factors for NCDs, with each contributing to about 5 million deaths annually . Reducing physical inactivity has and will continue to be a public health priority to reduce NCDs and the associated burden.
Psoriasis is a chronic, relapsing autoimmune disorder that affects 2 3% of the population and manifests as lesions of the skin with scaling and redness . These lesions show excessive keratinocyte proliferation , retention of nuclei in the stratum corneum due to aberrant keratinocyte differentiation , and the presence of inflammatory cells including T cells, B cells, neutrophils, and dendritic cells  . In active psoriatic lesions the inflammatory environment includes the expression of a host of Th17  and Th1 related cytokines such as IL 23, IL 6, IL 22, IL 17, and IFN γ .
Amphipols  are polymeric surfactants that maintain membrane proteins  water soluble in the absence of detergent, while stabilizing them . Previous studies have shown that A835, a polyacrylate based APol , is not toxic when added to cell cultures at a concentration sufficient to deliver MPs to their plasma membrane , or when injected to mice at doses sufficient to formulate a vaccine . Above a very low critical aggregation concentration , A835 self associates into well defined, ~40 kDa particles .
Extracellular serotonin  in brain is regulated in part by the presynaptic serotonin reuptake transporter . They also demonstrate increased anxiety and depression like behaviors and reduced aggressiveness on various tests  . For example, humans carrying one “S” 5 HTTLPR allele have 50% reductions in 5 HTT expression and function in lymphocytes, platelets and brain, compared with those with the LL genotype .
Metabolic syndrome , a clustering of obesity, insulin resistance, glucose intolerance, dyslipidemia, and elevated blood pressure, is occurring with epidemic frequency in westernized countries. The prevalence of MetS falls between 20%30% with higher values in African Americans, Hispanic Americans, and females. Studies have shown that as compared to healthy individuals, MetS patients have higher odds of developing cardiovascular disease  ranging from 1.26 to 3.86, depending on the study population and MetS definitions applied.
Desmosomes are cellcell adhesion structures  that are particularly abundant in tissues and organs that have to withstand significant mechanical stress, such as skin and heart. The desmosomal cadherins , together with PERP , form the transmembrane core of the desmosome. Within the core, direct heterophilic interactions between DSG and DSC proteins are believed to contribute to cellcell adhesion .
Ovarian cancer is the number one cause of death of the gynecological cancers. It is expected that there will be 21 650 incidences of ovarian cancer in the United States with 15 520 deaths. Thus, a better understanding of the mechanisms and prognosis of ovarian cancers is necessary to help develop more effective therapies for treatment .
Extensive research has provided important insights into the unique motivational state of the female mammal. Both operant and conditioned place preference  responses to cocaine rely on ascending DAergic projections originating in the VTA , suggesting that cocaine’s incentive value involves intact VTA function . The VTA also participates in the performance of motivated behavior directed toward natural stimuli, including offspring .
In the last few years, several susceptibility genes for schizophrenia have been identified by positional cloning. Naturally, these studies have examined multiple markers, as their goal was to detect association in genes about which there were few a priori hypotheses. Candidate gene studies have been proceeding simultaneously.
Despite great increase in understanding of cancer at molecular level, cancer remains as the second most common cause of death in the U.S. Survival rates for many common cancer types have changed little over the past two decades . If cancer is detected early, prior to metastatic spread, survival rates are vastly improved .
Hepatic fibrosis results from many chronic liver diseases, including hepatitis B and C, autoimmune hepatitis, alcoholic liver disease and non alcoholic steatohepatitis  . Hepatic stellate cells  are the principal liver cells that promote hepatic fibrosis, . Upon the activation of HSCs by various stimuli, such as transforming growth factor  β and platelet derived growth factor , HSCs transdifferentiate into myofibroblasts and then produce excessive extracellular matrix  proteins, including collagen type I, III and IV, resulting in hepatic fibrosis.
Prostate cancer is one of the most common cancers in men in the United States, with 186,320 new cases estimated in 2008, and one of the leading causes of cancer death among males, with approximately 28,660 deaths estimated in 2008 . With current therapies being unable to completely eliminate androgen independent prostate cancer cells that remain after androgen ablation , novel approaches for the treatment of prostate cancer are essential. Specific immunotherapy, either alone or in combination with standard definitive radiation therapy or chemotherapy, is one such novel approach .
The acquisition time for whole brain magnetic resonance imaging  data is limited by the time required to traverse the k space. This can be achieved by using partial k space sampling , compressed sensing , or exploiting a priori information , such as key hole imaging  and singular value decomposition MRI . In fMRI, parallel MRI has been successfully combined with the gradient echo EPI to achieve accelerated acquisitions .
Prognostic factors related to the clinical outcome following traumatic brain injury  include lesion type, level of consciousness and the extent of associated systemic injuries. Although elderly patients may gradually regain some of their lost abilities following TBI, the functional recovery is usually incomplete and unsatisfactory since the adult brain loses much of the capacity for plasticity and repair as it ages  . Although originally described in severely brain injured patients, damage to axons has also been observed in cases of mild and/or predominately focal TBI.
Fibrotic disorders, including systemic sclerosis  and idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis , are characterized by excessive deposition of extracellular matrix  components such as collagen and fibronectin . Fibrosis is the result of abnormal ECM remodeling which occurs due to an imbalance of ECM deposition and degradation . Activated fibroblasts are a primary source of ECM in fibrotic tissues .
Individual differences in body weight regulation are partially determined by genetic factors . Nevertheless, a detailed account of the hereditary effects on adiposity has been elusive to date, in part because a large number of genes that may each play a minor role . One strain has been selectively inbred to resist weight gain when placed on a 31% fat, high energy  diet, referred to as diet resistant  rats.
The endoplasmic reticulum  is one of the largest cellular organelles, its membranes representing as much as half of the total membranes of the cell. An essential function of the ER is the proper assembly of proteins that are ultimately destined for intracellular organelles and the cell surface . Disruption of ER homeostasis, termed ER stress, activates the UPR .
The management of sarcomas of the head and neck remains a challenge in the field of head and neck oncology. As sarcomas comprise less than 1% of all head and neck malignancies , there are no prospective, randomized controlled trials to guide management. Current guidelines are based on the collective efforts of retrospective studies from tertiary care centers as well as treatment guidelines extrapolated from sarcomas of the trunk and extremities .
The most common cause of premenopausal, chronic intercourse pain  is localized provoked vulvodynia . LPV exacts a severe psychosexual and interpersonal toll. The pathogenesis of LPV is unknown, resulting in a disarray of disease classification and a lack of mechanism specific therapy.
Autism spectrum disorders  are developmental disabilities resulting from dysfunction in the central nervous system and are characterized by impairments in three behavioral areas: communication , social interactions, and repetitive behaviors or restricted interests . ASD usually manifest before three years of age and the severity can vary greatly.
