Of the many complications attributable to injection drug use, skin and soft tissue infections remain one of the most common problems, and are experienced by up to one third of injecting drug users, but abscesses, cellulitis, and other infections are not the only injected related wounds that cause health problems for injecting drug users. Injecting drugs can lead to myriad adverse cutaneous and subcutaneous effects, including thrombophlebitis, venous sclerosis, lymphedema, superficial scarring and discoloration, chronic venous insufficiency, and ulcers.
Over 130,000 reproductive age women are diagnosed with cancer in the USA annually  Program  Research Data , National Cancer Institute, DCCPS, Surveillance Research Program, Cancer Statistics Branch, released April 2011, based on the November 2010 submission), with haematological cancers accounting for 18% of new diagnoses in women under the age of 45 . In the paediatric and adolescent populations, US cancer statistics suggest that incidence of leukaemia is increasing 0.5% per year . While various therapeutic protocols for haematological malignancies are available, many include alkylating agents which have been associated with gonadotoxicity and infertility .
MR guided cryoablation is a promising method for minimally invasive therapy of prostate, liver, and kidney tumors . It is also being developed for preventing the most common cardiac arrhythmias in both children and adults . reports good clinical results using this therapy for selected patients, in a range of organ systems.
Specific recognition of DNA sequences is essential for many biotechnology applications, for external control of gene expression, and for therapeutic targeting of DNA. The key feature of this approach is that one or more small molecules can be used to selectively target a clustered set of binding sites in DNA and generate a biological response that is not observed for binding to single sites . An additional attractive compound motif for development of sequence selective DNA binding agents of 46 base pairs that can recognize repeated DNA sequences is based on linked heterocyclic cations that bind in the DNA minor groove.
Childhood Absence Epilepsy  accounts for 10 to 15 percent of pediatric epilepsy diagnoses . The current study investigates attention related problems that might differentiate children with CAE from their healthy peers, and the role of disease on attention related problems in this group . investigated the ADDES HV sensitivity in correctly classifying children with seizures compared to ADHD.
Late onset Alzheimer’s disease  is the most common neurodegenerative disorder affecting more than five million people in the USA alone. With the exception of apolipoprotein E epsilon 4 , no polymorphism has shown consistent and replicated association with LOAD. Current case control approaches may not have the statistical power to detect the small effect sizes expected in a complex disease like LOAD.
The conformational and dynamic properties of the unfolded state of a globular protein under native conditions dictate the process by which the polypeptide begins the directed search for the native conformation. In addition to its fundamental role in biology, the unfolded state has also received considerable attention recently with an increased appreciation of intrinsically disordered proteins,  and the possible role of the unfolded ensemble in human diseases., Molar concentrations of urea or guanidine hydrochloride have typically been used to disrupt secondary and tertiary structures of proteins and the unfolded state achieved closely resembles a random coil. Single molecule, pulsed field gradient NMR and kinetic folding,  experiments have indicated that the earliest steps for a variety of motifs correspond to a global contraction of the unfolded ensemble, reflecting an adjustment to the solvent conditions.
Genomic imprinting is a cis acting epigenetic mechanism resulting in the parental specific expression of ~100 mammalian genes . In the Igf2r and Kcnq1 imprinted clusters, the unmethylated ICE contains an active non coding  RNA promoter that silences multiple genes on the paternal chromosome . Genomic imprinting consists of distinct developmental stages: imprint acquisition in gametes, onset of imprinted expression in early embryos, maintenance of imprinted expression in differentiated cells and, finally, imprint erasure in germ cells of early embryos .
The human Apobec3 locus encodes seven homologous genes expanded in tandem on chromosome 22 ; . Whereas several mechanisms have been suggested to underlie A3G antiviral activity, such as cytidine deaminase independent inhibition of viral reverse transcription ; ; , it is now widely accepted that the major antiviral activity of A3G is dC to dU hypermutation of the viral ssDNA ; ; ; ; ; ;  . Although the above mentioned A3G modes of deamination match the restrictions of catalyzing the viral DNA, it is yet unclear how A3G targets the newly synthesized viral DNA in the reverse transcriptase complexes .
Pemphigus foliaceus  is a tissue specific autoimmune disease in which antibodies against the desmosomal cadherin desmoglein 1  cause loss of keratinocyte adhesion in the superficial epidermis, resulting in skin blisters . Desmogleins are thought to function as cell cell adhesion molecules in the epidermis and maintain its integrity. Dsg1 is synthesized in the endoplasmic reticulum as an inactive precursor protein with an amino terminal propeptide , which is thought to prevent intracellular aggregation with other newly synthesized cadherins within the secretory pathway.
Resveratrol , a phytoalexin found in grape skins, red wine and peanuts, has been presented as a promising chemopreventive agent against cancer . The presence of resveratrol in red wine may contribute to this beverage's proposed cancer preventive effects . demonstrated in a two stage mouse skin cancer model that resveratrol possesses cancer chemopreventive activity against all three major stages of carcinogenesis comprising initiation, promotion and progression.
The human brain has a highly complex anatomical structure and achieving this through development requires the coordinated expression of sets of genes. A major focus of developmental neuroscience is to understand how this specificity is attained: the identification of genes which control the development of key brain regions and how the regions themselves develop spatially in 3D and temporally during gestation and postnatal development . Much of the work on determining patterns of gene expression in the developing brain has been carried out in the mouse and other organisms, but less so in human.
Examination of spontaneous muscle activity is an important part of routine electromyogram , particularly in supporting the diagnosis of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  and its variants . The detection of both spontaneous motor unit activity  and spontaneous muscle fiber activity  can be conventionally achieved by needle EMG. An earlier study using rat preparations  recorded EMG baseline of denervated muscles with conventional surface electrodes.
A major threat to tuberculosis  control efforts is the increasing global burden of drug resistant TB. Inappropriate treatment regimens and poor adherence to therapy are the most common causes of drug resistant TB and in large part have led to the development and transmission of multi drug resistant  TB  and extensively drug resistant  TB . The World Health Organization  has estimated a worldwide prevalence of 660,000 cases of MDR TB and 150,000 MDR TB related deaths annually.
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the most common brain tumor comprising 23% of all primary adult brain tumors, and is the most deadly with a life expectancy of 9 12 month. Recently, TRAIL has arisen as a promising new anti glioma therapy due to it's ability to induce apoptosis in a wide variety of malignant cells with high tolerance and minimal toxicity to normal tissue. Despite initial clinical excitement, the rapid clearance of soluble TRAIL following systemic administration and large dose required to achieve glioma regression have limited the effectiveness of TRAIL in patients.
Most HIV infections occurs in the context of actions that are related to social behaviors, such as having sex and using drugs. There is an increasing body of evidence indicating that social network characteristics  may play an even more important role in disease transmission than individual background or risk characteristics . Bridge populations, for example, have been pinpointed as major contributors to both sexual  and drug injecting related transmission of HIV .
Cathepsin K is a cysteine protease with collagenolytic, elastinolytic and proteoglycan degradative activities known to be involved in early osteoclast action . The enzyme is expressed by osteoclasts, chondroclasts, osteoblasts, hypertrophic chondrocytes, and other cells including endothelial cells , gastric mucosa , and skeletal and non skeletal tumors . Its highest level of expression is in osteoclasts .
Fractures and loss of bone have significantly affected the quality of life for a large segment of the population. Biodegradable polymers such as poly, poly, and their copolymers  are the most prevalent materials for tissue engineering applications . Inflammatory responses and foreign body reactions were reported for the patients after being treated with polyester implants .
Over the decades following the onset of the AIDS epidemic, studies repeatedly show that only a minority of men who have sex with men  engage in behavior that is likely to lead to HIV infection, even among men who are recruited from venues long associated with risk behavior, such as gay bathhouses , cruising areas  and online cruise sites  . Such an approach is called for in the National HIV/AIDS Strategy , which emphasizes the importance of bringing prevention to the most at risk populations . However, the advent of the Internet and its online cruise sites  has greatly increased the opportunities for and immediacy of meeting sexual partners.
Prostate cancer is one of the leading causes of death among men in the United States . Despite aggressive efforts toward early detection and treatment, the mortality rate for prostate cancer continues at a high level . Early stage prostate cancer requires androgen for growth and thus responds to androgen deprivation therapy .
Circulating peripheral blood monocytes represent a pleiotropic population of cells which are essential for innate immune responses to pathogenic micro organisms in the blood, mucosal surfaces and tissues . Peripheral blood monocytes, derived from bone marrow precursors, are recruited to sites of inflammation during bacterial infection . For certain infections monocytes may be the key mononuclear phagocyte mediating cell mediated immunity .
Ciclopirox olamine  , the ethanolamine salt of 6 cyclohexyl 1 hydroxy 4 methyl 2 pyridone, is a synthetic antifungal agent used to treat mycoses of the skin and nails for more than 20 years. The mechanisms of these actions of CPX seem diverse, involving disruption of membrane function in fungi, or targeting different metabolic  and energy producing processes in bacteria. , CPX also prevents the death of tropic factor deprived PC12 cells and postmitotic sympathetic neurons by blocking the cell cycle progression, or the death of cerebellar granule neurons in low K+ containing medium, but induces an active cell death in Saccharomyces cerevisiae.
The knee meniscus is a fibrocartilaginous tissue that provides stability within the joint, while also bearing and transmitting loads during normal locomotion. In response to joint loading, its semi circular wedge shape increases congruence between the convex femoral condyle and relatively flat tibial plateau, resulting in an inhomogeneous stress strain distribution within the tissue. Finite element models of the meniscus suggest that compressive forces dominate in the thinnest part of the wedge shape , while the thicker, more peripheral regions bear most of the circumferential tensile loads.
Acute myocardial infarction  is typically caused by platelet mediated thrombosis at the site of a ruptured or eroded atherosclerotic plaque. Anti platelet therapy with aspirin and clopidogrel is commonly prescribed early and continued following AMI to reduce recurrent ischemic events, but may cause an increase in the risk of bleeding. Both recurrent ischemic events and bleeding have been associated with increased late mortality., Recent studies have demonstrated wide variability of individual patient responsiveness to the inhibitory effects of clopidogrel on platelet aggregation, with potentially important implications for its clinical effectiveness and safety.
Higher step length variability is present in those with neurologic diseases and may precede dementia onset. Step length at preferred speeds is quite constant in healthy adults, but higher step length variability can be present in older adults without overt neurologic disease. Step control is a multifactorial process with involvement from the musculoskeletal system, peripheral nervous system, and central nervous system .
Although close contact is a well recognised risk factor for tuberculosis, the proportion of tuberculosis cases found attributable to identifiable contact with other cases is generally low,. This proportion can be estimated through traditional case control studies, asking about contacts, or by molecular epidemiological studies in which cases with shared DNA fingerprint patterns  are investigated. Estimates in sub Saharan Africa of the proportion of “clustered” cases with identifiable links range from 11 27%,.
Integrins are heterodimeric transmembrane receptors for extracellular matrix components that consist of non covalently linked α and β subunits . Eighteen α and 8 β subunits are identified in mammals  and they consist of a large extracellular domain, a transmembrane domain and a short cytoplasmic tail . The extracellular domain confers ligand specificity and is required for ligand interactions.
In disease states such as heart failure, myocardial infarction and hypertrophy, changes in the expression and location of Connexin43  occur , and may predispose to arrhythmias. Stretch may be an important stimulus to Cx43 remodeling; however, it has only been investigated in neonatal cell cultures, which have different physiological properties to adult myocytes. We hypothesized that localized stretch in vivo causes Cx43 remodeling, with associated changes in conduction, mediated by the renin/angiotensin system  .
It has been generally accepted that maximum vertical jumps could provide a reliable and sensitive assessment of various kinematic and kinetic variables . Nevertheless, the effect of Hcmd on vertical jumps remains largely neglected in literature. This phenomenon could explain the findings of some experimental and modeling studies suggesting that Hmax could be relatively insensitive to Hcmd .
Phosphatidylinositol and its phosphorylated derivatives  has long been known to have an important regulatory role in cell physiology . Phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5 triphosphate  and phosphatidylinositol 4,5 biphosphate  are two well known lipid second messengers . PIP2 on the other hand regulates a variety of diverse cellular activities, including modulation of the actin cytoskeleton, endocytosis, exocytosis, and ion channel activity  .
Humans have limited ability to repair injured or damaged organs. Recently, it has become clear that biophysical signals such as ion currents and patterned voltage gradients  are key components for the induction of regeneration and patterning of new tissue in structures such as amphibian limbs and mammalian corneas . The Xenopus larval tail is a complex organ containing multiple cell types: muscle, peripheral nerves, spinal cord, notochord, and vasculature.
The primary risk factor for cervical cancer is persistent infection with oncogenic subtypes of human papillomavirus  . The development of a prophylactic vaccine to prevent HPV infection represents an important step in reducing cervical cancer incidence and mortality. In 2006, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration  approved the first HPV vaccine for administration to females 926 years of age for the prevention of cervical cancer  .
Hypertension is a cardiovascular risk factor common among hemodialysis patients  and one which that may be better assessed using out of office blood pressure  monitoring either by home BP measurements or automatic interdialytic ambulatory BP recordings . Chronobiologic analysis reveals that arterial BP rhythms are markedly altered in patients on hemodialysis . Most hemodialysis patients have absence of nocturnal decline in BP, a phenomenon known as non dipping .
Glioblastoma  is the most common type of brain tumor and is associated with high morbidity and mortality rates. Patients with GBM routinely undergo surgery followed by adjuvant radiation therapy and chemotherapy. GBMs are among the most angiogenic of all human tumors, and the level of angiogenesis in GBMs is closely correlated with the degree of malignancy and patient prognosis  .
The complement system serves as a critical hub in the human innate immune and inflammatory system, and fulfills numerous roles in homeostasis, defense, repair, and disease . To achieve this most efficiently, the microbial surface must first be recognized by one of a series of pattern recognition proteins . Surface bound C4b then binds C2 to form the CP/LP C3 pro convertase which, when proteolytically activated by the same initiation complexes named above, gives rise to the fully active CP/LP C3 convertase, C4b2a.
The mesolimbic system, including the ventral tegmental area  and nucleus accumbens , is essential for reward seeking behavior. The NAcc integrates dopaminergic projections from the VTA and glutamatergic projections from limbic regions such as the basolateral amygdala , hippocampus, medial prefrontal cortex . The primary target of NAcc neurons is the ventral pallidum  , which in turn projects to the subthalamic nucleus, dopaminergic mesencephalon, and mediodorsal thalamus .
All proteins that traffic through the secretory pathway begin their journey when they are translocated as nascent polypeptides into the endoplasmic reticulum . The ER, a network of membrane bound tubular and sac like structures, provides an environment that is conducive for the folding and assembly of proteins into correct conformations that are functional and suitable for transport to their final destination . Xbp1 is required for development of specialized secretory cell types such as antibody secreting plasma cells  and pancreatic acinar cells  that are characterized by expansive networks of rough ER.
The microbial flora of the human oral cavity can be highly diverse, encompassing approximately 700 bacterial species , of which about ½ has not yet been grown in vitro. It is therefore of interest to characterize the normal flora of the elderly present in different oral sites. Significant site  and subject specificity has been shown in the microflora of the oral cavity of adults, but not of the elderly  .
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disorder that gradually damages the neocortex and hippocampus, reducing memory, learning and reasoning . A large body of evidence suggests that the accumulation of β amyloid  is a crucial event in the initiation and maintenance of neuronal degeneration in AD . Aβ neurotoxicity has been demonstrated both in vitro  and in vivo .
Treatment interventions for co occurring posttraumatic stress disorder  and substance use disorders  have shown promising results  and provide alternatives to traditional relapse prevention strategies for women in substance abuse treatment. However, given high drop out rates and difficulties with retention among this population, questions remain as to the specific conditions under which these women can best be engaged and benefit from treatment. While the evidence on racial/ethnic differences in prevalence rates of PTSD and SUDs is mixed , research findings indicate there are racial/ethnic disparities in the adverse consequences of these conditions and in access to mental health care .
Clinical resistance to anticancer therapies is a persistent problem that can be caused by genetic or epigenetic events occurring within cancer cells or by extracellular cues such as soluble factors or cell cell contacts . Ultimately, these diverse events lead to the activation of growth and survival signaling pathways within cancer cells that enable them to survive otherwise lethal pharmacological insults . By blocking these drug resistance pathways, it may be possible to improve the efficacy and durability of anticancer drugs.
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common cardiac arrhythmia and represents a significant health risk to the population. Therapy for AF seeks to restore normal sinus rhythm through pharmacologic cardioversion. Lack of ion channel selectivity and overlap in ion channel expression in the atria and ventricles however, underlies the nonspecific ventricular side effects of current pharmacological agents, .
Despite long standing interest in the relations between stress and eating behavior, the true nature of these associations and the underlying biological mechanisms involved remain poorly understood. Surgical removal of the adrenal glands  results in decreased food intake in rodents, and administration of glucocorticoids reverses this effect . If cortisol reactivity promotes obesity by stimulating food intake following stress, several findings would be anticipated.
Toxoplasma gondii is an obligate intracellular parasite of the phylum Apicomplexa, which also includes the deadly agent of malaria, Plasmodium falciparum. Another complex, composed of the transmembrane protein TgMIC6, is interacting with two soluble molecules TgMIC1 and TgMIC4. Parasites lacking TgAMA1 efficiently attach to host cells but are defective in rhoptry secretion, fail to create a MJ and are consequently unable to invade host cells .
Huntington’s disease  is associated with atrophy of the striatum and cerebral cortex, which leads to a loss of motor control and declines in cognitive function . The disease usually manifests in midlife and is due to an expansion in the CAG trinucleotide repeat within the gene encoding the protein huntingtin . Within the striatum, medium sized spiny neurons  are most susceptible to dysfunction and degeneration.
Allogeneic bone marrow transplantation  is currently used for the treatment of a variety of hematologic malignancies. It has also shown promise in solid cancers such as renal cell carcinomas  and in autoimmunity , but significant obstacles regarding acute graft versus host disease  still limit the broader use of this procedure. GVHD is an immune mediated disease in which donor T cells are primed mainly by recipient antigen presenting cells and then recognize and attack the genetically disparate recipient.
Alzheimer’s disease , the most common form of dementia, is characterized by progressive neurodegeneration and presence of two major histopathological lesions in the brain; neurofibrillary tangles and senile plaques. Although the amount of senile plaques is critical to the neuropathological diagnosis it does not relate to the degree of dementia . Instead, soluble Aβ correlates with the density of neurofibrillary tangles  and loss of synapses , i.e. with measures that are known to better reflect disease severity .
Stereotactic body radiotherapy  is now a well established treatment for medically inoperable early stage non small cell lung cancer , with 2 year local control rates ranging from 80 97%. However, an early prospective trial indicated that patients with centrally located lung tumors were at increased risk for severe pulmonary toxicity when treated with SBRT. As a result, tumors within a 2 cm radius of the proximal bronchial tree, often described as the “no fly zone ,” were excluded from the landmark RTOG 0236 trial  and are now being studied separately in a phase I/II trial  , which aims to determine the maximum tolerated dose  for SBRT in central lung tumors .
Gastrin is a peptide hormone produced primarily by endocrine G cells in the gastric antrum, with lower levels found in the duodenum and pituitary. First, the gastrin gene is expressed in the majority of colonic adenomas and cancers, and gastrin has been identified as an important downstream target of both Wnt and Ras signaling pathways. In these tumors, gastrin is present primarily in the nonamidated form due to the absence of processing enzymes in nonendocrine tissues .
The risk of injury associated with alcohol use is a function of the simultaneous combination of a number of factors . Although some of these characteristics are easier to measure than others, even if all were available and measured with high precision, the level of risk to which alcohol use exposes the drinker can still be quite variable due to the influence of a number of other key measured or unmeasured factors for which control may be difficult, such as context of injury , impulsivity/mood, others’ drinking, and weather/road conditions/condition of vehicles, etc. One epidemiologic approach used in an attempt to quantify the risk of injury associated with alcohol use is to compare, in a sample experiencing an injury, the amount consumed over a period of fixed length prior to injury to the same individuals’ consumption during a single control period of similar duration in which an injury did not occur.
Two trials have shown that male circumcision reduces the prevalence of high risk penile human papillomavirus  infection by approximately 35% in HIV negative men , and several cross sectional studies have found a lower rate of prevalent penile HPV infection in circumcised HIV uninfected men . However, it is unclear whether circumcision reduces the incidence of HPV acquisition or increases the clearance of preexisting HPV infection. One longitudinal observational study of 285 U.S. men, 25 of whom were circumcised, found no statistically significant difference in the hazards ratio  of acquisition of either high risk HPV  infections  or any HPV infection  in circumcised versus uncircumcised men .
With an estimated 20,000 procedures per year, multi component, inflatable penile prosthesis placement is the most common treatment for erectile dysfunction refractory to medical therapy. Device infection remains the most dreaded complication of penile prosthesis implantation as this inevitably results in additional operations with an increased risk of infection, tissues loss, urethral injury and penile shortening. Historically, infection rates have been cited as 3 5%, however, rates of less than 1% are often quoted in contemporary single surgeon series .
We assessed defibrillation strength shock induced changes of the membrane time constant  and membrane potential  in intact rabbit hearts after administration of lidocaine, a sodium  channel blocker, or nifedipine, a L type calcium  channel blocker . The experimental protocol was approved by the Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee of Cleveland Clinic. All animals used in this study received humane care in compliance with the National Institutes of Health’s Guide for the Care and Use of Laboratory Animals .
The beat to beat function of the L type calcium channel , CaV1.2, is to provide trigger Ca for excitation contraction coupling in cardiac myocytes. Over a longer time frame, LTCC Ca current  provides Ca that ultimately contributes to cellular Ca homeostasis. We recently showed that LTCC block by sustained in vivo pharmacological treatment results in an up regulation of ICa,L, CaV1.2 protein, and mRNA, in agreement with earlier studies .
Cystic fibrosis , an autosomal recessive disease manifesting progressive respiratory insufficiency, defective exocrine pancreatic secretion and elevated electrolyte concentration in the sweat, is related to loss of function mutations of the CF Transmembrane conductance Regulator  gene encoding a chloride transporting protein  . The major cause of morbidity and mortality of CF patients is chronic lung disease. However, current anti inflammatory drugs, such as corticosteroids, show limitations in terms of efficacy or occurrence of adverse effects in CF patients, suggesting the need of identifying novel molecular targets and more effective anti inflammatory drugs specifically tailored for CF pulmonary pathophysiology  .
Many congenital heart defects affect formation of the cardiac valves  structures needed to direct blood flow through the heart and prevent regurgitation. Heart valve defects such as bicuspid valves are relatively common but typically do not cause symptoms until adult life, at which time degeneration and calcification lead to deterioration of valve function. The cellular hallmarks of EMT are loss of endothelial cell cell contacts, delamination of ECs from the endothelium, cellular migration into the underlying extracellular matrix, and induction of α smooth muscle actin .
Rett syndrome  is a neurodevelopmental disorder caused by mutations in the gene encoding methyl CpG binding protein 2  that are predicted to result in loss of function of the protein  . Individuals affected with RTT are born healthy and experience normal development until 618 months of age, after which they enter a period characterized by regression of motor and language skills . RTT patients display a range of phenotypes that are predominantly expressed in the CNS, including stereotypical hand movements, problems with gait, social behavioral deficits associated with autistic like features, heightened anxiety, and loss of cognitive abilities including some learning disabilities  .
Lumbar disc surgery remains one of the most commonly performed operations, with rates exhibiting considerable geographic variation. Two recent randomized trials demonstrated that surgery provides faster pain relief and perceived recovery in patients with herniated disc. Outcomes were similar at 1 year for patients assigned to surgery and for those assigned to non operative treatment.
Dioxin like compounds are environmental contaminants of great concern produced as unwanted byproducts of industrial processes and combustion . Some are resistant to chemical and biological degradation and bioaccumulate in animals and humans . The most toxic dioxin is 2,3,7,8 tetrachlorodibenzo p dioxin .
A remarkable insight emerging from the molecular era of carcinogenesis research is the universality of certain molecular pathways in the pathogenesis of a diverse array of tumor types. Acute promyelocytic leukemia  provided another such opportunity when it was discovered that a reciprocal chromosomal translocation fusing the RARA and PML genes was the underlying cause of the differentiation defect that formed the basis for promyelocytic leukocytosis . This conclusion comes from three types of studies.
While chronic degenerative arthropathy is the main morbidity of hemophilia, a very high prevalance of low bone density is also seen in men and boys with hemophilia. The current study investigates bone degradation in the knee joint of hemophilic mice resulting from hemarthrosis and the efficacy of aggressive treatment with factor VIII in the period surrounding injury to prevent bone pathology . Skeletally mature factor VIII knock out mice were subjected to knee joint hemorrhage induced by puncture of the left knee joint capsule.
Gliomas are the most common primary tumors of the central nervous system, with glioblastomas  as the most malignant entity. Because local invasion of neoplastic cells into the surrounding brain is perhaps the most important aspect of the biology of gliomas precluding successful treatment, pharmacological inhibition of glioma cell migration and brain invasion is considered as a promising strategy for the treatment of GBM  . Microarray technology was used to explore the expression profile of migrating glioma cells.
Pushing is commonly used when opening doors or moving grocery shopping carts, as well as while moving goods in warehouse and distribution settings . Pushing activities are associated with 920% work related musculoskeletal disorders and low back injuries . The majority of studies are focused on investigating the magnitudes and directions of exerted pushing force .
Severe orthostatic hypotension and pre syncopal symptoms are the main cause of disability among patients with autonomic failure. The current recommended therapeutic approaches are limited to medications that increase sodium reabsorption and expand plasma volume such as fludrocortisones,,  or vasoactive agents such as the alpha 1 adrenergic agonist, midodrine. Pyridostigmine inhibits the enzyme acetylcholinesterase and increases the transmission of impulses from cholinergic neurons across the synaptic cleft.
Some of the best response rates with radionuclide therapy have been achieved in non Hodgkin’s lymphoma , which is considered to be a relatively radiosensitive malignancy that may be effectively treated with low dose rate radiation. While these results are promising, there is much room for improving efficacy with individualized treatment planning . In the majority of clinical radionuclide therapy studies, statistically significant tumor dose response correlations have not been established,, possibly due to inaccuracies in dose estimation.
There are substantial socioeconomic differences in rates of obesity and chronic diseases, including type 2 diabetes, and cardiovascular disease. Diet is a modifiable risk factor for such outcomes and as such is a likely contributor to health inequalities. Understanding the social and economic patterning of diet is important for informing public health action, as recognised by Public Health England in 2013 .
The central nervous system  plays an integral role in blood pressure regulation, primarily through sympathetic activation and mediation of various neurohumoral factors such as angiotensin II and vasopressin. Hormones such as these can access the circumventricular organs, which are adjacent to the cerebral ventricles and have a poorly formed blood brain barrier. The circumventricular organs implicated in blood pressure control include the organum vasculosum of the lamina terminalis , the area postrema, the subfornical organ and the anteroventral third ventricle  region.
Canavan disease  is a rare recessive autosomal white matter leukodystrophy  that is caused by mutations of the aspartoacylase gene . The disease has a high prevalence in people of Askenazi Jewish origin , and it is characterized by the presence of widespread spongy degeneration in the brain and spinal cord . Affected individuals suffer from mental retardation, weakness, blindness and functional disability, and most die by the age of five  .
Male mammals display a wide range of complex social behaviors toward young that can range from aggression to indifference to parental care . In addition to a lack of parental care, male mammals may also exhibit extreme aggression towards infants resulting in infanticide. For many species in which individual males engage in high levels of parental behavior at one time the same male will, at another stage of life, exhibit aggression towards young.
Citrobacter rodentium is a natural mouse pathogen. It is the causative agent of transmissible murine colonic hyperplasia, and is responsible for high mortality in suckling mice . As a member of the attaching and effacing  family of bacterial pathogens, and the only known AE pathogen to naturally infect mice, it is a valuable model organism for the study of pathogenesis of the clinically significant human pathogens, enteropathogenic Escherichia coli  and enterohaemorrhagic E. coli  .
The topology of chromatin is regulated by precise mechanisms that govern consistent packaging and replication of DNA, and also play a critical role in transcriptional regulation. Modulating this process in rapidly dividing cells may be a potentially important anti neoplastic strategy. Histone acetyltransferases  and histone deacetylases  work in an opposing manner by acetylating and deacetylating histones, respectively.
The recent advent of pathway targeted chemotherapeutic agents, such as gefitinib and erlotinib, has led to improved therapy for a small subgroup of patients with advanced lung cancer. However, research findings have demonstrated that tumors with similar clinical characteristics  may respond differently to the same drug. The mitogen activated protein kinase kinase  is one of the critical molecules in the Ras/Raf/MEK/ERK cascade, which mediates signal transduction from Ras/Raf to extracellular signal regulated kinases  through phosphorylation of both tyrosine  and threonine  residues of ERK proteins.
The concept of neighborhood holds significance in South Africa. Under the apartheid regime , residential areas were forcefully segregated through the Group Areas Act of 1950  which restricted certain racial groups in terms of ownership and land occupation. The 1980's in South Africa was arguably one of the most violent periods , characterized by civil unrest, torture, and the slaying of political figures, actions undertaken by the apartheid regime against its citizens .
The adolescent period is one of rapid and transformative development, characterized by efforts to confront and surmount challenges and to establish a sense of identity and autonomy. While the majority of adolescents manage the sometimes turbulent transition from childhood to adulthood becoming healthy and productive adults, there is an emerging concern that far too many adolescents may not achieve their full potential . Of particular concern are behaviors that place adolescents at risk for HIV infection, other sexually transmitted infections , and unintended pregnancy, in essence, sexual risk behaviors  .
The successful demonstration that epidural electrical stimulation of posterior spinal cord structures can suppress pain , led to a widely spread clinical practice of spinal cord stimulation  to modify the severity of perception of nociceptive and neuropathic pain. Clinical practice of SCS has been extensively reviewed . SCS for pain control has generally been applied to the thoracic spinal cord.
The hierarchy used for identifying hematopoietic and endothelial progenitors provides a unique quantitative method for assessing the degree of heterogeneity in stem cell cultures and may offer important insights into mesenchymal stem cell  biology. Hematopoietic high proliferative potential colony forming cells  obtained from both mouse and human bone marrow have been shown to form large colonies  in double layer agar cultures and differentiate into multiple hematopoietic cell types . Low proliferative potential colony forming cells  are defined as hematopoietic cells that can grow into colonies smaller than HPP CFC but greater than 50 cells .
In vivo thermoregulatory temperature responses of mammalian brains to radio frequency  heating are unknown for ultra high field magnetic resonance  systems . Studying these responses are necessary to develop appropriate RF safety guidelines for human MR imaging at the highest fields . Spatially unique correlations were reported between the whole head average specific absorption rate  and the maximum brain and rectal temperature changes during RF heating.
The inner ear comprises a fluid filled epithelium within a labyrinthine space ofthe temporal bone. Dilation of ES and ED epithelia is thought to cause thebony malformation pathognomonic for EVA. Studies of the ear in targeted mouse mutants that lack functionalpendrin have uncovered a pathological cascade involving dilation of the fluid filled earepithelium, altered ionic composition of the luminal fluid endolymph, malformation ofacellular matrix structures , changes in protein expression, metabolic stress, andpost natal death of the ear's primary sensory  cells .
Mating systems determine how genes combine into genotypes, and therefore strongly affect population genetic structure  and evolutionary potential . The mating systems of flowering plants have been the subject of especially intense scrutiny because of the many ways in which sexual organs can be deployed across individuals and populations, the prevalence of animal mediated mating, the array of morphological and biochemical adaptations known to affect plant mating systems, and the repeated evolution of largely self fertilizing species from outcrossing ancestors . The dynamics of plant mating systems have attracted theoretical attention ever since Fisher  pointed out the substantive advantage of an allele capable of self fertilization.
Campylobacter is a leading bacterial cause of food born disease worldwide , representing a huge health challenge. Young children remain most susceptible both in the developing and the developed world . Rarely, some infections due to specific C. jejuni serotypes result in serious post infectious complications like bacteremia, arthritis, Reiter's syndrome and Guillain Barré syndrome  .
Obesity continues as a growing trend in the United States, with over 32% of the adult population with a BMI ≥30. Moreover, unintentional injury remains the fifth leading cause of death among adults. Obese trauma patients continue to be clinically challenging as they are more than five times more likely to die from their injury than their non obese counterparts.
COMMD proteins are a group of evolutionarily conserved factors present in a wide range of organisms . All ten members of this family are found in vertebrates and are also present in Dictyostelium discoideum. In addition, several COMMD genes are also identifiable in Drosophila and Caenorhabditis species, as well as in various unicellular protozoa  .
Organic solvents are chemicals that are ubiquitous in occupational settings. Solvents are present in the workplace through the use of adhesives, paints, degreasing agents, and cleaning products. Solvents such as benzene and trichloroethylene have been recognized by the International Agency for Research on Cancer  and the US National Toxicology Program  as known human carcinogens; however there is limited data on solvents as human breast carcinogens  .
Tuberous sclerosis complex  is an autosomal dominant disorder resulting from mutations in either the TSC1  or TSC2  gene . In addition to autism and cognitive disabilities, epilepsy is the most common neurological symptom of TSC and is present in 7080% of individuals with TSC ). Epilepsy is in most cases difficult to manage with antiepileptic drugs and often requires surgical resection of one or more tubers  .
The preBötzinger Complex  is essential for normal breathing in rodents  and is postulated to be an essential site for respiratory rhythm generation . In brainstem spinal cord  and transverse slice in vitro preparations, respiratory rhythm persists in the absence of postsynaptic inhibition . Many models for rhythmogenesis predicate a significant role, often obligatory, for excitatory, presumably glutamatergic, pacemaker neurons .
Recent reports from the District of Columbia  Department of Health describe an HIV epidemic in Washington comparable to that in East Africa . Three percent of adults in the US capital are known to be living with HIV; many more remain undiagnosed and unable to obtain either lifesaving care or counseling to reduce the spread of infection  . In response to the continuing spread of HIV in the US and internationally, both the US National Institutes of Health  and the World Health Organization  have committed to implementing and evaluating universal testing and treatment for prevention of HIV infection .
Lipid transmembrane diffusion  is of great interest to the biophysical community. For these species, spontaneous flip fop may still be an important mechanism of transmembrane redistribution . While there has been some progress in the attempt to identify plasma membrane flippases, study of flip flop in biogenic membranes, such as the ER membrane, has revealed important mechanistic differences for flip flop in these two cellular environments.
The shared tumor associated antigens  that are potential targets of cancer immunotherapy primarily consist of non mutated self antigens that are either lineage specific or overexpressed. Due to immunological tolerance towards these proteins, B cells producing high affinity antibodies and T cells expressing high affinity T cell receptors  are often deleted, making the remaining repertoire relatively unresponsive to active immunization. Furthermore, for those antigens for which self tolerance is incomplete, the process of tumor development can actively tolerize the remaining T cells .
The clinical uses of mobile health  are broad and have expanded rapidly over the past decade but there has been little research on how useful these tools are across patient populations. The ubiquity of cell phones and touchscreen technology presents the opportunity to use mHealth tools to bridge gaps in health disparities if underserved communities accept and can easily use such tools. Few studies have evaluated the use of touchscreen technology for health questionnaires and have found that a majority of patients prefer the touchscreen to paper, including those with low health literacy and minorities .
This study evaluates polyomavirus JC  large T antigen  as a potential target for drug development. LTA is a hexameric protein with a helicase activity that is powered by ATP binding and hydrolysis. The helicase and ATPase function is critical for viral replication .
Representations arising from distracting stimuli interfere with our ability to selectively attend to task relevant information. Young adults during performance of the incongruent trials activate a network of regions including the bilateral middle frontal gyrus, bilateral inferior frontal gyrus, anterior cingulate cortex  and the parietal cortex  due to increased attentional control required to overcome the task irrelevant dimensions of the incongruent condition . Neuroimaging research has demonstrated increased recruitment of brain regions by older adults to perform cognitive tasks in which younger adults more selectively recruit neural resources .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinomas  are malignancies of the upper aerodigestive tract, including the mouth, larynx, and pharynx. HNSCC represents the sixth most common malignancy in the United States and accounts for ~500,000 new cancer cases per year worldwide . However, despite rapid approval of cetuximab for use in HNSCC by the Food and Drug Administration , improvement in patient survival with the use of this agent has been only modestly incremental.
Cholestasis, or impaired bile flow, is a form of liver disease that has various etiologies and can result in liver failure. There are numerous causes of cholestasis, and apoptosis has been proposed as a mechanism of bile acid induced liver injury . CAR may have a role in cell death via apoptosis by altering expression of Bcl 2 family proteins such as myeloid cell leukemia 1 .
Amphipathic polymers have demonstrated great potential as suitable membrane substitutes . Among the reasons that favor amphipols over conventional detergent based surfactants are their ability to increase stability of the embedded membrane protein in certain cases as well as their good refolding properties in particular for seven transmembrane helical  proteins . Ligand binding capabilities of amphipol refolded GPCRs could be demonstrated and high resolution insights of the LTB4 ligand while bound to perdeuterated BLT2 receptor could be obtained using homonuclear 1H spectroscopy of the ligand.
Gene expression refers to the process of synthesizing a functional gene productfrom the information encoded in a gene, and the study of gene expression is central tobiomedical research. While the traditional method of gene expression analysis is microarraytechnology, next generation sequencing technologies offer a competitive alternative inRNAseq. One of the interesting features of RNAseq technology is its ability to sequencemicroRNA , which are small, non coding species of RNA that play a variety of roles inthe regulation of gene expression.
The asymmetric distribution of molecules in polarized cells is a hallmark of metazoan development. For example, one characteristic of the anterior posterior axis of Drosophila oocytes is the concentration of bicoid RNA at the anterior pole and oskar RNA at the posterior pole. Polarization in neurons is evident not only by axonal and dendritic extensions, but also by the mRNAs that they contain,.
Alzheimer’s disease  is the most prevalent form of dementia worldwide. Amyloidogenesis results from the successive proteolysis of the membrane tethered amyloid precursor protein . First, APP is cleaved by a β secretase, releasing a large soluble fraction of APP into the milieu.
Conventional chemoradiation  for locally or regionally advanced squamous cell head and neck cancer  results in 2 year progression free survival  rates of only approximately 35% . Relapse has historically been predominantly locoregional . Cetuximab with RT improved locoregional control and survival compared to RT alone .
Neonatal strokes occur in ~1 per 4000 term births and commonly present with acute seizures . Thus stroke in the developing brain is a significant cause of associated neurological co morbidities that persist into adulthood . The data in the immature brain is controversial; some data show an increase in the survival of hippocampal precursor neurons and others show a decrease in the survival of this cell population .
The nervous system regulates epithelial homeostasis in different ways, and this regulation by the nervous system partly involves modulation of stem and progenitor cells . There is also crosstalk between tumor cells and nerves, such that tumors induce active neurogenesis, resulting in increased neuronal density in preneoplastic and neoplastic tissues . In addition, activation of muscarinic receptors has been shown to promote cell transformation and cancer progression .
More than 750,000 new strokes occur each year in the USA alone. Worldwide, stroke is responsible for approximately 4.4 million deaths  annually . As life expectancy increases, the incidence of stroke will continue to rise  and improvements in medical care will increase survival rates, leading to increased numbers of stroke survivors in our communities .
Systemic lupus erythematosus  patients have a 5 fold greater risk of myocardial infarction, occurring at a mean age of 49 , leading to a bimodal pattern of death where cardiovascular disease  is a leading cause of mortality 10 years after diagnosis of SLE . Young women  with SLE are approximately 50 times more likely to have an MI versus age matched control subjects . Relative risk in a separate SLE cohort for MI or stroke was 10.1 and 7.9, respectively, even after controlling for Framingham factors .
Alcohol misuse among college students continues to be a significant public health concern, marked by negative consequences . Research on naturalistic change among adults demonstrates that risky drinkers often make changes to their drinking without treatment . Other variables have yet to be examined .
Poxviruses are large, complex, enveloped DNA viruses that replicate in the cytoplasm of infected cells . Two major infectious forms of VACV have been characterized. Thus, the EV is essentially a MV with an additional lipoprotein membrane.
Advances in donor management, organ preservation, surgical technique, post operative care and immunosuppression have improved overall survival rates following lung transplantation, but the incidence of lung ischemia reperfusion injury  remains unchanged at 20% . Characterization of the cellular mechanisms leading to the development of LIRI may lead to therapeutic interventions and improved outcomes . The early response occurs following 90 minutes of ischemia and 15 minutes of reperfusion and involves the nuclear translocation of proinflammatory transcription factors with subsequent upregulation of transcription and secretion of inflammatory cytokines and chemokines .
Hypoxic ischemic brain injury results in cerebral palsy , mental retardation or learning disabilities in surviving children . Hypoxia ischemia is also associated with subsequent cerebral injury in a disproportionately high percentage of the survivors of premature birth ; ). We have generated a rabbit model of antenatal hypoxia at 70% gestation resulting in survivors that manifest early signs consistent with cerebral palsy ; ).
Mycobacteriosis is recognized as a significant disease problem in zebrafish research facilities . Findings range from overt disease outbreaks with high mortality to incidental findings where few fish show signs of disease. Several species of Mycobacterium have been identified, and experimental exposures indicate dramatic differences between species and strains .
In the CNS, myelin sheaths are elaborated by oligodendrocytes, which spirally ensheath segments of axons with multilayered compact membranes. Early experimental measurements suggest that myelin insulates the internodal axonal membrane by forming a high resistance, low capacitance compartment around the axon . Intracellular recordings in large myelinated fibers have substantiated this view, but demonstrate that myelin is less resistive than originally thought.
Pain perception is strongly modulated by dynamic adaptive processes e.g., , , . Although the degree of pain is driven by the intensity of a noxious stimulus, there is also a substantial portion of variance arising from temporal adaptation processes that may or may not interact with stimulus intensity , . The temporal dynamics of pain, and the ability to estimate them accurately, may hold keys to understanding multiple mechanisms of pain regulation, as well as the development of chronic pain , , ,  .
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related mortality in the United States when both sexes are combined . It has been estimated that 5 to 10% of CRC cases are secondary to a genetic condition, with Lynch syndrome  being the most common Mendelian disorder predisposing to CRC and accounting for 3 to 5% of all CRC  . Lynch syndrome is secondary to the presence of germline mutations in the genes involved in the DNA mismatch repair  pathway: MLH1, MSH2, MSH6 and PMS2 .
Survival rates for lung cancer have been low for many years , mostly because the majority of patients present with advanced stage disease.. Lung cancer risk can be estimated by several factors that can be easily determined, including smoking history, age, previous tobacco related malignancy, family history of lung cancer and the presence of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease . However, clinical prediction based on these risk factors is poor at the individual level , and there is an urgent need for non invasive assays for early detection of lung cancer among smokers and former smokers.
The endogenous opioid peptides consist of the enkephalins, the endorphins and the dynorphins which are proteolytic products of proenkephalin, proopiomelanocortin, and prodynorphin, respectively. Dynorphin A  is one of the major proteolytic fragments of prodynorphin and is widely distributed in the central nervous system. Unlike the enkephalins or endorphins, however, administration of dynorphin A either systemically or intrathecally produces little or no antinociception,,.
The management of drug resistant HIV has improved dramatically with the recent approval of a number of highly effective antiretroviral drugs . Among these is raltegravir , the first clinically available inhibitor of HIV integrase. When used in combination with other active drugs, raltegravir has proven to be very potent, well tolerated, and highly effective  .
Within the uterus, the female sex steroids estrogen and progesterone play pivotal roles in the establishment of a suitable environment for embryo implantation and pregnancy. In order to bring about these changes, estrogen and progesterone must appropriately modulate the expression of a variety of factors which includes growth factors, cytokines, extracellular matrix proteins, and adhesion molecules . miRNAs are transcribed from specific genes which reside between protein coding genes, within introns of genes, within exons or which make up the entire intron .
The ability to easily evaluate respiratory function in children with asthma is of central importance in terms of following the course of disease. With respect to asthma clinical research, physiologic tests are commonly used to define the effects of intervention. However, this approach may have limitations.
The basal ganglia  are an evolutionarily conserved set of brain nuclei widely implicated in motor control and learning . The songbird area X, for example, is a specialized striato pallidal nucleus homologous to the mammalian basal ganglia  . The projection patterns of these two populations are similar to neurons in the internal  and external  segments of the primate globus pallidus, consistent with mounting evidence that the division of the BG into direct and indirect pallidal pathways has existed for over 300 million years, predating the division of birds, mammals and reptiles into separate classes  .
Monoclonal gammopathy of undetermined significance  is a precursor lesion for multiple myeloma , an incurable bone marrow malignancy with an annual incidence of approximately 4.6 per 100,000. Historically, MGUS has been characterized by evidence of immunoglobulin heavy chain  expression, but could therefore only account for 80% of MM cases since 20% of MM cases secrete no IgH . The prevalence and risk of progression of the premalignant precursor entity for these light chain only MM  cases is unknown .
Microtubules  are cytoskeletal polymeric structures that are assembled from heterodimers of α  and β tubulin proteins . Several parameters used to characterize MT dynamic instability include the rates of growth and shortening that together define dynamicity, and the frequency of transitioning between the two phases termed ‘catastrophe’ and ‘rescue’ . The complexity entailed in MT instability is essential to the biological functions that MTs perform during cell division, migration, and intracellular trafficking .
One common issue experienced by rare diseases patients, their families, and health professionals is the lack of information about a specific disorder . Several comprehensive sources of information about rare diseases have emerged in the past decade in the U.S. and in Europe, including the Genetic and Rare Diseases Information Center  , the Rare Disease Database created by the National Organization for Rare Disorders   and Orphanet . The Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man  is the oldest of these resources and provides extremely detailed information about human genes and genetic phenotypes, but is intended primarily for use by health professionals .
Synaptic information processing depends on the amplitude and time course of neurotransmitter release from presynaptic terminals. Therefore, modifications in vesicle endo  and exocytosis can lead to altered synaptic interactions and information coding in neural circuits ,  . While synchronous release provides rapid communication with postsynaptic neurons, asynchronous release modulates postsynaptic excitability within relatively long periods of time.
Rehospitalizations cost Medicare $17 billion annually, are potentially avoidable, and a publicly reported statistic . A variety of disease based strategies can reduce the need for rehospitalization. For example, starting inhaled corticosteroids during the index hospitalization for asthma patients is associated with a 40% reduction in rehospitalization.
A rise in the incidence of hepatitis C virus  infection among men who have sex with men  has been reported . In HIV negative individuals with recent HCV, sustained virological response  ranges from 57 88% with pegylated interferon  mono therapy ,  with no evidence of additional benefit for ribavirin . In those with HIV/HCV, treatment recommendations are less clear .
Exposure to arsenic is a major public health concern throughout the world. Whether the source is naturally occurring deposits or industrial and agricultural runoff, the primary route of human exposure is contaminated ground water. Long term arsenic exposure is associated with increased risks of numerous human cancers , and so, arsenic has been classified as a human carcinogen by both the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency and the IARC.
It is becoming increasingly evident that precise regulation of eukaryotic gene expression requires communication between cis acting elements through alterations in higher order chromatin structure . Upon Ig gene rearrangement, the germ line, unrearranged IgH and Igκ alleles become deposited into pericentromeric heterochromatin and silenced  . We found that the three transcriptional enhancers and rearranged V gene promoters exhibited B cell specific proximal interactions over 22 kb, with the intervening DNA looping out.
Managed care has been deployed as a cost containment policy in the Medicaid program for more than thirty years. In this paper, I offer one attempt to resolve these conflicts by comparing Medicaid health care expenditures for adults with disabilities  across three Medicaid program types, FFS, mandatory managed care organizations  and voluntary MCOs . First, particularly due to the challenge of setting accurate capitation rates in this population, capitated reimbursement may provide a strong incentive to MCOs to reduce care provision in general.
Magnetic resonance microscopy  has become a standard tool for investigating cardiac structure and function in the mouse. The majority of MR work on mice has been done with 2D acquisition methods with limited resolution along the third axis . 3D studies have shown promise in the clinical arena as they increase signal to noise ratio  per unit time and allow for higher in plane resolution, ultimately allowing more sensitive calculation of cardiac function.
Mucolipidosis type IV  is a human lysosomal storage disorder caused by dysfunction of the mucolipin 1  protein . Clinical manifestations of ML IV include neuromotor retardation, retinal degeneration, corneal opacity, and gastric abnormality . TRPML1 belongs to the transient receptor potential  superfamily of ion channels.
The increased signal to noise ratio  at the static magnetic field  of 3T may improve cardiac MRI and MR spectroscopy  applications that are constrained by limited SNR at 1.5T . Noeske et al reported B0 field variations over the left ventricle  of ±130Hz . Furthermore, the overall increased B0 inhomogeneity makes the determination of the on resonance frequency f0 more challenging.
Bronchopulmonary dysplasia  develops in about 25% of very low birth weight infants, and remains a major cause of pulmonary morbidity and mortality in infancy . While the effects of oxygen toxicity on the pulmonary vasculature of the immature lung are well established , lipopolysaccharide  mediated endothelial injury can contribute to the vascular remodeling seen in BPD  by inhibiting endothelial cell proliferation, migration and angiogenesis. In premature infants, exposure to bacteria is common, can occur in utero or postnatally, and is associated with subsequent development of BPD .
Latinos are the largest and fastest growing ethnic minority group in the United States . A distinctive characteristic of the U.S. Latino population is its large number of immigrants. Today, the majority of immigrants gaining entry into the United States are Latino .
The use of alternative and complementary medicine has soared in popularity with patients, not just for improvement of baseline health, but even in the management of chronic conditions like psoriasis , . There is a growing body of popular and scientific literature for the use of nutritional supplementation in the treatment of psoriasis. With this information readily available, patients often perform independent research and ask their dermatologists about what they can add to their diets to make their condition more manageable.
The edge chipping test was originally developed in the late 1980s to study hard metal cutting tools at the National Physical Laboratory in London . Chips are formed by advancing an indenter into a material near an edge as shown in the insert of . This work has continued the ensuing years  including three papers in this Journal in 2014.
Alzheimer's disease  and its prodromal state, mild cognitive impairment , cause early episodic memory deficits . Later in its course, AD causes abnormally rapid decline in non memory cognitive domains and eventually leads to deterioration of most or all aspects of cognitive functioning . Because factors such as age and education play a role in determining AD risk and rate of cognitive decline, neuropsychological tests should also be capable of accounting for these individual differences  .
Contrast enhanced coronary MR angiography  has been proven to be a promising technique for high quality anatomic imaging of coronary arteries . Recently, Bi et al proposed a slow contrast injection scheme for whole heart coronary MRA . An empirical acquisition delay of 25  or 60  seconds was used.
Little is known about the frequency of persistent pain after endodontic procedures, even though pain is a core patient oriented outcome. We estimated the frequency of persistent pain, regardless of etiology, following endondontic treatment . Persistent tooth pain was defined as pain present ≥ 6 months after endodontic treatment.
During the past decade, gene expression profiling has become a powerful tool for predicting risk of breast cancer recurrence and mortality. Several gene expression profiles have been found to predict risk of recurrence in untreated breast cancer patients and in those treated with hormonal therapy and/or chemotherapy . Oncotype DX is a commercially available, validated 21 gene assay that quantifies risk of distant recurrence in node negative , estrogen receptor positive , tamoxifen treated breast cancer patients .
DJ 1 is one of the genes that cause inherited forms of Parkinson's disease  when mutated . DJ 1  maps to chromosome 1p36  and encodes a 189 amino acid protein. Mutations in this gene were originally found to segregate with PD in two consanguineous families, one with a large genomic deletion leading to absence of gene product, and the other with a missense mutation substituting a highly conserved leucine with a proline at position 166  .
Diffusion weighted magnetic resonance imaging  shows promise as an imaging biomarker for treatment response in glioma patients  as well as in a variety of other clinical tumor types . Routine in almost all preclinical and clinical scanners, diffusion maps can be generated from a minimum of two images acquired at low  and high  diffusion weightings. This initial report has been verified and expanded by ensuing publications using different tumor models and therapeutic agents , supporting the use of diffusion MRI as a sensitive imaging biomarker capable of detecting early cellular changes in treated tumors which precede macroscopic volumetric response .
Thiol disulfide exchange reactions are universal among all living cells. The two basic functions of the system are to supply electrons to biosynthetic enzymes, including ribonucleotide reductase, methionine sulfoxide reductase, and sulfate reductases, and to reduce inter  and intramolecular disulfides in oxidized proteins. The thioredoxin system also serves a critical role in protection from oxidative stress in many organisms .
P70S6K1 is activated through PI3K  and MAPK pathways . P70S6K1 is known to regulate cell growth by inducing protein synthesis. PTEN is a molecular inhibitor of PI3K.
Innate lymphoid cells  are emerging as important effector cells in innate immunity and tissue homeostasis . Type 2 ILCs  produce Th2 cytokines, such as IL 5 and IL 13, and play important roles in a variety of immune responses, including immunity to helminths, airway and skin inflammation, and tissue remodeling . However, we have limited knowledge about the ability of ILC2s to work together with other immune cells.
The Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome, caused by a novel coronavirus  infected 8000 individuals in 2002 2003, with an approximate 10% mortality rate . From these initial studies, several salient observations emerged. Second, SARS CoV vaccines were more effective in young than aged animal populations, in terms of protection from clinical disease and the development of a neutralizing antibody response .
Over 500 evidence based treatments  for child and adolescent mental health disorders exist, many with multiple randomized controlled trials  supporting their efficacy in improving outcomes and functioning., Organizational champions  individuals who make use of their reputations and informal status to support a change effort  have been identified as an important facilitator in theoretical models of implementation. Empirical studies support the effectiveness of local champions in facilitating implementation, particularly in its earlier phases . The most commonly used implementation strategy has been in person training for mental health professionals.
Point resolved spectroscopy  combined with 3 D phase encoding is commonly used for acquiring clinical magnetic resonance spectroscopic imaging  data. This provides metabolic data with excellent quality for patients with brain tumors and has been shown to be important for defining tumor burden . This method is currently limited by how much of the anatomic lesion can be covered within a single examination.
Cannabis is the world's most popular illicit substance. Over a similar time period, there also appears to have been a marked change in the constituents of the cannabis available on the street . Cannabis contains around 70 different chemicals which are unique to the plant and called cannabinoids.
The present study investigated the rate and pattern of neuropsychological recovery in heavy episodic drinking teens during the initial days to weeks of abstinence from alcohol . Adolescents  with histories of heavy episodic drinking  and socio demographically similar control teens  were recruited from San Diego area schools. HED and CON were comparable on 5th grade standardized math and language arts test performance to ensure similar functioning prior to onset of substance use.
Fibrates are lipid lowering drugs and they are used in patients with hypercholesterolemia and hypertriglyceridemia. Fibrates activate peroxisome proliferator activated receptors  with a higher affinity for PPARα than that for PPARγ and PPARδ . PPARs are ligand activated transcription factors belonging to the nuclear receptor family.
Neurogenesis continues throughout adulthood in vertebrates, due to endogenous progenitor cells which could be useful for brain repair . Growth factors are important components of stem cell niches . Neurotrophins are well known for promoting neuronal survival and for modulating synaptic plasticity .
Prostate cancer is the second most frequently diagnosed cancer in men worldwide . These deficiencies have resulted in an increased number of painful biopsies, over treatment of the disease and undesired side effects  for patients. PET and PET/CT imaging techniques employing   and  labeled choline have also been used for the detection of prostate cancers and have shown particular benefit with the evaluation of disease recurrence  .
HDL levels are inversely related to the incidence of cardiovascular disease, and increasing HDL can reduce atherosclerosis in animal models. , A principal anti atherogenic property of HDL is thought to be its ability to promote cholesterol efflux from macrophage foam cells. In addition, HDL has been described to have various anti inflammatory properties, including its ability to bind lipopolysaccharide, to remove oxidized lipids from LDL and to carry enzymes such as platelet activating factor acetylhydrolase  and paraoxonase  which inactivate oxidized phospholipids.
Interests in the biochemistry of animal venoms started decades ago. One that has caught the attention of biologists, neuroscientists and the pharmaceutical industry is the venom of Conus species of marine gastropods, each of which contain a potent cocktail of 100 200 neuroactive peptides. Subsequent studies on many conotoxins from different species indicated that the prepropeptides of conotoxins belonging to the same superfamily have a highly conserved signal sequence , a relatively conserved pro region, and a highly variable C terminal toxin encoding region.
Plasmodium falciparum, the most virulent of the parasites causing human malaria, has the unique ability to sequester in the vasculature of diverse host organs. Sequestration resulting from the adherence of erythrocytes that contain mature forms of P. falciparum  to the vascular endothelium occurs in all infections. However, several adhesive phenotypes have been associated with severe pathological outcomes of malaria, such as the formation of rosettes, and the sequestration of infected erythrocytes  in the microvasculature of the brain and the placenta.
The recent development of metabolic imaging of hyperpolarized 13C labeled compounds  presents new opportunities for the in vivo investigation of metabolism under normal and pathologic conditions. One of the technical challenges is the limited time available for imaging before the hyperpolarized signal has decayed to thermal equilibrium levels. An alternative strategy for exploiting spectral sparsity is undersampled spiral CSI .
Solid tumors possess a variety of physiological abnormalities that pose a barrier for conventional non surgical therapies . Additionally, the extracellular matrix  of tumors is reactive and contractile, supporting vascular proliferation and exerting mechanical stress on blood vessels to further compromise perfusion . Elevations in IFP result in reduction of transvascular hydrostatic pressure gradients.
WT1 is a zinc finger transcription factor that can activate or repress target genes that control cell growth and development. WT1 is subject to alternative splicing in two regions; a 17 amino acid insertion within the central region of the protein  and the insertion of three amino acids  within the zinc finger region . WT1 is expressed in several organs and tissues of the embryo and is particularly important for the development of the urogenital system where it functions as a tumor suppressor,.
Flow cytometry has traditionally been a manually intensive technique. However, automated high throughput FCM methods have recently been developed to rapidly collect large data sets with complexities similar to gene microarrays . The large amount of complex information generated by high throughput technologies needs to be processed in an automated, well describable way.
The mechanisms by which alcohol causes cell injury are still not clear. Bradford et al  reported that CYP2E1 but not NADPH oxidase was required for ethanol induced oxidative DNA damage in rodent liver and may play a key role in ethanol associated hepatocarcinogenesis, whereas NADPH oxidase but not CYP2E1 played the major role in ethanol induced hepatotoxicity. There is also a need to evaluate the role of CYP2E1 in the actions of ethanol in oral models of ethanol administration.
In living cells, intense electric pulses of nanosecond duration  impair the barrier function of membranous structures, including the plasma membrane, endoplasmic reticulum, and mitochondria . The membrane defects produced by nsEP have been intensively studied experimentally  as well as by molecular dynamics  and other simulation techniques , but their exact nature remains elusive . This pore size was established both by the selective uptake of smaller dye molecules and ions , and by blockage of cell swelling using solutes too large to pass through the pores .
Adult Purkinje cells each receive input from a single climbing fiber , which makes hundreds of synapses across its highly branched main dendrites . Understanding complex spike generation is therefore essential for understanding information processing and plasticity in Purkinje cells . The mechanism of complex spike generation has been debated for decades .
Coronary artery disease is the leading cause of death in the western world, and is responsible for approximately 450,000 deaths per year in the United States . High field MRI platforms can also lead to improved SNR, which is roughly proportional to the static magnetic field strength. However, SSFP imaging suffers from sensitivity to B0 inhomogeneity .
Dysregulated production of nitric oxide  is implicated in the pathogenesis of heart transplant failure, although the mechanisms by which this occurs in humans remains incompletely defined. NO has several biological properties that are concentration and cell source dependent. For instance, NO promotes T cell activation at low levels, but suppresses T cell responses at high concentrations.
Students with math difficulties  demonstrate varying levels of reading performance: Some students perform adequately in reading, whereas others demonstrate concurrent reading difficulties . As proposed by , this dichotomy may represent a productive scheme for subtyping MD . Deficits in phonological processing hinder acquisition of vocabulary and math facts, therefore leading to MDRD.
Mitochondria produce ATP that fuels excitation contraction coupling. They are also sources of damaging reactive oxygen species . Preserving cardiac mitochondrial health is therefore essential to maintaining normal cardiac function.
Murine models of rheumatoid arthritis  like disease have been essential for our understanding of disease pathogenesis and for preclinical testing of therapeutic agents. Autoreactive T cells prime B cells to secrete anti G6PI autoantibodies, which form antigen antibody immune complexes  in serum and tissues. Thus, the K/BxN serum transfer induced arthritis  model is ideal for establishing the kinetics of disease onset and resolution, while the K/BxAg7 model demonstrates the effects of chronic arthritis on bone and soft tissue structures .
The TIM proteins are a recently discovered family of molecules that play critical roles in the regulation of effector T cells. TIM 3 was shown to be an important regulator of pro inflammatory immune responses, notably in the central nervous system , as blocking the TIM 3 pathway using anti TIM 3 mAbs or TIM 3 Ig fusion proteins in mice led to increased proliferation and IFNγ production in Th1 cells and exacerbated the clinical and pathological features of experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  . TIM 3 expressing CD4+ and CD8+ T cells produce reduced amounts of cytokines or are less proliferative in response to antigens .
  This was a prospective observational study conducted at an academic, tertiary care ED. A satisfaction survey was conducted to determine the perceived value of this service to ED staff. This study received approval from the Institutional Review Board prior to initiation .
Until recently, the vertebrate crown group within chordates was thought to be characterized by at least two unique features, ectodermal neurogenic placodes and migrating neural crest cells.
