Tunicates, or urochordates, which had been assigned the basal node of the extant chordates, were largely overlooked with respect to these features as they were believed not to share as recent an ancestry as cephalochordates and vertebrates . Among these are neural crest or crest like cells , and the topic of this paper, neurogenic placodes   focal thickenings within epidermis in the head region that give rise to sensory structures.
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a chronic, progressive autoimmune disease primarily affecting the synovial joints and causing both significant morbidity and increased mortality . Pro inflammatory CD4+ T cells have been divided into Th1, Th2, and Th17 subsets based on their production of IFN γ, IL 4 and IL 17 respectively. Complete elimination of IFN γ or IFN γ receptor signaling leads to exacerbation of disease .
The Dominican Republic  has a long history of innovative HIV prevention programs in the female commercial sex industry. An environmental structural intervention integrating community solidarity and government policy strategies demonstrated significant reductions in sexually transmitted infections  and increases in condom use among female sex workers in the DR . Continued HIV related vulnerability, however, as documented by the frequency of STI and gaps in consistent condom use with regular partners, indicates the need to continue building upon these efforts.
Arsenic is a widely distributed environmental toxicant that can cause multi tissue pathologies. Proteomic assays allow for the identification of biological processes modulated by arsenic in diverse tissue types . The altered abundance of proteins from HaCaT human keratinocyte cell line exposed to arsenic was quantified using a label free LC MS/MS mass spectrometry workflow.
Quantifying changes in gastroduodenal permeability became more practical after Meddings et al introduced the sucrose permeability test in 1993 as a non invasive measure for assessing the extent of gastroduodenal damage induced by non steroidal anti inflammatory agents . Subsequently, several studies showed that abnormal gastroduodenal permeability to sucrose is a reasonable marker for the presence of gastroduodenal injury in NSAID users . Other researchers used sucrose permeability tests to assess damage to the gastroduodenal mucosa induced by oral corticosteroids , intense exercise , Helicobacter pylori infection , atrophic gastritis , Crohn’s disease , celiac disease , coffee , smoking  or a combination of these damaging factors  .
Virtual screening, a process in which ligands are docked to the structure of a target receptor and ranked according to their interactions with the receptor, has become an integral part of identifying lead compounds in modern drug discovery. Accurately ranking closely related cogeners is essential to successfully guide the design of optimized leads; incorporating the flexibility of the target receptor and the ligand while considering their conformations is critical to achieving accurate ranking results. Ensembles can be generated by compiling experimentally determined structures or stochastically determined conformations via molecular dynamics .
Adherence, or the degree to which program components are delivered as prescribed, is an important aspect of the multidimensional construct of program fidelity. However, when efficacious programs are translated into real world settings, implementation fidelity may vary greatly across sites, and changes in delivery from the program as intended may result in lower program effectiveness . When adherence is measured, studies generally report global assessments of how much or how well program content was implemented  for example, adherence may be calculated as the percentage of prescribed program elements that were actually delivered in an implementation.
Mitochondria play a central role in energy metabolism, in which mitochondrial oxidative phosphorylation is an extremely efficient system to produce energy required for the body . Although reactive oxygen species  are a natural byproduct during the normal oxidative phosphorylation process, increased production of ROS and decline of mitochondrial respiratory capacity is observed during aging . Oxidation of cell components by ROS affects the function of various tissues and organs with age .
Application of convection enhanced delivery  to intracerebral dosing of therapeutic molecules is intended as a method to maximize distribution per inoculation , minimizing the risks associated to multiple injections sites . CED combined with Intraoperative Magnetic Resonance Imaging  increases targeting accuracy and allows monitoring of the infusion cloud . In the last decade, adeno associated virus  serotype 2  has been the vector of choice for preclinical and clinical research in the central nervous system.
Discovery of central nervous system  drugs is challenging due to the complexity of neurological disorders, the paucity of pre clinical models with proven human translational value, and the persistent difficulty of delivering drug molecules across the blood brain barrier  to achieve optimal CNS exposure. The brain to plasma distribution ratio has been widely used in drug discovery as an index of brain penetration . A number of CNS drug discovery groups  have proposed optimization strategies based on an integrated use of BBB permeability, the effect of efflux transport, and nonspecific plasma and brain tissue binding, to ultimately characterize brain penetration in terms of unbound drug brain distribution: Kp,uuin vitro = Cu,brain/Cu,plasma, where Cu,brain and Cu,plasma are the unbound concentrations in the brain  homogenate and plasma, respectively.
Muscle fatigue is defined as “any exercise induced loss of ability to produce force with a muscle or muscle group” , and can result from failure at one or more sites along the motor pathway originating from the central nervous system and ending with force loss through cross bridge cycling. Muscle fatigue has been documented as task dependent, meaning that fatigue and its mechanisms vary depending on the task the muscle performs . The cause of muscle fatigue may depend on task performance and is important to developing task specific training interventions .
Calcium hydroxide aqueous slurry is widely used as an inter appointment antimicrobial dressing in root canal treatment . Dentin tubules in root canal walls have been shown to harbor microorganisms . The penetration of microorganisms into dentin tubules in infected teeth is generally reported between 50 and 100 μm .
After acute antigen challenge, T cells rapidly activate, proliferate and differentiate into effector cells and then subsequently contract in number. It is believed that co stimulatory signaling may be more influential during early stages of an immune response, while co inhibitory signaling may play a dominant role in later stages, aiding T cell contraction. Recently, the co inhibitory PD 1 receptor has been shown to participate in restraining the CTL response at the later contraction stage of the immune response to infection, thus contributing to persistent infection .
Ovarian cancer is the leading cause of death from gynecological malignancies . The current standard for management of ovarian cancer is cytoreductive surgery and platinum drugs based combination chemotherapy with taxanes . Ovarian cancer has been shown to be one of the potential therapeutic targets of TRAIL .
Class Ia ribonucleotide reductases  play a crucial role in DNA replication and repair catalyzing the reduction of nucleoside 5′ diphosphates  to 2′ deoxynucleoside 5′ diphosphates . A crystal structure of the class Ib RNR from Salmonella typhimurium containing both subunits has also been reported at 4.5 Å resolution and may be indicative of an intermediate in the formation of the active RNR complex that has remained elusive. This distance is too large for electron tunneling, given the enzyme’s turnover number of 1 10 s−1.
Both pH and temperature are vital indicators of normal metabolism and physiology in the central nervous system. On the other hand, infrared spectroscopy methods are far less invasive to provide better temperature distributions . In contrast, magnetic resonance imaging  and spectroscopy  allow measurements of both temperature  and pH  non invasively using variations of relaxation times, diffusion constants, or chemical shifts of various molecules  both endogenous , inorganic phosphate , phosphocreatine ) and exogenous  .
Transmission of Schistosoma mansoni and subsequent infection of human hosts are influenced by a large number of variables that are important not only to maintain the parasite life cycle but also to determine the outcome and severity of the disease. Among these factors are those related to the environment, particularly surface water distribution, presence of the snail intermediate host, and also factors related to the human host such as age, sex, water contact behavior, type of water supply, genetics, immune response and physiology . Indeed, several studies have been carried out to understand how epidemiological, socioeconomic and behavioral factors can affect the transmission and prevalence of infection  .
Episodic memory allows us to remember past events with a striking level of detail and specificity. Even for types of events we have experienced hundreds of times , we can often vividly remember an individual event within the series . How does the brain accomplish this amazing feat?
In a recent study we found that orthographically familiar forms of German nouns compared to orthographically unfamiliar forms of the very same phonological words  led to reduced activation in a region of the left visual ventral pathway, in left inferior parietal regions and in a large left inferior frontal language region . In a preceding study, we identified a large left occipitotemporal region, which included the VWFA, to be modulated by the frequency with which the words were encountered in print . We reasoned that despite the unexpected similarity of the ERPs elicited by letter case format and orthographic format violations, different brain regions may respond to the different types of deviance from the familiar pattern.
Clopidogrel is an antiplatelet drug used to prevent cardiovascular events in patients with acute coronary syndromes or a history of stroke, myocardial infarction, or peripheral arterial disease. Antiplatelet responses, as measured by ex vivo platelet function testing or aggregometry, are small or absent in approximately one third of patients. CYP2C19, a genetically polymorphic drug metabolizing enzyme, is one of several cytochrome P450 drug metabolizing enzymes that are involved in the two oxidative steps that generate the active metabolite of clopidogrel., Based on CYP2C19 genotype, patients can be classified as ultrarapid , extensive , intermediate , or poor clopidogrel metabolizers .
The dysfunction of glycogen synthase kinase 3β has been implicated in a number of diseases, including Alzheimer’s disease. The ability to non invasively quantify GSK 3βactivity in vivo is therefore of critical importance, and this work is focused upon development of inhibitors of GSK 3βradiolabeled with carbon 11 to examine quantification of the enzyme using positron emission tomography  imaging . PyrATP 1 was prepared from the corresponding desmethyl piperazine precursor in an automated synthesis module.
Histone deacetylases  represent a promising new target for drug development in cancer therapy. There are four classes of HDACs, which group the eleven known HDACs according to their homology with yeast deacetylases . The diversity of differentially acetylated proteins may in part explain why treatment of cancer cells with HDAC inhibitors leads to increased differentiation, growth arrest, and apoptosis.
Metals and alloys are the most commonly used materials for engineering surgically implantable devices in humans. Titanium in particular shows properties which render it a very suitable implant based on its durability and the passively formed oxide film on the metallic surface . Accordingly, titanium is now used extensively as a biomaterial in the fields of orthopedic surgery , plastic surgery , dental surgery  and cardiovascular surgery .
Non small cell lung cancer  is a leading cause of cancer related death. These enzymes catalyze the conversion of phosphatidylinositol biphosphate  to phosphatidylinositol triphosphate . Moreover, phospho S6 , a downstream target of the PI3K signaling pathway, is upregulated upon oncogenic K Ras induction in NSCLC of transgenic mice  .
Breast cancer ranks as the most common cancer in African American women and is the second leading cause of cancer deaths within low income populations . Although the occurrence of breast cancer in African American women is less than in Caucasians, the five year survival is only 75 percent as compared to 89 percent for Caucasians . It has been estimated that as much as one half of the disparity in breast cancer mortality for African American women, as compared to Caucasian women, can be explained by less frequent breast cancer screening that would have led to treatment at earlier stages of disease when the survival rates are much more favorable  .
Lung cancer, of which 8090% is non small cell lung cancer , has been the leading cause of cancer death in the U.S since the late 1960’s , with median survival below 8 months for disease stages III and IV . However, lung cancer mortality and survival rates vary markedly by race and ethnicity , such that the public health burden of the disease differs by population subgroup. Although randomized clinical trials  and some population based studies  have pointed to better survival among Asian NSCLC patients compared with non Asian patients, little is known about NSCLC survival differences among specific Asian and Pacific Islander  ethnic groups.
Vision loss due to posterior eye diseases, such as age related macular degeneration, diabetic retinopathy, glaucoma, and retinitis pigmentosa, accounts for most of the irreversible blindness world wide . Systemic administration requires high doses of drugs and has the potential of causing systemic toxicities . Due to these various problems, a safe, effective, and robust drug delivery method is needed .
The vast majority of people in the contemporary US experience sexual debut sometime during adolescence and prior to marriage . Despite this statistical normality, the characterization of adolescent sexual initiation as problematic in the US is largely accepted. Concern about unintended pregnancy and sexually transmitted infections , which are more likely with younger ages at debut , is one rationale for characterizing adolescent debut as a problem behavior.
GnRH neurons form the final common pathway for the central regulation of fertility. GnRH is typically released in pulses of varying frequencies . The gonadal steroid estradiol is a critical feedback regulator of GnRH neurons, and is involved in both suppression of episodic release  and induction of the surge mode of release  .
Each year, more than 175,000 Americans are diagnosed with acute respiratory distress syndrome  . Despite management advances such as the use of lung protective ventilation , ARDS continues to be associated with high morbidity and approximately 30 40% mortality . Patients who develop severe ARDS are typically under represented in clinical trials.
MicroRNAs are evolutionarily conserved, 2025 nucleotide long, non coding RNAs which bind to their targets through partial complementary sequence recognition. This results in either degradation of mRNA or inhibition of translation, thus modulating expression of miRNA targets . Therefore, it is not surprising that miRNAs are involved in diverse biological processes, including cell differentiation, proliferation, and apoptosis presumably through a myriad of targets  .
Autism is a neurodevelopmental disorder characterized by impairments in social functioning, stereotypica, including mental retardation , and seizure disorders, including epilepsy , are often comorbid with autism . Gamma aminobutyric acid  is the main inhibitory neurotransmitter in the brain. There are three classes of GABA receptors: GABAA, GABAB, and GABAC.
Accidental exposure to high doses of ionizing radiation often results in death due to multiple organ dysfunction. We previously developed a rat model of total body irradiation followed by a bone marrow transplant  using a 11 Gy single dose of X ray that did not cause gastrointestinal  toxicity . Rats were followed to 100 days and damage to the lung was assessed from 4280 days by multiple end points including histopathology.
The primary motor function of the stomach is to receive, store and prepare food for digestion . In addition, intrinsic neural reflex pathways participate in gastric accommodation to distension . Disturbances of these regulatory systems are thought to underlie functional disorders such as functional dyspepsia, in which relaxation of the gastric fundus in response to food intake is often impaired  .
Xenotransplantation promises an unlimited supply of organs for clinical use. Pigs are thought to be the most suitable source of xenografts . Nonetheless, acute humoral xenograft rejection  ensues and leads to intravascular thrombosis .
One possible mechanism of higher cardiovascular mortality associated with the metabolic syndrome  may be through abnormal modulation in autonomic tone . The Twins Heart Study  is an investigation of psychological, behavioral and biological risk factors for subclinical cardiovascular disease using twins. Participants were selected from the Vietnam Era Twin  Registry, a cohort of 7369 middle aged male male twin pairs both of whom served in the United States military during the Vietnam War.
Carbon monoxide  is a tasteless, odorless gaseous pollutant ubiquitous in the outdoor atmosphere, that is generated by combustion. Findings of earlier epidemiological studies were mixed, and few recent epidemiological studies have been conducted. Little research has been done on the potential adverse health effects in humans from current ambient exposure to generally low CO levels.
Exposure to trauma is common among individuals with substance use disorders , particularly among those with opioid related disorders, and is associated with elevated rates of posttraumatic stress disorder . , Lifetime prevalence estimates of PTSD among patients in methadone maintenance treatment  exceed those for the general population and vary from 14 to 41%. ,,,,, While the importance of diagnosing and treating PTSD in SUD treatment settings has been emphasized,, the extent to which MMT patients with and without chronic pain differ on lifetime trauma exposure and current PTSD symptoms is unclear .
The proliferation of vascular smooth muscle cells  plays a critical role in the formation of vascular lesions, and is the major pathophysiologic mechanism responsible for the failure of interventional therapeutic approaches to treat occlusive vascular disorders, including vein bypass failure, transplant arteriosclerosis, and restenosis after balloon angioplasty . With the recognition of the essential involvement of VSMC proliferation in occlusive vascular disorders, considerable effort has been directed at characterizing biochemical and molecular pathways that regulate the proliferative response of VSMC following arterial injury. Arginase is a binuclear manganese metalloenzyme that catalyzes the hydrolysis of L arginine to L ornithine and urea .
The prevalence of autism spectrum disorders  has increased since the early 1990s . One in 88 American children have an ASD, a 78% increase from 2002 to 2008 . Consequently, there are a growing number of adolescents with an ASD transitioning into adulthood.
Up to 15,000 children in the United States suffer an out of hospital cardiac arrest  every year. Between 10 and 30% of pediatric OHCA patients treated in the field have sustained return of spontaneous circulation  and survive to be admitted to a pediatric intensive care unit . Of these, <40% survive to hospital discharge.
The last 20 years have witnessed remarkable progress in understanding the cellular origins and molecular mechanisms involved in the development of B cell lineage neoplasms. It is well established that these B cell intrinsic molecular changes are not sufficient to fully induce transformation  and that secondary genetic mutations and other factors have important roles in the pathogenesis of B cell malignancies. They include engagement of the B cell receptor  by self or microbial antigens , influences mediated by T cells activated by microbial pathogens , host inflammatory responses , and the interface between tumor cells and stromal elements such as collagen interactions with integrins and other receptors .
Early adolescents are at a pivotal time in their lives regarding personal decisions that impact their future health. In an all too common scenario, many adolescents confront life changing difficulties after adopting risky behaviors  . Today’s youth are disproportionately affected by HIV/AIDS.
Monoacylglycerol lipase  is a 33 kDa, peripherally associated membrane enzyme of the serine hydrolase superfamily that catalyzes the hydrolysis of monoacylglycerols  to free fatty acid and glycerol . Beyond its initially described contribution to lipolysis in adipose tissue, MAGL has also been proposed to degrade the endogenous cannabinoid  2 arachidonoylglycerol   in the nervous system . 2 AG, along with a second endocannabinoid anandamide  , are signaling lipids that activate the cannabinoid receptors CB1  and CB2 , two G protein coupled receptors that also mediate the neurobehavioral and immunosuppressive effects of the pyschoactive component of marijuana, Δ9 tetrahydocannabinol  .
Transient protein modification is an essential regulatory mechanism for many biological processes. One type of transient modification, phosphorylation, is predicted to occur on approximately 1/3 of the total proteins encoded within the human genome,. Since the majority of Ser/Thr phosphorylation sites are reversible, the specificity of the phosphatases appears to be low when compared to Ser/Thr kinases .
Y box binding protein 1  is expressed in over 40% of breast cancers, but is most commonly associated with the estrogen receptor  negative subtypes . The activity of YB 1 is contingent upon phosphorylation of its serine 102 residue by p90 ribosomal S6 kinase  . These cells share important properties with classical tissue stem cells including self renewal and multi lineage differentiation capacity .
Fc receptors  are cell surface molecules primarily expressed on effector leucocytes of the innate immune system and by binding immunoglobulins provide adaptive immunity with a cell based effector system . There are three classes of leukocyte IgG FcRs  in humans, the high affinity IgG receptor FcγRI  and the low affinity IgG receptors, FcγRII  and FcγRIII  . The two major genes of the huFcγRII family encode FcγRIIa and FcγRIIb and its splice variants.
Proteins have evolved to fold, associate and function within cells or in other physiological fluid media, where the concentration of macromolecules, including proteins, nucleic acids, and carbohydrates, can be as high as 400 g/L . In fact, the cytoplasm of most eukaryotic cells contain numerous compartments and organelles bound by extensively folded membranes, as well as fibrous structures of various types that are thought to occupy between 1525% of the total cytoplasmic volume . The thermodynamic consequences of this phenomenon are known as excluded volume effects .
The neuronal ceroid lipofuscinoses are the most common cause of pediatric neurodegeneration worldwide. There are 9 different disease variants caused by mutations in 13 identified genes. The clinical presentations of these variants are all very similar, varying primarily in age of onset and speed of progression.
Lateralization is a basic organizational feature of the nervous system that is reflected in the fact that during the course of evolution the relative size of the corpus callosum and anterior commissure has decreased while the size of intrahemispheric circuitry has increased . These relative changes reflect the evolutionary emergence of new processes that are represented by local circuits in one or the other hemisphere. We have postulated that motor lateralization reflects the specialization of each arm hemisphere system for distinct and complimentary control processes .
Mn superoxide dismutase , one of the three mammalian superoxide dismutases, is encoded by a nuclear gene  and is then transported into the mitochondrial matrix. However the life span extension benefit has not been recapitulated in mammalian model systems  . The observation that MnSOD activity is often lower in tumors and transformed cells was made independently by two groups over 30 years ago .
Clinically overt heart failure is the endpoint of a long disease continuum characterized by progressive structural and functional changes of the heart, a dynamic process referred to as cardiac remodeling. Given the current burden of heart failure and the projected increase over the next 5 decades, it is important to understand factors that influence cardiac remodeling over the adult life course. LV mass is an important cardiac remodeling trait that is an intermediate phenotype for heart failure, and is also associated with increased risk for various cardiovascular disease  outcomes.
Hematopoietic stem cells  are able to self renew as well as give rise to all blood lineages. HSCs mainly reside in specialized bone marrow microenvironments, called HSC niches. However, the identity of these signals and the molecular mechanisms governing HSC fate largely remain elusive.
Overweight and obesity are at unprecedented levels. Advertisers capitalize on these responses, inundating potential customers with pictures of juicy hamburgers, crisp fries, and creamy chocolate desserts. Although some of these advertised foods may be healthy, the billions of advertising dollars spent every year by the fast food industry are mainly focused on marketing unhealthy food .
In both eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells, cytoskeletal proteins are likely to assemble in vivo into structures with a thickness greater than a single molecule and the formation of lateral interactions between individual filaments and their regulation may have important consequences for understanding filament assembly and function. Within the cell, these supramolecular structures arise mainly due to short range forces as a consequence of molecular crowding  as well as cytoskeletal binding proteins. An example of suprastructures formed in eukaryotic cells is the actin cytoskeleton, where parallel actin bundles have been observed near the cell surface in lamellopodia or filapodia.
Loss of cell polarization and luminal filling of mammary glands are crucial structural alterations in breast cancer . The expression of cancer related genes in breast epithelial cells can lead to disorganization of mammary gland structure in in vitro models and cause a pathology similar to epithelial tumors, indicating a critical requirement for the fidelity of tissue and cellular organization of acini . The Runx transcription factors  are essential for organogenesis, and mutations in these genes have been linked to several types of cancer .
Rhabdomyosarcomas are the largest subset of soft tissue sarcomas in infants and children and are highly heterogeneous, clinically aggressive tumors that show varying degrees of skeletal muscle differentiation . The two main histological patterns recognized include embryonal rhabdomyosarcoma  and alveolar rhabdomyosarcoma . Morphologic evaluation alone is often insufficient to make the distinction between ARMS and ERMS as some ARMS lack the alveolar architecture  and ERMS can be densely cellular and poorly differentiated .
Neurotransmission at chemical synapses is initiated by an action potential in the pre synaptic nerve terminal that opens Ca2+ channels and triggers exocytosis of neurotransmitter. The post synaptic impact of each event depends on the number of quanta released, the amount of neurotransmitter per quanta, and the post synaptic sensitivity. All three of these factors, and thus the overall efficiency of neurotransmission, depend on the recent firing activity of the neurons involved, a phenomenon referred to as synaptic short term plasticity .
Lung cancer is a devastating disease that affects over 200,000 individuals in the U.S. each year . Approximately 85% of all lung cancer cases have a link to cigarette smoke exposure . Logically, reduction or elimination of exposure to cigarette smoke would bring broad and important improvements to public health and this approach has been widely advocated.
Cytochromes P450  are obligatory enzymes in metabolism of cholesterol, steroid hormones and vitamin D3, in mitochondria . We are interested in delineation of structure/function relationships in P450s that initiate cholesterol transformations to bile acids and steroid hormones. Partial or complete lack of CYP11A1 activity results in a disorder of steroidogenesis in which cholesterol accumulates within the steroidogenic tissues, and the synthesis of all adrenal and gonadal steroids is impaired .
The first evidence incriminating Akt in oncogenesis was provided by studies of acute transforming viruses. Akt includes a family of related kinases, designated Akt1, Akt2 and Akt3 . The Akt kinases are downstream targets of receptor tyrosine kinases that signal through phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase  .
LTP in CA1 hippocampal pyramidal neurons is believed to represent one form of the cellular basis for learning and memory . NMDA type glutamate receptor  engagement induces elevation of intracellular calcium, which in turn activates Erk. This event is required for many types of LTP .
Substantial evidence exists to indicate that T cell responses can mediate the suppression and elimination of tumors in animal models and in human subjects . Certain tumors, including melanoma, may be associated with production of IL 5, IL 4, and IL 13 by CD4 and CD8 T cells , thereby adding an additional immunomodulating step that can repress host anti tumor responsiveness . McCarter et al showed that conditioned medium from in vitro cultures of melanoma cells could drive T cell lines toward a TH2 phenotype in co culture with MDDC .
Angiogenin  is a 14 kDa ribonuclease originally identified as an angiogenic protein  that has been shown to play an important role in tumor angiogenesis . Recently, ANG has been shown to be progressively upregulated in prostate cancer  and to play a direct role in cancer cell proliferation by constitutive nuclear translocation in cancer cells where it also stimulates rRNA transcription . PTEN has been shown to regulate cell size in association with its ability to regulate ribosome biogenesis .
The structural Microtubule Associated Proteins  of neurons consist of two classes,the HMW MAPs  and the Tau family. In contrast with MAP1a,b in which the MT binding domains are located in the N terminal domain , MAP2 and Tau isoforms contain tubulin binding motives in the C terminal domain while the N terminal domain of the molecules form a projection extending away from the MT wall . Both domains of structural MAPs contain numerous phosphorylation sites and are substrates for a large number of protein kinases , including the cAMP dependent protein kinase PKA bound to the N terminal domain of MAP2 , which was the first described member of the AKAP  family .
Alcohol abuse and dependence remain public health problems, with the worldwide prevalence of alcohol use disorders being 1.7% and the prevalence in the United States being 8.5% with an annual cost of 185 billion dollars . Whereas previous estimates of the ratio of men to women having an alcohol use disorder has varied between 1:2 and 1:3 , more recent data suggests the “gender gap” has been narrowing in younger and older populations . For example, there is ample evidence that both ethanol and nicotine increase extracellular dopamine  in the nucleus accumbens  and particular subunits for the nicotinic acetylcholine receptor  are implicated in ethanol’s stimulating effects .
TGFβ signals through a heterotetrameric receptor complex comprising type II receptors and type I receptors, both serine/threonine kinases, followed by a canonical SMAD dependent signaling cascade. The TGFβ SMAD cascade in epithelial cells is growth suppressive. The disruption of TGFβ SMAD suppressive signaling is advantageous for the cancer cells to grow .
CD4+ T helper cells can differentiate into different functional subsets defined by patterns of cytokine production , TH2, TH 17). Differentiation into these specialized subsets is mediated at least in part by the actions of specific signal transducer and activator of transcription  proteins  that control the transition of precursor cells into mature TH1, TH2, or TH 17 cells, respectively  . TH 17 cells produce IL 17A, IL 17F, IL 21, and IL 22, and are important in host defense against certain bacteria and fungi and implicated in autoimmune diseases including Crohn’s disease and psoriasis , .
Genital herpes is a chronic, lifelong disease caused by herpes simplex virus  that is characterized by unpredictable recurrences. However, more recently, it has been reported that in developed countries HSV 1 is now the main causative agent for primary genital herpes, especially among adolescents, women, and homosexual men . The clinical signs of genital herpes are indistinguishable between HSV 1 and HSV 2 .
Valsalva maneuver  is commonly used as a provocative maneuver to augment right to left shunting through patent foramen ovale . Obstructive sleep apnea  occurs when a sleeping patient attempts to inhale against an obstructed airway, and several reports suggest that OSA might also provoke right to left shunting. However, no previous studies explored the hemodynamic basis for this notion.
The extracellular signal regulated kinases ERK1/2 are among the most prominent signal transduction molecules through which extracellular stimuli are propagated from the cell surface to cytoplasmic and nuclear effectors. The mammalian neocortex arises from self renewing multipotent NPCs that initially generate neurons and subsequently produce glia. Disruption of the dynamics of NPC or IPC proliferation and differentiation result in alterations in cell number, cellular identity, and organization of the cortex  .
The human cerebral cortex was first mapped into more than 47 areas by histological descriptions such as cell shapes and packing density . Recent studies, using modern imaging techniques, have demonstrated the existence and correlation of different anatomical and functional areas in the cortex . For instance, there are motor , primary  and secondary  somatosensory, auditory  and visual areas  in the mouse cerebral cortex.
One out of every four children in the United States fails to achieve basic reading skills by the eighth grade . In addition to the motor impairments central to the diagnosis of CP, brain dysfunction may also result in cognitive problems, including learning disorders such as reading difficulties or speech and language skills. Phonemic awareness refers to the explicit awareness of phonemes as units of sound, and is associated with alphabetic literacy .
More than one billion children worldwide live in areas affected by armed conflict. Of these children, a majority live in sub Saharan Africa  . However, in many low income countries where conflict is widespread, scarce monetary or human resources are devoted to accurate measurement of mental health problems in children and adolescents, resulting in limited data to support claims about the burden of mental health disorders in young people or the outcomes of intervention research  .
Both stress urinary incontinence  and pelvic organ prolapse  are common conditions and many women will choose to undergo surgical treatment due to patient preference or dissatisfaction with conservative therapy. Because the prevalence of both SUI and POP have been shown to increase with age,  it is expected that the number of older women undergoing surgical treatment for these conditions will also increase. There is a growing body of evidence showing that although older women may be at higher risk for morbidity following procedures for pelvic floor disorders, the absolute risk of death is very small.
Major depressive disorder  is currently recognized as one of the leading causes of disease related disability worldwide and is predicted to be the leading cause by 2020 . Over the past 30 years, literature has amassed indicating that children and adolescents living with a depressed caregiver are at a substantial risk for a variety of developmental and adjustment difficulties. These difficulties can emerge and persist at any point from infancy through adulthood and include an increased risk for internalizing and externalizing problems  .
Prostate cancer is the second most fatal cancer among men in the United States, accounting for approximately 28,000 deaths in 2008 . Considerable epidemiologic attention in prostate cancer has focused on the vitamin D endocrine system and on calcium . Although numerous studies have investigated prostate cancer with respect to calcium intake from the diet, the subject of calcium in serum has received scarce attention, perhaps because calcium levels in serum are believed to be under strict homeostatic control.
Many methods of recombinant protein purification have been developed. The small size of the His tag, low cost, and ease of use have made it the most popular affinity tag available. The two most common E. coli contaminants are ArnA, a bifunctional enzyme involved in the modification of lipid A phosphates with aminoarabinose, and SlyD, a peptidyl prolyl cis/trans isomerase,.
Most proteins are marginally stable and degrade by numerous pathways in aqueous solution., At a laboratory scale, cryopreservation provides an effective way for researchers to preserve precious protein samples and standards, minimize interexperiment variability and maximize flexibility for experimental design and scheduling. Likewise, large scale cryopreservation is an important step in the manufacturing of therapeutic proteins. Freezethawing can cause aggregation of proteins, presumably because of protein structural perturbation caused by freezing., Freezing induced structural changes in proteins have been addressed previously in studies using confocal Raman microspectroscopy, fluorescence spectroscopy,,, and infrared microscopy to examine the structures of lysozyme, azurin, and lactate dehydrogenase.
PPARγ, a dynamic nuclear transcriptional regulator, has well characterized roles in adipocyte differentiation, lipid metabolism and insulin sensitivity, . Clinically PPARγ is the molecular target of the insulin sensitizing thiazolidinedione  class of drugs that includes rosiglitazone and pioglitazone. In the PROACTIVE trial, the PPARγ agonist pioglitazone had beneficial effects on the combined secondary endpoints of myocardial infarction, stroke and death.
In the retinal inner plexiform layer , rod and cone pathways are linked to output ganglion cells via abundant gap junctions . Of 20 gap junction forming connexin proteins in the mouse genome , mRNA or protein for only two connexins, Cx36 and Cx45, are detected in neurons of mouse IPL . Cx36 containing junctions, in particular, exhibit large scale ultrastructural diversity , with different forms correlated with different complements of the gap junction scaffolding and regulatory proteins zonula occludens 1 , ZO 2 and ZONAB  .
The accuracy of diet and disease associations is largely dependent upon the quality of dietary exposure assessment. However, assessing dietary intake in free living populations poses several challenges. The strengths and limitations of various self report dietary assessment methods have been extensively reviewed .
Tuberculosis  is a serious infectious disease caused by the Mycobacterium tuberculosis bacterium. Therefore, there is an urgent need for the development of new drugs and suitable therapeutic targets. The enzymes of the methylerythritol phosphate  pathway  are responsible for the biosynthesis of the precursors to isoprenoids  and its isomer, dimethylallyl ) and have been identified as suitable targets for drug development owing to their vital and diverse functions ) and absence in humans .
There has been a rapid rise in the use of anti hypertensive medications in pregnancy during the past decade. Recent data demonstrate that the most common 1st trimester antihypertensive exposure is beta adrenergic blocking agents, with nearly 0.5% of all pregnant women exposed to these medications during this trimester. The most concerning potential adverse effect of first trimester medication exposure is teratogenicity.
Alzheimer's disease  is characterized by the presence of β amyloid plaques, composed predominantly of the Aβ peptide, a 40  or 42 amino acid cleavage product of the amyloid precursor protein . Although much is known about the processing of APP to generate or prevent generation of Aβ , relatively little is known about the physiological function of APP itself. Several lines of evidence have revealed that APP may be involved in cell adhesion, cell migration, and neurite outgrowth  .
Vestibular schwannomas  originate from Schwann cells  of the vestibular nerve and typically occur as either unilateral, sporadic tumors or as bilateral tumors in patients with neurofibromatosis type 2  . Both sporadic and NF2 associated VSs result from loss of function of the NF2 tumor suppressor gene . Merlin, the protein product of the NF2 gene, regulates several signaling events that control tumor growth .
Men with a family history of prostate cancer and African American men are at increased risk for developing prostate cancer , with subsets at increased risk of aggressive disease and/or death from the disease . There is a need to better refine risk estimates for prostate cancer among high risk men in order to provide individualized screening recommendations based on predicted risk . BRCA1 and BRCA2 mutations have been reported to raise the risk for prostate cancer in males from families with hereditary breast and ovarian cancer syndrome  .
Translation termination takes place when one of three stop codons is recognized by a proteinaceous class 1 release factor  in the A site of the ribosome. How does the cognate recognition complex differ from the related near cognate complex that fails to promote rapid GTPase activation and accommodation? And, again, these views yielded detailed information only on the structural state of the decoding center and for the near cognate case only when paromomycin was simultaneously bound.
Helicobacter pylori  infection is among the most frequent human bacterial infections worldwide. The infection is usually acquired in childhood,,  but patterns of persistence and spontaneous clearance have not been well described. Understanding the determinants of persistent infection will help inform development of needed prevention and control strategies .
“Any emotion, if it is sincere, is involuntary.” DBS of various brain regions and circuit pathways has been employed to treat many basal ganglia related disorders . DBS has been utilized more recently to treat medication refractory neuropsychiatric disease  . Intraoperative testing of DBS devices can result in various mood, affective, and behavioral responses of relatively short latency.
Allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant  is used as a curative therapy for a large number of malignant and non malignant hematologic diseases. Graft versus host disease  is the major reason for non relapse mortality and is staged and graded according to severity of symptoms in three target organs . Effective GVHD prevention remains an area of active clinical research, but at present most patients are administered prophylactic agents that interfere with T lymphocyte numbers or function .
Myasthenia gravis  and experimental autoimmune myasthenia gravis , are caused by antibody mediated autoimmune responses to nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  which impair neuromuscular transmission . The MIR is defined by the ability of a single rat mAb to inhibit binding of many autoantibodies from MG patients or rats with EAMG . The α1 sequence 6676, the MIR loop, is crucial to the MIR .
As part of the development of atherosclerotic plaques, calcium is deposited in the arterial wall by a process that is histologically similar to bone formation. Coronary calcium occurs exclusively in atherosclerotic arteries and is absent in the normal vessel wall. Thoracic calcification may be atherosclerotic and also contribute to aortic stiffness, which has also been associated with adverse outcomes.
Gastrointestinal stromal tumors  are the most common mesenchymal tumors of the gastrointestinal tract, with an estimated annual incidence of 5,0006,000 cases in the United States . Approximately 7075% of GISTs harbor gain of function mutations in the KIT gene, while mutations in the related RTK gene PDGFRA  have been identified in another ~10% of GISTs . The discovery of oncogenic mutations in KIT and PDGFRA has led to the clinical use of the RTK inhibitor imatinib mesylate  for advanced or metastatic GIST.
The noradrenergic nucleus locus coeruleus  provides the sole source of noradrenergic innervation of the main olfactory bulb  . Noradrenergic fibers terminate in all but the most superficial MOB layers, densely targeting the internal plexiform and granule cell  layers with a more moderate density in the mitral cell and external plexiform layers . The LC system plays well documented roles in modulation of behavioral state and sensory processing including olfactory function.
Craniofacial wounds resulting from injury trauma or iatrogenic sources  present a major problem for surgery. However, problems exist with this approach , including the shortage of the amount of available bony tissue that can be harvested from the patient  and associated significant morbidities . More recently attention has been paid to growth factor therapies, specifically bone morphogenetic protein 2 , a member of the transforming growth factor beta  superfamily.
Autosomal dominant polycystic kidney disease  is the most common monogenic kidney disease and the fourth leading cause of end stage kidney disease worldwide., Polycystic liver disease , arbitrarily defined as the presence of any liver cyst, is its most common extrarenal expression., Liver cysts often remain asymptomatic, but some individuals experience chronic manifestations related to progressive liver enlargement leading to disability and severely impacting quality of life. Symptoms of PLD relate to effects from the volume of hepatic cysts or complications such as cyst hemorrhage, rupture, or infection. Some individuals require interventions including cyst aspiration and/or sclerosis, fenestration and/or combined liver resection/cyst fenestration, hepatic artery embolization, or in extreme cases, liver or combined liver kidney transplantation.
Herpes simplex virus type 1  is widespread, with seropositivity estimates of 45% to 98% worldwide and 57% to 85% of adults in the United States . HSV 1induced diseases, including genital lesions, cold sores in and around the mouth, corneal disease that can lead to impaired vision, and viral encephalitis, are all more likely to occur following viral reactivations rather than primary infection. Thus, there is a LAT function that is located completely within the first 1.5 kb of LAT that enhances the reactivation phenotype .
N methyl D aspartate receptors  mediate excitatory transmission and are involved in synaptic function associated with long term synaptic changes, oscillations, bursting behavior, learning, and memory . Acetylcholine  released from terminals of neurons whose cell body are located in the Nucleus Basalis  modulates the behavior of many cortical areas by activation of muscarinic receptors  and nicotinic receptors . Excitatory synaptic transmission in the primary auditory neocortex is subject to a particularly intense cholinergic modulation .
Reactive oxygen species , such as superoxide  and hydrogen peroxide , are implicated in the development of multiple cardiovascular disease pathologies, including hypertension, atherosclerosis and restenosis. One major source of ROS is the NADPH oxidase  family of enzymes . For example, Nox1 and Nox4 are the predominant homologues in rodent vascular smooth muscle cells  from large vessels.
Type 1 diabetes  is a common chronic illness that affects approximately 1 in every 400600 youth in the United States under the age of 20 . The incidence of T1D among children under the age of 5 is rising, indicating that an increasing number of families are impacted by T1D diagnoses every year . The impact of T1D care on parent functioning is extensive.
Integrins are among the most important cell adhesion molecules in metazoa. They play a key role in development, immune responses, leukocyte trafficking, homeostasis and cancer. In about half of the integrins, ligand primarily binds to the I domain, which is inserted within the β propeller domain.
Injury to the recurrent laryngeal nerve  results in vocal fold paresis or paralysis. The future ability to restore vocal fold movement for this dynamic neurological problem depends on strategies for maintaining the survival of axotomized neurons and stimulating axonal regeneration to the appropriate laryngeal muscles. While VEGF was first characterized as an angiogenic factor, it is known to have neurotrophic effects in the nervous system as well.
For several decades, the go to list of behavioral risk factors for chronic disease epidemiology has included smoking, alcohol consumption, physical activity, diet, and body habitus. An influential sleep lab experiment in 1999  reported that young men were hungrier and had worse glucose metabolism during a week of sleep restricted to four hours per night, compared to the week before or after the sleep restriction, suggesting that chronic partial sleep deprivation might be biologically causally related to obesity and diabetes. A National Sleep Foundation’s annual poll in 2009 found that one third of Americans reported losing sleep over the economy .
A variety of distinct visual manual signed languages have emerged, independently of the surrounding spoken languages, in Deaf communities around the globe. This paper examines the neural network engaged by narrative processing in signers, in particular prosody, facial expression, and role shifting, to determine whether this narrative processing network is similar across language modalities in spite of differences in the way in which the information is conveyed . Facial and spatial information processing for non linguistic materials is dependent on the right hemisphere  .
An estimated 5.4 million South Africans are infected with the human immunodeficiency virus  . In contrast, more culturally laden constructs like quality of life may not have relevance for all and it should not be assumed that a western understanding of this construct is relevant in other cultures . While the overall aim of any translation measure is to produce a new language version which is both conceptually equivalent to the original and relevant in the new target culture, the actual methods employed to produce a quality product vary greatly depending on each context.
Sex steroids and glucocorticoids have long been utilized in the clinic to control allergy, asthma and autoimmune diseases due to their anti inflammatory effects. Multiple sclerosis  is a debilitating neurological autoimmune disease with higher incidence in women. However, MS relapse rates are decreased during late pregnancy and treatment with pregnancy levels of estriol reduces CNS lesions.
Verbs are fundamentally different from nouns. Verbs, on the other hand, refer to states, actions or processes that can vary across both time and space. Verb argument structure can specify one, two, or three nominal arguments in roles such as agent, theme, recipient, goal or experiencer.
Collapse of the primary cavitation bubbles generated by a high intensityacoustic pulse can produce an extensive population of residual bubble nuclei . The resulting daughter bubbles are microscopic in size  and can persist for tens of milliseconds or even full seconds , depending on the conditions underwhich they were generated. In shock wave lithotripsy the efficacy of stone comminution is highly dependent on the rate of shock wave delivery, with testing both in vitro  and in vivo  demonstrating a decrease in per shockfragmentation efficiency with increasing shock rate.
Two significant milestones have characterized the pediatric HIV epidemic. First, the landmark Pediatric AIDS Clinical Trials Group study  in 1994 demonstrated that a 67% reduction in perinatal HIV transmission could be achieved with the administration of a combination of prenatal, intrapartum, and neonatal zidovudine  . The quantification of HIV 1 RNA levels in plasma and the measurement of CD4+ T lymphocyte counts have also been used as prognostic markers in HIV 1 infected individuals .
With the recent development of molecularly targeted agents, numerous epidermal growth factor receptor inhibitors  have been developed and some are approved for treatment of nonsmall cell lung cancer , head and neck squamous cell carcinoma , and colorectal cancer . There are two main classes of EGFRIs:  small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitors  such as gefitinib and erlotinib, and  monoclonal antibodies such as cetuximab and panitumumab. Although the response rates to these agents as monotherapy in unselected patients are modest, several studies have shown that survival is improved even in unselected patients .
Poly polymerase  1 and 2 enzymes regulate DNA damage repair and maintain genomic stability in cells. Inhibition of DNA repair by small molecule PARP inhibitors potentiates DNA damage caused by cytotoxic chemotherapies, including cyclophosphamide . Inhibition of PARP activity in the presence of deleterious mutations in the BRCA gene, which is involved in the homologous recombination pathway of DNA damage repair, can result in tumor cell death through the process of synthetic lethality .
Total joint replacement  is a highly successful procedure for the treatment of severe destructive arthritis. Wear debris induced inflammation and osteoclastic resorption at the bone implant interface are believed to play critical roles in the pathogenesis of aseptic loosening. The RANKL/OPG pathway plays a key role in bone metabolism and osteolysis.
Central sensitization is a complex phenomenon of synaptic plasticity characterized by the rapid onset activity dependent increase in the excitability of nociceptive spinal dorsal horn neurons . It has recently become clear that there are distinct forms of central sensitization. Several other types of synaptic plasticity arise in response to noxious stimuli which modify nociceptive transmission by altering synaptic efficacy.
Genetic factors are important for developing a psychotic disorder, the heritability for schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, the two most common psychotic illnesses, are both above 0.80 . Comprehensive neuropsychological research has established cognitive impairment as an intrinsic feature of psychosis . Cognition, and more specifically memory, has utility as an endophenotype of psychosis.
A key step in the progression of atherosclerotic lesions is formation of lipid loaded macrophage foam cells. Monocytes migrate from the blood, differentiate into macrophages that degrade LDL, and become filled with re esterified cholesterol droplets, . These processes contribute to early lesion growth and late complications leading to plaque rupture,  .
Food allergies pose significant risk of morbidity and mortality, particularly in young children. It has been estimated that approximately 1 2% of children develop peanut allergies  and over the past several decades, the rate of children that developed peanut allergies had increased in developed countries  . These studies have included analyses of responses to bacterial , parasitic , and viral  pathogens.
The temporal fine structure of a sound is the cycle by cycle timing of the waveform. Electrical stimulation of the auditory nerve through cochlear implants bypasses that imprecision. Indeed, auditory nerve fibers phase lock to higher frequencies when stimulated electrically than when stimulated with sound .
Astrocytes have recently gained prominence as essential mediators of the brain’s innate immune response to a variety of brain insults including infection. This barrier function is a key characteristic of astrocytes during infection and serves to protect the brain from immune cell infiltration and neuronal injury . Transforming growth factor beta  signaling in astrocytes is of particular interest because TGFβ s are master regulatory and primarily anti inflammatory cytokines that are universally increased during CNS infection and injury .
Parkinson disease  is a prevalent neurodegenerative movement disorder characterized pathologically by the rather selective loss of dopaminergic  neurons in the substantia nigra pars compacta . To date, a large number of LRRK2 mutations have been identified. Among these, the G2019S variant is the most common, with frequencies reaching up to 40% in North African PD populations .
Fucosidosis caused by deficiency of the lysosomal enzyme α L fucosidase is a progressive neurological lysosomal storage disease . Hypomyelination is the failure of normal myelin deposition that is attributable to oligodendrocyte dysfunction during active postnatal myelination . Downregulation of oligodendrocyte and myelin specific genes at 16 weeks in the frontal cerebrum of fucosidosis affected pups  suggests that the 14% loss of corpus callosum myelin in fucosidosis at this time   may be due to hypomyelination, rather than active myelin destruction.
Dentin matrix protein 1 , originally postulated to be dentin specific , was later detected in bone . The distinctive feature of DMP1 is the presence of many acidic domains, a property that implicates it is a possible participant in regulating matrix mineralization. The importance of DMP1 in biomineralization has been demonstrated by a number of studies  .
Photodynamic therapy  is an emerging treatment that has been used to treat malignant, premalignant, and benign conditions . A key component of PDT is the photosensitizer. It is inexpensive and is routinely available in hospital pharmacies.
Pain is a compound sensation that indicates real or potential injury. Processing of nociceptive information in higher brain structures activates descending pathways that modulate pain. The parathyroid hormone receptor 2  is expressed by neurons in many areas implicated in processing nociceptive information.
Bacterial DNA topoisomerase I belongs to the type IA family of DNA topoisomerase. This class of enzyme removes excess negative supercoiling from chromosomal DNA by cleaving the single stranded region of negatively supercoiled DNA while forming a covalent complex with the cleaved DNA, followed by passage of a second single DNA strand through the break, and rejoining of the cleaved DNA strand. Topoisomerase poisons targeting type IB and type IIA topoisomerases are effective antibacterial and anti cancer agents because these drugs can inhibit the DNA rejoining step of these topoisomerases .
Signaling from receptors in the plasma membrane requires a strong correlation between the extracellular stimulus and downstream intracellular events if information is not to be lost. It is unclear, for example, whether individual cells reliably transmit changes in the intensity of an extracellular stimulus to a graded change in cellular activity or whether the correlation between stimulus intensity and cellular response is realized largely by the average behavior of many cells . IP3 receptors  are intracellular Ca2+ channels located on the endoplasmic reticulum .
During development, extracellular cues activate conserved signal transduction pathways, which trigger changes in gene expression and ultimately lead to pleiotropic effects, including growth and differentiation. Frequently dys regulation of these pathways leads to human diseases like cancer. STATs are a unique family of latent cytoplasmic transcription factors that are recruited to phosphorylated IFN receptors and are then activated by JAKs.
Dog allergy is a public health burden highly associated with both asthma and allergic rhinitis. Contributing to this disease burden is the presence of around 53 million domestic dogs in the United States residing in approximately 33% of US homes. The magnitude of this problem makes it important to identify factors related to the accumulation of the major dog allergen Canis familiaris 1  in homes .
Growth factors are strongly associated with cancer development. Insulin like growth factor 1  and IGF2 are major growth factors involved in development and growth. During fetal growth IGF2 plays the main role in development and mice with IGF2 disruption exhibit serious growth retardation at birth .
Red cell distribution width  is routinely assessed as part of the complete blood count  to gather information on the heterogeneity in the size of circulating erythrocytes. Computationally, RDW is the coefficient of variation of the mean corpuscular volume  and therefore higher RDW values reflect greater heterogeneity in MCV , which is usually caused by perturbation in erythrocyte maturation or degradation. The RDW is used as an auxiliary index to help diagnose different types of anemia, but has also been evaluated as a potential screening marker for colon cancer and celiac disease because of its responsiveness to subtle nutrient deficiency.
The master circadian clock in mammals is a gene driven neural network that temporally regulates behavior and physiology. 20,000 neurons, and is located in the suprachiasmatic nuclei of the hypothalamus  . At a gross level, the SCN's control of circadian behavior is clearly established as SCN lesions result in behavioral circadian arrhythmicity  that can be restored by SCN transplants .
Salmonella enterica is a leading cause of bacterial gastro enteritis in humans worldwide . While most S. enterica infections are self limiting, serious cases often require treatment with antibiotics. For several decades, an increase in antibiotic resistance has been noted in S. enterica, as in other gram negative bacteria .
Herbicides represent an important group of agricultural pesticides. In plants, propanil inhibits photosynthesis to control broad leaved and grass weeds . Methemoglobinemia and hemolytic anemia have also been reported from animal studies with propanil exposure .
A preovulatory prolactin surge is evident on proestrous afternoon in rats . The rising titer of estradiol beginning late on diestrous day 2 and continuing into proestrous morning is essential for the occurrence of the prolactin surge and drives the early phase of the surge . Dopamine is the major inhibitor of prolactin release from the anterior pituitary gland .
One important observation about trabecular bone is its ability to adapt its structure according to the specific mechanical environment, as commonly defined as “Wolff's law” . This anisotropic nature of trabecular bone indicates that the “quality” of bone cannot be simply characterized by using dual energy x ray absorptiometry  to quantify some global parameters of bone, such as bone mineral density . As the National Institutes of Health specifies, “Bone quality refers to architecture, turnover, damage accumulation  and mineralization” .
A common mechanism through which activated receptor tyrosine kinases control intracellular pathways involves recruitment of SH2 containing proteins with regulatory or adaptor functions . For example, the Grb10 adaptor is an inhibitor of insulin signaling that is stabilized by mTOR mediated phosphorylation and suppresses insulin sensitivity in vivo . Loss of inhibitors can result in dysregulation of growth factor signaling, promoting the re wiring of metabolic pathways in a manner that supports rapid growth and cell survival.
Rapid advances in magnetic resonance imaging  have enabled noninvasive exploration of the human brain with increasing level of detail. Large databases of MR images are being assembled to enable researchers to examine subtle relationships between quantitative brain anatomy, disease progression, treatment regimens, risk, and other factors for various diseases. Differences in criteria among experts can lead to systematically different volume estimates of some brain regions, and so the highest consistency and sensitivity is achieved when a single individual traces the entire dataset.
Sudden cardiac death  results in 250,000 to 400,000 deaths in the United States annually. Coronary heart disease , with or without myocardial infarction , is the most common substrate underlying SCD in the western world, being responsible for approximately 75% of SCDs. However, the majority of individuals who die suddenly are not in recognized high risk subsets, and over half have no clinically recognized heart disease prior to death.
Over 40 years ago, Tokuhata and Lilienfeld  provided clear epidemiologic evidence for familial aggregation of lung cancer after accounting for personal smoking, suggesting the possible interaction of genes and smoking behavior in the etiology of lung cancer. similarly showed a 2.5 fold higher risk in the relatives of cases compared with controls after conditioning on smoking behavior and age. Genetic modeling studies have suggested that at least some of the observed familial aggregation of lung cancer may be due to inheritance of strongly acting genetic factors.
Differentiation between acute and older MIs is of great importance in clinical decision making. In the last decade, delayed enhancement  inversion recovery gradient echo  MRI with standard extracellular contrast agents became the most important and accurate imaging tool for assessing either the localization, the transmurality, or the extent, of MIs . DE is also capable of differentiating stunned myocardium from necrotic tissue in the acute phase , and hibernated myocardium from scar tissue in the chronic phase, of a MI .
Unintended pregnancy, defined as a pregnancy that is either unwanted or mistimed, is a serious global health issue related to a host of adverse health outcomes  including maternal and infant/child morbidity and mortality  as well as negative social consequences, such as school drop out . In the 2012 Honduras Demographic and Health Survey , 64% of all married women aged 15 49 reported using a modern method of contraception . Rather, populations with higher socioeconomic status  have experienced much greater rates of improvement compared to lower SES groups .
Proponents of translational research have identified practice based research  and practice based research networks  as essential for answering questions relevant to primary care and for overcoming barriers to the implementation of existing evidence into community based primary care practice. A practice based research network is defined as a group of separate practices that collaborate with each other and often with outside experts to conduct multiple research projects over an extended period of time while continuing to deliver care to patients. Family physicians in PBRNs have been contributing new knowledge to the discipline of family medicine for the past three decades.
Epithelial to mesenchymal transition  enables the migration of epithelial cells into connective tissues, a critical process for embryonic development . Such knowledge is critical for the understanding of the pathobiology of local invasion and metastasis of epithelial tumors, and may unveil novel therapeutic targets for this type of malignancy . Loss of E cadherin, a hallmark of EMT, is an important step in the progression of papilloma to invasive carcinoma .
Coffee and tea, the most frequently consumed beverages in the world, contain high levels of caffeine and polyphenols. Caffeine is a complex compound which has many different properties, some of which are mutagenic, and others which are anticarcinogenic, depending on experimental conditions . Caffeine is well known to be a stimulant of the central nervous system and has many physiological effects on the brain, including decreasing cerebral blood flow .
Among the multiple forms of age related hearing loss , the form associated with degeneration of cochlear stria vascularis  has been suggested to demonstrate the clearest genetic influences in humans . Through a detailed comparison of BALB/cJ  and C57BL/6J  mice, we showed that BALBs exhibit a lifelong EP pattern that is predicted by the density of strial marginal cells , while the overall appearance of the stria remains largely normal. Nevertheless, other origins of strial ARHL are likely.
Adenovirus  has been found in every class of vertebrates including mammals, birds, fish, amphibians and reptiles . In humans they cause common respiratory, gastrointestinal and eye infections, with 51 different serotypes described so far. They are widely used as vectors for gene therapy, and have showed promise in vaccine delivery and oncolysis ; .
The majority of cancer occurs as a result of alterations in oncogenes. Ligands of EGFR bind to the ectodomain of the receptor, leading to the formation of catalytically active receptor homo  and heterodimers in which the EGFR associates with other ErbB receptors. Although HER2 cannot bind any of the ErbB ligands directly, its catalytic activity can potently amplify signaling by ErbB containing heterodimers .
Human immunodeficiency virus  infection within the central nervous system  causes a variety of neuropathological changes. Although there is little evidence that macroglial cells in vivo are productively infected by HIV , activation of astroglia by viral proteins, or by substances released from reactive microglia, can amplify brain inflammation and neurotoxic sequelae, and also promote infiltration of infected monocytes from the periphery. Astroglia from humans and rodents secrete chemokine/cytokines in response to HIV 1 transactivator of transcription  protein .
Parkinson's disease  is characterized by progressive nigrostriatal degeneration and deficits in dopamine transmission. A pathological hallmark of PD are Lewy bodies  that present as intracellular inclusions of aggregated proteins and lipids in dopaminergic  neurons . In transgenic mutant α syn mice, and in mice treated with 1 methyl 4 phenyl 1,2,3,6 tetrahydopyridine  and rotenone  similar microglial responses are operative.
While many youth face obstacles to the successful development of sexual health, gay and bisexual youth and other young men who have sex with men  face particular challenges in this respect due to lack of support in the settings that traditionally promote positive youth development. Most peers also do not serve as potential romantic partners, which can limit the ability of young MSM to explore romantic relationships and develop this competency during adolescence. In the years since this study, use of the Internet in all segments of the population has exploded, but particularly among youth.
Living organisms exhibit daily rhythms in physiology, behaviour, and gene expression due to the existence of endogenous circadian clocks. In metazoans, the generation of circadian rhythmicity appears to be consequence of specialised tissues known as “master clocks”, which have different locations among species, i.e. lateral neurons in Drosophila , the pineal gland and retina in fish , pineal gland, retina and hypothalamus in birds , and the hypothalamic suprachiasmatic nuclei  in mammals  . The PER and CRY proteins form complexes that inhibit their own transcription by binding to the CLOCK:BMAL1 complex and blocking its function.
Advancing age has a significant impact on retinal structure, physiology and function. Age is a leading risk factor in age related macular degeneration, glaucoma, and vascular occlusive diseases., Under normal physiological conditions, blood flow  in the retina is closely coupled to metabolism and is tightly regulated. However, most optically based BF imaging techniques are limited to imaging the fovea or the optic nerve head, are confounded by media opacity if present , and are qualitative or semi quantitative which makes comparison across different subjects challenging .
A number of mental disorders and altered physiological states are increasingly being associated with fetal antecedent events . During this critical developmental time, endocrine disrupting compounds have the potential to be potent disruptors as alterations in hormone levels may lead to secondary anatomical and physiological changes in developing hormone sensitive systems  . Vinclozolin is a widely used dicarboximide fungicide previously described as an anti androgenic compound in mammals .
Numerous studies have shown that limitations in activities of daily living  are associated with institutionalization, death, and high health care costs. Because of this, assessment of ADL function has become a key component of geriatric assessment. However, ADL difficulty represents a fairly advanced stage of functional decline, and identification of older adults at risk for future ADL disability is important for prevention.
Neuronal cell death following traumatic brain injury  has been attributed to direct mechanical injury or to post traumatic secondary mechanisms that are activated weeks to months following brain injury . While cellular necrosis has been shown to be the prominent cause of cell death, recent evidence suggests apoptosis as a key mechanism that is involved in secondary or delayed neuronal cell death. The Bcl 2 family consists of an ever increasing number of members including the anti apoptotic proteins Bcl 2, Bcl x, Bcl w and mcl 1 and pro apoptotic proteins Bax, Bad, Bim and Bok .
In functional studies of the mouse brain, transgenic lines have played an invaluable role in various strategies including: labeling specific neurons by fluorescent protein expression, knocking out or over expressing genes in specific cell types, and ablating or inhibiting activity of specific neuronal populations. New molecular tools developed over the last decade have transformed approaches to study neural circuitry and plasticity with exquisite detail and control . For example, use of transgenic mice that express fluorescent markers at relatively high levels in defined neuronal populations, such as Thy1 EYFP, has facilitated detailed studies of the properties of a single neuron: morphology, connectivity, electrophysiology and gene expression, , and permits long term in vivo imaging.
Degeneration of the intervertebral disc  is a common and significant source of morbidity in our society. From 25% to 80% of adults over the course of their life will experience an episode of significant low back pain and as many as 90% of these people will improve without formal treatment. Historically, surgical interventions have focused on fusion of the involved IVD levels, which may eliminate pain but does not attempt to restore disc functions.
Cigarette smoking is a chronic illness characterized by repeated cycles of quit attempts and relapse. Most models for addressing smoking cessation are based on single, short term interventions lasting only a few weeks or months . The reach of current smoking cessation interventions is further limited by providing treatment only to smokers that are already prepared to quit .
  Light adapted adult zebrafish  were decapitated according to an Animal Study Protocol approved by the Animal Care and Use Committee of the National Institute of Neurological Disorders and Stroke, NIH, in accordance with National Research Council Guidelines and Public Health Service Policy on Humane Care and Use of Laboratory Animals. Interference filters mounted on one wheel  provided wavelengths from 330 650nm at 40nm intervals . Stimulus attenuations from 0.0 to 4.5 log units  were provided by another filter wheel, with further attenuation of 1 3 log units attained by manually inserting filters in the path.
Globally, 247 million people are infected with malaria every year, which causes 881,000 deaths annually. Pregnant women have an increased risk of Plasmodium falciparum infection which is maximal in the first and second pregnancy . Studies suggest that the var2csa variant of P. falciparum membrane protein 1  is the key protein which mediates this accumulation  .
Cholinergic neurons of the medial septum  that project to the hippocampus play an important role in learning, memory, and attentional processes, and have long been associated with the acquisition of working memory tasks . More recently, investigations utilizing the selective cholinergic immunotoxin 192 IgG Saporin  have found that lesioning cholinergic neurons of the MS has little or no effect on working memory in tests such as the Morris water maze . We previously reported that introduction of a mild aversive stimulus each day prior to training completely abolished the impairment in DMP acquisition produced by the cholinergic lesion in male rats .
The normal development of cortical regions of the mammalian brain depends on the migrations of neuronal precursors from germinal zones and assembly into neuronal laminae, where synaptic connections form . Since migration disorders are associated with cortical malformations, mental retardation and epilepsy , a clearer understanding of the molecular control of CNS neuronal migration could be relevant to the diagnosis and treatment of human brain disorders . The cerebellar cortex has long provided a model for glial guided neuronal migration .
The overall health problems related to schistosomiasis seems greater than ever; according to recent estimates up to 210 million people are infected with the disease in more than 76 countries , and an additional 779 million people are at risk of acquiring this infection . This is primarily because of the suboptimal success rates of most conventional control approaches especially as it relates to the developing world. Thus, the emphasis has been placed to develop new approaches involving a vaccine as an addition to the existing methods to control morbidity and mortality of the disease .
Exosomes are virus sized vesicles, ranging from 20100nm in size, and enveloped by a phospholipid membrane . Formed within the endocytic compartments, exosomes are released into the extracellular space via fusion of multivesicular bodies with the cell surface membrane . Tumor cells are avid exosome producers, and we have previously shown that these tumor derived exosomes, in contrast to exosomes produced by normal cells, exert immunosuppressive effects, impairing survival and functions of adaptive and innate immune cells  .
Ergosterol modulates membrane fluidity, stability, permeability and the activities of membrane bound enzymes in fungi. Fungal cells are known to regulate biosynthesis of sterols in response to sterol fluxes  . When sterol levels are reduced, ERG genes are upregulated by both Upc2p and Ecm22p  and both proteins have roles in sterol import and transport within the cell .
