Staphylococcus aureus is an aggressive pathogen that is responsible for a wide array of diseases ranging from pyogenic skin infections and food poisoning to complicated life threatening diseases such as bacteremia and endocarditis . Peptidoglycan hydrolases are enzymes that hydrolyse the peptidoglycan of the bacterial cell wall. These enzymes in S. aureus include N acetyl muramidase, N acetyl glucosaminidase, N acetylmuramyl L alanine amidase and endopeptidase .
Pervasive Developmental Disorders  are lifelong, neurodevelopmental conditions characterized by impairments in social interaction and communication skills, as well as repetitive behavior and unusual preoccupations. In addition, medication withdrawal of risperidone after six months of effective treatment resulted in the rapid return of disruptive behaviors. The randomized, controlled risperidone and aripiprazole trials that led to FDA approval enrolled children with autistic disorder with any combination of tantrums, aggression and self injury as measured by the Aberrant Behavior Checklist  Irritability subscale., Although the term “irritability” implies an affective component, these studies did not evaluate the context of the tantrums, aggression and self injury.
Psychiatric epidemiological studies have consistently demonstrated a significant gap between the need for and availability of mental health services in the United States. Currently, Latinos represent over 14% of the US population and are projected to represent nearly one third of the US population by 2050. Understanding their mental health service use is thus increasingly important as part of an overall strategy to address the nation's mental health needs .
Post radiotherapy fragility fractures are a frequent complication in cancer survivors. ; Radiation is effective in soft tissue sarcoma and carcinoma treatment, but underlying bone damage is common. Pelvic fracture rates range from is 9.520% , while rib fracture rates  range from 821% depending on dose.
Primary open angle  glaucoma is a leading cause of vision impairment and blindness in the United States and worldwide. The incidence of glaucoma increases with age, and it is higher among African Americans than most other racial and ethnic groups. As a broad category, thyroid condition may potentially have an effect on the development of glaucoma.
Tuberculosis  continues to be a world health problem of staggering proportions. Those individuals also infected with HIV are much more likely to develop active TB, further increasing incidence and mortality in areas of the world where HIV is rampant including sub Saharan Africa . In 2000, two separate laboratories identified the gene product Rv3855c  of M. tuberculosis as the enzyme responsible for bioactivation of ETA .
Peptide libraries are commonly used in a variety of endeavors including identifying peptide DNA interactions , as surrogates for screening protein protein interactions , and as a basis for finding potential peptidic drug molecules. Thus production of high quality peptide libraries is of wide interest for many applications . Typically, peptides for libraries have been produced via solid phase synthesis, which involves sequential coupling of amine protected amino acids to resin bound amino acids.
Gene based drugs typically require a carrier to facilitate delivery into cell nuclei, where they are transcribed and later translated into proteins that can elicit a therapeutic effect. While virally derived carriers have been the preferred vectors in clinical trials, a number of safety concerns have arisen due to their ability to alter the genome  and activate the immune system. Several degradable polymers containing ethylene imine units have been reported with comparable gene delivery efficiency to that of PEI but with reduced cytotoxicity.,,, Bromomaleimide functional groups have recently been developed for their ability to reversibly react with thiols.
Spinal bulbar muscular atrophy  is an adult onset, slowly progressive lower motoneuron disease characterized by proximal limb and bulbar muscle weakness and atrophy affecting primarily men. This disease is linked to an expansion of a CAG repeat in the androgen receptor  gene, coding for an expanded polyglutamine  repeat in the AR protein . Data from our ‘myogenic’ mouse model challenges this neurocentric view of SBMA.
Gastric motility is initiated and coordinated by an underlying omnipresentslow wave activity, that is generated by the interstitial cells of Cajal. Slow wavespropagate through the ICC networks and conduct to adjacent smooth muscle layers,inducing contractions when co regulatory conditions are met, such as after ameal. The pig is increasingly being used as an animal model for invivo studies of gastric slow wave activity and motility, mainly because the pig is a monogastric omnivore like manand because they are relatively easy to source.
Inhibitory control is a multi faceted cognitive process that facilitates resistance to interference from irrelevant environmental stimuli and the suppression of previously activated inappropriate motor responses . In essence, inhibitory control is the ability to restrain behaviors that would disrupt the efficient completion of a goal. Although problems with inhibition were once conceptualized as being universal among individuals with ADHD , recent research suggests that only approximately half of children and adolescents with ADHD show deficits in inhibitory control .
Recent studies have led to the emergence of a new class of genes with a specific anti cancer activity. Among those genes are apoptin, mda 7/IL 24, par 4, and also TRAIL. Their modes of action are currently under intense investigation fuelled by the expectation that they reveal novel therapeutic interference options.
Chlamydiae sps are obligate intracellular bacterial pathogens of humans and animals. In humans, Chlamydia trachomatis infects ocular and genital epithelial surfaces to cause diseases such as conjunctivitis, salpingitis and urethritis, and chronic inflammation from recurrent chlamydial infections can lead to devastating sequela such as blinding trachoma, pelvic inflammatory disease and infertility  . It has been proposed that attachment to the inclusion membrane maintains RBs in a replicative state while detachment triggers the developmental transition to EBs .
Current therapy for HCV infection consists of pegylated interferon  and ribavirin  . Treatment options currently in development include drugs that target the HCV encoded NS3 4A serine protease and the NS5B RNA dependent RNA polymerase  . These drugs have been evaluated in early phase clinical trials alone and in combination with pegylated IFN and/or RBV  .
Although inhibitory behavior has been the focus of substantial prior research, most studies have emphasized motor inhibition by measuring performance variables such as stop signal reaction time or levels of premature responding . This behavior depends on learning about environmental stimuli and evaluating which stimuli are significant for goal directed behavior. Considerable evidence implicates the prefrontal cortex  in a number of tasks in which responding is based on discriminating between stimuli, including the five choice serial reaction time task , signal discrimination  and attentional set shifting procedures .
Despite the development of highly active antiretroviral therapy , people who use illicit drugs continue to experience high levels of preventable HIV/AIDS related morbidity and mortality . To date, studies from a wide variety of settings indicate that people who use illicit drugs  have lower rates of HAART initiation , are less likely to achieve virological suppression , and experience higher rates of mortality  . A number of studies have identified links between common psychoactive agents, including cannabis, heroin and cocaine, and relevant immunologic or virologic parameters .
Metagenomics uses gene expression patterns to understand the taxonomy and metabolic activities of microbial communities. Metaproteomics applies the same approach to community proteomes. Previously, we used a novel three dimensional peptide separation method to identify over 2,000 salivary proteins, including 139 of microbial origin.
Alcohol and tobacco use each contribute 4% to the global burden of disease, with illicit drugs contributing an additional 0.8% . Within the developed regions of the world , the burden of disease attributable to alcohol and smoking is 9.2% and 12.2%, respectively; an additional 1.8% of disease is attributable to illicit drugs . Similarly, among a national sample of uninsured workers, those in construction/extraction occupations were significantly more likely to report binge drinking, or drug and alcohol use, compared to workers in service occupations .
  Demographic information about the participants is presented in . The contrast group was made up of 16 siblings of the children in the NF1 group and 21 children recruited from the community. Siblings were included regardless of overall intellectual functioning.
Although not high in frequency, negative interpersonal interactions such as conflict with family and friends, teasing or harassment by peers, and being reprimanded by parents or teachers are a feature of the adolescent experience . Interpersonal stressors such as these are examples of low frequency events that nevertheless have a high psychological impact. Less is known, however, about the impact of these normative interpersonal stressors for the physical health of adolescents.
Certain regions in the adult mammalian nervous system, including thesubventricular zone and the dentate gyrus, retain an ability to replenish neurons. The most striking capacity for self renewal in an adultneuroepithelium occurs in the olfactory epithelium  of the nose . Here,neurons are vulnerable and must be replaced to maintain function of a sensory systemthat is vitally important to most mammals.
Over 25 million Americans have asthma, and the number of diagnoses increased nearly 15% in the last decade. While deaths related to asthma have declined in recent years, it remains a significant cause of morbidity with 479,300 hospitalizations and almost 2 million emergency department  visits in 2009. African Americans are at the highest risk for developing asthma and are two to three times more likely to die from asthma than any other race or ethnic group.
Acquired mesial temporal lobe epilepsy  with hippocampal sclerosis is a common, often medically refractory neurological disorder thought to be initiated by a brain insult . Refractory MTLE is associated with a characteristic pattern of selective and extensive hippocampal neuron loss that results in hippocampal atrophy . Efforts to model epileptogenic brain injury have most frequently employed systemic chemoconvulsants .
Ozone is a chemically reactive gas present in air pollution and as such is one of the most common environmental toxicants . Ozone is generated through various photochemical driven reactions between oxygen and nitrogen oxides or volatile organic compounds , and therefore more prominent during summer months in most areas. Epidemiological studies have linked increases in environmental ozone with increased mortality, especially in susceptible populations such as asthmatics or individuals with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease .
Secondhand tobacco smoke  consists of the side stream smoke from the burning end of the cigarette, which contains the highest concentration of particulate matter, and the exhaled mainstream smoke . Exposure to SHS is associated with diverse health effects in nonsmokers. These adverse health outcomes include heart disease, lung cancer, asthma flares, chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , and upper airway problems such as sinusitis .
Black blood turbo spin echo  sequences are an essential component of the cardiac MRI pulse sequence repertoire and are commonly used for tissue characterization. Black blood preparation pulses suppress the signal from flowing blood without affecting the contrast in stationary tissues. These two properties give black blood TSE imaging an important role in visualizing the morphology of the myocardium, which is altered in conditions such as in arrhythmogenic right ventricular dysplasia .
Despite the multitude of antidepressant drugs available to patients, major depression remains a significant cause of morbidity and mortality in our society. Thus there is a great need to further understand the mechanisms underlying depression in order to develop new treatments. Within the hippocampus and ventral tegmental area, Ghsr mediates ghrelin’s enhancement of reward related behaviors,  cue potentiated feeding,, hippocampal spine synaptic density and memory retention.
Heterozygous mutations in the gene coding for the isocitrate dehydrogenase 1  enzyme have been reported in several cancer types, most notably in over 70% of diffuse low grade gliomas and 80% of secondary glioblastomas  . Amongst other effects, presence of the IDH1 mutation is associated with a range of alterations in the cellular metabolome. These have been reported in mutant IDH1 expressing cell models, ex vivo tumor samples, and in vivo patient studies, and include significant changes in choline containing metabolites, N acetyl aspartate, and glutamate .
Post operative venous thromboembolic  complications such as deep vein thrombosis  and pulmonary embolism  are well known complications of lower extremity total joint arthroplasty  procedures. In addition, VTE prophylaxis  is an element of widely disseminated evidence based clinical practice guidelines which have formed the basis for national initiatives to improve care quality. Many historical studies of pharmacologic VTEP in TJA, particularly those examining aspirin versus placebo, took place in an era when the perioperative care of TJA patients was far different than it is today.
Neurons are morphologically characterized by long, highly branched cytoplasmic extensions called neurites . The Drosophila brain is formed by a stereotyped set of approximately 100 neuroblasts that appear in the early embryo . Similar to primary axons, axons of a given secondary lineage fasciculate with each other and form a discrete bundle, the secondary axon tract  within the larval brain .
The cellular response to viral infection usually involves major changes in host gene expression to effect the suppression of viral replication by the induction of immune responses. The NF κB transcription factors are held inactive by their association with Inhibitor of κB  proteins. This allows the released NF κB transcription factors to bind to DNA, and then induce the transcription of a wide range of genes, including many of critical importance in immune responses, cell proliferation, and apoptosis  .
Exposure to chronic stress has been linked to cardiovascular disease  . This alteration may result in differential exposure to the stress hormone cortisol. For example, cortisol affects the development of insulin resistance  and central adiposity , influences blood pressure regulation  and inflammatory processes .
Fas ligand  was initially identified as a potent pro apoptotic type II transmembrane protein belonging to the TNF gene family , and it is predominantly expressed by CD4+, CD8+, NKT, and NK cytotoxic effector cells . It follows that FasL is a dangerous molecule and strict regulation of its activity is a necessity. FasL expression is controlled at a number of levels including transcription, vesicular compartmentalization, and cleavage.
Natural killer T cells  that share the cell surface receptors of NK cells  and in addition express an antigen receptor  generally recognize lipid antigens in the context of the CD1 molecules and bridge innate immune responses to adaptive immunity . Sulfatide is a sulfolipid in which the 3’ OH moiety on the galactose is sulfated and the carbohydrate moiety is attached to the ceramide in a β linkage. Therefore sulfatide is a potential autoantigen, and sulfatide reactive type II NKT cells might be modulated to influence the course of autoimmunity in the CNS.
Clostridium difficile is the most common cause of healthcare associated diarrhea in adults in the United States , and is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in adults , and children . Rates of C. difficile infection  in hospitalized children are increasing . However, C. difficile and its toxins can be detected in up to 70% of asymptomatic young children .
Through a collaborative multidisciplinary approach involving experimental and computational studies at various scales  from molecular to cellular and organismal  we are engaged in an effort to reveal the mechanisms that engender the complex effects of hallucinogenic drugs of abuse ). Using methods of molecular biophysics and computational biology, we simulate the dynamic properties of the ligand bound receptor systems for hallucinogens compared to non hallucinogenic congeners . The findings leading to this newly gained understanding include key mechanistic components such as  modes of receptor response ”) responsible for protein protein interactions ranging from homo  and hetero oligomerization to interactions with scaffold proteins , and  the role of conformational rearrangements of the receptor due to hallucinogen binding in association/dissociation of specific protein protein interactions and selective signaling.
Transfusion is a frequently administered therapy among critically ill patients; between one third and one half of patients are transfused at some point in the course of their intensive care unit  stays. , During the mid 20th Century, the decision to transfuse asymptomatic patients had been guided by the “10/30” rule, that a minimum acceptable hemoglobin level  of 10.0 g/dL , which continued for several decades. , With the recognition in 1982 that human immunodeficiency virus was a blood borne pathogen and new data documenting physiologic tolerance of anemia, by the 1980s, this automatic transfusion threshold came into question .
Exploratory spatial methods are used in neuroimaging to find areas that show an effect of diagnosis, demographics, treatment, etc., where no strong a priori anatomical hypothesis exists. To do this, a parametric map of some neuroimaging measure is acquired for each subject. To compensate, spatial smoothing is widely applied in exploratory analysis .
With increased short term survival rates among pediatric solid organ transplant recipients, health care providers have shifted focus to long term outcomes. Long term patient survival is limited by chronic rejection and graft loss, which is more common in adolescents . There is also an increased risk for medical complications following the transfer from pediatric to adult centered transplant services .
Several recent studies have shown the upregulation of key metastatic markers during the progression of melanoma and have provided potential molecular targets . Activation of the Wnt5A pathway leads to the release of calcium from intracellular stores and to the upregulation of target proteins, such as protein kinase C . In melanoma, upregulation of Wnt5A increases cell invasion .
People of Hispanic/Latino origin will constitute 29% of the U.S. population by 2050 according to Pew Hispanic Center projections, while non Hispanic whites will constitute less than 50% . This shift in the national demographic profile will likely have public health implications for burden of disease, its distribution and determinants . Paradoxically given language barriers, high poverty rates and low health insurance coverage, Hispanics/Latinos enjoy health advantages.
Bone metastasis is a common event during breast cancer progression with the resultant lesions often being osteolytic . Increased bone resorption results in the release of sequestered growth factors from the bone matrix such as transforming growth factor β  and insulin like growth factors . In order to resorb bone, the osteoclast forms a resorptive seal on the mineralized bone matrix after retraction of the osteoblast canopy .
During adolescence, a key developmental task is establishing autonomy. Some adolescents are more successful at this than others, and some parents are better at fostering adolescents’ autonomy than others. The result of merging these areas of inquiry is a model that attends to two different autonomy relevant aspects of parenting  within the context of family systems that go beyond individual parent child dyads .
Congenital heart disease, the most common significant birth defect, affects 8 per 1000 live births and requires cardiopulmonary bypass  and deep hypothermic circulatory arrest  surgery. Over the last several years, pH stat versus alpha stat blood gas management during CPB has been investigated in an attempt to establish which of these techniques results in lesser DHCA dependent brain injury . At the present time many other clinical and animal studies suggest that one or the other strategy is more beneficial.
Experiments in functional MRI  often involve single shot gradient echo echo planar imaging  pulse sequences to maximize acquisition speed and blood oxygenation level dependent  contrast . Correcting these errors has been a consistent field of research. Although large scale inhomogeneities are generally constant over experimental time series, this assumption fails when considering sensitive phase data due to the small scale changes associated with the resonance offset caused by the breathing cycle  and slight changes in the orientation of tissue boundaries.
Inflammatory bowel diseases , including Crohn’s disease  and Ulcerative colitis , is a chronic disease that results from dysregulated immune response to commensal microflora . It has been estimated that 1 to 2 million individuals in North American suffer from IBD with the peak of onset occurring between 15 and 30 years of age. Genetic studies have identified many loci in the genome associated with intestinal inflammation.
Mixed model procedures  have an impressive history in the statistical analysis of clustered, hierarchical, and spatial data. and Almasy and Blangero  later extended this variance component  method to perform linkage analysis of quantitative trait data by modeling a separate component of variation due to a putative major gene locus of interest. One can test this assumption using diagnostic tools such as those described in  and .
Elucidating the high energy conformations a protein samples as it traverses its folding landscape is the key to understanding which factors determine its folding trajectory. What characteristics of these intermediates contribute to their helpful or harmful nature? Furthermore, understanding the nature of the rate limiting transition state can lend insight into what restrictions are placed on an efficient folding process.
Chimeric simian human immunodeficiency viruses  were developed for studies of pathogenicity and preclinical assessment of candidate HIV 1 vaccines in nonhuman primate  models . However, currently available SHIV challenge stocks have limitations. Many HIV 1 Envs do not produce viable viruses when introduced into the SIV backbone.
The actin cytoskeleton is integral to many cellular processes including survival, migration, proliferation, differentiation, and cell cell communication . Since the dysregulation of these processes in osteoblasts could contribute to diseases such as osteoporosis by interfering with the normal maintenance of bone architecture and metabolism, it is important to understand the signaling pathways and intermediates that modulate the osteoblast actin cytoskeleton. It is known that the small G protein RhoA, when active in its geranylgeranylated and GTP bound form, is capable of maintaining the actin cytoskeleton .
Cellular respiration in aerobic organisms involves the transfer of electrons, coupled to transmembrane proton translocation, through the respiratory chain. Thirteen of the polypeptides of the respiratory chain complexes are encoded by the mitochondrial DNA , including subunits I III of CytcO. Mutations in the mtDNA have for a long time been known to be linked to various disease states.
Noise is one of, if not the, most common exposures in both occupational and community settings, and there are very few individuals who do not have the potential for at least occasional exposures to substantial levels of noise. The prevalence of NIPTS in developed countries may be greatly underestimated, and in developing countries, the prevalence may be as great, or even greater than, as developed countries. Worldwide, rates of NIPTS are expected to increase over the next 20 years.
Kallistatin  was first discovered as a tissue kallikrein binding protein and a unique serine proteinase inhibitor . Moreover, our previous study indicated that kallistatin inhibited angiogenesis and tumor growth in cultured cells and tumor xenografts in nude mice. In addition, transgenic mice overexpressing kallistatin are resistant to lipopolysaccharide induced mortality.
The California Smoke Free Workplace Act—Assembly Bill 13— was enacted into law in July 1994 and applied to bars statewide in 1998 . Since 2001, anthropologists at the Prevention Research Center in Berkeley have been conducting ethnographic evaluations of this law in California bars, collecting data through naturalistic observations and in depth interviews with bar patrons and staff . While we found the majority of bars in these studies to be smokefree, we identified many bars where indoor smoking has continued despite the law, and many of these bars could be grouped by patron type.
The measurement of salivary cortisol as a method of assessing hypothalamic pituitary adrenocortical  axis activation is effective and noninvasive, making it attractive to researchers interested in stress responses across the lifespan. However, researchers who collect saliva from infants and toddlers anecdotally report having difficulty with saliva collection because these young participants are often unwilling or unable to actively participate in saliva expectoration, problems exacerbated when multiple samples are solicited. For example, previous work has demonstrated that cotton dental rolls affect cortisol assays to varying degrees depending on the type of cotton and the type of assay.
Management of the axilla is a critical component of breast cancer care , but accurately determining the extent of axillary surgery in existing data sources has proven challenging. To date, the most reliable source of extent of axillary surgery has been cancer registry data . To ensure the quality of collected data across cancer registries, strict data standards have been developed.
FMS like tyrosine kinase 3  is a receptor tyrosine kinase that is commonly mutated in acute myeloid leukemia . A number of clinical trials for AML patients with FLT3 mutations have been performed using novel tyrosine kinase inhibitors  that target FLT3 . A number of FLT3 TKI active against FLT3/ITD have little activity against FLT3/PMs, such as the most frequently occurring D835Y mutation.
The ingredients and additives in tobacco products have important health implications. The type of tobacco affects carbon monoxide  and tobacco specific nitrosamines in smoke. Aceteldehyde, derived from burning sugars, enhances nicotine’s addictive effect, and is carcinogenic.
Integrin mediated cell adhesion to the extracellular matrix  plays central roles in various cellular processes including survival, cell cycle progression, and the expression of tissue specific phenotypes . Cell adhesion comprises the coordinated evolution of binding of integrin receptors to adhesive domains in ECM ligands, integrin clustering, interactions with the actin cytoskeleton, and focal adhesion assembly . Focal adhesions are discrete adhesive plaques that contain numerous structural  and signaling elements .
There is evidence that depression is associated with executive deficits . conducted one of the few studies that examined this question. Specifically, they assessed how autobiographical memory was associated with tasks of executive control and found that errors on the control tasks negatively correlated with ability to retrieve specific memories, or memories of contextualized events that lasted less than one day.
Despite known health risks, nicotine use remains high, especially in populations diagnosed with mental illnesses, including anxiety disorders and Post Traumatic Stress Disorder . Smoking in these populations may relate to the effects of nicotine on emotional memories. The current study examined the effects of nicotine administration on the extinction of conditioned fear memories .
Kv4.2 channels underlie the transient A type K+ current  in hippocampal dendrites where they control the amplitude of back propagating action potentials and shape postsynaptic responses . Recent studies have shown that Kv4.2 channels in hippocampus undergo activity dependent internalization in response to activation of synaptic glutamate receptors resulting in altered IA and enhanced magnitude of long term potentiation  . This is consistent for a role of Kv4.2 channels in controlling postsynaptic responses that contribute to synaptic plasticity  .
Since 1996, the zoonotic threat of avian influenza viruses  has been exemplified by the direct transmission of the H5N1 from poultry to humans in many countries throughout the world, including Asia, Africa and Europe . The AIV are classified as type A influenza viruses in the Orthomyxoviridae family. Although shore birds and waterfowl, such as ducks, swans, geese, waders and terns, are considered the original hosts, AIV strains have also been isolated from pheasants, quails and poultry .
Acute ischemic stroke  treatment is limited to IV or intra arterial  tissue plasminogen activator  and mechanical endovascular therapies. These strategies benefit eligible patients, but carry inherent risks, thereby making determination of individual risk versus benefit important when considering recanalization therapies. The most commonly assessed stroke risk factors are age, infarct volume, and baseline National Institutes of Health Stroke Scale  score.
Anaplastic astrocytomas  are diffusely infiltrative astrocytic tumors with cellular anaplasia and mitotic activity but, unlike glioblastoma , they have neither microvascular proliferation nor necrosis . Although less aggressive than GBM, mortality is still quite high with a five year survival rate of only 25.9 % . The prognostic role of isocitrate dehydrogenase  mutations in gliomas has recently been gaining significant attention .
There is great momentum for image guided interventions  in general and image guided drug delivery  in particular, with many activatable particles under development . Encapsulating chemotherapeutics within liposomes significantly reduces the toxicity of those drugs . Preclinical and clinical studies of activatable drug delivery vehicles are expanding .
Poor sleep quality predicts adverse outcomes in patients with coronary heart disease  . Known demographic risk factors for poor sleep include older age, female sex, non White race, less education, low income, and being unmarried. The potential effects of anger expression on sleep quality have not been evaluated in patients with CHD .
Exposure to ethanol during the development of the central nervous system  can lead to a wide array of neuroanatomical, behavioral and cognitive abnormalities, broadly subsumed under the Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorder  classification. Such exposure during these sensitive early periods is acknowledged to be a leading cause of intellectual disability worldwide . Despite concerted efforts to increase awareness of the dangers of developmental alcohol exposure, the incidence of alcohol related developmental disorders has continued to escalate since it was first characterized 40 years ago .
There is a high prevalence of depression in patients with diabetes. Approximately one third of diabetic patients also exhibit comorbid depression, and the odds of developing depression double in diabetics over the general population . A recent study also found that depression is associated with a 60% increase risk of type 2 diabetes .
Individuals infected with HIV 1 are at risk of developing HIV associated neurocognitive disorders  despite the availability of combined antiretroviral therapy . Abuse of Methamphetamine  increases the risk of HIV 1 infection . The various affected brain structures and neural circuits suggest pathological consequences beyond the dopaminergic system  .
The cellular level of the catalytic domain of telomerase  is directly related to telomerase activity . Telomerase is expressed in approximately 8590% of cancer specimens  and is a critical element in both tumorigenesis  and resistance to radiotherapy in cancer cells . Expression of hTERT is primarily regulated by the core promoter located 180 to +1 relative to the transcription initiation site , and this core promoter contains five Sp1 binding sites and one E box as a c myc binding site  .
The postsynaptic density protein 95  is one of the most abundant proteins present at excitatory postsynaptic sites in the CNS . PSD 95 binds other postsynaptic molecules, including NMDA receptors and signaling molecules . c Abl belongs to the Abl family and has been implicated in different neuronal processes, including neurulation and neurite outgrowth .
Laser light has been shown to be an effective nerve stimulus. have stimulated rat peripheral nerves, Izzo et al. Although electrical stimulation is the standard method of neural excitation, laser stimulation offers some significant advantages.
Serotonin , a key central nervous system neurotransmitter, is involved in regulating a broad range of psychological traits, behaviors, and physical functions including mood, sleep, appetite, and sexual activity. The serotonin transporter protein , which terminates the action of serotonin by facilitating its reuptake from the synapse, appears to be part of the pathway leading to psychiatric disorders and has been a target of widely used pharmacological treatments. a 44bp deletion/insertion generated two alleles of 5 HTTLPR, with the 14 repeat short  variant having less transcriptional activity and lower serotonin uptake than the 16 repeat long  variant.
The primate primary visual cortex  sends most of its output to area V2 in the form of multiple functionally specialized pathways, which segregate into distinct V2 modules . , , ) Based on qualitative observations, they proposed that all stripe types receive inputs from the same V1 layers  and that their V1 input is tangentially segregated into only two pathways:  CO blob columns to thin stripes,  interblob columns to pale and thick stripes  . However, several observations suggest that pale and thick stripes may instead receive segregated V1 inputs.
Cocaine abuse causes serious medical and social consequences in our society. However, the classic pharmacodynamic approach has failed to yield small molecule drugs due to the difficulties inherent in blocking a blocker. It has been shown that the predominant forms of recombinant BChE secreted from Chinese hamster ovary  cells were monomers and dimers, whereas native BChE consists more than 95% of tetramers that lead to the longer half life of native BChE in plasma.
Several experimental studies point to the antitumor effects of genetic and pharmacological blockade of the coagulation system including tumor cell associated tissue factor  ;, and often through interference with angiogenesis  . However, other reports suggest that TF expression by cancer cells is of little  consequence for tumor aggressiveness ;. A possible explanation of this conundrum could lie in the observation that TF may be expressed by various subsets of host cells often present in the tumor mass, including, stromal fibroblasts, inflammatory cells and the endothelium, all likely involved in regulation of angiogenesis , but this possibility has not been explored directly .
Opioid analgesics are effective for the management of moderate to severe pain. With continuation of opioid therapy, some opioid related side effects such as sedation may subside. On the other hand, a prolonged course of opioid therapy may lead to tolerance to and physical dependence on opioid analgesics.
Adoptive immunotherapy using T cells and their derivatives has shown promise as treatment for human malignancies, but to date the range of susceptible tumors has been limited. One of the constraints for successful treatment is the limited trafficking of lymphocytes, which requires effector T cells to express chemokine receptors matched with the chemokines produced by the tumor cells or their associated elements . Many human tumors produce low levels of chemokines, while others produce chemokines for which effector T cells lack receptors.
Erectile dysfunction  is associated with cardiovascular disease , however the association between change in ED status over time and future underlying CVD risk is unclear . We studied 965 men free of CVD in the Boston Area Community Health Survey , a longitudinal cohort study with three assessments. ED was assessed with the 5 item International Index of Erectile Function  at BACH I  and BACH II  and classified as no ED/transient ED/persistent ED.
Hepatic ischemia and reperfusion  complicates liver transplantation, major hepatic resection and prolonged portal vein occlusion . The pathophysiology of hepatic IR injury is complex and involves a complex orchestration of necrosis, apoptosis and inflammation mediated by hepatic  and extra hepatic  components . Moreover, hepatic IR frequently leads to remote organ injury including the kidney, lung, and heart .
Catheter ablation has become an integral part of the management of atrial fibrillation  when a strategy to preserve normal sinus rhythm is required. However, critical details of the technique are still controversial, the procedure demands high technical dexterity and carries significant risk of complications. However, isolation of the left sided veins can be difficult due to the presence of a thick pectinate muscle separating the veins from the left atrial appendage .
This qualitative study is part of a larger mixed methods evaluation of a state small grants program for pregnancy prevention . Science based practices include identifying public health objectives, specifying goals for behavior changes, logic models, selecting or developing curricula using behavioral/social science research, and integrating evaluation into program development, adaptation, implementation and assessment  . On the community level, there is increasing interest in adopting effective, science based approaches.
Pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma  is one of the most lethal cancers with less than 4% of patients surviving past 5 years of diagnosis. These included the formation of intraepithelial neoplasias , the most common precursor lesions observed in human PDAC. However, KrasG12D alone rarely induces full blown pancreatic cancer .
The US has made little progress in the last three decades in protecting its young people against teen pregnancies and HIV and other sexually transmitted infections  . Youth are becoming sexually experienced early  , and the proportion increases steadily through high school: more than two thirds of high school seniors have had sex . Moreover, almost 40% of US teens who are sexually active reported not using a condom during their last intercourse  .
African Americans have a higher incidence and overall mortality of lung cancer compared to Caucasians. Survival analyses of patients participating in cooperative groups clinical trials, which provide for uniform extent of disease and therapy, showed statistically significantly worse survival at one year for African American patients. This disparity suggests an even more pressing need to develop new anticancer agents to target lung cancer in this patient population, and the low rate of enrollment of African Americans in cancer clinical trials is distressing.
Diabetic individuals often suffer from complications such as coronary artery disease, peripheral artery disease and stroke which contribute to the morbidity or mortality among these subjects . This higher incidence of cardiovascular complications as well as the unfavorable prognosis among diabetic individuals who develop such complications has been correlated to diabetes mediated impairment of angiogenesis . Inhibited angiogenesis is known to contribute to impaired coronary collateral vessel formation and wound healing .
The biochemical purification of proteins and macromolecular complexes has become the rate limiting step in structure determination by single particle cryo electron microscopy . A purification protocol of a recombinant protein for structural studies typically consists of an affinity chromatography step followed by size exclusion chromatography. Such a two step purification scheme requires an appreciable amount of protein, which cannot always be produced, and takes several hours, during which time biological complexes can disintegrate.
In both Menkes Disease, with low levels of copper, and Wilson's disease, with elevated levels of copper, neural function is impaired . In humans, acquired copper deficiency can accompany long term parenteral nutrition or malabsorption; in addition to hematological symptoms, sensory ataxia and spastic gait may occur . Biomarkers that accurately reflect mild changes in copper status have not yet been established  .
Embedded in biomedical science are many sets of related dichotomies: body or mind, objective or subjective, biology or belief, specific or non specific, and pharmacology or placebo . In treatment, these effects are generally considered additive . Taking pain relief as an example, it is believed that analgesic treatments consist of two components: the treatment specific effect from the physical or pharmacological interventions, and the non specific, or placebo, component.
The mammalian telencephalon develops at the rostral end of the neural tube as part of the early forming prosencephalon. The development of the telencephalon is under the guidance of a series of morphogens in and around the forebrain. These cues include Bone Morphogenetic Proteins , Wnts, Fibroblast Growth Factors  and Sonic Hedgehog .
Patients with chronic, life limiting illnesses face serious and confusing health care decisions in the last years of life which are often complicated by documents such as “living wills”. A preferred approach involves legally appointing a health care agent or proxy but most efforts to prepare surrogates to make substituted decisions have been unsuccessful. In a systematic review on the accuracy of surrogate decision making, Shalowitz et al concluded that surrogates incorrectly predicted patients' treatment preferences in one third of cases.
Like most large scale biological experiments, the vast majority of proteomics studies tend to produce long lists of candidate proteins. Such tools are crucial in order to get a clear understanding of the biological mechanisms taking place in a given sample and are critical to guide further studies on subsets of proteins within a dataset. Multiple techniques were proposed to analyze large scale biological datasets, some of which were originally applied to gene expression analysis but were then adapted to proteomics studies .
Atrial fibrillation  is the most common sustained heart rhythm abnormality, affecting over 2.2 million adults in the United States. AF is an important risk factor for both incident and recurrent stroke. Cardioembolic stroke, most of which is due to AF, is the most lethal subtype of ischemic stroke and has a higher risk of disability than other stroke subtypes.
Opioid misuse, abuse, and dependence have become major clinical and public health problems in the United States. Although heroin remains a major drug of abuse, the growing number of people addicted to prescription opioids now eclipses the number of people addicted to heroin. This pervasive trend is reflected in the rapid increase in the number of unintended lethal overdoses in the United States, most of which can be attributed at least in part to prescription opioids.
Second harmonic generation  is a nonlinear optical phenomenon where photons interact with a nonlinear material and generate photons with twice the energy. Recently, SHG microscopy based imaging has caught attention among biologists, especially neuroscientists, due to its exquisite sensitivity to interfaces  and to its fast and linear response to changes in membrane potential . Commonly used SHG chromophores are push pull styryl dyes with a dominant uniaxial molecular dipole.
Mixing commercial facilities, single family housing, and multifamily housing has for centuries enabled residents to walk to multiple near home destinations. In the U.S., this long tradition was broken with the advent of Euclidian zoning, which allowed localities to separate land uses. Originally intended to protect health by separating noxious industrial land from residential areas , segregated land uses are now implicated in modern health problems associated with less walking, heavier weight, and more automobile pollution  .
Contrast enhanced whole heart coronary magnetic resonance angiography  at 3T with slow infusion of contrast agent has recently been proposed . An inversion recovery prepared spoiled gradient echo sequence, which is relatively insensitive to the increased field inhomogeneities at 3T, was employed. A preliminary clinical study has shown that 3T contrast enhanced coronary MRA is a promising method for detecting coronary artery disease in patients .
Campylobacter jejuni is an important food borne pathogen and the leading cause of bacterial gastroenteritis in humans . Moreover, severe post infectious complications include Guillain Barré syndrome, a significant cause of acute neuromuscular paralysis , and irritable bowel syndrome. Because the incidence of human C. jejuni infection is noticeably increasing, with the rapid emergence of antibiotic resistant strains, there is growing interest to identify novel virulence factors and pathogenesis mechanisms associated with this pathogen as a key step toward controlling the disease .
Peripheral arterial disease  is prevalent in 12% of the United States population, and is associated with increased morbidity and mortality. Ambulatory dysfunction and lower physical activity level of patients with PAD places them at greater risk for disuse atrophy of the lower extremity musculature than is typically observed with normal aging. Fat free mass is the largest contributor to resting energy expenditure in healthy controls, and in patients with PAD and intermittent claudication.
Itraconazole  is a systemic triazole antifungal with a broad spectrum of activity commonly used for the treatment of Candida spp. infections, the most frequent fungal pathogens . In mammals, ICZ also interacts with this enzyme, but with much lower affinity , resulting in the accumulation of lanosterol and inhibition of the cholesterol biosynthesis pathway .
Degenerative disc disease contributes to disability and pain pathology in the cervical and lumbar spine in over 80% of the US population. Unfortunately not much is known of these biological factors that contribute to the onset of changes in NP cell phenotype and morphology., Juvenile NP cells have been characterized via the presence of brachyury T and production of extracellular matrix molecules .,, Studies that quantify percentage of NP cells that appear in cell clusters indicate significantly greater number of NP cell clusters present in juvenile tissue compared to mature or degenerated tissue in rat and human. Culturing juvenile porcine, notochordally  derived NP cells on soft , laminin rich surfaces,,, promotes NP cells to assemble into multi cell aggregates, similar to those observed in situ, with increased glycosaminoglycan production, and preservation of NP markers.
Neuroendocrine tumors  comprise a group of tumors derived from peptide  and amine producing cells of the neuroendocrine system, which are located largely in the gastrointestinal system but also in other tissues, including pancreas and lung. They are characterized immunohisto logically by the expression of markers of endocrine tissue, such as chromogranin A, synaptophysin, and neuron specific enolase, which can be used, in conjunction with clinical presentation, in the diagnosis of NETs. Despite a relatively low incidence, NETs represent a significant clinical challenge in diagnosis and clinical management.
Hospitalization is common among older persons, and results in substantial morbidity and costs. The Medicare age population experiences a rate of hospitalization of 17.5% or 6.4 million per year, comprising over 49% of acute hospital days, and resulting in over $148.2 billion of annual Medicare expenditures. Frequently, hospitalization can initiate the terminal downward spiral for an older person.
Cigarette smoking is a leading preventable cause of death globally and in the US, where nearly 45 million adults smoke. Packaging regulations including pictorial health warning labels and restrictions on industry branding are central to global tobacco control, but regulations in the US have allowed the industry to promote smoking through cigarette packs virtually unrestricted. Most recently, the FDA decided not to appeal the 2012 US Court of Appeal’s decision deeming the warnings unconstitutional.
For most of the last century, demographers were the only social scientists that routinely and unobtrusively collected data on sexual behavior in population based surveys. The importance of fertility in the demographic paradigm provided the justification needed to conduct empirical studies of this sensitive topic. Embarrassing or socially stigmatized behaviors like sex are subject to a wide range of reporting problems in surveys  .
Proximal spinal muscular atrophy  is a common, often fatal, infantile neurodegenerative disease caused by mutations in the Survival of Motor Neuron 1  gene . SMN2 therefore produces only ~10% of the full length functional protein derived from SMN1 and is unable, except in multiple copies, to protect against motor neuron degeneration and the SMA phenotype in affected individuals  . The ubiquitous expression of the SMN protein is consistent with an essential role in the biogenesis of UsnRNP particles .
There is abundant evidence that enzyme activity or protein protein interactions can be dependent upon association with lipid membranes. The myristoylation motif  is essential and highly conserved in Nef alleles from both laboratory HIV 1 strains and in primary isolates from AIDS patients . Gerlach et al reported significantly decreased binding affinity to lipid membranes and impaired helix formation upon mutation of Trp5 and Trp 13  .
Over the past twenty years, a substantial number of studies have shown a relationship between sleep and improvement on memory tasks ). Karni and Sagi reported post training improvement that is only evident several hours after training , and the greatest amount of learning is shown after inter session nocturnal sleep, specifically rapid eye movement  sleep . Declarative memories are the consciously accessible memories of fact based information  .
Positron emission tomography  is a powerful and widely used diagnostic tool that has the advantages of high sensitivity  and ability to provide quantitative imaging analyses of in vivo abnormalities. 64Cu  has decay characteristics that allow for both PET imaging and targeted radiotherapy for cancer. Radioisotopes have been introduced to various nanoparticles , including quantum dots,, gold NPs,,, carbon nanomaterials,, and polymeric NPs, through radionuclide labeling to allow noninvasive in vivo nuclear imaging of NPs’ pharmacokinetics, tissue distribution, and clearance.
Acute HIV infection  is the period just following HIV infection when, due to a lack of an immediate immune response, the viral burden is dramatically high before receding to a lower set point . Previous research has demonstrated that some individuals diagnosed with AHI continue to engage in sexual activity, including unprotected sex, suggesting that interventions beyond post test counseling are needed to reduce forward transmission . Currently, no guidelines are available on the prevention of forward transmission of HIV during AHI and no behavioral interventions for individuals with AHI have been evaluated and published, to our knowledge .
Withdrawal hyperexcitability of the central nervous system  is a well known consequence of physical dependence on ethanol, and is one of the most alarming manifestations of the withdrawal syndrome in alcoholics. During extended ethanol exposure, compensatory  changes occur in the CNS leading to the development of functional tolerance in the presence of ethanol, as well as to cross tolerance to other depressant drugs. The brain region and circuit involved in naturally occurring, genetically determined differences in neural activation associated with ethanol withdrawal are not known.
Recent studies support the hypothesis that motor adaptation to external perturbations such as force field, saccadic gain shift, and visuomotor transformations occurs at multiple time scales . To account for this multi timescale adaptation,  proposed a two state model, in which a fast process contributes to fast initial learning, but forgets quickly, and a slow process contributes to long term retention, but learns slowly. How these proposed fast and slow processes area organized, however, is ambiguous.
Dendritic cells  are an essential component of immune responses through their capacity to capture, process, and present antigens to T cells . Their main function is to launch immunity against foreign antigen and maintain the tolerance to self. Antigen presentation by immature DCs usually results in immune tolerance because of the lack of costimulatory molecules .
Over the last several years, advances have been made in understanding the development of ND. Understanding the full developmental course of addiction requires understanding four underlying processes:  When in the lifecycle are symptoms of dependence first experienced? How long after the onset of tobacco use does it take to become dependent?
Orthostatic intolerance  is defined by signs and symptoms of lightheadedness, tachycardia, diaphoresis, heat, hypotension, hyperpnea, headache, nausea, fatigue, cognitive deficits, and exercise intolerance while upright relieved by recumbence ;. Postural Tachycardia Syndrome  is chronic OI associated with excess upright tachycardia without hypotension  . POTS patients often report “Brain Fog” while upright to describe impaired awareness, mental confusion, lightheadedness, mental fatigue, and cognitive deficits, especially of working memory  .
Representations are cognitive constructs in which features of the external world are abstracted and mirrored in the nervous system as “functioning isomorphisms” . The theoretically simplest form of representation would be generated by a pure conditioning process, in which the perceptual world was considered as an aggregate of distinct elemental events. Representations of each event would be linked only to other events that were “intrinsically associated,” through being similar in appearance, similar in physiological consequences, or sufficiently invariant in sequential occurrence.
The ribosome is a complex macromolecular machine composed of three strands of RNA and over 50 proteins. The only putative in vitro assembly intermediates that have been identified for 30S ribosome assembly are RI and RI*; . However, the abundance of cofactors involved in 50S assembly has offered the opportunity to study intermediates induced as a result of cofactor disruption, including those resulting from the deletion of SrmB, CsdA and DnaK or DnaJ, and mutations to CgtAE and DbpA.
Heat shock proteins , the functional components of the inducible heat shock response are implicated in the regulation of tumorigenesis by virtue of their ability to promote tumor cell survival . HSP70 also regulates immune function, including antigen cross presentation , dendritic cell maturation  and NK cell  and MDSC  activities. HSP70 is released from tumor cells via passive release from dying cells and active trafficking via the endolysosomal pathway  or release within lipid bound exosomes  .
p63 is a homolog of the tumor suppressor p53 . In contrast to p53, which is inactivated in a majority of human cancers but is largely dispensable for normal development, p63 is critical for the development and maintenance of stratified epithelial tissues. The most striking developmental abnormality of p63−/− mice is a complete lack of stratified epithelia and its derivatives .
Female pelvic floor disorders  are a heterogeneous group of conditions that include urinary incontinence , pelvic organ prolapse  and fecal incontinence. These conditions can have a negative impact on a woman’s quality of life. Estimates from population based studies in the United States reveal that in older, community dwelling women, the prevalence of UI is as high as 41% and POP is 25%.
In post traumatic stress disorder  as well as other anxiety disorders, normally adaptive fear responses become dysfunctional or maladaptive  when behavioral responses are no longer commensurate with appropriate fear for the situation, or when behavior disrupts normal daily functioning. An important clinically relevant consequence of prior trauma is when inappropriate behavioral responses to mildly aversive or fear generating situations translate into the formation of new phobias . Although extinction training is often spaced over several days, some recent findings indicate that the massed presentation of the CS initiates the process of extinction successfully, and that massed procedures produce fear extinction that is effective for both short  and long term reduction in fear response .
In 2008, 1 in every 7 US households was food insecure, or at risk of going hungry because of an inability to afford food. Food insecurity generally occurs cyclically and episodically, with periods of food adequacy followed by food scarcity; the average food insecure household experiences seven episodes of food scarcity annually. We hypothesized that the cyclic nature of food insecurity, and its associated fluctuations in dietary intake, would predispose patients with diabetes to wide variations in blood glucose levels, including clinically significant hypoglycemia .
Epidemiologic and animal studies support the health benefits of habitual green tea consumption that include anti obesity properties , reduced risk of cardiovascular disease , decreased levels of oxidative stress ; as well as anti proliferative , anti inflammatory  and anti diabetic effects . A number of mechanisms have been proposed by which green tea and its constitutive polyphenolic catechins may modulate body weight   . For example, green tea and its extracts have been shown to induce carbohydrate malabsorption ; downregulate fatty acid synthase  ; suppress pancreatic and gastric lipase ; induce thermogenesis  ; incite sympathetic nervous system activity and lipolysis ; reduce adipocyte differentiation ; and alter the satiety response  .
Numerous studies have associated the mesolimbic dopaminergic  system, originating from the ventral tegmental area , with ethanol addiction. For instance,  ethanol consumption is reduced by the administration of dopamine antagonists  or agonists , or by the genetic deletion of dopamine D1 receptors  ;  pharmacological manipulations of VTA DA neuron activity alter ethanol consumption ;  ethanol increases dopamine release, from both the synaptic terminals ) and the somatodendritic region in the VTA ; and  ethanol stimulates the spontaneous activity of VTA DA neurons . However, the specific mechanism by which ethanol excites VTA DA neurons has not been fully clarified .
Metal organic frameworks  have attracted the interest of chemists, physicists, and materials scientists due to their promising applications in catalysis, separations, optics, magnetism, host guest chemistry and gas storage, as well as for the variety of their often esthetically pleasing, highly symmetric structures. The synthesis of coordination polymers utilizing secondary building units   functional, pre assembled clusters of atoms, capable of independent existence  allows the tailoring of the polymer properties via the introduction of SBU derived functionalities. The trinuclear Cu3) moiety is a common cluster unit generated in situ from reactions of copper  and pyrazoles or triazoles.
Fucosylation, the modification of proteins or glycans with a 6 deoxy monosaccharide, L fucose, plays critical roles in many physiological and pathological processes. Tissue development, fertilization and cell adhesion rely on proper protein fucosylation. Aberrant fucosylation of membrane proteins, however, is characteristic of many pathological conditions, including cancer, neurological disorders, immune dysfunction, and developmental defects.
Fluorescence spectroscopy has changed significantly in recent years due to the discovery of Metal Enhanced Fluorescence , a metalfluorophore interaction that greatly increases the observed emission intensity . Since the discovery of MEF the phenomenon has been applied to several bioassays . Furthermore, many studies of MEF have been conducted and the results were obtained using a sample geometry where two metal deposited slides are sandwiched together with the fluorescent sample within.
Many preclinical studies have examined the influence of pharmacological agents on the dose related effects of self administered cocaine to evaluate potential pharmacotherapies for cocaine addiction . Despite these advances, little is known regarding which neural systems regulate dose related changes in responding maintained by self administered cocaine. This empirical question is important because elucidating which neural systems might be engaged in this process could provide clues for effectively treating cocaine addiction .
Anaplastic lymphoma kinase  positive Anaplastic Large Cell Lymphoma  is an aggressive T cell lymphoma that carries a chromosomal translocation involving the ALK gene . The most common chromosomal aberration is the translocation t, occurring in nearly 75% of cases, which results in abnormal expression of a chimeric fusion protein, nucleophosmin  ALK . Auto phosphorylation and subsequent activation of ALK in the fusion proteins has been demonstrated to be lymphomagenic both in vitro and in vivo .
The gp130 family of cytokines, including IL 6, IL 11, LIF, IL 31 and Oncostatin M  play various roles in inflammation, hematopoiesis and immune responses . Functions of this family of cytokines in mucosal immunity are complex and overlapping due to the combinatorial expression of shared and specific receptor subunits on various cell types. Previous studies indicate shared but also private and specific activities of OSM among gp130 cytokines .
Microbial recognition by the innate immune system is mediated by a multitude of cellular and endosomal membrane bound, as well as intracellular receptors. While cyclophilin 18 is recognized by both mouse and human CCR5 , profilin has been shown to mediate powerful cytokine production from mouse dendritic cells via activation of TLR11 . In fact, TLR11 that was previously found to mediate recognition of uropathogenic bacteria has been identified as a major component and is essential for development of protective immune response in infected mice through the induction of massive IL 12 production by dendritic cells.
To date, approximately 100% of large molecule drugs do not cross the BBB and 98% of small molecules cannot penetrate this barrier, thereby limiting drug development efforts for many CNS disorders. Two of the most common motor neuron diseases are SMA and ALS, both debilitating disorders of children and adults, respectively, with no effective therapies to date. Recent work in rodent models of SMA and ALS have demonstrated significant promise for gene delivery using viruses that are retrogradely transported following intramuscular injection, and is currently being explored for clinical trials.
Breast cancer is the most common type of female cancer and represents 14% of cancer related deaths in women . It has been estimated that there will be about 226,870 new cases of breast cancer in United States in 2012, and about 39,510 women will die from this disease . Breast cancer is a genetically heterogeneous group of tumors with a variety of morphologic features.
Multiple myeloma  remains incurable with current therapies and novel approaches targeting the molecular mechanisms of the disease are needed. In the absence of a single unifying molecular genetic event leading to the disease manifestation, the focus of new therapies should be based on biological pathways critical to tumor survival,,. Interactions between the myeloma cell and the marrow microenvironment leads to increased cytokine secretion both by the myeloma cells as well as the cells of the microenvironment, in particular VEGF, IL6 and IGF,,,,,,,,.
Although general anti proliferative agents that induce death in all rapidly dividing cell types remain the backbone of many chemotherapeutic regimens, recent advances have suggested that “personalized” anti cancer strategies hold considerable promise. In personalized medicine, a detailed understanding of the molecular aberrations in the cell is utilized to select a drug with an appropriate mechanism of action. Morphologically, apoptosis is characterized by cell shrinkage and membrane blebbing, which facilitate the engulfment and recycling of cellular components without provoking the inflammatory response.
Pacemaker cells  within the sinoatrial node  generate the electrical impulse that initiates each heartbeat. Sinus node dysfunction , characterized by loss of PCs and SAN fibrosis, is a common but poorly understood disease. With the advent of cellular reprogramming technology,,  there is increasing interest in understanding gene regulatory networks in PCs, both to improve our understanding of SND and to facilitate novel therapies such as biological pacemakers and SAN regeneration .
Because lung cancer is the leading cause of cancer death  it is important to advance the understanding of cellular and molecular aberrations associated with lung tumorigenesis to improve diagnosis, prevention and therapy of this disease. Various genetic and epigenetic changes have been implicated in lung cancer including activation of oncogenes by mutations or amplification, inactivation of tumor suppressor genes by loss of heterozygosity, and by transcription silencing via promoter hypermethylation  . The JAK/STAT3 signaling pathway plays important roles in carcinogenesis because many Stat3 target genes including cyclin D1, Bcl XL, Mcl1, Hspa1a and Cryab are involved in cell proliferation and survival .
Individual differences in risk for mood and anxiety disorders likely stem from multiple predisposing factors, including genetic variants that shape the developmental formation and/or adult functional integrity of the neural circuitry subserving emotion . In preclinical models of these disorders, inbred mouse strains exhibit marked differences in anxiety  and fear related phenotypes. Of note, the C57BL/6J strain typically shows lesser anxiety  and stress related behavior but greater conditioned fear behavior relative to certain other strains including BALB/cJ and in some cases DBA/2J ) .
Pyrrolysine is the 22nd amino acid found to have entered natural genetic codes . Crystallography of the monomethylamine methyltransferase revealed that the UAG codon is decoded as a novel amino acid, pyrrolysine . E. coli expressing pylS and pylT and given exogenous pyrrolysine translates UAG as pyrrolysine .
The p75 neurotrophin receptor  is a potential therapeutic target for AD . p75NTR also regulates neurite outgrowth through its interactions with the Nogo and LINGO co receptors . p75NTR is expressed by populations that are particularly vulnerable in AD, including basal forebrain cholinergic, hippocampal, cortical and entorhinal neurons ; and its expression is further increased in AD .
Mesenchymal stem cells  are able to self renew and differentiate into a variety of cell types including adipocytes, chondrocytes, myocytes, osteoblasts, etc. . MSCs are traditionally isolated from bone marrow.
The basement membrane  is a major functional component of the extracellular matrix. Functional and targeted contrast agents can be developed to spatially localize molecular targets in the body  . The goal of this work was to develop an MRI visible contrast agent that is specifically targeted to the BM.
The striatum incorporates two major locomotor regulatory circuits, the direct and indirect pathways, which together modulate cortical output that determines locomotor activity. At the postsynaptic level, type A1 adenosine receptors  and type D1 dopamine receptors  form heterodimers on striatal neurons of the direct pathway, whereas heterodimers of A2A adenosine receptors  and D2 dopamine receptors  form on neurons of the indirect pathway ). Inhibitory interactions both within and between these heterodimeric receptors modulate striatal neuronal excitability and neurotransmission .
Individuals with physical disabilities are as sexually active and have the same reproductive health needs as those without a disability . However, individuals with disabilities experience multiple physical and attitudinal barriers to reproductive health services . Previous research shows reduced cervical and breast cancer screening among women with disabilities .
Airway epithelial overexpression of the epithelial Na+ channel β subunit , driven by the Clara cell secretory protein  promoter in transgenic  mice, results in epithelial Na+ hyperabsorption, airway surface liquid  dehydration, impaired mucus clearance, airway inflammation and early post natal mortality . The inflammatory infiltrate is characterized by enlarged/highly vacuolated macrophages, persistent neutrophilia associated with elevated KC, MIP 2 and TNFα, and transient eosinophilia with increased levels of IL 13 and eotaxin 1 . YM1, YM2 and acidic mammalian chitinase, all associated with Th2 type inflammation in asthma and helmintic infection , are also elevated in Scnn1b Tg mice.
Efficient infection of human primary macrophages, dendritic cells and resting CD4+ T cells by simian immunodeficiency virus  requires the accessory protein Vpx . Vpx is essential for both SIV infection of primary macrophages and viral pathogenesis in vivo . Viral reverse transcription is prevented in primary macrophages when cells are infected with either Vpx deficient SIVmac or HIV 2 .
Short term memory  plays a crucial role in processing speech . STM and speech perception in noise exhibit somewhat parallel age trends. However, complex working memory  shows a steep developmental slope up to the age of sixteen .
People cannot attend to multiple objects or events without some loss of perceptibility. But this admittedly artificial situation, in which attention is held at a single central region for prolonged periods, does not represent how attention normally functions. Studies of attention during steady fixation have another drawback, namely, they cannot consider the role played by attention in the control of the saccades themselves.
Dynamic contrast enhanced magnetic resonance imaging  measures the transit of a tracer such as a gadolinium chelate to estimate physiologic parameters related to perfusion or permeability in vivo. Clinical applications include estimates of tumor angiogenesis  and response to therapy  as well as physiologic measurements of organ function such as kidney glomerular filtration rates  and perfusion . Several challenges limit our ability to determine AIF.
Ca2+ release mediated by the inositol 1, 4, 5 trisphosphate receptor  is critical to cellular signal propagation. However, uncontrolled Ca2+ release from the endoplasmic reticulum  triggered by IP3R dysfunction or ER stress elevates intracellular Ca2+ concentration  resulting in toxicity and cell death. Depletion of ER Ca2+ stores results in ER stress that evokes the unfolded protein response .
Ecological theory and empirical work indicate that competition should result in competitive exclusion when resources are limited. Most laboratory  and field  studies show convincingly that larval A. albopictus are superior competitors for resources compared to A. aegypti, the resident species it encounters most frequently in the Americas. Here we focus on three alternative  hypotheses that seem likely to be testable using field data.
Atypical antipsychotic drugs are a mainstay of psychiatric pharmacotherapy and are used to treat a variety of psychiatric illnesses, most notably schizophrenia. The mechanisms underlying these metabolic side effects in humans are not known. Drug therapy is typically continued in patients that are resistant to the weight gain promoting effects of antipsychotics, though the weight gain independent effects of these drugs are less well understood in humans.
The somatodendritic surface of CNS neurons is a highly dynamic membrane environment, in which the number of specific signaling receptors accessible to extracellular ligands is tightly controlled by vesicular trafficking processes . Endocytic removal of neural signaling receptors has been investigated in considerable detail , but less is known about how signaling receptors are returned to the somatodendritic surface. Endocytic recycling in neurons is remarkable both for its high throughput and biochemical selectivity.
There is a growing body of evidence suggesting that chronic vascular inflammation plays a role in the development of essential hypertension, either as a pathogenic or secondary event . Inflammatory mediators, such as C reactive protein , interleukin 1β ; interleukin 6 , tumor necrosis factor alpha , and reactive oxygen species , have been proposed to contribute to essential hypertension through several mechanisms, including enhancement of arterial stiffness and/or endothelial dysfunction . The mechanism whereby hypertension leads to chronic kidney disease and progression to end stage renal disease  remains poorly understood, and the extent to which inflammation contributes to this process is unknown .
Domoic acid is a small neurotoxic molecule that is naturally produced by phytoplankton and accumulates in seafood products during harmful algal blooms  . Domoic acid has since been shown to severely impact seabirds and marine mammals via transfer through planktivorous prey . For humans, risks of exposure to high levels of domoic acid are managed by testing shellfish and regulating harvests based on toxin loads ; however, there are no regulatory guidelines in place for protection from long term low level repetitive exposure  due to a lack of knowledge regarding the health impacts of chronic or episodic low level domoic acid exposure  .
High quality genome sequence is a prerequisite for whole genome analyses but further, robust and complete annotations are essential for a genome to be fully utilized by the scientific community. Genome annotation involves mapping features such as protein coding genes and their multiple mRNAs, pseudogenes, transposons, repeats, non coding RNAs, SNPs as well as regions of similarity to other genomes onto the genomic scaffolds. Many of these features can be automatically predicted by sophisticated software packages based on sequence or structure comparisons .
Protein biomarkers are critical for early detection of disease, prognosis and therapy monitoring. However, the number of new FDA approved biomarkers has greatly decreased in recent years , which has been attributed to the high false discovery rate of the “omics” methods, and the lack of robust methods for biomarker verification . More importantly, a structural variant of hemoglobin  is currently being used to assess glycemic control in people with diabetes, and has been proposed as a useful method of screening for and diagnosing diabetes  .
Degenerative joint disease affects twenty million adults with an economic burden of over $40 billion per year in the US. Many cartilage tissue engineering studies use chondrocytes as the cell source, however this approach is challenged by limited supply of chondrocytes, their limited regenerative potential due to age, disease, de differentiation during in vitro expansion, and the morbidity caused by chondrocyte harvest. Likewise, mechanical properties of engineered cartilage produced using these scaffolds and hMSC were at least one order of magnitude below values reported for normal cartilage despite prolonged in vitro culture .
Nuclear DNA content, or genome size , varies > 1000 fold among angiosperms . Moreover, several studies have reported within species correlations between GS and ecological variables, such as altitude, latitude and temperature . Because the efficacy of selection is expected to scale with Ne, the lack of relationship between GS and Ne may indicate that selection has had little impact on the broad scale evolution of GS in higher plants .
Stroke is a leading cause of death nationally and internationally  and is associated with enormous public health burden, reductions in quality of life, increased health care costs, and a loss in economic productivity. Stroke is the 4th leading cause of death in the U.S. . In South Carolina, stroke was the 3rd leading cause of death and ranked 8th among other states in 2006 .
Normal learning and behavior require the proper maturation and plasticity of synapses. Large scale genetic screens of families with autism spectrum disorder  and intellectual disabilities  have identified hundreds of risk genes that converge on synaptic abnormalities as the core cause., The prevalence of these neurodevelopmental disorders underscores the importance of identifying key synaptic regulators and the underlying mechanisms whereby they control cognition and behavior. β Catenin has dual roles in cadherin synaptic adhesion complexes and canonical Wnt signal transduction: both networks are essential for normal brain development and function.
Cancer vaccines have not significantly improved the clinical outcome and patient survival , even though it is possible to detect tumor specific CTL in peptide vaccinated patients. More encouraging results have been obtained, for both solid and hematological malignancies, in settings of adoptive immunotherapy by the administration of autologous tumor specific CD8+ T cells expanded and activated in vitro . Still, clinical success of adoptive immunotherapeutic approaches have been restricted to about 50% of patients, who show mostly partial rather than complete clinical responses  .
Oligodendrocyte precursor cells  are generated from progenitor zones in the forebrain beginning at various times during embryonic development . Wnts are secreted glycoprotein ligands that regulate development of dorsal CNS structures . Wnts have prominent roles in progenitor cell proliferation, cell lineage and differentiation decisions .
Argininosuccinate synthetase  catalyzes the third step in the urea cycle, the conversion of citrulline and aspartate into argininosuccinic acid with the cleavage of ATP into AMP and PPi. Complete deficiency of the enzyme results in classic citrullinemia.
