This disorder is typically associated with elevations in citrulline above 1500 μM and is associated with significant long term neurological disability .
In this study we provide global transcriptomic profiling and analysisof botulinum toxin A treated muscle over a 1 yearperiod . Microarray analysis was performed on rat tibialis anterior musclesfrom 4 groups  at 1, 4, 12, and 52weeks after BoNT A injection compared with saline injected rats at 12weeks . Dramatic transcriptional adaptation occurred at 1 week with aparadoxical increase in expression of slow and immature isoforms, activationof genes in competing pathways of repair and atrophy, impaired mitochondrialbiogenesis, and increased metal ion imbalance.
Atherosclerosis, the major cause of cardiovascular diseases, has been a leading contributor to morbidity and mortality in the United States, and it has been on the rise globally. Current imaging methods, such as x ray angiography, magnetic resonance imaging , intravascular ultrasound , computed tomography, and optical coherence tomography  allow exquisite delineation of advanced lesions. Thus, it is intriguing to explore label free imaging methods which can also provide chemical selectivity and submicron resolution .
Oligomers of N substituted glycines, or “peptoids”, are a new class of unnatural materials that are capable of mimicking the structure and function of peptides and proteins. Furthermore, peptoids containing a wide variety of side chain functionalities can be readily prepared by using a two step, submonomer method. These properties make peptoids attractive structures in drug discovery as well as materials engineering .
Frailty, a public health challenge, may be a significant issue among homelessand disenfranchised populations in urban and rural cities across the United States. For decades, frailty has been written about andcharacterized; a seminal paper identifies frailty as a clinical syndrome withspecific hallmark characteristics  such as shrinking, weakness, exhaustion, slowness, and lowactivity. While other authors focus on signs, and disease classifications, oftenleading to adverse outcomes  .
Excessive alcohol consumption during pregnancy may cause many adverse developmental effects in the conceptus that are now recognized as a spectrum of cognitive, behavioral, and structural abnormalities termed Fetal Alcohol Spectrum Disorders . Many FASD patients demonstrate only a small subset of dysmorphic features, with varying degrees of expression, and to date clinical diagnosis of cases with less obvious dysmorphology is not reliable . Over the last several years published diagnostic guidelines for FAS/FASD have included; Institute of Medicine  guidelines , FASD 4 Digit Diagnostic Code , Center for Disease Control and prevention  guidelines , Hoyme FASD guidelines , and Canadian FASD guidelines .
Recombinant adeno associated virus  vectors have recently emerged as a promising and novel means by which transgenes can be delivered to different tissue types successfully in a large range of animal species including humans. Unfortunately, one disadvantage to single intracranial injections of rAAV vectors into the brain parenchyma of large animal models or humans will be the restricted distribution of the rAAV vectors to relatively small volumes of the brain. However, research into CED delivery devices is under current investigation by several researchers  .
The negative impact of having a family member with a serious mental health issues or chronic illness is well documented. Literature reviews consistently point to the physical, emotional, financial, and interpersonal toll that people with serious mental health issues  and chronic illnesses  have on their loved ones who are often spouses or cohabitating adults. These difficulties include relationship dissatisfaction , enabling behaviors , negative communication styles , and interpersonal violence  .
The use of flame retardants has contributed to a drastic drop in the incidence of fires in the past thirty years. The latter are extensively used in a variety of consumer products such as textile, carpets, polyurethane foams, television sets, small appliances and computers. PBDEs are chemically and toxicologically similar to non coplanar polychlorinated biphenyls  .
Respiratory syncytial virus  is a major cause of infant morbidity from severe lower respiratory tract infection with bronchiolitis worldwide. Early attempts at vaccination of seronegative infants and young children using formalin inactivated RSV were unsuccessful. Vaccinees, after subsequent natural RSV infection, exhibited a more severe illness characterized in several instances by enhanced pulmonary injury with extensive mononuclear cell infiltration and pulmonary eosinophilia, compared to placebo vaccine control children .
Mutations in leucine rich repeat protein kinase 2  underlie the most common known genetic cause of familial and apparently sporadic Parkinson's disease  cases . These include a “Ras of complex proteins” / GTPase domain and a kinase domain that shares a high degree of homology with mitogen activated protein kinases kinase kinase  . A number of studies in the absence of a physiological LRRK2 substrate indicate that the G2019S substitution likely increases the kinase activity of LRRK2 ;  .
The HIV 1 matrix  protein represents the N terminal domain of the precursor Gag  protein that directs the assembly of HIV particles . Molecular biology experiments have demonstrated that MA plays essential roles in targeting PrGag proteins to membranes for assembly, and in incorporation of HIV SU/TM  envelope  protein trimers into virus particles . Moreover, viruses carrying large deletions in the MA coding region can be infectious in cell culture systems, as long as the large cytoplasmic domain of SU is deleted .
Forkhead box  transcription factors represent a closely related family of proteins that mediate cell cycle progression, survival, and differentiation . Use of a conditional mouse knockout model shows a requirement for Foxd3 in the establishment of murine ES cell lines . FoxD3 regulates specification of the neural crest lineage.
Small animal models of human disease play an important role in the development of new therapies for human diseases by providing a complete, functional biological system in which the effects of novel interventions may be tested and characterized. Efficiency may be improved by simultaneously imaging multiple subjects. To that end, multiple mouse MRI  techniques have the potential to improve experimental throughput, enabling the scanning of entire groups of animals in the time required to image just one, improving statistical power and reducing the cost of powerful imaging techniques in biomedical research  .
The ancient phylum of Apicomplexa encompasses thousands of unicellular animal parasite species, including important human pathogens such as Plasmodium, Toxoplasma, Cryptosporidia and Cyclospora species. While most healthy adults do not develop disease symptoms, congenital infection of infants during pregnancy can lead to severe developmental impairments or death. T. gondii and other apicomplexan parasites rely on changes in the actin cytoskeleton, especially at the apical end, to invade the host cell.
Immunologic self tolerance is required for an effective immune system, and is provided by the concerted activities of central and peripheral tolerance. A growing body of evidence describes mechanisms underlying the generation and activity of regulatory T cells  that bear the CD4+25+Foxp3+ phenotype . These Ag specific Tregs play an important role in tolerance to tissue specific self Ags  .
Intercellular calcium waves  provide a mechanism for long range signaling between astrocytes . Transmission of ICWs can involve both gap junction mediated direct cytosol to cytosol diffusion of second messengers such as IP3 and Ca2+, and release of molecules such as ATP that diffuse through extracellular space, interacting with receptors on neighboring cells to mobilize calcium from the intracellular and extracellular compartments  . The main type of glial cell in sensory ganglia is the satellite glial cell .
Saturation transfer  magnetic resonance spectroscopy  techniques enable the measurement of in vivo chemical reaction kinetics . The creatine kinase  reaction has been studied in humans with phosphorus  ST MRS in the brain , skeletal muscle , and the heart . The CK reaction is the primary energy reserve of the heart.
Misery perfusion constitutes a hemodynamic state in which cerebral blood flow falls yet oxygen metabolism is maintained by increased oxygen extraction fraction  . Several methods for measuring OEF have been developed. In addition, the quantitative processing of OEF images requires considerable technical expertise.
Benzene, a component of gasoline, is associated with various hematological cancers . Multiple possible mechanisms of action are thought to be involved in benzene toxicity . We observed significant effects on the expression of a relatively large number of genes across the range of exposures.
Recent high throughput sequencing of cancer genomes has led to newdiscoveries of mutations in cellular processes that were not previously known toplay a causal role in cancer. Among the recentlydiscovered spliceosome genes that are involved in cancers, SF3B1 is the mostfrequently mutated. SF3B1 mutations are found with high frequency in myelodysplasticsyndromes  and chronic myelogenous leukemia ; it is also mutated in solidtumors such as lung adenocarcinomas, breast cancer, and pancreatic cancer.
Surrogate decision makers of critically ill patients often have inaccurate expectations about their loved one's prognosis. This is problematic because prognostic information influences treatment decisions. Undue optimism in particular may lead to the use of invasive treatments that are inconsistent with patients' preferences.
Human interleukin 6 is a multifunctional pro inflammatory cytokine produced by many cell types including immune cells , vascular smooth muscle cells , adipocytes and skeletal muscle . Interleukin 6 has both an acute and chronic inflammatory role . It mediates downstream inflammatory cascades, including the production of C reactive protein and fibrinogen .
The regulatory functions of CD4+ CD25+ FoxP3+ cells  in maintaining peripheral tolerance, to self antigens has led to studies investigating their use in inhibiting alloreactive T cell responses following allogeneic marrow transplantation. Naturally occurring Tregs can induce transplantation tolerance in mice. A significant reduction of lethal graft versus host disease  has been observed following injection of freshly isolated or ex vivo activated Tregs.
S100A4, also known as Fsp1 , is well known to be over expressed in fibrotic diseases of the lung, kidney, liver, and heart . In normal adult tissues, its expression is confined to fibroblasts and other cell types of mesenchymal origin. However, in the higher grade endometrioid carcinomas and the non endometrioid carcinomas, S100A4 protein is expressed in tumor epithelial cells.
The acute respiratory distress syndrome  is a highly morbid clinical entity marked pathophysiologically by the flooding of the alveolar space with protein rich fluid which leads to severe impairment of gas exchange and hypoxia . Under normal conditions, the pulmonary endothelium forms a thin semipermeable barrier between the vascular space and the interstitial and alveolar spaces allowing for effective gas exchange while preventing the excess leakage of fluid and protein . However, this barrier becomes severely compromised during ARDS .
First described in yeast , the SUV3 gene was later found to be conserved throughout evolution with orthologs documented in bacteria, plants, nematodes, Drosophila and mammals . The yeast SUV3 protein localizes primarily in the mitochondrial matrix and displays RNA helicase activity . Together with the ribonuclease DSS1, SUV3 forms a RNA degradosome complex  that affects a variety of mitochondrial processes.
Neuropeptides and their role in regulating inflammatory processes is becoming a topic of major interest in clinical medicine. It has been established that substance P and calcitonin gene related peptide are associated with inflammation associated pain . Recently, the role of other neuropeptides has been investigated, especially the neurotrophin family, of which brain derived neurotrophic factor  belongs, and have been shown to play a role in airway inflammation .
Alzheimer Disease  is a neurodegenerative disorder involving severe cognitive decline that is characterized by initial synaptic dysfunction and later extensive neuronal death in the CNS . A hallmark of AD is the presence of extracellular amyloid plaques, formed by aggragated amyloid beta , a 40  or 42 aminoacid long peptide resulting from cleavage of the larger amyloid precursor protein  . For example, in AD patients the levels of soluble Aβ correlate with disease severity, while plaques burden does not.
A large number of new neurons are added to the dentate gyrus  of adult mammals . Despite the wide range of behaviors that appear to require new neuron function, little is known about the specific contribution of new neurons to hippocampal function . Functional gradients have been shown to exist within the hippocampus.
Current efficacy data supporting the routine use of acellular dermal matrices  in postmastectomy tissue expander/implant reconstruction is limited. A multi center, blinded, randomized controlled study was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of ADM in the setting of TE/I reconstruction. The primary objective of the study was to determine whether the use of ADM would decrease patient reported, post operative pain.
Inherited deficiency of hepatic alanine:glyoxylate aminotransferase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 1  or glyoxylate reductase/hydroxypyruvate reductase  in primary hyperoxaluria type 2  results in marked overproduction of oxalate by the liver . High concentrations of oxalate in the urine form complexes and crystals with calcium resulting in urinary tract stones, as well as injury to renal tubule epithelial cells and nephrocalcinosis . Over time there is progressive loss of renal function .
Although the role of B7: CD28 interactions in promoting initial T cell activation is well established, a separate role for B7: CD28 interactions in promoting T cell tolerance has only recently been acknowledged . Investigation of the severe and accelerated diabetes that develops in CD28 deficient  and B7.1/2 double deficient  NOD  mice  revealed that B7: CD28 interactions control regulatory T cells . These NOD mice demonstrate a profound decrease of the CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cell population in both CD28KO and B7DKO mice, and the transfer of this regulatory T cell subset from control NOD animals into CD28 deficient animals can delay/prevent diabetes.
Transforming growth factor βs  are multifunctional cytokines with widespread effects on cell growth and differentiation, migration, and extracellular matrix  deposition, and have key roles in wound repair . The transition from scarless fetal type repair to adult type repair with scar occurs between days 16  and 18  of gestation in fetal rat skin . Our previous results implicated decreased TGF β1 and   β2, and increased TGF β3 expression, as well as decreased type I and II TGF β receptor  expression in scarless early gestation E16 fetal wounds .
TMS holds significant promise as a tool for cognitive neuroscience  as well as psychiatric research in the areas of depression and obsessive compulsive disorder . Present TMS coilss stimulate large regions of tissue at a time limited to areas near the surface of the brain, as the electric field drops as the inverse of the distance to the coil. Hence, present TMS coils generate substantial unwanted stimulation outside the desired region .
A growing consensus has indicated that the temperature sensitivity of the water proton resonant frequency   is the most well suited parameter to exploit to create temperature maps for MRI guidance of thermal therapies. Typically, changes in water PRF are estimated using phase difference images of a gradient echo sequence . Difference images are necessary to remove variations caused by inhomogeneities in the magnetic field.
Podosomes and invadopodia are related cellular structures present in cells with physiologically or pathologically invasive behaviors respectively . The function of both podosomes and invadopodia is considered to be coordinated attachment to, and degradation of, the extracellular matrix , thus facilitating migration and invasion. In contrast, many human cancer cells appear to contain invadopodia constitutively.
During the year 2008, there were about 215,000 new patients diagnosed with lung cancer, more than 80% of whom will die of their disease. Despite tremendous advances in our understanding of cancer biology and developments in cancer therapeutics, the prognosis for lung cancers remains extremely poor . One solution lies in understanding the lung cancer genome and its variations in their entirety, based not only on the histologic type, but also the developmental stages of lung cancers.
Adults rely on intrinsic sources of regulation to manage their emotions and effectively navigate social interactions and the environment . At the neural systems level, emotion regulation is supported by mature amygdalaprefrontal circuitry in healthy adults . Taken together, these studies suggest that the mother is uniquely relevant as an external source of regulation when the child approaches and engages with the environment .
Programmed cell death 4  is a novel tumor suppressor that inhibits tumorigenesis by interfering with translation initiation. Mutational inactivation has been excluded as an underlying mechanism for the loss of Pdcd4 . Upon phosphorylation, the E3 ubiquitin ligase β TrCP1 binds to and facilitates the ubiquitylation of Pdcd4, thus, targeting Pdcd4 for proteasomal degradation ,.
The domestic dog  exhibits the greatest morphologic diversity of any mammal . Variation in size between breeds spans two orders of magnitude with the 1 kg Chihuahua and 100 kg mastiff representing extremes of the continuum. An equally impressive level of variation is apparent when considering conformation.
Endothelial cell proliferation and migration are essential for angiogenesis. Typically, proliferation and chemotaxis of endothelial cells is driven by growth factors such as vascular endothelial growth factor  and basic fibroblast growth factor   . Subsequent steps in the signaling cascade are only partially understood, but VEGF is known to induce increased intracellular calcium , accumulation of inositol 1,4,5 trisphosphate  and 1,2 diacylglycerol , activation of protein kinase C , and tyrosine phosphorylation of both phospholipase Cγ  and phosphatidylinositol 3 kinase   .
The goals of non surgical periodontal therapy  are debridement of bacterial plaque and removal of bacterial products from root surfaces. While this approach is usually successful in arresting periodontal attachment loss, periodontal breakdown may continue to progress in some patients. The periodontal pathogens Aggregatibacter actinomycetemcomitans and Porphyromonas gingivalis are exceptionally difficult to eliminate by debridement alone .
Obsessive compulsive disorder  and Tourette syndrome  are neurodevelopmental disorders with significant phenotypic and genetic overlap., One promising avenue for identifying cross disorder genetic risk factors in neurodevelopmental disorders is the study of genomic copy number variants , segments of DNA ranging from 1 kilobase to several megabases that show deletions or duplications compared to a reference. CNVs predisposed to these disorders overlap substantially, highlighting the cross disorder effects of this class of genetic variation., Both disorders frequently co occur in individuals, and there is evidence for shared OCD/TS genetic risk from family studies,, with genetic correlation estimates ranging from 4190%.,. In OCD, locus specific CNV analyses have been reported,, but no prior genome wide CNV analysis has been performed.
The Mammalian Rel NF κB family of transcription factors play important roles in innate and adaptive immune responses, inflammation, cell survival and cancer, . In this pathway, p100, which is mainly associated with RelB in non stimulated cells, is phosphorylated by IKKα at its C terminal region, leading to K48 linked polyubiquitination also by the SCFIκB complex. This alternative pathway is activated by lymphorganogenic cytokines, such as lymphotoxin  α β heterotrimers and B cell survival and maturation factors, such as CD40 ligand  and BAFF.
Bipolar disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of hypomania or mania and major depression. Because bipolar disorder may present with depression, individuals who present with major depression may have a major depressive disorder  or a bipolar disorder, which would not be recognized until the occurrence of a defining mania or hypomania. Subthreshold hypomanic symptoms have been posited to be of nosological relevance  though the predictive validity of such symptoms toward the development of a frank bipolar disorder is not established .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinomas  may arise in diverse locations but have a common etiologic association with tobacco and/or alcohol exposure. The management of HNSCC often consists of surgical resection, followed by postoperative radiotherapy or chemoradiation therapy. However, cure rates from chemoradiotherapy or radiation alone, with preservation of organ function, have been reported comparable to those achieved by combined surgery and postoperative radiotherapy.
Biofilms, defined as surface attached bacteria encased in a hydrated polymeric matrix, are the cause of many persistent and chronic bacterial infections. A second type of polysaccharide secreted by bacteria are capsular polysaccharides, which unlike exopolysaccharides remain tightly associated with the cell surface and are important virulence factors . Two different mechanisms have been proposed for capsular polysaccharide production.
Cancer immunoediting, the process whereby the immune system controls tumor outgrowth and shapes tumor immunogenicity, is comprised of three phases: elimination, equilibrium and escape ). Elimination is a modernized view of the older concept of cancer immunosurveillance that now takes into account that efficient tumor destruction requires the coordinated effects of both innate and adaptive immunity. While this pressure is sufficient to control net tumor progression, eventually, if the immune response fails to completely eliminate the tumor, the process results in the selection of tumor cell variants that are able to resist, avoid, or suppress the anti tumor immune response, leading to the escape phase and the outgrowth of clinically apparent cancers  .
Early experience has been shown to have a profound impact on the prevalence of functional bowel disorders. Restricted fetal growth  significantly increases the incidence of irritable bowel syndrome  and a birth weight less than 1500g accelerates the age of symptom onset , most likely due to an immature gastrointestinal tract at birth . Animal models have been employed to study the impact of early experience in both somatic and visceral sensory systems.
Traumatic brain injury  is one of the most common causes of death and long term disability in the pediatric age range . Incidence rates are lower for moderate  and severe  TBI, but these more serious injuries are more often associated with long term disability . Despite their pervasiveness, investigations of outcomes after TBI in school age children indicate that effects may be especially pronounced on measures of perceptual and psychomotor speed, attention, planning and mental flexibility, discourse processing, and verbal recall .
Oligodendrocytes  are necessary for myelination of axons in the central nervous system, and thus essential for proper brain function. In rodents, most OLs are generated during late embryogenesis and early postnatal life . Several cell types are described as the initial oligodendrocyte progenitors: common oligodendrocyte and astrocyte progenitors  , glial restricted precursors , a common neuronoligodendrocyte progenitor in the ventral spinal cord , and adult subventricular zone .
Matrix assisted laser desorption/ionization time of flight mass spectrometry  is a well established rapid, selective, and sensitive analytical tool for characterization of biomolecules. However, limitations of using organic matrix in conventional MALDI mass spectrometry in terms of low mass interference and inhomogeneous co crystallization have encouraged investigation of inorganic materials  as surface assisted laser desorption ionization  substrates. using 30 nm cobalt particles mixed with glycerol.
Activation of N methyl D aspartate receptors  initiates a cascade of molecular events underlying synaptic plasticity and learning . However, NMDARs are not necessary for hippocampal dependent forms of learning and memory under all experimental conditions   and the precise role of NMDARs in synaptic plasticity and memory encoding is not fully understood . NMDARs are heteromeric assemblies composed of an obligatory GluN1 subunit and 1 or more GluN2  subunits .
The acute phase response  is characterized by rapid and dramatic changes in the pattern of proteins produced and released by liver cells in response to a series of pathological conditions such as inflammations, infections and traumas . The APR constitutes an ideal system for the study of the regulation of gene expression. In the liver, the APR is characterized by significant changes in its gene and protein expression profile, resulting in the up regulation of positive acute phase proteins  such as C reactive protein, as well as in the down regulation of negative APPs such as transthyretin  and albumin.
In contrast to most other mammalian cell types, adult neural cells have traditionally been thought of as non regenerative cells. Over the past 20 years, however, our understanding of the reality, importance and consequences of post developmental neural cell proliferation has undergone considerable revision. In turn, neurogenesis is dependent upon a resident population of cells in the brain which can be induced to proliferate in response to various stimuli.
Progressive remodeling of the left ventricular  architecture occurs after myocardial infarction . Therefore, new therapeutic strategies are urgently needed in order to ameliorate both patient prognosis and quality of life . However, these both apply materials that are non biodegradable and result in a permanent foreign body encapsulating the epicardium.
Recent estimates for the incidence of hypertriglyceridemia  levels over 150 mg/dl) is 30% of U.S. adults . However, because hypertriglyceridemia is also associated with more pernicious dyslipidemia  and the metabolic syndrome , its current prevalence and health consequences likely far exceed these estimates. But to date no therapeutic strategy targets GPAT .
Imitation plays a central role in the development of motor control, speech/language/communication, and social life . The Broca's area contains a matching system that facilitates language acquisition through imitation. Children with SLI show poor performance in working memory , in attention control , in procedural memory , in nonverbal cognitive development , in visuospatial processing , and in gross motor control .
Vascular smooth muscle cells  arise from a diverse range of tissues including neural crest, somites, splanchnic mesoderm, gut mesothelium, and epicardium , and past data has demonstrated that many coronary VSMC  are derived from the embryonic epicardium, . While several genes have been identified that are essential for the formation, attachment, and spreading of the epicardium, few genes have been identified that are essential during epithelial to mesenchymal transition  and subsequent differentiation into cVSMC and cardiac fibroblasts . Platelet derived growth factor receptor  tyrosine kinases are one family of signaling proteins that are potentially involved in epicardial cell function.
Several of the biochemical constituents of saliva, such as acidic and basic proline rich proteins , lysozyme, lactoferrin, peroxidase, histatins, cystatins, mucins and secretory immunoglobulins A , have been isolated in sufficient quantities, mostly from pure glandular secretions, enabling studies to investigate their functional roles . More recently, histatins were found to increase the migration of transformed oral buccal epithelial cells in an in vitro model for wound healing . Based on the biological activities of these and other salivary proteins, saliva is believed to represent an early, principal barrier to oral infections, including dental caries and periodontal disease, and to facilitate healing .
The Hsp90/Hsp70 based chaperone machinery that forms signaling protein•Hsp90 heterocomplexes  is also part of the cellular defense against unfolded proteins . Hsp70 and Hsp40, a cochaperone that increases the ATPase activity of Hsp70, are required for the ubiquitin dependent degradation of many proteins , and the constitutive Hsc70 and inducible Hsp70 appear to act equivalently in promoting proteasome dependent degradation  . However, there are many E3 ligases , and it is not known how many of them function in a chaperone dependent manner, although some clearly do .
Toxoplasmosis is a serious infectious disease for humans. It is caused by Toxoplasma gondii, an obligate, intracellular, apicomplexan parasite that infects all human cells and tissues but has special tropism for the eye and the brain. Thus, there is a great need for the development of a safe and potent vaccine .
Despite an overall decline in mortality rates, the gap in mortality rates among socioeconomic status  groups has increased in many countries in the last couple of decades . Although established coronary risk factors such as cigarette smoking, hypertension, and hypercholesterolemia are more common in low SES groups, these differences do not account for more than a third of the social gradients in cardiovascular disease in the British civil servants study . Karasek reported that high demands and low control conditions at work were considered stressful .
The costs and benefits of producing communication signals can vary , and therefore individuals should modulate their signalling effort  according to extrinsic factors, such as characteristics of the physical environment or the quality of competition among conspecifics, and to intrinsic factors, such as the signaller’s own physiological state or competitive quality. Such context dependent, behavioral plasticity requires the neural processing of these factors, followed by production of the appropriate motor programs involved in modulating signal production . In most songbird species, adult males attract mates and repel competing males by producing learned vocalizations known as song .
Mitochondria are essential for cellular function and are a sensitive target for damage induced by ischemia reperfusion  injury, such as the overproduction of reactive oxygen species  and overload of Ca2+, both of which can trigger the formation of the mitochondrial permeability transition  pore at reperfusion . Mitochondrial dysfunction has significant implications for post ischemic recovery . Despite being the site of such pathological events, mitochondria are also involved in the protective mechanism of ischemic preconditioning  whereby short non lethal periods of ischemia protect the heart from subsequent prolonged ischemic insults .
Well differentiated neuronal neoplasms composed of small neurons superficially resembling oligodendrocytes  have a tendency to arise within the ventricular system, most often in the septum pellucidum nearby the foramen of Monro. The term “central neurocytoma” is reserved for these lesions. Morphologically similar neoplasms may occur in the cerebral hemispheres or in the spinal cord parenchyma and are therefore referred as “extraventricular neurocytomas”   .
Crystallins, the major structural proteins of the eye lens, are primarily categorized into three distinct families: α, β and γ. The agents that induce oxidative stress include hydrogen peroxide , superoxide, hydroxyl radical, and others. The stress can cause cell death, aging, and development of malignancy.
Microfabrication technologies have been used to chemically and topologically pattern glass coverslips to investigate the influences of such features on neuronal polarity, axon migration and growth cone behaviours. Microfluidic devices can be used to form binary chemical patterns that can be used to present cells with stark differences in the substratum. Patterns can be deposited using microcontact printing,,  but this process is challenging and inefficient for substrate gradients .
suggest that a chemical agent’s optical clearing potential is strongly tied to its ability to screen non covalent, hydrophilic, intermolecular attractive forces resulting in destabilization of high order collagen structures. Unfortunately, these agents typically possess hydrophilic properties, and hence are unsuitable as topically applied agents due to their inability to penetrate through the lipid rich stratum corneum. The primary objective of our study was to evaluate the optical clearing potential of DMSO  when applied topically to in vitro and in vivo skin.
Anemia, bleeding, and other potential indications for allogenic red blood cell  transfusions are common among patients admitted to intensive care units . Historically, pathophysiologic reasoning informed recommendations that a hemoglobin concentration  greater than 10 g/dL should be maintained in this patient population. However, based on more than a decade of clinical research evidence, more recent clinical practice guidelines advocate for using restrictive transfusion thresholds in ICU patients .
Obesity is a serious public health problem of dramatically rising prevalence in recent decades in the United States and the world, with currently over 65% of adults in the U.S. classified as either overweight or obese . Most functional magnetic resonance imaging  studies on obesity have focused on how the condition alters the cortical response to food cues . Regions of increased response include the limbic areas such as the hypothalamus, amygdala, hippocampus, orbitofrontal cortex, and insula .
Retinal microvascular abnormalities that accompany diabetes include arteriolar constriction , capillary dropout, and localized areas of ischemia, the last of which is implicated in the eventual vision problems associated with the pathological growth of new blood vessels . Animal models of diabetes are potentially valuable tools in the investigation of early changes in the diabetic retina. While the use of animal models should allow investigations of the vasoactive mediators potentially responsible for the decreased flow observed in human diabetic patients, to date, there is little information available on the identity of these vasoconstrictors, even in animal models .
Tuberculosis  is an infectious disease caused by Mycobacterium tuberculosis  and related species that is most commonly observed as a chronic pulmonary infection . However, the emergence of HIV that sensitizes latently TB infected individuals and the inevitable development of drug resistant TB strains through use of the same antibiotics for more than 50 years has led to a dramatic worldwide rise in TB mortality, which prompted the World Health Organization  to declare TB a global public health emergency. Current efforts to bring TB under control are focused on development of new antibiotics, improved diagnostics, and vaccines .
The cerebellar cortex is one of the best characterized circuits of the central nervous system and is known to play a key role in the precise timing of motor control. Purkinje cells form the sole output of the cerebellar cortex and project to the deep nuclei of the cerebellum  where they form GABAergic synapses. Purkinje cells also exhibit local axon collaterals, which typically bifurcate in the granule cell layer and project back up to the Purkinje cell layer, and occasionally into the molecular layer.
Oxidative damage to DNA leads to activation of poly polymerase , which participates in DNA repair. Within the nucleus, PARP 1 and PARP 2 are the major enzymes that contribute to overall PARP activity induced by DNA damage , and they appear to have specific functions in the DNA repair process . Studies in cell systems demonstrated that over activation of PARP produces cell death by a mechanism that involves translocation of apoptosis inducing factor  from mitochondria to the nucleus .
Malaria is a significant cause of anemia in children living in areas of high and low intensities of transmission . In these children, the prevalence of malarial anemia is over 30%, and in the future, it is likely the prevalence and intensities of malarial anemia will increase as drug resistance in Plasmodium falciparum, already reported to artemisinin in Asia, increases and spreads to Africa and elsewhere. The anemia in malaria has been attributed to destruction of infected and non infected red cells and variable degree of dyserythropoiesis,   and both acute and sub acute infections contribute to the morbidity and mortality associated with malarial anemia , .
Emergency department  evaluation of syncope may benefit from improved epidemiologic understanding of patterns and predictors of short term, cardiac events. Previous studies have examined risk factors at 1 year following an episode of syncope, a timeframe not ideal for decision making in the acute care setting . Recent cohort studies identifying predictors of short term  events after syncope are relatively small ,  and reported prediction models have limited stability and generalizability.
It is well established that pregnant women are at a significantly higher risk of HIV acquisition during pregnancy and breastfeeding than their non pregnant counterparts. Research done in several low and middle income countries show that despite universal antenatal testing, HIV infected babies are born to women who had negative HIV tests during prenatal care, implicating seroconversion during pregnancy. Because of this concern, HIV testing of women at the time of labor and delivery has been implemented at the Grupo Conceiçao, a large public medical group located in Porto Alegre, the capital and largest city in the Brazilian state of Rio Grande do Sul.
In cemented total hip arthroplasty, the implant needs a mechanically stable cement bone interface for long term survival. From a surgical perspective, the depth of cement penetration into the bone is dependent on several factors, including cement viscosity , bone preparation technique  and degree of cement pressurization . On the other hand, a strong relationship between the cement bone contact area and the interfacial tensile strength was reported  .
Although vocal communication is essential for the survival of many animal species, the neurophysiological basis of the perception of intra specific communication signals is still not well understood. To study such natural categorization, one must use a model species for which the semantics of vocalizations can be easily derived from the observation of social behaviors. Here, we use semantics to describe call categories obtained from the meaning of vocalizations that is inferred by the behavioral contexts in which vocalizations are emitted.
HisG is an ATP phosphoribosyl transferase  that catalyzes the first step in the biosynthetic pathway for histidine, which also leads to intermediates that play a role in purine biosynthesis. HisG condenses ATP with phosphoribosyl pyrophosphate  to produce phosphoribosyl ATP  and inorganic pyrophosphate  . Histidine biosynthesis is metabolically expensive, requiring 10 enzymatic reactions and consuming an estimated 41 ATP molecules.
In response to injury/infection there is the sequential release of pro inflammatory mediators including complement, histamine, bradykinin and 5 hydroxytryptamine along with cytokines and chemokines that cause cell and edema accumulation. Concomitantly, there are braking signals that temper the severity of this early onset phase including adrenaline, adenosine, steroid hormones, cAMP and counter regulatory cytokines including IL 10. In attempts to enhance our understanding of acute inflammation, we are beginning to realise that, in addition to endogenous checkpoints that temper PMN trafficking there are also signals that control the transition of PMNs to phagocytosing macrophages , IL6/IL6ra complex), scavenge cytokine/chemokine from the inflammatory environment , lipoxins) as well as clear macrophages to the draining lymph nodes  and resolvins) leading to inflammatory resolution.
The central nervous system  is composed of complex networks of synaptically linked neurons. The development and use of neurotropic viruses as an alternative to traditional tract tracing tools have greatly enhanced our understanding of complex neuronal circuitry, particularly the innervation of thoracic and abdominal viscera . Despite this progress there is a paucity of knowledge concerning how injury, particularly spinal cord injury , affects neuronal circuitry.
A “divergent pathway” model has been proposed to conceptualize the development of cutaneous melanoma. , The hypothesis predicts that the former group will be at greater risk of developing melanomas on usually sun exposed body sites such as the head and neck, whereas the latter group will be at greater risk of developing melanoma on body sites with large numbers of melanocytic nevi, such as the back . Several lines of evidence support this divergent etiologic pathway of melanoma development.
Ewing’s sarcoma is a poorly differentiated pediatric and young adult cancer of bone and soft tissue. EWS/FL 1 is the most common chromosome translocation associated with Ewing’s sarcomas . Rapid tumor growth and extensive bone destruction are typical features of this tumor .
The vast majority of Cardiac Magnetic Resonance  is performed using non real time techniques based on either prospective or retrospective processing of physiological signals such as using the ECG to synchronize MRI data acquisition with the cardiac phases, but real time CMR at high spatial resolution has long been a goal of the field. CMR has experienced significant progress over the past 10 years largely due to the introduction of parallel imaging, and its use is now commonplace in clinical CMR , , . Another contributor to real time CMR research is known as dynamic imaging.
The conserved kinase Chk1 is a participant in the first line of defense against DNA damage and replication blocks. The Chk1 proteins consist of two primary domains, the well conserved N terminal kinase domain and the less conserved non catalytic C terminal domain that contains two highly conserved subdomains that we call TRF and GD domains., The C termini of the Chk1 orthologues are phosphorylated following DNA damage and replication blocks. The C terminal domain of vertebrate Chk1 has also been suggested to play an inhibitory role in the kinase activity of the protein.
David Marr  characterized vision as “knowing what is where.” Clearly, a retinotopic map can be made to track object locations in the world if retinotopic target positions are shifted to compensate for eye movements . There are a number of different face aftereffects in the literature . The first experiment studies FAE across eye movements.
Alzheimer’s disease  is a progressive and gradual decline in cognitive function accompanied by extensive neurodegeneration. APP is sequentially cleaved by two membrane bound endoprotease activities, β  and γ secretase. A fragment of 99 amino acids  remains membrane bound, and is in turn rapidly cleaved by γ secretase to generate Aβ.
The delivery of antigen to elicit protective immunity or tolerance represents an area of considerable interest for both vaccine development and the treatment of autoimmunity . The expression patterns of FcγRs and FcRn also differ, since FcγRs are primarily expressed by cells of hematopoietic origin  whereas FcRn is ubiquitously present in cells of diverse origin such as endothelial and epithelial cells . Although the role of FcγRs in antigen uptake and presentation is well documented , there is very limited knowledge concerning a possible function for FcRn .
Coronary thrombosis on a ruptured coronary plaque is the main pathophysiologic event that leads to acute coronary syndromes . Each of these therapeutic interventions, however, has significant limitations. The time required to open a coronary vessel successfully with PCI is, even at the most experienced centers, 90 minutes after presentation to the Emergency Department , during which extensive myocardial necrosis may have already occurred.
Knowledge of the spatial radiofrequency  field distribution is important in a number of MRI applications such as quantitative T1 measurement  and correction of the B1 dependent intensity variation . A number of B1 mapping methods have been introduced . Most methods estimate the RF field distribution as a function of the image intensities.
Soft tissue sarcoma  is a heterogeneous group of mesenchymal malignancies. One of the most prominent characteristics of human STS is their resistance to apoptosis . Because the vast majority of cytotoxic modalities exert their anti tumor effects by inducing tumor cell apoptosis, resistance to apoptosis is one of the most significant challenges in sarcoma chemotherapy.
Although it has been appreciated for decades that folding of RNA into biologically active structures is controlled by the rate of RNA synthesis by RNA polymerase ,, the mechanisms by which RNAP guides RNA folding remain poorly understood. Conversely, RNA structures can influence the rate of transcript elongation either by prolonging pausing through interactions in the RNA exit channel or by sterically blocking reverse translocation  of the RNA 3′ end out of the RNAP active site, . The elemental paused elongation complexes  thus serve as regulatory intermediates whose duration can be modified by nascent RNA structures known to form within the RNA exit channel of RNAP.
Body dysmorphic disorder , a severe disorder characterized by preoccupation with an imagined or slight defect in one’s physical appearance, affects an estimated 1.82.4% of the population . For example,  described a woman who worried excessively about her daughter’s “crooked” nose and tried “pushing on it to make it straight” . reported on a 63 year old male so distressed by the belief he had caused his daughter’s hair to thin that he committed suicide.
We and others have recently described a new subset of antigen presenting cells , termed Interferon producing Killer Dendritic Cells  or Natural Killer Dendritic Cells , that exhibit properties of both natural killer cells  and dendritic cells  . In depth phenotypic analyses established splenic IKDC as a homogeneous CD11cloB220+CD49b+ population, distinct from murine NK by their expression of MHC class II molecules  and from DC by their expression of NK receptors. Upon stimulation in vitro with CpG oligodeoxynucleotides  or in vivo with Listeria monocytogenes  splenic IKDC killed typical NK targets and demonstrated the unique ability to produce interferon gamma , IFN α and interleukin  12 .
Currently emerging and re emerging infectious diseases of zoonotic origin such as highly pathogenic avian influenza A pose a significant threat to human and animal health due to their elevated transmissibility . These drivers can be of an environmental, geographic, demographic, genetic, or other nature. For example, diffusion could be caused by climate, human and avian population density, and other key demographic profiles .
Emergency Medical Dispatchers  play an important role in optimizing acute stroke care and facilitating rapid transport by initiating pre arrival instructions to callers and dispatching emergency resources at the appropriate high level of priority. A more recent study of EMS calls in Germany similarly found that dispatchers recognized stroke in only 51% of stroke patients. The QA Guide version 11.1 of the Medical Priority Dispatch System  is the most widely employed dispatcher guide in the United States.
Telomeres are repetitive DNA sequences that cap and protect chromosomal integrity. Shorter telomere length has been associated with early mortality and outcomes such as cardiovascular and metabolic disease . Much of this work has focused on telomere length in tumor tissue, but studies suggest correlation between telomere length in different tissues, include leukocytes  .
Posttraumatic stress disorder  is a stress linked disorder that affects a substantial proportion of the population, and is particularly prevalent in combat veterans. PTSD can be triggered by acute or chronic exposure to traumatic events, with intensity and duration of trauma considered important determinants in the trajectory of posttraumatic symptoms  There are several animals models of PTSD in the literature, including acute predator exposure , electric tails shocks, single prolonged stress, and inescapable stress, among others . However, efforts to develop paradigms that model chronic stress induced emergence of posttraumatic stress like behaviors have been limited .
The use of phages to treat bacterial infections, phage therapy, is an enigma of Western medicine. Proposed and practiced before the development of antibiotics and before phage genetics was even understood, phage therapy was disgraced and displaced in the West by antibiotics during the 1940s, although it survives even today in Eastern Europe. In concept, phage therapy seems invincible: a self replicating organism selectively killing only a pathogen, amplifying itself only where it is most needed  sites where the pathogen is lurking and abundant.
Acute lung injury  and acute respiratory distress syndrome  remain major challenges in modern intensive care medicine that are still associated with high mortality and morbidity . Although the pivotal role of PMNs in lung injury is unchallenged , molecular mechanisms underlying PMN trafficking in the lung remain obscure. Several targets to control PMN infiltration have been identified and some drug candidates are in clinical trials, but no specific drug is available for treatment of ALI patients today .
Myocarditis is an acute inflammatory disease of the heart which may lead to chronic inflammation of the myocardium and dilated cardiomyopathy  . In myocarditis and DCM, autoantibodies react with cardiac myosin . In animal models of cardiac myosin induced myocarditis, pathogenic roles for CD4+ T cells  and autoantibodies  have been described.
Helicobacter hepaticus  infection was discovered in the early 1990s in mice used in a carcinogenesis study . It has been suggested that a non genotoxic mode of action is involved in the induction of hepatocellular tumors by H. hepaticus. In male mice, increases in the incidences of hepatocellular neoplasms, hemangiosarcomas, total malignant neoplasms and total neoplasms were associated with H. hepaticus infection when accompanied by hepatitis .
RNA interference , a post transcriptional gene silencing method, mediated by small interfering RNA  of 1923 base pairs   has attracted attention for the development of novel highly effective therapeutics. Therefore, a considerable interest is being devoted to the development of non viral gene delivery vehicles  . Extracellular stability is essential for resistance of the delivery system against the aggressive biological environment en route to the target tumor site, while availability of the nucleic acids is required to permit efficient therapeutic effects within the cancer cells.
Diuretic drugs are central to the treatment of hypertension. It is therefore appropriate to consider ways in which their benefit can be optimized. Placebo controlled trials have demonstrated that diuretics are highly efficacious in reducing cerebrovascular accidents and yield a smaller but significant reduction in non fatal myocardial infarction.
Most mutations induced by carcinogens occur when DNA containing residual damage is replicated during S phase of the cell cycle. Originally examined in budding yeast, Lawrence and colleagues determined that replication blocking lesions in the template strand can be bypassed by proteins in the RAD6 DNA damage tolerance pathway . These mechanisms are conserved but with additional layers of complexity in higher eukaryotes .
Antiretroviral  adherence is a key determinant of clinical outcomes, including viral load suppression, emergence of drug resistance, and progression to AIDS and death . In the past decade, there has been a marked expansion in the distribution of highly active antiretroviral therapy  in resource constrained countries, as a result of international initiatives such as the US government's President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief  and the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria. Studies from low resource settings have reported adherence rates that are equivalent to or higher than those in resource rich countries .
Most current research involving measurement of gaze direction  employs video based eyetracking devices, which provide a relatively simple and cost effective way of obtaining two dimensional records. For angles of eye position up to ±30 deg relative to straight ahead, the pupil center shifts approximately linearly with eye position, while the minified corneal reflection shifts considerably less. The horizontal and vertical differences between pupil center and corneal reflection location, once they have been calibrated using fixation targets at known locations, provide fairly accurate estimates of eye position.
Because of its great importance, isoprene  and its oxidation reactions have been studied for many decades. , Isoprene is produced by plants under heat stress, and it has been suggested that isoprene protects plant membranes from thermal shock. Approximately 500 teragrams of isoprene are emitted into the atmosphere annually, and consequently, the process of isoprene oxidation has significant effects on atmospheric chemistry.
Successful behavior requires continuous coordination between the initiation and inhibition of actions, the latter being particularly important when sudden changes in the situation call for an alteration, or even the cancellation, of a planned or ongoing behavior. Recent years have seen enormous interest in the Stop signal task. The dominant view contends that, in response to a Stop stimulus, a signal from the inferior and/or medial frontal cortex is sent to the basal ganglia to cancel the motor program triggered by the Go stimulus.
Lung transplantation has the potential to increase survival and improve quality of life for patients suffering from end stage lung disease. Due to the shortage of available donor organs and high mortality on the waiting list, the allocation system for lung transplantation in the United States has undergone considerable evolution over the past decade. Prior to 2005, the allocation system was based upon the amount of time accrued on the waiting list.
A greater understanding of the molecular pathways driving tumor initiation and proliferation has heralded an age of targeted therapies for cancer. The therapeutic successes of these drugs are satisfying from both the scientific and medical perspectives. Here, we further characterize its role in the context of head and neck squamous cell carcinoma  .
The trillions of microbial cells that reside within the intestine shape aspects of host metabolism and immune function and extend the physiological definition of humans . Protracted loss of the typical composition has been associated with several disorders including inflammatory bowel diseases . Therefore, the mechanisms that link relevant variables, such as changes in diet, to changes in the microbiome, are integral to understanding how environmental factors and behavior influence human biology .
Activation induced deaminase  catalyzes two B cell specific DNA alteration events, somatic hypermutation  and class switch recombination  . During SHM, point mutations are introduced into variable  region exons and the immediate downstream intronic J region, thereby enhancing the DNA sequence diversity of V regions to allow the selection of B cell clones with increased affinity for antigens . Since B cells activated with different stimuli undergo distinct differentiation pathways and display unique signatures of gene expression , we hypothesize that the process to generate AID mediated DSBs may be differentially regulated in distinct B cell populations .
Transcutaneous electrical nerve stimulation  is commonly used for the relief of acute and chronic pain. To examine efficacy of any treatment for pain, including TENS, it should be compared to an adequate placebo that allows evaluation of its physiological effect . Placebo induced expectancies decrease pain and modulate specific neural mechanisms , , .
Shotgun proteomics is a method of identifying proteins in a complex mixture by digesting a protein mixture to peptides prior to analysis. The resulting MS/MS spectra are then searched against a protein sequence database using a database searching algorithm to produce a peptide spectrum match  . Data acquisition in this manner can be used to acquire the precursor mass of the peptide at high resolution and high mass accuracy while maintaining the speed and sensitivity of the linear ion trap for acquisition of MS/MS spectra .
Axon regeneration in the mature mammalian brain and spinal cord is extremely limited after injury. Presumably, recovery would be improved if axon regeneration could be achieved and if regenerating axons re established functional synapses below the injury level . The extent of axon regeneration depends on the intrinsic capacity of mature neurons to re grow axons  and extrinsic inhibitors in myelin and the glial scar .
Ventricular arrhythmias commonly occur after successful resuscitation from cardiac arrest with a reported incidence of ventricular fibrillation  as high as 79%. Some studies have reported an inverse relationship between the number of VF episodes and survival. These episodes were noted to occur within a time window of 23 to 115 seconds with a median of 45 seconds after the return of spontaneous circulation.
The discovery of DNA vaccine technology in the early 1990s was a major event in the history of vaccinology due to the many unique features of DNA immunization, including its ability to elicit balanced antibody and T cell immunity . Animal studies further demonstrated that DNA immunization is effective in eliciting higher levels of antigen specific B cell responses . Several pattern recognition receptors  have been identified which respond to DNA molecules .
Parity has a nonlinear association with cardiovascular events;,  with the minimum incidence in women with 2 births, a slightly higher incidence in nulliparas and primiparas, and a sharply higher incidence for women with higher parity. Parity is also associated with greater LV mass. Thus childbearing may have long lasting effects on the cardiovascular system, but the mechanism is unknown.
Lung cancer is the second most prevalent cancer occurring in both men and women in the United States, accounting for 162,000 deaths in 2008 , more than any other cancer. High risk populations include smokers and former smokers, as well as individuals exposed to second hand smoke, asbestos, and radon. Presently, there is no easily applied screening protocol for lung cancer similar to those used for breast, prostate, and colon cancers.
While sensory input is complex and dynamic, it also contains regularities that have shaped sensory systems over phylogenetic time . Statistical learning refers to an unconscious process by which regularities are automatically segmented from continuous environments, where the only cues for segmentation are statistics of co occurrence between specific stimuli. Such learning also occurs for visual regularities consisting of repeated spatial and temporal configurations of shapes, locations, motions, and actions .
Fear extinction is a form of learning in which the expression of a conditioned fear response is reduced after repeated experience of a conditioned stimulus in the absence of a unconditioned aversive stimulus . There is growing evidence that fear conditioning and fear extinction are independent forms of learning that are mediated by partially dissociable neural mechanisms . Such models can be applied in a variety of ways; for example, phenotypic surveys of mouse inbred strains provide a valuable approach to identifying genetically associated variation in behavior and neural circuitry .
Hematopoietic stem cell transplantation  is a high risk medical procedure that is utilized worldwide as therapy for many malignant and non malignant hematologic diseases., The number of autologous and allogeneic transplants performed continues to rise, particularly as outcomes have significantly improved over the past few decades. Clinical research has played an important role in advances of standard of care seen in HSCT patients over time,, which has led to improved supportive care, better understanding of disease risks, and newer treatment approaches. Nonetheless, efficacy is still limited by short and long term treatment related complications.
ATP binding cassette  transporters constitute a large family of integral membrane proteins that utilize the energy of ATP hydrolysis to translocate ions, lipids, nutrients and drugs across lipid bilayers. ABC exporters are medically important since their members contribute to antibiotic or antifungal resistance of human pathogens, the development of multiple drug resistance , and several human genetic disorders due to protein dysfunctions. ABC exporters share a common architecture including a minimum of two transmembrane domains  and two highly conserved nucleotide binding domains .
In metazoans, germline tissue is required for the transmission of genetic information from one generation to the next. In fruitflies, PGCs are initially specified by maternally derived mRNAs and other germ plasm components that are localized to the posterior end of the early embryo . The PGCs then begin to proliferate, and between 4 and 5 hpf they transition from round, immotile cells into a polarized migratory population , localizing to the anterior and lateral boundaries of the mesoderm during gastrulation .
Atherosclerosis, the disease process responsible for the leading cause of death in the industrialized world, is driven by a chronic, maladaptive inflammatory response . In this regard, many of the characteristics of clinically dangerous advanced plaques, including thinning of a protective “cap” of subendothelial collagen, oxidative stress, defective clearance of dead cells , and tissue damaging necrosis, suggest that this resolution process is defective in these lesions . However, more proof in vivo is needed to support this concept.
Stress to a cell can trigger the activation of a specialized group of mitogen activated protein kinase  cascades that induce cell death . The activated ASK1 phosphorylates and activates two different downstream kinases, MKK4/MKK7 and MKK3/MKK6. Furthermore, it has been demonstrated that knocking down of ASK1 in embryonic fibroblasts causes the cells to become resistant to H2O2 and TNF induced apoptosis, and overexpression of a constitutively active form of ASK1 in cell induces caspase 3 dependent apoptosis .
Epilepsy is a common neurological disorder . In temporal lobe epilepsy, the most common type of epilepsy in adults, seizures initiate in the mesial temporal lobe . In tissue from patients, dentate granule cells are hyperexcitable .
The Ubiquitin Proteasome System  and the HDAC6 dependent lysosomal pathway are two major pathways for protein turn over within eukaryotic cells . The proteasome inhibitor Bortezomib  has recently been licensed for the treatment of refractory multiple myeloma and mantle cell lymphoma and it is currently being examined as a treatment for several cancer types including ovarian carcinoma . PS 341 exhibits selective anti tumor activity against ovarian cancer cells in vitro, but in a xenograft model only slowed ovarian tumor growth .
Ultraviolet radiation  spectrum of solar light represents the major skin stressor. The mutagenic and genotoxic effects of UVR are predominantly related to absorption of UVB by DNA which acts as chromophores for wavelengths in the range of 290320 nm . Exposure to UVR causes DNA damage in form of primarily cyclobutane pyrimidine dimers  and to lower degree of pyrimidine photoproducts PPs .
Eukaryotic secretory and membrane proteins are translated on the endoplasmic reticulum  membrane, facilitating translocation across the lipid bilayer and integration of membrane domains. Once folded, newly synthesized proteins are packaged into transport vesicles that mediate delivery between the ER and Golgi . COPII consists of five distinct polypeptides: Sar1p, Sec23p, Sec24p, Sec13p, and Sec31p.
In the United States, 50,000 patients are affected by multiple myeloma , 16,000 patients are newly diagnosed with MM, and 11,000 MM patients die of the disease each year . MM is a late stage B cell malignancy characterized by the infiltration of malignant plasma cells in bone marrow, and is associated with high monoclonal  protein in the blood. MM can occur de novo or it can evolve from benign monoclonal gammapathy of undetermined significance  that involves in low levels of bone marrow plasmacytosis and M protein.
We previously reported models that characterized the synergistic interaction between remifentanil and sevoflurane in blunting responses to verbal and painful stimuli. This preliminary study evaluated the ability of these models to predict a return of responsiveness  during emergence from anesthesia and a response to tibial pressure when patients required analgesics in the recovery room. We hypothesized that model predictions would be consistent with observed responses.
The T cell receptor :CD3 complex mediates numerous downstream signaling events at multiple developmental stages to ensure optimal T cell development, peripheral function, and a finely tuned and effective adaptive immune system . This feature is not unique to CD3ε as it was previously shown that a similar motif in the CD3ζ cytoplasmic domain binds to acidic phospholipids and is required for stable TCR:CD3 synapse formation . Accumulating data thus propose a model in which the CD3ε and CD3ζ cytoplasmic domains associate with the lipid membrane in resting T cells and TCR ligation induces a triggering event that initiates the release of the CD3ε and CD3ζ cytoplasmic domains, facilitating signal transduction.
Bladder diverticula are defined as outpouchings of the urothelial lining through the muscularis layer of the bladder wall. They may result from congenital weakness of the bladder wall at the level of the ureterovesical junction  or may be acquired as a result of increased intravesical pressure, typically in the context of lower urinary tract obstruction . Bladder diverticula may sometimes harbor tumors, classically thought to be secondary to urinary stasis with chronic infection and inflammation leading to metaplasia and subsequent tumor formation.
The intestinal epithelium plays a central role in orchestrating organ function through nutrient absorption and by providing a barrier between the environment and underlying tissues. As the epithelium remodels, proliferative progenitor cells become restricted to intervillus regions, which mark the future sites of crypts where intestinal stem cells and secretory Paneth cells will reside  . One family of factors implicated in enterocyte development is the GATA family of zinc finger DNA binding transcription factors, specifically GATA4 and GATA6.
Oscillatory activity is a ubiquitous feature of neuronal dynamics. It has been suggested that the synchronous discharge of neuronal assemblies might provide a mechanism to couple distributed processing over different neuronal populations . Many studies investigating oscillatory activity have focussed on linear coupling between nodes of a network at the same frequency .
Body’s stress controlling mechanism that are disrupted and implicated in tumor progression causally connected to enhanced body’s immune defense system. Specifically, increased cancer incidence, malignancy and growth rate has been shown to be prevalent in patients with chronic stress, whereas managing stress of these patients promoted immune function that fights against their cancer . The increasing understanding of the mechanism and control of the neuroimmune system in the regulation of cancer chemoprevention offers promise for the design of therapeutic strategies.
Sarcoidosis is a granulomatous inflammatory disorder that can affect multiple organs . Pulmonary involvement occurs in more than 90% of cases . However, spontaneous remission may occur and, therefore, the optimal approach for initiating and titrating treatment is still controversial .
A major driver of spatial attention is one’s prior knowledge about where important events may appear. The attentional guidance view conceptualizes contextual cueing as a form of attentional guidance . The attentional guidance account is contrasted with a post selection decision account, which states that implicit learning does not affect the deployment of spatial attention before the target is found.
In addition to functioning as a barrier and absorptive organ, intestinal epithelial cells  are involved in defense and inflammatory diseases by releasing multiple cytokines and inflammatory mediators . For Example, TLR 2 recognizes peptidoglycan, a main cell wall component of Gram positive bacteria, lipoprotein, lipotechoic acid and lipopeptides , TLR 4 recognizes lipopolysaccaride  of G  bacteria , TLR 9 binds to unmethylated CpG DNA of bacteria  and TLR 11 recognizes T. gondii profilin . These adaptor molecules act independently or in combination based on the TLRs and activate MAPK  and NF κB resulting in the transcription of inflammatory and immunomodulatory genes include chemokines, cytokines and co stimulatory molecules .
Dysregulation of the hedgehog signalling pathway has been linked to the development and progression of a variety of different human tumors including cancers of the skin, brain, colon, prostate, blood, and pancreas. We assessed the clinicopathological factors that are potentially related to expression of Gli1, the transcription factor that is thought to be the most reliable marker of hedgehog pathway activation in bladder cancer . Bladder cancer cases were identified from the New Hampshire State Cancer Registry as histologically confirmed primary bladder cancer diagnosed between January 1, 2002, and July 31, 2004.
Two characteristics, inhibition by intracellular ATP and activation by MgADP, define ATP sensitive potassium  channels and underlie their ability to respond to metabolic changes inside a cell . Different KATP channels have different metabolic sensitivities . This property allows the pancreatic KATP channels to regulate insulin .
Alveolar soft part sarcoma  is a malignant neoplasm of unknown histogenesis that typically arises in the soft tissues of children and young adults . Characteristic for ASPS, most tumors in that original study arose within  the skeletal muscle of the extremity, or less commonly in the buttock, tongue, or abdominal wall . The characteristic histologic features of ASPS include an organoid arrangement of dyscohesive epithelioid tumor cells, wherein nests of cells are separated by fibrovascular septae .
Autistic and psychotic disorders have historically been considered as related diagnostic entities. ASD and SZ share common neurobiological processes  and genetic risk factors . In particular, formal thought disorder in ASD has been found to be induced by anxiety and stress .
Bone morphogenetic protein 4  is a member of the transforming growth factor beta  superfamily of secreted signaling ligands. Given the high amino acid identity between the mature peptides of human Bmp4 and Bmp2  and Bmp4 and Dpp  , it has been proposed that these proteins could function interchangeably. For example, homozygous knockout embryos that survive beyond gastrulation have delayed liver bud morphogenesis .
Disruption in circadian rhythms and perceived changes in sleep continuity and architecture are common features of psychiatric disorders. Similar results have been found for plasma melatonin  and plasma cortisol in BPD. Furthermore, BPD and schizophrenia  have been shown to be associated with later bedtime and increased nocturnal activity  .
Elucidating how risk factors interact over time may facilitate targeting and tailoring interventions to improve outcomes. For instance, while depressive symptoms have been associated with poor cardiovascular outcomes , Ferketich et al. noted they may be associated with higher risk for men than women . Among women, an interaction between race and increasing body mass index may lead to higher mortality for whites than blacks .
The effects of acetylcholinesterase  inhibitors on the symptoms of dementia of the Alzheimer type  can be highly variable. Although AChE inhibitors demonstrate modest overall benefits compared with placebo for stabilizing or slowing decline in mild to moderate Alzheimer’s disease, summary estimates show small effect sizes. It is not currently possible to identify those who will respond to treatment prior to treatment.
Urea Cycle Disorders  comprise several inherited deficiencies of enzymes or transporters necessary for the synthesis of urea from ammonia . UCD incidence is estimated to be ~1:8200 live births. .
Photoacoustic imaging  has been used extensively in pre clinical models of human disease including prostate, breast, and ovarian cancer. Small molecule agents include methylene blue or indocyanine green with very intensephotoacoustic signal. Fluorophore, fluorescent proteins, quenchers, and activatable hybrid molecules, are also members of this category.
Anatomical alignment of the lower extremity has been proposed as a risk factor for lower extremity injuries, in particular, knee injuries. Among these lower extremity alignment variables, the quadriceps angle  has been frequently studied, which is defined as the angle formed by a line from the anterior superior iliac spine to the patella center and a line from the patella center to the tibial tuberosity. As Q angle represents the direction of the quadriceps muscle force vector in the frontal plane, excessive angulation is thought to predispose individuals to injuries caused by abnormal quadriceps forces acting at the knee and patellofemoral joints.
Epithelial cells are central participants in mucosal immunity against microbial infection in the gastrointestinal tract. The epithelial cells can produce antimicrobial molecules, proinflammatory cytokines and chemokines in response to microbial infection. This host immune response is finely controlled and reflects a delicate balance between effector functions and their potential to cause unwanted damage to healthy tissues .
Huntington's disease  is a dominantly inherited neurodegenerative disorder caused by the expansion of a CAG repeat within the HD gene encoding huntingtin . The HD CAG expansion initiates a protracted cascade of events that results initially in the degeneration of medium spiny neurons in the striatum, motor, cognitive and psychiatric decline and eventual death . Significantly, age of onset and disease severity are highly dependent on CAG length .
Three randomized trials indicate that circumcised men have lower risk of acquisition of human immunodeficiency virus  than uncircumcised men,  and prevention interventions focusing on male circumcision  are being introduced worldwide. Whether MC is associated with women's risk of acquisition of HIV or other sexually transmitted infections , however, has not been well studied. is a necessary cause  which is significantly lower in women with circumcised male partners. )
There is consistent epidemiologic evidence that self reported long sleep  is associated with increased mortality and numerous morbidities, including hypertension, stroke, coronary heart disease, and diabetes. These hazards have increased in a dose response pattern with increases in sleep duration beyond 7 h, and have persisted following control for multiple factors, including sleep apnea, depression, health status, and medication use. Notwithstanding these data, the hypothesis that long sleep could be hazardous has not been widely accepted, perhaps particularly since 8 h of sleep is commonly assumed to be ideal for health.
Alzheimer’s disease  is a genetically complex disorder characterized by neurodegeneration and progressive cognitive dysfunction. Risk for AD is likely influenced by a variety of genes affecting multiple biological pathways. In an effort to identify these susceptibility genes, well over 1,000 genetic association studies have been published implicating or refuting nearly 600 different loci as potential AD loci.
Transcription factor binding to genetic regulatory elements initiates gene expression. This process is regulated through signaling cascades that modify proteins to permit their binding. Regional chromatin structure is determined by epigenetic mechanisms including DNA methylation, a repressive DNA modification.
A growing body of evidence supports the contention that epithelial cancers including the colorectal cancer are diseases driven by a small set of self renewing cells, termed cancer stem cells  or cancer initiating cells, that are distinct from the bulk of the cells in the tumor . Two recent transgenic animal studies have demonstrated that crypt stem cells are the cell of origin of intestinal cancers . CSC possess not only the ability to self renew but also differentiate and can give rise to heterogeneous tumors .
Long interspersed elements type 1  are the most abundant transposable elements in both human and mouse genomes. For example, the mouse genome contains 3600,000 copies of L1, with 33,000 full length, potentially active copies . L1 replicates in the genome by retrotransposition, a copy and paste mechanism involving reverse transcription of an RNA intermediate.
Intraoperative resident participation is integral to any surgical training program. With recent technological advancements and an emphasis on minimally invasive procedures, numerous surgical fields now train their residents in robotic procedures . In Urology, many programs utilize robotic prostatectomy  to familiarize residents with appropriate robotic technique  .
Most currently available vaccines work by eliciting antibody responses and are relatively inefficient at inducing cellular immunity. Yet, the latter is vital for resistance to a wide panel of pathogens, including Mycobacterium tuberculosis and the malaria parasite, as well as being a critical element of anti tumor immunotherapy. This may be due in part to the fact that in humans DNA vaccines are administered in a small volume.
Conjugated equine estrogen  was introduced into clinical practice in 1941 for the treatment of menopausal symptoms and related conditions.
