African American women who undergo mastectomy are also significantly less likely to have breast reconstruction compared with White women in the US , an issue garnering increasing research attention and concern .
Angiogenesis, a process of new blood vessel formation, contributes to various physiological processes and pathological settings. Recent reports suggest that reactive oxygen species  can positively or negatively regulate angiogenesis. While physiological levels of ROS are required for angiogenesis, excess amount of ROS generated during inflammation and ischemic response may inhibit reparative vascular remodeling by inducing endothelial dysfunction and apoptosis.
The RAF MEK ERK protein kinase signaling cascade is a central pathway that regulates cell growth, proliferation, differentiation and survival in response to extracellular stimuli . Somatic mutations in B RAF, a member of the RAF kinase family, have been found in ∼6% of human cancer , with the highest incidence in malignant melanoma , papilliary thyroid cancer , serous ovarian cancer  and colorectal cancer  . Mouse embryonic fibroblasts lacking LKB1 fail to senescence in culture  but more readily undergo apoptosis in response to energy stress .
Most mortality in sub Saharan Africa  is currently due to communicable diseases, but WHO estimates that by 2030 noncommunicable diseases  will be the most common causes of death., As NCDs rise to account for 46% of all deaths by 2030, the SSA region will face a 64% increase in deaths due to NCDs  the largest percent increase of all regions. Many studies have documented the emerging burden of NCDs in rural and urban sub Saharan Africa, including rates of and risk factors for hypertension, stroke, diabetes mellitus, and ischemic heart disease. Recent meta analyses document the overall prevalence of hypertension in the general population to be 16.2%., In Uganda, cross sectional surveys defined hypertension as one elevated blood pressure reading, and found a prevalence of 27.2% in a mostly rural population, and 22% in a strictly rural population.
The relationship between inflammation and depression in humans and in animal models is well established. Individuals receiving immunotherapies have a higher incidence of depressive symptoms . Patients with major depressive disorders have higher levels of serum pro inflammatory cytokines than healthy controls .
CD4+ T cells have emerged as an important arm of immune system in combating tumors . CD4+ T cells could mediate tumor rejection by killing tumor cells via TRAIL, FasL or granzyme perforin dependent pathways, by up regulating MHC class I and II expressions on tumor cells, inhibiting tumor cell proliferation, promoting NK cell function, rescuing CTL from activation induced cell death, inducing angiogenesis inhibitors and recruiting macrophages/eosinophils via IFN γ mediated mechanisms . In most cases, CD4+ T cells may orchestrate broad immune components of hosts to elicit a tumor specific immune attack when considering the following: first, most tumor cells are MHC class II / , which cannot be recognized by CD4+ T cells ; second, the unique ability of CD4+ T cells to regulate other immune cells in vivo ; lastly, CD4+ T cell help is especially important in the situation of tumor bearing host lacking intrinsic “danger” signals .
Borderline Personality Disorder  is a serious, disabling condition with significant morbidity and mortality. Although little is known about the etiology of the disorder, recent research has demonstrated that there is a large heritable component in BPD . Thus, genes related to the serotonin system are potential candidate genes .
One of the most interesting characteristics of synapses lies in their ability to differentially respond following variations in afferent input, a property known as synaptic plasticity. Synaptic plasticity is a proposed neural correlate of learning and memory, and has been extensively characterized in the hippocampus . Functional AMPARs are heteromeric tetramers assembled from a combination of four different subunits .
Glioblastoma multiforme  is the most aggressive and fatal adult human brain cancer, and over 10,000 new cases are diagnosed in the United States each year. A defining feature of the mesenchymal subset is mutations and/or deletions in the gene encoding neurofibromin 1 , suggesting that this subtype may be uniquely amenable to agents that target pathways driven by NF1 loss . RAS GTP/GDP cycling is positively regulated by GTP exchange factors , which promote the exchange of GDP for GTP and negatively regulated by GTPase activating proteins , such as NF1, that promote the hydrolysis of GTP to GDP.
Obesity is now regarded as an epidemic on a worldwide scale, a consequence of nutritional and genetic factors . High fat diets are major factors that promote the development of obesity, which results in disorders including cardiovascular disease, hypertension, diabetes mellitus and immune dysfunction with increased susceptibility to infection . It is known that high fat diets, enriched with SFA, can impair immune responses by affecting inflammatory pathways through the adipokine, cytokine and chemokine networks .
There is a natural propensity for attention to be captured by threatening stimuli; however, individuals differ in the extent to which they selectively attend to threat cues in social environments. For instance, anxious individuals have greater attentional bias for threat signals than nonanxious individuals, particularly for signals of threat conveyed through facial expressions . Therefore, a better understanding of the link between attentional bias for threat and anxiety, particularly in relation to individual differences in threat bias sensitivity, may have relevance to the development of anxious psychopathology .
Mercury  in the environment is an increasing health concern. The levels of inorganic mercury  are elevated in the cerebellum of Alzheimer's disease patients . Inorganic mercury binds to various molecular weights of thiol containing proteins   with high binding ability .
Balanced facial growth is essential for a symmetric, well proportioned face and normal occlusion. Such records may provide invaluable dento facial phenotypic information for genetic studies of malocclusion etiology and facial variation . Studies using 2D soft tissue images have reported genetic associations between upper facial height and the gene ENPP1  and between the cephalic index and the gene FGFR1 .
Speech consists of rapidly changing elements that require fine grained neural representation of temporal information, especially in background noise. Temporal cues are important components of auditory object formation , a necessary element of auditory stream segregation. Early stages of auditory stream segregation occur subcortically , and timing cues needed for speech perception and auditory stream segregation are preserved in the brainstem via neural synchrony .
Uveal melanoma is the most common intra ocular malignancy. Although there are effective treatments for primary tumors in the eye, 50% of patients who develop large primary tumors develop metastatic disease and die within 615 months of diagnosis . Because there are no effective therapies for metastatic disease, we are exploring cell based vaccines as a therapeutic option.
Over the past two decades, the development of functional magnetic resonance imaging  technology has generated near exponential growth in neuroimaging research and its clinical applications . In classic block designs, the duration of each regressor in the regression model matches the duration of the stimulus block. In 95% of event related studies containing a decision process , the duration of the decision period is assumed to be constant and is typically modeled by the convolution of a constant height, finite impulse function  positioned at event onset with a canonical hemodynamic response function  .
Hypophysiotropic thyrotropin releasing hormone  synthesizing neurons located in the medial and periventricular parvocellular subdivisions of the paraventricular nucleus of the hypothalamus  control the hypothalamic pituitary thyroid  axis. These neurons integrate a variety of humoral and neuronal signals and mediate the effects of these inputs toward the pituitary gland. One of the major regulatory mechanisms over hypophysiotropic TRH neurons is the negative feedback effect of thyroid hormones which maintains euthyroid levels of thyroid hormone in the circulating blood.
Despite a proliferation of research on the experiences of same sex attracted or lesbian, gay, and bisexual  youth, contextual influences on these youths’ development are not fully understood . Yet we know relatively little about the prejudices that may affect these youths’ experiences, because most studies of attitudes toward lesbian and gay people have been conducted with adults. Attitudes toward homosexuality among adults have been found to vary significantly across national populations .
The serum level of CA 125 is well established as a highly useful surrogate for monitoring the response to treatment and confirming relapse in women with epithelial ovarian cancer . However, the literature has focused on the more common ovarian cancer histologies, particularly the serous subtype  . The prognostic value of CA 125 for clear cell or mucinous ovarian cancers is less certain.
Endometrial cancer is the most common gynecological malignancy in the United States, with approximately 46,000 newly diagnosed cases and 8,100 related deaths in 2012 . The strongest prognostic factor for endometrial cancer is stage at diagnosis. Endometrioid adenocarcinoma, the numerically predominant histological tumor type, typically presents with stage 1 disease, which is an important factor in the overall favorable outcomes for these tumors .
Interoception is the sense of the internal physiological and sensory status of the organism . Many conceptualizations of emotion  posit a connection between subjective experience and body state, suggesting that interoception is related fundamentally to emotion. A network of structures, which includes, but is not limited to, the dorsal lateral prefrontal cortex  and insula is involved in emotion processing and may show altered activation in PTSD .
Human brain maturation is a complex process that can now be examined in detail using in vivo neuroimaging techniques . Early neuroimaging investigations focused on region, lobe or total brain volumes . However, brain maturation starts well before birth and occurs as a unified process with inter regional interactions and dependencies.
The nitrite anion  is biologically important, for example in denitrifying bacteria where it forms from nitrate  reduction catalyzed by a molybdoenzyme. In fact, this supposedly inert anion can be and is recycled in vivo to generate nitric oxide and constitutes a biochemical circulating reservoir for this important signaling molecule, in particular under conditions of physiologic hypoxia and ischemia  . The classical biological source of NO is nitric oxide synthase  oxidation of L arginine .
Skin cancer is the most common form of cancer in the United States, with approximately 1 million new cases per year . Among three major types of skin cancer, melanoma is the most serious form. The most common type of skin cancer is basal cell carcinoma , followed by squamous cell carcinoma .
Infants, children, adults, and many non human animals are able to represent large numbers of objects, sounds, and events in an imprecise fashion, using the Approximate Number System . For example, there is a bilateral activation pattern in the horizontal segment of the intraparietal sulci  during tasks which require recruitment of the semantic representation of quantity , with activation increasing during calculation tasks such as subtraction, approximate addition, or numerical comparison . One likely reason that scaling processes such as multiplication and division appear to rely on distinct verbal numerical regions such as the AG is because of the tendency to provide multiplication problems to subjects in a way that allows or encourages the use of rote learned, exact calculation based on memorized tables .
A considerable body of evidence suggests that painful conditions are often accompanied by alterations in cutaneous sensory perception. Nathan reported that localized pain due to peripheral or central lesions can impair the perception of tactile stimuli within the painful region ; similarly, provoking pain in patients with pathological pain  increases tactile detection thresholds in the area of pain referral . In some clinical conditions, widespread impairment of tactile sensitivity has been documented.
Acute compartment syndrome  is a condition which occurs when increased intramuscular pressure  within a closed fascial space impairs vascular perfusion to a point below the level necessary for muscle and nerve viability. Various criteria are used for diagnosis of ACS, including an absolute IMP level higher than normal  with clinical symptoms , or a tissue perfusion pressure  of less than 3040 mm Hg . While the technique is generally accurate and reproducible, several factors such as pain, infection risk, and disagreement over the appropriate threshold pressure for diagnosis of ACS leaves some clinicians reluctant to perform direct IMP measurements.
Tissue recombination studies and genetic experiments in chick and mice demonstrated an intricate dependence of craniofacial and pharyngeal morphogenesis on signaling between the anterior mesoderm and the neural crest . In the context of the developing cardiovascular system and facial muscles, cranial neural crest plays an essential role in regulating the balance of Fgf and BMP signals sensed by the anterior mesoderm. The development of this vascular tree is incredibly complex and intimately depends on signaling between all germ layers and the neural crest, reviewed by .
The rapidly growing field of metabolomics seeks to describe and understand the different metabolic states of an organism. As an illustration, >55 metabolomic or metabanomic articles have been published in Anal. since 2001, where >45% of these papers use PCA, PLS DA or a comparable statistical tool.
The calcium sensing receptor  is in Family C/3 of the G protein coupled receptor superfamily . Mutations in CaSR cause human diseases of calcium handling. Loss of function mutations increase the EC50 for activation by extracellular Ca2+, causing FHH  and NSHPT  .
Although statins provide 25% to 40% reduction in cardiovascular disease  events, there is considerable residual risk of CVD events with this therapy . Failure of recent trials  to provide evidence of additional clinical benefit by raising HDL C levels in addition to the conventional, statin based strategy, supports a recent meta regression analysis suggesting that simply increasing the amount of circulating HDL C with drugs does not reduce the risk of coronary heart disease events, coronary heart disease deaths, or total deaths . No agent, however, solely increases HDL C. For instance, niacin increases HDL C up to30% but concomitantly reduces LDL C, triglycerides, and lipoprotein, and small, dense LDL .
Children with sickle cell disease  are at markedly increased risk of infection from Streptococcus pneumoniae, which is estimated to be 300 to 600 times higher than the general population, due to functional hyposplenism. Historically, the estimated incidence was six episodes of invasive pneumococcal disease  per 100 patient years with a 25 35% case fatality rate. In the mid 1980's, the polyvalent polysaccharide S. pneumoniae vaccine  and prophylactic penicillin were shown to reduce the risk of IPD and were adopted as standard of care.
The retinoblastoma tumor suppressor protein, Rb is a major regulator of multiple cellular processes including cell cycle, differentiation and apoptosis . HR HPVs are the etiological agents of cervical cancer and are associated with a subset of oral and head and neck cancer . Recently, multiple viral oncoprotein proteins including human cytomegalovirus  pp71 protein , the Epstein Barr virus  nuclear antigen ENNA3C , the hepatitis C virus N55B , and the HTLV 1 Tax oncoprotein  were shown to induce proteasomal degradation of Rb.
Dengue virus  is maintained in a primarily anthroponotic cycle between humans and the Aedes aegypti mosquito . aegypti on vertebrate hosts results in the simultaneous introduction of virus and saliva into the skin . In the context of DENV infection, the addition of Ae.
The cricopharyngeus  muscle is comprised of the transverse fibers at the caudal portion of the inferior pharyngeal constrictor and is the primary location of the upper esophageal sphincter . At rest it is tonically contracted and relaxes with deglutition. Aspiration and weight loss ensue in severe cases .
Among coccal green algae, only a few genera show multinucleate  vegetative cells. The occurrence of such stages is likely due to a prolonged cell cycle, where after nuclear division no simultaneous sporogenesis takes place. Coenocytic coccal green algae are mainly isolated from soil and aeroterrestrial habitats, and reports on their development in cultures are sparse .
Hepatocellular carcinoms  is the fifth most prevalent cancer in the world and is the third leading cause of cancer related death with annual death rate exceeding 500,000. Primary hepatocellular carcinoma, the most common primary malignant tumor arising in the liver accounts for >90% of all primary liver cancer. The disease is progressive and death usually occurs within 10 months of initial diagnosis .
Airborne particles below 2.5 μm in diameter, PM2.5, are associated with increased morbidity and mortality. This same size class of particles also influences global climate, through absorption and scattering of light and through effects on the formation, albedo and lifetime of clouds. Gaseous pollutants such as ozone are measured continuously at 1200 sites throughout the country, yet atmospheric particle chemistry data are limited to 24 hour averages once every third or sixth day, with just 380 sites nationwide  .
Malignant Melanoma remains among the most life threatening of all cancers, and its incidence has been rising dramatically in the last decades. Despite great progress in understanding the genetics and biochemistry of malignant melanoma, patients with metastatic disease have very few treatment options available. Each of the steps of the metastatic cascade is rate limiting.
Concurrent cisplatin based chemo radiotherapy constitutes the standard treatment for locally advanced cervical cancer. Moderate to severe toxicity often requires dose reduction of cisplatin, delay in the treatment or discontinuation of therapy. Thus, novel, less toxic and equally effective compounds are highly desirable .
Attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder  is commonly diagnosed during childhood, affecting around 8% of school aged children worldwide . Psychostimulant medications are effective for the treatment of ADHD, and methylphenidate  is one of the most prescribed therapeutic agents . Despite its well documented efficacy in the control of ADHD related symptoms , little is known about the long term consequences resulting from early life exposure to MPH  .
Three distinct, yet inter related, stimulatory signals are required for the activation and differentiation of naïve T cells into cytokine producing effector T cells . For example, antigen specificity controlled by T cell receptor  signaling dictates which subset of T cells becomes initially activated , while costimulation signals primarily mediated by CD28 signaling prevent these newly activated T cells from becoming anergic . In this regard, a growing list of specific cytokines that includes IL 6, IL 12, IL 21, type I IFNs, and TGF β have each been demonstrated to provide additional stimulation signals that controls the expansion, survival, and differentiation program of newly activated CD4+ and CD8+ T cells .
Cytotoxic aggregates arising from the misfolding of the 140 residue intrinsically unstructured protein α synuclein  have been implicated in the pathogenesis of Parkinson's disease, the second most common neurodegenerative disorder in humans. In a process common to many neurodegenerative diseases, misfolding commences with the formation of small soluble oligomers , which proceed to yield larger protofibrils and eventually form insoluble cross β sheet fibrils. , An unstructured to structured transition also underlies the most tangible physiological function of aS; namely, its ability to bind synaptic vesicles in α helical conformation.
Intravesical administration of zymosan in adult rats leads to a time dependent increase in urinary bladder inflammation  and a significant enhancement of abdominal muscle electromyographic  and arterial blood pressure  responses to urinary bladder distension  when compared to controls . This inflammation induced bladder hypersensitivity is being suppressed by endogenous opioids because either intraperitoneal  or intrathecal  administration of naloxone at the time of UBD testing significantly increases the magnitude of EMG responses when compared to controls . The opioid inhibitory effect may be under descending control of the RVM since electrical stimulation of the RVM inhibits the VMR to UBD and is partially mediated by spinal opioids.
Previous cross sectional research has indicated that larger discrepancies between measured and self identified good weight  have been associated with greater dieting frequency, increased snacking, yo yo dieting, physical inactivity, tobacco use, and alcohol consumption . Individuals with chronically larger weight discrepancies had three times greater risk of developing type 2 diabetes compared to individuals with smaller weight discrepancies . Although this concept of weight discrepancy has not been validated against measures of weight dissatisfaction, similarities do exist.
Although the human genome is thirty times larger than that of Caenorhabditis elegans, each species is endowed with a similar number of protein coding genes, a fact seemingly in support of an abundance of “junk DNA” within our genome. Two major discoveries over the last ten years challenge this decades old concept. Second, the combined efforts of the ENCyclopedia Of DNA Elements  Consortium and many other labs have revealed the existence of millions of codes that punctuate the human genome, most notably codes for transcription factor binding.
During a systematic search for peptides recognized by CD8+T lymphocytes and encoded by alternative positive strand open reading frames  of the influenza A virus  strain A/PR/8/34  , Chen et al. reported the existence of a novel 87 aa protein representing the eleventh defined IAV gene product. Without exception, human H1 isolates from 1918 to 1988 encode full length PB1 F2. Isolates from 1988 to 1998 encode an ORF either for full length or for C terminally truncated PB1 F2.
Intraocular inflammatory disease or uveitis is a major cause of visual handicap in the United States, causing an estimated >100, 000 new cases of ocular morbidity per year and 10% of the new cases of legal blindness . It has been generally accepted that non infectious uveitis is an autoimmune disorder predominantly mediated by T helper cells . Earlier studies on humans as well as in animal models demonstrated that Th1 mediated autoimmune responses play a pivotal role in this disease .
Chronic kidney disease  is associated with an increased risk of gestational hypertension, preeclampsia, and intrauterine growth retardation . Data regarding the impact of reduced glomerular filtration rate  on pregnancy in women with a single kidney has primarily come from studies in kidney transplant recipients . In regard to kidney donors, two small series suggested that pregnancy after kidney donation was not associated with an increased risk of adverse fetal or maternal outcomes .
The structure of amyloid fibrils is of considerable interest because of the many debilitating diseases that are associated with amyloid formation. Accordingly, a wide range of techniques has been used to investigate these structures, including X ray diffraction, electron microscopy, and magic angle spinning  NMR spectroscopy . However, such a model represents only an educated guess about the structure of the monomers that assemble to form an amyloid protofibril .
T1 weighted dynamic contrast enhanced  MRI has in recent years been widely utilized in studies of many different types of cancer , frequently for purposes of diagnosis  and assessment of the effectiveness of antiangiogenic therapies . The results from the first two approaches depend on DCE MRI pulse sequence parameters, contrast agent dose and injection rate, magnetic field strength, and vendor platform, etc . These data acquisition details vary greatly between institutions, thus limiting DCE MRI study reproducibility and comparability between different imaging sites.
There have been multiple studies in the last decade linking mental health to neighborhood factors . Neighborhood social factors are measured in multiple ways. Another common approach is to measure individuals own perceptions of their surrounding social environment.
Several studies have reported that live cultured cancer cells exposed to anticancer drugs or to anti Fas antibodies undergoing apoptosis and cells at certain stages of proliferation and cell cycle show an increase in the proton nuclear magnetic resonance  signal corresponding to the so called mobile lipids  represented mostly by triacylglycerides. ML apparently come from intracellular lipid bodies or membrane microdomains during the ongoing metabolic changes associated with programmed cell death, . Specifically, it may provide a more convenient assay for apoptosis than conventional biochemical techniques , and provide a better understanding of the mechanism involved in the activity of the drugs, since this methodology can be used to differentiate apoptosis from cell necrosis .
Port wine stains  are primarily venous micro vascular malformations of the skin that commonly occur on the face. Skin lesion depth ranges from 1 to 5 mm  . PWS may be treated effectively with a variety of vascular selective lasers.
Anaphylaxis is a serious allergic reaction that is rapid in onset and may cause death. Epinephrine is the drug of choice for the treatment of anaphylaxis. Allergic reactions to foods affect up to 6% of children, and food allergy is the most common cause of anaphylaxis in children .
The circadian timing system governs daily  rhythmic processes via information that stems from a molecular mechanism which is classically modeled as a cell autonomous oscillator. That model features transcriptional and post transcriptional elements forming interlocked loops . Loss of PDF does not perturb the cellular clock but changes its phase and or reduces its strength  .
The Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical  classification system is a drugclassification system developed by the World health Organization  Collaborating Centrefor Drug Statistics Methodology in Norway. Traditional uses of ATC have included pharmacoepidemiologic studies. For example,ATC has supported the analysis of prescription drug costs  and use of drugs in various populations .
Venous thromboembolism  occurs disproportionately among older adults . The reasons likely involve increases in both intrinsic blood coagulation potential that occur with age and presence of acquired co morbid conditions that predispose to thrombosis, such as obesity, surgery, cancer, and immobility . Family studies suggest the existence of genes that jointly influence thrombosis susceptibility and plasma coagulation and fibrinolytic factor levels .
In 2006, The University of Texas, M D Anderson Cancer Center started treating patients at the newly built Proton Therapy Center in Houston  . The facility utilizes three identical passive scattering nozzles. Two are mounted on rotational gantries, and the other one is mounted in a fixed horizontal orientation.
In the adult brain, active neurogenesis occurs constitutively in two defined regions: the subgranular zone of the hippocampus and the subventricular zone  lining the lateral ventricles . Neural stem/progenitor cells  within these neurogenic regions can self renew, proliferate, and differentiate into neurons or glia, that allows them to generate a reservoir of neurons, astrocytes, and oligodendrocytes as back up in times of normal cell turnover or brain injury  . Recent findings have revealed that uncontrolled, chronic brain inflammation is an underlying driving force to intensifying the rapid deterioration of the central nervous system in neurodegenerative diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease , HIV 1 Associated dementia , multiple sclerosis, and Parkinson’s disease  .
Young infants vary in their patterns of responsiveness to unfamiliar events. Some of this variation has an origin in one or more temperamental biases. Those who show very low levels of motor activity and distress at four months  are biased to become sociable and bold and are called uninhibited  .
Impotence, or erectile dysfunction , is a major complication of type II diabetes, and many diabetic men with ED are refractory to common ED therapies . Twenty two 10 week old male fatty type II diabetic ZDF rats underwent weight and blood glucose measurement every 2 weeks. At age 22 weeks, all animals underwent unilateral CN electrostimulation and ICP measurement to confirm impotence, and paragonadal adipose tissue  was harvested and digested to yield 1.5 million ADSC.
Surgical autogenous arteriovenous access  is the preferred method of access for hemodialysis, with improved patient survival, fewer infectious complications, longer patency and reduced costs relative to arteriovenous bridge grafts and catheters). However, creation of the AVF carries a frustratingly high failure to mature rate. Approximately 60% of AVFs do not mature to the point of usability for dialysis, resulting in further procedures and interventions for patients.
Musculoskeletal disorders  are a leading work related health issue among construction workers, but determining the true burden of morbidity associated with work activities is difficult within current surveillance and medical insurance systems. There is growing evidence that work related injuries and illnesses are under reported due to both employer and employee factors; studies have shown cost shifting of work related claims to private or public health insurance programs. Shifting of claims from work related coverage to other sources places the burden of disease on workers and their families and shifts attention to managing the disease rather than focusing prevention efforts on work related causes .
What is the relationship between color categories and color discrimination? Is discrimination better across a category boundary  than it is within a category? using a series of blue stimuli, have shown that native Russian speakers respond more rapidly when the discriminanda lie on opposite sides of the boundary between goluboy and signyi.
The heart and gut are electromechanical organs both designed to move content efficiently and effectively. Disruption of this process results in disease. Chronic intestinal pseudo obstruction  can be viewed as an insufficiency of the “intestinal pump” similarly to chronic heart failure.
Under solution conditions where protein stability appears to be optimized to minimize protein aggregation in bulk solution, aggregates and particles can form. Recently, the potential for silicone oil to induce aggregation and particle formation has been of great concern in the industry because of efforts to develop therapeutic protein products in prefilled syringes. Silicone oil is applied to cartridges and barrels of plastic and glass syringes to facilitate smooth and easy movement of plungers within the barrels.
Adolescence is a time of physical, educational, social, and psychological change . Ultimately, those who effectively develop their identity demonstrate commitment to societal standards and those who do not are likely to reject mainstream values and beliefs, potentially leading to destructive behaviors or negative affiliations. Recent research on adolescent identity development has linked a coherent sense of oneself and one's place in the world with school attendance, graduation, and academic achievement, particularly for youth who are members of non dominant racial/ethnic groups  .
Vector control remains the most effective method in combating the spread of the mosquito Aedes aegypti, the primary vector of dengue virus. About 50 to 100 million cases of dengue fever occur each year, resulting in more than 20,000 deaths . A clearer understanding of factors influencing mosquito presence and production and how environmental conditions encountered by immature mosquitoes in water storage drums impact potential disease transmission should lead to more effective control strategies .
Coinfections with different pathogens  affect about one third of the human population . In some cases, chronic viral infections are beneficial to host immune responses to bacterial and viral coinfections . Thus, one mechanism by which pathogens may suppress immunity to heterologous infections is through impaired recruitment and activation of naïve T cells during a coinfection  .
Apical support for the uterus and upper vagina is provided by the cardinal  and uterosacral  ligaments . These ligaments are critical in pelvic organ prolapse  as, in addition to apical prolapse, they are strongly related to anterior vaginal wall descent ; the most common form of POP being present in 8387 % cases . Importantly, the anterior vaginal wall is the site of failure in 72 % of recurrences .
Serrated polyps of the colorectum are comprised of hyperplastic polyps , sessile serrated adenomas , and traditional serrated adenomas  . HPs are characterized by an average size <0.5 cm, a predominantly left sided location, and the lack of neoplastic potential. Unlike HPs, SSAs are notable for irregularly shaped crypts that widen towards the muscularis mucosae in association with basilar crypt branching, papillary formations, and an irregularly distributed proliferation zone .
Advances in the clinical care of children with sickle cell anemia , such as earlier diagnosis, penicillin prophylaxis, folate supplementation and hydroxyurea therapy have reduced morbidity and mortality related to this disease . Suboptimal growth, however, remains a significant clinical problem. Compared to their healthy peers, studies suggest that children with SCA are smaller and have delayed pubertal development.
Statistics is an essential training component for a career in clinical and translational science . Given the increasing complexity of statistics, learners may have difficulty selecting appropriate courses. Our question was: what depth of statistical knowledge do different CTS learners require?
Although the extracellular matrix  was classically viewed as an inert scaffold onto which cells are organized into organs and tissues, studies in recent decades have established the ECM as dynamic structures that can profoundly influence diverse aspects of cellular behavior and function . Fragments of these and other ECM proteins, generated as products of elevated levels of matrix degradative enzymes, have been shown to induce chemotaxis for inflammatory cells, enhance phagocytic functions, stimulate immune responses, and induce gene expression changes . Induced expression of matricellular proteins, a group of matrix associated signaling proteins that play diverse regulatory roles, also contribute to dynamic changes in the ECM at sites of inflammation and injury repair .
High level of co morbidity among urinary and gastrointestinal disorders suggests an existence of pathways connecting and concurrently coordinating the function of several pelvic organs. Functional pelvic disorders are distinguished by chronic pelvic pain of unknown etiology and may develop as a result of cross sensitization in the pelvis . Our previous studies have demonstrated an association between inflammation in the pelvis, hyperexcitability of extrinsic sensory neurons and development of pelvic organ cross sensitization .
In the adult vertebrate, particular neural populations are continually replaced throughout adulthood whereas other neuron types presumably persist more or less for the lifespan of the organism . In some brain regions, the number of incoming neurons compensates for the number of "replaceable" neurons that die . Regulatory mechanisms underlying neuronal incorporation are not well understood, although evidence increasingly suggests that functional activity of the circuitry that incorporates new neurons may contribute to the survival of young incoming neurons.
Inflammatory bowel disease  is a term describing two complex diseases: Crohn’s disease  and ulcerative colitis . IBD primarily affects people living in industrialized countries. A recent epidemiological survey of IBD in the US reports prevalence rates of 201 per 100000 and 238 per 100000 for CD and UC, respectively .
Although the outcome of traumatic brain injury  is clearly influenced by sex , the mechanisms involved are poorly understood. It is known that the functions of gonadal steroids, such as progesterone, extend well beyond reproduction , playing roles, for instance, in recovery after injury. Cycling females typically show less cerebral edema than males and pseudo pregnancy in females gives even greater protection .
Chlorine is a reactive gas used in a variety of industrial processes, including the production of plastics, solvents, paper products, and purified drinking water. Chlorine is considered a chemical threat because of the large amounts that are produced and transported in the U.S., its ease of acquisition, and its acute toxicity . Chlorine is highly toxic by inhalation, and toxic exposures to humans have occurred from both accidental and intentional releases of chlorine.
Obesity is associated with increased incidence of cardiovascular disease, notably including hypertension . In addressing issues related to regulation of arterial BP and heart rate , we have found that challenging an animal using a sudden, carefully controlled classical aversive  conditioning paradigm yields considerable insight into autonomic nervous function . We have previously described the hemodynamic response to a sudden onset behavioral challenge for Sprague Dawley rat .
Dantrolene is a direct acting skeletal muscle relaxant that exerts its effects by dissociating excitation contraction coupling in muscle via inhibition of the release of calcium from intracellular storage sites within the sarcoplasmic reticulum. The ryanodine receptor  is the important dantrolene binding site within skeletal muscle and serves as the major intracellular calcium release channel  . In dogs, dantrolene is also excreted through the urinary and biliary systems, primarily as 5 hydroxydantrolene  .
The yellow oleander tree  is common through much of the tropics and subtropics. Poisonings are reported widely, but it is only in South Asia that ingestion of oleander seeds has become a popular means of self harm. Many cardenolides have been identified in yellow oleander, predominantly thevetin A and B, but also peruvoside, neriifolin, thevetoxin, ruvoside, and theveridoside.
The importance of thermoregulation in the testis is illustrated by the fact that slight increases in temperature can disrupt spermatogenesis and ultimately cause problems with fertility . In addition, the temperature within the testis is regulated by a countercurrent heat exchange system between the pampiniform plexus and the testicular artery. Thus, there is a possibility of the testis becoming hypoxic .
Non invasive imaging methods such as MR angiography , CT angiography  and Doppler ultrasound  are used to assess renal vascular health in order to guide clinical judgements regarding management of people with kidney disease. However, these measures are only useful for the assessment of large arteries and are insensitive to alterations in vascular perfusion at the microvascular level . Ultrasound contrast agents are composed of high molecular weight gases encapsulated in an albumin, polymer or lipid shell.
It has been estimated that nearly 5.3 million incidents of intimate partner violence  occur every year in the United States to women ages 18 and older resulting in nearly 2 million injuries and 1,300 deaths . IPV has been linked with both immediate and long term health, social, and economic consequences. Research has also identified that women experiencing IPV are more likely to be unemployed, and receiving public assistance  .
The V regions of actively transcribed Ig genes undergo physiologically induced and regulated sequence diversification, which expands and modulates the repertoire for antigen recognition and provides a dynamic response to infection by pathogenic microorganisms . Gene conversion is the primary source of diversity in the pre immune antibody repertoire of chicken and other fowl. Somatic hypermutation occurs in antigen activated human and murine B cells and also diversifies the pre immune repertoire in other species, such as sheep  .
Intrinsic apoptotic pathways that respond to cytotoxic stress, including DNA damage, activate a hierarchical series of caspases that disassemble cells without inciting inflammation in bystanding cells. Permeabilization of mitochondria is seminal to the regulation of cell death induced by cytotoxic or genotoxic stress . Among the most important proteins released from mitochondria is cytochrome c. One established paradigm, supported by abundant evidence, holds that cytochrome c exits through a permeability transition pore composed of the outer mitochondrial membrane protein VDAC1 , the inner mitochondrial membrane protein ANT , and the inner membrane associated protein cyclophylin D .
Dendritic macromolecules encompass several subclasses of molecular compounds. One strong demand arising from the biomedical field is the availability of Janus type dendritic structures that can assume two, or even more, different tasks such as targeting a particular site, transporting at this site a medicinally active drug and imaging it with a diagnostic label. have assembled two dendritic polylysines, one functionalized with a label and the other with peptides, whereas Lukin et al. combined divergent and convergent approaches to prepare Janus type sulfonamides dendrimers.
Central sensitization is a fundamental mechanism underlying the increased excitability of nociceptive pathways following peripheral tissue injury and inflammation and is reflected in increases in nociceptive neuronal spontaneous activity, mechanoreceptive field  size, and responses to noxious mechanical stimuli and in decreases in mechanical activation threshold . The brainstem trigeminal subnucleus caudalis has many morphological and functional similarities with the spinal dorsal horn and indeed is nowadays often termed the medullary dorsal horn , and previous findings have documented that central sensitization can be induced in MDH nociceptive neurons by application to the tooth pulp of the inflammatory irritant and small fibre excitant mustard oil  . In this acute dental inflammation model, we also documented that glutamatergic and purinergic mechanisms and non neuronal cells  in MDH are involved in this central sensitization  .
Hypoxic ischemic encephalopathy  is a syndrome of disturbed neurologic function that occurs secondary to decreased blood oxygenation or diminished brain perfusion as a result of an asphyxic event in the perinatal period. The delayed phase is associated with encephalopathy and increased seizure activity; thus, an opportunity to modify disease progression exists between the time of resuscitation of the asphyxiated newborn and the second phase of neuronal injury. Therapeutic hypothermia is the current standard intervention for neonates with HIE.
For many decades, the central tenet of radiation biology was that the biological effects of ionizing radiation occur only in cells that are directly hit by radiation. While these effects were mainly observed after exposure to high linear energy transfer  radiations, they were also observed after low LET radiation exposures . Elucidation of these events may affect both radiation protection and radiation therapy of cancer  .
Cortical inhibitory interaction at the columnar level has functional significance in many basic brain functions including general principles of cortical circuitry and local neural processing, and particular mechanism and architecture underlying the processing of complex sensory input . For instance, combining optical imaging and electrophysiological techniques has revealed that long range horizontal connections in primary visual cortex  modulate both excitatory and inhibitory synaptic interactions between iso orientation columns  and that these horizontal connections are widely assumed to be present to support contour integration . The short range inhibition between neighboring columns with different orientation preferences, on the other hand, is engaged in providing contextual information about the visual scene  or may be closely related to cross orientation inhibition  and sharpening the orientation column tuning response .
Traumatic brain injury  is characterized by physical brain injury as a result of acceleration deceleration, resulting frequently from impact with an immobile object that often leads to cognitive deficits and impairment of behavior. U.S. soldiers exposed to blast wave pressure and combat experiences without any physical brain injury during Middle east wars are commonly diagnosed with mild TBI and post traumatic stress disorder . Mild TBI is the most frequent form of trauma among deployed military populations .
Exposure of the ovarian surface epithelium to elevated gonadotropin levels has been proposed to play a deleterious role in ovarian carcinogenesis. This view is based on the concept that post ovulatory inclusion cysts formed from invagination of the ovarian surface epithelium  are exposed to excessive sub stromal stimulation by gonadotropins and estrogen in the pre menopausal period, resulting in increased cellular proliferation with eventual progression to malignant transformation. The hypothesis is largely based on observations in animal models in which various means of increased production of gonadotropins  was associated with ovarian tumor development.
The amount of myocardial perfusion required for successful defibrillation after prolonged cardiac arrest is not known. Coronary perfusion pressure  is a surrogate for myocardial perfusion. One limited clinical study reported that a threshold of 15 mmHg was necessary for return of spontaneous circulation , and that CPP was predictive of ROSC.
Obesity now affects approximately one third of Americans and is associated with many comorbidities, including an increased risk of death from cardiovascular disease, diabetes, and cancer. The rapid increase in obesity and its sequelae is a worldwide phenomenon. Although current non surgical treatments of obesity remain inadequate, it is generally accepted that weight loss can be achieved through caloric restriction and enhanced physical activity.
When will computers beat humans in protein structure prediction? Or are there still any human insights that cannot be reproduced in automated approaches? During the CASP experiments, several groups  demonstrated that the interventions by human experts, who made use of biochemical information , can indeed help with template recognition, structural assembly, and final model selection.
Impaired social interaction is one of the three core symptoms of the Autism Spectrum Disorders  . This impairment has been attributed to a dysfunction of the human mirror neuron system , which is thought to play a central role in our ability to perceive the intentions and goals of others . Accurate perception and interpretation of an observed movement requires the ability to distinguish it from other movements by representing it with a unique neural response.
Ceruloplasmin  is a 151 kDa glycoprotein that is predominantly synthesized in the liver . Ceruloplasmin transports over 95% of the body’s copper, an essential cofactor for cytochromes and enzymes. Over the past decades, Cp became increasingly recognized as a multi functional metalloprotein besides maintaining copper homeostasis.
Glioblastoma multiforme or GBM is the most common form of human primary malignant brain tumors . Understanding molecular mechanisms underpinning the highly invasive properties of GBM has significant basic and clinical implications . It was found that Akt is activated in a great majority  of the GBM cases , and along with inactivation of p53 and Rb pathways represents one of the three major molecular mechanisms of gliomagenesis.
Mild cognitive impairment , considered to be the earliest detectable form of Alzheimer’s disease , converts to AD at the annual rate of 1015% . Post translational modification of brain proteins, specifically nitration, is reported in both MCI and late stage AD . Protein nitration is an important oxidative modification in neurodegenerative disease .
Formaldehyde and goods containing this chemical reportedly account for more than 5% of the yearly US Gross National Product , which is about $500 billion. A significantly greater number of people are exposed to lower levels of formaldehyde in the environment, as it is generated by automobile engines , is present in tobacco smoke, and is released from various household products such as plywood, particleboard, furniture and carpeting  . Recently, the International Agency for Research on Cancer  classified formaldehyde as a known human carcinogen  based on “sufficient epidemiological evidence that formaldehyde causes nasopharyngeal cancer in humans” .
Leptin is an adipocyte derived hormone which controls feeding behavior through specific receptors within the hypothalamus . Additionally, leptin has important physiological roles in the control of fat storage or mobilization, the reproductive system, the immune system, bone homeostasis, antioxidant defense , insulin sensitivity , and neuronal activity and/or protection . Direct injection of leptin into the hippocampus of rodents can improve memory processing and modulate long term potentiation and synaptic plasticity  .
Health care associated infections  represent 5% of all adverse events in hospitalized patients in the US. Approximately one third of HAI related deaths are attributable to bloodstream infections , the majority of which are central line associated bloodstream infections . CLABSIs result in increased mortality, morbidity, hospital length of stay and cost.
Cytochrome P450  comprises a superfamily of enzymes and plays an important role in the oxidative metabolism of a large number of endogenous and exogenous compounds . CYP3A4 is the most abundant P450 enzyme in human livers and is involved in metabolism of > 50% of marketed drugs . Low drug clearances mediated by impaired CYP3A4 would invoke unexpected side effects or drug interactions with co administered food or medicines.
CD8+ T cells are an important component of the immune response to both intracellular pathogens and tumors due to their ability to recognize and eliminate individual cells expressing the target antigen. The magnitude of the CD8+ T cell response has been correlated with control of acute infections  and tumor progression  as well as the level of memory T cells that remain in the host following immunization or infection . In the case of tumor antigens, several reports indicate that direct presentation by tumor cells localized to the lymphoid organs can induce T cell activation directly .
Adverse remodeling of the left ventricle  following myocardial infarction  is a significant cause of congestive heart failure. While short term post MI survival has dramatically improved over the past decades, there remains a need to develop therapeutic strategies to limit or prevent the progression to heart failure. The extracellular matrix  is a key regulator of LV remodeling, and the matrix metalloproteinases  are a key family of proteases that modulate the ECM response.
Mexicans are the largest group of immigrants in the U.S. They encounter problems with accessing health care services due to a lack of health insurance and accessible providers, language and cultural barriers, immigration status, and inadequate information . A review of studies on migration for health care across the three NAFTA countries  found that U.S. residents seek health care, dental care and pharmaceuticals in Mexico primarily because those services cost less in Mexico than in the U.S.  California Health Interview Survey 2001 data were analyzed for medical care, dental care, and/or prescription drug purchases in Mexico in the previous year.
The availability of multiple drugs specific for HER 2  has revolutionized the treatment of HER 2+ metastatic breast cancer  . However, not all patients benefit and survival gains could be further enhanced. Innovative therapies that complement and synergize with these drugs are urgently needed to improve disease outcomes .
Hormonal end products of the HypothalamicPituitaryAdrenal  and HypothalamicPituitaryGonadal  axes share many of the same properties, including similar  circadian rhythm profiles characterized by a general decline across the daytime hours . Furthermore, these two axes are highly interactive, with empirical evidence in adults and animal studies indicating that increased activity in one axis suppresses activity in the other axis . The field has begun to acknowledge the benefits of examining multi system interactions given that various systems within the body work in concert, not in isolation .
Research over the past 20 years has shown that methadone maintenance reduces opioid use and is an effective HIV risk reduction intervention ,,,,,,,. Further, significantly lower rates of opioid use have been observed when patients with regular methadone program attendance are compared to those with poor attendance , and when patients receiving minimal ancillary services are compared to those receiving more intensive services ,  . Consistent with these reductions in opioid use, methadone maintenance markedly reduces opioid injection and needle sharing.
We recently reported that high levels of multiple sex and growth hormones were associated with increased postmenopausal breast cancer risk. Limited research has explored the relationship between reproductive, anthropometric, and lifestyle factors and levels of multiple hormones simultaneously . This cross sectional analysis included 738 postmenopausal Nurses' Health Study participants who were controls in a breast cancer nested case control study and had measured levels of estrone, estradiol, estrone sulfate, testosterone, androstenedione, dehydroepiandrosterone sulfate, prolactin and sex hormone binding globulin .
The PAQR family of proteins is composed of integral membrane receptors for a diverse array of agonist ligands . There are 11 human PAQRs that can be grouped into three main classes based onsequence comparisons . Class I  includes two receptors—AdipoR1/PAQR1 and AdipoR2/PAQR2—for the adipose derived hormone, adiponectin .
Since its designation as a cytokine by Kim and colleagues in 2005 , considerable progress has been made with elucidating the properties of the unusual cytokine IL 32. Structurally, IL 32 does not share similarities with known cytokine families . A receptor for IL 32 is currently unknown, although ligand affinity column assays have shown that IL 32 can bind to neutrophil proteinase 3 , and that subsequent processing alters the biological activity of IL 32α and IL 32γ  .
The inner mitochondrial membrane uncoupling proteins  are suggested to regulate the proton gradient over the inner mitochondrial membrane, thereby regulating mitochondrial ATP production and/or mitochondrial reactive oxygen species production . Despite its homology to the well characterized brown adipose tissue specific UCP1, the exact mechanism and physiological function for the skeletal and cardiac muscle variant UCP3 have not been revealed. UCP3 is mainly expressed in skeletal and cardiac muscle.
Heart failure  is a serious and costly cardiovascular disorder, but its natural history can be modified by appropriate, sustained drug therapy. Lifelong adherence to prescribed medications is an important determinant of optimal health outcomes. A significant portion of the healthcare advice and prescriptions dispensed at HF medical encounters was not fully implemented due to nonadherence.
Cervical cancer disparities persist in the predominantly Hispanic population in South Texas. Cervical cancer incidence is higher among women in South Texas compared to women in the rest of Texas , and both are higher than the incidence nationwide  . The vaccine currently is recommended for girls/boys and young women/men aged 1126 .
Protein kinase B or Akt, is a serine/threonine kinase, which in mammals comprises three highly homologous members known as PKB alpha , PKB beta  and PKB gamma   . Forced membrane localization of Akt through its myristoylation/palmitylation is sufficient for maximal phosphorylation of key aminoacids and in turn for its full activation. The activity of this plasma membrane targeted Akt chimera  is 60 fold higher compared with the unstimulated wild type enzyme  and it is widely utilized in studying the effects of Akt in several signal transduction pathways  .
Chlamydia trachomatis is an obligate intracellular bacterial pathogen and the etiologic agent of blinding trachoma, the world’s leading cause of infectious blindness. Despite its benefits, there is debate on its overall effectiveness and sustainability . An alternative strategy for trachoma control is vaccination .
In breast cancer, mortality results not from tumor growth per se, but from the tumor invading through normal tissue boundaries and metastasizing to distant sites. EMT provides a pathway by which cancerous layers of epithelial cells  can dissociate and become motile, leading to invasion through the basement membrane into blood vessels or lymphatics, and metastatic spread. As such, targeting EMT represents an important new therapeutic strategy for the prevention or treatment of breast cancer .
Older persons who refuse assistance to address problems in performing instrumental activities of daily living , as in cases of self neglect, present clinicians with ethical and clinical challenges. In these situations, clinicians need to assess the person’s capacity to make a decision. This assessment may have substantial clinical implications that may include partial or complete conservatorship or guardianship .
Cardiovascular diseases are among the most significant health problems in the United States today, with hypertension affecting African Americans  disproportionately. Blood pressure  and hypertension have been challenging phenotypes for gene discovery due to their complex nature. Although genome wide association studies  have successfully identified thousands of loci affecting human complex diseases, these identified loci only explain small proportions of heritability.
The alcohol deprivation effect  is defined as a temporary increase in the voluntary intake of ethanol solutions and the ratio of ethanol/total fluid intake over baseline drinking conditions, when ethanol is returned following a period of alcohol deprivation . Repeated experience of alcohol withdrawal has been postulated to increase the vulnerability and susceptibility of future withdrawal episodes . Therefore, it is possible that the neurobiological adaptations associated with repeated periods of alcohol exposure and abstinence may increase the hyperexcitability of the central nervous system , and enhance both the withdrawal and stimulating effects of ethanol  .
Integration into the host chromosome of the double stranded DNA product of reverse transcription is an essential step in the life cycle of human immunodeficiency virus type 1  . This process is facilitated by integrase , a 32 kDa virally encoded enzyme. Following reverse transcription, HIV 1 IN, along with other viral and cellular proteins, binds to specific sequences in the long terminal repeats  of the viral cDNA to form the pre integration complex.
Melanoma is the sixth most common cancer, and the malignancy with the highest rise in incidence over the past decades, with an estimated 62,480 new cases and 8,420 deaths in the United States in 2008 . The increase in mortality from melanoma is believed to be partially due to an increase in incidence, but also due to the limited efficacy of current treatment regimens for unresectable melanoma, which induce responses in a mere 1020% of patients. The mutations typically involve a substitution of glutamate to a valine at position 600  .
Alveolar Soft Part Sarcoma  is an extremely rare soft tissue sarcoma affecting primarily young children and adolescents . This slow growing neoplasm is believed resistant to existing chemotherapeutic agents and radiation, limiting treatment primarily to surgical resection of the tumor. ASPS exhibits a unique histopathology which is the basis for clinical diagnosis.
Trypanosoma cruzi is the etiologic agent of Chagas disease, a major cause of heart disease in endemic areas of Latin America. Acute T. cruzi infection is accompanied by an intense inflammatory reaction in many tissues including the heart. The synthesis of NO is mediated by nitric oxide synthase .
Blood vessel formation is a dynamic and complex process that serves a vital role in both health and disease. A host of reports have implied that endothelial cells and mural cells are closely associated, and the interactions between them are required for the regulation of vessel formation, stabilization, remodeling and function in vivo and in vitro. Endothelial cell secreted PDGF B is known to be necessary for the recruitment of pericytes to newly formed vessels through PDGFR β.  Notch3 /  mice were a generous gift from Dr. Tom Gridley.
Standardization of visual acuity measurement is essential for accurate monitoring of the response to treatment in individual patients and in clinical trials. By consensus of experts, the Early Treatment for Diabetic Retinopathy  logMAR charts have become the gold standard for adult visual acuity testing. More recently, a computerized version of ETDRS that uses crowded, isolated letters was developed; the new Electronic ETDRS  has high test retest reliability and good agreement with ETDRS chart in adults and in children aged 712 years.
The role of estrogen and progesterone in the development of epithelial ovarian cancer is poorly understood. Several reproductive hormonal factors , parity, and breastfeeding) are associated with decreased risk of ovarian cancer; while prolonged postmenopausal hormone  use, particularly estrogen only, increases risk . The effect of lifestyle factors, including diet and physical activity are unclear  .
Successful recollection engages a network of brain regions that includes the hippocampus, left posterior parietal cortex, medial prefrontal cortex , parahippocampal cortex, and retrosplenial/posterior cingulate cortex. These regions appear to be engaged regardless of the nature of the study and test materials employed or the type of retrieval test . In a previous study , we evaluated whether recollection related activity in different regions of the network differed in their sensitivity to the duration of an interval over which recollected information was to be maintained.
Temporal cortex lies in a posteroventral portion of the neocortex, and it is heavily involved in auditory and visual processing in most mammals. In squirrels, three distinct divisions of temporal cortex were previously described by . Also, the inner and outer bands of Baillarger are densely myelinated.
Isocyanates , highly reactive chemical compounds essential to polyurethane production, are used to make a variety of foams, adhesives, coatings, and elastomers, and are well known to cause occupational asthma . Although isocyanates remain one of the most commonly reported causes of occupational asthma , the prevalence, incidence, and risk factors for development of isocyanate asthma under current work conditions are not well defined, as there have been few recent epidemiology studies of isocyanate exposed workers, despite the increasing use of polyurethane products in numerous industries . More recent studies have largely been limited to cross sectional studies of end users such as spray painters, rather than factory workers producing polyurethane products .
Cardiac diseases and arrhythmias are common with aging and at least partly linked to increasing cardiac electrophysiological and autonomic dysfunction., Heart rate variability  provides indices related to cardiac electrophysiology and autonomic regulation, including respiratory, baroreflex, and circadian fluctuations, that are indicative of healthier responses. With advancing age, increased HRV can also reflect abnormal  sinus patterns that are associated with increased risk. However, several key issues remain to be addressed in older adults, who are at much higher risk for both abnormal HRV and cardiac events than middle aged populations.
Heart disease is the leading cause of death in the U.S.  High levels of low density lipoprotein , high blood pressure, and diabetes mellitus are major modifiable risk factors of heart disease. The Hispanic population is the most rapidly growing segment in the U.S., making up 15% of the total population in 2008 with estimated increase to 30% by 2050. Over half  of the Hispanic population in 2007 were of Mexican origin.
Werner Syndrome  is a rare autosomal recessive genetic disease characterized by increased cancer and early onset or increased frequency of specific age related phenotypes, including graying and loss of hair, osteoporosis, and diabetes mellitus type II . Although their precise DNA metabolic roles are still unclear, germ line defects in three of the five human known RecQ helicases are associated with hereditable disease, as defects in WRN, BLM or RECQ4 result in Werner, Bloom or Rothmund Thomson syndrome, respectively. WRN possesses four DNA binding regions: the helicase, RQC, HRDC and exonuclease domains that, together, appear to confer specificity for particular DNA structures .
The adipokine Leptin regulates appetite and food consumption through central nervous system mechanisms, but it is increasingly recognized that leptin also exerts a broad range of actions on peripheral organs, including the cardiovascular system. Increasing evidence indicates that leptin influences cardiac remodeling, although it remains unclear whether the net effect is cardioprotective versus adverse. Some studies indicated direct hypertrophic effects of leptin on isolated ventricular rat cardiomyocytes, whereas other animal models suggest that leptin is essential for maintaining normal cardiac structure.
Lipid molecules play a key role in cell biology. Recently, we have reported the discovery of block liposomes  in a model in vitro system. Cryo TEM has identified diblocks  and triblocks  consisting of nanoscale tubules  connected to spherical vesicles as well as diblocks  consisting of rods  connected to spherical vesicles.
Alcohol  abuse and alcoholism are serious public health concerns throughout the world. Alcoholism is the second most prevalent axis I diagnosis among individuals aged 1544 , and is one of the most highly heritable addictive disorders . More than 18 million Americans  have been estimated to meet the diagnostic criteria of alcohol abuse or dependence .
Prostate to bone metastases induce mixed lesions containing areas of extensive bone destruction  and formation  that are mitigated by the principal cells of the bone, osteoclasts and osteoblasts respectively . The high jacking of the normal bone remodeling process by the metastatic prostate cancer cells results in an increase in growth factors and cytokines that subsequently can stimulate tumor growth thus generating what has been referred to as a ‘vicious cycle’ . Therefore, understanding the molecular mechanisms that facilitate the interaction between the multiple cell types in the tumor bone microenvironment can provide new targets for therapies that will be effective in controlling and/or curing prostate to bone metastases .
Erectile dysfunction  affects approximately 18 million men aged 20 years or older in the US. Projections from US prevalence data indicate that by 2025, over 300 million men worldwide will have ED. The relationship between ED and cardiovascular disease  has received substantial attention.
Obesity is a major public health concern. Poor diet and inactivity are two of the greatest contributors to United States  deaths. To be effective, initiatives such as MyPyrimid.gov, Dietary Guidelines for Americans, Nutrition Facts Panels, and point of purchase restaurant labeling, require that the public understands concepts such as  what a calorie is,  where calories are found and  how many calories a person needs.
The Thai RV144 phase III vaccine trial demonstrated for the first time that a vaccine can prevent HIV infection . Subsequent clinical trials are underway to improve on the modest  efficacy of the RV144 vaccine with the potential to achieve a licensable product . Decade long delays in successful implementation of Hepatitis B vaccines  and ongoing obstacles in HPV vaccine roll out with low coverage in young women  and young men   suggest the importance of an implementation science approach to prepare for the effective translation of future HIV vaccines from clinical trials into routine practice .
The matrix metalloproteinases  are a family of enzymes that are involved in proteolytic processing of interstitial structural proteins, signaling molecules and growth factors. For example, increased MMP levels within the myocardium have been demonstrated in animal models of ischemia and reperfusion and heart failure. Using transgenic and pharmacological approaches, modifying MMP expression and activity has been shown to directly effect myocardial structure and function.
Inverted urothelial papilloma  is an uncommon urothelial neoplasm  with a generally accepted benign clinical course and a distinctive histomorphology. Periodic reports have linked rare cases of IUP with recurrence , as well as synchronous  and/or metachronous  urothelial carcinomas   leading to ambiguity with regards to the biologic potential of IUP; however, several recent studies have not shown an increased risk of UCA  . A limited number of IUP studies using single gene based assays have identified mutations in FGFR3, in 9.8% to 45% of cases .
Hepatitis C virus  is a RNA virus that currently infects over 150 million people across the world. Since human immunodeficiency virus  and HCV share similar routes of transmission, such as exposure to contaminated blood and sexual activity, approximately 25% of HIV infected persons are co infected with HCV, which is much higher than the HCV prevalence in the general world population. HIV/HCV co infection has been shown to decrease the probability of spontaneous HCV clearance and increase the rate of progression to cirrhosis, decompensated liver disease, hepatocellular carcinoma, and death .
Low dose spiral computed tomography  scans have been introduced as a way to detect lung cancers at an earlier, potentially more curable, stage of disease . CT scans have been shown to improve detection of smaller chest nodules, increasing early detection of lung cancer , , . The largest randomized trial of CT scanning for lung cancer, the National Lung Cancer Screening Trial  found a 21% decrease in lung cancer mortality and a 7% decrease in all cause mortality in those getting CT scans compared to the chest radiography group .
The use of blood contacting medical devices for treatment of cardiovascular disease leads to the activation of factors in response to materials that initiate blood coagulation and thrombosis. It is widely believed that the intrinsic coagulation cascade has little physiological significance and that the extrinsic cascade is the predominant pathway of coagulation in vivo . The intrinsic pathway is thought to be initiated by the “binding” of coagulation factor XII  to the negatively charged surface via “specific interactions” .
Roughening of the metal counterface is responsible for substantial increase of wear rate in metal on polyethylene total joint replacements . This arguably is the cause of much of the variability in wear rates and wear directions seen among individual patients within study cohorts . This has prompted several groups to study scratch patterns, toward a more definitive determinant of wear acceleration propensity ,,.
Increases in synaptic dopamine concentrations resulting from direct inhibition of the dopamine transporter  by cocaine have profound effects on the neurochemistry of dopaminergic synapses and account for a variety of cocaine induced behaviors. Our previous results indicate that the frequency, duration and pattern of cocaine administration are critical factors affecting the cellular responses to repeated cocaine administration . The dynamins are a class of GTPase mechanoenzymes that are centrally involved in endocytosis and receptor trafficking .
Fluoroquinolone  antibiotics were introduced in the mid 1980s and have been widely used against various infectious diseases including urinary tract infections . Both chromosomally mediated and plasmid mediated FQ resistance emerged rapidly and have since progressed. The increasing prevalence of FQ resistance among uropathogens in hospitals and long term care facilities  is a threat to the use of FQs as empirical therapy for UTI.
Fragile X associated tremor/ataxia syndrome  is seen in a subgroup of older adults who are carriers of premutation alleles  of the fragile X mental retardation 1  gene . The pathogenesis of FXTAS results from the direct neural cell toxicity of elevated levels of the expanded CGG repeat FMR1 mRNA , which leads to protein dysregulation . FXTAS also includes neuropathy, usually featuring pain in the lower extremities, and autonomic dysfunction in the majority of patients  .
Many game theoretical models have been developed to examine how animal contests are resolved. These models fall into one of two main categories based on the type of assessment that occurs during the contest: mutual  or self assessment. Empirical studies have supported several of these models  .
Inhibition of poly polymerase  has emerged as a promising drug strategy for the treatment of cancers mutated for BRCA1/2 because of its ability to selectively kill cells through synthetic lethality . More recently, PARP inhibitors have been shown to be effective in cells with defects in other genes involved in homologous recombination  and the DNA damage response suggesting that PARP inhibitors may be effective in treating a wider range of tumours that do not have BRCA mutations . In humans, the core mitotic complex consists of four subunits: SMC1A, SMC3, RAD21  and one of two possible stromal antigen proteins .
Human respiratory syncytial virus  is a major cause of viral bronchiolitis in infants, young children, elderly, and immune compromised patients. During 1960s, a formalin inactivated RSV vaccine  administered to children resulted in approximately 80% hospitalization and two deaths during next epidemic winter season, causing vaccine related enhanced RSV disease   . Despite the extensive endeavor to develop RSV vaccines, there is no licensed RSV vaccine .
The availability of allogeneic hematopoietic cell transplant  has expanded with the development of lower dose nonmyeloablative conditioning regimens, which depend on achieving a delicate balance between recipient and donor cells to obtain immunosuppression of the recipient, optimal anti tumor effect, and minimal toxicity. There is considerable variability in the clinical outcomes of these patients. Some of the interpatient variability in clinical outcomes could, in part, reflect differences in each recipient’s sensitivity to MMF.
During conditions of increased glutamate release such as seizures, group I metabotropic glutamate receptors  activate many second messenger pathways that may contribute to epileptogenesis . Exposure to the group I mGluR agonist 3,5 dihyroxyphenylglycine  results in the induction of epileptiform discharges in hippocampal slices that persist for hours after DHPG is removed . The epileptiform activity includes brief interictal discharges and longer  synchronous activity that resembles ictal activity.
Acne vulgaris is the most common disorder of human skin that affects up to 80% of individuals in their lives . propionibacterium acnes  is a Gram positive anaerobic bacterium that mostly resides in the pilosebaceous follicles of the skin. Genomic analysis of P. acnes has shown a variety of P. acnes pathogenicity .
Injection drug users  are often afflicted by serious health hazards, including overdose, blood borne diseases , and soft tissue infections. Abscesses, as defined in this study, are subcutaneous masses, filled with pus and debris, resulting from one’s bodily defenses against an outside infectious agent. Although treatment of uncomplicated abscesses can be relatively easy, large metropolitan counties and hospitals have been particularly burdened by the relatively high prevalence of soft tissue infections among IDUs, often a result of delayed treatment  .
Rubella virus, a member of the Togaviridae family, typically causes a relatively benign illness, although arthritis and arthralgia have been observed in adults. Less frequent complications include both encephalitis and thrombocytopenia. Infection during pregnancy, especially early in pregnancy, can cause congenital rubella syndrome , leading to devastating fetal abnormalities.
Resting state functional magnetic resonance imaging  measures spontaneous low frequency fluctuations in the blood oxygen level dependent  signal that is correlated with intrinsic neuronal signaling . Considering the intrinsic neuronal signaling accounts for a large proportion of brain activity, the study of these spontaneous fluctuations has enabled systematical delineation of the functional brain architecture  and the examination of whether the functional architecture of intrinsic activity is altered in neurological and psychiatric conditions  and mild cognitive impairment  , and Schizophrenia  ). Several review articles  have provided extensive surveys of relevant studies.
Face perception is argued to be “special” in part on the basis of behavioral effects that distinguish it from the perception of objects. For instance, face perception suffers more than object perception when images are turned upside down  and selective attention to half of a face is easier when face halves are aligned than misaligned, a composite effect  that is not observed for non face objects. Resolving this debate is important for the study of perception and memory.
Cancer cells in a primary tumor are adept at exploiting their local tissue microenvironment. By contrast, when metastatic cells leave these favorable surroundings, they must possess or acquire traits to enable survival and colonization of potentially hostile tissue environments, .
