Application of this approach requires a unique marker that allows transplanted hepatic progenitors to be distinguished from host liver cells, a requirement satisfied by Thompson et al. with the discovery of a mutant strain of F344 rats lacking an enzymatically active form of the cell surface exoprotease, dipeptidyl peptidase IV  . This DPPIV model system has since been used in large numbers of investigations in the rat aimed at demonstrating the ability of progenitor cells from the liver, pancreas, and bone marrow to undergo hepatocytic or ductal differentiation  .
The clinical management of melanoma is evolving rapidly due to improved understanding of the molecular drivers of this disease. Recurrent point mutations affecting residues G12, G13, and Q61 of NRAS are the second most common activating event in melanoma . Previous studies have demonstrated that NRAS mutations are essentially mutually exclusive with BRAFV600 mutations, likely due to the fact that they also activate signaling through RAS RAF MAPK.
Neoadjuvant chemotherapy  is the standard of care to downstage inoperable cancers, and it is increasingly being used for operable cancers to facilitate better outcomes in breast conserving surgery . MRI may either overestimate or underestimate the residual disease . Knowing which factors may influence the diagnostic accuracy will provide important information to assist in choosing the optimal subsequent management procedures for patients undergoing NAC .
One of the central functions of the visual system is to recognize objects. Crowding is a striking example where this fails. In the second “feature integration” stage, the registered features are pooled together for object recognition.
A growing number of children who are deaf are receiving bilateral cochlear implants , in an attempt to provide them with acoustic cues that are known to be important for spatial hearing. The benefits of BICI in adults are well documented. When both cochlear implants  are activated compared with when a single CI is used there appear to be significant improvements in the ability of adult patients to understand speech in noise , and to localize sounds .
Subchondral cysts are deeply related to the pathogenesis of osteoarthritis , but the factors contributing to cyst formation are not well known. A three dimensional analysis of subchondral cysts at the micro structural level was conducted using high resolution peripheral quantitative CT , and their relationships with cartilage attrition and subchondral bone microstructure were investigated . Femoral heads extracted from ten female patients with hip OA were scanned using HR pQCT at a voxel size of 41 μm.
Prostate cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer death among men in the United States, with an anticipated 186,320 newly diagnosed cases and 28,660 deaths in 2008 . The majority of men with clinically localized PCa are treated with radical prostatectomy , which provides excellent cancer control . However, there is no consensus regarding the optimal management of locally advanced PCa .
Implementation of evidence based practices  in community based treatment settings is both challenging and complex . In particular, delivery of evidence based care in racial and ethnic minority communities is an important element in reducing health disparities . Organizational research in this area has explored outer context factors, such as funding support and regulatory expectations  affecting evidence based care; few studies have explored the intersection of the outer context with internal factors in SAT organizations such as leadership , staff readiness for change , and provider attitudes about EBPs .
Caring for stroke survivors can be burdensome for their informal caregivers, with additional burden perceived when caring for stroke survivors with emotional problems . Although there is extensive literature evaluating caregiver burden and benefit in stroke patients  there has been little comparison of informal caregiver burden across cultures for any chronic condition . In Korea, Confucian ideology places the eldest male at the head of the family, receiving loyalty from his offspring.
Obstructive sleep apnea  and hyperaldosteronism are very common in subjects with resistant hypertension. We hypothesized that aldosterone mediated chronic fluid retention may influence OSA severity in patients with resistant hypertension. We tested this in an open label evaluation by assessing the changes in the severity of OSA in patients with resistant hypertension following treatment with spironolactone .
2,4,6 Trichlorophenol , a major environmental pollutant, has been used extensively as a preservative and a biocide . A gene cluster, tcpRXABCYD, is involved in TCP degradation , and all the encoded proteins have been characterized except TcpY . Second, TcpB  reduces the quinone to 6 chloro 2 hydroxy p hydroquinone .
Modern India is a country of great diversity at many levels: cultural, linguistic and genetic . One outstanding feature of Indian society is its organization around the Hindu caste system, which is observed by almost 80% of the population and forms one of the world's longest surviving social hierarchies. This system is based on the division of society into four broad castes, each originally linked to a specific social occupation: Brahmins, the priests; Kshatriyas, the warriors; Vaishyas, the farmers, merchants and businessmen; Sudras, the servants and workers.
Users of marijuana and cannabinoid  related substances often experience a compulsive craving for food. The appetite stimulating effects of cannabinoids, CBs, have been known for centuries. Currently, there are two well characterized CB Rs with known splice variants: CB1 Rs and CB2 Rs.
In the United States, 459 children died from pedestrian injuries in 2010 and another 215,188 were treated in emergency departments following pedestrian injuries . Global data are less precise, but estimates exceed 30,000 child pedestrians killed annually worldwide . Strategies to reduce child pedestrian injuries and deaths are urgently needed .
Despite increasing demand for clinical interventions into sexual problems in an aging population, epidemiological data on the subject are scarce . Statistical analysis of data from the 20052006 National Social Life, Health, and Aging Project , a nationally representative U.S. probability sample of 1,550 women and 1,455 men aged 5785 at the time of interview . Likelihood of experiencing sexual dysfunction in the preceding 12 months .
Voltage gated sodium channels  are transmembrane glycoproteins that underlie the rapid upstroke of action potentials  in excitable tissues such as the heart, skeletal muscle and brain. Mendelian inherited mutations in Nav channels result in diseases of excitability such as myotonias, paralyses, cardiac arrhythmias, and ataxias and seizure disorders . The transmembrane portion of the α subunit is formed by four homologous domains , each containing six membrane spanning helices  that form the ion selective pore and contain the activation voltage sensors.
According to the American Cancer Society, over 23,000 new cases of brain and other nervous system tumors will be diagnosed in 2013 in the United States . High grade gliomas, such as anaplastic astrocytoma and glioblastoma multiforme , account for approximately 38% of primary brain tumors, and to date, treatment options have remained limited. Following optimal surgical debulking, radiation therapy alone has been shown to increase mean survival time of GBM patients from approximately six months to only one year .
One of the major routes of pathogen exposure in humans occurs through the oral cavity, . The majority of these peptides that have activity against bacteria and fungi are small , cationic, and amphiphilic. Originally isolated from myeloid neutrophil cells in the 1980’s, these peptides are commonly referred to as human neutrophil peptides, .
Breast magnetic resonance imaging  is the most sensitive modality for detecting breast cancer, often identifying malignancy otherwise occult by mammography, ultrasound, and clinical breast examination . To facilitate consistent reporting of and management recommendations for breast MRI findings, the American College of Radiology published the first edition of the Breast Imaging Reporting and Data System  MRI lexicon in 2003, with the most recently revised edition published in 2013 . Standardized use of the lexicon and BI RADS assessment categories allows for improved communication among radiologists and clinicians with regards to suspicious imaging findings and clinical recommendations .
Periventricular leukomalacia , the predominant pathological substrate underlying cerebral palsy and potentially cognitive deficits in long term survivors of prematurity, is a lesion of the immature cerebral white matter typically associated with cerebral hypoxia ischemia with additional contribution from maternofetal infection in some cases . Pathologically, the PVL lesion is composed of a focally necrotic component in the deep periventricular white matter that is characterized by macrophages and axonal spheroids as well as a diffuse component in the surrounding white matter characterized by reactive astrogliosis and activated microglia. Evidence suggests that there is damage to pre OLs in the diffuse component  which likely results in the myelin deficits in long term survivors of PVL .
The nature of the relationship between exposure to sexual content in the media and adolescent sexual development has not been clearly established. The amount of time in that Youth use media almost 6.5 hours an average day . Thus the media are clearly a considerable presence in their lives and sexual content in television is well documented  although there are conflicting views about change over time .
The development of pulmonary hypertension  is multi factorial with genetic background and environmental stress being two critical components. Lungs are open to the environment and are susceptible to cold air stimulation. In the US, cold weather is associated with increased mortality from pulmonary and cardiovascular diseases., Cold exposure causes pulmonary vasospasm in patients with Raynaud’s phenomenon.
The androgen receptor  is a member of the nuclear hormone receptor  superfamily, which consists of a large group of ligand regulated transcription factors . AR is expressed in many tissues and influences an enormous range of physiologic processes such as cognition, muscle hypertrophy, bone density, and prostate growth and differentiation . AR is thus the major therapeutic target for this malignancy  .
Retrieving a word from memory has consequences for later retrieval. This phenomenon, known as repetition priming, can be explained by the fact that each retrieval event is also a learning event, and so the second retrieval benefits from the learning that occurred the first time . Somewhat less well known is the fact that repetition priming has a “dark side”.
An emerging hallmark of cancer is the “metabolic transformation” that occurs to accommodate the needs of a proliferating population of cells . Cancer cells also need essential amino acids that mammalian cells cannot synthesize. Cells grown in culture are provided with media that is supplemented with glucose, essential amino acids, and glutamine as nutrients for cell growth.
Experimental data obtained thus far have demonstrated the existence of ionizing radiation induced “bystander effects”  in diverse eukaryotic cell systems. BE can be induced both by low  and high linear energy transfer  radiations. Using microbeam irradiation, micronuclei  induction , mutations  and oncogenic transformation  have been observed in bystander cells.
Fall school openings have been consistently associated with an increase in the transmission of respiratory agents, including occasionally influenza . It is difficult to measure the contribution of schools to influenza transmission in a community. School holidays and other closures have been used to estimate the impact of closing schools on reducing seasonal influenza transmission .
Brain derived neurotrophic factor  and its specific receptor TrkB are critically involved in neural development and synaptic plasticity . BDNF release depends on neuronal activity . The effect of BDNF is generally believed to be mediated by the activation of TrkB receptors.
Treatment options and therapeutic guidelines have evolved substantially since highly active antiretroviral treatment  became the standard of HIV care in 1996. We conducted the present population based analysis to characterize the determinants of direct costs of HAART over time in British Columbia , Canada . We considered individuals ever receiving HAART in BC from 19962011.
Molecular chaperones are a family of cellular proteins that assist polypeptides with correct assembly and disassembly. There are several classes of molecular chaperones, including chaperonins and heat shock proteins . HSPs have both intracellular and extracellular functions.
The mammalian pancreas is a mixed gland composed of two distinct tissues, exocrine and endocrine. The endocrine portion of the pancreas supplies insulin to the entire body and the exocrine portion produces various enzymes required for the digestion of food. Morphogenesis of the mouse pancreas begins with the formation of two buds, respectively positioned on the dorsal and ventral side of the posterior foregut; these buds are clearly visible at about embryonic day  10.5, and subsequently fuse into a single organ upon rotation of the gut.
Non human primate embryos are increasingly regarded as valuable translational models for human health, including studies on infertility and embryonic stem cells. However, only a few centres have the capability to produce monkey embryos, both because of the need to maintain substantial numbers of expensive animals and the requirement for special expertise and facilities required to generate embryos by IVF. Numerous other research laboratories might benefit from studying monkey embryos but lack one or both of these essential requirements.
Aromatase inhibitors  have become the choice for first line hormonal therapy ofestrogen receptor alpha  positive breast cancer in postmenopausal women. However, many patients are initially refractory or acquire resistance to AI treatment. The mechanisms responsible for the development of resistance remain poorly defined.
Altered chromatin architecture is thought to sometimes spread along a chromosome causing epigenetic changes to the genes located in the affected region . In addition to the MSL proteins, the dosage compensation complex contains noncoding roX RNAs . Male viability can be restored by providing roX RNA from an autosomal transgene demonstrating that the MSL complex can locate the X in trans .
Natural IgM is a critical mediator of innate immune protection. Indeed, IgM antibody against viruses, bacteria, and fungi is readily detectable in the circulation of unimmunized mice, and is highly efficient in activating complement and sequestering antigen in secondary lymphoid organs . These functions not only control the early spread of pathogens directly, but also promote the initiation of T dependent humoral responses  .
Acute kidney injury , as defined by a wide range of serum creatinine increments, is a consistent and powerful predictor of in hospital mortality, and is associated with an increase in length of stay at hospital, hospital costs, and posthospitalization resource utilization. , The limited oxygen supply to renal tissue renders the kidney susceptible to hypoxia, particularly the medulla, and has been long recognized as an important factor in the pathogenesis of AKI. Hypoxia inducible factor 1a  is the major transcription factor that mediates cellular responses to tissue hypoxia.
Chronic Helicobacter infections are found in over 50% of the adult population in the U.S. and up to 90% of the developing world population . Recent studies associated other Helicobacter species with liver and colonic diseases including ulcerative colitis, inflammatory bowel disease and Crohn's disease . Similar to human diseases, Helicobacter hepaticus frequently remains undetected but can cause hepatitis in addition to the above mentioned diseases  .
In 1980, the World Health Organization declared that smallpox had been eradicated . Vaccination against smallpox is currently restricted because of the risk of adverse side effects , due in part to the higher percentage of first time vaccinees, an increase in the number of individuals with compromised immune systems, and contraindications for those with heart disease . Recently, several compounds have been identified that inhibit various steps in poxvirus infection, including virion morphogenesis  and DNA synthesis .
Although the nucleotide sequences of mouse and human fortilins, also known as p21 and translationally controlled tumor protein , were reported in 1988 and 1999, their role in apoptosis regulation has been unknown. Fortilin proved to be a molecule that interacts specifically with MCL1 . Since MCL1 is a well characterized anti apoptotic molecule , we reasoned that fortilin—a protein partner of MCL1—is also involved in apoptosis regulation.
FTLD is amongst the most prevalent neurodegenerative dementias after Alzheimer's. Symptomatology includes pronounced behavioral changes with altered motivation, personality and/or language function, with pathology in the frontal and temporal lobes . A genome wide association study of FTLD TDP risk demonstrated linkage with polymorphisms near the TMEM106B locus .
The similarities between the rhesus macaque brain and its human counterpart have lead to use of the former in studies of neurological disorders and their treatment . Due to the serial nature and high cost of these studies, non invasive modalities: MRI for morphology or function and proton MR spectroscopy  for metabolism, are often favored. Metabolic quantification requires knowledge of several parameters that influence the 1H MRS signal.
The cardiovascular manifestations of acute neurological events have been well documented . Several ECG abnormalities have been reported in patients following acute cerebrovascular events including QT interval prolongation, ST segment deviation and T wave changes . These abnormalities have been attributed to transient increases in sympathetic activity  .
Muscular dystrophies  comprise a heterogeneous group of inherited diseases that mainly affect striated muscle. MD are characterized by progressive muscle weakness, atrophy and in many instances, premature death . MD share common histopathological features, such as muscle necrosis followed by replacement with connective  tissue and fat .
Group AB plasma, the traditional universal donor plasma product, is a limited resource. We compared outcomes of Group A plasma transfusion in comparison to AB . Analysis of blunt injured patients who received emergency release plasma from was performed.
Primary biliary cirrhosis  is a complex autoimmune disease that is likely caused by environmental interaction with genetically determined predisposition . PBC is characterized by the destruction of small intrahepatic bile ducts, subsequently causing biliary cholestasis. This sustained chronic injury may ultimately lead to the development of end stage liver disease requiring liver transplantation.
Our ability to prepare and adapt to the environment is fundamental to human existence. This alerting mechanism appears largely driven by the hippocampus preparing the HPA axis for arousal and stress , which may be accompanied by memory representations upon waking that allow orientation to self, place, time and personal demands  . Morning cortisol concentrations and thus the CAR, are thought to be largely genetically determined based on heritability of daytime cortisol, .
Recent reports indicate the increased use of methylphenidate  for behavioral disorders, cognitive enhancing effects, and for recreation . The exact role of MPD on the DA system is unclear; however MPD has been shown to have a chemical structure similar to cocaine, a drug with a high probability of abuse  . The VTA interacts with the pre frontal cortex  glutamatergic transmission facilitating the rewarding actions of psychostimulants .
Over the last four decades, the use of Drosophila as a model organism has expanded dramatically to include many aspects of behavior and physiology previously thought inaccessible to genetic analysis. The pioneering work in this area by Benzer and colleagues included the isolation of neurodegeneration mutants, beginning with drd. Mutations in this gene cause an adult lethal phenotype, with flies dying within the first two weeks after eclosion, and death is accompanied by gross degeneration in the brain.
Telomerase is a ribonucleoprotein complex composed of the catalytic protein subunit hTERT  and RNA subunit hTR , which serves as the template for the synthesis of telomeric DNA . Most human tumor cells demonstrate high level of telomerase activity, while normal somatic cells display undetectable level of activity . Thus, many studies have focused on the regulation of hTERT expression to investigate the mechanisms of carcinogenesis.
Collateral vessels provide a mechanism to protect against adverse outcomes associated with atherosclerosis. For people with lower extremity peripheral artery disease , collateral vessels are a natural bypass system, protect against critical limb ischemia, and may reduce ischemia related leg symptoms. However, collateral vessels do not restore perfusion to normal.
Allergic rhinitis  is an IgE mediated disease with symptoms of rhinorrhea, nasal obstruction, nasal itching and sneezing upon exposure to aeroallergens. In the USA, approximately $11.2 billion was spent on AR treatments in 2005. Early exposure to traffic related air pollutants, specifically diesel exhaust particles , may enhance risk for aeroallergen sensitization and development of allergic disorders in childhood., No prospective study has defined the exact relationship between early DEP exposure and percutaneous aeroallergen sensitization, especially the predictive value of early sensitization, during the first three years of life and the subsequent development of childhood AR.
The class of foods known as added sugars has been defined by the United States Department of Agriculture  as sugars and syrups that are added to foods during processing or preparation. They include white sugar, brown sugar, raw sugar, corn syrup, corn syrup solids, high fructose corn syrup, malt syrup, maple syrup, pancake syrup, and fructose sweetener; they do not include naturally occurring sugars such as lactose in milk or fructose in fruits . Direct etiologic relationships between added sugars and disease have been shown for dental caries  and are hypothesized to contribute to weight gain .
The human placenta represents the anatomical and functional feto maternal interface. When a robust inflammatory reaction during pregnancy is mounted , both maternal and fetal inflammatory responses can be observed. One of the histologic manifestations of such an inflammatory response is infiltration of both maternal and fetal neutrophils in the placenta .
Magnetic resonance imaging  provides exquisitely detailed images of the anatomy of the prostate and is the most sensitive imaging modality available for the detection and local staging of prostate cancer. For optimal MR imaging of prostate cancer, an endorectal coil must be used in conjunction with a pelvic phased array coil . Heijmink et al  found that insertion of the endorectal coil changed the prostate diameter by 5.5 mm  in the anteroposterior direction, 3.5 mm  in the right to left direction, and 2.2 mm  in the craniocaudal direction.
Previous research has primarily focused on the relationship between illicit drug use and HIV/STI risk behavior among African American women. Very few studies have solely reviewed the role of alcohol use on risky sexual behavior. The present study examined the relationship between alcohol use at non abuse levels and risky sexual behaviors and sexually transmitted infections  among young adult African American women .
High resolution peripheral quantitative computed tomography  is a promising non invasive method for in vivo 3D characterization of human bone . These properties are modified through distinct physiologic processes  and, therefore, represent unique targets for pharmacologic intervention. Recently evidence of significant macroscopic intra cortical porosity in early post menopausal osteopenic women has been reported .
There has recently been a series of neuroimaging studies that demonstrate that there is a pitch processing center in lateral Heschl’s gyrus . This component is referred to as the sustained pitch response . There is also a subcomponent of the transient N1m that peaks 100 150 ms after the onset of a pitch producing sound.
Endocrine disrupting compounds  are chemicals that perturb the endocrine system either by acting as agonists or antagonists to sex hormone receptors, thus mimicking or preventing the action of endogenous estrogens and androgens. Laboratories have reported the estrogenic activity for EDCs of various classes such as naturally occurring phytoestrogens  , man made plasticizers  , pesticides  , and other synthetic industrial chemicals   . BPA can migrate from containers into the contents, allowing for the direct exposure to humans via ingestion .
Stress is common and unavoidable, and exposure to stress of various forms can significantly alter brain function and promote cognitive and emotional disorders. Effects of stress on cognition are complex and depend on factors including the nature, duration, and timing of stress, and the specific cognitive task employed. The hippocampus contributes greatly to memory,, and it has been increasingly recognized that processing of sensory signals into memories in rodents involves dorsal hippocampus networks., In contrast, ventral hippocampus is endowed with distinct afferent/efferent connections, including robust pathways to amygdala,, which may enhance the emotional salience of memories., Stress, and stress hormones, influence dorsal and ventral hippocampus differentially: chronic stress attenuates long term potentiation in dorsal, but not ventral CA1, suggesting that discrete mechanisms exist for the effects of stress mediators on dorso ventral components of the hippocampal formation.
During T cell development, the organism generates a T cell population with an extended repertoire of antigen specificities. The majority of thymocytes bear TCRs that do not recognize the MHC molecules present in the thymus, and these cells die relatively rapidly . Furthermore, those cells that are positively selected develop into two different lineages, CD4 or CD8, depending on the ability of their TCRs to bind MHC class II or I, respectively.
Human HCC is the fifth commonest cause of cancer deaths worldwide  and is increasingly frequent in the USA , with approximately 15,000 new cases annually . It arises on the basis of cirrhosis in most patients, so that patients have 2 diseases of their liver, namely cirrhosis and cancer. The newer cell cycle inhibitors and anti angiogenic agents that are currently under evaluation in many clinical trials, have the potential for filling this need .
Placebo response rates in trials of antipsychotic medications for acute schizophrenia are rising, mirroring increases observed in illnesses such as Major Depressive Disorder  . In 28 atypical antipsychotic trials, Kemp et al. reported that the average symptom improvement among patients assigned to placebo increased by over 10 points on the Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale  between 1991 and 2006 . Agid et al  found that the standardized mean effect size associated with placebo treatment significantly increased over time .
Although cementless implants have become increasingly popular, particularly in the North American market, polymethylmethacrylate  cement is still widely used to secure orthopaedic implants within bone. Despite its long clinical history, the behavior of the cement mantle in an implant/cement/bone construct is poorly understood. This has led to unexpectedly poor clinical outcomes for some novel cemented implants .
Estrogens regulate physiological processes in various tissues, including but not limited to the uterus, mammary gland, bone, prostate, colon, lung, heart and brain. 17β Estradiol  or Estrogen Receptor alpha   is critical for this outgrowth of mammary ducts, and ovariectomy of adult female mice causes regression of terminal end buds , which can be restored by estradiol treatment . Estradiol stimulates a number of physiological responses in the mammary gland.
Integral membrane proteins  are difficult to handle in vitro because they are not soluble in aqueous solutions unless they are complexed by surfactants, most often detergents. Detergents, however, destabilize most MPs . A835, a polyacrylate based APol, has previously been shown to preserve the secondary structure of native MOMP  as assayed by circular dichroism  .
Cardiovascular diseases are the leading cause of deaths in the developed world. Current techniques for characterizing atherosclerosis include: Intravascular Ultrasound , angiography or their combination. Inflammation in endothelial cells of an artery may participate in initiation and progression of plaque .
Delirium is common, morbid, and costly in hospitalized elders . Despite increasing awareness of its importance, most delirium, particularly hypoactive delirium and delirium superimposed on dementia, still goes unrecognized . Prompt recognition of delirium is the first key step in its appropriate management, which involves careful review for reversible contributors, preventing complications , and instituting cognitive and physical rehabilitation .
The biologic and physiologic changes during the teen years are more strongly correlated with pubertal maturation than chronologic age. Common markers of pubertal onset include self or parental report of menarche, height velocity, and breast development. Difficulties in determining breast stage development in the obese child and teen inaccuracies in self report limit the use of such methods .
Phase II enzymes play important roles in maintaining redox homeostasis, resistance against oxidative stress, and detoxification and elimination of toxins. The expression of many phase II enzymes, such as nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide phosphate: quinone oxidoreductase , glutathione S transferases , heme oxygenase 1 , and glutamate cysteine ligase , can be up regulated in response to stimuli such as oxidative stress . This inducible feature makes these enzymes critical for protection against toxic insults and implies a promising strategy to prevent and/or treat diseases through modulating the expression level of these enzymes.
Metastatic melanoma is the leading cause of skin cancer deaths in the US, with a median overall survival of only 69 months . Despite advances in the field, the reference therapy for patients diagnosed with metastatic melanoma is Dacarbazine , which was first approved for treatment in the 1970’s. However, these monotherapies are typically restricted in their efficacy and tend to provide only a small improvement in progression free survival before resistance develops .
Therapeutic hypothermia is now standard clinical care for moderate to severe neonatal encephalopathy in the UK and developed world. Clinical trials have included whole body cooling with core temperature reduced to 33.5°C for 72 hours, as the optimal temperature for neural rescue is likely to be below 34°C. There are however around 40% of infants who, despite hypothermic treatment, have an adverse neurodevelopmental outcome.
Acquisition of chronic pulmonary infection with Pseudomonas aeruginosa is a major cause of morbidity and mortality in patients with cystic fibrosis . The emergence of clinical mucoid isolates of P. aeruginosa in a CF patient, due to overproduction of a capsular polysaccharide, alginate, is an indicator of decreased life expectancy . Increased transcription of genes that encode alginate biosynthetic enzymes involves multiple regulatory and signalling molecules .
China has witnessed an increasing rate of heterosexual transmission of HIV in recent years. In a nationally representative sample, an estimated 9% of Chinese men aged 20 to 64 years reported paying for sex . There has been a growing interest in understanding how individual level behavior change can be linked to the group or community level.
It is predicted that in 2009, 192,370 women in the United States will develop breast cancer and 40,170 women will die from the disease . Selective estrogen receptor modulators  reduce ER positive breast cancer recurrence by approximately 50% . p38s are members of the MAPK family that also includes the extracellular signal regulated kinases  and the c Jun N terminal kinases .
Viridins, a class of compounds from fungi of which wortmannin  is a member, have long intrigued pharmacologists because of their potent antiproliferative and immune suppressive properties. Viridins are steroid like molecules which have a “extra” furan ring as a common, key structural feature. Wm is a nanomolar PI3 kinase inhibitor, , but at higher concentrations inhibits polo like kinase, mTOR, DNA dependent protein kinase and ATM.
Integrins are extracellular matrix  receptors that play important and diverse roles in metazoans, including regulation of cell motility, differentiation, survival and proliferation. Two ubiquitously expressed families of integrins are formed by dimerization of either the β1 integrin subunit  with one of 12 alpha subunits or the αv integrin subunit with one of β1, β3, β5, β6, or β8 subunits,. A critical role of Itgb1 for liver  formation has been shown in experiments with chimeric mice where Itgb1 null cells did not participate in liver formation .
Spinal cord injury  typically leads to formation of scar tissue that can be categorized into glial and fibrotic components. Most of our current knowledge of the scar tissue has come from studies on the astroglial component, whereas our understanding of the fibrotic component is relatively lacking. In vitro assays indicate that fibroblasts are inhibitory/non permissive for axon growth  and genetic ablation of fibroblasts leads to cavitation at the injury site .
Drugs of abuse that are reinforcing share a common mechanism in causing elevated synaptic dopamine levels in the nucleus accumbens . Another feature of cocaine and other similar psychostimulants is repeated intermittent exposure induces behavioral sensitization, characterized as a progressively heightened behavioral response after abstinence and re exposure . Alterations in dopaminergic neurotransmission from the ventral tegmental area  to the nucleus accumbens are part of the underlying mechanism which brings about behavioral sensitization.
A formidable challenge in the field of Parkinson’s Disease  research is to understand the processes that lead to the death of dopamine  containing neurons in the substantia nigra . Postmortem studies reveal a reduction in the activity of mitochondrial complex I by 30% to 40% . Mitochondrial function is critical to the maintenance of adequate adenosine triphosphate  for basic cell processes.
There has been much debate about the role of depression and other mental disorders as risk factors that further the initiation of smoking in young people . The association between mood disorders and smoking has been well established in epidemiological research ; nevertheless, the direction of the relation between smoking and depression has not been understood fully . For example, the findings of Kendler et al. supported the causal linkage from depression to smoking, whereas Wu & Anthony  found that smoking occurred before depression in older children and adolescents.
Cryptococcus neoformans is a free living pathogenic fungus that primarily inhabits soil contaminated with decaying organic matter and bird excreta . C. neoformans is unusual among the pathogenic fungi in that it has several well characterized virulence factors such as a polysaccha ride capsule, degradative enzymes, and melanin pigment production . C. neoformans is a non specific pathogen that has been reported to infect and/or cause disease in a myriad of taxonomically diverse organisms from mammals to birds to such invertebrates as insects and worms  .
Toll like receptor 9  was identified as the receptor for oligodeoxynucleotides  containing unmethylated cytosine guanosine  dinucleotides and was originally thought to distinguish pathogen DNA from that of the mammalian host on this basis, as unmethylated CpG dinucleotides are relatively uncommon in mammalian DNA compared with pathogen DNA . However, subsequent studies revealed specific instances in which mammalian DNA proved to be a highly effective TLR9 ligand  and pointed to a critical role for mammalian DNA in the pathogenesis of certain autoimmune diseases including systemic lupus erythematosus  and psoriasis  . As TLR9 is located intracellularly, it is necessary for the DNA to be internalized before it can engage TLR9 .
The purpose of this article is to describe the development of a scale that will allow us to understand the level of confidence that family members have for participating in health care decisions for terminally ill loved ones. We first identified a need for such a scale when our study of terminally ill patient decision making revealed that a high percentage of patients preferred shared decision making with family. The challenge, however, is that family and other surrogate decision makers are often unprepared for end of life decision making and many report high levels of distress from this role .
ADP ribosylation factor  proteins are small GTPases that are essential regulators of many intracellular vesicular trafficking pathways . ARF1 is a key component in the formation of a number of different vesicular coat complexes and is essential to the dynamic assembly/disassembly of AP 1, AP 3, AP 4 and GGA1 3 based vesicle coats . ARF6 exhibits a sub cellular localisation pattern distinct to that of ARF1 and is distributed predominantly to the plasma membrane and endosomes .
Niacin is a lipid altering agent that favorably affects multiple lipid parameters. Niacin is the most effective medication in current clinical use for increasing high density lipoprotein  cholesterol . Niacin has been evaluated in combination with simvastatin in several clinical trials and has demonstrated efficacy, with clinical improvement in multiple lipid parameters .
Cell migration in response to chemotactic and haptotactic cues is essential for proper organismal development . Localized control of actomyosin contractility is essential for directed cell migration. Non muscle myosin II isoforms A and B localize to different cellular regions to regulate traction forces and directionality, respectively, during cell spreading and migration.
Spontaneous fluctuations in blood oxygenation level dependent  fMRI signals have recently aroused a large amount of interest in the fMRI literature . However, this assumption is only accurate when the global signal and experimental conditions are orthogonal to each other, that is, uncorrelated. Whether findings from such research are applicable to seed based connectivity studies is unknown .
Hepatitis B virus  remains an important human pathogen despite the existence of a highly effective vaccine. Particularly in resource limited contexts, vaccination rates remain well under 100% and vaccination at birth of infants born to HBV positive mothers is not fully protective against vertical transmission . Moreover, it is estimated that over 240 million individuals, ~4% of the world population, remain chronically infected with HBV and are therefore at high risk for cirrhosis and hepatocellular carcinoma , leading to ~800,000 deaths per year that are directly linked to HBV infection  .
Necrotizing enterocolitis  is the leading cause of death from gastrointestinal disease in preterm infants, and remains a major cause of long term disability in those who survive the disease, . Despite the increasing frequency with which NEC is diagnosed, its pathogenesis remains largely uncertain, although there is general acceptance that its development reflects persistent intestinal mucosal injury. In seeking to understand how mucosal injury in NEC occurs, we have recently shown that NEC development requires activation of the innate immune receptor Toll like receptor 4  on enterocytes, and that TLR4 activation by bacterial endotoxin  inhibits enterocyte proliferation and leads to disease progression, .
Based on experimental animal models and epidemiological evidence, Helicobacter pylori infection causes persistent chronic gastritis, which in susceptible individuals, may progress to atrophy, intestinal metaplasia, dysplasia, and finally intestinal type gastric cancer . H. pylori infection resulted in overexpression of type 2 cyclooxygenase  in primary gastric cancer and gastric cancer cell lines of human and mouse gastric epithelial cells . Recent studies suggested a positive association between hypergastrinemia, H. pylori infection, and gastric cancer in humans and mice .
When a population is well adapted to its environment, the vast majority of new mutations will be neutral or negative. This process is called ‘stochastic tunneling’ . The evolution of complex adaptations is more problematic in sexual populations because of genetic recombination.
Retinal ganglion cells  are the sole output neurons of the retina. Their dendrites receive synapses from bipolar and amacrine interneurons in the inner plexiform layer , their somata reside in a narrow ganglion cell layer, they express several common molecular features, and their axons travel through the optic nerve to retinorecipient structures in the brain, where they form glutamatergic synapses . As a well defined and accessible neuronal type, RGCs have been a favored object for elucidating developmental, molecular, cell biological and electrophysiological principles that apply to central neurons generally .
Within its native range in Asia, Aedes japonicus  larvae are found in a wide variety of natural and artificial containers, however rock pools appear to be the most favored habitat . Immatures of this species have occupied a similar ecological niche since its invasion of the United States in 1998 via used tire shipments  from Japan . As an invasive species, the likelihood of Ae.
Herpesviruses comprise a family of relatively large double stranded DNA viruses, which are widespread among humans and other animals. Roseoloviruses are among the most prevalent viruses in the human population with primary infection occurring during early childhood . Primary infections with HHV 6B and HHV 7 have been reported to cause exanthema subitum  while the clinical symptoms associated with HHV 6A are still unclear.
Although common in Nature, self assemblies that are principally driven by entropy are rare among the range of synthetic assemblies reported to date. Recently, we have been interested in assembly systems designed to rely on entropic changes. , Specifically, we are investigating the properties of water soluble cavitands such as 1 .
Chromatin structure is organized by nucleosomes, each of which consists of an octamer composed of four core histones  and ~147 bp DNA, which wraps around the octamer. The N terminal tails of histones are extensively modified post translationally, including phosphorylation, acetylation and methylation, which contribute to the modulation of gene expression. More recently, H3K36 trimethylation has also been suggested to regulate RNA splicing , but by and large regulation of RNA splicing by chromatin modifications remains poorly understood.
T regulatory cells  play a critical role in maintaining peripheral tolerance, and their loss results in severe autoimmune disease in both humans and in mice . However, the underlying mechanism remains controversial. However, Tregs are not completely resistant to the antiproliferative effects of rapamycin, and the overall level of Treg expansion in the presence of rapamycin may be insufficient to achieve therapeutic numbers of Tregs .
Mucus secretions serve as the body’s first line of defense against pathogens , toxins , and environmental ultrafine particles  at exposed surfaces not covered by skin, such as the eye and the respiratory, gastrointestinal and cervicovaginal tracts. The barrier properties of mucus are rooted in its dense network of mucin fibers, which contain highly glycosylated  segments interspersed by hydrophobic, lipid coated domains . These features enable mucus to trap foreign particles through steric obstruction and/or adhesion to mucus constituents via hydrophobic, electrostatic and hydrogen bonding interactions.
Optimal adherence to highly active antiretroviral therapy  is crucial to maximize the clinical benefits of treatment, delay disease progression, and to prevent the emergence and transmission of drug resistant viruses. Maintaining long term adherence to HAART is difficult due to complex regimens, unpleasant side effects and because patients with HIV infection must take HAART consistently for the duration of their lives. Thus it is critical to identify modifiable factors that impede long term adherence to HAART .
With Edward Kendall’s discovery of compound E, Louis Sarrett’s synthesis of ‘cortisone’ and Philip Hench’s successful application to a patient with rheumatoid arthritis , glucocorticoids  became the ‘wonder drug’ of the 20th century and have held a special place in the management of rheumatoid arthritis ever since . Their use is cost effective and their potent anti inflammatory properties help provide rapid symptomatic relief. A better understanding of these adversities has changed the status of GCs to ‘best friend, worst enemy’ and despite extensive clinical experience with their use, there remains significant controversy among clinicians with respect to their efficacy, safety, optimal dose and duration of therapy .
The population in the US is progressively aging. The proportion of the population aged >65 years is projected to increase from 12.4% to 19.6% by 2030. and the absolute number of elderly persons is projected to increase from approximately 35 million to 71 million. As the population ages, older adults will have surgery more frequently.
Memory storage remains a limitation when running very large neuronal networks . With number of neurons n, connectivity storage grows as n2. With connectivity densities of 0.110%, 1 · 106 neurons will require from 1 · 109 to 1 · 1011 synapses.
Banned organochlorine  insecticides are widespread persistent organic pollutants that bioaccumulate in wildlife and humans. They are neurotoxic through their interactions with ion channels . Others, such as dieldrin, are tumor promoters in rodent models .
ATP dependent cyclical interactions between myosin containing thick filaments and actin containing thin filaments drive muscle contraction in all animals. Biochemical and structural data suggest that initial crossbridge binding evokes allosteric effects on thin filaments involving a propagated opening of myosin binding sites along the filaments leading to cooperative activation of contraction . TnC serves as the Ca2+ sensor of the troponin complex.
Glycerol 3 phosphate acyltransferase 1 converts sn glycerol 3 phosphate to 1 acyl sn glycerol 3 phosphate, the first step in the biosynthetic pathway of all glycerolipids. It is known that lipogenic enzymes such as acetyl CoA carboxylase  and fatty acid synthase , like mtGPAT, are hormonally and nutritionally regulated   properties consistent with their role in triacylglycerol synthesis . Studies show that insulin and EGF stimulate lipogenesis and ACC activity in isolated adipocytes .
Venous thromboembolism , comprising the conditions of deep vein thrombosis  and pulmonary embolism , is the third most common cardiovascular disorder in adult Americans. While the magnitude of VTE increases dramatically with advancing age, relatively little is known about the natural history of this disorder in the elderly. The high risk elderly population has unfortunately been under represented in clinical trials evaluating therapeutic options for this condition, thereby leaving clinicians to generalize resulting data to the elderly when making clinical decisions.
The neuregulin 1  encodes a family of growth factors that interact with ERBB receptor tyrosine kinases via the epidermal growth factor  like domain to initiate intracellular signaling cascades critical to neuronal functions . The NRG1 proteins are divided into 6 types, Types I to VI. NRG1 proproteins undergo extracellular proteolytic processing at the juxtamembrane region to release EGF like domain, which then participates in paracrine signaling involving ERBB receptors .
Cochlear implants are the first successful example of replacing a human sensory end organ with an electronic device. There are two main reasons why the cochlear implant is considered one of the major medical advances of the twentieth century. This is a hypothesis that cannot be easily tested with animal models because animals do not have speech and language.
Hepatocellular carcinoma  is the most common primary hepatic malignancy and is the second most common cause of cancer related deaths in the world. Several variables affect the risk of recurrence following resection, including tumor size, tumor number, and vascular invasion. CD8+ cytotoxic T lymphocytes are the major effectors against tumor cells .
Mast cells  are stem cell factor  dependent hematopoietic cells that are ubiquitously distributed throughout the body  and they initiate inflammatory responses to allergens and infectious agents . The importance of c Kit signaling in MC proliferation makes it crucial to understand the basic mechanisms by which Kit regulates MC function. They are derivatives of arachidonic acid generated by MCs, eosinophils, basophils, macrophages, and myeloid dendritic cells , and act through two main receptors, CysLT1R and CysLT2R .
While medical advances have improved cancer survival, there is an increasing emphasis on addressing the “human costs” of cancer treatment . Among the most promising predictors are response expectancies . For example, an expectation that one will become nauseated would be considered a response expectancy, while expectations that one will be able to lift one’s arm, or that it will rain today would not.
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a chronic systemic autoimmune disease characterized by joint inflammation and progressive cartilage and bone erosion . Murine models of collagen induced arthritis  have been widely used to understand the development of erosive autoimmune arthritis . Pathogenesis of both RA and CIA involve pannus formation and hyperplastic inflammatory tissue that invades the articular cartilage and bone of the joints .
Halophilic Archaea  represent some of the mostextremophilic microorganisms known. Some Haloarchaea arepolyextremophilic, displaying resistance to several stressors in the environment. NRC 1 was the first in the Haloarchaeafamily to be sequenced and provided a convenient experimental genetic system forpostgenomic studies of DNA repair and replication .
When Ca2+ enters cells in response to depletion of intracellular stores, it is called store operated Ca2+ entry, and serves as the major route of Ca2+ entry into animal cells . Depletion of Ca2+ in the ER induces a series of events in the conformation and localization of STIM1, enabling it to interact with and open ORAI1, a CRAC channel located in the plasma membrane, restoring cytosolic and ER Ca2+ concentrations . Platelets of Orai1−/− mice display defective store operated Ca2+ entry and impaired activation and thrombus formation under flow in vitro .
In bilingual populations, residual differences can be seen between native and non native language processing, even if both languages are spoken well. Thus, it is more difficult for non native listeners to understand speech in a noisy background than it is for native listeners . This advantage of the native language for speech recognition under poor listening conditions exists even if the second language is spoken very proficiently .
Since the first description of simple and complex cells in the primary visual cortex  , the synaptic circuits underlying these two types of cells have been extensively studied and discussed. It is generally proposed for simple cells that the spatially segregated On and Off subregions in their receptive fields  primarily originate from convergent inputs from On  and Off center thalamic relay cells, respectively . However, the results contradicting the push pull model have also been obtained.
Single particle electron microscopy  is routinely used to resolve the three dimensional  structure of large macromolecular assemblies . To overcome these reconstruction issues and, ultimately to understand the functional significance of structural heterogeneity it is therefore vital to develop methods that are able to resolve the heterogeneity within the data and obtain higher resolution multi model reconstructions . However, in a more general scenario, structural variability may result when flexible regions within a molecule are not stabilized in any particular state, but instead can occupy a continuum of structural states.
Programming refers to the action of a factor during a sensitive developmental period affecting the organization and maturity of specific organs. Considering the extended pre  and postnatal developmental trajectory of the brain, it is apparent that early life experiences have the potential to sculpt brain morphology. During development of the human brain, little synapse formation occurs before the beginning of the third trimester, when it accelerates to approximately 40,000 synapses per minute  .
Infections acquired during hospitalization  are associated with increased hospital length of stay, rates of death, and increased costs. Substantial effort is devoted to preventing healthcare associated infections through practices designed to reduce the transmission of nosocomial pathogens, such as hand hygiene, bundles for insertion and care of devices, and isolation of patients with multi drug resistant organisms , . The skin of hospitalized patients is a reservoir for pathogens and invasion by skin flora is thought to be a mechanism contributing to healthcare associated infections.
Filling out personality measures takes time. Unfortunately, time is a precious commodity in most psychological studies, and investigators who wish to comprehensively assess their participants’ personalities must balance that wish against the need to allocate sufficient time to other components of a study. Most prominently, the “Big Five” domains of personality are now routinely measured using 20 item, 10 item or even 5 item personality inventories in place of much longer measures .
Staphylococcus aureus, a persistent nasal colonizer in approximately one third of the human population , causes infections ranging from superficial skin lesions to life threatening syndromes such as endocarditis, osteomyelitis, toxic shock, and sepsis . Indeed, S. aureus is the second leading cause of healthcare associated bacteremia, accounting for ~13 % of such infections. Of note, the acquisition of nosocomial S. aureus bloodstream infections leads to extended length of hospital stay and increased antibiotic usage, costs, and mortality  .
  Participants were asked to make judgments about the probability of an air traffic conflict, a horizontal loss of separation of 5 nautical miles . The Navigation Display   was an egocentric display. The Traffic Heading Information display on the EID  contained a compass that had a grey hash mark for every displayed traffic heading during the trial.
Epithelial tubes enable the rapid distribution of liquids, gases, and circulating cells throughout the body. For example, vertebrate vascular endothelial cells form a lumen when cytoplasmic vesicles accumulate in a central region of the cell and fuse with one another, or fuse with an invading apical membrane domain . Polarization in many cells is mediated by the proteins PAR 3 , PAR 6  and aPKC  , which are collectively called PAR proteins.
Colonoscopy is the primary modality for prevention of colorectal cancer  per multisociety guidelines , and the cost effectiveness of CRC screening with colonoscopy is primarily dependent on high quality baseline examination and adherence to guideline recommendations for timing of repeat screening colonoscopy . CMS proposed a new quality measure for the 2013 PQRS: frequency of recommending repeat colonoscopy in 10 years after a normal colonoscopy in an average risk patient . By 2014, failure to report will result in a reduction in Medicare payments.
Skin cancer is the most common cancer in the US . Targeting these molecular pathways has been demonstrated to hold promise for skin cancer prevention  . SIRT6 is an anti aging protein important for many aspects of organismal health .
A recognized important component of the pathophysiology of hemorrhagic shock  is an increase in vascular permeability. Apoptosis is initiated either via the extrinsic “death ligand” pathway or the intrinsic “mitochondrial” pathway . This catenin cadherin interaction has been shown to be the most important determinant of junctional strength and paracellular permeability , and loss of integrity of this interaction leads to significant changes in vascular permeability .
Temporal lobe epilepsy is the most common type of epilepsy in adults . In many patients with temporal lobe epilepsy the dentate gyrus displays abnormal features: loss of neurons in the hilus , including GABAergic interneurons , dispersion of granule cells , mossy fiber sprouting , and possibly more granule cells with basal dendrites that extend into the hilus . In some species, including certain bats  and monkeys , a subpopulation of granule cells regularly has basal dendrites.
Primary ovarian insufficiency , which is probably a more appropriate term for premature ovarian failure , is a disorder associated with female infertility affecting 1 2% of women under 40 years . This disease may be characterized by primary amenorrhea  in major defects with prepubertal onset or secondary amenorrhea  in women with post pubertal onset. The secreted bioactive mature BMP15 dimers signal through serine/threonine kinase receptors.
With increasing participation in youth sports, there is an increasing desire for young athletes to achieve peak performance . Resistance training may be one of the most popular and effective forms of conditioning aimed at enhancing sports performance, and its use is widespread among high school, college, and professional athletes . However, resistance training in the young athlete has been controversial.
The respiratory system has evolved a potent ability of host defense against bacterial infection. Alveolar epithelial and immune cells, such as macrophages, are the critical components of innate immune system to recognize invading microbes and use inflammatory signals to concert an effective innate and adaptive immune response, , . Gram negative bacteria are commonly isolated from hospital acquired infection patients and can cause serious acute and chronic infections in susceptible individuals.
Recent reports suggest that up to 40% of patients who have a sagittal split ramus osteotomy  experience persistent  neurosensory alteration . Several authors have suggested that the anatomical position of the mandibular canal and surrounding bone quality before surgery may be related to the likelihood of nerve injury during an SSRO,. Others have suggested that the placement of osteotomy cuts and/or fixation placement may be important contributors to the possibility of nerve injury,.
As unintentional injuries continue to be the leading cause of hospitalization and death for toddlers between the ages of 1 and 4, the Centers for Disease Control in the United States has argued that child supervision is a key factor in reducing injuries and fatalities . Considering supervision as integral to the affective relationships between caretaker and child facilitates an examination of a sociality where economics and gender matter in defining who is and is not a ‘good’ supervisor . Some mothers let their children run and play with friends or siblings while they sat nearby on a blanket.
Malignant gliomas are the most common tumors in the central nervous system . Acquisition of malignant growth, insidious invasion, high neovascularization, and resistance to therapies by glioma cells involve multiple genetic alterations, such as epidermal growth factor receptor  overexpression, that activate various cellular signaling pathways . The most common EGFR mutation is EGFRvIII, an in frame deletion of exons 2 to 7 in the gene that encodes amino acid residues 6 to 273, resulting in a ligand independent, constitutively active, and cell surfaceretained receptor .
Burn patients are at high risk for infection. Burn injury causes significant immune dysfunction, which might be attributable to burn induced apoptosis in immune organs., As the thymus degenerates with age in humans, the spleen plays a pivotal role in human immune defenses. This splenic dysfunction is recognized as an important factor in burn associated infections.
Tissue reperfusion following a period of ischemia triggers a complement dependent inflammatory reaction that culminates in necrotic and apoptotic cell death. established that following ischemia and reperfusion  of skeletal muscle, complement is activated by self reactive natural IgM antibodies  that bind to post ischemic tissue. So called natural IgM Abs are produced mainly by the B 1 subset of B lymphocytes, and the screening of hybridomas generated from an enriched B 1 cell fraction led to the identification of an IgM mAb that recognized non muscle myosin expressed in reperfused tissues , .
RNAs carry out a myriad of cellular functions, many of which require folding to specific structures. Because structured RNAs typically include base paired regions that form favorably even as isolated elements, globally unfolded conformations are generally not stable. The high stability of local structure also poses challenges for the kinetics of folding, because disruptions of native or non native contacts that are necessary to allow refolding of misfolded intermediates can be slow enough to limit the overall rate of folding.
Cognitive dysfunction is a critical component of schizophrenia and a major predictor of impaired long term outcome . Although traditional models of schizophrenia focused on dysfunction within a limited number of cognitive domains, more recent batteries incorporate a wider range of domains, including perceptual level testing  . The present study investigates mechanisms underlying cognitive dysfunction in schizophrenia using the perceptual closure task , which requires integration between lower and higher level brain regions.
B cell regulator of immunoglobulin heavy chain transcription  was the first eukaryotic member of the ARID  family of DNA binding proteins described  but its function in vivo has not been elucidated. ARID containing proteins are expressed in a wide range of organisms including Drosophila, C. elegans and Xenopus  where they have diverse functions, including roles in gene expression, physical development, and cell growth . While all contain a similar ARID sequence, only a few of the ARID3 subfamily members  bind specific DNA motifs, and gene targets have been identified for only a handful of those .
Since 1922, lifelong insulin replacement has been the mainstay of type 1 diabetes treatment. However, cells thus generated are often polyhormonal, and are characterized by an indifferent response to glucose, unless transplanted into mice, where they acquire undetermined factors required for their functional “maturation”, . Although terminally differentiated β cells are only present in the pancreas, endocrine progenitors with similar features to pancreatic endocrine progenitors are also found in the intestine, the site of the body’s largest endocrine system.
Vaccinia virus  is a large DNA virus widely known for its use as a vaccine for the closely related variola virus, the causative agent of smallpox . Vaccination is accomplished by inoculation in the skin by scarification of the epidermis. Inoculation typically results in a localized VV infection of keratinocytes at the inoculation site.
Nitrone spin traps are a class of synthetic chemicals specifically designed for trapping free radicals and making them more stable. Two commonly used nitrone spin traps are 5,5 dimethyl 1 pyrroline N oxide  and phenyl N tert butylnitrone . It produces a diverse array of protective or beneficial effects in animal models of disease and injury that include endotoxin shock, ischemia reperfusion injury, stroke, intracerebral glioma, and aging  .
Since a predominant area of focus in the newly expanded antiretroviral therapy  era has been cardiovascular problems such as insulin resistance, hyperlipidemia, and fat redistribution, other emerging metabolic alterations have been, for the most part, neglected. For example, data indicate that ART carries the potential to alter calcium  metabolism  . Similar to ART, animal studies have revealed a significant inverse relationship between calcaemia and ethanol consumption .
Pediatric low grade astrocytomas  encompass the most frequent primary brain tumors afflicting children. These alterations lead to increased downstream signaling pathways that have been found to be active in PLGA, particularly MAPK . Other PLGA subtypes have different alterations.
Acetaminophen  is one of the most widely used drugs to relieve mild to moderate pain and reduce fever . APAP is bioactivated to a toxic reactive metabolite, N acetyl p benzoquinone imine , by cytochrome 2E1  and, to a much lesser extent, cyp1A2 in the liver. Cyp2E1 is critically involved in the bioactivation of APAP to form NAPQI and, thus, APAP hepatotoxicity .
Juvenile idiopathic arthritis  is the most common rheumatic disease of childhood with an incidence of 2 to 20 per 100,000 children, and a prevalence of 16 to 150 per 100,000,. It is a chronic arthritis of unknown etiology with 7 subtypes  oligoarticular persistent, oligoarticular extended polyarticular rheumatoid factor  positive, polyarticular RF negative, systemic, psoriatic, enthesitis related, and undifferentiated JIA. Although JIA is the most commonly used classification scheme, other categorizations include juvenile rheumatoid arthritis  consisting of 3 subtypes  and juvenile chronic arthritis  with 4 subtypes  .
The main olfactory epithelium  of rodents comprises several cell types: ciliated olfactory sensory neurons  sending odorant information to the olfactory bulb, supporting cells that control the local ionic environment, and basal cells that proliferate to give rise to the different epithelial cells . Furthermore, multiple microvillous cells whose function is not well understood have been observed in the MOE of rodents and humans: 1) Microvillous OSNs with an axon projecting to the olfactory bulb  displaying a morphology similar to that of the microvillous sensory neurons of the vomeronasal organ  express the transient receptor channel C2  . 2) Microvillous cells that are not OSNs and lack a basal process/axon .
There is a resurgence of interest in the area of cancer metabolism, including understanding deregulated metabolic pathways, which confer growth advantages to tumors . One metabolic adaptation to energy metabolism in cancer is known as the Warburg Effect , where glycolysis readily occurs even in the presence of oxygen; this classical hallmark of cancer has been associated with the activity and expression of the key enzyme lactate dehydrogenase , where increased enzyme activity has been associated with more aggressive disease . There is a need, therefore, for robust assays of enzyme kinetics, historically carried out by spectrophotometric analysis ; however, the spectrophotometric assays cannot be performed on whole, viable cells and are consequently an indirect method of evaluating response to targeted therapies .
Entering its third decade, the HIV/AIDS epidemic continues to pose a major public health problem. Historically, the primary mode of transmission for HIV in Puerto Rico has been injecting drug use , which accounts for 50% of all cases among adults since 1981 . This judgment is based on an enduring feature of identity conferred by a health problem or health related condition and the judgment is, in some essential way, medically unwarranted.
1,3 Butadiene  is a petrochemical used in production of synthetic rubber and plastics. The International Agency for Research on Cancer has upgraded BD classification to become now listed among agents that “are carcinogenic to humans” . Long term inhalation exposure to BD  has caused tumor formation at multiple organ sites in mice and rats .
Primates have a large representation of the oral cavity, especially of the teeth and tongue, in the primary somatosensory cortex . This is due, in part, to the difficulties in reaching this most lateral part of S1 during microelectrode mapping experiments and studies of connections based on cortical injections . Much like the hand, representations of different parts of the oral cavity and face have been found in multiple areas of somatosensory and motor cortex.
It was previously believed that corneal allograft rejection was solely mediated by CD4+ Th1 immune responses. Th1 cells produce interferon γ  and IL 2 and mediate delayed type hypersensitivity  to the organ donor’s histocompatibility antigens, both of which are closely associated with graft rejection. In the classical T helper cell paradigm, type 2 T helper cells  secrete IL 4, IL 5 and IL 13, as well as other cytokines, which cross regulate Th1 cytokines, thereby suppressing clonal expansion of Th1 cells .
Natural killer  cells can kill cancer cells in the absence of prior stimulation and hold considerable potential for cell based therapies targeting human malignancies . This notion is corroborated by the observation that, among patients with leukemia undergoing hematopoietic stem cell transplantation, the antileukemic effect of the transplant was significantly greater when the donor NK cells exhibited a killer inhibitory receptor  profile that predicted a higher cytotoxicity against the leukemic cells of the recipient . Moreover, allogeneic NK cells might be beneficial when directly infused into patients, a procedure that was shown to induce clinical remission in patients with high risk acute myeloid leukemia  .
Invasive weeds that colonize agricultural fields cost millions of dollars in crop losses and weed control measures every year. Many of these agricultural weeds share similar fitness related traits that make them highly competitive with crop species. Cultivated cereals, however, have undergone selection for reduction of shattering during the domestication process, to increase the amount of seed harvested by humans .
Gigantism, a rare condition that causes abnormal growth in children, often has a genetic etiology. Indeed, cases running in a family were first reported in the late 19th century . These lesions, much more common in adults, have an annual incidence of approximately 3 per 1,000,000 and a prevalence of about 60 per 1,000,000  .
An important aspect in the fabrication of microscale systems is the ability to control wetting and surface tension of fluids by defining regions of hydrophilicity. Plasma treatment is widely used for creating hydrophilic surfaces and patterns, and for chemically functionalizing the surface. Because of its simplicity, flexibility, effectiveness, and relatively low cost, plasma treatment has become a popular method in academic labs as well as in industry.
Metanephric adenoma  is a benign, often asymptomatic and incidentally identified renal tumor comprised of primitive metanephric tubular cells . Patients commonly present in the fifth to sixth decade of life, and there is a slight female preponderance . Mitotic activity is usually very low or absent in MA, and necrosis is very rare .
The family of mammalian toll like receptors  includes at least 10 members that sense the presence of pathogenic microorganisms and injury induced endogenous ligands . Activation of TLRs mediates innate immune responses through nuclear factor κB  and interferon regulatory factor  dependent pathways . Activation of TLR2 and TLR4 in adult NPC leads to secretion of pro inflammatory cytokines such as TNF α .
Proline rich tyrosine kinase 2  is a focal adhesion kinase  related protein, also known as calcium dependent tyrosine kinase , cellular adhesion kinase β, related adhesion focal tyrosine kinase , or FAK2 . Recently, Pyk2 has become a potentially important new therapeutic target or prognostic marker because overexpression of Pyk2 has been found in many human tumors . For example, studies on endothelial cells  where FAK plays a critical role during the vascular development showed that they have an adaptive capacity to switch to Pyk2 dependent signaling after deletion of FAK .
C. albicans, in healthy people, resides as a commensal microorganism. However, in immunocompromized patients it becomes an opportunistic fungal pathogen, capable of causing mucosal, cutaneous, and systemic infections including oropharyngeal candidiasis . Most of the currently used antifungal agents target the fungal cell membrane sterol, ergosterol and the cell wall.
The functional imaging technique Intrinsic Signal Optical Imaging ; ; ; for a recent review see ) using red illumination is commonly employed for mapping cortical activity and plays an important role in furthering our understanding of brain function and organization. The detected ISOI signal evoked by a brief stimulus is slow in onset , long in duration , and, at least in the rat , is comprised of three signal phases consisting of a dip in signal below baseline followed by an overshoot in signal above baseline and another dip below baseline . Such practice is at the expense of data collection efficiency, substantially slowing the rate at which trials can be accumulated and hence undesirably prolonging an experiment; also, the occurrence of stimulus deliveries is considerably sparse compared to the stimulation experienced by awake and behaving subjects.
Young adulthood is characterized by important life transitions, often including migration from one’s parents’ home and sexual debut. First, recent societal trends in many countries—including a delay in marriage and steady or decreasing age of sexual debut—are lengthening the period between sexual onset and marriage . Observed relationships between migration and sexual behavior are common.
The process of tumorigenesis, previously thought to stem primarily from genetic changes within transformed cells, is now known to also depend on extracellular signals from non cancerous cells present in the tumor microenvironment  . Among the normal cells that contribute to the TME are bone marrow derived myeloid cells whose function and contribution to neoplastic growth has been best understood . Within the bone marrow microenvironment, BMMSC and osteoblasts provide a supportive niche for homing of hematopoietic stem cells  and tumor cells which promotes quiescence and survival .
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis  is a neurodegenerative disorder that primarily affects lower motor neurons resulting in progressive muscle atrophy that eventually leads to respiratory failure and death within 15 years . Whereas most cases of ALS occur sporadically with no known cause, approximately 10% of ALS cases are inherited in an autosomal dominant manner. Epidemiological and experimental findings suggest that individuals with high levels of energy expenditure and/or low levels of energy intake may be at increased risk for ALS .
Collagen type I from skin and tendon is highly conserved teleologically, and has optimal compatibility as a biomaterial. For these reasons, collagen has served as the fundamental component in a wide variety of engineered tissues, including skin, bone, blood vessels, tracheae, and nerve   . Pore size can be optimized for cellular attachment, migration and proliferation by several different methods including, but not limited to, lyophilization, electrospinning or solvent casting ,  .
High rates of injury incidence related to sports and recreation in children aged 1014 years  identify adolescence as a potential period of childhood development in which children may be at an amplified risk for such injuries. There is some evidence that indicates that the timing of increased injury risk may coincide with the adolescent growth spurt. Injuries at this age can devastate a child's ability to participate in physical activities and may trigger long term sequelae such as early onset of osteoarthritis.
Magnetic resonance angiography  is a useful tool in the diagnosis of vascular diseases and the monitoring of their treatment. Meanwhile, conventional non contrast enhanced techniques such as time of flight and phase contrast angiography rely on blood flow to generate contrast . On the other hand, flow independent angiography  exploits the inherent MR properties  of the tissues .
Tumor necrosis factor  related apoptosis inducing ligand , a potent death ligand that preferentially induces apoptosis in transformed cells, is under evaluation as an anti cancer agent in humans, . TRAIL initiates apoptosis signaling cascades by ligating two death receptors, death receptor 4   and death receptor 5   . TRAIL signaling in liver is especially important where receptor expression can suppress hepatocarcinogenesis, in addition to its potential efficacy in targeting established tumors, .
Natural killer  cells defined by CD56 expression and the absence of CD3 comprise 1015% of peripheral blood lymphocytes. They also reside in spleen, bone marrow, lymph nodes, liver, intestine and the pregnant uterus. In this process NK cells become functionally competent.
Scientific interest in one carbon metabolism  and cancer risk is increasing. The primary component of the system is folate, and the transfer reactions involve conversions between several of its forms. Other key components include vitamins B2, B6, and B12, each of which acts as an essential cofactor for one or more enzymes that catalyze one carbon transfer reactions .
In nuclear medicine imaging it is essential to find a balance between diagnostic quality of the images, which can, in principle, be improved by longer acquisition times, with the need to reduce acquisition time or injected activity. Human and mathematical observer studies and ROC analysis are powerful tools for optimizing and evaluating image quality for a variety of applications . In nuclear medicine imaging, quantum noise results from the random nature of radioactive decay and absorption, resulting in Poisson noise in acquired projection data.
Catheter ablation is finding increasing use in modern medicine. Current ablation strategies include thermal ablation , ethanol injection and photodynamic therapy. Characteristic of all approaches is the indiscriminant destruction of both cells and extra cellular structures within the ablated volume.
