The theoretical foundations of speech comprehension and production modeling date back to the nineteenth century when it was observed that language disorders resulted from lesions to particular cortical regions . Since that time, pioneering human electrical stimulation studies mapping cortical representations of the speech articulators  and investigations on patients with stroke related lesions  have elaborated initial theories, providing greater detail into the functional segregation of brain regions involved in speech production and perception. Modern theoretical perspectives propose that speech perception and production might be more accurately characterized by a large network of interacting brain areas rather than local independent modules  .
It has been shown that the traditional biomedical approach is insufficient for understanding chronic pain. , Many patients show poor treatment response despite diverse rehabilitation modalities. In recent years, it is increasingly recognized that patients’ pain experience is heterogeneous, and that treatment should be tailored to enhance efficacy.
Malignant rhabdoid tumor  is a rare and extremely aggressive childhood cancer. While the most common locations occur in the kidney and central nervous system, MRT also arise in almost any site . Despite significant advances in the treatment and outcome of other pediatric tumors, for MRTs diagnosed before the age of 6 months, patient survival at 4 years drops to approximately 8.8% .
Corynebacterium jeikeium is a clinically important opportunisticpathogen capable of causing a wide range of disorders including endocarditis, septicemia,joint infection, pneumonia, osteomyelitis, meningitis, and soft tissue infection , particularly inimmunocompromised patients or those with indwelling medical devices. It is recognized as themost frequently recovered medically significant Corynebacterium speciesamong patients in intensive care facilities, with the capacity for nosocomial dissemination . Previous work  hassought to investigate the range of genomic, physiological, and phenotypic differencesdisplayed by this organism.
Aging issues in cancer are becoming more prominent as age projections suggest the number of geriatric cancer patients will increase in the next 20 to 30 years. Physically healthy older individuals experience significant levels of depression . Among the elderly with chronic illness, depression  often interferes with the ability to make treatment decisions and adhere to lengthy treatment regimens.
Prostate cancer  is the most common cancer in elderly men with one out of six men afflicted with this malignancy in the United States . Androgen receptor  mediated signaling cascade is central to normal prostate physiology/homeostasis . Under pathological condition such as PCA, this signaling cascade functions as the contributory factor .
Smoking blends containing high efficacy synthetic cannabinoids  have recently emerged as popular substitutes for cannabis. Commercial preparations of these products are readily available, heavily marketed toward young people, perceived as safe, and not easily detected in drug screens . Like Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol , the primary psychoactive constituent of marijuana, the synthetic compounds in these smoking products are presumed to elicit their psychoactive effects by activating CB1 cannabinoid receptors  in the CNS, although many of these compounds possess much higher efficacy than Δ9 THC .
The bipotent population of cells that give rise to both cortical  aswell as medullary epithelial  cells that participate in the maintenance ofself tolerance within the organism  has received much attention in recent years. Previous studies showed thymic epithelium  to be generated exclusively fromthe endoderm . This morphology results in a visibly densely packed cortexsurrounding a markedly more defused medulla.
Injuries from trauma continue to be the leading cause of death for persons less than 45 years of age in the U.S. . Despite recent advances in trauma and critical care, as well as an improved understanding of the basic pathophysiology of severe trauma and its sequelae, morbidity and mortality, especially later following trauma, remain high . Although it is generally accepted that murine models do not fully recapitulate the human condition in its entirety, they remain the mainstay for invasive and interventional studies in trauma and burns .
Methamphetamine  is one of the most commonly abused drugs in the U.S. Approximately 10.4 million Americans 12 years of age or older have used MA for non medical reasons at least once in their lifetimes . This behavioral sensitization is long lasting and can be reinstated after chronic administration has ceased.
Compromised energy metabolism in brain cells is believed to play a pivotal role in the dysfunction and degeneration of neurons that occurs in disorders such as stroke and Alzheimer's disease . The energy demand of neurons in the brain is increased when they are stimulated by glutamate, an excitatory neurotransmitter critical for cognition, motor function, and other behaviors . Impaired glutamate reuptake through glutamate transporters in astrocytes and neurons further exacerbates the extracellular accumulation of glutamate.
A link between the ABO blood group system and malaria susceptibility has long been suspected. Significant associations between blood group and P. falciparum malaria have been reported from cross sectional and case control studies in Brazil, Gabon, India, Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe  ). The ABO A and B antigens have been implicated in the formation of ‘rosettes’ the process by which infected red blood cells  surround themselves with uninfected erythrocytes .
Previous implementation of 3D Single Breath hold Chemical Shift Imaging  in humans has already been demonstrated for evaluating hyperpolarized xenon 129  distribution in multiple lung compartments in healthy subjects and in subjects with cystic fibrosis . Here, we report the application of this technique for assessing, in a regional manner, pulmonary ventilation and gas uptake exchange in lung tissue and in the red blood cells  in smokers and second hand smokers . Eight subjects enrolled in this study underwent 3D SB CSI, .
The lifetime risk of colorectal cancer  in Western populations is about 5 6%, with annual incidence rates of 48 50 per 100,000 population. The National Polyp Study , a prospective clinical trial documented 76% CRC incidence reduction among 1,418 patients provided colonoscopic polypectomy over 5.9 years of mean follow up, and a CRC mortality reduction of 53% over 15.8 years of follow up relative to the general population. , The outcomes of community based colonoscopy programs have shown much lower cancer protection rates.
Plants produce thousands of phenolic compounds, which play roles in plant development and interactions with microbes . In response to root pathogens, many plants release de novo synthesized HCAs into the rhizosphere, and grapevines infected with Xylella accumulate HCAs and HCA conjugates in their xylem sap . HCAs are broadly antimicrobial; they disrupt membrane integrity and decouple the respiratory proton gradient .
Adoptive transfer of human hematopoietic stem cells  into immunodeficient mice that lack T cells, B cells and natural killer  cells can lead to stable engraftment of human HSCs . For example, SCID mice that were transplanted with human thymus, bone marrow and skin failed to generate any antigen specific IgG following immunization with tetanus toxoid  vaccine . Although additional transplantation of human lymph nodes into the recipient mice improved antibody response, the level of TT specific human IgG was still very low  .
Autism spectrum disorder  is a heterogeneous disorder with significant genotypic and phenotypic complexity . Indeed, with the transition to the DSM 5, all behaviorally defined subtypes have been subsumed by the umbrella term Autism Spectrum Disorder, allowing for identification of subtypes more closely aligned to biological mechanisms . The genetic etiology of ASD is no less varied.
Antigen presenting cells  play a central role in the induction of T cell activation as well as T cell tolerance. A major regulatory mechanism for IL 10 production occurs at the transcriptional level, and it is dictated by negative and positive feedback loops involving several transcriptional regulators and signaling pathways that are cell type specific. Important transcriptional regulators of IL 10 include STAT3, Sp1, AP 1, NFκB, C/EBPβ, and GATA3.
Colorectal cancer  is the second leading cause of cancer related deathin the United States  when men and women are considered together . The estimated fraction of CRC attributed toinherited predisposition ranges between 1030% . As a result, it is possible that the conventional syndrome basedapproach to performing inherited cancer predisposition testing, which includesgenerating a differential diagnosis and sequentially testing for single geneticconditions, may shift to panel based tests .
Phenotype driven screens of mutagenized populations of cells underlie much of the advances made in modern genetic research in the last century . Such endeavors, however, were limited mostly to lower organisms. Although regional or genome wide mutagenesis and phenotypic screens have been carried out in mice by several large laboratories, the operational burden in cost and time was extremely high.
Normal heart rhythms originate in the sinoatrial node. HCN encoded funny current  and the Kir2 encoded inward rectifier  counteract each other by respectively oscillating and stabilizing the negative resting membrane potential, controlling action potential firing. Therefore, IK1 suppression and If overexpression have been independently exploited to convert cardiomyocytes  into AP firing bioartificial pacemakers.
The thymus provides a unique inductive microenvironment for the maturation of bone marrow derived precursor cells into the immunocompetent T lymphocytes. This microenvironment is composed of various nonlymphoid cells. Additionally, it has been shown that the interactions between nonlymphoid cells of the thymic warp and maturing thymocytes are bidirectional: the latter cells control the maturation of respective nonlymphoid cells and induce the formation of microenvironmental niches for their own development .
Earlier, we reported syntheses of ethyl β D galactopyranosyl  2′ deoxy 2′ fluoro β D glucopyranoside  and 1′ fluoroethyl β D lactose  for positron emission tomography  of pancreatic carcinoma. Et FDL requires a precursor, which involves 11 steps to synthesize and produces overall low yields. Synthesis of precursors for  FEL requires four steps, but those precursors produced low radiochemical yields.
Lateral interactions mediated by local interneurons  are ubiquitous in neural networks. In insects, olfactory receptor neurons  on the antennae detect specific suites of odors and send this information to the primary olfactory neuropil in the insect brain, the antennal lobe . The lateral interactions exerted within the AL differ across species.
Breast cancer is the most prevalent cancer diagnosis in women. It is a significant cause of mortality and morbidity in the United States, with an estimated 182,460 new cases of invasive breast cancer and 40,480 new deaths in the year 2008  . Steady improvements in the survival rates of patients with breast cancer have been observed in recent years.
Lung cancer is the world’s leading cause of cancer death, and non small cell lung cancer  accounts for 8085% of lung cancer cases. Cisplatin  or carboplatin based combinations are generally used in metastatic NSCLC, and yield median survival times  of 810 months. Platinum based regimens are combined with radiotherapy for inoperable stage IIIA and IIIB NSCLC, with MSTs of 1518 months, and adjuvant platinum based chemotherapy increases 5 year survival rates by approximately 5% in patients with resected NSCLC, with the major benefit being seen in stages II and III.
Defects in formation of the human brain are common, devastating birth defects. Both genetic and environmental factors contribute to these conditions. Dozens of genes have been identified that affect these aspects of neural development; in addition, dietary deficiencies, maternal diabetes, and maternal use of alcohol or tobacco increase the frequency of neural tube defects and microcephaly .
Excess of glucocorticoids , either endogenous as in aging or due to glucocorticoid administration as immunosuppressants, leads to loss of bone . Chronic GC therapy is prescribed for a multitude of medical conditions including autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis, organ transplants, asthma, as a component of cancer chemotherapies, and a variety of inflammatory afflictions . Patients with chronic GC exposure exhibit a consistent reduced bone formation rate and histomorphometric features of increased bone resorption .
Ricin is a heterodimeric toxin which inactivates ribosomes. Attempts to treat and/or protect animals from ricin intoxication have been numerous and varied and fall into three categories:  post exposure passive immunization,  post exposure treatment with small molecules, and  prophylactic immunization. Several approaches have been taken to develop an effective vaccine.
Organogenesis integrates signaling, proliferation, patterning and structural processes to generate the variety of forms and functions essential to viability. During the subsequent pupal period, further growth and branching morphogenesis lead to its forming the Dorsal Air Sacs, the major tracheal organs of the adult fly that deliver oxygen to the thoracic flight muscles . Although ASP development, structure and physiology are largely unexplored, the ASP promises to be an excellent system for investigating basic mechanisms of organogenesis.
Military service can have positive as well as negative consequences  and both short term and long term effects. The psychosocial stress experienced by veterans with a history of active combat has both psychological and physical components. Approximately 65% of American men over the age of 55 served in World War II or the Korean conflict and about 25% of older American men were exposed to combat early in their lives.
Parkinson’s disease  is one of the most common neurodegenerative diseases in the world, affecting nearly 1.8% of people above 65 years of age in Europe . Although PD is a sporadic disease in most cases, various hereditary forms have similar clinical phenotypes to those of sporadic PD. Genetic studies on these familial forms of PD have provided critical clues that enhance the understanding of the molecular mechanisms of selective degeneration of nigral dopaminergic neurons.
Mounting evidence has shown that a significant proportion of pelvic high grade serous carcinomas  arise from a non invasive occult carcinoma in the distal fallopian tube, designated “serous tubal intraepithelial carcinoma ”. STICs have been identified in 1015% of prophylactic salpingo oophorectomy specimens from women with germline BRCA mutations, , and in the tubal fimbriae from up to 60% of women with sporadic ovarian HGSC. Complete microscopic sectioning of fallopian tubes has also revealed focal proliferations of morphologically normal secretory cells that show diffuse p53 immunoreactivity, termed “p53 signatures,” which may represent early clonal expansions of tumour initiating cells .
In 20092010, 17% of United States  children ages 219 years were obese, with greater odds of obesity among black and Hispanic children. Though little is known about the influence of having a non US born parent on obesity related behaviors in childhood,  designing appropriate interventions for these children will be key to addressing racial/ethnic disparities. Evidence suggests that immigrant adults have lower obesity risk despite lower income and educational attainment.
The hepatitis C virus  is an important human pathogen, infecting an estimated 120 180 million individuals worldwide. Although HCV is recognized and targeted by innate, cellular, and humoral immune mechanisms, persistent infection is common. Infected individuals may develop cirrhosis, liver failure, hepatocellular carcinoma, and extrahepatic diseases including mixed cryoglobulinemia and non Hodgkin lymphoma .
Each year, nearly 400,000 Americans ages 65 and older are hospitalized for pneumonia .Pneumonia is the third most common cause of hospitalization among Americans 6584 years old, and the second most common among those over age 85 . Nearly 11% of older adults hospitalized for pneumonia die within 30 days of hospitalization , and approximately half die within one year . Beyond increased mortality, hospitalization for pneumonia may raise the risk of subsequent cognitive and functional decline .
Scaffold design is important in tissue engineering due to its role in supporting cell attachment and growth, assisting exchanges of nutrients/oxygen and metabolite wastes, and eventually facilitating the formation of a functional tissue/organ. Many parameters need to be considered for scaffold design: pore size, porosity, interconnectivity, surface properties, and mechanical properties, among others . Therefore, much attention has been paid to the impregnation of a scaffold matrix with HAp nanoparticles and the decoration of a scaffold surface with apatite  using a simulated body fluid .
A small for gestational age  neonate is usually defined as one whose birth weight is below the 10th percentile for gestational age. An SGA newborn may be constitutionally small or the consequence of several mechanisms of disease, such as uteroplacental insufficiency, chromosomal abnormalities, congenital infection, genetic syndromes, etc. Therefore, SGA is considered one of the “great obstetrical syndromes” because it has multiple etiologies, a long preclinical phase and the other criteria that define these syndromes.
The utility of thoracic radiotherapy is limited by the radiosensitivity of normal lung parenchyma . Clinically significant radiation lung injury occurs in up to 30% of patients irradiated for lung cancer  and in about 1015% of other thoracic oncology patients . Currently, the only way to decrease the chance of developing life threatening radiation pneumonopathy is to minimize the amount of lung exposed to radiation.
Elements of cellular immunity interact with malignant tissue, and can control circulating cancer cells and residual disease even if ineffective against the primary tumor. Specifically, studies in animals and humans have indicated that immune control over circulating tumor cells and micrometastases is carried mainly through cell mediated immunity , including CTL, NKT cells, macrophages, DC, and NKC . Molecular mechanisms of tumor recognition by NK cells have been recently revealed, and a role for NK cells in controlling leukemia and metastases in humans has received substantial support  .
The use of macromolecular carriers for the delivery of chemotherapeutics originated from the hypothesis that polymers may be used to improve both the solubility and the blood circulation time of small molecule drugs . It was later discovered that macromolecules have the additional benefit of increased accumulation in tumor tissue as a result of the leaky vasculature surrounding rapidly growing neoplasm—a concept known as the enhanced permeation and retention  effect . Important design features  include a long blood circulation time, high tumor accumulation, high drug loading, low toxicity, low polydispersity index and simple preparation.
Many cardiovascular disorders including ischemic heart disease and heart failure are associated with extensive fibrosis. A critical event in the development of cardiac fibrosis is the transformation of fibroblasts into an active fibroblast phenotype or myofibroblast. Myofibroblasts, which are not present in healthy cardiac tissue with the exception of the valve leaflets, express vimentin, αsmooth muscle actin , collagen types I, III, IV and VIII, and have morphological and biochemical characteristics in between those of fibroblasts and smooth muscle cells.
I feel so embarrassed by thisthis thing… Who would want a wife like this? How can I go out and not feel unable to look people in the eyes and tell them the truth? Once I do, who would want to develop a friendship, I mean a close one?
Phosphodiesterase 6  enzyme complex consists of catalytic PDE6α and PDE6β as well as regulatory PDE6γ subunits. During photoresponse recovery, GNAT1 is deactivated by hydrolysis of GTP to GDP, permitting PDE6γ to rapidly re inhibit PDE6αβ . The function of Ca2+ sensitive GCAPs on the guanylate cyclase feedback loop is thought to be the most predominant mechanism of adaptation in amphibians.
Narcolepsy is now considered to be a neurodegenerative sleep disorder linked to the loss of neurons containing the neuropeptide orexin, also named hypocretin  . In rodents, narcoleptic symptoms are triggered in response to deletion of the HCRT gene , loss of neurons bearing the gene , or deletion of the hypocretin 2 receptor  . Cataplexy, which is defined as a sudden loss of antigravity muscles during waking, is an important diagnostic symptom of the disease.
Pain is an international health problem, affecting approximately 1 in every 5 individuals . Approximately 200 million opioid prescriptions are written annually in the United States, and in 2013 vicodin was the overall number one prescribed medication . Secondary health complications, including opioid abuse and dependence, afflict 2.1 million people .
Enlargement of the left atrium  is an independent predictor of adverse cardiovascular outcomes,  and its prognostic value in a variety of cardiovascular diseases such as atrial fibrillation, myocardial infarction, dilated and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is well documented. Antero posterior  diameter of the LA, assessed by two dimensional echocardiography, is the most widely used measure of LA size in epidemiological studies and in the clinical practice. However, the A P diameter is inaccurate, as it relies on several geometrical assumptions and often results in an underestimation of the LA size when compared to LA volumes.
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a systemic autoimmune disease, and one of its key pathological features is the destruction of joint tissues, including cartilage, by inflamed synovial pannus leading to a loss of joint function. Invading synovial pannus tissue produces proteinases that degrade components of the joint extracellular matrix  . Aggrecan is considered to be lost first in the early stages of RA, followed by collagen degradation.
The glucose 6 phosphatase catalytic subunit  is predominantly expressed in liver and kidney and plays a major role in glucose homeostasis by catalyzing the final step in the glycogenolytic and gluconeogenic pathways, namely the hydrolysis of glucose 6 phosphate to glucose and inorganic phosphate . A global knockout of the IGRP gene results in a mild metabolic phenotype characterized by a ~15% decrease in fasting blood glucose . Unfortunately, attempts to directly demonstrate glucose 6 phosphate hydrolysis by IGRP in vitro have been mostly unsuccessful , raising the question as to whether IGRP requires other cellular factors to exhibit activity or whether it has an unknown catalytic function .
Mycobacterium tuberculosis  infection is a major world public health problem; over 2.0 million people die every year from this common infection. As well, IFNγ can induce autophagy, a mechanism that plays an important role in the innate immunity against intracellular microorganisms ; MHC type II restricted CD4+T cells, MHC class I CD8+T cells and macrophages are important in the protective immunity against Mtb where a decrease of the number or function of these cells results in the reactivation of the infection . The TST is performed by intradermal injection in the anterior forearm of 5 units  of Tuberculin.
Neuromuscular control is believed to be fundamental to minimizing undue stresses and strains to tissues that stabilize the knee . A natural consequence of aging is a loss of muscle mass and strength . One common method to assess the neuromuscular response to a perturbation is to examine the muscles’ long latency responses  that occur before the volitional reaction time .
classic treatise on autism was titled “Autistic Disturbances of Affective Content.” Clinically, individuals with autism have minimal affective response to social aspects of their environment yet can exhibit extreme affect to ostensibly inconsequential nonsocial aspects of the environment. Despite the potential relation of dysregulated affective processes to the core features of autism, little is known about affective disturbances in this disorder. The goal of the present study was to assess basic affective processes in autism via an examination of affective modulation of the startle response, a well validated measure of affective processing.
The development of multicellular organisms occurs in four dimensions: the three axes of space and a fourth axis of time. C. elegans develops into the adult through four larval stages, designated L1 L4. Recent work has shown that several heterochronic genes are evolutionarily conserved in sequence from C. elegans to mammals, epitomized by the developmental timing microRNA  called let 7, which is 100% conserved in humans.
Hypertension affects 65 million adults in the US, 29% of Americans age ≥18 years, and is a major contributor to cardiovascular disease. Despite availability of effective therapies for >50 years, fewer than half of Americans with hypertension had controlled blood pressure In 20012002. Many hypertension control quality improvement strategies exist, but to date, no successful, large scale program sustained over a long period of time has been described.
Despite remarkable advances in the treatment of coronary disease, nearly 1/3 of patients who survive a myocardial infarction develop heart failure within 5 years. This burden of disease has driven investigation of progenitor cell therapy for the heart, including clinical trials of bone marrow derived cells. More recently, the discovery of resident cardiac stem cells, which possess a pre determined cardiac fate and can generate new heart tissue, has spurned interest in their clinical application.
Dynamic Contrast Enhanced  MRI has been proposed as an in vivo cancer imaging tool for diagnosis, monitoring of treatment effect, and evaluation of anti cancer drugs, especially for vascular directed therapies . By modeling the MRI signal as a function of contrast agent exchange between intravascular and extra vascular compartments, DCE MRI is able to infer tissue vascular physiology such as perfusion and permeability. Both semi quantitative and quantitative approaches to DCE MRI kinetic analysis have been utilized.
Chronic progressive kidney disease  risk is strongly predicted by CKD occurrence in family members. Among incident dialysis patients, 23% have a relative with ESRD . Rather hypertension appears to play a permissive role on which other factors determine disease risk.
During the development of the mammalian cerebral cortex, neural progenitor cells located in the ventricular zone  generate the majority of projection neurons via consecutive rounds of expansion and differentiation , but the mechanisms by which progenitor self renewal and differentiation are regulated during cortical development are not well understood . In a previous study we found that ephrin B1 plays a critical role in maintaining the neural progenitor state during cerebral cortical development . Ephrin B is the transmembrane ligand of the Eph receptor tyrosine kinases and transduces a “reverse signal”  in ephrin Eph mediated neural functions .
Profilin 1 , ubiquitously expressed in all cell types, was initially identified as an actin monomer  sequestering protein . Later studies revealed that Pfn1 enhances ADP to ATP exchange on G actin, and is actually capable of facilitating actin polymerization by acting as a shuttle to deliver ATP bound G actin to the barbed ends of actin filaments . Besides actin, Pfn1 binds to various phosphoinositides , phosphatidylinositol 3,4 bisphosphate P2) and phosphatidylinositol 3,4,5 triphosphate ), at least in vitro, and a number of proline rich proteins ranging from those participating in cytoskeletal to transcriptional control in cells .
Candida albicans is the most common fungal pathogen of humans. At the most serious level mortality rates from systemic candidiasis are high. C. albicans possesses a number of putative virulence attributes and among the most widely studied are the secreted aspartyl proteinases , encoded by a family of ten genes  that can be divided into subfamilies based on amino acid sequence homology alignments .
Stroke is the fourth leading cause of death and the leading cause of disability in the United States . Despite tremendous progress in understanding the pathophysiology of ischemic stroke, translation of this knowledge into effective therapies has largely failed. But because of an increased risk of hemorrhage beyond a few hours post stroke, only about 12% of stroke patients can benefit from rtPA  .
Regulatory T  cells are a population of CD4+ T cells with natural suppressive capabilities, which are critical for maintaining peripheral tolerance . Treg cells can be defined by their specific expression of the forkhead family transcription factor, FoxP3, which is necessary for their differentiation and function . Treg cells can be categorized depending upon the location of their origin .
Cardiovascular disease  is the leading cause of premature death in the U.S., both in aggregate and subpopulations of whites, blacks and Latinos. Since 1950, mortality from cardiovascular disease has fallen steadily, but the rate of decline has been greater in whites than in blacks. , Trends in cardiovascular mortality for Latinos have yet to be thoroughly assessed.
Lifetime prevalence of rape is 18% among US adult women, with annual prevalence between 0.3  and 1.1% . Delayed presentation may result in loss of forensic evidence and postpones treatment for sexually transmitted infections, postexposure prophylaxis for HIV, and emergency contraception, which are maximally effective if given early after assault . Rape sequelae include illness and increased healthcare utilization .
Mucormycoses are rare life threatening fungal infections caused by fungi of the order Mucorales . These infections usually afflict patients with immunosuppressed systems due to neutropenia, hematologic malignancies, corticosteroid treatment, diabetes or trauma . Owing to the rising prevalence of diabetes, cancer and transplantation in aging populations in the developed world, the number of mucormycosis infections are rising  .
Childhood cancer survivors are at increased late mortality risk because of the late effects of their cancer and treatment; survivors’ life expectancy is reduced by as much as 28% . Mortality risk has been modified by era of treatment , type of treatment , diagnosis , and demographic characteristics . Although risk of mortality from recurrence or progression of primary disease decreases with length of follow up, survivors demonstrate excess late mortality including a 15 fold increased risk of death attributable to subsequent neoplasms, 7 fold increase in risk of cardiac deaths, and 9 fold increase in risk of pulmonary deaths .
Prostate cancer is the most common form of non skin cancer diagnosed in men in the United States. Over 186,320 new cases will be diagnosed in 2008 . ADT is now prescribed in the setting of localized disease  or for those who have a rising PSA without evidence of metastases after primary therapy.
The robust stimulant qualities of coffee have been enriching human vitality since its incarnation, however only recently have specific health benefits of this brew been reported in the scientific literature. Coffee is now considered as a medically beneficial beverage given inverse associations with metabolic syndrome, cardiovascular disease, and weight gain, despite previous reports. revealed a strong inverse dose dependent relationship between coffee consumption and total and cause specific mortality.
Empirical studies and modeling exercises of HIV testing and treatment have demonstrated the effectiveness of universal HIV testing and early treatment in preventing sexual transmission of HIV, lowering community viral load, and consequently reducing HIV incidence among high risk populations such as men who have sex with men  and general populations in both concentrated and generalized epidemic settings . However, in many countries and especially among stigmatized populations, unique individual, social, cultural, and structural barriers to HIV testing and access to care and treatment pose significant challenges to this cascade . MSM in China are becoming the group most highly affected by HIV/AIDS .
Macrophages and T lymphocytes play critical roles in the initiation and development of atherosclerosis. Activated endothelium recruits monocytes by secretion of chemoattractants, after which monocytes bind to and subsequently transmigrate though the endothelial layer . Lesional lymphocytes secrete the inflammatory cytokine IFN γ which further activate macrophages and vascular cells  .
The ability of cytotoxic T lymphocytes to recognize and eradicate diseased cells relies on the surface presentation of small peptide fragments bound onto specialized receptors of the class I Major Histocompatibility Complex  . These epitope precursors have to be trimmed by ER resident aminopeptidases so that they can bind onto nascent MHC class I molecules . ER aminopeptidase 1  has been demonstrated to play a crucial role in trimming peptide precursors leading to the generation or destruction of mature antigenic peptides .
CD4+ T lymphocytes constitute a principal component of the adaptive immune system that functions together with innate immune cells to afford host protection against infection and tissue damage . Among the best studied of these effector subsets are Th1 cells, which secrete IFN γ and provide protection against intracellular pathogens, and Th2 cells, which produce IL 4 in response to extracellular bacteria and parasites . IL 23 does not appear to be required for initial Th17 differentiation, but IL 23 receptor is expressed by developing Th17 cells and IL 23 can stimulate further differentiation, expansion and survival of Th17 cells .
Voltage gated sodium channels are responsible for the initiation phase of action potentials in neurons. There are nine mammalian isoforms of this channel, and they differ in their developmental and tissue specific expression. Nav1.2 and Nav1.6 are two sodium channel isoforms expressed at high levels in the adult CNS.
Medium spiny projection neurons  in the nucleus accumbens  undergo lasting molecular and cellular adaptations following repeated cocaine administration that likely contribute to behavioral changes associated with addiction . Excitatory glutamate input to NAc MSNs is critical in the regulation of behavioral sensitization and drug seeking behavior in animal models of addiction . Subsequent studies suggest these behavioral changes result from withdrawal induced increases in surface expression of AMPAR subunits in the NAc , and enhanced AMPA mediated synaptic currents that facilitate long term potentiation in the NAc  .
Amnestic mild cognitive impairment  is a term used to define the transitional phase between normal aging and early Alzheimer disease . aMCI individuals share similar pathology with AD including temporal lobe atrophy, low CSF Aβ levels, and the accumulation of neurofibrillary tangles in the hippocampus and entorhinal cortex . However, the severity of the pathology is reduced in aMCI compared to AD.
The prenatal period may represent a time when the impact of inhaled environmental agents on respiratory outcomes in the offspring is heightened. Season of birth also has been associated with subsequent development of atopy and asthma in multiple studies. However, studies examining the relationship between a specific season of birth and childhood sensitization to allergens found in higher concentrations during later pregnancy are limited.
South Africa has the largest number of HIV infected people worldwide. Although the yearly mortality due to AIDS related deaths has improved from 257,000 in 2005 to 194,000 in 2010, late diagnosis and poor access to treatment continue to be a challenge. Since the South African antiretroviral treatment  program was rolled out in 2004, there has been increased focus on HIV policies and programs promoting testing.
One of the hallmarks of cancer is the invasion of tumor cells into adjacent normal tissue . The altered microenvironment is recognizable at the light microscopic level as desmoplasia and used by pathologists to diagnose invasion. Cancer associated fibroblasts  constitute a significant component of the tumor stroma.
Among several proposed functions, translocator protein 18 kDa  transports cholesterol across the outer mitochondrial membrane to an enzyme , which converts cholesterol into pregnenolone, a common precursor for steroids . TSPO was first detected in kidney and was originally called the peripheral benzodiazepine receptor. Our lab recently discovered that about 10% of the population show no specific binding to TSPO using PBR28, a PET radioligand with high affinity and selectivity for TSPO .
The membrane raft hypothesis assumes lateral lipid membrane heterogeneity to critically influence cellular functions involving signaling, sorting, and trafficking . This hypothesis evolved from findings from biochemical assays based on the detergent resistance of membrane components at low temperature . Lateral segregation of plasma membrane components is often described within the context of Lo and Ld type membrane phases .
Adult T cell leukemialymphoma  is a highly aggressive T cell malignancy etiologically linked to the retrovirus human T cell leukemia virus type I  . HTLV 1 is transmitted mainly through breastfeeding, sexually, and via blood transfusions, and is endemic in areas of southern Japan, the Caribbean basin, intertropical Africa, South America, the Middle East, and Papua New Guinea. An estimated 1520 million people are infected with HTLV 1 worldwide, the majority of whom are asymptomatic carriers .
Cholesterol serves diverse regulatory and metabolic functions in mammalian cells, including regulation of its own cellular concentration via multiple pathways. In addition, much of cell biology is mediated by the physical properties of lipid bilayers, which can in turn be regulated by cholesterol. Computational models are important for predicting high resolution structural and dynamic properties of the membrane that are not experimentally accessible.
The prevalence of obesity has been increasing at alarming rates worldwide. Obesity has been associated with type 2 diabetes as well as with other chronic diseases, including certain types of cancer, heart disease, and stroke. Likewise, reports of greater depression, more injuries from accidents, and economic loss from unemployment linked to obesity magnify the impact of obesity on health.
Multiple sclerosis  is an inflammatory, demyelinating disease of the central nervous system  believed to be mediated by myelin specific T cells. The majority of patients with MS have lesions disseminated in the brain, and some have accompanying spinal cord lesions. Disease in these models is manifested by ascending flaccid paralysis, referred to as “classic” EAE.
Tracheal stenosis is largely an acquired deformity that results from a combination of events including external trauma and infection as well as iatrogenic causes, such as prolonged endotracheal intubation and tracheotomy. Current surgical treatments consist of serial endoscopic dilation, cartilage grafting, laser ablation, endotracheal stenting, tracheostomy, and segmental resection. These procedures are often associated with significant morbidity and mortality.
The use of plants as factories to produce important pharmaceutical proteins, including vaccine antigens and therapeutic monoclonal antibodies , is attractive for several reasons. First, plants can produce large volumes of proteins efficiently and sustainably and, under certain conditions, can have significant advantages in manufacturing costs . Third, plants possess an endomembrane system and secretory pathway that are similar to mammalian cells , permitting appropriate post translational modification of recombinant proteins, which are often critical to their proper functions .
Stress has been shown to contribute to the induction of various psychiatric disorders such as depression and alcohol dependency . The mesolimbic dopamine  pathway originating in the ventral tegmental area  projects to the nucleus accumbens  and plays a role in reinforcement or motivational behavior, while the nigrostriatal DA pathway originating in the substantia nigra  projects to the dorsal striatum and plays a prominent role in expression of motor behavior . It has been noted that alterations in reward and motivational processes, at the level of dopamine DA neurotransmission, may be implicated in both stress and alcohol dependence .
The t is the most common chromosomal translocation in human low grade lymphomas. More than 85% of follicular lymphomas and 25% of diffuse B cell lymphomas possess this translocation. Two promoters mediate transcriptional control of the bcl 2 gene .
For the unicellular bacterium, this boundary is a structurally complex cell wall integrating cytoskeletal proteins and a cytoskeletal polymer, the peptidoglycan, with membrane bilayer. These membrane proteins may be divided among proteins that associate with the membrane, that embed into the membrane by a single membrane spanning domain , and that embed into the membrane using multiple membrane spanning domains . From the perspective of human control of infection, there is arguably no more important class of bacterial membrane proteins than the Penicillin Binding Proteins .
The antigen antibody complex is a critical interaction exploited in a range of fundamental immune based detection technologies such as immunoblotting, immunohistochemistry, immunoprecipitation and flow cytometric analyses. Yet antibody generation is something of a gamble, with no guarantee for the sensitivity or selectivity of an antibody raised against an epitope from a protein of interest, and whether the antibody will be effective across all desired techniques. Improving the performance of antibodies to enhance detection and signal to noise ratios continues to be a challenge in many research technologies.
Block copolymer  self assembly is considered a powerful route to achieve nanoscale  materials because of its ability to form various periodic structures with tunable length scale. BCPs in hybrids with high inorganic loading can be removed by chemical, photochemical and/or thermal treatments without collapse of the structures, resulting in nanoporous functional materials. Extensive studies of this method have been performed in the last nearly two decades both in thin films and in the bulk.
Plasmodium vivax is a major cause of malaria worldwide leading to >50% of the disease is outside Africa, mainly afflicting Asia and the Americas with approximately 2.5 billion people at risk from vivax malaria . Therefore, an important part of control strategy will be an implementation of a vaccine capable of inducing protective immunity against P. vivax . P. vivax Duffy binding protein  is a 140 kDa type 1 integral membrane protein which belongs to a family of homologous Duffy binding like erythrocyte binding proteins  located within the micronemes of Plasmodium merozoites .
For over 50 years Abraham Maslow’s hierarchy of needs has been one of the most cited theories of human behavior . At the top of Maslow’s pyramid is the need for self actualization, described as the desire “to become everything that one is capable of becoming” . Although Maslow’s theory is cited within the literature on recovery from serious mental illness   there has been limited discussion, and even less empirical support, about how material deprivation, or a lack of basic needs such as housing, affect one’s recovery potential .
Sirtuin 1 , a mammalian counterpart of the yeast silent information regulator 2  and a proto member of the sirtuin family, is an NAD dependent protein deacetylase. It has been considered as a tumor promoter because of its increased expression in some types of cancers and its role in inactivating proteins that are involved in tumor suppression . It deacetylates and thus inhibits the tumor suppressor p53 .
Vegetation distribution and diversity are vital for humans, as they are not only playing a direct role in ecosystem services such as fodder or wood production, but also involved in key ecosystem functions . Dominant plant species drive ecosystem stability  and more generally ecosystem functioning . Plant species richness is known to influence forest productivity  but there is a growing consensus that it is functional diversity rather than species numbers per se that affects ecosystem functions .
The associations of pilot error with the type of flight operations and basic weather conditions are well documented. The correlation between pilot characteristics and error is less clear. This study aims to examine whether pilot age is associated with the prevalence and patterns of pilot error in air taxi crashes .
Voltage gated sodium channels respond to membrane depolarization by undergoing a series of conformational changes that culminate in channel opening and subsequent inactivation. The “outward” movement of charged residues in the voltage sensors in response to a depolarization triggers a conformational change that is transmitted to the pore gates. The principal subunit of the voltage gated sodium channel is a large 260 kDa polypeptide and has four homologous domains  which together form a functional channel .
Contact lenses impede the movement of oxygen to the anterior of the cornea, and create a lens induced hypoxia Chronic corneal hypoxia is a major issue because it causes corneal edema, which may be manifested clinically as central corneal clouding, striae and folds. In the long term, contact lens induced hypoxia may lead to corneal exhaustion syndrome and discontinued contact lens wear. It also has been found that contact lenses that do not meet the cornea’s oxygen needs cause impaired corneal metabolism and integrity, decreased epithelial thickness, stromal thinning, increased endothelial polymegathism and limbal redness and vascularization., Other studies show that hypoxia causes increased bacterial adhesion to epithelial cells and overnight hypoxia increases the risk for infection.
The scale up of antiretroviral therapy  is one of the largest global public health interventions ever implemented, almost reaching 10 million HIV infected adults in sub Saharan Africa  . Consequently, these adults are now unlikely to die from opportunistic infections that typified the pre ART era hence live longer. For instance, older adults were found to have; advanced disease at diagnosis, faster progression to AIDS, and higher mortality,.
While there are numerous clinical complications that are associated with the development of acute myocardial infarction , none are more potentially devastating or carry a worse prognosis than cardiogenic shock  . Despite marked advances in medical treatment, revascularization techniques, and mechanical support during the past 2 decades, cardiogenic shock is still the most common cause of hospital mortality associated with AMI . On the other hand, data obtained from a limited number of recent studies suggest possible declines in the hospital mortality associated with cardiogenic shock , partially associated with the implementation of early revascularization therapy based on recent practice guidelines .
The intercellular connectivity of neurons is critical for correct function, but detailed descriptions of neuronal wiring circuits in vertebrates are still lacking, and their functional outputs poorly understood . The expression of these guidance molecules is highly regulated and identifying when and where they are expressed is important to obtain a molecular understanding of neuronal network development and function. While important progress has been made on the large scale documentation of gene expression patterns within the nervous system, the technique usually used   in situ hybridisation   often only identifies the soma of the neuron expressing the gene, and not their functional protein products.
Since Silent Spring , a keen interest has developed in the occurrence and environmental health impacts of persistent environmental pollutants, like the polychlorinated biphenyls . We lack a clear mechanistic understanding of their toxicity. Traditional approaches have focused on the liver, as a target organ, and on the regulation and catalytic properties of the cytochrome P 450  superfamily, abundant there .
Enhanced susceptibility effects at high field have led to the rapid development of methods which use the phase of the MR signal, particularly in neuroimaging. ΔB0 mapping is widely used to correct distortions in echo planar imaging , and high resolution gradient echo  phase imaging has been applied in the assessment of vascular malformations such as cavernomas  and iron stores in pathologies including dementia , Huntington’s, and Alzheimer’s disease  . The phase of the MR signal has both time independent and time dependent components.
Several variants in genes that encode for drug metabolizing and transport proteins have been demonstrated to affect inter individual drug responses by regulating the absorption, distribution, metabolism, and excretion  of medications. Allele frequency differences for these variants are greater among African than European or Asian populations. Therefore, extrapolation of allele frequencies of these variants genotyped in one African population to another African population may be misleading.
In the central nervous system semaphorins promote axon guidance by mediating both attractive and repulsive cues . For example, neuropilins are expressed by vascular endothelial cells, where they heterodimerize with tyrosine kinase receptor subunits to compose receptors for heparin binding isoforms of vascular endothelial growth factor  . Other families of axon guidance molecules have also been implicated in vascular patterning, including the Slit/Robo, Ephrin/Eph and Netrin/Unc5 networks, suggesting significant parallels between the neuronal and vascular systems  .
Malignant peripheral nerve sheath tumors  are an aggressive soft tissue sarcoma and about 50% of MPNSTs arise in Neurofibromatosis Type 1 patients . NF1 patients have 813% lifetime risk of developing a MPNST. The 5 year survival rate ranges from 39 to 60 % .
Breast cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in women with prevalence increasing with age . Breast cancer is associated with somatic genetic and epigenetic alterations in the breast tissue such as tumor suppressor gene mutation or other molecular changes that compromise their function . About 60 70% of human breast cancers are estrogen receptor α  positive and estrogen dependent .
Zebrafish embryos and larvae provide a unique system in which to study motor control because of the ability to combine genetics, imaging, and electrophysiology . To address this deficit, we have focused on the glutamatergic system in the developing zebrafish embryo and its role in two simple motor behaviors . Zebrafish show highly stereotyped escape responses and swimming that have been shown to be dependent on the hindbrain .
α Hemolysin  secreted by the bacterium Staphylococcus aureus is an exotoxin involved in a number of human diseases. It can self assemble on lipid bilayers of a susceptible host cell membrane to form a wide heptameric pore. Important aspects of αHL as a promising scaffold for synthetic ion channels are: 1) it can bind to various biological or synthetic lipid bilayers readily and spontaneously; 2) once bound to the membrane, it is stable over a wide range of pH and temperature; 3) it can be modulated in many ways to adjust ion selectivity.
Atrial natriuretic peptide  is a 28 amino acid  peptide which consists of a 17 AA ring formed by a disulfide bond together with a 6 AA N terminus and a 5 AA C terminus. ANP possesses natriuretic, vasodilatory, lusitropic, renal enhancing, and renin angiotensin aldosterone system  inhibiting properties via activation of the natriuretic peptide receptor A  and generation of the second messenger 3′,5′ cyclic guanosine monophosphate  . Importantly, ANP is cleared from the circulation through degradation by neutral endopeptidase  and by a receptor mechanism following binding to the natriuretic peptide receptor C   .
The lifetime risk of symptomatic knee osteoarthritis  is nearly 50% . Therefore, preventative strategies targeting mechanical risk factors are important to develop. As a mechanical factor, varus knee alignment has been linked to incident medial knee OA , likely due to higher than normal medial knee joint forces .
Heme is an iron containing cofactor necessary for a variety of biological processes . Heme is also found in the cytochromes involved in the electron transport chain used for ATP synthesis. Free heme is a lipophilic molecule that can intercalate in, and thus destabilize, lipid bilayers of cell and organelle membranes .
CC is the fourth most common cancer and inflammation is an established risk factor for CC . Patients with inflammatory bowel disease are at increased risk for CC and the mortality in patients diagnosed with CC in the setting of IBD is higher than for sporadic colorectal cancer  . LPA mediates its effects primarily by coupling to a family of G protein coupled receptors, LPA1~LPA5 .
Approximately two thirds of the world’s 33.2 million individuals infected with the HIV virus live in sub Saharan Africa. Alcohol has been associated with the HIV epidemic through its contribution to risky sex. Most are geared toward minority groups living in the U.S.  Bernal and colleagues have developed a framework for enhancing cultural ecology when adapting psychotherapy for treatment outcome research.
Epithelial ovarian cancer  represents the fifth most common cause of cancer mortality in women due in part to the advanced stage at which patients typically present, with an estimated 22,240 new patients and 14,030 deaths in 2013 in the United States . Most deaths  are among patients who had advanced stage, high grade serous  epithelial ovarian cancer , a histological subtype shown to have unique tumor epigenetic characteristics . The diverse outcomes observed among HGS EOC patients may relate to different molecular subtypes, even among tumors with similar pathological characteristics .
The murine skull vault consists of mainly two different skeletal elements, the frontal and parietal bones. Each component is formed from entirely different tissue origins during development, cranial neural crest  or cephalic mesoderm, respectively . In this study, we address the cell autonomous roles of Tgfbr2 in development of the skull vault .
The activity of the thiamine dependent enzyme complex α ketoglutarate dehydrogenase  declines in brain in numerous age related neurodegenerative diseases . KGDHC consists of three components: E1k , E2k  and E3 . Thus, a better understanding of the consequences of a partial reduction in KGDHC is required .
In an attempt to develop proper rodent models of excessive intake of alcohol , multiple procedures involving temporally limited accesses to alcohol have been tested. For instance, repeated daily exposures to 10%  alcohol, for limited time periods of 1 h, during the light phase of the daily light/dark cycle, and with fixed time of access on each day, resulted in relatively high intakes of alcohol  in selectively bred, alcohol preferring Alko Alcohol  rats . The repeated, concurrent availability of multiple alcohol concentrations  in two daily 1 h drinking sessions, 3 h apart during the dark phase, resulted in mean alcohol intakes exceeding 2.5 g/kg/session in selectively bred, Indiana alcohol preferring  rats ; these alcohol intakes, together with the corresponding blood alcohol levels , met the proposed criteria for binge like drinking .
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is a progressive liver disease that ranges from simple steatosis to nonalcoholic steatohepatitis .Along with the obesity rates in the United States, the incidence of NAFLD and NASH have increased in recent years, and it is estimated that NAFLD affects between ~30% and 40% of the adult population . NAFLD patients have an increased overall mortality rate and those who develop NASH have an increased rate of liver related mortalities . The growing prevalence and increased mortality associated with these diseases have underscored the need for: 1) greater mechanistic understanding of disease progression and 2) development of more sensitive and reliable disease biomarkers .
There is widespread recognition of the importance of taxation as one of the most effective measures of tobacco control and its demonstrated value as a public health policy in preventing tobacco related disease and death. The taxation of tobacco products, however, may not be as effective in curbing tobacco consumption as it is intended to be, owing to compensatory behavior among smokers to maintain the affordability of tobacco products in response to price increases. Such compensatory behavior would diminish the expected reduction in cigarette consumption and would, in turn, dampen the impact of any tax induced price increase on public health outcomes.
Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate  is an important first line agent for antiretroviral therapy  in North America and Europe because of its proven effectiveness, favorable toxicity profile, and demonstrated regimen durability. In contrast, introduction of TDF into first line therapy has been limited in resource constrained settings, particularly in sub Saharan Africa. Although experience with the agent has been favorable within clinical trials, the cost of TDF has been a major barrier to widespread use.
The innate immune system uses pattern recognition receptors  to recognize various pathogens based on their molecular structures. This leads to cellular activation and inflammatory cytokine production required for proper host defense . The toll like receptors  are a large family of evolutionarily conserved PRRs that recognize a range of microbial products .
Myeloid cells express an extensive collection of cell surface receptors that are involved in a diverse range of functions ranging from microbial recognition and activation of cellular responses; to cell development, migration, proliferation, maturation and survival. Of specific interest are the Group V C type lectin like receptors which are type II transmembrane proteins, with a single extracellular carbohydrate recognition domain , a transmembrane region and a cytoplasmic tail which may contain signalling motifs . Within this group is a subgroup of receptors known as the ‘Dectin 1 cluster’, which is encoded in a distinct genetic locus within the Natural Killer  gene complex .
Understanding how the pre mRNA for IgH is processed is key for understanding how secreted immunoglobulin  is made. Memory or mature B cell mRNA encodes the membrane bound B cell receptor for antigen, produced by use of the weak non consensus 5' splice site, embedded in the secretory terminal exon, and downstream membrane exons; thus resulting in usage of the strong promoter distal IgH membrane poly site. The binding of ELL2 and CstF 64 to RNAP II is dependent on phosphorylation of Ser 2 on the CTD of RNAP II.
Flower color produces some of the most beautiful displays in nature, and serves an important function in the ecology and evolution of plants by attracting animal pollinators . A molecular description of the control of floral pigmentation in a multi species group displaying various flower colors and patterns would, therefore, be of great interest for understanding the molecular bases underlying phenotypic diversification, plant pollinator interactions, and pollinator mediated speciation. Two major pigment types determine flower color in Mimulus: anthocyanins are responsible for the pink/purple color and carotenoids for the yellow .
The interaction between antigen presenting cells  and T cells is central to the initiation of adaptive immunity. The cellular and humoral components that dictate the subsequent immune response continue to be intensively studied. Consumption of critical amino acids , production of particular hormones  or cytokines , and generation of regulatory lymphocytes are suppression mechanisms attributed to APCs .
The initiation of transcription in eukaryotes is regulated by coactivators that are recruited to promoters by gene specific activators . Monoubiquitination of H2B at Lys123 in yeast is catalyzed by the E2/E3 pair, Rad6/Bre1 , which triggers recruitment of the Set1 containing COMPASS complex . Set1 can either di  or trimethylate histone H3 at Lys4 , which is a prerequisite for engaging SAGA .
The incidence of new HIV infections related to injection drug use has remained at 1520% in the United States over the past decade . Substance abuse treatment is also part of this paradigm and has contributed toward decreasing HIV risk among those ready to abstain from drug use  . Most studies have recruited persons who are primarily at risk for sexual transmission .
The blood brain barrier  is a diffusion barrier present in all areas of the brain consisting of endothelial cells, astrocyte end feet, and pericytes ; however, in some brain structures , the BBB is incomplete or leaky . BBB endothelial cells have no fenestrations, more extensive tight junctions than the rest of the body, and sparse pinocytic vesicular transport . Several methods, some involving ultrasound, have been investigated to increase the permeability of the BBB to drugs, antibodies, and gene transfer .
Prostate cancer  is the most commonly diagnosed cancer in men, with occurrence of metastasis to the bone in almost 80% of advanced metastatic disease . The mechanisms by which prostate cancers are induced to metastasize to bone and successfully grow tumors rely on a tight interplay between the tumor and the tissue micro environment. Among these are osteocalcin , osteopontin , bone sialoprotein , matrix metalloproteinases  and Wnt factors , which are linked to disease prognosis.
Major depression in older adults, or Late Life Depression , is a prevalent and debilitating psychiatric disorder that is commonly linked to a wide range of cognitive dysfunctions . LLD is most often associated with deficits of executive functioning, i.e. the depression dysexecutive syndrome of late life , which is often conceptualized as representing individuals with concurrent cerebrovascular disease . Further, there is considerable heterogeneity in the types, severity, and overall number of cognitive impairments reported in LLD samples .
Colorectal cancer is the third most commonly diagnosed cancer among men and women in the United States . Despite screening and decreasing incidence rates over the past few decades, colorectal cancer is expected to account for 89% of all cancer deaths in 2008 . Conclusions from recent review articles of observational studies strongly support the hypothesis that higher levels of vitamin D  reduce risk of colorectal cancer .
Chemotactic cell migration plays an important role in tumor invasion by directing the spread of tumor cells towards growth factors. Tumor cells can move while attached to each other, which often occurs at early stage of cancer progression. By generating PIP3 at the proximity of chemoattractant, PI3Ks activity defines the leading edge of the migrating cell .
Colorectal cancer  is the third most common cancer diagnosed among U.S. men and women with ~130,000 new cases diagnosed each year. Six percent of all Americans, 1 out of 17, will develop CRC , and only ~5% to 10% of these cancers are explained by a specific genetic susceptibility. A long standing issue in cancer biology has been attributing the cause of cancer to environment and genetic factors.
Weight perception, which refers to the perception of one’s body shape, is an important dimension of body image concern and plays a significant role in related behaviors. The negative psychological effects of poor body image and distorted weight perception, such as low self esteem, anxiety and depression, have been reported in some studies conducted in Western societies. Participants who perceive themselves as overweight may often feel isolated or discriminated against in social situations.
Cystic fibrosis  is caused by an autosomal recessive mutation in the gene that encodes for the chloride channel cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator gene . Most CF patients die as a result of airway obstruction due to the excessive inflammatory response to chronic lung infection with the opportunistic bacterial pathogen P. aeruginosa . Despite advances in treatments, there remains no cure.
We evaluated the role of glutathione related genotypes on overall survival, time to progression, adverse events, and quality of life  in stage IIIB/IV non small cell lung cancer patients who were stable or responding from initial treatment with platinum based chemotherapy and subsequently randomized to receive daily oral carboxyaminoimidazole or a placebo . Of the 186 total patients, 113 had initial treatment with platinum therapy and DNA samples of whom 46 also had QOL data. These samples were analyzed using six polymorphic DNA markers that encode five important enzymes in the glutathione metabolic pathway.
Over the last 55 million years of evolution, the rodent clade has had considerable success and diversification, radiating into some 28 families, 400 genera and over 2000 extant species . Given that tree squirrels are also skilled in climbing and exploring the fine branches of their arboreal niche, and use their forepaws to manipulate food items, as do most primates, it is not surprising that their sensorimotor system and cortex are well developed and proportionately large with as many as five somatosensory areas . The auditory cortex has also been explored in squirrels and several auditory areas have been described .
There is a proliferation of genomewide association  studies worldwide. Indeed, recent months have seen an explosion of publications on genetic variants influencing human quantitative traits, such as height , body mass index  , and lipid levels . Method  analyzes cases and controls together and includes the disease status as a covariate in the model .
Rheumatoid arthritis  is a systemic autoimmune disorder primarily characterized by the inflammation and degradation of synovial joints, affecting an estimated 0.6% of all adults in the United States . The development of increasingly effective disease modifying therapies has dramatically improved the prognosis of individuals with RA over the past 20 years. Nonetheless, broad differences in health outcomes persist among patients .
In cardiac muscle cells, the ion motive ATPase SERCA2a sequesters calcium  by transporting it across the membrane of the sarcoplasmic reticulum . The rate of uptake of Ca from the cytoplasm largely determines the rate of muscle relaxation during the diastolic phase of the cardiac cycle. Thus, SERCA2a activity is an important determinant of both cardiac relaxation  and contraction .
The brain plays a key role in the regulation of arterial blood pressure via baroreflex mechanisms and by altering chronic efferent sympathetic tone. In particular, alterations in renal sympathetic nerve activity  that influence hormones affecting renal function and urinary salt and water excretion contribute to determining the long term level of blood pressure . Importantly, in the two kidney one clip  model of renovascular hypertension  excitatory synaptic inputs to the RVLM are increased.
Bevacizumab improves survival in patients with advanced non small cell lung cancer . This phase II clinical trial assessed the effects of the addition of bevacizumab to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in resectable non squamous NSCLC . Patients with resectable stage IB IIIA non squamous NSCLC were treated with bevacizumab followed by imaging 2 weeks later to assess single agent effect.
The prevalence of diet related chronic diseases, including obesity, diabetes, heart disease, and cancer, disproportionately burdens rural populations in the United States. . Rural residents tend to consume fewer fruits and vegetables than their urban counterparts , and low income rural residents have particularly low levels of fruit and vegetable consumption .
The progesterone receptor  is an estrogen regulated protein found in female reproductive tissues and in many breast tumors, and it can serve as a target for various endocrine therapies, including the treatment of the breast cancer. PR could also be used as a target for diagnostic imaging and radiotherapy of breast cancer by the administration of a suitably radiolabeled PR ligand that accumulates in receptor positive tumors, where it can be detected and quantified by imaging. Therefore, the development of PR ligands with potential for both diagnostic imaging and radiotherapy is an area of great current interest .
Containing the costs of alcohol and drug treatment has become a major goal for state and local governments that fund treatment . One repercussion has been an increase in less expensive outpatient services and a decrease in more costly residential and inpatient treatment. They are particularly limited in terms of addressing the needs of homeless clients who face constant obstacles to their health and safety as well as their sobriety.
Patellofemoral pain is one of the most common disorders of the knee, accounting for 25% of all knee injuries seen in sports medicine clinics . The incidence of patellofemoral pain is greater in women compared to men, particularly in young athletes . Physical therapy interventions for patients with patellofemoral pain often focus on altering recruitment of the medial and lateral components of the vasti .
Neutrophils represent the dominant population of white blood cells in circulation and the first responders to bacterial and fungal infections. Neutrophils are also involved in various chronic and acute inflammatory conditions ranging from atherosclerosis to burn injury. Both neutropenia  and neutrophilia  require additional clinical investigation whenever detected.
Each year in the United States, over 4,000 women die from cervical cancer, almost all cases of which are caused by persistent infection with human papillomavirus  . The highest priority for prevention are women disproportionately affected by cervical cancer mortality, including women who are racial and ethnic minorities, those with low socioeconomic status, and those who have not been recently screened . Patterns of disparities in cervical cancer mortality have changed little in recent decades, despite the broader success of provider based cervical cancer screening programs that have dramatically reduced the burden of disease in the general population .
Quantitative comparison of rate constants for the reactions of individual RNA sequence variants is an essential experimental tool for determining the biological specificity and catalytic properties of ribozymes, ribonucleases and RNA processing factors. This direct approach is best, but it can be time consuming and precision may be limited by variation in enzyme specific activity, difficulty controlling reaction conditions between experimental trials, as well as inaccuracies or non linearity in quantification of substrate or product concentrations . Internal competition is an alternative method for quantifying enzyme rate constants that involves analyzing the change in the ratios of concentrations of alternative substrates or products as a function of reaction progress in reactions containing multiple substrates.
Prostate cancer has a protracted natural history. In the absence of definitive local therapy, the 15 year prostate cancer specific mortality  is approximately 20%. This risk may be substantially less among men living in regions where screening with prostate specific antigen  is prevalent, given the 511 year lead time with screening.
Cellular sensing of viral pathogens by the host activates inflammatory gene expression and triggers cell death. Innate antiviral cytokines such as interferon  have long been considered central to control of viral spread , with caspase dependent apoptotic cell death viewed as a complementary, evolutionarily conserved clearance mechanism triggered by distinct signals. These include  caspase inhibitors, such as baculovirus p35 , viral inhibitors of apoptosis  , poxvirus crmA  and viral FLICE  inhibitory proteins  , as well as,  mitochondrial cell death suppressors such as viral Bcl 2 homologs and other proteins encoded by large DNA viruses that block cytochrome c release from mitochondria .
IL 17 is a member of a newly identified cytokine family produced predominantly by Th17 cell . IL 17 enhances T cell priming and stimulates fibroblasts, endothelial cells, neutrophils, macrophages, and epithelial cells to produce multiple pro inflammatory mediators, including IL 1, IL 6, TNF α, NOS 2, metalloproteinases and chemokines . In humans, expression of IL 17 has been detected in sera and target tissues of patients with systemic rheumatic diseases, multiple sclerosis, inflammatory bowel disease and asthma.
Approximately 20% of the U.S. population is significantly affected by pain lasting at least 6 months,,  most commonly back pain, joint pain and headache. Individuals with non cancer pain conditions  now commonly receive opioids as treatment for their NCPC. Several factors make the subgroup of NCPC patients with MH and SUDs particularly important to study.
Glycine receptors  are the main mediators of fast synaptic inhibition in the spinal cord and brainstem . In particular, in the ventral area of the lumbar spinal cord, GlyRs activation is responsible for the control of left right and flexor extensor alternation during locomotor rhythms . A detailed knowledge of the kinetics of GlyRs at the single channel level is necessary in order to understand the properties and behaviour of glycine mediated synaptic transmission.
Traumatic brain injury  is a major public health concern for children 014 years, with an estimated annual incidence of 435,000 emergency department visits and 37,000 hospitalizations . Long term neurobehavioral impairments are well documented following moderate to severe TBI in both younger and older children . Similarly,  observed that children who sustained severe TBI during early childhood  performed more poorly than children with mild TBI on measures of attention and processing speed out to 5 years post injury.
Adjustments to microvascular network structure occur in several ways. New capillaries are formed by sprouting from pre existing microvessels through angiogenesis, while arterioles grow into larger diameter channels through arteriogenesis. Monocytes, in particular, facilitate arteriogenesis and angiogenesis as growth factor sources .
The adenine nucleotide translocase  catalyzes the reversible exchange of ADP for ATP with a 1:1 stoichiometry across the inner mitochondrial membrane . We have previously developed a technique to measure mitochondrial ADP ATP exchange rates by exploiting the specific feature of ANT to transport only the free ADP and ATP forms, unbound to Mg2+ . Changes in free extramitochondrial  were attributed exclusively to the ANT because they exhibit virtually 100% sensitivity to carboxyatractyloside  in the submicromolar range , while all other known nucleotide transporters are insensitive to inhibition by cATR .
Neural tube defects  are one of the most common birth defects in the United States, occurring in 2/10,000 births annually. A variety of clinical abnormalities can result. Despite all of the positive results from epidemiologic studies and interventions regarding folate, the mechanisms underlying the relationship of folate status and NTD risk are not fully understood.
reported a patient with Hodgkin lymphoma , subacute cerebellar degneration, and antibodies that stained cerebellar Purkinje neurons in a characteristic pattern. These findings were further described in a case series in 1992 by Hammack et al. This characteristic staining pattern was termed anti Tr after the lead investigator on the oriniginal report and was subsequently identified in other patients with paraneoplasitc cerebellar degeneration, about 90% of whom had HL., Patients with paraneoplastic cerebellar degeneration typically have progressive nystagmus, limb ataxia, dysarthria, and gait ataxia.
Tubal ligation and hysterectomy are commonly performed operations  that have been associated with a lower risk of ovarian cancer, particularly endometrioid tumors . We recently reported that the benefits of tubal ligation were stronger for women who received the procedure at the time of last delivery and a suggestion that hysterectomy is more protective at older ages in a case control study of ovarian cancer . Few other studies have examined the impact of details of the surgical procedures or characteristics of the women receiving these surgeries on the associations between tubal ligation or hysterectomy and ovarian cancer.
Due to the changing linguistic demographics of the United States, specifically the large influx of Spanish speakers , it is imperative that the audiology community considers appropriate test alternatives for the assessment of speech perception abilities of children who speak English as their second language. Though listeners attending to their second language  in quiet often have good speech recognition scores, performance tends to be significantly poorer for these same listeners compared to their monolingual counterparts when they are asked to listen in the presence of competing noise . Another consideration is the linguistic history of the tester.
Despite multiple advances in the treatment for breast cancer, the mortality rate remains high. An estimated 40,500 breast cancer deaths are expected yearly in the US. Breast cancer is therefore the most common female cancer in the United States and the second most common cause of cancer death in women.
Computational enzyme design has been used to create catalysts for a wide range of reactions , but considerable challenges remain in both increasing the fraction of designs that have activity and increasing the overall level of activity. The in silico design process proceeds in three stages:  construction of an idealized active site description, or theozyme;  placement of the theozyme in a suitable protein scaffold; and  optimization of the surrounding sequence for transition state binding. Catalysis is initiated by attack of a reactive lysine on the carbonyl group of the β hydroxy ketone substrate to form a tetrahedral carbinolamine intermediate that subsequently breaks down to give a protonated Schiff base.
Sepsis is a major public health problem throughout the world.
