The Drosophila paradigm for patterning the anterior posterior  axis has provided a touchstone for comparative studies of segmentation in other insects and arthropods . One surprising outcome of the Drosophila screens was the revelation that the blastoderm is transiently organized into parasegments by the pair rule genes . For instance, the pair rule gene fushi tarazu  is expressed in odd numbered parasegments that straddle segment boundaries .
Merlin is a tumour suppressor whose loss leads to the formation of benign tumours of the nervous system, mainly schwannomas and meningiomas that are also hallmarks of the inherited disease neurofibromatosis type 2 . P21 activated kinase  phosphorylates merlin and is inhibited by merlin in a negative feedback loop. PAK is thus being regarded as potential therapeutic target in NF2 .
Habituation to redundant sensory input, or sensory gating, has been studied utilizing electroencephalography  recordings of a paired click auditory stimulus. These studies have largely focused on habituation of the primary auditory response approximately 50 ms after presentation of the stimulus . Gating is the reduction in amplitude of response to the second click relative to the first click measured as the event related brain potential .
It is well recognized that exposure to air pollutants can cause the exacerbation of asthma and cardiovascular diseases  and inflammation related processes are known to play a key role in these effects . Consistent with this notion, air pollution particles have been shown to activate Nf κB and up regulate pro inflammatory genes such as eotaxin and interleukins  . Ambient air pollutants contain chemicals present in both the vapor  and particle phases, but most health assessment studies have focused on ambient and exhaust particles.
The magnitude of the static magnetic fields employed in magnetic resonance imaging  has steadily increased in recent years. Three to four tesla  MRI machines are now common, and experimental MRI machines have recently been developed with field strengths of 8 T  and 9.4 T  for human studies, and 21 T for animal studies . When positioned at the homogeneous center of the magnetic field, movement of the head  generated mild to severe vertigo .
Negative mood has been proposed as an important psychological factor in the initiation, maintenance, and relapse of smoking behavior . Smokers often report greater motivation to smoke in response to increases in negative mood  and maintain strong expectancies that smoking alleviates unpleasant feelings . There is limited research on the effect of negative mood states on smoking behavior via non stressful induction methods such as exposure to images and/or sounds intended to elicit a more general unpleasant state .
Endometrial carcinoma is the most common gynecological cancer in the United States and fourth most common cancer among women, after breast, lung, and colon cancer with 47,130 cases and 8,010 deaths reported in 2012 . There are two distinct types of endometrial cancers based on histological and molecular characteristics. Type I tumors, referred to as the endometrioid type, are generally well differentiated adenocarcinomas with or without squamous differentiation, whereas Type II, the nonendometrioid type, are uterine papillary serous and clear cell carcinomas .
Neurotrophic factors have been shown to augment neuronal survival, function and axon growth in numerous animal models of neuronal degeneration and nervous system injury. However, clinical translation of neurotrophic factor therapy has been hampered by the inability of these proteins to traverse the blood brain barrier and reach target areas of the CNS, and by dose limiting adverse effects from broad exposure of non targeted structures in the CNS and PNS . This has led to several clinical trials delivering trophic factors by ex vivo and in vivo gene therapy in neurodegenerative disorders such as Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease .
Cardiovascular disease, the leading cause of death worldwide, accounts for one in three deaths in the United States and is primarily driven by atherosclerosis. Atherosclerosis progression ultimately results in a toxic microenvironment in which dead or dying lipid laden foam cells are sequestered from the circulation by a VSMC derived fibrous cap. We sought to identify novel, potentially atheroprotective genes in a previous study, in which we conducted a transcript screen for alternately regulated genes in human arteries versus veins and other tissues.
Although lipopolysaccharide  induced proinflammatory molecules are indispensable for counteracting the growth and dissemination of gram negative bacteria, overproduction can lead to sepsis syndrome, also known as endotoxin shock. The occurrence of endotoxin tolerance has been reported in several disease settings, including sepsis, trauma, surgery, and pancreatitis, underlining its clinical significance. Pharmacologic modulation of LPS responsive genes to accelerate the onset of endotoxin tolerance would be beneficial in clinical settings dominated by acute hyperinflammatory responses to infection.
Criminal violence is one of the most burdensome public health issues worldwide, with staggering socio economic repercussions . The urgent need to develop effective strategies for the prevention of criminal violence has recently given impetus to new research efforts aimed at identifying its psychobiological causes. These investigations have revealed that the propensity towards criminal violence is underpinned by a complex interplay of genetic and socio environmental factors ; the exact nature of these interactions, however, remains poorly understood, also in consideration of the ethical, legal and logistic concerns raised by genetic studies in criminal offenders .
RNA viruses, which have small genomes with limited coding potential, depend on recruited host factors during the replication process. While many of the identified genes are important for RNA virus replication, other host genes were found inhibitory by reducing the accumulation of the viral RNA. Tomato bushy stunt virus  has emerged as one of highly suitable model virus systems to study RNA virus replication and host   virus interaction due to the recent development of the highly tractable yeast as a model host  and cell free approaches .
Carotid intima media thickness , a validated surrogate measure of cardiovascular risk , is increased in diabetes . The Diabetes Control and Complications Trial   glucose reduction interventions in a Type 1 diabetic cohort produced subsequent reductions in CVD event rates  which were heralded by reduced rates of IMT progression . Alpha glucosidase inhibitors improve glucose control in part by delaying glucose digestion, thereby allowing better matching of the endogenous insulin response with glucose absorption.
Receptor mediated activation of protein kinase Cs  via Gαq and phospholipase C signaling is implicated in myocardial contractile abnormalities, cardiac hypertrophy, and the progression to heart failure , . Of the twelve recognized PKC isoenzymes , myocardium expresses significant amounts of four: two “conventional” isoenzymes  and two “novel” isoemzymes . The canonical mechanism for PKC activation is via phospholipase C  mediated increases in cytosolic free calcium and phospholipids.
Tympanoplasty and ossiculoplasty, which are widely used to overcome conductive hearing loss due to middle ear pathology, rely on coupling sound pressure in the ear canal to the oval window  of the cochlea. The method of coupling ear canal sound to the OW can work for many middle ear pathologies, but has a significant failure rate , and is often not feasible for others, e.g., congenital aural atresia  . In experiments in the cat, Wever and Lawrence  and Voss et al.
More than half of incident cancer cases and two thirds of cancer deaths already occur in developing countries. In sub Saharan Africa, cancer incidence is expected to increase drastically over the next few decades due to multiple factors, notably increased life expectancy and westernized lifestyles as well as increased quality of diagnostics. Though cancer registration is indispensable as an accurate and longitudinal measure of the true burden of disease and thus to inform national cancer control programs,, only 11% of the population in Africa is covered by a cancer registry, and only 1% of African populations are covered by high quality population based cancer registries.
The cystic fibrosis transmembrane conductance regulator  is a membrane bound protein composed of 1480 amino acids with a mass of 168,142 Da and 180,000 Da after glycosylation. There are 2 nucleotide binding domains, NBD1 and NBD2. NBD1 is formed by residues 377637, while NBD2 consists of residues 11751430.
Lung cancer is a major cause of disease burden and loss of life in the United States and worldwide. More people die of lung cancer in the United States than from colon, breast, and prostate cancers combined. The American Cancer Society estimates that there will be 215,020 new cases of lung cancer and 161,840 deaths attributed to lung cancer in 2008.
Perivascular adipose tissue  is a fat depot just beginning to be appreciated for the contributions it makes to vascular function, human health and disease . For example, removal of PVAT enhanced arterial contraction to an exogenous agonist. While studying the role of kynurenines in PVAT induced depression of contraction , we made the novel observation that PVATs in the rat contain substantial concentrations of catecholamines, including dopamine , norepinephrine  and adrenaline .
The JIL 1 tandem kinase in Drosophila localizes specifically to euchromatic interband regions of polytene chromosomes and is the predominant kinase controlling the phosphorylation state of histone H3S10 at interphase . JIL 1 is essential for viability and reduced levels of JIL 1 protein leads to a global disruption of chromosome structure  as well as to extensive ectopic spreading of heterochromatic factors . Recently, based on analyses of transcriptionally active regions during the heat shock response  an alternative model was proposed where JIL 1 is required for transcription by the RNA polymerase II  machinery .
Spinal cord injury  destroys neural and glial elements and severs the axonal connections between the motor and sensory systems leading to permanent and often devastating loss of function . Neural stem and progenitor cells comprise a promising resource for the treatment of traumatic spinal cord injury. NPCs derived from human embryonic and induced pluripotent stem cells  have also shown efficacy .
Through the formation of tight junctions joining the endothelial cells of capillaries in the brain, the blood brain barrier  acts to restrict and regulate the exchange of substances between the general circulation and the central nervous system . As such, the integrity of the BBB is critical to neuronal health since it protects the brain from toxins, facilitates nutrient transport, and maintains ion balance. One explanation is that the sensitivity of DCE MRI may not be adequate to detect subtle changes in BBB permeability due to insufficient leakage of contrast agent into the interstitial space.
Microphthalmia associated transcription factor , the master regulator of melanocyte differentiation, promotes melanocyte lineage survival and plays a key role in melanoma progression. MITF can inhibit proliferation by directly activating expression of the cyclin dependent kinase inhibitors, p21CIP1 and p16INK4A . Thus, SWI/SNF subunit composition is an important determinant of SWI/SNF specificity .
Oxygen homeostasis is vital for proper functioning and fluctuations in oxygen metabolism can have detrimental consequences on biological organisms. Organisms have evolved signaling pathways to deal with oxidative damage to macromolecules, particularly DNA. Damaged cells subsequently activate signaling pathways regulating DNA repair and/or cell death.
The mammalian tachykinin family of neuropeptides that includes substance P, neurokinin A, neurokinin B, neuropeptide K and neuropeptide gamma exert their biological actions through G protein coupled receptors termed neurokinin 1, neurokinin 2, and neurokinin 3  . Activation of NK 3 receptors primarily causes phosphoinositol 4, 5 biphosphate  breakdown into 1,4,5 inositol triphosphate  and diacylglycerol through phospholipase C activation , eventually leading to Ca2+ mobilization and induction of Ca2+ dependent downstream signaling pathways . NK 3 receptors are found peripherally on nerve endings of primary afferent neurons innervating the respiratory, gastrointestinal and urinary tracts , however they are also differentially expressed in the central nervous system.
The prevalence rates of Alzheimer’s disease , obesity, type 2 diabetes mellitus , and nonalcoholic fatty liver disease /non alcoholic steatohepatitis , which includes metabolic syndrome, have all increased dramatically over the past several decades . This concept is supported by epidemiologic data demonstrating a significant association between T2DM and MCI or dementia, and that T2DM is a significant risk factor for developingAD . Mechanistically, increased risk of dementia in T2DM and obesity could be linked to chronic hyperglycemia, insulin resistance, oxidative stress, accumulation of advanced glycation end products, increased production of pro inflammatory cytokines, and/or microvascular disease .
Cannabinoid CB1Rs are members of a large group of G protein coupled receptors  extensively expressed in mammalian brain tissue . CB1Rs are located largely on axon terminals in the CNS and are activated by diverse agonists, including plant derived compounds such as Δ9 THC, synthetic agonists such as WIN55,212 2, and by membrane lipid derived endogenous cannabinoids  . Activation of CB1Rs on axon terminals by these agonists inhibits neurotransmitter release throughout the CNS .

Rather, most have contrasted infants’ preference for speech and non speech sounds. Likewise, in gesture production,  found a greater acceptance of verbal rather than gestural labels between 1620 months  .
English proficiency is associated with alcohol use in some immigrants groups, but little is known about its association among Arab Americans. Ethnographic work suggests gender, religion, education, and age influence prevalence of alcohol use among Arab Americans . Two year prospective study of recent Iraqi refugees and non Iraqi Arab immigrants in Michigan using bilingual surveys and interviewers .
Cervical spondylomyelopathy  commonly affects Great Danes. In addition, since Great Danes are usually affected with the osseous associated form of cervical spondylomyelopathy,, survey radiographs will frequently reveal osteoarthritic changes and sclerosis of the cervical vertebral articular processes.,,, Occasionally, vertebral body malformations may also be found.,, Similar methods have been reported for quantifying cervical vertebral malformation in horses, and cervical spondylotic myelopathy in people. In order to improve accuracy and minimize effects of magnification errors, a ratio method has been proposed.
As of 2010, there were an estimated 34 million people were living with HIV worldwide, with nearly 70% of these individuals in sub  Saharan Africa. To date, HIV reverse transcriptase inhibitors, including non nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors , nucleoside reverse transcriptase inhibitors  and nucleotide reverse transcriptase inhibitors  are major components of highly active antiretroviral therapy  used as first line therapies for the treatment of HIV infection. For these reasons new drugs are needed to maintain therapeutic options for patients failing on currently available therapies .
The emergence of the swine origin influenza H1N1 pandemic demonstrates quite plainly the potential threat of influenza viruses . In addition, annual influenza epidemics are responsible for significant mortality and morbidity . Alternatives to egg and cell culture derived vaccine approaches, like recombinant haemagglutinin  expressed in E. coli and insect cells, influenza virus like particles  expressed in insect cells, mammalian cells or plants, and influenza DNA vaccines have been established  .
The colon is lined with a single layer of epithelial cells which invade into the underlying mesenchyme to form tubular glands called crypts of Lieberkühn. These cells fuel the rapid renewal  of colonic epithelial cells on the luminal aspect where most of the non proliferative cells are positioned. This polarity of cellular organization is thought to be maintained by a balance of biochemical and biophysical in vivo microenvironments, including gradients of soluble factors  across the basal luminal axis, and biophysical interactions with supporting cells  and their secreted extracellular matrices.
Thymomas are rare neoplasms accounting for only 0.2% to 1.5% of all malignancies . Despite their rarity, they comprise about 20% of all mediastinal masses and account for up to 50% of anterior mediastinal masses  Patients with thymoma are frequently diagnosed with paraneoplastic syndromes, the most common of which is myasthenia gravis . Multiple studies also suggest that patients diagnosed with thymoma are at an increased risk of developing second primary malignancies, with a reported frequency ranging from 8 to 28%  .
Protein kinase CK2  is a ubiquitous serine/threonine protein kinase that phosphorylates more than 300 substrates in the cell and is involved in a variety of biological processes, including cell proliferation, migration, differentiation, apoptosis, circadian rhythms, and angiogenesis . In cell culture, different chemical and antisense inhibitors of CK2 were shown to induce apoptosis of various cells . In vivo, antisense oligonucleotide to CK2α catalytic subunit was able to inhibit growth of xenografted tumors .
Colon cancer is among the leading causes of cancer related deaths in the world’s developed countries. For example, if cellular homeostasis between cell growth and cell death is disrupted, clonal expansion could ensue to result in the overproduction of transformed cells. Eicosapentaenoic acid  and docosahexaenoic acid  are two typical n 3 PUFA found in fish oil.
Postsynaptic responses critically depend on the type of presynaptic terminals and the number and arrangement of synapses . In case of excitatory transmission, these parameters show great variability. However, giant excitatory terminals, which target proximal dendritic regions or somata and establish contacts via a large number of synapses, have also been described .
Increasing evidence indicates that the biological heterogeneity of breast cancers has clinical and epidemiologic implications. Classifying invasive breast cancers into distinct subtypes based on tumor histology is especially relevant in this regard: the distinct patterns of growth and cellular organization , chromosomal alterations , and tumor marker expression  associated with different histologic types of breast cancer suggest distinct etiologies. Consistent with these biological distinctions, some epidemiologic studies have reported that histologic subtypes of breast cancer differ in their associations with established breast cancer risk factors  .
The insulin like growth factor II receptor  is a transmembrane receptor that primarily binds IGF II, resulting in the degradation of IGF II by internalization and transport to the lysosomes. By removing IGF II from the extracellular environment and precluding its activation of the insulin like growth factor I receptor , IGF2R is believed to reduce the mitogenic effects of IGF II . Loss of heterozygosity at the IGF2R locus has been reported in breast carcinomas, and somatic missense mutations of the remaining allele have shown alteration in ligand binding .
A prior localized inflammatory response  or a period of unpredictable sound stress  produce long term changes in the duration and second messenger signaling pathway for inflammatory mediator induced mechanical hyperalgesia. This change involves a switch from Gs to Gi in the G protein that mediates inflammatory mediator induced mechanical hyperalgesia . While this type of switch in second messenger signaling pathways, from Gs to Gi, has previously been reported for β2 adrenergic receptor  signaling in cardiac myocytes, caused by chronic exposure to receptor agonists such as epinephrine , in cardiac muscle cells this involves an increased Gi mediated inhibition of adenylyl cyclase, which would be expected to attenuate rather than enhance mechanical hyperalgesia .
Perhaps the largest public health initiative in the western world has focused on improvement of diet, particularly in those with a high risk of cardiovascular disease. Trials have shown that diets rich in fruits and vegetables reduce blood pressure ; and adverse cardiovascular events . This nitrite is swallowed and in the acidic environment of the stomach is reduced to nitric oxide  or re enters the circulation as nitrite.
Peer and parental influences have long been noted as key socialization forces affecting adolescent development. Adolescence is a critical time period during which youth form friendships, and simultaneously engage in substance use behaviors such as cigarette smoking within their peer networks. It is also a time during which the initiation and subsequent fueling of long term smoking trajectories occur , as most adult smokers begin in adolescence .
The process of T cell activation in secondary lymphoid organs  is accompanied by the up regulation of several different adhesion proteins and chemokine receptors associated with recruitment to sites of inflammation in peripheral tissues . The α4β7 integrin and CCR9 are associated with specific homing of CD4  and CD8  T cells to the gut, and the ligands for P selectin and E selectin  have been associated with CD4  and CD8  T cell homing to the skin. Initial studies analyzing CD4 T cells demonstrated that T cells activated in mucosal and skin sites differentially express α4β7 and PSL .
One in every 50 children undergoes a surgical procedure in their first year of life. A large body of evidence, predominantly from laboratory studies of healthy animals and to a lesser extent from children that had surgical procedures under general anesthesia at an early postnatal age, suggests that general anesthesia administered during the early postnatal period may have negative long term consequences for brain development . The mechanisms that mediate these developmental changes and the full spectrum of pathophysiological alterations induced by neonatal anesthesia, currently predominantly linked to the brain, are poorly understood .
Traumatic brain injury  is a leading cause of death and disability for over 1.5 million Americans annually . These shortcomings emphasize the need for novel approaches to limit post traumatic edema . Aquaporins  are a family of water channels that permit selective, bidirectional water movement in response to the osmotic gradient .
Tissue engineering approaches to skeletal muscle regeneration using both in vitro and in vivo means have been met with limited success, largely due to an inability to provide adequate vascularization. We have previously identified a method by which prevascular tissues are formed from scaffold free self assembly of human endothelial and fibroblast cells,. During 3 days of in vitro culture, cells self organized capillary scale networks of endothelial cells and synthesized an extracellular matrix containing at least laminin, fibronectin, and collagen type I to form prevascular tissue constructs.
Previous research has demonstrated that a relationship exists between external bone size and tissue level mechanical properties . Further, variation in tissue modulus among individuals was shown to arise through modulation of both mineralization and porosity . Specifically, slender tibiae  had a lower porosity and higher ash content than more robust tibiae .
Despite advances in modern chemotherapy, CLL remains incurable. Various clinical observations suggest that CLL cells are susceptible to T cell cytotoxicity. These include ‘spontaneous’ remission of the disease during increased immunity , responses to α interferons  and the graft versus leukemia effect following allogeneic stem cell transplant .
The hepatitis C virus  infects 3% of the world population and is mainly responsible for liver transplantation in patients with cirrhosis in developed countries . Furthermore, HCV is the most common chronic blood borne pathogen in the United States  affecting 1.8% of the population and is the major etiologic factor responsible for the recent doubling of hepatocellular carcinoma   . HCV infection is currently treated by the combination of pegylated interferon α , ribavirin, and the recently approved NS3/4A protease inhibitors which have led to an increased sustained virological response  compared with PEG IFN and ribavirin alone, but also increased adverse events including anemia and gastrointestinal symptoms .
Human embryonic stem cells  are derived from the inner cell mass of the blastocyst stage of development, characterized by a unique capacity for indefinite self renewal, while maintaining an ability to differentiate into specialized cells . The safety of hESCs and their derivatives is an important concern in regenerative medicine. The apparent parallels between stem cell self renewal and cancer cell proliferation have led to speculation that a common network of genes may regulate these traits, and that tight control of these genes during the lineage specification process of pluripotent stem cells into quiescent cellular lineages is critical for avoiding tumor formation .
Oxford Houses are democratically run recovery home systems that serve over 10,000 individuals in the United States . The democratic, self run property of Oxford Houses differentiates them from many recovery models; instead of employing staff to manage day to day house operations, house members elect house officials to take on these responsibilities. There are no limits on how long a resident can stay in a house.
The production of new neurons in the adult mammalian brain is predominantly restricted to two areas, the subventricular zone  and the hippocampal subgranular zone  . Whether neurogenesis continues in the normal adult cerebral cortex, either from SVZ neural stem cells  , or from intrinsic neural progenitors within cortex  remains controversial , though formation of new cortical interneurons from subventricular zone or intrinsic cortical progenitors following cerebral injury has been well documented . In the present study, we provide genetic fate mapping evidence for the de novo formation of glutamatergic pyramidal neurons from oligodendroglial progenitor cells  within the normal adult murine piriform cortex .
Acute pancreatitis  was once considered an uncommon disease of childhood. This concept changed with publication of single center experiences in the United States, Mexico and Australia describing increased rates of pancreatitis in children within the last few decades . Most children with pancreatitis have a single, mild, acute episode that resolves without complications.
Huntington’s disease  is a progressive neurodegenerative disease caused by an expansion of a CAG repeat in the Huntingtin  gene . Although the disease is monogenic and the etiology is known, there is no current treatment . Since then, it has been shown that short hairpin RNA  delivered by viral vectors leads to a decrease in Htt protein and associated pathology ; however, shRNAs can be toxic when integrated into the genome .
Overweight and obesity are common, affecting more than 1.1 billion individuals worldwide. In several industrialised countries, approximately two thirds of the adult population is classified as overweight or obese on the basis of having a body mass index  in excess of 25 kg/m2. In addition to reducing life expectancy, excess weight is an independent risk factor for a wide spectrum of chronic disorders, in particular, type 2 diabetes, cardiovascular disease  and some site specific cancers.
A fundamental question in developmental biology is the degree to which embryogenesis is stereotyped versus stochastic. In vertebrates and many other species, however, embryonic development generates predictable patterns but is not invariant from embryo to embryo. Fate mapping with single cell resolution is not straightforward in vertebrate embryos and other embryos with large cell numbers, so it is possible that their cell lineages and movements may be more stereotyped than currently believed, or that hidden patterns may emerge from finer scale analysis.
Recent decades have seen substantial increases in the prevalence and severity of asthma, a complex inflammatory disorder of the airways. Although the unifying pathophysiological feature of asthma is airway hyperresponsiveness  leading to dynamic airflow obstruction, the clinical expression of disease is heterogeneous. For instance, a large percentage of asthmatics are atopic, with elevated serum immunoglobulin E ; others have no evidence of atopy.
The spliceosome is a highly dynamic RNA protein machine requiring the ordered binding and release of 5 small nuclear ribonucleoprotein particles  to the intron containing pre mRNA. In this complex, U4 snRNA is extensively base paired to U6 snRNA. Despite the presence of all 5 essential snRNAs, this form of the spliceosome is catalytically inactive; the two sequential trans esterification reactions require the unwinding of U4 from U6 and the coordinated release of U1 snRNP.
The normal, alert conscious state is critical for functioning in the real world. However, the mechanisms of impaired consciousness in temporal lobe seizures are not well understood. Impaired consciousness occurs in disorders that either directly reduce function of the cerebral cortex, or indirectly affect the cortex through disruption of subcortical activating systems.
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  comprise a diverse family of ligand gated ion channels  that are expressed throughout the vertebrate central and peripheral nervous systems. Twelve neuronal nAChR subunits have been identified . Subunit composition determines the localization and the physiological and pharmacological properties of each receptor subtype.
Aging and atherosclerosis are accompanied by geometric, material, and consequentially, deformational changes in arteries. For example, age is correlated with a decrease in elastin content in the abdominal aorta concomitant with increased diameter, and increased stiffness as evidenced by decreased diametric pulsatility and increased pulse propagation speed . While these effects have been well documented in relation to the radial/circumferential structure of arteries, they are not well understood in relation to the longitudinal direction .
Elevated triglyceride , low high density lipoprotein cholesterol , and elevated small, dense low density lipoprotein particles  have been established as important risk factors for cardiovascular diseases  . Several studies have revealed ethnic difference in the variation in lipid/lipoprotein traits . Compared to other ethnic groups, despite a higher prevalence of hyperglycemia, hypertension, and obesity, the prevalence of hypertriglyceridemia and low HDL c is lower in blacks .
Netrin 1 is a secreted molecule that is largely known to play a defined role in guiding vertebrate commissural axons in neuronal development . Recent studies have further demonstrated a critical role of netrin 1 in endothelial cell proliferation, migration and angiogenic signaling , in addition to morphogenesis of epithelial cells . These include deleted in colorectal cancer , UNC5A, B, C, D, neogenin, α6β4 and α3β1 integrins .
Developing new cancer drugs is an endeavor with a high probability of failure and extraordinary costs. This approach, called drug repurposing, builds on the available clinical safety and pharmacologic data to reduce both the cost and the time expended introducing a new drug. A candidate for this drug development paradigm may be metformin.
It is increasingly appreciated that among cigarette smokers, those with schizophrenia have elevated rates of smoking  compared to the general population  . There is evidence that nicotine, the reinforcing agent in tobacco smoke, may ameliorate cognitive and information processing deficits associated with schizophrenia , which may explain these high co morbid rates tobacco smoking in this disorder. Many cognitive deficits are present in patients with schizophrenia, including deficits in attention , executive function  verbal memory  and spatial working memory .
Hair cells  and supporting cells  in the sensory epithelium of the inner ear arise from a common progenitor . The Notch pathway determines initial specification and subsequent cell fate of sensory progenitors . Embryonic Notch signaling directs the formation of the intricate SC and HC mosaic of inner ear epithelia.
Atherosclerosis, a major cause of stroke and myocardial infarction, is an inflammatory process. These macrophages secrete pro inflammatory cytokines and ingest oxidized low density lipoprotein . Inflammatory cascades involving activated macrophages, T cells, and mast cells may also weaken plaque fibrous caps and promote plaque rupture, thrombosis, and ischemia.
Excessive alcohol drinking is a leading cause of chronic liver disease worldwide, which results in a spectrum of liver disorders, ranging from simple fatty liver to more severe forms of liver injury such as alcoholic hepatitis, cirrhosis, and hepatocellular carcinoma. , Fatty liver is the earliest response to alcohol drinking and occurs in almost everyone who drinks heavily, while more severe forms of alcoholic liver injury typically develop in up to 35% of heavy drinkers. , More severe forms of alcoholic liver disease such as alcoholic hepatitis require treatment.
Distraction osteogenesis  is a technique for skeletal expansion that uses the body’s natural healing capacity to form bone in response to mechanical tension across an osteotomy. The standard clinical DO protocol, for both the axial and craniofacial skeletons, consists of a distraction rate of 1 mm/day achieved by manually turning an activation screw 1 to 4 times daily. Attempts at increasing the rate of intermittent distraction beyond 1mm/day have generally resulted in insufficient bone formation and/or non union.
Despite recent progress in our understanding of iron absorption, iron deficiency remains the most prevalent micronutrient deficiency worldwide. Whereas dietary calcium is known to reduce the bioavailability of iron , the molecular basis of this interaction is not understood. Divalent metal ion transporter 1   is the principal or only mechanism by which nonheme iron is taken up at the intestinal brush border , reviewed .
The migration of lung DCs to lymph nodes  is critical for orchestrating adaptive immune responses against inhaled antigens or microbes . Under homeostatic conditions, CCR7 dependent migration of lung DCs to draining LN is important for the induction of regulatory T cells, which help maintain peripheral tolerance to innocuous environmental antigens . During infection or other inflammatory insults, migratory DCs become licensed to induce cytotoxic T cells or effector T helper cell differentiation .
For large segments of the population, the internet has become a primary source of information on a broad range of health issues and a means of communication. This development provides a unique opportunity for epidemiologic research, in particular the conduct of prospective cohort studies. By avoiding the expense of physical encounters, postal fees, telephone recruiters, or other more expensive approaches, a study that recruits participants and communicates with them over the internet could theoretically be conducted much more efficiently with respect to the cost of the information required.
Rotavirus  is the most common cause of severe dehydrating diarrheal disease in young children worldwide, causing up to 100 million cases and > 600,000 deaths each year . RV infections are also common in adults, especially those who interact with children, but generally cause only mild symptoms . Its genome consists of 11 dsRNA segments that each code for different rotaviral proteins.
The pigmentation of amphibian eggs and cleavage stage embryos differs dramatically from species to species, but the species can be generally categorized as having pigmented or unpigmented eggs. The evolutionary transition from pigmented to unpigmented  has occurred a number of times independently. It has been suggested that this variation represents an adaptation for protection against UV radiation from the Sun, as species that lay their eggs in the open  tend to have darkly pigmented eggs, but eggs are largely unpigmented in species in which fertilized eggs develop in a concealed location .
The deposition of amyloid β  in the extracellular space of the brain is a pathological hallmark of Alzheimer's disease . AD pathogenesis is associated with alterations in Aβ homeostasis resulting in an accumulation of Aβ peptides within the brain paranchyma  . These cells are responsible for normal tissue maintenance and continually sample the extracellular environment.
Intracerebral hemorrhage  is a common and often fatal stroke subtype that burdens approximately 1 in 5000 people every year  for which there is no treatment. Even if the patient survives the ictus, the resulting hematoma within the brain parenchyma triggers a series of events termed secondary injury, leading to brain edema, progression of neurological deficits or death . In agreement with this scheme, intra cerebral injection of lysed erythrocytes or purified Hb produces massive brain edema within less than 24h .
Practice protocols that mandate prescreening for sexually transmitted infection prior to insertion of an intrauterine device for contraception can pose obstacles for women seeking this highly effective method of birth control. Some practices screen for presumed risk factors for sexually transmitted infection in order to identify those who may be infected or those in whom laboratory testing should be obtained. The value of such criterion based screening is unclear .
In 2007, about 33 million people globally were infected with HIV 1. The number of HIV infections worldwide has been stable since 2000; however, new cases continue to increase in resource limited nations. The estimated incidence of HIV in the United States in 2006 was 56,300 affecting primarily Blacks  followed by Whites , Hispanics , Asian/Pacific Islanders  and American Indian/Alaska Natives .
Mucosal surfaces serve as both entry and transmission routes for most pathogens. Although there are studies suggesting that systemic immunization can provide mucosal protection , others have suggested that mucosal immunization is required for effective T cell dependent mucosal immunity  . There are important distinctions between different mucosal tissues.
The concept of vascular or arterial age has been proposed in several previous studies. The idea is to adjust the age of a patient based on their level of atherosclerosis. Stein et al  have developed an algorithm for calculating vascular age based on carotid IMT.
The option of multichannel cochlear implantation for patients who have sensory hearing loss has been available for the last two decades. Although it is optimal to implant children in early childhood , it is not always possible to do so. One way to do this is to assess changes in the neurophysiological brain responses as a function of experience with sound, starting with the initial stimulation of the central auditory pathways via a CI .
The adaptive immune response to intracellular parasites or bacteria is in large part dependent upon the generation of primed CD4+ T cells in secondary lymphoid organs. The clonal proliferation that accompanies priming provides for a greater number of antigen specific cells that can differentiate into effector cells capable of homing to sites of infection. The number and function of Th1 cells can be limited by the activation of regulatory T cells  and other populations of IL 10 secreting cells, including Th1 cells, which may restrain immunopathology while preventing the complete elimination of the parasite .
Hematopoietic stem cells  constantly differentiate into all blood cell lineages via distinct differentiation programs. This causes reprogramming of early lymphoid and myeloid progenitors leading to enhanced development of myeloid lineage cells but curbed production of lymphoid lineage cells . using a novel “cellular barcoding” technique .
Although colon rectal cancer  is the third leading cause of cancer death in men and women in the United States , the cellular and molecular events associated with its pathogenesis are not known to a certainty. Despite extensive research, the pathological and molecular markers for prognosis of colon cancer are still lacking. SFN has been shown to possess anti inflammatory activity, resulting in down regulation of COX 2 expression , probably through inhibition of NFκB DNA binding and transactivation of NFκB dependent genes .
Reductions of 70% or more of new AIDS diagnoses and death have been reported in the highly active antiretroviral therapy  era . As a result, older HIV infected patients are one of the fastest growing demographics, with a quintupling of AIDS patients in the U.S. over 50 years of age between 1990 2000 . The HIV epidemic also has disproportionately affected minority populations, particularly African Americans.
Protein tyrosine O sulfation is a widespread post translational modification that was suggested to affect an average of 1% of all tyrosine residues in all proteins, secreted and membrane bound, in higher order eukaryotes . Tyrosylprotein sulfotransferases  are ~50 kDa glycoproteins found in the trans Golgi network that catalyze the transfer of sulfate from the universal sulfate donor 3' phosphoadenosine 5' phosphosulfate  to the hydroxyl group of tyrosine residues within highly acidic motifs in proteins or polypeptides . In vitro substrate specificity studies using synthetic peptides indicated several differences in substrate preferences of the individual isozymes .
Oxidative stress is associated with the aging process, is a risk factor for several neurodegenerative diseases, and is decreased by reduced energy intake. Oxidative damage to cells and tissues results from reactive oxygen species production. The sulfur containing side chains of methionine and cysteine are particularly susceptible to oxidation.
Glutamate is an endogenous excitatory neurotransmitter, and it is estimated that this neurotransmitter is used by as many as one third of the synapses in the central nervous system . At high concentrations, glutamate is neurotoxic, and glutamate induced neuronal death contributes to the development of neurodegenerative diseases . Two common pathways of glutamate neurotoxicity have been described.
Single channel recordings yield important information about ion channels. The analysis of single channel recordings is based either on time course fitting or event list analysis . Event list analysis requires implementation of idealization criterion  and subsequent transformation of recorded data into list of dwell times which are classified as open and closed events .
In 2007, ~ 218,890 men in the U.S. will be diagnosed with prostate cancer , and >27,000 deaths will be attributed to the disease . Although the causes of the variation of PC incidence are likely to be related to differences in screening methods, diet and health related behaviors, clinical practice patterns, and environmental risk factors, there is a large body of literature that also strongly implicates a genetic etiology . Mitochondria can generate reactive oxygen species and activate apoptosis.
Genistein is a phytoestrogen abundant in soy . Since US FDA approved the health claims of soy diet on reducing coronary disease in 1999 , soy consumption in US has been steadily increasing  . Since genistein is a weak estrogen , its potential endocrine disruptive effects have also been identified in many studies and recognized in the NTP CERHR Expert Panel Report .
Alcohol use disorders  occur commonly in the general population, with recent estimates of their current  prevalence of 8.46% . In addition to their high prevalence, AUDs are associated with a variety of adverse medical, psychiatric, family, legal, and work related problems , with an estimated annual cost in the United States of nearly $185 billion . Not uncommonly, individuals with an alcohol use disorder are identified as needing treatment by virtue of having co occurring medical or psychiatric problems .
Prostate cancer  is the most frequently diagnosed non cutaneous male malignancy and the third leading cause of cancer related death in men in most western industrialized countries . Despite an initial efficacy of androgen deprivation therapy, most patients with PCa progress within 2 years from androgen dependent status to hormone refractory PCa, for which there is no curative therapy. Androgen receptor  signaling plays a key role in the development of hormone refractory PCa.
Nitroxyl  donors are used clinically as deterrents for alcohol use  and also exhibit anti cancer properties , protect tissue against reperfusion injury , and show promise for the treatment of heart failure . The pharmacology of HNO is generally associated with modification of thiols and heme proteins . Although the pharmacology of HNO has been investigated in considerable detail over the last decade, whether HNO functions as an endogenous signaling agent is currently a matter of speculation .
Intracellular protein degradation is an important facet of proteome maintenance, and misregulation of proteolysis can lead to severe cellular defects. Thus, mechanisms must exist to limit the destructive potential of this enzyme. The importance of proper regulation of ClpP activity is highlighted by the action of acyldepsipeptide antibiotics, which kill bacteria by binding to ClpP, preventing association with ClpX or ClpA, and endowing ClpP with the ability to degrade unfolded polypeptides, including nascent chains.
The vertebrate body axis undergoes segmentation and specialization into distinct regions during embryogenesis. Post embryonically, vertebrate axial segmentation is most easily visualized as the resulting vertebral column . Specifically, vertebrate species known to add segments post embryonically do so via terminal addition to the tailbud.
Success rates for long term weight loss maintenance through traditional lifestyle strategies are poor, with high recidivism rates being the norm. Daily physical activity has been consistently shown to be a critical factor in maintaining long term weight loss. The preponderance of physical activity research has focused on frequency, intensity, and duration of physical activity needed to facilitate weight loss and prevent weight regain, but research identifying individual level barriers to achieving these recommendations is still very much inchoate .
The complex relationship between inflammation and cancer has been well described since the late 1800’s . The principal purpose of an acute inflammatory response is to create a protective tissue microenvironment that allows for recognition and attempted repair of cell damage, as well as the elimination of pathogens and permanently damaged cells. Persistent inflammation, however, may promote tumor formation  .
Bipolar Disorder is characterized by recurrent episodes of depression and/or mania along with interepisodic mood symptoms that interfere with psychosocial functioning. Despite periods of symptomatic recovery, individuals with bipolar disorder often continue to experience impairments in psychosocial functioning, particularly occupational functioning. Two determinants of psychosocial functioning of euthymic  individuals with bipolar disorder are residual depressive symptoms and cognitive impairment  .
Cardiac mortality of end stage renal disease patients is several fold increased in comparison to the general population . However, the precise nature of the inflammatory and/or oxidative pathways involved remains unclear. As renal failure progresses, compounds accumulate in blood and tissues due to a decline in renal function.
In mammalian cells, both the nucleus and mitochondria serve as repositories for genetic information . As a consequence, alterations in mtDNA integrity have been associated with various human pathologies, such as mitochondrial diseases , diabetes , cancer  and neurodegenerative disorders  . While significant progress has been achieved in understanding the mechanisms involved in the maintenance of nuclear genome integrity, our understanding of corresponding mitochondrial mechanisms remains incomplete.
Delirium is an acute confusional state marked by inattention and global cognitive dysfunction. The strong correlation between delirium and hospital related falls has led to calls for delirium prevention quality metrics to improve hospital care and prevent falls in older persons . Importantly, at least 3040% of delirium cases are preventable .
Immune related pathology can result in a number of bone marrow failure diseases including systemic lupus erythematosis , rheumatoid arthritis or Felty’s syndrome, and Large Granular Lymphocyte  leukemia. The number of circulating LGL cells in the peripheral blood is often elevated, and consistent with an autoimmune origin, many patients have serological abnormalities that are similar to other autoimmune disorders, . Some T LGL leukemia patients have been reported to have concomitant B cell malignancies including chronic lymphocytic leukemia , follicular lymphoma , mantle cell lymphoma , diffuse large B cell lymphoma , and monoclonal gammopathy of unknown significance , although the prevalence of anemia and thrombocytopenia in LGL leukemia patients is similar with and without B cell deregulation .
The antigen specific T cell repertoire is shaped by binding of the TCR hypervariable region to a diverse array of short processed peptides bound to MHC molecules. To ensure an adequate immune response to a vast number of potential antigens, the total theoretical T cell repertoire is extremely diverse and estimated at 2.5 × 107 T cells in an individual at any given time . Public T cells are characterized by the expression of identical TCR Vα and/or Vβ genes that are present in the majority of subjects and dominate the response to a specific epitope.
Human natural killer  cells are part of the innate immune system and recognize microbe infected cells and tumor cells through a combination of activating and inhibitory receptors that do not require somatic gene rearrangement, such as the killer cell immunoglobulin like receptor  family . γδ T cells bear more innate like attributes and appear earlier in the thymus than αβ T cells . TCR is never found in NK cells, but a subset of terminallydifferentiated effector memory T cells expresses KIR  .
Transcranial electrical stimulation using weak direct currents   transcranial direct current stimulation    is a powerful method of brain modulation that has been increasingly tested as a tool to modulate plasticity in neuropsychiatric diseases . Relatively simple to apply, tDCS involves application of direct current through at least one electrode positioned on the scalp. In fact, some of the neurological sequelae are presumably consequences of disrupted cortical activity following the traumatic event, and tDCS in this circumstance can be a useful tool to reactivate and restore activity in essential neural networks associated with cognitive and motor processing.
Powassan virus  is the sole North American member of the tick borne encephalitis  complex which is otherwise geographically distributed across temperate Eurasia . Many of these viruses, including POWV, have been identified as the causative agents of severe central nervous system infections in humans . Lineage I, the “prototype” lineage, is maintained in an enzootic transmission cycle between Ixodes cookei and Ix.
Atherosclerosis is a focal inflammatory disease of the vasculature, marked by chronic activation of the endothelium. Atherogenic shear stress patterns activate the inflammatory transcription factor NF κB, whose downstream targets include multiple cytokines  and adhesion molecules , which together mediate recruitment of leukocytes necessary for lesion formation . NF κB activation is mediated by a shear stress mechanosensor, platelet endothelial cell adhesion molecule  1, .
Uncontrolled proliferation and migration of vascular smooth muscle cells  coupled with increased deposition of extracellular matrix  are major causes of intimal thickening during the development of vascular occlusive disease . Substrate stiffness influences adhesion, proliferation and differentiation in a variety of cell types . Cells sense the mechanical properties of their substrate through integrins .
Antiretroviral pre exposure prophylaxis , as daily oral tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and co formulated emtricitabine/tenofovir disoproxil fumarate, has been demonstrated to be efficacious for the prevention of HIV acquisition in diverse populations. PrEP could be an important component of safer conception strategies for women at risk for HIV infection, including those in HIV serodiscordant couples , particularly if the infected partner is not eligible for, willing, or able to take antiretroviral treatment., Efforts to implement PrEP as a public health strategy for HIV prevention in heterosexual populations will be accompanied by PrEP exposure during conception and pregnancy, either inadvertently for women with unrecognized early pregnancy or intentionally as part of reducing HIV risk during conception, and thus understanding the safety of PrEP in the periconception period is a priority . Tenofovir disoproxil fumarate and emtricitabine are pregnancy category B medications, with no evidence of teratogenicity in animal experiments and in observational studies of humans.
One of the key themes in biology is the characterisation of structure function relationships. It is generally accepted that anatomical connectivity provides important constraints on effective connectivity. Similarly, network analyses of anatomical connectivity  and functional interactions in the Macaque cortex  have revealed similar clustering in the cortical network and indicated that, both from an anatomical and functional perspective, the Macaque cortex possesses small world properties.
γ Amino butyric , the major neurotransmitter of inhibitory synaptic neurotransmission, influences virtually every homeostatic function mediated by the medulla oblongata. While many biogenic amines and neuropeptides modulate the effects of GABA and vice versa, GABA’s interactions with serotonin  are particularly important and are the focus of this report. The 5 HT medullary regions are involved in the modulation of breathing, blood pressure, chemosensitivity and/or heart rate according to the level of arousal .
The current first line therapy for patients with glioblastoma multiforme  consists of maximal surgical resection followed by radiotherapy and Temozolomide chemotherapy. GBM is composed of heterogeneous types of tumor cells. Maternal embryonic leucine zipper kinase  is a member of the snf1/AMPK family of serine/threonine kinases .
Cancer care requires a great deal of information work on the part of the patient . Beyond the psychological stress of dealing with a life threatening illness, patients must manage a range of personal health information to play an active role in their health care . For example, patients often gather and integrate their medical records, web pages, notes, and articles to make treatment decisions.
The 2011 National Healthcare Disparities Report documents that racial and ethnic disparities remain pervasive . These initiatives are commonly referred to as pay for performance programs  . It is well recognized  that there are both advantages  and disadvantages  to P4P programs currently designed and implemented as reported by the American Academy of Family Physicians  .
Allergic rhinitis is estimated to affect 30 to 60 million people in western countries and is associated with decreased quality of life, disorder in sleep hygiene, and impairment in work performance. Nasal biopsy is a considerably more invasive procedure and requires technical expertise in tissue sampling and processing. Furthermore, this approach is limited by sampling error, cytology cost, and bleeding risk.
The noradrenaline  lies at the confluence of massive cortical and subcortical inputs . Individual NA medium spiny neurons  receive convergent glutamatergic inputs from the prefrontal cortex , hippocampus, and amygdala , as well as GABAergic and modulatory inputs from multiple sources . Subthreshold membrane fluctuations are essential for integrating information carried by such inputs, as MSN have highly negative resting membrane potentials  and must be driven to depolarized potentials  in order for action potentials to be generated .
Brain injuries are suspected causes of acquired temporal lobe epilepsy . Convulsive status epilepticus  induced brain damage in rats is the most commonly used method to investigate epileptogenic mechanisms experimentally, primarily because prolonged SE induced by chemoconvulsants , or electrical stimulation  produces a permanent epileptic state. The idea that rats are reliably “pre epileptic” for several weeks post SE is crucial for hypotheses that invoke delayed secondary processes as likely epileptogenic mechanisms , and is also important because a “therapeutic window” must be open long enough after injury to permit practical anti epileptogenic intervention  .
Juvenile hormones  play a key role in insect development . The posteclosion  development of midgut, fat body and ovaries, three critical tissues that are involved in blood meal digestion and reproduction, are JH dependent processes . For pharate adult mosquitoes the exact timing of CA activation is critical and it has to be developmentally coordinated with eclosion.
During mitosis, sister chromatids must segregate properly to maintain the genetic integrity of the two daughter cells. The mitotic spindle, a microtubule based network originating from opposite poles, captures, aligns, and separates the replicated chromosomes. The spindle assembly checkpoint ensures that chromosomes do not segregate until they are properly attached.
Infantile spasms syndrome  is a devastating form of childhood epilepsy characterized by involuntary, massive motor spasms during early infancy that herald a lifelong disorder of severe seizures and intellectual disability. Mutations in a growing list of genes critical for the establishment of proper neural networks during development have been associated with its many inherited forms . Although short term spasm reduction can be achieved, high relapse rates, cognitive impairment, and long lasting side effects highlight the need for more effective therapy  .
ZIP4 is a zinc transporter that plays an important role in maintaining the cellular zinc level  . Our recent study has indicated that ZIP4 is overexpressed in human pancreatic cancer, and aberrant expression of ZIP4 contributes to pancreatic cancer pathogenesis and progression . ZIP6 , a breast cancer associated protein, has been indicated to play a critical role in estrogen positive breast cancer and metastasis to lymph nodes .
In a recent paper  we reported that dermal fibroblasts obtained from human skin during surgery for soft tissue sarcoma at 2 9 weeks after the end of a course of fractionated radiotherapy  demonstrated substantial levels of DNA damage when examined at their first division in culture after removal from the patient. Estimates of the dose received by the skin samples demonstrated that the levels of micronuclei observed were dependent on dose. Latent damage in human skin after irradiation is consistent with results of studies of wound healing after irradiation  and with reduction of the tolerance to late radiation damage after a second course of radiation treatment to previously irradiated skin .
Craniosynostosis is defined as the premature fusion of one or more cranial sutures and has an overall prevalence of 35 per 10,000 individuals . Approximately 515% of craniosynostosis cases involve multiple cranial sutures, referred to as complex craniosynostosis. Craniosynostosis can be further described as syndromic, in which other features are present in the patient, or non syndromic.
Squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck  is one of the six most common cancers in the world . Its traditional risk factors, including tobacco and alcohol consumption, have recently declined . However, there is an increase in the incidence of HNSCC associated with human papilloma virus  infection, which continues to rise worldwide .
Dopamine is thought to influence impulsivity , a category of behaviors encompassing deficits in the ability to delay immediate gratification for future larger rewards, and in response inhibition. Novelty seeking, which includes a dimension of impulsiveness , and attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder , which features impulsivity as a symptom , are associated with variants of genes encoding synaptic proteins that modulate dopaminergic activity . Furthermore, administration of dopaminergic agonists reduces impulsive responding by ADHD and control subjects , and rats  .
Transcriptional regulation is a key mechanism controlling the formation and subsequent behaviour of hematopoietic stem cells  . These computational screens were performed using the Ets/Ets/Gata  signature  using the Scl +19 HSC enhancer as a template . Given these constraints, the predicted E/E/G elements have all been clustered within a single hematopoietic enhancer.
Congestive heart failure  is a major cause of morbidity and mortality and represents the leading discharge diagnosis among older individuals in the United States , . Epidemiological data suggest that nearly 50% of HF patients exhibit a left ventricular ejection fraction in the normal range   . A primary manifestation of all forms of HF is exercise intolerance and a reduced functional capacity , .
Although some cognitive functions, such as episodic memory and visuo spatial skills, decline in older age , language abilities remain relatively stable among older adults . Verbal knowledge  and vocabulary , in particular, have been found resistant to the effects of cognitive aging. Word production is a high speed, fairly automatic and errorless process.
Acute allograft rejection is a T cell dependent phenomenon. However, we and others have shown that other pathways of allograft rejection must exist inasmuch as kinetics of rejection are unaltered in mice genetically deficient in STAT4 that have defective Th1 differentiation  . The role of Th17 cells in acute allograft rejection has been less widely studied.
Chronic exposure to nicotine, the addictive chemical in tobacco smoke, produces neuroadaptive changes that promote continued smoking . Even with the most effective pharmacotherapies, only one in four smokers is able to quit . Evidence for the heritability of nicotine dependence and smoking cessation  has led to intensive efforts to identify susceptibility genes for these complex traits .
Social cognition is broadly defined as the cognitive processes and individual factors  involved in social interactions . Elements of social cognition include emotional regulation and decision making, and brain regions associated with these processes include frontolimbic circuitries . observed dampened amygdala and hippocampal activation in alcoholics viewing positive and negative emotional facial expressions during fMRI.
Medullary carcinoma of the colon  is a distinct subtype of colonic adenocarcinoma with a unique histologic appearance and a more favorable prognosis in comparison to poorly differentiated colonic adenocarcinomas . Previous studies have shown that MC as opposed to PDC of the colon are more often right sided, seen in older female patients, and have a lower incidence of lymph node metastases . Molecular studies have revealed that the majority of MCs exhibit microsatellite instability and show an absence of hMLH1 protein by immunohistochemistry .
Activation of protein kinase A , which traditionally occurs with β adrenergic receptor  stimulation, is known to enhance cardiomyocyte contraction . These effects occur primarily through the phosphorylation of phospholamban  by PKA at Serine16 , and can be reversed by phosphatases, namely protein phosphatase 1  and 2a  . Consequently, the phosphatase vs. kinase equilibrium plays a critical role in regulating cardiomyocyte contractility .
Fifty years have passed since the first description of sickle cell disease  in Saudi Arabia . When the HbS mutation was associated with the Arab Indian  HBB  haplotype, HbS homozygotes or compound heterozygotes for HbS and β0 thalassaemia were reported to have a milder phenotype than patients with a HbS mutation of African origin . This was attributed to their high fetal haemoglobin  level.
Life for the vertebrate requires sustained and rhythmic beating of the heart for delivery of oxygen and nutrients to the brain and other organs. Central to this membrane regulation is the cardiac cytoskeleton. Over the past two decades, the cardiac cytoskeleton has emerged as a central governing factor in the control of cardiac membrane integrity, and dysfunction in cytoskeleton and cytoskeletal associated proteins has been directly linked with a host of human cardiac pathologies, most notably cardiac myopathies and dystrophies.
Developmentally present steroids are recognized as essential components of mammalian sexual differentiation . Testosterone  has three metabolic pathways. It can bind and act via androgen receptors , be aromatized to estradiol , which acts via estrogen receptors , or be irreversibly reduced to the non aromatizable dihydrotestosterone , which also acts via AR.
Emerging lines of evidence suggest that cancer cells may have mitochondrial dysfunction and adapt aerobic glycolysis to generate ATP. The involvement of reactive oxygen species  signaling in tumor metastasis has also been recognized . Oxidative stress is a state of redox imbalance caused by increased ROS generation, decreased antioxidant capacity, or both.
A major goal in the search for therapies for spinal cord injuries  is to develop tools for promoting both the regeneration of damaged axons and the restoration of synaptic contacts with their appropriate targets. Neurons in the CNS normally do not regenerate following damage, in part due to the presence of factors that retard axonal growth in the mature brain. Axons may also be confronted by a proteoglycan rich glial scar at the lesion site, which forms a physical and molecular barrier to regrowth  .
Uterine fibroid tumors  are the most common gynecological neoplasms clinically affecting up to 30% of all women during reproductive age. The primary characteristics of uterine fibroids are the increased proliferation of myometrial cell, production of the abundant extracellular matrix , and the downregulation of ECM degrading enzymes. Recent progress in cDNA microarray analysis revealed a distinct similarity of leiomyoma with other fibrotic processes.
Lymphoid malignancies are a heterogeneous group of neoplasms originating from B  and T lymphocytes . Although the etiology of lymphoid malignancies remains largely unexplained, immune deficiency is the strongest known risk factor, with HIV infection conferring a more than 20 fold increased risk of non Hodgkin lymphoma  . Other factors affecting the immune system have also been postulated to increase the risk of developing lymphoid malignancies, particularly NHL  .
TLX1  is an evolutionarily conserved member of the non clustered NKL subclass of homeobox genes that orchestrates spleen organogenesis and specification of neuronal cell fates . Although TLX1 is not expressed during normal hematopoietic development, it is frequently activated in T cell acute lymphoblastic leukemia  by chromosomal translocations which place the TLX1 coding region downstream of T cell receptor  gene regulatory elements . In support of this notion, enforced expression of TLX1 in bone marrow derived stem/progenitor cells induced T cell tumors in transplanted mice, albeit at long latency  .
Schizophrenia is a psychiatric disorder with a prevalence of 0.51.0%. Although its heritability has been estimated to be in the order of 80%, unambiguous identification of susceptibility genes has proven to be extremely challenging. This paper is devoted to dysbindin, the product of the DTNBP1 gene.
The endoplasmic reticulum  is essential for secretory and membrane protein folding and assembly. Inositol Requiring Enzyme 1  is a key UPR regulator . IRE1 encodes an ER resident transmembrane protein with an ER luminal domain coupled to cytosolic kinase and endoribonuclease  domains .
Polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons  comprise a class of chemicals composed of two or more fused aromatic rings. Since PAHs are produced by the incomplete combustion of organic matter, including petroleum, coal, and other carbonaceous materials , they are ubiquitous contaminants of the human environment. Humans are exposed to PAHs via inhalation, ingestion, and dermal contact.
Human visual object recognition is impressive in several ways: it is fast, seemingly automatic, robust under degraded viewing conditions, and capable of recognizing novel instances of a very large number of common categories . For example, in their everyday lives, people routinely recognize the dog whose nose is sticking out from the blanket, the highly unique modernistic chair, and the cup on the table as a particular and favorite cup. Competing theories of object recognition  often pit different kinds of hypothesized processes and representations against each other.
One of the cardinal pathological changes in Alzheimer's disease  is the accumulation of amyloid beta peptide  in amyloid plaques and the walls of blood vessels . Human clinical trials of synthetic Aβ vaccination , however, were halted due to brain inflammation presumably induced by T cell mediated and/or Fc mediated immune responses  and/or toxicity of AN1792 . The latter was thought to be caused by relocation of parenchymal Aβ aggregates to the walls of cerebral blood vessels ; thus, the inflammatory responses and cerebral hemorrhages associated with Aβ immunotherapies can be detrimental to the AD patients’ health.
Highly active anti retroviral therapy  markedly decreases AIDS progression among HIV infected individuals . However mitochondrial toxicity resulting from the use of specific antiretrovirals used as part of HAART has been linked to several adverse effects including lipodystrophy, peripheral neuropathy, hepatic steatosis, myopathy, cardiomyopathy, pancreatitis, bone marrow suppression, and lactic acidosis . Nearly all of these adverse effects resemble clinical symptoms seen in inherited mitochondrial diseases , , suggesting that host mitochondrial genotype may play a role in their development.
The triggering receptors expressed on myeloid cells  contain a single V set immunoglobulin  domain, and are involved in cell activation within the innate immune system . A glycoprotein with significant homology to the TREMs, TREM like transcript 1 , has been exclusively found in the mouse and human megakaryocyte  lineages . Interestingly, a Src homology domain containing tyrosine phosphatase  is recruited to the ITIM  of TLT 1 after activation, although there is a lack of consensus on its identity for it has been identified as SHP 1 or SHP 2 according to the publication .
High levels of treatment adherence are critical for people with HIV to benefit from antiretroviral medications, and to remain free from opportunistic infections resulting from a compromised immune system . For example, research has found mean adherence rates of 67% of prescribed doses over 6 months . Thus, identifying reasons for treatment nonadherence among AfricanAmericans in particular is critical for determining ways to improve their long term health outcomes and ultimately to narrow disparities .
The mitogen activated protein kinase  pathway is one of the critical downstream effectors of Ras, a small GTPase that is vital in the modulation of numerous cellular functions. Ras has long been known to play an important role in cancer genetics. Recently, the Ras/MAPK pathway has been implicated in several developmental syndromes with cutaneous manifestations.
The striking increase of uterine blood flow in pregnancy is essential both for optimal growth and survival of the fetus and for cardiovascular well being of the mother. Previous studies demonstrated a critical role of BKCa channels in the adaptation of uterine circulation and increased uterine blood flow in pregnancy. The predominant β subunit in vascular smooth muscle cells is the β1 subunit  and other β subunits are either undetectable or negligible., BKca channels in vascular smooth muscle are primarily activated by elevation of intracellular Ca2+ concentrations, and the β1 subunit enhances Ca2+ sensitivity of BKCa channels., In addition, chronic hypoxia during gestation abrogated these changes.
Data mining algorithms, sometimes called machine learning or statistical learning algorithms, have been increasingly used in biomedical research in recent years. Data mining is broadly defined as the process of selecting, exploring, and modeling large amounts of data to discover unknown and useful patterns or relationships. Data mining algorithms arose from the fields of statistics and computer science, and are widely used in marketing, banking, engineering, and bioinformatics.
“Why do adolescents become dependent on alcohol and other drugs  and what might be done to redirect them back to sobriety?” The greatest increase in AOD use disorders is among our nation’s minors , the personal and social costs of which are substantial. First, teens are much less likely to participate in AOD treatment compared to adults, with some researchers estimating that only 10% of the 1.4 million adolescents with AOD problems are receiving treatment . This decrease in parental monitoring is due to the increase in single parent households, greater number of parental hours spent working outside the home, and higher divorce rates .
Delivery of foreign DNA into eukaryotic cells has become an important tool in molecular biology and in gene therapy studies. The disadvantages of biological methods include delivery of DNA molecules of only a limited length, biosafety concerns and complexity in preparing virus. Electroporation is a physical based method for DNA delivery, and thus possesses some advantages over other methods.
Practice guidelines recommend the use of ICDs in patients with heart failure  and a left ventricular ejection fraction  of ≤ 35% in the absence of contraindications . The GWTG program is a national, voluntary, observational, hospital based, and ongoing quality improvement initiative that began in the year 2000 under the auspices of the AHA. Begun in January/March 2005 and continued to the present, the HF module originating from the Organized Program to Initiate Life Saving Treatment in Hospitalized Patients with Heart Failure serves as the primary dataset for this analysis.
Human beings’ complex social environment has evolved hand in hand with two other distinct capacities: our ability to identify other people as individuals, and our ability to convey complex ideas to them via spoken language. Contemporary work on primate evolution has furthermore pointed at the potential phylogenetic significance and underpinning of functional lateralization of the human language faculty . found that right hemisphere lesions more frequently led to impairment in voice recognition than did left hemisphere lesions.
Neurogenesis in the dentate gyrus of the adult hippocampus is highly labile. Much of this lability is due to the exquisite sensitivity of the progenitor cells to glucocorticoids . BDNF has high levels of expression in the adult dentate gyrus .
The mouse genome encodes a large number of nonclassical MHC class I  molecules, including many with unknown functions . The MHC class Ib tissue distribution and expression levels vary considerably . Some class Ib proteins, including CD1d and MR1, are encoded outside of the MHC.
Following in the footsteps of exciting clinical data on the efficacy of the small drug inhibitor of Bruton tyrosine kinase   ibrutinib, in patients with mantle cell lymphoma   and chronic lymphocytic leukemia   ibrutinib is now undergoing phase 2 clinical testing for multiple myeloma   registered online at ClinicalTrials.gov as NCT01478581 and NCT01962792. The promise of BTK as new therapeutic target in MM was first suggested by 3 concurrent preclinical studies demonstrating that inhibition of BTK with 3 different small molecules  ibrutinib , LFM A13  and CC 292   effectively targets both myeloma cells, including cancer stem cell  like cells commonly referred to as MM stem cells , and non malignant bystander cells in the tumor microenvironment, such as osteoclasts  . BTK  is an X chromosome encoded member of the Tec protein tyrosine kinase family that has long been known to play a central role in B cell receptor  signaling .
The impact of neoadjuvant therapy on post pancreatectomy complications is inadequately described . Data from the NSQIP Pancreatectomy Demonstration Project  was used to identify patients with pancreatic adenocarcinoma who did and did not receive neoadjuvant therapy. Neoadjuvant therapy was classified as chemotherapy alone or radiation ± chemotherapy.
Laboratory methods routinely used for diagnosis of HIV infection are based on detection of anti HIV antibodies, which typically appear 35 weeks after HIV infection . These methods do not identify individuals with acute  HIV infection. Furthermore, acute HIV infection is often associated with a high concentration of HIV in plasma and genital secretions , which in turn is associated with increased risk of transmission .
Incidental encounters with mediastinal masses have become more common with the growing use of computed tomography  in clinical practice as well as in screening of lung cancer. Anterior mediastinal masses account for 50% of all mediastinal masses . Anterior mediastinal masses can represent a wide spectrum of diseases, including thymoma, thymic carcinoma, thymic cyst, thymic hyperplasia, mature teratoma, malignant germ cell tumor, and malignant lymphoma .
Voltage gated potassium  channel pore forming α subunits form complexes with a range of ancillary  subunits, such as the single transmembrane domain proteins encoded by the KCNE gene family , leading to various channel subunit compositions with diverse functional characteristics . The KCNQ1 K+ channel α subunit is widely distributed in both excitable and non excitable cells of vertebrates, and is unique among the S4 gene superfamily in that it forms either voltage activated or constitutively active K+ selective channels depending on its specific KCNE family β subunit partner . KCNQ1 and KCNE gene disruption are linked to multiple pathologies, often with an unclear molecular etiology.
Relapse is a common feature of cocaine addiction even after long periods of abstinence .
