Although there is no effective treatment, the neural circuitry underlying relapse is rapidly coming into focus . Key components include prefrontal cortex , which processes the signals that trigger relapse , and nucleus accumbens , which has long been implicated in goal directed behavior, including drug seeking .
In 2009, more than seven million Americans were involved currently with thecriminal justice system  in some capacity, and nearly 70% of those involved with the CJS met criteriafor an alcohol or other substance use disorder . The positive relationshipbetween substance use and illegal behaviors suggests that decreasing the probability of relapse maydecrease the incidence of illegal behaviors and arrests. In 2004, Witkiewitz andMarlatt published anintegrated and updated model of relapse for persons with SUDs in the general population.
The hepatitis delta virus  ribozyme is a small, self cleaving RNA that participates in the double rolling cycle replication of the HDV virus. The HDV virus has an RNA genome and contains closely related genomic and antigenomic ribozymes that self cleave to process the genomic and antigenomic concatemers into linear monomers. The active site is found at the cleft where the stacking networks intersect.
In DSM 5, low prosocial emotions , designate youth at risk for early onset, persistent conduct problems , and adult psychopathy . Yet, little is currently known about how CU traits develop. Research suggests that similar levels of CU may arise from distinct developmental circumstances , and that the presence of co occurring internalizing problems  is a key marker.
During adult neurogenesis glial fibrillary acidic protein  expressing quiescent type I cells self renew, divide and give rise to transient amplifying type IIa cells which will differentiate into neuronal nuclei  expressing mature granular cell neurons . We previously developed and characterized a transgenic animal that labels type I and IIa progenitor cells with green fluorescent protein  under the control of the nestin promoter and its second intron enhancer . Excitatory amino acid transporter 2 , a glutamate transporter, was identified in this screen and found to be upregulated about ten fold in postnatal day 28  progenitors compared to those isolated at P7.
Spina bifida myelomeningocele  is a neural tube defect associated with a modal pattern of strengths and deficits in motor, cognitive, academic, and behavioral domains . The academic profile of children with SBM has been well documented; using a low achievement definition of learning disabilities  to identify learning disability, it has been estimated that up to one third of children with SBM have a disability in reading comprehension . Moreover, even when children with SBM do not meet stipulated criteria for the diagnosis of a reading comprehension disability per se, their reading comprehension skill is typically significantly lower than their word decoding skill, a pattern less often observed in typically developing  controls  .
Mammalian sterile 20 like kinase 1  is a serine/threonine kinase of the Hippo signaling pathway, with regulating apoptosis as one of its major functions . Prior studies in the heart concluded that Mst1 induces cardiac damage through activating myocyte apoptosis and that inhibiting Mst1 is cardioprotective by reducing myocyte apoptosis . The tacit assumption is that Mst1 regulates cardiomyocyte numbers, thereby affecting cardiac function, but this has rarely been measured.
Advances in high throughput sequencing technologies present the opportunity to infer aspects of biological mechanisms from vast amounts of sequence data—the cell's own language for encoding those mechanisms. Such inferences rely on the assumption that sequence patterns that have been conserved for a billion years or more reflect important structural or mechanistic similarities. Examining functionally divergent residues within available crystal structures thus can identify the molecular features responsible for important functional distinctions and, as a result, suggest specific mechanisms to test experimentally.
MicroRNAs  are endogenously processed non coding RNAs which regulate gene expression by blocking the translation or decreasing the stability of mRNAs . The pre miRNAs are then exported by exportin 5 to the cytoplasm, where Dicer further processes them into mature double stranded miRNAs with ~22 nt in length . To date, over 600 human miRNAs have been reported, and more than 1000 predicted miRNA genes remain to be experimentally confirmed .
Mitral valve repair has become the gold standard treatment for patients with mitral regurgitation and most commonly includes the implantation of an annuloplasty ring  which invariably changes the geometry, dynamics and force distribution of the mitral annulus . Such annular changes have been demonstrated to perturb the geometry of the mitral leaflets during valve closure , which has been associated with alterations in physiological stress patterns acting on the leaflets and suboptimal repair durability . The effects of annuloplasty rings on mitral leaflet dynamics are, however, less clear.
Mammalian TOR is a constitutively expressed, evolutionarily conserved protein kinase which plays a central role in the regulation of cell growth, proliferation, apoptosis, and metabolism . mTORC1 contains mTOR, raptor, mLST8  and PRAS40, and its function is acutely inhibited by rapamycin, a potent immunosuppressant with anti tumor effect . Mammalian TORC2 is resistant to acute rapamycin inhibition.
The Wellcome Trust Case Control Consortium  genome wide association  study, in addition to the detection of four new and confirmed type I diabetes  loci, provided some evidence for previously undetected  T1D loci with effect sizes in the range of odds ratios between 1.1 and 1.3. The evidence provided by such GWA studies for these previously undetected loci can be pooled together in meta analysis studies or used to design follow up studies. Both of these approaches provide the additional samples required to detect novel loci with robust statistical power.
Desmoplastic small round cell tumor  is a rare and aggressive sarcoma that typically affects adolescent and young adult Caucasian males . Although fewer than 200 cases have been described in the literature, identification of a characteristic chromosomal translocation  and fusion protein  has facilitated the definitive diagnosis of DSRCT. Multimodal therapy with surgery and aggressive combinations of chemotherapy and adjuvant radiation therapy  have provided the best results to date.
Differentiated phenotypes derived from pluripotent stem cells are potential cell sources for tissue engineering and therapeutic applications, but effective and robust methods for scale up production have yet to be identified. Initial studies indicate, however, that cells cultured on microcarriers may be more sensitive to shear stress  and therefore motivate a more thorough understanding of the biological impact of shear stress parameters . Shear stress effects are often difficult to interpret in scalable systems due to complex patterns of fluid flow.
The prevalence of asthma has increased since 2001 in the United States and is a major public health problem in many countries such as Colombia, which has a prevalence estimated at 1012%., Childhood asthma causes considerable morbidity, interference with normal daily activities, and a burden for the whole family. Moreover, compared with older children with this condition, young asthmatic children experience less favorable responses to asthma treatments, thus increasing the healthcare utilization and overall burden of the disease., These asthma symptom questionnaires typically assess patient reported elements of impairment. Some of them also include information about the history of exacerbations and pulmonary function parameters.
The most common cause of damage to the myocardium is ischemic injury resulting from occlusion of the coronary arteries. In addition, aging decreases myocardial tolerance to specific components of ischemic injury, including oxidative stress. Although several clinical factors contribute to the poor prognosis for elderly patients with ischemic heart disease,,  evidence from experimental animal studies and in humans,  suggest that this effect may be related to a decline in intrinsic myocardial resistance to injury.
Vascular response to mechanical injury comprises 2 main processes, neointimal hyperplasia and vessel remodeling. Proliferation in many cell types is driven by mitogen activated protein kinase  activation. The three major subfamilies of MAPKs, i.e. extracellular signal regulated kinase , c Jun N terminal Kinase  and p38MAPK are activated in response to stimuli such as cytokines and growth factors, and studies using both genetic models as well as pharmacological inhibitors of MAPKs showed significant inhibition of neointimal hyperplasia after injury, indicating that MAPKs promote neointima formation.
In our previous study on individuals with autism spectrum disorder   we reported abnormalities in the attention orienting frontal event related potentials  and the sustained attention centro parietal ERPs in a visual oddball experiment. At frontal regions of interest  the ASD group showed significantly higher amplitudes and prolonged latencies of early ERP components  to novel distracter stimuli in both hemispheres. rTMS offers a non invasive method for altering excitability of the brain.
Hepatic stellate cells  are the principle source of hepatic collagen, and therefore, play a critical role in the development and maintenance of hepatic fibrosis, a nefarious consequence of all chronic liver diseases regardless of etiopathogenesis, . In health, HSCs store retinoids and generate little if any collagen. Analogous to activation induced cell death of T lymphocytes, activated HSCs are eliminated by apoptosis.
The ERBB4 receptor tyrosine protein kinase gene is involved in the production of different isoforms of the ERBB4 protein through alternative splicing . ERBB4 binds trophic factors, such as neuregulin 1  or neuregulin 3. In the central nervous system, ERBB4 and its ligand NRG1 play a critical role in neurodevelopment such as glial and neuronal migration, myelination, excitatory neuronal receptor expression and the onset of puberty .
CD4+CD25+ regulatory T cells  constitute 510% of peripheral CD4+ T cells in naïve mice . Tumors may differentiate, expand, recruit and activate Treg  via multiple mechanisms . When compared with naïve Treg, suppressor functions of tumor Treg have been reported to be ineffective, comparable or enhanced in various tumor models .
Results of the recent Treatment of Preserved Cardiac Function Heart Failure with an Aldosterone Antagonist  trial examining the clinical benefit of mineralocorticoid receptor  antagonism in patients with heart failure with preserved ejection fraction  were negative. However, interpretation of these results is hampered by broad inclusion criteria resulting in a heterogeneous patient population that could mask specific patient subgroups that may preferentially benefit from MR antagonism,. Thus, in conjunction with the renin angiotensin aldosterone system activation in obesity and MetS, MR antagonism holds promise for the treatment of obesity associated DD but this and potential underlying mechanisms have not been studied and remain unclear .
For more than 1/3 of individuals ages 1824 in the U.S., the transition into adulthood co occurs with transitions into, through, and out of college . During this developmental period these young adults must learn to navigate new freedoms and responsibilities , tasks which may be especially challenging for those coping with trauma and its effects. Trauma and resulting post traumatic stress  symptoms are unfortunately common in young adults attending college .
It has been known for some time that tumor cells can have impaired HLA class I antigen expression during the course of tumor progression . HLA class I antigen downregulation or loss often occurs in tumor cells when the primary tumor breaks the basal membrane, invades the surrounding tissues, and/or starts to metastasize to regional lymph nodes or distant organs . Tumor induced immune modulation of surrounding tissue including sentinel lymph nodes plays an important role in this invasive/metastatic process.
Immunodominance is a well established phenomenon whereby a few specific peptides are selected as representative epitopes of a given protein antigen to the immune system. Newly synthesized MHCII molecule associates with the class II invariant chain , which targets it to specialized endosomal compartments  where the Ii is proteolysed until only a fragment known as the class II associated invariant chain peptide  remains bound in the MHCII peptide binding groove. DM functions by inducing conformational changes in MHCII/peptide complexes resulting in the release of the bound peptide inducing a peptide receptive MHCII.
Acetaminophen  is a widely used analgesic and antipyretic drug. It is thought that the mitochondrial protein adducts are involved in the inhibition of mitochondrial respiration  leading to formation of reactive oxygen  and peroxynitrite in mitochondria . The resulting oxidative stress activates the c jun N terminal kinases 1/2  by multiple pathways .
Antigen receptor diversity due to VJ recombination is the hallmark of the adaptive immune system in jawed vertebrates. During T cell development, four antigen receptor genes, Tcra, Tcrb, Tcrg and Tcrd, undergo rearrangement to direct the expression of αβ or γδ TCRs . However, whereas almost all V gene segments rearrange to Jα segments and contribute to the Tcra repertoire, only a subset rearrange to Dδ segments and contribute to the Tcrd repertoire.
Preterm  birth  is a complex adverse outcome of pregnancy, accounting for approximately 70% of perinatal mortality, and is a major predictor of long term neurologic morbidity  . The incidence of PTB in the United States in 2005 was 12.7%. Intrauterine infection and or inflammation are strongly associated with preterm birth , .
The genomes of eukaryotic cells are constantly being subjected to exogenous and endogenous genotoxic stresses. These checkpoints sense damaged or abnormally structured DNA and coordinate cell cycle progression with DNA repair. In cases when damage is excessive or repair is unfavorable, the cell death machinery is activated in order to eliminate damaged cells  .
The hippocampal formation comprises a group of cortical regions including the dentate gyrus, hippocampus, subiculum, presubiculum, parasubiculum and the entorhinal cortex . Damage to these structures in adult humans and animals causes a profound loss of declarative memory function without other sensory, motor or cognitive impairments . The hippocampal formation comprises a unique set of unidirectional excitatory pathways .
Several studies have examined the longitudinal course of attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder  in samples of male subjects . Although recent studies have begun to examine ADHD in females , few studies have examined its longitudinal course in these samples . Also, the influence of sex on the course of ADHD has yet to be specifically tested.
CD4+ T cell activation involves the formation of a highly organized interface between the T cell and the antigen presenting cell  known as the immunological synapse  . In addition, T cell polarization is highly dynamic as illustrated by the early detection of signalling TCR microclusters or signalosomes in the outer ring of the synapse  and their subsequent movement to the centre of the synapse where they are internalized and destined to degradation , thus ensuring signal down regulation  . To identify molecules that act as a functional bridge between TCR signalosomes and the cytoskeleton and cellular organelles, we performed a proteomic analysis of lipid raft microdomains from human T cells undergoing activation through their TCR.
In the United States, and more prominently in South Carolina, a large and widening disparity in breast cancer mortality rates has been reported between African American and European American women . The cause of this disparity has been attributed to factors ranging from differences in tumor biology, to environmental factors, to socioeconomic and cultural differences between the groups . Socioeconomic status and cultural beliefs could affect a woman's survival through certain time intervals across the breast cancer diagnosis continuum, resulting in delays in detection, diagnosis, and treatment.
While numerous molecular targets have been identified and several targeted molecular imaging agents have been reported for the detection of malignant tumors, only a handful of them showed limited clinical potential. Due to its distinct expression in premature stages of tumors such as PDAC, Cath E has been suggested as a potential clinical tumor marker for early detection.,, PET imaging is a sensitive way of imaging and monitoring treatment response of many cancers. However, the usefulness of FDG PET in some cancers is limited due to low glucose turnover at early stages., A number of studies have shown that FDG PET is useful in defining regions of locally advanced pancreatic cancer; though false positive is possible in cystic tumors., To obtain a decisive diagnosis of an early cancer stage, patients are currently required to be subjected to invasive biopsies and histological confirmation .
Mutations in the gene HPRT1, encoding the enzyme hypoxanthine guanine phosphoribosyltransferase , are known to cause a rare X linked metabolic disorder, Lesch Nyhan disease . Many different diseasecausing mutations have been reported . Spread through nearly the whole gene are missense mutations, nonsense mutations, splicing mutations, small and large coding and noncoding deletions or insertions, partial duplications, noncoding regulatory mutations, and more complex changes.
Current recommendations for measuring the cerebrospinal fluid opening pressure obtained during lumbar puncture include performance of lumbar puncture in the lateral recumbent position, followed by repeat measurement after extension of the legs and placement of the neck in the neutral position. ,, Extending the legs is thought to decrease intra abdominal pressure, thereby avoiding false elevations of the opening pressure. In our experience, many pediatric lumbar punctures are performed with the patient in the flexed lateral recumbent position without returning the patient to the extended position for measurement of opening pressure .
Increased spontaneous neural activity is a major consequence of intense sound exposure that has been observed at several levels of the mammalian auditory system, including the cochlear nucleus, inferior colliculus and auditory cortex . This alteration has been implicated as a possible factor contributing to the induction of tinnitus  and could play an important role in other auditory deficits. Such changes are potentially disruptive to normal signal detection and information processing in neurons further downstream from hyperactive cell populations.
When naïve T cells are stimulated by antigen, engagement of CD28 by its ligands CD80 or CD86  lowers the threshold for activation . T cell activation then induces expression of members of the tumour necrosis factor receptor  family including 4 1BB, which transmits activation and survival signals during subsequent effector and memory T cell stages  . During infection of 4 1BBL deficient mice, with influenza or LCMV, the CD8+ T cell response is impaired.
Neuronal firing patterns are shaped by the characteristics of the after hyperpolarization  following action potentials . The AHP is composed of fast and slow components, mediated by the large conductance voltage  and calcium activated potassium  channels, and the small conductance, slowly activating  potassium channels, respectively. The inner ear houses specialized epithelia containing hair cells, the sensory cells that transduce mechanical energy into the neural signals transmitted to the central nervous system.
Oxidative stress induced cell damage is implicated in many neurological disorders including stroke, spinal cord injury, and periventricular leukomalacia , the major underlying pathology for cerebral palsy and cognitive impairment associated with prematurity . Reactive oxygen/nitrogen species, oxidants and arachidonate metabolites are all elevated in the cerebral spinal fluid of PVL patients  and in PVL white matter lesions . Increased production of free arachidonic acid occurs during brain ischemia and inflammation as a result of activation of phospholipases .
Advances in the therapy of heart failure  have delayed disease progression and prolonged survival. Yet there is little understanding about the trajectory of patient preferences in heart failure . Many scales and questionnaires probe symptoms in HF, but these scores do not equate to the importance of survival to an individual.
Progressive hepatolenticular degeneration, also known as Wilson’s disease , is a genetic disorder characterized by excess copper accumulation in the liver and other vital organs., There are wide clinically presenting symptoms of WD including a variety of hepatic, neurological, ophthalmic and psychiatric symptoms., The current treatment of WD is based on the use of copper chelating agents to block the adsorption of this ion in the stomach and to promote its urinary excretion from the body. D penicillamine or  2 amino 3 methyl 3 sulfanyl butanoic acid , a metabolite of penicillin, has been used as an orally active drug for WD in the clinic for over five decades., Such a slow acting mechanism renders improvement of treatment efficacy by TTM for WD incremental. However, zinc acetate is only effective as a maintenance therapy for WD.
Microbes secrete a range of products that aid in adhesion to surfaces and to other cells , but even within a single species, microbes vary widely in their tendency to adhere . Adhesion is critical for the formation of surface attached microbial communities known as biofilms . When conditions are suitable, cells strengthen their attachment and divide to form a growing population on the surface .
Laparoscopic cholecystectomy is the most frequently performed abdominal surgical procedure, and one of the most common operations in Europe and the United States . Surgical morbidity has been reported as 24%, however the incidence of major complications that require acute re intervention is much lower . A rare but serious complication of laparoscopic cholecystectomy is bile duct injury , with a reported incidence of 0.31.5% .
Id  proteins are helix loop helix  transcription factors that regulate cell proliferation and differentiation. Id proteins are mainly expressed during embryogenesis and are required for maintaining the timing of neuronal differentiation. However, expression of Id proteins is reactivated in many human cancers.
It has long been known that cigarette smoking and other forms of tobacco consumption are addicting, and that addiction is at least in part caused by nicotine . Nicotine, believed to be the substance primarily responsible for addiction to tobacco smoking, is a simple molecule that affects many parts of the brain through binding sites on nicotinic acetylcholine receptors . When acetylcholinergic neurons release acetylcholine, it binds to muscarinic and nicotinic acetylcholine receptors and generally stimulates the release of glutamate and GABA.
Long term persistence of mycobacteria in the face of an apparently robust immune response thwarts tuberculosis control, and may explain the inefficacy of the BCG vaccine. Tuberculosis begins with the phagocytosis of mycobacteria by macrophages and dendritic cells at the site of infection, and the migration of infected cells into deeper tissues where they aggregate with additional macrophages and other immune cells to form characteristic structures called granulomas. It has been hypothesized that superinfecting or re infecting bacteria are able to survive by evading established granulomas where pre existing immune elements are concentrated .
Since their characterization, cytosine phosphate guanine  oligodeoxynucleotides  have been studied as immunotherapeutic agents for the treatment of different diseases, including various cancers. Members of the CpG A ODN family are potent natural killer  cell activators, and induce effective responses against NK sensitive tumors. This class, however, is highly susceptible to nuclease degradation.
Identification and isolation of adult stem cells are still challenging for stem cell biologists. The evidence through previous studies leaves little doubt that corneal epithelial stem cells reside in the limbus, and these cells exhibit the full complement of well defined keratinocyte stem cell properties . Limbal tissue biopsies and cultivated limbal epithelial cells have been successfully transplanted to patients with limbal deficiency to reconstruct the diseased and damaged corneas .
Prenatal stress has been associated with increased vulnerability to psychiatric disturbances such as schizophrenia, depression, attention deficit hyperactivity disorder and autism . Excess circulating maternal stress hormones can alter the programming of fetal neurons and interfere with development of the nervous system . Similar changes in HPA axis activity and behaviour have been induced by prenatal stress in laboratory rodents and non human primates .
Obstetrical Brachial Plexus Palsy  is a common birth injury, occurring in approximately three in every 1000 births; ; ; . The persisting sequelae are wide ranging, severely restrict the arm function, limit activities of daily living independence , and reduce the quality of life for patients and their caregivers; . As such, even though humeral deformity is complex and likely three dimensional; surgical procedures, such as humeral derotation osteotomy; ; ;  and humeral head relocation, are being recommended based on limited two dimensional knowledge.
Friedreich ataxia  is an autosomal recessive neurodegenerative disorder caused by mutations in the FXN gene, reducing the levels of the mitochondrial protein frataxin . Deficiency of frataxin leads to increased intramitochondrial iron levels, deficiency of iron sulfur cluster containing enzymes, and enhanced sensitivity to oxidative stress . Patients usually present during adolescence with progressive limb and gait ataxia, dysarthria, and hypertrophic cardiomyopathy .
Gonads are essential parts of animal reproductive systems. Somatic gonads provide environment for proper maintenance and development of germline and support transport of gametes and subsequent fertilization. Parts of the somatic gonad, the myoepithelial sheath and the spermatheca, have highly differentiated contractile actin cytoskeletal structures .
Parkinson’s disease is a neurological disorder characterized by the progressive loss of dopaminergic neurons in specific brain areas and occurs most prevalently in older adults . Characteristic symptoms include tremor, rigidity, dyskinesias, and postural gait changes . A reduction in these intentional prosodic pitch changes can be measured by examining F0 variability, which has been shown to contribute to overall speech intelligibility in both healthy and dysarthric speakers  .
Inflammatory molecules play a pivotal role in tumorigenesis and cancer progression . LL 37 is the 37amino acid peptide derivative of human cationic antimicrobial protein 18 , originally identified as a product of various leukocytes . In recent years, expression of LL 37 has also been detected in other cell types such as epithelia, in which inflammatory stimuli can up regulate peptide expression .
The anterior olfactory nucleus  is a cortical structure located in the olfactory peduncle, caudal to the olfactory bulb and rostral to the piriform cortex, and receives a significant input from mitral and tufted cells in the olfactory bulb . It has significant reciprocal connections with both the bulb and the piriform cortex , and is thought to play an important role in relaying information between the left and right hemispheres  . The AON is comprised of subregions  that are named for their relative location in the AON: pars dorsalis, pars lateralis, pars ventralis , pars medialis, and pars externa .
Shock wave lithotripsy  is an effective means of removing uncomplicated stone burdens of 2 centimeters or less located in the upper urinary tract , and is the most preferred therapy by urologists  and patients  alike. Despite such wide acceptance, however, both human and animal studies have documented a consistent and predictable pattern of acute tissue injury and impaired renal hemodynamics after SWL . The tissue injury primarily occurs in the microvascular system of the renal medulla and spreads into the cortex toward the capsule where a subcapsular hematoma may form.
The aphelids are a phylogenetically divergent group of intracellular parasitoids of common species of eukaryotic phytoplankton. There are three known genera: Aphelidium, Amoeboaphelidium, and Pseudaphelidium, but the group is very diverse, including many related environmental sequences . The phyla Microsporidia and Cryptomycota , and the class Aphelidea have recently been shown to be the deepest branches of the ‘Holomycota’ lineage forming the so called ARM clade , which is sister to the classical fungi .
Microarrays using bacterial cells as sensors have found many uses in such areas as high throughput assays of gene expression,,  detection of toxins,  and determination of the bioavailability of chemicals in soil. The advances in genetic engineering of the past decades have enabled the tailoring of bacterial functionalities for microarray applications. Currently, one of the major challenges in the development of bacterial cell microarrays is the detachment of bacterial cells from the substrate causing sensor failure.
Cardiomyocytes undergo remodeling in response to pathological stimuli, such as neurohumoral factors, pressure or volume overload, biomechanical stress, myocarditis, or inherited mutations . This causes cells to change morphology, increase protein synthesis and reactivate the cardiac fetal gene expression program. While initially compensatory, these changes ultimately prove maladaptive, leading to adverse ventricular remodeling through increased biomechanical stress, loss of contractility and function, and initiation of aberrant signaling processes that eventually cause heart failure.
Cyclin D1, a protein involved in cell cycle progression, is thought to be the point of convergence of mitogenic signal transduction cascades . Overexpression, amplification, gene rearrangements, and mutations of this gene have been found in tumors of different origins . It is postulated that the G allele favors the normal splicing of CCND1 exons 4 and 5, to produce the canonical cyclin D1a mRNA, while the A allele enhances alternative gene splicing, resulting in a shorter transcript, cyclin D1b.
The natural alkaloid epibatidine, while showing high affinity to neuronal nAChRs and an analgesic effect in animal models of pain, produces many negative side effects including toxicity, hypertension, respiratory paralysis and seizures due, in part, to its low selectivity for central nAChRs . Neuronal nAChRs consist of various combinations of α2 α10 and β2 β4 subunits and are differently distributed in various regions of the mammalian nervous system with respect to their subunit composition . The α4β2 is a major nAChR subtype of the central nervous system , while α3β4, though detected in some brain regions, predominates in the periphery , and α7 nAChRs are present in both central and peripheral regions of the nervous system .
Breast cancer is one of the most common cancers and is responsible for 14% of all cancer related deaths in women and 1.6% of all female deaths worldwide. When detected early, breast cancer is very treatable and therefore the ability to diagnose breast cancer in its early stages is vital to significantly improving the 5 year survival rate. These protein markers include CA 15.3, carcinoembryonic antigen , MUC1, and human epidermal growth factor 2 .
Fyn is a tyrosine kinase that belongs to the Src family of protein tyrosine kinases  . Fyn is highly expressed in the adult brain , and plays an important role in the central nervous system  . Fyn associates with GluN2B by interacting with the scaffolding protein RACK1 , and the close proximity of Fyn to GluN2B allows the efficient phosphorylation of the subunit .
Growing evidence from preclinical and clinical studies suggests that stem cell therapy may provide a viable therapeutic alternative to restore the target organ . Imaging modalities including single photon emission computed tomography , positron emission tomography , optical fluorescence, and magnetic resonance imaging  have all been implemented to evaluate the transplanted stem cells . MRI using super paramagnetic iron oxide  cell labeling techniques is emerging as the main diagnostic modality to track the transplanted stem cells.
Self poisoning through ingestion of Oduvanthalai is common in South India. Mortality may occur due to arrhythmias, renal failure, shock and respiratory distress. This prospective, clinical study was designed to assess renal tubular dysfunction due to Oduvanthalai poisoning .
Pain is a significant health concern with considerable economic and emotional costs. However, pain perception can vary greatly between individuals . Consistent with this theory, certain psychological factors are increasingly recognized as playing a role in pain perception.
Mutations in the gene encoding presenilin 1  are responsible for many cases of early onset familial Alzheimer’s disease , in part by increasing amyloid β peptide  production as a result of aberrant processing of the amyloid β protein precursor . FAD mutations have been used to develop various mouse models of AD to replicate Aβ peptide hypersecretion. A growing body of evidence suggests that the study of excitatory synaptic transmission is essential to understand early events that contribute to the development of AD .
Tumors that recur after an initially positive response to treatment are often resistant to chemotherapeutic drugs. It is important to explore the mechanism responsible for cisplatin resistance to improve its therapeutic index and overcome the resistance to this drug that emerges in the clinic . The molecular mechanisms that mediate these alterations are largely unknown.
Recent advances in the treatment of lung cancers have come from recognition that lung cancers are not a single disease entity, but rather a collection of distinct molecularly driven neoplasms. first described a subset of patients with lung cancers harboring activating mutations in the EGFR gene who responded to treatment with EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitors . BRAF is a member of the RAF kinase family of serine/threonine protein kinases which have diverse roles in mediating proliferation and survival.
Isolated renal phosphate wasting and subsequent hypophosphatemia may result from a number of genetic syndromes that include: autosomal dominant hypophosphatemic rickets , X linked hypophosphatemic rickets , and autosomal recessive hypophosphatemic rickets . Furthermore, ARHR patients manifest peri osteocytic lesions upon bone biopsy, which are a hallmark of XLH . We previously demonstrated that homozygous mutations in Dentin matrix protein 1 , including the deletion of nucleotides 1484 1490  and the missense replacement of the initial methionine with valine, , are causative for ARHR .
There is increasing evidence for a link between bone metabolism and the vasculature. Thus, elderly women with osteoporosis  or with high bone turnover  have increased cardiovascular mortality. In addition, mice with deletion of osteoprotegerin , which binds and neutralizes the key osteoclastogenic factor, receptor activator of NFκB ligand , not only have severe osteoporosis and a marked increase in bone turnover but also diffuse vascular calcification .
UV resonance Raman  spectroscopy is recognized as a powerful technique for probing peptide and protein secondary structure. Excitation between 180 and 215 nm is in resonance with the amide π→π* electronic transition of the peptide backbone, resulting in enhancement of amide vibrations. In the work here, we use UVRR spectroscopy to examine the secondary structure conformations and underlying electronic transitions of both Ala3 and Ala4 .
Intestinal commensals are potential important contributors to the development of sporadic human colorectal cancer , but the identification of relevant microorganisms has been impeded by the complex ecology of the large intestine . Several bacteria are definitively linked to gastrointestinal tumorigenesis; for example, Helicobacter pylori is considered a class I carcinogen for gastric cancers . However, in contrast to the stomach where the microbiota only consists of Helicobacter spp., These difficulties have made the epidemiological approach to identifying CRC associated microorganisms problematic.
Myocardial infarction  is a leading cause of death worldwide, . The healing of acute ischemic myocardial injury influences the outcomes post infarction decisively. Recent experimental work suggests that this critical healing process requires a precise balance between removal of debris and regulation of scar formation.
Carbonic anhydrase  on the extracellular membrane surface is found in a variety of tissues that include kidney , lung , and skeletal muscle . The enzyme was indirectly implicated in regulation of excitatory synaptic transmission, as the curtailment of extracellular alkaline shifts by ECA was shown to limit post synaptic NMDA receptor activation during synchronous neural activity . The principal isoforms of ECA in the brain are CA4  and CA14  and both enzymes catalyze the buffering of activity dependent pHe transients  .
Natural killer  cells are known to provide a critical host defence system during the early phases of infection with a variety of viruses, fungi, bacteria and parasites . NK cells do not possess conventional clonotypic antigen specific receptors but are capable of spontaneously killing tumour and virus infected cells that have down regulated one or more MHC molecules and/or expressed certain stress antigens on their surface .. NK cells have also been shown to play an important role during pregnancy , autoimmunity and tissue inflammation  . Target recognition and cytokine stimulation are the two major triggering mechanisms for NK cells and both shape their effector responses .
Spinal transection in humans results in an irreversible loss of motor and sensory functions. According to  “urodeles thus constitute the most advanced phylogenetic group in which functional regeneration occurs following lesions that interrupt ascending and descending pathways of the spinal cord”. Nevertheless, it is accepted that some reptiles like lizards, are able to regenerate amputated legs and tails  including the terminal portions of the spinal cords .
Tissue morphogenesis occurs in the complex and changing environment of a developing organism. Integrins are heterodimeric transmembrane receptors composed of an α and a β subunit. Each subunit has a large extracellular domain, single pass transmembrane region and small cytoplasmic tail .
Older adults constitute an increasing proportion of people living with HIV disease. The most recent CDC report indicates that 35% of HIV infected individuals in the US are age 50 and above, which represents a significant rise from 17% in 2001 . Increased risks for cardiovascular, liver, kidney, and bone diseases, and non AIDS cancers have been reported in cART receiving cohorts .
Language shift from Spanish to English has been studied in different communities in the United States . However, few studies have focused on the language shift of native and foreign born  aged  Mexican origin Latinos/as . defines language shift as a situation in which the habitual use of one language is being replaced by the habitual use of another.
Apoptotic dysregulation is a fundamental characteristic of cancer that allows transformed cells to survive and proliferate . The inhibitor of apoptosis proteins  are one of the major protein families that regulate caspase activation and programmed cell death . The family currently consists of eight members that are characterized by the presence of one or more baculoviral IAP repeat  domains and are highly conserved among mammalian and non mammalian species  .
Acute lung injury  is a common cause of life threatening acute respiratory failure in children and adults. ALI is characterized by activation of the pulmonary endothelium, disruption of endothelial and alveolar epithelial barriers, and an increase in microvascular permeability, resulting in protein rich pulmonary edema . While the exact pathogenetic mechanisms of this clinical disorder are unknown, an understanding of these mechanisms is critical for the development of novel therapies .
The Hedgehog  pathway controls cell proliferation and differentiation in response to a gradient of secreted Hh ligands . Hh proteins such as Sonic Hedgehog  bind the inhibitory receptor Patched1  on the cell surface, thereby releasing Ptch1 mediated inhibition of seven pass transmembrane protein Smoothened . These target genes include downstream transcription factors such as Mycn , along with core Hh pathway components including Ptch1 and Gli1.
Clinical imaging of the longitudinal relaxation time, T1, in human subjects has several potential applications, including perfusion imaging , dynamic contrast imaging , assessment of Parkinson’s disease , assessment of schizophrenia  and multiple sclerosis , and quantification of myocardial blood flow . In spite of its potential clinical utility quantitative T1 mapping is not routinely used due to the long scanning time inherent in inversion recovery sequences. DESPOT1 derives T1 from two or more spoiled gradient recalled echo  images acquired with a constant TR and different flip angles.
Depression is associated with increased mortality risk after acute myocardial infarction , with an approximate relative risk of 2.4 for all cause mortality  according to a meta analysis of 22 studies. However, there have been relatively few published studies of depression as a predictor of mortality in unstable angina . UA patients comprise about 26 percent of hospitalized patients with acute coronary syndrome , and although long term prognosis is more favorable compared with MI patients, early invasive revascularization strategies are less beneficial for prevention of recurrent events in UA patients.
In eukaryotic cells, molecular oxygen primarily functions as the terminal acceptor of electrons during mitochondrial electron transport. Most of the oxygen consumed in this process is reduced to water by cytochrome oxidase. Normally, only a small percentage of the total oxygen consumption appears as partially reduced species such as the superoxide ion and hydrogen peroxide.
Ethanol exposure during pregnancy causes birth defects  and can lead to fetal alcohol spectrumdisorders  . FASD symptoms generally include growth deficiency and brain damage. FASD is one of the major contributors to intellectual disability in the Westernworld .
Abundant evidence implicates the peptide hormones oxytocin and arginine vasopressin in the regulation of social behavior. In humans, intranasal oxytocin administration increased trust and prosocial behaviors in experimental economic tasks , and led to a higher ratio of positive to negative behaviors during the discussion of a marital disagreement , compared to participants who received the placebo administration . High peripheral oxytocin levels have been associated with better relationship quality.
Prenatal and early postnatal exposures and events can affect the entire life course. While these associations are certainly multifactorial, differences in the gut microbiota could contribute. As well summarized by Arrieta and colleagues, several studies have noted differences in the neonatal fecal microbiota by route of delivery.
Identifying novel approaches to detect EOCs more effectively would have a substantial clinical impact in reducing ovarian cancer related mortality. One of the major reasons for the high rates of EOC associated mortality is that more than 60% of patients are diagnosed with advanced stage disease and there are currently no biomarkers with sufficient specificity to detect new cases of early stage EOC in the clinic. Historically, studies of the underlying biology and etiology of EOC have focused on the epithelial component of tumours .
Bregs are present in several murine models of chronic inflammation, including collagen induced arthritis , inflammatory bowel disease, and experimental autoimmune encephalomyelitis  . Although the most widely used markers for B regs are the expression of IL 10 and CD19, combinations of other surface molecules including CD1d/CD21 , CD5/CD1d  or CD1d, CD21, CD23 and CD24 )  have emerged as additional markers for the identification of this subset of B cells . It has previously been shown that, in contrast to immunized wild type mice, chimeric mice lacking IL 10 or CD40 exclusively on their B cells fail to recover from EAE .
This paper addresses the question: when both selection and demography vary over time in a structured population with overlapping generations, how can we measure the long run expected strength of selection on quantitative traits? He addressed selection on matrix elements themselves rather than on quantitative traits that influence matrix elements. He included, for example, selection acting through survival at different ages or selection acting through reproduction .
Dendritic spines are small protrusions on the surface of dendrites that receive the majority of excitatory synapses, and changes in their morphology are implicated in synaptic plasticity and long term memory . Actin is the major cytoskeletal component that is accumulated in dendritic spines . Rapid assembly and disassembly of actin drives the formation of dendritic spines and their morphological plasticity .
Thousands of single gene, mitochondrial, and chromosomal disorders have been described. Application of whole exome sequencing  has enabled identification and characterization of new diseases and has expanded the phenotypes of known syndromes . Clinically available testing was unrevealing.
Sepsis is a progressive, inflammatory response to overwhelming infection associated with tissue hypoperfusion and multiorgan dysfunction. Based on pathophysiologically oriented views, ALI and ARDS can be of pulmonary  or extrapulmonary  origin. There are several studies indicating that direct and indirect ALI are truly different.
Homologous recombination  promotes the repair of DNA double strand breaks and facilitates the recovery of stalled or collapsed replication folks,. In mitotic cells, two major mechanisms ensure the timely elimination of joint molecules. Firstly, the human BTR complex , or yeast STR complex , promote the dissolution of double HJs to generate NCO products,.
Chronic disease is the central health care problem in the United States  and beyond. Nearly one out of two Americans suffer from at least one chronic disease, and chronic diseases contribute to the majority of U.S. health care costs. Typically incurable and characterized by exacerbations and remissions, chronic diseases must be managed throughout a lifetime.
Data have accumulated demonstrating that the adult olfactory epithelium  retains stem cells that are competent to make neurons, i.e., neural stem cells, and that the population of globose basal cells  is likely to include stem cells capable of replacing destroyed neurons and all other epithelial cell types during the recovery of the epithelium from direct or indirect injury. While still subject to investigation, it has been suggested that a set of multipotent olfactory progenitor  cells resides among the GBC population of the OE and can be activated after lesion when both neurons and non neuronal cells need to be replaced . More direct evidence comes from lineage tracing and transplantation analysis .
The zebrafish is gaining popularity in a number of disciplines that can utilize the sophisticated genetic methods already available for this species, the pharmacological tools originally developed for other laboratory model organisms, and also numerous practical advantages of zebrafish, e.g., its small size and prolific nature. Behavioral brain research is one of these disciplines. A subset of these publications concerns the induction and quantification of fear responses  .
HIV/AIDS is a leading cause of infectious disease mortality worldwide. Among the multiple genetic factors that influence AIDS progression, the human leukocyte antigen  class I genes have the strongest effects identified to date . Extensive allelic polymorphisms are observed in the HLA A, B and C genes, concentrated primarily among nucleotides that encode residues within the peptide binding grooves of the HLA class I molecules, which determine specificity for the associated peptide ligands .
Falls are common among individuals with Parkinson disease , a progressive neurodegenerative movement disorder affecting more than 1 million people in the United States. Seventy percent of patients experienced a fall within a one year period, with 50% of fallers experiencing a recurrent fall in the subsequent year . Many falls occur from backward perturbation or while moving backward ,.
Cortical bone is a composite material containing approximately 20 25% water by volume  . Bone water occurs at various locations and in different binding states. In normal bone the majority of bone water is loosely bound to the organic matrix , with a minor fraction tightly bound to bone mineral  .
The potential risks surrounding a pandemic outbreak of influenza would apply to any new variant of the influenza virus, although, there is a significant clinical difference in the immunopathology of certain influenza strains when humans have been infected . Strain A/H5N1 was first identified in domestic chicken stocks in the Far East . Only sporadic evidence of human infection was available early on but there has been a steady increase in the incidence and severity of small human outbreaks as well as an increasing possibility of a pandemic .
Parvocellular neurons that produce arginine vastotocin  or arginine vasopressin  are present in the medial bed nucleus of the stria terminalis  of almost all land vertebrates . Manipulations within those areas demonstrate that VT/VP is involved in a broad range of social behaviors, including communication, pair bonding, parental behavior and aggression, and some of these behaviors are influenced in a species specific manner  Despite this vast literature, there remains one very large hole: We know almost nothing about the kinds of stimuli that these neurons process on a moment to moment or short term basis. We recently addressed this issue in a study of five species of estrildid finches that differ selectively in their species typical group sizes  .
  In line with its theoretical objectives, the study was conceived as qualitative and open ended, aiming at eliciting individual definitions and processes of recovery in order to facilitate in depth understanding of what recovery means and how it happens from the point of view of persons with recurrent mental health problems in Ireland . In addition, it was decided to limit the study to those who identified themselves as having experienced mental health problems more than once during at least two years, as this group was perceived by services as the most problematic and costly in terms of their recovery . We selected a grounded theory  approach as it offers the possibility of theory building  and is sensitive to social context and culture .
Cardiac muscle contraction is regulated by a Ca2+ triggered cascade of thin and thick filament protein protein interactions. Troponin is a heterotrimeric protein complex consisting of troponin C , a Ca2+ binding protein with two EF hand motifs in each terminal domain, troponin I , the subunit which inhibits contraction via its interaction with f actin, and troponin T , a scaffolding protein that tethers troponin to the thin filament through association with cTnI and tropomyosin. During systole, Ca2+ enters the cytosol and binds to the N domain of cTnC , which prompts a slight opening of cNTnC and the resultant interaction with the “switch” region of cTnI .
Falls are the leading cause of fatal and nonfatal injuries among adults aged 65 and older . Research suggests that intervention programs can reduce the rate of falls by approximately 30 40% . Identifying and incorporating risk profiles improves the efficiency and effectiveness of falls prevention programs and is critical for geriatric evaluation.
The number of patients undergoing primary total hip and knee arthroplasties has steadily increased over the past decade, with nearly 800,000 procedures being performed in the United States each year . Prosthetic joint infection  is a serious complication following arthroplasty, with S. aureus being a common inciting pathogen . The majority of PJIs are thought to occur during surgery, likely originating from skin commensals.
The aim of this study was to investigate the effect of quantification method on estimates of voluntary quadriceps muscle activation . Twenty two people with no history of serious lower extremity injuries underwent voluntary quadriceps activation testing at 60° of knee flexion. Predictive equations were developed that describe the relationships between the three methods .
Determination of ribonucleic acid structure by NMR spectroscopy can be challenging for a number of reasons. Although spectral resolution can be improved through the use of multi dimensional 13C editing, the aromatic 1H and 13C atoms critical for residue assignment and structure analysis exhibit strong 1H 13C dipolar coupling in larger RNAs, which can result in severely broadened NMR signals. As such, the average size of the 298 RNA NMR structures that have been deposited in the Nucleic Acid Database  to date is only 25 nucleotides, and only 13 comprise more than 50 nucleotides .
Spatial attention helps us select relevant information from rich, noisy, and potentially overwhelming amounts of perceptual information. For example, people selectively listen to a single speaker in a cocktail party filled with many voices . Although many influential theories of perceptual attention were driven by research in the auditory domain , recent neuroimaging research has predominantly examined the visual modality.
Penile cancer is a rare malignancy, and few guidelines are available to define treatment paradigms. For greater understanding of the natural history of surgically treated penile cancer, we analyzed experience at our institution . Using an institutional database, we identified 127 patients treated for squamous cell carcinoma of the penis from 1995  2011.
Each summer U.S. teaching hospitals experience a turnover of resident physicians, leading many to investigate whether declines in patient outcomes occur as a result of operational disruption and relative inexperience of new cohorts of physicians . An important reason why prior estimated July effects may have been mixed and small in magnitude is that most studies do not examine whether the July effect varies according to the predicted risk of inpatient mortality. Mortality outcomes of patients at low risk of inpatient mortality  either because of few severe co morbid conditions or because the disease necessitating hospitalization is relatively low risk  may be unaffected by resident inexperience in July, whereas mortality among hospitalized patients with high predicted mortality may be most affected by errors or relative inexperience at the start of the residency year .
Calicheamicin  γ1I  from Micromonospora echinospora spp. Structurally, CLM is a member of the 10 membered enediynes which all share a signature bicycloenediyne core. This reactive intermediate is exquisitely positioned by the CLM aryltetrasaccharide , the critical DNA docking element of CLM .
Exocyclic nucleobase adducts are among the most important types of DNA damage because of their ability to exert significant biological effects . For example, 1,N6 etheno deoxyadenosine adducts induced by vinyl chloride preferentially adopt the syn conformation about the glycosidic bond, forming a Hoogsteen base pair with guanine or cytosine instead of the normal adenine partner, thymine  . 1,3 Butadiene is a known animal and human carcinogen found in automobile exhaust and in cigarette smoke .
Biologic scaffold materials composed of mammalian extracellular matrix  are commonly used for the repair and reconstruction of injured or missing tissues and organs . The mechanical and material properties of ECM scaffolds and the host tissue response to these biomaterials has been shown to depend upon the tissue specificity of the ECM material , processing methods , hydration , three dimensional configuration , and terminal sterilization . The wide spectrum of clinical outcomes possible as a result of these factors has been recently reviewed for ECM scaffold materials commonly used for orthopedic applications  .
DNA protein cross links  are bulky macromolecular conjugates that can form following the sequential alkylation of DNA and proteins by bis electrophiles. DPCs can be induced by a variety of cytotoxic, mutagenic, and carcinogenic agents, including ionizing radiation , transition metals , endogenous and exogenous aldehydes , and chemotherapeutic drugs . In vivo half lives of DPCs can range from hours to days, depending on their chemical stability and their ability to be recognized by repair proteins .
Hypertension and cerebral amyloid angiopathy  account for most primary intracerebral hemorrhage. CAA affects the vessels of the cortex and leptomeninges without significant involvement of the penetrating. By contrast, hypertension causes arteriosclerosis in both cortical and subcortical arteries.
The use of a newly developed three dimensional  ultrasound method to measure volume blood flow  is reported. This method was originally proposed by  and . Therefore, the goal of this paper was to verify the performance of an angle independent, robust, volumetric flow measurement technique that can be implemented using data obtained from current clinical scanner architecture.
It has been suggested that cultural identification is strongly associated with the expression of certain anxiety disorders . There has been a surge in the number of studies focusing on minority mental health issues, and increasing recognition of the need to deepen the understanding of the mental health features of non White samples versus White samples, in order to make the currently defined diagnoses more applicable to a range of individuals . Yet, while this interest is growing, there still remains a dearth of information about the mental health picture of non White race ethnic groups in the United States  .
Cell transplantation shows great promise for repair and restoration of heart function following myocardial infarction . They reported a higher proportion of engraftment when compared to simpler interventions . The hostile environment with persistent oxidative stress ultimately leads to apoptosis of the majority of the transplanted cells.
Many common causes of blindness involve the death of retinal photoreceptors: in Retinitis Pigmentosa  mutations, typically in photoreceptor specific genes, lead to progressive degeneration of rods and cones and gradual loss all useful sight. Both subretinal and epiretinal electronic prostheses have the capability to stimulate retinal ganglion cells  directly . Recently a newer strategy has led to recovery of some visual function in animal models of RP by transgenic expression of photosensitive molecules directly in bipolar and RGCs .These strategies equally depend upon the viability and survival of inner retinal cells following photoreceptor death .
Head and neck squamous cell carcinoma , accounts for 650,000 new cases worldwide  with more than 12% distributed in China . Unfortunately, most patients in China are already in advanced stages when diagnosed and over 76,000 die each year  . It has been postulated that leukoplakia represents an early stage in OSCC, as some lesions evolve to malignant neoplasms .
Hantaviruses, enveloped RNA viruses of the family Bunyaviridae, are known to cause hemorrhagic fever with renal syndrome  and hantavirus cardiopulmonary syndrome  in humans. The HFRS is found primarily in Europe and Asia, and presents as an acute febrile illness associated with marked renal involvement. In acute HFRS, proteinuria and elevated creatinine are common.
Konzo is an upper motor neuron disease characterized by a sudden onset of a non progressive and irreversible spastic paraparesis . Outbreaks of konzo have been reported from several remote rural areas of the Democratic Republic of Congo, Central African Republic, Tanzania, and Mozambique . The pathogenetic mechanisms of konzo have yet to be elucidated.
During adolescence, structural remodeling occurs in a number of brain regions, including the hippocampus, where neural plasticity is a characteristic throughout the lifespan . However, the rate of postnatal neurogenesis is not constant. Neurogenesis is highest during the perinatal period  and is higher in adolescence than in adulthood .
RNA dependent protein kinase  is an interferon induced, double stranded , RNA activated serine/threonine protein kinase that has a well established role in anti viral defense mechanisms. In support of its role in growth suppression, for example, treatment of murine cell lines with dsRNA, TNFα or lipopolycacharide leads to a PKR dependent apoptosis, which may be due to phosphorylation of eIF 2α, but also to the expression of other pro apoptotic factors such as Fas. , In addition, PKR induces apoptosis in epithelial cancer cell lines in response to adenoviral overexpression of TNFα, E2F 1 and the melanoma differentiation associated gene 7 , a novel tumor suppressor gene.
Myotendinous junctions  are highly specialized and architecturally complex structures which form at the interface between muscle and tendon . Structural and functional interaction between muscle and tendon cells at the MTJ, especially mechanical force transduction, results in the development of the adult phenotype. During embryonic/neonatal period tenoblasts in the developing tendon become embedded in a three dimensional  matrix consisting of several types of collagens , proteoglycans, elastin and fibronectin and are transformed into flat cells  with a large number of cellular protrusions .
Recent epidemiologic studies suggest that sunlight may protect against non Hodgkin lymphoma . Most ,  studies,  including a pooled analysis of 10 studies, have found inverse associations between NHL risk and individual  sun exposure, evaluated in terms of self reported time outdoors, sunbathing or other behavioral exposures during various ages. Ultraviolet radiation  exposure is the product of many factors, including not only duration of sun exposure, and host susceptibility characteristics , but also season and geographic location, among others.
Tumor cells have been characterized by “plasticity”, or the capacity to transition between mesenchymal  or amoeboid  migration mechanisms thought to be analogous to normal physiological function for motile cell types such as fibroblasts or immune cells  . Direct comparisons between tumorigenic and non tumorigenic cell types   thought to utilize analogous migration modes   have revealed important differences in function  . For example, while HT 1080 fibrosarcoma cells  were previously characterized by a mesenchymal mode that was qualitatively similar to motile fibroblasts in collagen , , pronounced differences in cytoskeletal structure and cell adhesion properties have been identified through comparisons with human dermal fibroblasts  cultured using identical 2D and 3D cell culture platforms  .
Over the last four million years, the Earth has undergone frequent climatic oscillations including many ice ages . Recent studies making use of the increased power afforded by genome scale data have allowed to test increasingly finer hypotheses regarding the existence and the timing of post divergence gene flow  . The impact that quaternary climatic fluctuations had on speciation is highly dependent on the taxa and the geographic range .
Eukaryotic cells contain a set of functionally distinct membrane bound compartments called organelles. The maintenance of a full set of organelles is fundamental to eukaryotic life. Organelles multiply either by fission of existing organelles or by de novo formation .
18F is the most commonly used isotope for positron emission tomography , due to its nearly ideal imaging properties . The most common use of 18F labeled peptides is to image receptor sites in vivo . For example,  lists the properties of several of the more commonly reported fluorination procedures.
Protein motions are necessary for an enzyme's biological function, but the role of enzyme dynamics at various timescales and their contribution toward catalytic activity is not clear. Enzymes undergo slow conformational sampling that involves large regions of the protein moving on time scales of nanoseconds to seconds. In addition, there are local motions that occur on the picosecond to femtosecond time scale.
Weakness in the autoimmune disease, myasthenia gravis  is caused by antibodies directed against skeletal muscle acetylcholine receptors  on the muscle membrane portion of the endplate . The secondary synaptic folds are simplified due to loss of endplate membrane . The serum level of AChR binding antibodies does not predict the severity of weakness , but the postsynaptic membrane area correlates with the size of the endplate potentials  miniature endplate potentials  and with the patient’s clinical signs of weakness  .
The link between chronic inflammation and tumor progression is now a well accepted concept . The inducible cyclooxygenase 2  enzyme is also involved in cross talk with the inflammatory stroma in colorectal cancer , resulting in promotion of angiogenesis, cell survival, proliferation, migration, and invasion  . Natural plant derived compounds are an attractive class of investigational agents for cancer prevention and treatment.
Polybrominated diphenyl ethers  are flame retardant chemicals that have been used in commercial products such as textiles, plastics, wood, electronic materials, and polyurethane foam . At high temperatures, PBDEs release bromine radicals that inhibit the spread of flame . These chemicals are lipophilic and bioaccumulative, and thus they are of ecotoxicological concern .
Smoking is the number one preventable cause of premature death in the United States with approximately 440,000 dying each year . Most smokers  express a desire to quit , but most relapse within the first few months . There are several behavioral and pharmacological interventions that improve cessation rates.
An important logistical limitation of quantitative positron emission tomography  scans is the need to measure, during image acquisition, the concentration over time of the parent radiotracer in plasma, i.e. the input function. This is generally done by collecting serial arterial blood samples, then separating the fraction of parent compound from its radiometabolites. The whole procedure is labor intensive, time consuming and uncomfortable for the patient, and alternative techniques are needed to reduce  or possibly eliminate  the need for blood sampling.
Each year, it is estimated that 250 000 anterior cruciate ligament  reconstruction surgeries are performed in the USA. The average cost associated with ACL injuries, including diagnostic tests, surgery and rehabilitation, is conservatively estimated to be $17 000 per each reconstructive case from 1999 data. Time lost from ACL injury can be 6 months or longer.
Faces, unlike many of the visual stimuli that we encounter each day, are processed holistically. That is, we are unable to attend to a single face part when it is presented in the context of a whole face; rather, numerous behavioral studies have revealed interference from the ostensibly unattended face parts. Faces are presented sequentially; a study face composed of two face halves is shown, followed by a blank screen or mask, and then a test face.
Young adults ages 1824 have the highest smoking prevalence compared to other age groups in the United States . During young adulthood many people either make the transition from occasional use to addiction or stop smoking . Receptivity to tobacco advertising  and exposure to tobacco promotional activities  are associated with young adult tobacco use .
Acute and chronic rhinosinusitis are a common cause of significant morbidity and healthcare expenditure. An analysis of the National Health Interview Survey between 1997 and 2006 found that sinusitis affects 15.2% of the United States’ population annually. Rhinosinusitis is a common concern in the pediatric population.
Nicotinic acetylcholine receptors  are a diverse family of ligand gated cation channels that are expressed throughout the nervous system. One major class of AChRs found in the CNS is the homopentameric α7 AChR subtype, characterized by its ability to bind α Bgt with high affinity  . Its dysfunction has been implicated in many neurological and neuropsychiatric disorders such as Alzheimer’s disease , schizophrenia , and Down’s syndrome .
Endometrial cancer is the most common female gynaecological cancer in the United States, ranking fourth among all cancers in women in age adjusted incidence . There is a growing interest in the role of phytoestrogens in female hormonal cancers , particularly on breast cancer risk . However, despite the well established association of estrogens unopposed by progesterone and endometrial cancer , the role of phytoestrogens in endometrial cancer risk has received little attention .
Murine B cell development is a leading developmental system for the analysis of gene regulatory networks that orchestrate cell fate ‘choice’ and lineage commitment . The analyses of early B cell development are thus highly advanced, as regulatory networks of signaling molecules and transcription factors have been elucidated that endeavor to account for the generation of B lineage progeny from multi potent progenitors . Cells lacking either E2a or Ebf1 can be cultured ex vivo in the presence of Scf , Flt3l  and Il 7 .
Novel targeted therapies for cancer include immune therapy and small molecule targeted therapies. One approach to immunization therapy is to use dendritic cells or peptide immunogens to stimulate an immune response against defined cancer antigens. An alternate approach is adoptive T cell therapy, which involves autologous or heterologous transplantation of primed cells.
The effect of vitamin D on a wide variety of non skeletal health outcomes, including colorectal cancer , has been the subject of considerable debate . High vitamin D has been associated with reduced risk of CRC in observational studies evaluating dietary intake , circulating 25 hydroxyvitamin D , and predicted 25D . A recent meta analysis of observational data reported a 26% lower risk of CRC  per 10 ng/mL increment in blood 25D levels .
Sudden cardiac death following myocardial infarction  is the most common cause of mortality from heart disease. As we and others,  have shown, abnormal intracellular Ca2+ cycling is a well established mechanism of alternans. Specifically, we have recently shown that the sarcoplasmic reticulum  Ca2+ ATPase , an important regulator of SR calcium reuptake, can significantly modulate the magnitude of alternans .
The Junín, Machupo and Guanarito clade B new world hemorrhagic fever arenaviruses  are associated with outbreaks in Argentina, Bolivia and Venezuela, respectively . Humans become infected through direct contact with rodents or by inhalation of aerosolized rodent excreta, primarily during harvest season or residential infestation . Because they are readily transmitted by aerosols, these Category A arenaviruses are potential bioterrorism agents and are included in the list of agents in the Material Threat Determinations and Population Threat Assessment issued by the Department of Homeland Security .
Death certificates are the main data source for many mortality studies. These data are often used to identify public health problems, allocate funding, and set new goals. Additionally, physicians tend to overstate cardiovascular causes of death compared with subsequent autopsy or review of hospital discharge data  .
Lung cancer is the most common cancer and the leading cause of cancer death both globally and in the United States. In prospective studies, a study in Norway involving 51,452 subjects and 154 lung cancer cases noted a significant protective effect of cod liver oil  against lung cancer ; and a Japanese prospective study showed that frequent consumption of fresh fish or shellfish was associated with lower lung cancer risk . Studies have indicated that in contrast to the cancer preventive effect of n 3 PUFA, n 6 PUFA such as linoleic acid  is associated with higher risk of cancer .
Nucleotide Excision Repair  in eukaryotes repairs DNA via a cascade of biochemical interactions requiring more than 30 proteins. NER repairs a variety of DNA lesions including those induced by UV light such as cyclobutane pyrimidine dimers  and 6,4 photoproducts . Genetic defects in NER in humans lead to several cancer prone conditions including Xeroderma pigmentosum.
Calcium regulated exocytosis is a process by which vesicles containing neurotransmitters or hormones fuse with the plasma membrane . Several groups of proteins coordinate this multistep process. Among them are the soluble NSF attachment receptor  proteins that form the SNARE complex, which is thought to force the plasma and vesicular membranes into close proximity, thereby initiating membrane fusion  and possibly mediating formation of the fusion pore  .
In radioactive decay, three types of radiations can be produced: alpha particles ; beta particles ; and gamma rays  . Gamma radiation has a very small wavelength  and therefore has high energy, which is capable of ionizing molecules and atoms. In biological systems or in solution, ionizing radiation generates hydroxyl radicals  by water radiolysis .
Intermittent claudication is a symptom of peripheral arterial disease , and is associated with elevated rates of mortality and morbidity. Intermittent claudication afflicts 5% of the US population older than 55 years of age, and occurs during ambulation when the peripheral circulation is inadequate to meet the metabolic requirement of the active leg musculature. Thus, intermittent claudication impairs ambulation, daily physical activity, and health related quality of life.
Sexual reproduction provides genetic variation that allows populations to adapt to changing environments  and in some species such as cyclical parthenogenetic monogonont rotifers its product is a diapausing embryo. The diapausing embryo  can also serve as a means of dispersal . Although monogonont rotifer mating behavior was first described more than 40 years ago, few studies have provided detailed information on specific components of the mating sequence .
Synaptic vesicle components, including vesicular membrane proteins, are constantly transported by constitutive vesicles from the cell soma to the active zone at the presynaptic membrane. In nerve terminals, there are three different synaptic vesicle pools with respect to their sensitivity to stimulation : a reserve pool  that responds to stimulation very slowly , a slow response pool  that secretes neurotransmitters more acutely , and a readily releasable pool of SVs that are docked to the presynaptic membrane at the active zone , and responds immediately to stimulation. Carboxypeptidase E  is a major component in large dense core vesicles  in neuroendocrine cells and exists in both soluble and membrane forms .
Defining the molecular mechanisms underlying synapse loss presents a critical challenge to understanding neurodegenerative disease pathology. By contrast, mutations that directly affect mitochondrial metabolism cause early onset neurodegeneration in a number of developmental disorders, including Leigh Syndrome, Leber’s Hereditary Optic Neuropathy and Kearns Sayre Syndrome . In Leigh Syndrome, for example, patients appear normal at birth, but become broadly ataxic, display nystagmus and spasticity, and ultimately die during childhood .
The global emergence of novel psychoactive drugs of abuse has triggered the need for close monitoring around the world. One class of anorexigenic compounds studied in the early 1960s was based on the 5 phenyl 4,5 dihydrooxazol 2 amine  template structure . The majority of these analogs published by Poos et al.  All reagents and dry solvents used in the syntheses were obtained from Sigma Aldrich Ltd. .
Platelet activating factor , prostaglandins  and lysophosphatidic acid  are three major phospholipid mediators shown to be involved in many different biological pathways in inflammatory diseases and cancer . Their importance is underscored by the emergence of COX inhibitors and non steroidal anti inflammatory drugs  as potent anti cancer agents targeting PGs and LPA . PAF induces its multiple cellular effects through its specific receptor, PAFR, which belongs to the G protein coupled receptor  family and transduces cell signals via the G proteins and associated protein phosphorylation cascades .
A number of cyanobacterial lectins bind with high affinity to high mannose oligosaccharides on viral envelope glycoproteins, preventing virus attachment and entry into target cells . These natural products might therefore be utilized to prevent or treat human viral diseases. One potential target for lectin therapy is the Zaire Ebola virus , the causative agent of the current epidemic in West Africa.
AS1411 is a 26 base guanine rich oligonucleotide  with an unmodified  DNA backbone. This molecule and its related analogs can inhibit proliferation and induce cell death in many types of cancer cells, but have little effect on normal cells . A Phase I clinical trial of AS1411  in patients with metastatic cancer has indicated no serious adverse effects with promising clinical activity, and AS1411 is now being tested in Phase II trials  .
Cervical cancer, a virally caused cancer, is the second most common cancer and the second most frequent cause of death by cancer in women worldwide . Despite the robust carcinogenic potential of E6 and E7, HPV infection alone is not sufficient for the development of cervical cancer because only a minor fraction of patients infected with HPV develop cervical cancer . Other studies, however, have concluded otherwise.
Transgender people are individuals who do not identify with the gender that society commonly associates with their birth sex assignment . Trans women identify and often live as a feminine gender  . Trans people also experience high rates of physical as well as sexual violence .
Delay  discounting refers to the devaluation of an outcome as a function of the time to the delivery of that outcome.
