The primary function of the endothelium is to act as a living barrier between blood and tissue that can, among many other functions, control the passage of molecules and leukocytes into and out of the bloodstream. The expression of intercellular adhesion molecule 1  and vascular endothelial cell adhesion molecule  on the activated endothelium subsequently triggers a transition from rolling to firm adhesion via leukocyte integrins. ,,, This firm adhesion allows the leukocytes to actively migrate on the endothelium, often exploring at or near cell—cell junctions, and finally locate a site to transmigrate through the endothelium at both junctional and nonjunctional locations.
Nuclear factor κB  is a transcription factor with critical roles in a number of inflammatory responses, as well as oncogenesis, metastasis and chemoresistance. Stimulation of cells with inflammatory cytokines leads to activation of the canonical pathway, which is mediated by phosphorylation of the IκB proteins by inhibitory κB kinases  . Once freed from its binding proteins in the cytoplasm, NF κB is able to accumulate in the nucleus and interact with regulatory elements and affect gene specific transcription  .
High gamma  oscillations of electrocorticogram  signals play a crucial role both for functional brain mapping  and for BCI research . These HG signals are spatially localized over specific areas of the cortex directly related to the individuals environment and behavior. The major advantages of the HG signals compared to the traditional alpha and beta signals are  an increased information transfer rate and  a higher spatial specificity .
Magnesium  is the most abundant divalent cation in biology and is essential to all living cells as it participates in a myriad of key physiological and biochemical processes, from enzymatic activity to genomic stability. Since the discovery of the CorA gene, the pioneering work of Maguire and colleagues using in vivo radiotracer measurement have provided the functional and genetic basis for its role in bacteria, , . The structures of CorA from Thermotoga maritima offered the first structural template to understand Mg2+ permeation and transport, , .
The Microscale Life Sciences Center  at the University of Washington is dedicated to performing multi parameter analysis at the single cell level . Studying individual cells allows for a more comprehensive understanding of a cell’s activities. Understanding the characteristics of outlier cells is believed to be essential for developing better diagnoses and treatments of such ailments as heart disease, stroke, and cancer .
MicroRNAs  are small ~22 nucleotide  RNAs that post transcriptionally regulate gene expression . Thus, miRNAs are important regulators of basic cellular and developmental processes, and misregulation of miRNA expression has been associated with a multitude of biological effects, including disease  . Transcription by RNA polymerase II yields primary  miRNA transcripts that are subsequently capped and polyadenylated .
Melanoma is a skin cancer arising from the uncontrolled proliferation and invasion of melanocytes. It has also been proposed that melanoma cells switch between mutually exclusive invasive and proliferative states., NICD binds to the DNA binding factor RBPSUK  and leads to increased transcription of target genes. Melanoma cells with constitutively active Notch signalling show increased motility in vitro and increased lung colonisation, through Notch mediated regulation of N cadherin.
The thermophilic bacterium T. thermophilus has become a model organism for understanding life at extreme temperatures . It is also a rich source of proteins and macromolecular complexes for which structures have been determined including RNA polymerase , the 70S ribosome  and the Cmr complex of the CRISPR Cas host defense system . T. thermophilus HB27 is particularly well suited as a model thermophile as its genome is completely sequenced , it is easily cultivated aerobically in the laboratory, it is sensitive to a wide array of antibiotics  and the rate of DNA uptake and transformation are particularly unique.
Hypothyroidism, and to a lesser degree, hyperthyroidism and thyroid cancer, occur at increased rates following radiotherapy exposure to the thyroid. Children treated for acute lymphoblastic leukemia  may receive cranial or craniospinal radiotherapy as part of therapy, placing them at risk of thyroid dysfunction due to disruption of the hypothalamic pituitary axis and/or direct injury to the thyroid gland. While the risk of thyroid dysfunction has been described following higher dose radiotherapy given for brain tumors and Hodgkin lymphoma, the effect of lower doses given to ALL patients has not been as well characterized.
Cocaine is a highly abused psychostimulant with repeated use potentially culminating in drug addiction. Elucidating the molecular mechanisms underlying acute/occasional drug use and repeated drug taking is essential for understanding addiction. Cocaine is a monoamine transporter inhibitor therefore blocking the reuptake of dopamine, serotonin and norepinephrine into presynaptic neurons resulting in enhanced synaptic levels of these neurotransmitters .
Epilepsy is a common neurological disorder that affects about 1% of the world's population , and genetic epilepsy  syndromes comprise ~30% of all cases . The receptor is composed of five subunits, and the predominant synaptic receptors are composed of two α subunits, two β subunits and one γ2 subunit. The most common epilepsy associated GABAA receptor gene  is GABRG2, and epilepsy mutations in γ2 subunits have been shown to decrease receptor function by altering receptor biogenesis or channel function .
Paclitaxel is a microtubule dynamics inhibitor widely used in cancer chemotherapy. It was originally isolated from the bark of the Pacific yew tree, Taxus brevifolia, and was subsequently developed commercially by Bristol Myer Squibb and sold under the trademark Taxol. The incidence of neuropathy in patients receiving paclitaxel is estimated to be 5090 % and is characterized by dysesthesia  of the hands and feet .
By the year 2030 there will be about 70 million Americans aged 65 and older. This dramatic increase in the elderly population will place significant stress on the healthcare system and increase the number of older individuals seen by almost all types of physicians. The problem is compounded by the failure to train a specialized physician workforce sufficient to provide either primary or consultative care of the scope needed.
Helper dependent adenoviral  vectors hold tremendous potential for a large number of therapeutic applications ranging from inherited disorders to cancer and vaccination. HDAd can infect a large variety of cell types to mediate long term, high level expression without chronic toxicity. However, a major disadvantage of HDAd is the induction of a potent and potentially lethal acute reaction following systemic injection of high vector doses.
The requirements for successful cancer immunotherapy are not fully understood. Tumor vaccines that successfully result in the stimulation of large numbers of tumor specific CTL do not necessarily result in tumor destruction . One is the relatively low affinity of the T cell repertoire specific for self/tumor antigens caused by mechanisms of tolerance that delete and inactivate T cells with high affinity for self antigen .
Insulator DNA sequences are thought to partition the genome into functional chromosomal domains to regulate gene transcription . The compartmentalization of chromatin into distinct regulatory domains seems to alter interactions between target genes and nearby cis acting enhancer elements . CTCF was the first human insulator DNA binding protein identified that is a ubiquitously expressed, highly conserved, zinc finger protein that has multiple roles in gene regulation , including regulation of the imprinted maternal H19 allele .
Branched tubular organs such as the lung, vascular system, and kidney are essential for transporting oxygen, nutrients, and cells in all multicellular organisms. The fully developed trachea consists of four types of tubes that differ in sizes and architecture . These tubes are comprised of a linear arrangement of single cells whose apical surfaces surround an extracellular lumen.
Genetic analysis can be used to identify genes required for specific behaviors and can lead to the identification of neural circuits and molecular mechanisms underlying the behavior. The fruit fly, Drosophila melanogaster, is an ideal model organism for investigating the molecular mechanisms or circuits underlying male and female sexual behaviors owing to the availability of vast genetic information and clearly defined behaviors. In Drosophila, female sex pheromones evoke male courtship behavior , and male courtship songs produced by wing vibrations stimulate the sexual receptivity in virgin females .
Nipah and Hendra viruses are highly pathogenic paramyxoviruses of the henipavirus genus that cause acute encephalitis and respiratory illness. The geographical distribution of these reservoir bats partially coincides with the distribution of HNV outbreaks and spillovers events around the Indian Ocean, reaching from Australia  to Southeast Asia and the Indian subcontinent . raised the possibility of lateral transfer of HNV from or to other Eidolon species on mainland Africa and hypothesized a much wider distribution of HNV.
The health benefits of physical activity  and aerobic fitness for children are well established . In general, published research indicates a positive, or at worst, a null association of PA and aerobic fitness with AA . conducted a three year randomized trial with elementary aged students to increase their PA to at least 90 weekly minutes by integrating PA and academic lessons in intervention classrooms.
Frontotemporal dementia  is a set of progressive disorders affecting predominantly the frontal and/or anterior temporal lobes of the brain. Clinically, it is characterized by prominent impairment in personality, behavior and/or language . Approximately 35 40% of autosomal dominant FTD results from mutations in the gene encoding microtubule associated protein tau  on chromosome 17q21  and show abnormal tau pathology in the brain .
Emerging evidence suggests that a significant number of the gene mechanisms that contribute to risk for schizophrenia modulate complex cognitive functions that depend upon the prefrontal cortex and medial temporal lobe . For example, a rare haplotype within the DISC1 gene associates with low prefrontal cortical volume and impairments in cognitive function, specifically working memory . These genotype phenotype relationships further underscore the value of cognitive mechanisms as candidate endophenotypes for schizophrenia and related psychotic disorders .
Enzymes that produce nicotinamide from the catabolism of nicotinamide adenine dinucleotide  are now appreciated to mediate many physiological processes that were nearly unimaginable just a decade ago. These enzymes include poly polymerases , monotransferases, ADP ribosyl cyclases, and sirtuin protein deacetylases. After DNA damage, PARPs consume NAD+ to form large ADP ribose polymers and nicotinamide.
Depression has substantial public health implications. It is also one of the most common psychiatric illnesses. Studies dating back to the early 20th century have provided evidence that depression runs in families .
The coronary vasculature is essential for heart function, yet the processes that govern its formation are incompletely understood. It then envelops the developing heart, thus giving rise to the epicardium, the outer, mesothelial layer of the heart . Fibroblast growth factor s and transforming growth factor β ?
Rodents are capable of fine tactile discrimination tasks that require detection and processing of rapid whisker movements occurring in close succession . Thalamic barreloid neurons respond typically with 0 3 spikes per stimulus to single or periodic whisker deflections, with a mean of less than 2 spikes/stimulus . This sparse firing indicates that a neuronal code based on single cell response magnitudes or interspike intervals is unlikely to be employed.
Prostaglandins  play a diverse role in many physiological and pathological events in the human body. mPGES 1 is reported to play a key role in a number of disease conditions, including inflammation, arthritis, fever, pain, cancer, stroke, and bone disorders. Unlike COX inhibition, inhibition of terminal mPGES 1 will only block the production of PGE2 without affecting the production of other prostaglandins including PGI2.
Social networks are defined as the web of social relationships that surround an individual. Previous studies have found that greater social network size measured close in time or prior to diagnosis is associated with better survival after a breast cancer diagnosis. In the Nurses’ Health Study  of 2,835 postmenopausal women with any stage breast cancer, Kroenke and colleagues found that socially isolated women, i.e., those with small networks, were twice as likely to die of their breast cancer than socially integrated women.
Hypertension is the most common primary diagnosis in the US with about 35 million office visits and is a major risk factor for stroke, myocardial infarction, heart failure, and chronic kidney disease. The lifetime risk of developing hypertension is 90%  among adults between 55 and 65 years. It has been recognized that modifiable lifestyle factors  could play an important role in the prevention of hypertension.
Cannabis, the most widely used illicit drug worldwide, exerts dose related psychoactive effects when the primary psychoactive component, Δ9 tetrahydrocannabinol , interacts with cannabinoid receptors in brain. THC binding to the CB1 cannabinoid receptor leads to the “high” experienced by cannabis smokers . THC is metabolized by hepatic cytochrome P450 enzymes 2C9 and 2C19 to the equipotent monohydroxy compound , 11 hydroxy THC , and undergoes further oxidation to non psychoactive 11 nor 9 carboxy THC  .
Tobacco smoking causes 500,000 deaths annually in the United States, and nicotine is the single most important pharmacological agent responsible for tobacco addiction . Nicotine, cotinine and 3HC undergo further phaseII detoxification reactions by conjugation with glucuronic acid via catalysis by the UDP glucuronosyltransferase  family of enzymes. Approximately 90% of the systemic dose of nicotine is excreted through the urine, and while both O  and N glucuronidation of 3HC was observed in HLM, only its O glucuronide, 3HC Gluc, was detectedin the urine of smokers  .
Relationships between objective measures of chronic rhinosinusitis  and health related quality of life  remain elusive for patients electing endoscopic sinus surgery . However, a patients’ symptomatic experience has been shown, at best, to be weakly associated with objective findings such as computed tomography  results. , In fact, most of the literature shows that CT imaging does not correlate well with patient symptoms or HRQOL.
Myocardial infarction  and stroke are the leading vascular contributors to illness and death in the United States,,  with hundreds of thousands of Americans experiencing one of these events annually. In 2010, 7.6 million US adults were MI survivors and 6.8 million were stroke survivors, and these prevalence rates are predicted to increase by up to 25% over the next two decades owing to treatment advances and growth of the population aged 65 or older. The chronic care of MI and stroke survivors will place huge burdens on families, health care systems, and public programs such as Medicare and Medicaid .
Several cluster randomized HIV prevention trials aim to demonstrate the population level preventive impact of antiretroviral therapy . 2013 World Health Organization guidelines raising the ART initiation threshold to CD4<500/µL could attenuate these trials’ effect size by increasing ART usage in control clusters . We used a computational model to simulate strategies from a hypothetical cluster randomized HIV prevention trial.
Wnt signaling plays an essential role in the regulation of bone homeostasis and fracture repair . Activation of Wnt signaling by means of secreted Wnts leads to increased bone formation. This anabolic activity is regulated by the expression of several Wnt antagonists, such as secreted frizzled related proteins , Wnt inhibitory factor 1 , Dickkopf 1  and Sclerostin .
Environmental factors and genetic variants acting alone and in combination influence two interrelated and highly prevalent metabolic diseases, obesity and atherosclerosis . Thus, continued efforts to characterize gene gene and gene environment interactions and to identify specific genes remain important endeavors . This CSS panel consists of 21 inbred strains of mice, each with a single A/J derived chromosome  that was introgressed into the C57BL/6J  genome by multiple backcrosses and selection .
Focal adhesion kinase  is an important cancer target, because FAK gene amplification and protein overexpression have been demonstrated in a wide range of malignancies . FAK is a non receptor protein tyrosine kinase that integrates signals from integrins and growth factor receptors to regulate cell proliferation, survival, migration, invasion and cancer stem cell  renewal . Although elevated FAK expression is often observed in human tumors, no specific mutations or translocations have been identified to predict which patient population is most likely to respond to a FAK inhibitor.
Drug transport into the nail is expected to be influenced by formulation factors, such as pH. pH can influence nail permeability by affecting the degree of drug ionization within the solution or by altering the keratin matrix within the nail itself. Conversely, Malhotra and Zatz and Kobayashi et al. found pH to be an influential factor in determining nail permeability.
Fibrinogen is a 340,000 kDa protein synthesized in the liver that plays an essential role in clot formation. Fibrinogen is composed of two sets of three polypeptide chains: Aα, Bβ and γ, which are assembled with the stoichiometry 2 . This allows for interaction of neighboring fibrin monomers to form the matrix that is the foundation of a fibrin clot.
Reactive oxygen species  are produced by metabolic processes such as oxidative phosphorylation, and the cytochrome p450 monoxygenase system, but can also be generated by radiation or other environmental exposures. We previously reported that plasma protein carbonyls, and urinary 15 f2t isoprostanes, were associated with an increase in breast cancer risk in a large case control study . Additionally, higher levels of 8 oxodG adducts have been detected in breast tumor tissue compared with adjacent non tumor tissue, and with normal breast tissue from controls .
Reactive oxygen species  generated during prolonged ischemia and subsequent reperfusion are known to contribute to ischemia/reperfusion injury , although, paradoxically, transient ROS generation is also an essential trigger for cardioprotection by ischemic  and pharmacologic preconditioning . In cardiac cells, mitochondria are the major source of ROS, although intracellular NADPH oxidase, xanthine oxidase, monoamine oxidase, etc., may become important ROS sources under pathophysiological conditions. Mitochondria energized with physiologically relevant NADH related substrates produce very little ROS, unless other factors, such as respiratory chain inhibitors  or mitochondrial ATP sensitive K channel activators  are also present.
Traumatic injury accounted for 30% of all life years lost in the United States and was the leading cause of death in Americans between 1 and 44 years old . In preclinical trauma studies, alcohol induced vasodilation, diuresis, decreased cardiac output, impaired vasoreactivity, and depressed myocardial contractility negatively impacted resuscitation and worsened outcomes . Alcohol exposed trauma victims who survived their injuries were at increased risk for nosocomial infection and acute respiratory distress syndrome .
Vision is an active process—we frequently move our eyes, head, and body to acquire visual information to guide our actions. In some cases, self movement generates visual information that would not be available otherwise, such as the motion parallax cues to depth that accompany translation of the observer, . When we rotate our eyes to track a point of interest, we add a pattern of full field motion to the retinal image, altering the patterns of visual motion that are caused by self motion or moving objects.
Inorganic polyphosphates are used in the meat industry to increase the water holding capacity  of pork, poultry and beef products . Polyphosphate use in comminuted meat products improves yield and is particularly useful for production of low salt products  . Another mechanism that is less understood is their action on actomyosin.
Completion of a blood meal by the tick Ixodes scapularis requires an extended period of feeding during which it can transmit the pathogenic spirochete Borrelia burgdorferi. One group of inhibitors that have been characterized from tick saliva contains cystatin like molecules that were named sialostatin L and sialostatin L2 . The structures of several vertebrate cystatins have been determined, either as free molecules or in complex with target proteases .
Abdominal aortic calcification  is associated with incident myocardial infarction or stroke, but no study has reported the association of AAC on lateral spine dual energy X ray absorptiometry  images with coronary artery calcium . The primary aim of this study was to assess the association between AAC scored on lateral spine DXA images intended for vertebral fracture assessment  using a validated 24 point semi quantitative scale and coronary artery calcium detected with electron beam computed tomography  in community dwelling older men and women without known heart disease. The secondary aims of this study were to assess the association between AAC scored on VFA images with a newer simplified 8 point semi quantitative scale and CAC scored with EBCT, and to perform an exploratory analysis of the additional prediction of a high CAC level from the additional of AAC score on lateral spine DXA images combined with clinical risk factors compared to the prediction of CAC from clinical risk factors alone .
Silencing is distinct from classic gene repression in its ability to block transcription throughout a chromosomal region. Hence, silencing of HML and HMR is needed for a robust mating ability . Although silencing is constitutive in yeast, conditional or inducible alleles of the Sir proteins have revealed orchestrated events that establish silencing de novo.
Human rhinoviruses  cause the common cold and are frequently detected in asthma exacerbations. RV typically induces neutrophilic inflammation in the upper airways of both asthmatic and non asthmatic patients; however, in asthmatics these infections can lead to more severe lower respiratory symptoms, as well as reductions in lung function. Interestingly, the severity of asthma symptoms may not be related to viral load, prolonged viral shedding, or to differences in proinflammatory cytokines in the upper airway secretions.
Individuals with schizophrenia consistently show impairments in social cognition . SC has become a potential treatment target due to its association with functional outcomes. An alternative method of assessment is to administer an observer based scale incorporating an informant’s “first hand” impressions in ratings .
An increase in urban populations in developing countries has been accompanied by increased industrial activities, an indiscriminate use of pesticides, a lack of environmental regulation and an increase in poorly planned cities, all resulting in environmental pollution . The presence of Aedes aegypti   larvae has been confirmed in polluted habitats such as drains containing domestic wastewater and man made aquatic habitats , habitats previously not associated with this species of mosquito. Metallic habitats are of particular interest as they provide a source of metal contamination directly to the breeding site.
The insulin/IGF 1 like signaling  pathway is an evolutionarily conserved neuro endocrine pathway that regulates metabolism, development, stress resistance and lifespan . These kinases in turn function to negatively regulate the forkhead transcription factor , DAF 16  . Thus DAF 16 is a major downstream target of the IIS pathway.
The Breast Cancer Susceptibility Gene 1  encodes a tumor suppressor that acts to maintain genetic stability. Individuals that inherit a mutation in BRCA1 are predisposed to developing breast, ovarian, and other cancers. BRCA1 mutated breast cancers are particularly aggressive and exhibit poor outcomes compared to other subtypes of breast cancer.
Federal regulation of cigarettes and other tobacco products has been recommended as an element of a broad based approach to reduce the disease burden of tobacco use . One component of federal regulation is likely to be the power to mandate limits of emissions of tobacco smoke toxins. Nicotine is responsible for tobacco induced disease in that it sustains tobacco use.
Current standard combination chemotherapy regimens for patients with metastatic CRC contain 5 fluorouracil  in combination with oxaliplatin or irinotecan. Although the response rate to systemic therapies is ~50%, drug resistance develops in nearly all patients with metastatic CRC, leading to ~50,000 deaths each year in the United States . A better understanding of the mechanisms by which cancer cells develop resistance to individual chemotherapeutic agents is urgently needed to identify novel therapeutic targets and methods that would improve survival .
The behavioral investigation of human memory has been of interest to neuropsychologists for several decades. Certain behavioral tests, in particular free recall, clearly display the memory deficit associated with a number of types of brain damage , neurological disorders , and healthy aging . A number of prominent studies have documented the organizational difficulties exhibited by various patient groups in free recall.
The vascular injury in systemic sclerosis  occurs very early in the disease, even before the onset of fibrosis. This immune cell recruitment is facilitated by vascular endothelial cells which, upon injury, upregulate adhesion molecules such as VCAM 1, ICAM 1 and E selectin, ultimately leading to immune activation, cell recruitment and tissue damage. This process has been observed in SSc clinicalpathological studies, as there is a strong correlation between immune cell infiltration and the severity and progression of skin disease.
A growing interest in the field of glycobiology, defined in a broad sense as the study of sugars and their roles in biology, has emerged in recent years. Research in this area has uncovered many roles for both glycolipids and glycoproteins in the basic functioning of the brain. Further, disruptions in these systems have been linked to several neurological disorders, such as Alzheimer's disease  and Huntington's disease .
Dendritic cells  are the primary antigen presenting cells  that mediate T cell immunity and tolerance . In skin, it is thought that epidermal Langerhans cells  and dermal dendritic cells  serve this role by taking up antigen  in the periphery and acting as sentinels. Following activation by pathogenic stimuli skin DCs upregulate MHC II, CD40, CD80, and CD86 molecules and migrate to the skin draining lymph nodes  to prime naïve T cells .
The importance of karyotype at diagnosis in predicting outcome in patients with acute myeloid leukemia  and myelodysplastic syndrome  is well established. These studies have clearly demonstrated that the outcome for patients with chromosome 5 and 7 abnormalities  have an inferior leukemia free survival and overall survival when traditional cytotoxic chemotherapy, including combinations of cytarabine and anthracyclines, are used. Such inferior outcome is also seen even with the use of allogeneic stem cell transplantation in first complete remission .
Internationally, the Peer Change Agent  model is one of the most frequently used conceptual frameworks for HIV prevention interventions . Peer change agents  are generally trained to use similar strategies to communicate HIV risk reduction messages among targeted peers. Change agents themselves, however, can often be more important than the messages they convey.
CL was the first polyglycerolphospholipid discovered and was first isolated from beef heart by Mary Pangborn . CL also plays an essential role in mitochondrial biogenesis , and the assembly of respiratory enzyme supercomplexes . Phosphatidic acid is converted to cytidine diphosphate 1,2 diacyl sn glycerol  catalyzed by cytidinediphosphate 1,2 diacyl sn glycerol synthetase .
The mitogen activated protein  kinase / extracellular signal regulated kinase  pathway regulates cell cycle progression, cellular growth, survival, differentiation, and senescence by responding to extracellular signals. However, patients become resistant within a year of treatment . Oncogene induced senescence is a process that is thought to suppress tumorigenesis.
Nonalcoholic fatty liver disease  is the most common of liver pathologies and is closely associated with obesity and the metabolic syndrome. The mechanisms leading to NASH are multifactorial. The “two hit” model of NASH was proposed in 1998  in which alterations in lipid homeostasis associated with obesity, insulin resistance and adipokine disruption result in steatosis and constitute the “first hit”.
It has been postulated that in schizophrenia there is a progressive excitotoxic process involving excessive glutamatergic activity in various cortical and subcortical fields that may account for the deteriorating course of the illness. This leads to neuronal dysfunction and underlies the deteriorating cognitive and social functional state characteristic of the illness, despite the beneficial symptomatic effects of antipsychotic medications. Most of the evidence for this process is indirect and stems from pharmacological studies with N methyl D aspartate receptor  blockers.
Gap junctions, formed by connexin  molecules, are transmembrane channels allowing the exchange of small molecules , such as metabolites, ions and second messengers between contacting cells. Mutations of connexin genes are linked to multiple human diseases, including defective myelination diseases such as Charcot Marie Tooth disease  , Pelizaeus Merzbacher like disease  , congenital sensorineural hearing loss   and oculodentodigital dysplasia    . This extensive network is vital, because it facilitates ion and metabolite exchange throughout the avascular lens, maintaining osmotic and metabolic homeostasis and ultimately, lens transparency .
Although appropriate use of prescription drugs can substantially improve health status, accessing these treatments may sometimes consume catastrophic proportions of available income. Recent surveys have shown that low income households often cut back on basic necessities or take less medication than prescribed due to out of pocket drug costs . Family budgets in low income households are very tight, dominated by basic living needs for housing, food, and transportation.
Thymocytes undergo a series of developmental stages through interactions with major histocompatibility complex  expressing antigen presenting cells , resulting in the generation of mature T lymphocytes and selection of the T cell repertoire . This results in the selection of T cells expressing receptors recognizing a universe of foreign antigens in association with self MHC in the absence of autoreactivity. Although B cells also reside in the thymus in normal mice and humans , less attention has been paid to the thymic B cell population.
The primate auditory system is characterized by two parallel, chemically defined processing pathways that can be segregated based on immunoreactivity to either parvalbumin  or calbindin . The relative densities of neurons expressing these CaBPs and other calcium dependent molecules change with age in auditory structures throughout the rodent auditory system , and similar observations have recently been made in the macaque monkey . These density changes occur in parallel with age related cochlear pathologies that lead to decreased excitatory output from the sensory periphery , and changes in the balance of excitation and inhibition in auditory neurons which lead to over excitable central auditory structures in aged animals .
Acute myocardial infarction  is one of the leading causes of morbidity and mortality in the adult population that strikes 7.6 million American adults, or about one person every 44 seconds in the United States. The mainstay of current therapy for acute MI is the restoration of blood flow  to the affected area through angioplasty, sometimes in conjunction with thrombolytic therapy to remove/prevent thrombi formation. However, the reperfusion of ischemic tissue can itself lead to severe myocardial damage.
Cocaine is a widely abused drug with no FDA  approved medication available for treatment seeking users. A promising concept for anti cocaine medication is to accelerate cocaine metabolism by hydrolysis at the benzoyl ester, producing biologically inactive metabolites. However, wild type human BChE  has a low catalytic activity against naturally occurring  cocaine .
ACL reconstruction improves stability of the ACL deficient knee, and may mitigate subsequent damage to the medial meniscus. However, it does not consistently protect the joint from osteoarthritis  progression over the long term, , . The high number of sports related ACL injuries in young individuals, and the lack of effective treatment options for knee OA in this population makes this an emerging problem .
Metastasis is the key process that leads to death from solid tumors. A major challenge is how to utilize these resources to identify regulatory mechanisms that drive tumor invasion and metastasis . Metastasis suppressors are genes that do not significantly alter primary tumor growth but prevent cancer cells from undergoing metastasis, .
Family based linkage analysis has been highly successful in identifying genetic loci underlying Mendelian disorders. In contrast, linkage analysis of complex traits and diseases in the general population has resulted in little success. While many complex trait and disease variants have been identified through genome wide association studies , the majority of these loci have small effect sizes and cumulatively explain relatively little of the overall risk.
The innate immune response relies on the recognition of the antigen by receptors that recognize specific structures found exclusively in microbial pathogens termed pathogen associated molecular patterns  . The signaling provided by TLRs triggers maturation and activation of APCs  increasing their ability to prime naïve T cells. In this way, TLRs link the recognition of pathogens with induction of adaptive responses.
The brain is a high oxygen consuming organ and constantly exposed to oxidative stress. Polyunsaturated lipid in lipoproteins and membranes are particularly susceptible to oxidative stress damage, leading to the production of several reactive aldehydes such as 4 hydroxynonenal  and 4 oxo 2 nonenal  , which are capable of modifying protein  and DNA . Indeed, there is substantial evidence for increased lipoperoxidation in neurodegenerative disease associated with oxidative stress, such as Alzheimer disease and Parkinson disease  .
Individuals with salt sensitivity of blood pressure  are usually unable to excrete excess sodium without experiencing a concurrent increase in arterial pressure , . These individuals are at increased risk for essential hypertension, cardiovascular disease , and premature death , . There is strong evidence that genetic mechanisms may underlie the inter individual variation in BP response to salt intake .
Schizophrenia is associated with very high rates of tobacco addiction  relative to the general population  . Nicotine, the primary addictive and reinforcing constituent in cigarettes, has high affinity for the beta2 subunit containing nicotinic acetylcholine receptors . However, results from a post  mortem study suggests that smokers with schizophrenia fail to upregulate β2* nAChRs to the same extent as comparison smokers.
Functional imaging of the central nervous system is of great significance in the neurological sciences because of its potential to reveal how intricate physiological processes occurring at the cellular level contribute to the vast array of neurological functions in humans. Understanding how these mechanisms underpin higher order brain function would offer new insight into well studied yet poorly understood phenomenon such as the activity based changes that accompany memory formation and recall or functional deficits that manifest as disease specific symptomology. In recent years, multiple imaging modalities have been employed in an effort to provide functional data about the inner workings of the human brain.
The use of effective connectivity has become more popular, with no single method being used to the exclusion of others. This poses problems when attempting to compare results across studies, as the multiple ways in which connectivity can be determined will not necessarily lead to the same conclusion about whether two or more neural units are strongly interacting or not . Several different models including structural equation modeling , nonlinear system identification techniques , autoregressive techniques , and dynamic causal modeling  have been introduced as valid methods for estimating effective connectivity from fMRI time series data.
Recent discoveries linking tiny pieces of RNA, called microRNAs , with the activity of thousands of genes are fueling excitement about the roles that these molecules play inside the cell . Interestingly, the 2025 nucleotides of mature miRNAs form ‘imperfect’ double helical complexes with their RNA targets . The reasons for such imperfections and the potential functional role that the non canonical bases might play are open questions of biological relevance .
Human genetic disorders are caused by diverse types of mutations. Many of these mutations, including nonsense mutations, frameshift mutations, and mutations that cause alternative splicing events, result in premature termination codons . For example, approximately 15% of the mutations leading to Duchenne muscular dystophy , 10% of the mutations responsible for cystic fibrosis, and common β globin mutations responsible for thalassemia are PTC mutations .
As shown in , definitions of dyslexia  have expanded and evolved in recent years, in part due to refined understanding obtained through research and in part due to controversy that has arisen over the role of cognitive abilities in the definition and classification of RD. Although some reference to cognitive/intellectual ability has historically been included in most definitions of dyslexia, either in the form of discrepancy scores  or IQ cut off , the past two decades have brought increasing criticism of these models  and a tendency toward exclusion of IQ from the definition of RD . Several studies have addressed this issue and will be described briefly .
Proton Magnetic Resonance Spectroscopy  is widely considered the most accurate non invasive method to measure liver fat . It has been validated in phantoms, animals, and humans, and is performed clinically as well as in research . Its large scale feasibility has been demonstrated in a prospective cohort study in which liver fat content was measured spectroscopically in 2,349 subjects  .
Lead is now accepted to lower children’s IQ at commonly encountered exposures, and no threshold has been determined for this effect. Nevertheless, lead’s effect on children’s behavior is less understood compared to its impact on IQ. Few studies have been done at levels of exposure <10 µg/dL, and almost all have focused on attention related problems.
The prevalence of overweight among children in Texas is higher compared to U.S. wide estimates, especially among economically disadvantaged populations . National prevalence estimates indicate 16% of Mexican American adolescents are obese and 34% are overweight based on the CDC BMI for age growth charts . Additional details on Senate Bill 19 are provided elsewhere  .
Ovarian cancer is the fourth most common cancer in women. These cells release inflammatory cytokines and oxidizing agents including myeloperoxidase . MPO is present at high levels in neutrophils and monocytes, and catalyzes reactions with hydrogen peroxide and chloride to produce hypochlorous acid , a potent microbicidal agent that damages DNA, proteins, and lipids .
Gene therapy has great potential for treatment for many inherited retinopathies , which are mostly monogenic blinding diseases. Most of the genes mutated in IRs are expressed in photoreceptors . Notably, AAV serotypes 5, 7, 8 and 9 target PRs of various species efficiently .
Type 2 diabetes is considered “the epidemic of the 21st century”, affecting approximately 24 million individuals in the US alone . Compared with people without type 2 diabetes, those with type 2 diabetes have higher death rates , and are at elevated risk of cardiovascular disease  and other complications of diabetes, such as retinopathy, nephropathy, and neuropathy . Diabetes and its complications remain major causes of morbidity and mortality in the US  .
The cortical generators of EEG/MEG measurements can be estimated by solving an inverse imaging problem where the unknown sources are distributed on an individual’s cortex with their orientations fixed and orthogonal to the local surface . The associated inverse procedure is thus extremely ill posed and has an infinity of solutions . Several studies have proposed to address this issue by imposing a partial fMRI constraint  or by modeling more finely the relationship between the BOLD signals and the EEG/MEG measurements .
Pentachlorophenol  is a synthetic molecule that has been used throughout the world for purposes as varied as antimicrobial agent, detergent and wood preservative. Even though its use has been restricted after the 1980s, it is still widely present in the environment, and it is considered as a chemical pollutant of concern . Acute toxicity of PCP is usually occupationally related with significant damage to various organs, and chronic exposure also results in severe health disorders .
The use of mosquito repellents helps reduce or prevent mosquito bites that may lead to not only discomfort but also mosquito borne diseases such as malaria and West Nile virus illness. Mosquito coils have been and are still the most commonly used mosquito repellents worldwide. Based on our personal communications with a mosquito coil manufacturer, it is estimated that 45 to 50 billion mosquito coils are used annually by approximately 2 billion people worldwide.
Colon cancer is third most malignant tumor type involving uncontrolled growth of cells in colon. Many small molecule and antibody based therapeutics have been engineered and developed for cancer therapy to target this disease effectively. Increase uptake of fatty diets need extensive recirculation of bile acids for its digestion.
Cyclodextrins are cyclic oligosaccharides with hydrophobic interiors used as formulation vehicles to increase the amount of drug, including hormones and vitamins, which can be solubilized in aqueous vehicles . 2 hydroxypropyl β cyclodextrin  was extensively studied in rodents, dogs, and monkeys where it was generally well tolerated at low doses . All of these changes were reversible following cessation of HPβCD administration  .
T cell exhaustion is a type of immune response describing the condition in which T cells exhibit reduced differentiation, proliferation and effector function. Phenotypically, PD 1 expression has been demonstrated to be a marker to identify exhausted T cells in viral infection and tumors . Co stimulatory molecule CD70 can be expressed on T cells upon TCR stimulation.
The diagnosis of patients with pulmonary infiltrates and human immunodeficiency virus  infection remains a frequent challenge. The first description of elevated BG, both in serum and BAL, of HIV positive patients with PCP was in 1996. Since that time several studies have been reported.
Pemphigus encompasses a group of autoimmune blistering diseases exhibiting pathogenic autoantibodies against desmogleins , a family of desmosomal cell adhesion glycoproteins . The hallmark of these diseases is the presence of intraepidermal vesicles  and anti epidermal autoantibodies . Pemphigus foliaceus  and pemphigus vulgaris  are the two major phenotypes of pemphigus .
Smoking is the leading cause of preventable death among women and a leading preventable cause of poor pregnancy and infant outcomes in high income countries . Self reported smoking during pregnancy in nine countries in Latin America, Asia, and Africa was highest in two countries, Uruguay  and Argentina  . Studies in high income countries have found that women’s self reported smoking status during pregnancy can underestimate smoking prevalence by 24 28%, and intervention studies have documented differences in self reported and biochemically verified quitting .
Polarized membrane trafficking of signaling receptors is critical for developing neurons to respond to extracellular stimuli mediating growth, guidance and neuronal survival. The family of tropomyosin related kinases  receptors provides a prominent example of trophic factor receptors that undergo long distance axonal trafficking to regulate growth and survival of developing neurons . A key mechanism by which the prototypical neurotrophin, NGF, secreted by peripheral target tissues, provides trophic support to sympathetic neurons is by regulating endocytosis and retrograde trafficking of NGF:TrkA complexes in signaling endosomes from axon terminals to cell bodies .
Researchers have long sought to understand juvenile delinquency because of its very clear social costs . A second approach to understanding delinquency utilizes measures of personality . To our knowledge, these two lines of research  parental monitoring and personality  have not yet been integrated .
Kidney stones are a common and serious medical disorder, causing significant medical costs . Urinary citrate is an important inhibitor of calcium stones and low urinary citrate is a common contributor to many stone types . However, some findings indicate that this may not be the case.
The prevalence of type 2 diabetes is increasing worldwide, and is expected to affect 380 million people by 2025. In the US, use of sulfonylureas  continue to be one of the main classes used to manage type 2 diabetes. Despite over three decades of treatment experience with glipizide and glyburide, it remains unknown whether co administration of anti infective agents increases the risk of hypoglycemia, as suggested by case reports.
Obesity and over overweight, as defined by the , are important health concerns that continue to escalate in scope and severity. Globally, more than 300 million adults are obese . Obesity is a major problem in the United States .
Maintenance of B cell homeostasis requires proper intracellular integration of signals delivered from multiple surface receptors such as the B cell antigen receptor, Toll like receptors , B cell activating factor  receptor, and CD40, as well as intracellular cues. Tnfaip3 encodes the A20 protein, a ubiquitin modifying enzyme . Radiation chimeras bearing Tnfaip3−/− hematopoietic cells also develop spontaneous systemic inflammation, which is alleviated by depletion of commensal intestinal bacteria with antibiotics .
Our laboratory has shown that patients with sickle cell disease  have significantly decreased HDL C and apoA I., We have also demonstrated that among SCD patients, those with lower apoA I levels have impaired vasodilatory responses to acetylcholine during forearm blood flow strain gauge plethysmography , and they tend to have elevated estimated pulmonary artery systolic pressures, an echocardiographic marker of pulmonary hypertension. In support of this finding, in pulmonary arterial hypertension patients without SCD, plasma HDL C levels are low, and predict clinical worsening and death. Niacin ER treatment promotes an increase in HDL C containing apoA I.
Gene modification by homologous recombination  is a relatively inefficient process mammalian cells, typically occurring at a low frequency of about one event per 105   107treated cells as compared to the high rate of random, non targeted integration of the donor DNA , which occurs in about one cell per 102   105 treated cells. However, positive negative selection achieves only a low degree of enrichment in mammalian cells other mouse ES cells, and many colonies must be screened to identify the targeted recombinants. approaches that substantially enhance the rate of gene targeting have great potential applications in biotechnology  and biomedical sciences  .
Addressing the sexual and reproductive health needs of people living with HIV is an emerging concern in secondary HIV prevention, especially in sub Saharan Africa with generalised epidemics and large numbers of reproductive age women living with HIV. The limited studies of fertility intentions among HIV positive men indicate they also want to have children . These include “high technologies,” such as sperm washing, insemination with donor sperm using intrauterine insemination , in vitro fertilisation  or intracytoplasmic sperm injection .
That brain derived neurotrophic factor  contributes to the processing of nociceptive messages was originally suggested by a dramatic alteration in the levels of BDNF expression in the spinal cord following tissue or nerve injury . BDNF levels increased in peptidergic nociceptors, and there is de novo expression in cell bodies of large diameter afferents . For example, genetic deletion of BDNF from NaV1.8 expressing nociceptors decreased inflammation induced thermal hyperalgesia .
Every year in the United States more than 1.25 million people suffer burns and 6.5 million have chronic skin ulcers caused by pressure, venous stasis, or diabetes mellitus . The treatment of these conditions remains imperfect and expensive. There is hope that stem cell therapy may prove beneficial as it has been increasingly well established that stem cells play an important role in wound healing.
Infusion of angiotensin II  induces a loss of lean tissue or skeletal muscle  that is attributed to a decrease in systemic and muscle insulin like growth factor 1  . The Ang II induced reduction in body mass  can be alleviated by treatment with an angiotensin receptor blocker  suggesting that the mechanism of mass loss is angiotensin receptor mediated  . Furthermore, acute dexamethasone  treatment inhibits growth hormone receptor  and IGF1 mRNA levels in cultured hepatocytes  and in rats , despite being reported to increase hepatic GHr mRNA levels in rabbits .
Neural stem/precursor cells  have recently generated much interest as a therapeutic means of reducing neural tissue loss after neurodegenerative diseases or central nervous system  injury. Identified in embryonic CNS and in discrete adult brain areas such as the subventricular zone  and the subgranular layer  of the hippocampal dentate gyrus, NPCs are unique for their continuous self renewal and multipotent abilities to generate neurons, astrocytes, and oligodendrocytes upon exposure to specific differentiation signals . Neurogenesis in the adult hippocampal dentate gyrus has crucial roles in learning, memory, and behavioral states .
Sickle cell disease  associated vasculopathy in the penis is characterized by aberrant nitric oxide and phosphodiesterase  5 signaling, and by increased oxidative stress. Preliminary clinical trials show that continuous treatment with PDE5 inhibitor sildenafil unassociated with sexual activity decreases priapic activity in patients with SCD. However, the mechanism of its vasculoprotective effect in the penis remains unclear .
Homogeneous glycopeptides and glycoproteins carrying defined glycan structures are indispensible tools for structural and functional investigation of glycoproteins. To circumvent this problem, several research groups, including ours, have recently explored synthetic sugar oxazolines, a highly activated species mimicking the presumed oxazolinium ion intermediate generated by a substrate assisted mechanism of catalysis, as donor substrates for glycopeptide synthesis. Extension of this approach to the synthesis of homogeneous glycoproteins carrying a defined oligosaccharide moiety was also achieved.
The distal vasculature in the adult lung—distributed through approximately 300,000,000 alveoli—is a major site of injury and remodeling in acute lung injury . Once destroyed by injury or disease the spontaneous restoration of small vessel and capillary networks, leading to better lung function, has proved limited. While major advances have been made in the treatment and management of patients with ALI, vascular loss remains a significant clinical problem.
Methylphenidate  continues to be an important pharmacotherapeutic option for treating Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder . A number of reports also describe the ability of MPH to at least partially substitute for other psychostimulants such as cocaine , amphetamine  and methamphetamine  . Several reports indicate that repeated exposure to MPH induces locomotor sensitization in rodents  .
Early and successful reperfusion of the acutely ischemic myocardium is the most effective salvage against irreversible ischemic injury , but can also cause reperfusion injury. Among the cellular culprits that contribute to reperfusion injury, bursts of reactive oxygen species  occurring during early reperfusion have been known to occur since the late 1980’s, . Despite a clear understanding of the role of ROS in reperfusion injury, there are no adjuvant treatments currently administered in routine clinical practice to protect the heart against reperfusion injury .
Lung cancer is the most common cause of cancer death, accounting for more deaths than colorectal, prostate, and breast cancer combined . One class of lung cancer is non small cell lung carcinoma  . Unfortunately, most patients present with locally advanced or metastatic disease and are considered incurable.
Cooling towers are heat rejection devices used in industrial settings to efficiently cool building water systems without the use of chemical refrigerants. Cooling towers provide a unique environment for microbial growth and dissemination . These devices generally have sizable water reservoirs, within which the temperature is typically maintained between 25°C and 35°C.
Early pharmacological based studies suggested the existence of at leastjust two receptors for cysteinyl leukotrienes  and these speculations were later confirmed with the cloning of the CysLT1 and 2 receptors . It is characterized by high affinity for leukotriene D4, approximately 10 fold higher than that for LTC4. In contrast, the CysLT2 receptor is not thought to mediate bronchospasm, has a unique pattern of distribution, and is characterized by equivalent affinity for LTC4 and LTD4 not thought to be important in asthma and allergic inflammation.
In the past, most of medical schools’ curricula were based on the traditional model of teaching in which education activities were reduced to a transfer of information . In many instances, students failed to connect newly acquired material to preexisting knowledge and apply principles needed for problem solving and understanding concepts  . More recently, it was made well known by the television game show, “Who Wants to Be a Millionaire” with the ask the audience lifeline .
A central tenet of cancer biology states that cancer is clonal, with tumors arising as the result of expansion of increasingly dysregulated cells. Asbestos, which is known to induce mesothelioma, is an example of a non mutagenic carcinogen. In the case of carcinogens such as asbestos, it may be that dysregulation of the somatic epigenome is equally, if not more crucial for cancer development .
Proper adherence to a treatment plan, especially taking medication regularly and as prescribed is a common clinical challenge for both patients and clinicians. The projected medication adherence rate in chronic illness ranges from 20% to 80% . The authors of the meta analysis found that depressed people were 1.76 to 3.03 times more likely to be nonadherent compared to those who were not depressed .
Bmi1, a member of the mammalian polycomb group of multimeric transcriptional repressors, is involved in the regulation of development, stem cell self renewal, cell cycle, and senescence . Bmi1 was first identified as a c myc cooperating oncogene in murine B cell lymphomas . In addition, Bmi1 has been shown to be important for self renewal of neural stem cells , and its expression is essential for the tumorigenicity of MycN induced neuroblastoma .
The psychoactive properties of cannabis have been recognized since early time and today, it remains the most widely used illicit drug globally. Despite the possible stigma and legal issues associated with its use, Cannabis sativa has been widely used as a herbal remedy over the centuries for the treatment of various conditions such as migraine, spasticity, nausea and vomiting as well as a magnitude of other disorders. Several cannabinoid medications are currently FDA approved in the United States or in phase III trials, such as Dronabinol, Nabilone, or Nabiximols.
Ordered progression through the eukaryotic cell cycle depends on mechanisms that tie the abundance and activity of critical regulatory molecules to the events of DNA replication and cellular division. By destroying proteins at specific points in the cell cycle, the Ubproteasome system  provides directionality to the events of cell duplication, and insures that each phase of the cycle occurs after the previous one is completed  . Despite the biological importance of cell cycle regulated proteolysis, techniques to study this phenomenon are limited.
Unlike mammals, adult teleost fish like zebrafish, are able to regenerate a damaged central nervous system and therefore provide a good model for investigating mechanisms underlying neuronal repair. The robust regenerative power of the teleost retina is demonstrated by the observation that chemically induced whole retina destruction results in retinal regeneration that is accompanied by restoration of visual function . These observations, combined with reports that Müller glia in postnatal chicks and rodents have a limited capacity to regenerate neurons following retinal injury , implicated Müller glia as a source of retinal progenitors that participate in repair of damaged retinas .
Malignant gliomas, including anaplastic astrocytoma  grade III) and glioblastoma multiforme  are among the most devastating malignancies. Median post diagnosis survival for anaplastic astrocytoma is less than 3 years and for glioblastoma multiforme is 1214 months . Gliomas often respond to radiotherapy, however, subsequent recurrence is almost inevitable, suggesting insufficient killing of tumorigenic cells .
Preterm birth is the major cause of neonatal mortality and morbidity worldwide, yet the underlying etiologies remain poorly understood . Numerous studies suggest that intrauterine infection is an important mechanism leading to preterm labor and may account for 40% of preterm births . However, this number may be higher because many infections are likely to be subclinical and the pathogenesis is not detected due to the lack of sensitivity of conventional culture techniques .
The patient centered medical home  is a model of care that advocates believe is central to achieving the “triple aim” of improving health, controlling costs, and enhancing patient experience in primary care. Core components of the PCMH include comprehensive primary care, enhanced access, care management, and quality improvement; all directed toward the fundamental goal of orienting care around the needs of the patient., One anticipated benefit of the model is that the PCMH will better position health care systems and providers to support a patient’s active role in maintaining their health and managing their diseases. The concept is an important aspect of patient centeredness, one of the six fundamental aims of a high performing health system.
Induction of efficient long term immune memory is the aim of all vaccine protocols. Costimulatory molecules play a critical role in initiating and maintaining optimal immune responses . These studies used replication competent recombinant vaccinia  as prime and replication defective recombinant fowlpox  as boost.
The sulphydryl containing amino acid, cysteine plays an important role in intermediary metabolism in the heart. In adults cysteine is obtained from dietary sources, proteolysis and methionine catabolism . The intracellular concentration of cysteine in the rat heart is 0.089 mM compared to 0.097 mM in the plasma  .
Acute myeloid leukaemia  represents a biologically and clinically heterogeneous disorder characterised by a clonal expansion of haematopoietic progenitor cells blocked in their maturation. About 50% of AMLs present cytogenetic abnormalities of various types that can be used to categorise the patients into different risk groups. The FLT3 protein is commonly mutated in AML, with 2030% of cases carrying an internal tandem duplication within the juxtamembrane domain  and 812% a single point mutation at position 835 in the kinase domain , leading to constitutive signalling and enhanced cell survival and proliferation.
It is widely believed that somatic as well as germline mutations play important roles in the origin and progression of colorectal cancers . Many genes have been investigated for mutation to elucidate mechanisms of colorectal cancer development, with these investigations demonstrating the involvement of mutations in colorectal carcinogenesis and progression. reported that PIK3CA, a catalytic subunit of the class IA phosphatidylinositol 3 kinases, was somatically mutated in 32% of colorectal cancers, resulting in the attenuation of apoptosis and facilitated tumor invasion.
Engrailed  is a homeodomain containing transcriptional regulator that has an important role in nervous system development. It is found ubiquitously in bilaterian animals, indicating that it arose more than 500 million years ago, in the Cambrian era . En was first identified in Drosophila, where it was shown to play a crucial part in the early patterning of body segments and limbs ; it was subsequently found also to have a role in vertebrate limb development  .
High plasma triglyceride  concentration is an important risk factor for cardiovascular disease , particularly in women, who have a two  to three fold greater relative risk for CVD associated with an increase in plasma TG concentration than men . Therefore, interventions that decrease or prevent an increase in plasma TG concentrations might be important in reducing CVD, especially in women. Aerobic exercise lowers plasma TG concentration  and this might, at least in part, provide a mechanism for the cardioprotective effect of regular, endurance type physical activity .
With advancing age, adults experience a decline in appetite and food intake , and in the extreme could lead to severe weight loss and malnutrition . Undesired weight loss may involve social, psychological, and medical issues . Free living and institutionalized older persons who experience weight loss often are psychologically depressed , and treatment for the depression has been shown to help these persons regain weight .
MicroRNAs  are 21 24 nucleotide RNA molecules that regulate the translational efficiency and stability of target messenger RNAs . Numerous studies have documented that dysregulated miRNA expression is a very frequent, if not ubiquitous, feature of human cancers. Examples of known oncogenic miRNAs include the miR 17 92 cluster, which accelerates tumorigenesis in models of both solid and hematopoietic malignancies,, miR 21, which has pro proliferative and anti apoptotic activity in several tumor types, and miR 155, which promotes lymphomagenesis.
HTR2C is a widely investigated serotonin receptor . For example, HTR2C has been associated with psychiatric disorders, feeding behavior, and antipsychotic induced side effects . We recently reported that in a sample of males HTR2C rs6318 was associated with serum cortisol responses to a series of emotional stress tasks in the laboratory .
HIV associated neurologic disorders  are characterized by a spectrum of central nervous system  complications. Based on disease progression, HAND can range from asymptomatic neurocognitive impairment  to minor neurocognitive disorder  to the more severe HIV associated dementia . Highly active antiretroviral therapy  has deceased the frequency of HAD, but HAND is still common: more than 50 % of HIV infected persons receiving HAART demonstrate milder HAND syndromes , including ANI and MND.
The prevalence of overweight and obesity is increasing and has doubled worldwide since 1980. In 2010, approximately 35% of adult women in the United States were obese. Women of childbearing age are at particularly high risk for significant weight gain during their reproductive years.
Cancer cells are characterized by metabolic alterations and the tumor microenvironment is often marked with impaired blood flow and hypoxia, all of which can elicit endoplasmic reticulum  stress. Tumor cells adapt to these adverse conditions by activating the unfolded protein response , with induction of GRP78 as a major pro survival arm of the UPR signaling pathways . Knockdown of GRP78 by siRNA in cancer cells as well as tumor associated endothelial cells reduced their proliferative rate and sensitize them to chemotherapeutic treatment .
Ischemia/reperfusion injury  involves the transient deprivation of blood flow and oxygen followed by the return of blood flow during reperfusion. Liver IRI and subsequent dysfunction or failure occurs in many clinical settings including transplantation surgery, tissue resections or hemorrhagic shock . Liver IRI has been reported to cause up to 10% of early organ dysfunction, leading to increased rates of acute and chronic rejection .
The establishment of the vertebrate body plan during embryogenesis results from a series of exquisite and tightly controlled cell polarization and cell migration events during gastrulation . Wnt proteins comprise a large family of secreted glycoproteins with conserved functions from invertebrates to vertebrates . A number of molecular components for non canonical Wnt signaling have been identified .
During vascular development, smooth muscle cells are initially highly proliferative, then become quiescent and express proteins that allow the cells to assume a highly contractive phenotype. This phenotypic modulation is critical for smooth muscle cells to respond to pathophysiological stresses. The smooth muscle cysteine rich proteins, CRP1 and CRP2, are also implicated as important SRF cofactors.
Anorexia nervosa  and bulimia nervosa  are separate disorders in the DSM IV TR, although their diagnostic boundaries are far from stable . We apply behavioral genetic methods to determine the extent to which this partially overlapping symptom picture could be attributable to shared genetic or environmental factors . AN is marked by low weight; however, provisions are made for the presence of bulimic symptoms in the binge purge subtype .
The aryl hydrocarbon receptor  is a ligand activated transcription factor  that is well characterized for mediating the carcinogenic responses to environmental polyaromatic hydrocarbons , such as 2,3,7,8 tetrachloro dibenzo p dioxin  . It is a member of the basic helix loop helix /PAS family of heterodimeric transcriptional regulators. Binding of PAH to cytoplasmic AhR leads to the receptor activation and subsequent translocation into the nucleus, where it dimerizes with another bHLH protein, the AhR nuclear translocator .
A remarkable problem in molecular neurobiology is how an ORN activates one of a large family of odor receptor genes, while simultaneously repressing all the others. The problem of receptor gene choice is faced by animals ranging from insects to mammals . Most Or genes are expressed in one of the two adult olfactory organs, the antenna and the maxillary palp; the larval olfactory organ expresses a subset of Or genes that partially overlaps with the adult repertoire .
The low density lipoprotein receptor  related protein 1  is a large endocytic receptor that belongs to the LDLR family. LRP1 binds and endocytoses over 30 structurally and functionally distinct ligands, including apolipoprotein, proteinases, proteinase inhibitor complexes, and extracellular matrix proteins such as matrix metalloproteinases  and urokinase type plasminogen activator  . Accumulating evidence suggests that altered expression of LRP1 is closely related to various diseases such as Alzheimer’s disease , cancer, and atherosclerosis.
Considerable effort has been directed towards developing fast and effective ligand docking algorithms applicable to drug discovery and design  . Among commonly used virtual screening approaches are docking based techniques that prioritize the testing compounds by predicting the binding mode for a query compound  ; this is followed by the prediction of binding affinity  . Hence, many studies describe successful self docking benchmarks , .
As a critical component in the multi level regulation of gene expression, nuclear receptors  have been considered the Rosetta Stone of physiology , as they recognize hormonal, environmental, and dietary signals, and elicit individual physiological responses by altering transcription . Today, there are seven subfamilies  of NRs known . Daphnia magna, commonly known as the water flea, is a crustacean in the Branchiopod class.
Type 1 diabetes  is an autoimmune disease characterized by immunocyte infiltration of the pancreatic islets  and destruction of the insulin secreting β cells. Diabetes in the biobreeding  rat exhibits many similarities to the human disease, including onset during puberty, insulitis, and lifelong dependency on exogenous insulin  . The MHC  contributes the largest genetic risk as it does in humans and in the NOD mouse.
The electrostatic interaction is crucial for the structural, functional, and dynamic properties of biomolecules. Since biomolecules are surrounded by solvent molecules, the solvent effect must be taken into account in modeling the electrostatics interaction. The finite difference method , as the most widely adopted method, commonly uses uniform grids to discretize the space and builds up a set of linear equations directly from the PBE.
Cigarette smoke has been reported to contain well over 4000 chemicals, at least 81 of which have been classified as carcinogens by the International Agency for Research on Cancer , including the known carcinogens 4  1  1 butanone , which is present in cigarettes at a range of concentrations up to 500 ng per cigarette , and benzopyrene P), which is present in the range of 3.36 to 40 ng per cigarette . Several studies have examined cigarette smoke condensates and shown mutagenic activity in the TA98 Salmonella reverse mutation assay . These values are far higher than the reported levels of either NNK or BP.
The incidence of abdominal aortic aneurysm  is on the increase with approximately 150,000 new cases diagnosed in the US each year . Although the mortality rates associated with AAA are high, there still remains uncertainty about the correct time to surgically repair these aneurysms. Currently, the trend is to use the maximum diameter criterion , where AAAs that reach or exceed 5  5.5 cm in maximum diameter are deemed a rupture risk, and subsequently repaired.
There is an increasing appreciation of the essential roles of lipids in cellular metabolism and signaling that has replaced the notion that lipids only function as an energy reservoir or structural components for cells. Lipids turn over and are biosynthetically remodeled during cell cycle or undergo chemical restructuring to new lipid species with altered properties that serve as bioactive mediators in various signaling pathways. The LIPID MAPS Consortium  has addressed these issues and has developed the infrastructure to carry out a systematic analysis of all cellular lipids .
hMATE1 , encoded by SLC47A1, is a newly identified organic cation/H+ exchanger expressed in the apical membrane of renal tubule cells and the canalicular membrane of hepatocytes. hMATE1 has been shown to mediate the cellular uptake of structurally diverse small molecular weight organic cations such as tetraethylammonium , N methylpyridinium, metformin, paraquat and oxaliplatin. The location in the kidney and the overlapping specificities suggest that hMATE1 and hMATE2 K may function somewhat redundantly in the kidney by mediating tubular transport of cationic organic molecules across the apical membrane.
Despite a critical role in the control of human fertility, the mechanisms regulating human oocyte maturation are not well characterized. The Mos protein is a serine/threonine kinase which activates the MAP kinase cascade through direct phosphorylation of the MAP kinase activator MEK . In the mouse, Mos protein is absent from immature oocytes and maturation dependent cytoplasmic polyadenylation correlates with the translational activation of the maternal Mos mRNA at or after germinal vesicle breakdown .
HSV 2 is the major cause of genital herpes, one of the most common sexually transmitted infections worldwide and a significant risk factor of HIV acquisition . In the US, 17% of people are seropositive for HSV 2 and 58% are seropositive for HSV 1 . Elsewhere, the seroprevalence rate is much higher, reaching 95% in some populations of HIV infected persons and female sex workers .
ERG recordings are used widely in the clinical evaluation of human retinal disorders  and in animal models expressing mutations that result in retinal abnormalities . Among various animal models, rodents, especially mouse, have increasingly become one of the main choices for study, owing to the large repositories of mouse lines with genetic defects, as well as advances in genetics and transgenic technology. However, although the rod pathway is very similar in rodent and primate retinas , there are distinct differences in cone signal processing.
Blood transfusion is performed to augment oxygen carrying capacity, since allogeneic transfusion is not always available and can result in transmission of infectious and immunologic diseases, allergic, alloimmune and other adverse events. Transfusions are reserved for situations of high risk for inadequate O2 delivery, mostly assessed by low hemoglobin  concentrations . The amount of O2 released in the peripheral circulation depends on the quantity of the circulating red blood cells , blood perfusion, arterial O2 saturation, RBC Hb O2 affinity and metabolic O2 needs.
Genetic abnormality is responsible for a wide range of human diseases including cancer. Certain recombinant viral vectors take advantage of the evolutionary ability of viruses to efficiently insert DNA cargo into cells, but pose challenges with limited cargo size, difficulty in manufacturing, and safety concerning immunogenicity and tumorigenicity., There are three major, endocytic pathways by which cells uptake foreign materials: clathrin mediated endocytosis,  caveolae mediated endocytosis , and macropinocytosis. The coated pits of about 100150 nm in diameter can form a polygonal clathrin lattice with adaptor proteins, and are eventually pinched off from the plasma membrane.
Atherosclerosis is characterized by chronic oxidative stress and inflammatory changes in the vascular tissue. Increased local and systemic levels of oxidized low density lipoprotein  induce endothelial cell activation, dysfunction, apoptosis and impaired vasorelaxation, and contribute causally to atherosclerosis development and progression . Of note, LOX 1 is an NF κB and AP 1 responsive gene , indicating that in addition to signaling via LOX 1, OxLDL can also upregulate its expression, resulting in positive amplification in its pro inflammatory and pro apoptotic signaling.
By the end of 2007, the number of people living with HIV  in China was estimated to be 700,000 . Of newly reported cases of HIV, 37.9% were thought to be transmitted through unprotected heterosexual contact and 29.4% through needle sharing behaviours among injection drug users ., Between 1996 and 2004, the national prevalence of HIV rose from 0.02% to 0.93% among female sex workers  and from 1.95% to 6.48% among IDUs. Public health efforts are now primarily concerned with preventing the secondary transmission of HIV from these core groups to the general population.
A biochemical coagulopathy is part of the clinical spectrum of sickle cell anemia . We previously examined transgenic sickle mice  for expression of tissue factor  by the vascular endothelium. Remarkably, this endothelial TF expression pattern was re created by exposure of the mild phenotype NY1DD sickle mouse to hypoxia/reoxygenation , which converted the low TF NYIDD mouse to a high TF mouse .
Although there are positive physical and psychological benefits of physical activity, a majority of the population does not participate in physical activity at the recommended levels . In physical activity clinical trials, there are a number of considerations when measuring an outcome, such as study goals, participant burden, project budget and accuracy/precision . Given the variability in different measures, and that one technique cannot measure all aspects of physical activity in free living situations, complementary methods of measurement have been recommended .
The steroid hormone 17β estradiol , acting through estrogen receptors , plays an important role in development and progression of breast cancer . Tamoxifen , an anti estrogen, reduces breast cancer recurrence and mortality in women with ER positive tumors . E2 bound ER recruits coactivators, which serve as a bridge between ER and general transcription machinery, or are associated with histone acetyltransferases to stimulate transcription .
Vision plays an important role in the ability of people to process information from their environment and to participate in many everyday activities such as reading, working at home or in the office, walking, driving, and interacting with others. We previously reported on significant associations between visual impairment, including visual acuity and visual field loss, and health related quality of Life  in the Los Angeles Latino Eye Study , a population based study of adults. The National Institute Visual Function Questionnaire  was designed to measure areas of vision targeted functioning and well being that were identified as important by persons with eye disease.
Outcome prediction of patients who are in a locked in state is challenging. Extensive pontine infarction on diffusion weighted imaging MRI  has been proposed as a poor prognosticator.
