We report on three patients with a locked in state with unexpected favorable recoveries despite DWI evidence of widespread pontine ischemia .
In human studies, research has clearly demonstrated a link between alcohol consumption and stress with those individuals that experience higher levels of stress exhibiting higher levels of alcohol consumption . Stress, either an internal or environmental event, disrupts homeostasis via an activation of the hypothalamic pituitary adrenal  axis, which leads to the rapid secretion of corticotropin releasing hormone  and ultimate release of glucocorticoids such as corticosterone  in the rodent . Disruptions in HPA axis function are believed to influence alcohol self administration , and alcohol itself increases brain levels of CRH and plasma levels of CORT , thereby activating the HPA axis.
Organ dysfunction in the critically ill is assuming an increasing level of importance, both as a primary outcome marker in clinical trials and as a quality indicator for patients in the intensive care unit . We currently have an incomplete understanding of pediatric Multiple Organ Dysfunction Syndrome  epidemiology and outcomes in the U.S. Unlike our counterparts in adult medicine, we have had no large prospective clinical datasets to examine MODS across multiple institutions.
Mechanical loading plays a critical role in bone remodeling, and unloading due to bed rest and weightlessness in space reduces bone mass and structural strength . The β catenin dependent Wnt signaling plays an important role in bone formation  and fracture healing . In addition, in vivo studies using mice show that mechanical loading increases the level of Wnt/β catenin signaling activity  .
Engineered nanomaterials  are a large variety of particles with at least one dimension in the 1100 nm range. Although there is intense interest in describing the mechanisms by which some ENM  cause inflammation and injury, the underlying mechanism to explain the bioactivities of ENM remain unclear . IL 1β and, another IL 1 family member, IL 18 are potent pro inflammatory cytokines that promote an array of innate immune processes .
Hb adducts are used for biomonitoring of toxicant exposure in human epidemiological studies  and to elucidate the relative contributions of different metabolic pathways in cases where a toxicant can yield multiple reactive metabolites . Renal cell carcinomas from workers exposed to TCE exhibited mutation in the von Hippel Landau tumor suppressor gene. GSH dependent metabolism of TCE results in initial formation of S  L glutathione  which can be metabolized to yield DCVC.
Controlled regulation of homeobox HOX cluster genes is critical for normal proliferation and differentiation in embryogenesis. HOXA9 and HOXA10 are overexpressed in the majority of human acute myeloid leukemias  . In mouse leukemia models, ectopic expression of HOXA9 or HOXA10 confers a growth advantage to immature myeloid cells and is sufficient to cause leukemia invivo .
Chronic liver diseases  are an important cause of morbidity and mortality in the United States  nearly 150,000 persons are diagnosed with CLD annually , and 36,000 patients die of CLD, primarily attributable to complications of decompensated cirrhosis and/or hepatocellular cancer., Annually, these generate approximately 5.9 million CLD related ambulatory care visits and 759,000 CLD related hospitalizations, with healthcare costs exceeding $1.5 billion. Cirrhosis results from progressive hepatic fibrosis, a maladaptive response to chronic hepatocyte injury. The gold standard for the diagnosis and staging of fibrosis is liver biopsy.
The relationship between the biomechanical behavior of naturally occurring extracellular matrix  scaffolds and the remodeling of these scaffolds in vivo is not fully understood. Ideally, a scaffold would closely mimic the mechanical behavior of the tissue that it is intended to replace . An understanding of the collagen fiber alignment and biaxial mechanical behavior of ECM scaffold materials harvested from different tissue sites should logically improve the ability to predict their suitability for various tissue replacement applications.
An increase of substances abuse prevalence in Brazilian youths has been observed in the last few years. Prior surveys of adolescents conducted in the ten most populous cities in Brazil in 1987, 1989, 1993, and 1997 reveal an increasing prevalence of substance abuse. Accordingly, an instrument that can accurately and efficiently detect youths who are at high risk for substance abuse, or already have a substance abuse problem, has practical utility for prevention and treatment.
The ability to sort cells from heterogeneous population and to study them at the single cell level provides unique opportunities for drug discovery and for understanding signaling pathways in disease . Monoclonal antibodies  are a rapidly growing class of human therapeutics with a market size of roughly $78 billion in 2012 . Conventional mAb production involves fusing splenocytes from immunized mice with an immortalized myeloma cell line.
Activation of T cells required the integration of signals from a minimum of two receptors: in naïve T cells, these signals are generally provided by an antigen dependent signal through the T cell receptor   combined with an antigen independent signal through CD28 . Anergy of peripheral T cells is one mechanism that prevents autoimmunity by insuring that T cells activation and initiation of the immune response occurs only within an appropriate context in which costimulation is provided by professional antigen presenting cells. Downstream pathways are subsequently triggered, leading to events including activation of mitogen activated protein kinases, and the transcription factors NF κB, AP 1 and NFAT leading to alteration in gene expression, including inducing cytokines such as interleukin 2 .
Immunotoxins are antibody toxin chimeric proteins targeted to kill cancer cells . A feature of protein immunotoxins is the potency associated with the enzymatic component of the toxin. PE and diphtheria toxin  are both cytotoxic because they gain access to the cytosol and inhibit protein synthesis via the ADP ribosylation of EF2.
There is a growing literature on how combining information from different senses may enhance perceptual performance. It has been suggested that one behavioral consequence of a putative PoIE might be enhanced detection sensitivity for near threshold stimuli in one sense when co occurring with an event in another sense  . Given PoIE proposals that multisensory benefits should arise particularly in near threshold detection for low intensity stimuli, we focused on d’ for lower   intensity visual stimuli when co occurring with a sound or alone .
The unique antibody repertoire development in rabbits  has been exploited for the generation of polyclonal and monoclonal antibodies with exceptionally high avidity, affinity, and specificity . In addition to high affinity and specificity, rabbit monoclonal antibodies can recognize epitopes conserved between human, mouse, and rat antigens ; ; . This cross reactivity along with the demonstration that rabbit monoclonal antibodies can be humanized has raised an interest in utilizing rabbit monoclonal antibodies for therapeutic applications .
In response to infection, B and T cells undergo rapid proliferation and subsequent differentiation leading to the generation of effector cells that successfully combat the infection. Target genes for EGR 1 identified in other cell types include c Myc, Cyclin D2, p19 and Cyclin G2  . Mice homozygous for Egr 2 deficiency die during the first two weeks after birth due to brain abnormalities  .
The amygdala plays an essential role in emotional learning and memory, which is investigated extensively using pavlovian fear conditioning. This procedure involves pairing a conditioned stimulus  with an aversive unconditioned stimulus  to establish a CS US association and re exposure to the CS elicits a conditioned fear response. The basolateral amygdalar complex , which comprises the lateral, basal, and basomedial nuclei, is a key site where the CS US association occurs .
Consider four HIV negative men living in New York City: Ben, Darryl, Greg, and John. Ben reports four acts of unprotected anal intercourse , each with a different casual partner whose status he did not know. Darryl reports four UAI acts with casual partners, all of whom he believes to be HIV negative.
Although prolactin  is critical for physiologic development and differentiation of the mammary gland, its role in breast cancer remains poorly understood. However, recent epidemiologic studies and experimental models have pointed to an important role for PRL in the development and progression of breast cancer . Moreover, the expression of the PRL receptor  in a majority of clinical tumors , and limited phenotype of the PRL receptor knock out mice apart from the mammary gland , suggest that insight into the pathogenic activities of PRL may lead to preventative and therapeutic approaches with minimal side effects .
The tongue plays a key role in both sensory and motor aspects of the oral stage of swallowing, particularly for preparing, forming, manipulating, and transporting the bolus. It is therefore of interest to understand the sensory function of the tongue for tasks that may be relevant for detecting differences in the flow characteristics of swallowing, in particular, sensory tasks that require motor behaviours of the tongue to explore, squeeze or move a bolus in order to ascertain its flow properties. Conversely, recent studies confirm that tongue strength declines with age in healthy people, beginning as early as age 60 .
Chlamydia trachomatis is the most common sexually transmitted bacterial pathogen in the world and infection can lead to pelvic inflammatory disease and infertility in women. Chlamydial infection of epithelial cells upregulates proinflammatory cytokines, chemokines, type I IFNs, and IFN stimulatory genes . A similar detrimental effect of IFNβ signaling has been reported during other bacterial infections as well  .
There is growing evidence that constitutive as well as somatically acquired alterations in TGF β signaling are associated with colorectal cancer risk and disease progression. Germline mutations of the SMAD4 and BMPR1A genes are associated with juvenile polyposis  and common and functionally relevant alleles of SMAD7 influence colorectal cancer risk . The central role of impaired TGF β and Bone Morphogenic Protein  signaling in colon cancer development and progression was first demonstrated in animal experiments by the use of cis Apc+/Δ716 Smad4+/− compound mutant mice .
Psychologists, economists and policy makers are interested in how early inputs in the life cycle affect later productivity . Children’s psychological problems  or exposure to abuse  impact functioning decades later in adulthood. Bullying is systematic abuse of power and refers to repeated aggression against another person that is intentional and involves an imbalance of power .
Consensus statements recommend that interdisciplinary family meetings occur for all ICU patients within five days of admission and include discussions about patient values, prognosis, and the options of comfort care or withdrawing life support when death is possible. However, whether surrogates of critically ill patients are offered comfort care as a treatment option depends primarily on whether their physician believes life support should be withheld or withdrawn., Previous work has documented that physicians are reluctant to discuss outcomes for critically ill patients in the face of prognostic uncertainty, and frequently do not ask surrogates about patient values. How physicians decide whether to discuss withdrawing life support as an option under these circumstances is unclear .
Hepatocellular carcinoma  is the most common primary malignant tumor of the liver and a major cause of death among patients with cirrhosis . Over the past 20 years, the use of a multimodality therapy approach for HCC has improved overall 5 year survival from 7% to around 50%. Heralded by the Barcelona Clinic for Liver Cancer, current treatment algorithms incorporate a diverse range of therapies for different stages of liver cancer and disease .
Head and neck lymphedema  is a common side effect of head and neck cancer  treatment. It has been estimated that more than 50% of treated HNC patients will develop some degree of HNL., Although the etiology of HNL varies, common causes include surgery that removes lymph nodes, or impairment of lymphatic vessel contractility  associated with radiation therapy or surgery. Additionally, the tumor itself may cause vessel obstruction.
Neuronal monoamine transporters are targeted by a myriad of currently employed therapeutic drugs, such as antidepressants, as well as widely abused illicit drugs such as the psychostimulant cocaine. In spite of their pharmacological significance, relatively little is known about the biophysical properties of transporter proteins—the mechanism by which monoaminergic substrate transport occurs remains a mystery, as does the specific mechanism of transport affecting drugs. Interaction with the neural dopamine transporter , in particular, appears to mediate the reinforcing properties of cocaine .
Alterations in intracellular Ca2+ concentration  are fundamental transduction elements in cell signalling. Voltage dependent Ca2+ channels  translate membrane potential  changes into intracellular Ca2+ signals. Strong depolarizations in Vm are needed to open HVA channels, which inactivate slowly and are classified into L , N , P/Q  and R  types depending on their biophysical properties .
Hematopoiesis in normal hosts is tightly regulated in order to maintain daily blood cell turnover among different lineages . These primitive precursors reside in the bone marrow and possess the unique capacity for self renewal as well as the potential to differentiate into mature blood cells . At the present time, knowledge about the functional adjustment of these cells towards lineage commitment during the granulopoietic response to bacterial infection remains limited .
An increasing body of evidence indicates that cytochrome P 450  dependent metabolites of arachidonic acid, including epoxyeicosatrienoic acids , play an important role in regulation of cardiovascular and renal functions . Based on these studies it has been proposed that the EETs mediated antihypertensive actions are related to their immediate vasodilatory effects and direct influence on renal tubular transport of sodium ,, . We found recently that cis 4 benzoic acid , an sEH inhibitor, induced a significant reduction in plasma ANG II levels and normalization of kidney ANG II concentration in Ren 2 transgenic rat model of angiotensin II  dependent hypertension  .
Embryonic stem  cells have the potential to replace tissues lost by injury, disease, or normal aging if lineage differentiation can be controlled. Replicating the intrinsic and extrinsic factors influencing fate choice provides one possible method toward obtaining the specific phenotype of interest for stem cell therapies. Glutamatergic spiral ganglion neurons  that make up the auditory nerve convey sensory information from inner hair cells  to the central nervous system, and are particularly susceptible to death secondary to IHC loss.
Approximately half of the species in the moss family Splachnaceae are entomophilous, having their spores dispersed by flies . Entomophilous species grow on organic substrates such as dung, old bones and owl pellets, and have mature sporophytes with an inflated, often brightly coloured swelling  just proximal to the spore containing capsule. The sporophytes of all entomophilous species so far examined release volatile chemicals that attract flies .
Primary infection with influenza virus results in a localized pulmonary infection and inflammation, and elicits an influenza specific CD8+ T cell immune response that is necessary for viral clearance . These CD8+ T cells are thought to control virus infections by killing influenza infected pulmonary cells using perforin  and Fas dependent mechanisms . In contrast, when perforin−/− bone marrow reconstituted Fas−/− mice were likewise infected with influenza virus, ~70% of the mice had sustained long term  high viral titers  suggesting that influenza specific CD8+ T cell cytotoxicity requires access to either the perforin or Fas cytotoxic pathways to effectively control influenza virus infections.
The HER2/neu  gene is amplified in approximately 25% of breast cancers . Gene amplification results in overexpression of the HER2 protein which is associated with an aggressive clinical course to include a shorter disease free interval after adjuvant therapy and decreased overall survival  . The natural history of HER2 overexpressing breast cancer has been altered however by the routine use of trastuzumab, a monoclonal antibody targeting the extracellular domain of the HER2 protein.
Although invasive intraductal papillary mucinous neoplasms  of the pancreas is thought to be more indolent than sporadic pancreatic adenocarcinoma , the natural history remains poorly defined. We compare survival and identify prognostic factors following resection for invasive IPMN vs. stage matched PAC . The Surveillance, Epidemiology, and End Results  database  was utilized to identify 729 patients with invasive IPMN and 8082 patients with PAC who underwent surgical resection .
Identification of microdeletion syndromes began with the recognition that syndromic phenotypes are often associated with mental retardation. One of the first classic chromosomal microdeletion syndromes identified was 4p   syndrome  in which cleft lip and/or palate is a common feature . Our ability to detect chromosomal microdeletion syndromes is evolving and is greatly enhanced by the use of more advanced molecular technologies especially the use of microarrays .
Obesity and its co morbidities have reached epidemic proportions . Consumption of high calorie foods is proposed as a major factor contributing to the wide spread development of obesity . Importantly, food intake is driven not only by energy demands, termed “homeostatic” feeding, but also by the hedonic gratification associated with eating a preferred food, referred to as “non homeostatic” feeding .
Thiazolidinediones , including rosiglitazone and pioglitazone , are used widely to improve insulin sensitivity in patients with type 2 diabetes. Experimentally, TZDs reduce atherosclerosis in both LDL receptor −/− and apoE −/− mice. , The molecular target for TZD is PPARγ; a nuclear receptor that is highly expressed in all cell types involved in vascular pathologies, including macrophages, endothelial cells, and smooth muscle cells .
Accurate measurement of cancer preventive behaviors is important for assessing quality of medical care, conducting descriptive and interventional research studies, monitoring progress toward national goals, and determining public policies. Findings differ, however, depending on whether administrative data, patient self report, or medical records are used as the data source. Therefore, medical records are frequently used as the data source for assessing quality of medical care and conducting health services research in community settings.
